AccessorFunc.DESCRIPTION:
Adds simple Get/Set accessor functions on the specified table.

Can also force the value to be set to a number, bool or string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to add the accessor functions too.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key of the table to be get/set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the functions (will be prefixed with Get and Set).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The type the setter should force to (uses [FORCE](/gmod/Enums/FORCE)).

Add_NPC_Class.DESCRIPTION: Defines a global entity class variable with an automatic value in order to prevent collisions with other [CLASS](/gmod/Enums/CLASS). You should prefix your variable with CLASS_ for consistency.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the new enum/global variable.

AddBackgroundImage.DESCRIPTION: Adds the specified image path to the main menu background pool. Image can be png or jpeg.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the image.

AddConsoleCommand.DESCRIPTION: Tells the engine to register a console command. If the command was ran, the engine calls [concommand.Run](/gmod/concommand.Run).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the console command to add.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: helpText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The help text.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Concommand flags using [FCVAR](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR)

AddCSLuaFile.DESCRIPTION: Marks a Lua file to be sent to clients when they join the server. Doesn't do anything on the client - this means you can use it in a shared file without problems.
NOTES:
This function is not needed for scripts located in **lua/autorun/** and **lua/autorun/client/**: they are automatically sent to clients.

		You can add up to **8192** files. Each file can be up to **64KB** compressed (LZMA)
WARNINGS:
If the file trying to be added is empty, an error will occur, and the file will not be sent to the client

		

		The string cannot have whitespace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: file
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name/path to the Lua file that should be sent, **relative to the garrysmod/lua folder**. If no parameter is specified, it sends the current file.

The file path can be relative to the script it's ran from. For example, if your script is in `lua/myfolder/stuff.lua`, calling [AddCSLuaFile](/gmod/Global.AddCSLuaFile)("otherstuff.lua") and [AddCSLuaFile](/gmod/Global.AddCSLuaFile)("myfolder/otherstuff.lua") is the same thing.
NOTES: Please make sure your file names are unique, the filesystem is shared across all addons, so a file named `lua/config.lua` in your addon may be overwritten by the same file in another addon.

AddonMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Loads the specified image from the `/cache` folder, used in combination [steamworks.Download](/gmod/steamworks.Download). Most addons will provide a 512x512 png image.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The material, returns `nil` if the cached file is not an image.

AddOriginToPVS.DESCRIPTION: Adds the specified vector to the PVS which is currently building. This allows all objects in visleafs visible from that vector to be drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin to add.

AddWorldTip.DESCRIPTION:
This function creates a World Tip, similar to the one shown when aiming at a Thruster where it shows you its force.

This function will make a World Tip that will only last 50 milliseconds (1/20th of a second), so you must call it continuously as long as you want the World Tip to be shown. It is common to call it inside a Think hook.

Contrary to what the function's name implies, it is impossible to create more than one World Tip at the same time. A new World Tip will overwrite the old one, so only use this function when you know nothing else will also be using it.

See [SANDBOX:PaintWorldTips](/gmod/SANDBOX:PaintWorldTips) for more information.
NOTES: This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entindex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: **This argument is no longer used**; it has no effect on anything. You can use nil in this argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text for the world tip to display.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dieTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: **This argument is no longer used**; when you add a World Tip it will always last only 0.05 seconds. You can use nil in this argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Where in the world you want the World Tip to be drawn. If you add a valid Entity in the next argument, this argument will have no effect on the actual World Tip.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Which entity you want to associate with the World Tip. This argument is optional. If set to a valid entity, this will override the position set in `pos` with the Entity's position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pitch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The pitch value of the angle.

If this is an [Angle](/gmod/Angle), this function will return a copy of the given angle.

If this is a [string](/gmod/string), this function will try to parse the string as a angle. If it fails, it returns a 0 angle.
(See examples)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: yaw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The yaw value of the angle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: roll
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The roll value of the angle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created angle

AngleRand.DESCRIPTION: Returns an angle with a randomized pitch, yaw, and roll between min(inclusive), max(exclusive).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Min bound inclusive.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Max bound exclusive.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The randomly generated angle.

assert.DESCRIPTION: If the result of the first argument is false or nil, an error is thrown with the second argument as the message.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: expression
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The expression to assert.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: errorMessage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The error message to throw when assertion fails. This is only type-checked if the assertion fails.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: returns
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Any arguments past the error message will be returned by a successful assert.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If successful, returns the first argument.

If successful, returns the error message. This will be nil if the second argument wasn't specified.

Since the second argument is only type-checked if the assertion fails, this doesn't have to be a string.
Returns any arguments past the error message.

BroadcastLua.DESCRIPTION: Sends the specified Lua code to all connected clients and executes it.
NOTES: If you need to use this function more than once consider using net library. Send net message and make the entire code you want to execute in net.Receive on client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: code
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The code to be executed. Capped at length of 254 characters.

BuildNetworkedVarsTable.DESCRIPTION: Dumps the networked variables of all entities into one table and returns it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Format:

* key = [Entity](/gmod/Entity) for NWVars or [number](/gmod/number) (always 0) for global vars

* value = [table](/gmod/table) formatted as:

  * key = [string](/gmod/string) var name

  * value = any type var value

CanAddServerToFavorites.DESCRIPTION: Used internally to check if the current server the player is on can be added to favorites or not. Does not check if the server is ALREADY in the favorites.

CancelLoading.DESCRIPTION: Aborts joining of the server you are currently joining.

ChangeBackground.DESCRIPTION: Sets the active main menu background image to a random entry from the background images pool. Images are added with [AddBackgroundImage](/gmod/Global.AddBackgroundImage).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: currentgm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Apparently does nothing.

ChangeTooltip.DESCRIPTION: Automatically called by the engine when a panel is hovered over with the mouse

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel that has been hovered over

ClearBackgroundImages.DESCRIPTION: Empties the pool of main menu background images.

ClientsideModel.DESCRIPTION: Creates a non physical entity that only exists on the client. See also [ents.CreateClientProp](/gmod/ents.CreateClientProp).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Parented clientside models will become detached if the parent entity leaves the PVS.
Clientside entities are not garbage-collected, thus you must store a reference to the object and call [CSEnt:Remove](/gmod/CSEnt:Remove) manually.
Clientside models will occasionally delete themselves during high server lag.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file path to the model.
WARNINGS: Model must be precached with util.PrecacheModel on the server before usage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: renderGroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The render group of the entity for the clientside leaf system, see [RENDERGROUP](/gmod/Enums/RENDERGROUP).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created client-side model. ( C_BaseFlex )

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Clientside entities are not garbage-collected, thus you must store a reference to the object and call [CSEnt:Remove](/gmod/CSEnt:Remove) manually.

NOTES:
The ragdoll initially starts as hidden and with shadows disabled, see the example for how to enable it.

There's no need to call Entity:Spawn on this entity.

The physics won't initialize at all if the model hasn't been precached serverside first.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file path to the model.
WARNINGS: Model must be precached with util.PrecacheModel on the server before usage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: renderGroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [RENDERGROUP](/gmod/Enums/RENDERGROUP) to assign.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created client-side ragdoll. ( C_ClientRagdoll )

ClientsideScene.DESCRIPTION: Creates a scene entity based on the scene name and the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the scene.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetEnt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to play the scene on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: C_SceneEntity

CloseDermaMenus.DESCRIPTION: Closes all Derma menus that have been passed to [RegisterDermaMenuForClose](/gmod/Global.RegisterDermaMenuForClose) and calls [GM:CloseDermaMenus](/gmod/GM:CloseDermaMenus)

collectgarbage.DESCRIPTION: Executes the specified action on the garbage collector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: action
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The action to run.

Valid actions are `collect`, `stop`, `restart`, `count`, `step`, `setpause` and `setstepmul`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arg
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The argument of the specified action, only applicable for `step`, `setpause` and `setstepmul`.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
If the action is count this is the number of kilobytes of memory used by Lua.

If the action is step this is true if a garbage collection cycle was finished.

If the action is setpause this is the previous value for the GC's pause.

If the action is setstepmul this is the previous value for the GC's step.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An integer from 0-255 describing the red value of the color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An integer from 0-255 describing the green value of the color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An integer from 0-255 describing the blue value of the color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: a
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An integer from 0-255 describing the alpha (transparency) of the color.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [Color](/gmod/Color).

ColorAlpha.DESCRIPTION: Returns a new [Color](/gmod/Color) with the RGB components of the given [Color](/gmod/Color) and the alpha value specified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Color) from which to take RGB values. This color will not be modified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new alpha value, a number between 0 and 255. Values above 255 will be clamped.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new [Color](/gmod/Color) with the modified alpha value

ColorRand.DESCRIPTION: Creates a [Color](/gmod/Color) with randomized red, green, and blue components. If the alpha argument is true, alpha will also be randomized.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: a
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should alpha be randomized.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [Color](/gmod/Color).

ColorToHSL.DESCRIPTION: Converts a [Color](/gmod/Color) into HSL color space.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Color).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hue in degrees `[0, 360]`.
The saturation in the range `[0, 1]`.
The lightness in the range `[0, 1]`.

ColorToHSV.DESCRIPTION: Converts a [Color](/gmod/Color) into HSV color space.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Color).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hue in degrees `[0, 360]`.
The saturation in the range `[0, 1]`.
The value in the range `[0, 1]`.

CompileFile.DESCRIPTION: Attempts to compile the given file. If successful, returns a function that can be called to perform the actual execution of the script.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the file, relative to the garrysmod/lua/ directory.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The function which executes the script.

CompileString.DESCRIPTION:
This function will compile the code argument as lua code and return a function that will execute that code. 

Please note that this function will not automatically execute the given code after compiling it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: code
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The code to compile.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An identifier in case an error is thrown. (The same identifier can be used multiple times)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: HandleError
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If false this function will return an error string instead of throwing an error.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A function that, when called, will execute the given code.

Returns the error string if there was a Lua error and third argument is false.

ConsoleAutoComplete.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of console command names beginning with the given text.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Text that the console commands must begin with.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of console command names.

ConVarExists.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether a [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) with the given name exists or not

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) exists, false otherwise.

CreateClientConVar.DESCRIPTION:
Makes a clientside-only console variable

Although this function is shared, it should only be used clientside.
NOTES: This function is a wrapper of Global.CreateConVar, with the difference being that FCVAR_ARCHIVE and FCVAR_USERINFO are added automatically when **shouldsave** and **userinfo** are true, respectively.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Name of the ConVar to be created and able to be accessed.

This cannot be a name of existing console command or console variable. It will silently fail if it is.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Default value of the ConVar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldsave
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should the ConVar be saved across sessions in the cfg/client.vdf file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: userinfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should the ConVar and its containing data be sent to the server when it has changed. This make the convar accessible from server using [Player:GetInfoNum](/gmod/Player:GetInfoNum) and similar functions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: helptext
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Help text to display in the console.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the convar cannot be changed to a number lower than this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the convar cannot be changed to a number higher than this value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created convar.

CreateConVar.DESCRIPTION: Creates a console variable ([ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)), in general these are for things like gamemode/server settings.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Name of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

This cannot be a name of an engine console command or console variable. It will silently fail if it is. If it is the same name as another lua ConVar, it will return that ConVar object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Default value of the convar. Can also be a number.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Flags of the convar, see [FCVAR](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR), either as bitflag or as table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: helptext
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The help text to show in the console.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the ConVar cannot be changed to a number lower than this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the ConVar cannot be changed to a number higher than this value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The convar created.

CreateMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Creates a new material with the specified name and shader.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: .pngs must be loaded with [Material](/gmod/Global.Material) before being used with this function.
This will not create a new material if another material object with the same name already exists.

NOTES: This does not work with [patch materials](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Patch).
Materials created with this function can be used in Entity:SetMaterial and Entity:SetSubMaterial by prepending a "!" to their material name argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material name. Must be unique.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shaderName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The shader name. See [Shaders](/gmod/Shaders).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Key-value table that contains shader parameters and proxies.

* See: [List of Shader Parameters on Valve Developers Wiki](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Category:List_of_Shader_Parameters) and each shader's page from .
NOTES: Unlike IMaterial:SetTexture, this table will not accept ITexture values. Instead, use the texture's name (see ITexture:GetName).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created material

NOTES: The particle effect must be precached with Global.PrecacheParticleSystem and the file its from must be added via game.AddParticles before it can be used!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to attach the control point to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effect
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the effect to create. It must be precached.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: partAttachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: See [PATTACH](/gmod/Enums/PATTACH).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entAttachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The attachment ID on the entity to attach the particle system to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: offset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The offset from the [Entity:GetPos](/gmod/Entity:GetPos) of the entity we are attaching this CP to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created particle system.

CreatePhysCollideBox.DESCRIPTION: Creates a new [PhysCollide](/gmod/PhysCollide) from the given bounds.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This fails to create planes or points - no components of the mins or maxs can be the same.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Min corner of the box. This is not automatically ordered with the maxs and must contain the smallest vector components. See [OrderVectors](/gmod/Global.OrderVectors).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Max corner of the box. This is not automatically ordered with the mins and must contain the largest vector components.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new PhysCollide. This will be a NULL PhysCollide ([PhysCollide:IsValid](/gmod/PhysCollide:IsValid) returns false) if given bad vectors or no more PhysCollides can be created in the physics engine.

CreatePhysCollidesFromModel.DESCRIPTION: Creates [PhysCollide](/gmod/PhysCollide) objects for every physics object the model has. The model must be precached with [util.PrecacheModel](/gmod/util.PrecacheModel) before being used with this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Model path to get the collision objects of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of [PhysCollide](/gmod/PhysCollide) objects. The number of entries will match the model's physics object count. See also [Entity:GetPhysicsObjectCount](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObjectCount). Returns no value if the model doesn't exist, or has not been precached.

CreateSound.DESCRIPTION: Returns a sound parented to the specified entity.
NOTES: You can only create one CSoundPatch per audio file, per entity at the same time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetEnt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound to play.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [CRecipientFilter](/gmod/CRecipientFilter) of the players that will have this sound networked to them.
NOTES: This argument only works serverside.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The sound object

CreateSprite.DESCRIPTION: Creates and returns a new [DSprite](/gmod/DSprite) element with the supplied material.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Material the sprite should draw.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new [DSprite](/gmod/DSprite) element.

CurTime.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the uptime of the server in seconds (to at least 4 decimal places)

This is a synchronised value and affected by various factors such as host_timescale (or [game.GetTimeScale](/gmod/game.GetTimeScale)) and the server being paused - either by sv_pausable or all players disconnecting.

You should use this function for timing in-game events but not for real-world events.

See also: [RealTime](/gmod/Global.RealTime), [SysTime](/gmod/Global.SysTime)

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This returns 0 in [GM:PlayerAuthed](/gmod/GM:PlayerAuthed).

NOTES:
This is internally defined as a float, and as such it will be affected by precision loss if your server uptime is more than 6 hours, which will cause jittery movement of players and props and inaccuracy of timers, it is highly encouraged to refresh or change the map when that happens (a server restart is not necessary).

This is **NOT** easy as it sounds to fix in the engine, so please refrain from posting issues about this

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Time synced with the game server.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not create a unique object, but instead returns a shared reference. That means you cannot use two or more of these objects at once.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [CTakeDamageInfo](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo) object.

DebugInfo.DESCRIPTION: Writes text to the right hand side of the screen, like the old error system. Messages disappear after a couple of seconds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: slot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The location on the right hand screen to write the debug info to. Starts at 0, no upper limit

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The debugging information to be written to the screen

DEFINE_BASECLASS.DESCRIPTION:
This is not a function. This is a preprocessor keyword that translates to:

```

local BaseClass = baseclass.Get( "my_weapon" )

```

If you type `DEFINE_BASECLASS( "my_weapon" )` in your script.

See [baseclass.Get](/gmod/baseclass.Get) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Baseclass name

DeriveGamemode.DESCRIPTION: Loads and registers the specified gamemode, setting the GM table's DerivedFrom field to the value provided, if the table exists. The DerivedFrom field is used post-gamemode-load as the "derived" parameter for [gamemode.Register](/gmod/gamemode.Register).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: base
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Gamemode name to derive from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the animation to create

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to run the animation on

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Function to call to process the animation

Arguments:
* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) pnl - the panel passed to Derma_Anim
* [table](/gmod/table) anim - the anim table
* [number](/gmod/number) delta - the fraction of the progress through the animation
* [any](/gmod/any) data - optional data passed to the run metatable method

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A lua metatable containing four methods:
* Run() - Should be called each frame you want the animation to be ran.
* Active() - Returns if the animation is currently active (has not finished and stop has not been called)
* Stop() - Halts the animation at its current progress.
* Start( Length, Data ) - Prepares the animation to be ran for Length seconds. Must be called once before calling Run(). The data parameter will be passed to the func function.

Derma_DrawBackgroundBlur.DESCRIPTION: Draws background blur around the given panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to draw the background blur around

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Time that the blur began being painted

Derma_Hook.DESCRIPTION: Creates panel method that calls the supplied Derma skin hook via [derma.SkinHook](/gmod/derma.SkinHook)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to add the hook to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: functionName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of panel function to create

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hookName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of Derma skin hook to call within the function

ARGUMENTS.NAME: typeName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Type of element to call Derma skin hook for

Derma_Install_Convar_Functions.DESCRIPTION:
Makes the panel (usually an input of sorts) respond to changes in console variables by adding next functions to the panel:

* [Panel:SetConVar](/gmod/Panel:SetConVar)

* [Panel:ConVarChanged](/gmod/Panel:ConVarChanged)

* [Panel:ConVarStringThink](/gmod/Panel:ConVarStringThink)

* [Panel:ConVarNumberThink](/gmod/Panel:ConVarNumberThink)

The console variable value is saved in the `m_strConVar` property of the panel.

The panel should call

[Panel:ConVarStringThink](/gmod/Panel:ConVarStringThink) or 

[Panel:ConVarNumberThink](/gmod/Panel:ConVarNumberThink) 

in its [PANEL:Think](/gmod/PANEL:Think) hook and should call [Panel:ConVarChanged](/gmod/Panel:ConVarChanged) when the panel's value has changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel the functions should be added to.

Derma_Message.DESCRIPTION: Creates a derma window to display information

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text within the created panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The title of the created panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Button
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text of the button to close the panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame)

Derma_Query.DESCRIPTION: Shows a message box in the middle of the screen, with up to 4 buttons they can press.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The message to display.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The title to give the message box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn1text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to display on the first button.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn1func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run if the user clicks the first button.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn2text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to display on the second button.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn2func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run if the user clicks the second button.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn3text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to display on the third button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn3func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run if the user clicks the third button.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn4text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to display on the fourth button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: btn4func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run if the user clicks the fourth button.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The Panel object of the created window.

Derma_StringRequest.DESCRIPTION: Creates a derma window asking players to input a string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The title of the created panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: subtitle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text above the input box

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The default text for the input box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: confirm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to be called once the user has confirmed their input.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cancel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to be called once the user has cancelled their input

ARGUMENTS.NAME: confirmText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override text of the "OK" button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cancelText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override text of the "Cancel" button

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame)

DermaMenu.DESCRIPTION: Creates a [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) and closes any current menus.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keepOpen
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If we should keep other [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu)s open (`true`) or not (`false`).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to parent the created menu to.

RETURNS.NAME: menu
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu).

DisableClipping.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether rendering should be limited to being inside a panel or not.

See also [Panel:NoClipping](/gmod/Panel:NoClipping).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: disable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not clipping should be disabled

RETURNS.NAME: oldState
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the clipping was enabled or not before this function call

DOF_Kill.DESCRIPTION: Cancels current DOF post-process effect started with [DOF_Start](/gmod/Global.DOF_Start)

DOF_Start.DESCRIPTION:
Cancels any existing DOF post-process effects.
Begins the DOF post-process effect.

DOFModeHack.DESCRIPTION: A hacky method used to fix some bugs regarding DoF.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables depth-of-field mode

DrawBackground.DESCRIPTION:
Draws the currently active main menu background image and handles transitioning between background images.

This is called by default in the menu panel's Paint hook.

DrawBloom.DESCRIPTION: Draws the bloom shader, which creates a glowing effect from bright objects.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Darken
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Determines how much to darken the effect. A lower number will make the glow come from lower light levels. A value of `1` will make the bloom effect unnoticeable. Negative values will make even pitch black areas glow.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Multiply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Will affect how bright the glowing spots are. A value of `0` will make the bloom effect unnoticeable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: SizeX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The size of the bloom effect along the horizontal axis.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: SizeY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The size of the bloom effect along the vertical axis.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Passes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Determines how much to exaggerate the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ColorMultiply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Will multiply the colors of the glowing spots, making them more vivid.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Red
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much red to multiply with the glowing color. Should be between `0` and `1`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Green
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much green to multiply with the glowing color. Should be between `0` and `1`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Blue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much blue to multiply with the glowing color. Should be between `0` and `1`.

DrawColorModify.DESCRIPTION: Draws the Color Modify shader, which can be used to adjust colors on screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modifyParameters
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Color modification parameters. See [Shaders/g_colourmodify](/gmod/Shaders/g_colourmodify) and the example below. Note that if you leave out a field, it will retain its last value which may have changed if another caller uses this function.

DrawMaterialOverlay.DESCRIPTION: Draws a material overlay on the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This will be the material that is drawn onto the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: RefractAmount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This will adjust how much the material will refract your screen.

DrawMotionBlur.DESCRIPTION: Creates a motion blur effect by drawing your screen multiple times.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: AddAlpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much alpha to change per frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: DrawAlpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much alpha the frames will have. A value of 0 will not render the motion blur effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Determines the amount of time between frames to capture.

DrawSharpen.DESCRIPTION: Draws the sharpen shader, which creates more contrast.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Contrast
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much contrast to create.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How large the contrast effect will be.

DrawSobel.DESCRIPTION: Draws the sobel shader, which detects edges and draws a black border.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Threshold
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Determines the threshold of edges. A value of `0` will make your screen completely black.

DrawSunbeams.DESCRIPTION: Renders the post-processing effect of beams of light originating from the map's sun. Utilises the `pp/sunbeams` material.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: darken
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `$darken` property for sunbeams material.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: multiplier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `$multiply` property for sunbeams material.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sunSize
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `$sunsize` property for sunbeams material.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sunX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `$sunx` property for sunbeams material.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sunY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `$suny` property for sunbeams material.

DrawTexturize.DESCRIPTION: Draws the texturize shader, which replaces each pixel on your screen with a different part of the texture depending on its brightness. See [g_texturize](/gmod/Shaders/g_texturize) for information on making the texture.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Scale of the texture. A smaller number creates a larger texture.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: BaseTexture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This will be the texture to use in the effect. Make sure you use [Material](/gmod/Global.Material) to get the texture number.

DrawToyTown.DESCRIPTION: Draws the toy town shader, which blurs the top and bottom of your screen. This can make very large objects look like toys, hence the name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Passes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An integer determining how many times to draw the effect. A higher number creates more blur.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of screen which should be blurred on the top and bottom.

DropEntityIfHeld.DESCRIPTION: Drops the specified entity if it is being held by any player with Gravity Gun or +use pickup.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to drop.

DynamicLight.DESCRIPTION: Creates or replaces a dynamic light with the given id.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The minlight parameter affects the world and entities differently.

NOTES: Only 32 dlights and 64 elights can be active at once.
WARNINGS: It is not safe to hold a reference to this object after creation since its data can be replaced by another dlight at any time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An unsigned Integer. Usually an [entity index](/gmod/Entity:EntIndex) is used here.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: elight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Allocates an elight instead of a dlight. Elights have a higher light limit and do not light the world (making the "noworld" parameter have no effect).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A DynamicLight structured table. See [DynamicLight](/gmod/Structures/DynamicLight)

EffectData.DESCRIPTION: Returns a [CEffectData](/gmod/CEffectData) object to be used with [util.Effect](/gmod/util.Effect).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not create a unique object, but instead returns a shared reference. That means you cannot use two or more of these objects at once.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [CEffectData](/gmod/CEffectData) object.

Either.DESCRIPTION:
A compact 'if then else'. This is *almost* equivalent to (`condition` and `truevar` or `falsevar`) in Lua.

The difference is that if `truevar` evaluates to false, the plain Lua method stated would return `falsevar` regardless of `condition` whilst this function would take `condition` into account.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: condition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The condition to check if true or false.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: truevar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the condition isn't nil/false, returns this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: falsevar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the condition is nil/false, returns this value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The result.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound to play

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to play at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to emit the sound from. Must be [Entity:EntIndex](/gmod/Entity:EntIndex)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: channel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound channel, see [CHAN](/gmod/Enums/CHAN).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the sound, from 0 to 1

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundLevel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound level of the sound, see [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flags of the sound, see [SND](/gmod/Enums/SND)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pitch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pitch of the sound, 0-255

EmitSound.DESCRIPTION: Emits the specified sound at the specified position.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Sounds must be precached serverside manually before they can be played. [util.PrecacheSound](/gmod/util.PrecacheSound) does not work for this purpose, [Entity:EmitSound](/gmod/Entity:EmitSound) does the trick

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound to play

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to play at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The entity to emit the sound from. Can be an [Entity:EntIndex](/gmod/Entity:EntIndex) or one of the following:

* `0` - Plays sound on the world (position set to `0,0,0`)

* `-1` - Plays sound on the local player (on server acts as `0`)

* `-2` - Plays UI sound (position set to `0,0,0`, no spatial sound, on server acts as `0`)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: channel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound channel, see [CHAN](/gmod/Enums/CHAN).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the sound, from 0 to 1

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundLevel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound level of the sound, see [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flags of the sound, see [SND](/gmod/Enums/SND)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pitch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pitch of the sound, 0-255

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dsp
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The DSP preset for this sound. [List of DSP presets](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

EndTooltip.DESCRIPTION: Removes the currently active tool tip from the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the panel that has a tool tip.

Entity.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the entity with the matching [Entity:EntIndex](/gmod/Entity:EntIndex).

Indices 1 through [game.MaxPlayers](/gmod/game.MaxPlayers)() are always reserved for players.
NOTES: In examples on this wiki, **Entity( 1 )** is used when a player entity is needed (see ). In singleplayer and listen servers, **Entity( 1 )** will always be the first player. In dedicated servers, however, **Entity( 1 )** won't always be a valid player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entityIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity if it exists, or NULL if it doesn't.

error.DESCRIPTION: Throws a Lua error and breaks out of the current call stack.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: message
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The error message to throw

ARGUMENTS.NAME: errorLevel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The level to throw the error at.

ErrorNoHalt.DESCRIPTION:
Throws a Lua error but does not break out of the current call stack.

This function will not print a stack trace like a normal error would.

Essentially similar if not equivalent to [Msg](/gmod/Global.Msg).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Converts all arguments to strings and prints them with no spacing.

EyeAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angles of the current render context as calculated by [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function is only reliable inside rendering hooks.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angle of the currently rendered scene.

EyePos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the origin of the current render context as calculated by [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function is only reliable inside rendering hooks.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Camera position.

EyeVector.DESCRIPTION: Returns the normal vector of the current render context as calculated by [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView), similar to [EyeAngles](/gmod/Global.EyeAngles).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function is only reliable inside rendering hooks.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: View direction of the currently rendered scene.

FindMetaTable.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the meta table for the class with the matching name.

Internally returns [debug.getregistry](/gmod/debug.getregistry)()[metaName]

You can learn more about meta tables on the [Meta Tables](/gmod/Meta Tables) page.

You can find a list of meta tables that can be retrieved with this function on [TYPE](/gmod/Enums/TYPE). The name in the description is the string to use with this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: metaName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The object type to retrieve the meta table of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The corresponding meta table.

FindTooltip.DESCRIPTION: Returns the tool-tip text and tool-tip-panel (if any) of the given panel as well as itself

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to find tool-tip of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: tool-tip text
tool-tip panel
panel that the function was called with

Format.DESCRIPTION: Formats the specified values into the string given. Same as [string.format](/gmod/string.format).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: format
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The string to be formatted.

Follows this format: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdio/printf/

ARGUMENTS.NAME: formatParameters
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Values to be formatted into the string.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The formatted string

FrameNumber.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of frames rendered since the game was launched.

FrameTime.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime)-based time in seconds it took to render the last frame.

This should be used for frame/tick based timing, such as movement prediction or animations.

For real-time-based frame time that isn't affected by host_timescale, use [RealFrameTime](/gmod/Global.RealFrameTime). RealFrameTime is more suited for things like GUIs or HUDs.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: time (in seconds)

GameDetails.DESCRIPTION: Callback function for when the client has joined a server. This function shows the server's loading URL by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: servername
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Server's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: serverurl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Server's loading screen URL, or "" if the URL is not set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mapname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Server's current map's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxplayers
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Max player count of server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The local player's [Player:SteamID64](/gmod/Player:SteamID64).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamemode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Server's current gamemode's folder name.

DEPRECATED: This function was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and is removed in Lua 5.2. Use Global.collectgarbage( "count" ) instead.
gcinfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current floored dynamic memory usage of Lua in kilobytes.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current floored dynamic memory usage of Lua, in kilobytes.

GetConVar.DESCRIPTION: Gets the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) with the specified name.
NOTES: This function uses Global.GetConVar_Internal internally, but caches the result in Lua for quicker lookups.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the ConVar to get

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) object, or nil if no such [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) was found.

GetConVar_Internal.DESCRIPTION: Gets the ConVar with the specified name. This function doesn't cache the convar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the ConVar to get

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ConVar object

DEPRECATED: Store the ConVar object retrieved with Global.GetConVar and call ConVar:GetInt or ConVar:GetFloat on it.
GetConVarNumber.DESCRIPTION: Gets the numeric value ConVar with the specified name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the ConVar to get.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ConVar's value.

DEPRECATED: Store the ConVar object retrieved with Global.GetConVar and call ConVar:GetString on it.
GetConVarString.DESCRIPTION: Gets the string value ConVar with the specified name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the ConVar to get.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ConVar's value.

GetDefaultLoadingHTML.DESCRIPTION: Returns the default loading screen URL (asset://garrysmod/html/loading.html)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Default loading url (asset://garrysmod/html/loading.html)

GetDemoFileDetails.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves data about the demo with the specified filename. Similar to [GetSaveFileDetails](/gmod/Global.GetSaveFileDetails).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filename
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file name of the demo.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Demo data.

GetDownloadables.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table with the names of files needed from the server you are currently joining.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: table of file names

getfenv.DESCRIPTION: Returns the environment table of either the stack level or the function specified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: location
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The object to get the enviroment from. Can also be a number that specifies the function at that stack level: Level 1 is the function calling getfenv.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The environment.

GetGlobalAngle.DESCRIPTION: Returns an angle that is shared between the server and all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or default if the global is not set.

GetGlobalBool.DESCRIPTION: Returns a boolean that is shared between the server and all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or the default if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns an entity that is shared between the server and all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or the default if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalFloat.DESCRIPTION: Returns a float that is shared between the server and all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or the default if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalInt.DESCRIPTION: Returns an integer that is shared between the server and all clients.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function will not round decimal values as it actually networks a float internally.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or the default if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalString.DESCRIPTION: Returns a string that is shared between the server and all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or the default if the global value is not set.

GetGlobalVector.DESCRIPTION: Returns a vector that is shared between the server and all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique index to identify the global value with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if the global value is not set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The global value, or the default if the global value is not set.

GetHostName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the current server.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the server.

GetHUDPanel.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the panel that is used as a wrapper for the HUD. If you want your panel to be hidden when the main menu is opened, parent it to this. Child panels will also have their controls disabled.

See also [vgui.GetWorldPanel](/gmod/vgui.GetWorldPanel)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The HUD panel

GetLoadPanel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the loading screen panel and creates it if it doesn't exist.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The loading screen panel

GetLoadStatus.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current status of the server join progress.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current status

GetMapList.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table with the names of all maps and categories that you have on your client.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: table of map names and categories

getmetatable.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the metatable of an object. This function obeys the metatable's __metatable field, and will return that field if the metatable has it set.

Use [debug.getmetatable](/gmod/debug.getmetatable) if you want the true metatable of the object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return the metatable of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The metatable of the value. This is not always a table.

GetOverlayPanel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the menu overlay panel, a container for panels like the error panel created in [GM:OnLuaError](/gmod/GM:OnLuaError).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The overlay panel

GetPredictionPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns the player whose movement commands are currently being processed. The player this returns can safely have [Player:GetCurrentCommand](/gmod/Player:GetCurrentCommand)() called on them. See [Prediction](/gmod/Prediction).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player currently being predicted, or NULL if no command processing is currently being done.

GetRenderTarget.DESCRIPTION:
Creates or gets the rendertarget with the given name.

See [GetRenderTargetEx](/gmod/Global.GetRenderTargetEx) for an advanced version of this function with more options.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This crashes when used on a cubemap texture.

NOTES:
Calling this function is equivalent to

```lua

GetRenderTargetEx(name,

	width, height,

	RT_SIZE_NO_CHANGE,

	MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SEPARATE,

	bit.bor(2, 256),

	0,

	IMAGE_FORMAT_BGRA8888

)

```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The internal name of the render target.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the render target, must be power of 2. If not set to PO2, the size will be automatically converted to the nearest PO2 size.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the render target, must be power of 2. If not set to PO2, the size will be automatically converted to the nearest PO2 size.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The render target

GetRenderTargetEx.DESCRIPTION:
Gets (or creates if it does not exist) the rendertarget with the given name, this function allows to adjust the creation of a rendertarget more than [GetRenderTarget](/gmod/Global.GetRenderTarget).

See also [render.PushRenderTarget](/gmod/render.PushRenderTarget) and [render.SetRenderTarget](/gmod/render.SetRenderTarget).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The internal name of the render target.
WARNINGS: The name is treated like a path and gets its extension discarded."name.1" and "name.2" are considered the same name and will result in the same render target being reused.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the render target, must be power of 2.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the render target, must be power of 2.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sizeMode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag that influences the sizing of the render target, see [RT_SIZE](/gmod/Enums/RT_SIZE).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: depthMode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag that determines the depth buffer usage of the render target [MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH](/gmod/Enums/MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: textureFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Bitflag that configurates the texture, see [TEXTUREFLAGS](/gmod/Enums/TEXTUREFLAGS).

List of flags can also be found on the Valve's Developer Wiki:

https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Valve_Texture_Format

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rtFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Flags that controll the HDR behaviour of the render target, see [CREATERENDERTARGETFLAGS](/gmod/Enums/CREATERENDERTARGETFLAGS).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: imageFormat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Image format, see [IMAGE_FORMAT](/gmod/Enums/IMAGE_FORMAT).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new render target.

GetSaveFileDetails.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves data about the save with the specified filename. Similar to [GetDemoFileDetails](/gmod/Global.GetDemoFileDetails).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filename
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file name of the save.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Save data.

GetTimeoutInfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the client is timing out, and time since last ping from the server. Similar to the server side [Player:IsTimingOut](/gmod/Player:IsTimingOut)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is timing out?
Get time since last pinged received

GetViewEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity the client is using to see from (such as the player itself, the camera, or another entity).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The view entity.

HSLToColor.DESCRIPTION: Converts a color from [HSL color space](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_and_HSV) into RGB color space and returns a [Color](/gmod/Color).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hue in degrees from 0-360.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: saturation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The saturation from 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The lightness from 0-1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Color) created from the HSL color space.

HSVToColor.DESCRIPTION: Converts a color from [HSV color space](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_and_HSV) into RGB color space and returns a [Color](/gmod/Color).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hue in degrees from 0-360.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: saturation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The saturation from 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value from 0-1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Color) created from the HSV color space.

HTTP.DESCRIPTION: Launches an asynchronous http request with the given parameters.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This cannot send or receive multiple headers with the same name.

NOTES:
HTTP-requests to destinations on private networks (such as `192.168.0.1`) won't work.

To enable HTTP-requests to destinations on private networks use Command Line Parameters `-allowlocalhttp`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parameters
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The request parameters. See [HTTPRequest](/gmod/Structures/HTTPRequest).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if we made a request, `nil` if we failed.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: [pcall](/gmod/Global.pcall)ing this function will break autorefresh.

NOTES: This function will try to load local client file if `sv_allowcslua` is **1**.
Addon files (.gma files) do not support relative parent folders (`..` notation).
WARNINGS: The file you are attempting to include MUST NOT be empty or the include will fail. Files over a certain size may fail as well.
If the file you are including is clientside or shared, it **must** be Global.AddCSLuaFile'd or this function will error saying the file doesn't exist.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the script to be executed. The path must be either relative to the current file, or be an absolute path (relative to and excluding the **lua/** folder).
NOTES: Please make sure your file names are unique, the filesystem is shared across all addons, so a file named `lua/config.lua` in your addon may be overwritten by the same file in another addon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Anything that the executed Lua script returns.

DEPRECATED: To send the target file to the client simply call AddCSLuaFile() in the target file itself.
IncludeCS.DESCRIPTION:
This function works exactly the same as [include](/gmod/Global.include) both clientside and serverside.

The only difference is that on the serverside it also calls [AddCSLuaFile](/gmod/Global.AddCSLuaFile) on the filename, so that it gets sent to the client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filename
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The filename of the Lua file you want to include.

ipairs.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an iterator function for a for loop, to return ordered key-value pairs from a table.

This will only iterate though **numerical** keys, and these must also be **sequential**; starting at 1 with no gaps.

For unordered pairs, see [pairs](/gmod/Global.pairs).

For pairs sorted by key in alphabetical order, see [SortedPairs](/gmod/Global.SortedPairs).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to iterate over.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The iterator function.
The table being iterated over.
The origin index **=0**.

isangle.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is an [Angle](/gmod/Angle).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is an [Angle](/gmod/Angle).

isbool.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [boolean](/gmod/boolean).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [boolean](/gmod/boolean).

IsColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the given object does or doesn't have a `metatable` of a color.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Engine functions (i.e. those not written in plain Lua) that return color objects do not currently set the color metatable and this function will return false if you use it on them.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The object to be tested

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the given object is a color or not

IsEnemyEntityName.DESCRIPTION:
Returns if the given NPC class name is an enemy.

Returns true if the entity name is one of the following:
* "npc_antlion"
* "npc_antlionguard"
* "npc_antlionguardian"
* "npc_barnacle"
* "npc_breen"
* "npc_clawscanner"
* "npc_combine_s"
* "npc_cscanner"
* "npc_fastzombie"
* "npc_fastzombie_torso"
* "npc_headcrab"
* "npc_headcrab_fast"
* "npc_headcrab_poison"
* "npc_hunter"
* "npc_metropolice"
* "npc_manhack"
* "npc_poisonzombie"
* "npc_strider"
* "npc_stalker"
* "npc_zombie"
* "npc_zombie_torso"
* "npc_zombine"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: className
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the entity to check

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is an enemy

IsEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is an [Entity](/gmod/Entity). Alias of [Global.isentity](/gmod/Global.isentity).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is an [Entity](/gmod/Entity).

IsFirstTimePredicted.DESCRIPTION:
Returns if this is the first time this hook was predicted.

This is useful for one-time logic in your SWEPs PrimaryAttack, SecondaryAttack and Reload and other  (to prevent those hooks from being called rapidly in succession). It's also useful in a Move hook for when the client predicts movement.

Visit [Prediction](/gmod/Prediction) for more information about this behavior.
NOTES: This is already used internally for Entity:EmitSound, Weapon:SendWeaponAnim and Entity:FireBullets, but NOT in  util.Effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not this is the first time being predicted.

IsFriendEntityName.DESCRIPTION:
Returns if the given NPC class name is a friend.

Returns true if the entity name is one of the following:
* "npc_alyx"
* "npc_barney"
* "npc_citizen"
* "npc_dog"
* "npc_eli"
* "npc_fisherman"
* "npc_gman"
* "npc_kleiner"
* "npc_magnusson"
* "npc_monk"
* "npc_mossman"
* "npc_odessa"
* "npc_vortigaunt"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: className
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the entity to check

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is a friend

isfunction.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [function](/gmod/function).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [function](/gmod/function).

IsInGame.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the client is currently playing either a singleplayer or multiplayer game.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if we are in a game.

ismatrix.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the passed object is a [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix).

IsMounted.DESCRIPTION: Checks whether or not a game is currently mounted. Uses data given by [engine.GetGames](/gmod/engine.GetGames).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: game
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The game string/app ID to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the game is mounted.

isnumber.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [number](/gmod/number).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [number](/gmod/number).

ispanel.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [Panel](/gmod/Panel).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [Panel](/gmod/Panel).

isstring.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [string](/gmod/string).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [string](/gmod/string).

istable.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [table](/gmod/table).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [table](/gmod/table).

IsTableOfEntitiesValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not every element within a table is a valid entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table containing entities to check

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: All entities valid

IsUselessModel.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether or not a model is useless by checking that the file path is that of a proper model.

If the string ".mdl" is not found in the model name, the function will return true.

The function will also return true if any of the following strings are found in the given model name:

* "_gesture"

* "_anim"

* "_gst"

* "_pst"

* "_shd"

* "_ss"

* "_posture"

* "_anm"

* "ghostanim"

* "_paths"

* "_shared"

* "anim_"

* "gestures_"

* "shared_ragdoll_"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model name to be checked

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the model is useless

IsValid.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether an object is valid or not. (Such as [Entity](/gmod/Entity)s, [Panel](/gmod/Panel)s, custom [table](/gmod/table) objects and more).

Checks that an object is not nil, has an IsValid method and if this method returns true.
NOTES: Due to vehicles being technically valid the moment they're spawned, also use Vehicle:IsValidVehicle to make sure they're fully initialized

ARGUMENTS.NAME: toBeValidated
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table or object to be validated.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the object is valid.

isvector.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the passed object is a [Vector](/gmod/Vector).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to perform the type check for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the variable is a [Vector](/gmod/Vector).

JoinServer.DESCRIPTION: Joins the server with the specified IP.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: IP
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The IP of the server to join

JS_Language.DESCRIPTION: Adds javascript function 'language.Update' to an HTML panel as a method to call Lua's [language.GetPhrase](/gmod/language.GetPhrase) function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: htmlPanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to add javascript function 'language.Update' to.

JS_Utility.DESCRIPTION: Adds javascript function 'util.MotionSensorAvailable' to an HTML panel as a method to call Lua's [motionsensor.IsAvailable](/gmod/motionsensor.IsAvailable) function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: htmlPanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to add javascript function 'util.MotionSensorAvailable' to.

JS_Workshop.DESCRIPTION: Adds workshop related javascript functions to an HTML panel, used by the "Dupes" and "Saves" tabs in the spawnmenu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: htmlPanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to add javascript functions to.

Label.DESCRIPTION: Convenience function that creates a [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel), sets the text, and returns it

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to set the label's text to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Optional. The panel to parent the DLabel to

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

LanguageChanged.DESCRIPTION: Callback function for when the client's language changes. Called by the engine.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new language code.

Lerp.DESCRIPTION:
Performs a linear interpolation from the start number to the end number.

This function provides a very efficient and easy way to smooth out movements.
NOTES: This function is not meant to be used with constant value in the first argument, if you're dealing with animation! Use a value that changes over time. See example for **proper** usage of Lerp for animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: t
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The fraction for finding the result. This number is clamped between 0 and 1. Shouldn't be a constant.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: from
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The starting number. The result will be equal to this if delta is 0.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: to
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ending number. The result will be equal to this if delta is 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The result of the linear interpolation, `from + (to - from) * t`.

LerpAngle.DESCRIPTION: Returns point between first and second angle using given fraction and linear interpolation
NOTES: This function is not meant to be used with constant value in the first argument, if you're dealing with animation! Use a value that changes over time

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ratio
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ratio of progress through values

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angleStart
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle to begin from

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angleEnd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle to end at

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: angle

LerpVector.DESCRIPTION: Linear interpolation between two vectors. It is commonly used to smooth movement between two vectors
NOTES: This function is not meant to be used with constant value in the first argument, if you're dealing with animation! Use a value that changes over time

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fraction
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fraction ranging from 0 to 1

ARGUMENTS.NAME: from
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The initial Vector

ARGUMENTS.NAME: to
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The desired Vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The lerped vector.

LoadAddonPresets.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the contents of `addonpresets.txt` located in the `garrysmod/settings` folder. By default, this file stores your addon presets as JSON.

You can use [SaveAddonPresets](/gmod/Global.SaveAddonPresets) to modify this file.

RETURNS.NAME: JSON
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The contents of the file.

LoadLastMap.DESCRIPTION: This function is used to get the last map and category to which the map belongs from the cookie saved with [SaveLastMap](/gmod/Global.SaveLastMap).

LoadPresets.DESCRIPTION: Loads all preset settings for the [presets](/gmod/presets) and returns them in a table

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Preset data

Localize.DESCRIPTION: Returns a localisation for the given token, if none is found it will return the default (second) parameter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: localisationToken
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The token to find a translation for.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The default value to be returned if no translation was found.

LocalPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns the player object of the current client.
NOTES: LocalPlayer() will return NULL until all entities have been initialized. See GM:InitPostEntity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player object representing the client.

LocalToWorld.DESCRIPTION:
Translates the specified position and angle from the specified local coordinate system into worldspace coordinates.

If you're working with an entity's local vectors, use [Entity:LocalToWorld](/gmod/Entity:LocalToWorld) and/or [Entity:LocalToWorldAngles](/gmod/Entity:LocalToWorldAngles) instead.

See also: [WorldToLocal](/gmod/Global.WorldToLocal), the reverse of this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: localPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position vector in the source coordinate system, that should be translated to world coordinates

ARGUMENTS.NAME: localAng
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle in the source coordinate system, that should be converted to a world angle. If you don't need to convert an angle, you can supply an arbitrary valid angle (e.g. [Angle](/gmod/Global.Angle)()).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: originPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin point of the source coordinate system, in world coordinates

ARGUMENTS.NAME: originAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the source coordinate system, as a world angle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The world position of the supplied local position.
The world angles of the supplied local angle.

Material.DESCRIPTION: Either returns the material with the given name, or loads the material interpreting the first argument as the path.
NOTES: When using .png or .jpg textures, try to make their sizes Power Of 2 (1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, etc). While images are no longer scaled to Power of 2 sizes since February 2019, it is a good practice for things like icons, etc.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The material name or path. The path is relative to the **materials/** folder. You do not need to add **materials/** to your path.

To retrieve a Lua material created with [CreateMaterial](/gmod/Global.CreateMaterial), just prepend a "!" to the material name.
NOTES: Since paths are relative to the materials folder, resource paths like ../data/MyImage.jpg will work since ".." translates to moving up a parent directory in the file tree.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pngParameters
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A string containing space separated keywords which will be used to add material parameters.

See [Material Parameters](/gmod/Material Parameters) for more information.
NOTES: This feature only works when importing .png or .jpeg image files

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Generated material
How long it took for the function to run

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Initial data to initialize the matrix with. Leave empty to initialize an identity matrix. See examples for usage.

Can be a [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) to copy its data.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New matrix.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material the mesh is intended to be rendered with. It's merely a hint that tells that mesh what vertex format it should use.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model to precache.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The same string entered as an argument.

module.DESCRIPTION:
Creates a table with the specified module name and sets the function environment for said table.

Any passed loaders are called with the table as an argument. An example of this is [package.seeall](/gmod/package.seeall).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the module. This will be used to access the module table in the runtime environment.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: loaders
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Calls each function passed with the new table as an argument.

Msg.DESCRIPTION:
Writes every given argument to the console.

Automatically attempts to convert each argument to a string. (See [tostring](/gmod/Global.tostring))

Unlike [print](/gmod/Global.print), arguments are not separated by anything. They are simply concatenated.

Additionally, a newline isn't added automatically to the end, so subsequent Msg or print operations will continue the same line of text in the console. See [MsgN](/gmod/Global.MsgN) for a version that does add a newline.

The text is blue on the server, orange on the client, and green on the menu:

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: List of values to print.

MsgAll.DESCRIPTION: Works exactly like [Msg](/gmod/Global.Msg) except that, if called on the server, will print to all players consoles plus the server console.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: List of values to print.

MsgC.DESCRIPTION: Just like [Msg](/gmod/Global.Msg), except it can also print colored text, just like [chat.AddText](/gmod/chat.AddText).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Values to print. If you put in a color, all text after that color will be printed in that color.

MsgN.DESCRIPTION:
Same as [print](/gmod/Global.print), except it concatinates the arguments without inserting any whitespace in between them.

See also [Msg](/gmod/Global.Msg), which doesn't add a newline (`"\n"`) at the end.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: List of values to print. They can be of any type and will be converted to strings with [tostring](/gmod/Global.tostring).

NamedColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns named color defined in resource/ClientScheme.res.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of color

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A [Color](/gmod/Color) or nil

ARGUMENTS.NAME: addMetatable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If true, the userdata will get its own metatable automatically.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created userdata.

next.DESCRIPTION: Returns the next key and value pair in a table.
NOTES: Table keys in Lua have no specific order, and will be returned in whatever order they exist in memory. This may not always be in ascending order or alphabetical order. If you need to iterate over an array in order, use Global.ipairs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: prevKey
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The previous key in the table.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The next key for the table. If the previous key was nil, this will be the first key in the table. If the previous key was the last key in the table, this will be nil.
The value associated with that key. If the previous key was the last key in the table, this will be nil.

NumDownloadables.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of files needed from the server you are currently joining.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of downloadables

NumModelSkins.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the amount of skins the specified model has.

See also [Entity:SkinCount](/gmod/Entity:SkinCount) if you have an entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Model to return amount of skins of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of skins

OnModelLoaded.DESCRIPTION: Called by the engine when a model has been loaded. Caches model information with the [sql](/gmod/sql).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: numPostParams
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of pose parameters the model has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: numSeq
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of sequences the model has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: numAttachments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of attachments the model has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: numBoneControllers
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of bone controllers the model has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: numSkins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of skins that the model has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: size
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Size of the model.

OpenFolder.DESCRIPTION: Opens a folder with the given name in the garrysmod folder using the operating system's file browser.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not work on OSX or Linux.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: folder
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The subdirectory to open in the garrysmod folder.

OrderVectors.DESCRIPTION: Modifies the given vectors so that all of vector2's axis are larger than vector1's by switching them around. Also known as ordering vectors.
NOTES: This function will irreversibly modify the given vectors

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vector1
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bounding box min resultant

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vector2
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bounding box max resultant

pairs.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an iterator function([next](/gmod/Global.next)) for a for loop that will return the values of the specified table in an arbitrary order.

* For alphabetical **key** order use [SortedPairs](/gmod/Global.SortedPairs).

* For alphabetical **value** order use [SortedPairsByValue](/gmod/Global.SortedPairsByValue).
NOTES: In sequential tables like player.GetAll or ents.GetAll (and `ents.Find*` functions), it's more efficient to use Global.ipairs or [for](http://lua-users.org/wiki/ForTutorial) iterator.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to iterate over.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The iterator ([next](/gmod/Global.next)).
The table being iterated over.
**nil** (for the constructor).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: file
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The particle file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The particle file.

NOTES: The particle effect must be precached with Global.PrecacheParticleSystem and the file its from must be added via game.AddParticles before it can be used!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: particleName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the particle effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The orientation of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the particle will be parented to the entity.

ParticleEffectAttach.DESCRIPTION: Creates a particle effect with specialized parameters.
NOTES: The particle effect must be precached with Global.PrecacheParticleSystem and the file its from must be added via game.AddParticles before it can be used!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: particleName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the particle effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attachment type using [PATTACH](/gmod/Enums/PATTACH).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be used in the way specified by the attachType.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachmentID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the attachment to be used in the way specified by the attachType.

NOTES: Do not forget to delete the emitter with CLuaEmitter:Finish once you are done with it

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The start position of the emitter.

This is only used to determine particle drawing order for translucent particles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: use3D
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whenever to render the particles in 2D or 3D mode.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new particle emitter.

Path.DESCRIPTION: Creates a path for the bot to follow

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the path to create.
This is going to be "Follow" or "Chase" right now.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The path

pcall.DESCRIPTION: Calls a function and catches an error that can be thrown while the execution of the call.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Using this function with [include](/gmod/Global.include) will break autorefresh.
This cannot stop errors from hooks called from the engine.

This does not stop [Global.Error](/gmod/Global.Error) and [ErrorNoHalt](/gmod/Global.ErrorNoHalt) from sending error messages to the server (if called clientside) or calling the [GM:OnLuaError](/gmod/GM:OnLuaError) hook. The success boolean returned will always return true and thus you will not get the error message returned. [Global.error](/gmod/Global.error) does not exhibit these behaviours.
This does not stop errors incurred by [include](/gmod/Global.include).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to be executed and of which the errors should be caught of

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments to call the function with.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the function had no errors occur within it.
If an error occurred, this will be a string containing the error message. Otherwise, this will be the return values of the function passed in.

Player.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player with the matching [Player:UserID](/gmod/Player:UserID).

For a function that returns a player based on their [Entity:EntIndex](/gmod/Entity:EntIndex), see [Entity](/gmod/Global.Entity).
