For a function that returns a player based on their connection ID, see [player.GetByID](/gmod/player.GetByID).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: playerIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The retrieved player.

PositionSpawnIcon.DESCRIPTION:
Moves the given model to the given position and calculates appropriate camera parameters for rendering the model to an icon.

The output table interacts nicely with [Panel:RebuildSpawnIconEx](/gmod/Panel:RebuildSpawnIconEx) with a few key renames.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Model that is being rendered to the spawn icon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position that the model is being rendered at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: noAngles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If true the function won't reset the angles to 0 for the model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of information of the view which can be used for rendering

PrecacheParticleSystem.DESCRIPTION: Precaches the particle with the specified name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: particleSystemName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the particle system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scene
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the scene file to precache.

PrecacheSentenceFile.DESCRIPTION: Load and precache a custom sentence file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filename
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the custom sentences.txt.

PrecacheSentenceGroup.DESCRIPTION: Precache a sentence group in a sentences.txt definition file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: group
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The group to precache.

print.DESCRIPTION:
Writes every given argument to the console.

Automatically attempts to convert each argument to a string. (See [tostring](/gmod/Global.tostring))

Seperates lines with a line break (`"\n"`)

Separates arguments with a tab character (`"\t"`).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: List of values to print.

PrintMessage.DESCRIPTION:
Displays a message in the chat, console, or center of screen of every player.

This uses the archaic user message system ([umsg](/gmod/umsg)) and hence is limited to ≈250 characters.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Which type of message should be sent to the players (see [HUD](/gmod/Enums/HUD))

ARGUMENTS.NAME: message
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Message to be sent to the players

PrintTable.DESCRIPTION: Recursively prints the contents of a table to the console.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tableToPrint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to be printed

ARGUMENTS.NAME: indent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of tabs to start indenting at. Increases by 2 when entering another table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: done
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Internal argument, you shouldn't normally change this. Used to check if a nested table has already been printed so it doesn't get caught in a loop.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Newly created projected texture.

ProtectedCall.DESCRIPTION:
Runs a function without stopping the whole script on error.

This function is similar to [pcall](/gmod/Global.pcall) and [xpcall](/gmod/Global.xpcall) except the errors are still printed and sent to the error handler (i.e. sent to server console if clientside and [GM:OnLuaError](/gmod/GM:OnLuaError) called).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to run

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the function executed successfully or not

RandomPairs.DESCRIPTION: Returns an iterator function that can be used to loop through a table in random order

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to create iterator for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the iterator should iterate descending or not

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Iterator function

rawequal.DESCRIPTION: Compares the two values without calling their __eq operator.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value1
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The first value to compare.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value2
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The second value to compare.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the two values are equal.

RealFrameTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the real frame-time which is unaffected by host_timescale. To be used for GUI effects (for example)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Real frame time

RealTime.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the uptime of the game/server in seconds (to at least **4** decimal places). This value updates itself once every time the realm thinks. For servers, this is the server tickrate. For clients, its their current FPS.

You should use this function (or [SysTime](/gmod/Global.SysTime)) for timing real-world events such as user interaction, but not for timing game events such as animations.

See also: [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime), [SysTime](/gmod/Global.SysTime)
NOTES:
This is **not** synchronised or affected by the game.

This will be affected by precision loss if the uptime is more than 30+(?) days, and effectively cease to be functional after 50+(?) days.

Changing the map will **not** fix it like it does with Global.CurTime. A server restart is necessary.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Uptime of the game/server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: unreliable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
If set to true, makes the filter unreliable. 

This means, when sending over the network in cases like [CreateSound](/gmod/Global.CreateSound) (and its subsequent updates), the message is not guaranteed to reach all clients.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new created recipient filter.

require.DESCRIPTION: First tries to load a binary module with the given name, if unsuccessful, it tries to load a Lua module with the given name.

RestoreCursorPosition.DESCRIPTION: Restores position of your cursor on screen. You can save it by using [RememberCursorPosition](/gmod/Global.RememberCursorPosition).

RunConsoleCommand.DESCRIPTION: Executes the given console command with the parameters.
NOTES: Some commands/convars are blocked from being ran/changed using this function, usually to prevent harm/annoyance to clients. For a list of blocked commands, see Blocked ConCommands.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: command
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The command to be executed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The arguments. Note, that unlike [Player:ConCommand](/gmod/Player:ConCommand), you must pass each argument as a new string, not separating them with a space.

RunGameUICommand.DESCRIPTION: Runs a menu command. Equivalent to [RunConsoleCommand](/gmod/Global.RunConsoleCommand)( "gamemenucommand", command ) unless the command starts with the "engine" keyword in which case it is equivalent to [RunConsoleCommand](/gmod/Global.RunConsoleCommand)( command ).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: command
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The menu command to run

Should be one of the following:

* Disconnect - Disconnects from the current server.

* OpenBenchmarkDialog - Opens the "Video Hardware Stress Test" dialog.

* OpenChangeGameDialog - Does not work in GMod.

* OpenCreateMultiplayerGameDialog - Opens the Source dialog for creating a listen server.

* OpenCustomMapsDialog - Does nothing.

* OpenFriendsDialog - Does nothing.

* OpenGameMenu - Does not work in GMod.

* OpenLoadCommentaryDialog - Opens the "Developer Commentary" selection dialog. Useless in GMod.

* OpenLoadDemoDialog - Does nothing.

* OpenLoadGameDialog - Opens the Source "Load Game" dialog.

* OpenNewGameDialog - Opens the "New Game" dialog. Useless in GMod.

* OpenOptionsDialog - Opens the options dialog.

* OpenPlayerListDialog - Opens the "Mute Players" dialog that shows all players connected to the server and allows to mute them.

* OpenSaveGameDialog - Opens the Source "Save Game" dialog.

* OpenServerBrowser - Opens the legacy server browser.

* Quit - Quits the game `without` confirmation (unlike other Source games).

* QuitNoConfirm - Quits the game without confirmation (like other Source games).

* ResumeGame - Closes the menu and returns to the game.

* engine

SortedPairs.DESCRIPTION:
This function can be used in a for loop instead of [pairs](/gmod/Global.pairs). It sorts all **keys** alphabetically.

For sorting by specific **value member**, use [SortedPairsByMemberValue](/gmod/Global.SortedPairsByMemberValue).

For sorting by **value**, use [SortedPairsByValue](/gmod/Global.SortedPairsByValue).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to sort

ARGUMENTS.NAME: desc
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Reverse the sorting order

The table being iterated over

SortedPairsByMemberValue.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an iterator function that can be used to loop through a table in order of member values, when the values of the table are also tables and contain that member.

To sort by **value**, use [SortedPairsByValue](/gmod/Global.SortedPairsByValue).

To sort by **keys**, use [SortedPairs](/gmod/Global.SortedPairs).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to create iterator for.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: memberKey
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Key of the value member to sort by.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the iterator should iterate in descending order or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Iterator function
The table the iterator was created for.

SortedPairsByValue.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an iterator function that can be used to loop through a table in order of its **values**.

To sort by specific **value member**, use [SortedPairsByMemberValue](/gmod/Global.SortedPairsByMemberValue).

To sort by **keys**, use [SortedPairs](/gmod/Global.SortedPairs).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to create iterator for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the iterator should iterate in descending order or not

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Iterator function
The table which will be iterated over

xpcall.DESCRIPTION:
Attempts to call the first function. If the execution succeeds, this returns `true` followed by the returns of the function. If execution fails, this returns `false` and the second function is called with the error message. 

Unlike in [pcall](/gmod/Global.pcall), the stack is not unwound and can therefore be used for stack analyses with the [debug](/gmod/debug).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Using this function with [include](/gmod/Global.include) will break autorefresh.
This cannot stop errors from hooks called from the engine.

This does not stop [Global.Error](/gmod/Global.Error) and [ErrorNoHalt](/gmod/Global.ErrorNoHalt) from sending error messages to the server (if called clientside) or calling the [GM:OnLuaError](/gmod/GM:OnLuaError) hook. The success boolean returned will always return true and thus you will not get the error message returned. [Global.error](/gmod/Global.error) does not exhibit these behaviours.
This does not stop errors incurred by [include](/gmod/Global.include).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to call initially.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: errorCallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to be called if execution of the first fails; the error message is passed as a string.

You cannot throw an [Global.error](/gmod/Global.error)() from this callback: it will have no effect (not even stopping the callback).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments to pass to the initial function.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Status of the execution; `true` for success, `false` for failure.
The returns of the first function if execution succeeded, otherwise the **first** return value of the error callback.

GetTracerShootPos.DESCRIPTION:
Used to get the "real" start position of a trace, for weapon tracer effects.

"real" meaning in 3rd person, the 3rd person position will be used, in first person the first person position will be used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Default position if we fail

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon to use.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attachment ID of on the weapon "muzzle", to use as the start position.
NOTES: Please note that it is expected that the same attachment ID is used on both, the world and the view model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The "real" start position.

Init.DESCRIPTION: Called when the effect is created.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effectData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The effect data used to create the effect.

PhysicsCollide.DESCRIPTION: Called when the effect collides with anything.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: colData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Information regarding the collision. See [CollisionData](/gmod/Structures/CollisionData)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: collider
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object of the entity that collided with the effect.

Render.DESCRIPTION: Called when the effect should be rendered.

Think.DESCRIPTION: Called when the effect should think, return false to kill the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to remove this effect.

EFFECT.DESCRIPTION: These hooks are used inside of a Lua effect. Lua effects are stored in either the `/lua/effects` directory or in a gamemode in `/gamemodes/

AcceptInput.DESCRIPTION: Called when another entity fires an event to this entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inputName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the input that was triggered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The initial cause for the input getting triggered. (EG the player who pushed a button)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: caller
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that directly triggered the input. (EG the button that was pushed)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data passed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should we suppress the default action for this input?

CalcAbsolutePosition.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever the entity's position changes. A callback for when an entity's angle changes is available via [Entity:AddCallback](/gmod/Entity:AddCallback).

Like [ENTITY:RenderOverride](/gmod/ENTITY:RenderOverride), this hook works on any entity (scripted or not) it is applied on.
NOTES: The give concommand will call this hook serverside only upon entity spawn.

If EFL_DIRTY_ABSTRANSFORM is set on the entity, this will be called serverside only; otherwise, this will be called clientside only. This means serverside calls of Entity:SetPos without the EFL_DIRTY_ABSTRANSFORM flag enabled (most cases) will be called clientside only.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's actual position. May differ from [Entity:GetPos](/gmod/Entity:GetPos)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's actual angles. May differ from [Entity:GetAngles](/gmod/Entity:GetAngles)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New position
New angles

CanProperty.DESCRIPTION:
Controls if a property can be used on this entity or not.

This hook will only work in Sandbox derived gamemodes that do not have [SANDBOX:CanProperty](/gmod/SANDBOX:CanProperty) overridden.
NOTES: This hook will work on ALL entities, not just the scripted ones (SENTs)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player, that tried to use the property

ARGUMENTS.NAME: property
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class of the property that is tried to use, for example - bonemanipulate

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Return false to disallow using that property, return true to allow.

You must return a value. Not returning anything can cause unexpected results.

CanTool.DESCRIPTION:
Controls if a tool can be used on this entity or not.

This hook will only work in Sandbox derived gamemodes that do not have [SANDBOX:CanTool](/gmod/SANDBOX:CanTool) overridden.
NOTES: This hook will work on ALL entities, not just the scripted ones (SENTs)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player, that tried to use the tool

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The trace of the tool. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tool
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class of the tool that is tried to use, for example - `weld`

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to disallow using that tool on this entity, return `true` to allow.

CreateSchedulesInternal.DESCRIPTION: Called just before [ENTITY:Initialize](/gmod/ENTITY:Initialize) for "ai" type entities only.

DoImpactEffect.DESCRIPTION: Called so the entity can override the bullet impact effects it makes. This is called when the entity itself fires bullets via [Entity:FireBullets](/gmod/Entity:FireBullets), not when it gets hit.
NOTES: This hook only works for the "anim" type entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult) from the bullet's start point to the impact point

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage type of bullet. See [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to not do the default thing - which is to call UTIL_ImpactTrace in C++

DoingEngineSchedule.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever an engine schedule is being ran.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

DoSchedule.DESCRIPTION: Runs a Lua schedule. Runs tasks inside the schedule.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sched
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The schedule to run.

Draw.DESCRIPTION:
Called if and when the entity should be drawn opaquely, based on the [Entity:GetRenderGroup](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderGroup) of the entity.

See [ENT](/gmod/Structures/ENT) and [RENDERGROUP](/gmod/Enums/RENDERGROUP) for more information.

See also [ENTITY:DrawTranslucent](/gmod/ENTITY:DrawTranslucent).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bit flags from [STUDIO](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO)

DrawTranslucent.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity should be drawn translucently. If your scripted entity has a translucent model, it will be invisible unless it is drawn here.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bit flags from [STUDIO](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO)

EndTouch.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity stops touching another entity.
WARNINGS: This only works for **brush** entities and for entities that have Entity:SetTrigger set to true.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity which was touched.

EngineScheduleFinish.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever an engine schedule is finished.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ExpressionFinished.DESCRIPTION: Called when an NPC's expression has finished.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strExp
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path of the expression.

FireAnimationEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Called before firing clientside animation events, such as muzzle flashes or shell ejections.

See [ENTITY:HandleAnimEvent](/gmod/ENTITY:HandleAnimEvent) for the serverside version.
NOTES: This hook only works on "anim", "nextbot" and "ai" type entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle of the effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The event ID of happened even. See [this page](http://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Animation_Events).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the event

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to disable the effect

GetAttackSpread.DESCRIPTION: Called to determine how good an NPC is at using a particular weapon.
NOTES: "ai" base only

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon being used by the NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target the NPC is attacking

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of degrees of inaccuracy in the NPC's attack.

GetRelationship.DESCRIPTION: Called when scripted NPC needs to check how he "feels" against another entity, such as when [NPC:Disposition](/gmod/NPC:Disposition) is called.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity in question

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: How our scripter NPC "feels" towards the entity in question. See [D](/gmod/Enums/D).

GetRenderMesh.DESCRIPTION: Specify a mesh that should be rendered instead of this SENT's model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table containing the following keys:
* [IMesh](/gmod/IMesh) Mesh - Required
* [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial) Material - Required
* [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) Matrix - Optional

GetShadowCastDirection.DESCRIPTION: Called when the shadow needs to be recomputed. Allows shadow angles to be customized. This only works for `anim` type entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Type of the shadow this entity uses. Possible values:

* 0 - No shadow

* 1 - Simple 'blob' shadow

* 2 - Render To Texture shadow (updates only when necessary)

* 3 - Dynamic RTT - updates always

* 4 - Render to Depth Texture

RETURNS.NAME: dir
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new shadow direction to use.

GravGunPickupAllowed.DESCRIPTION: Called by [GM:GravGunPickupAllowed](/gmod/GM:GravGunPickupAllowed) on ALL entites in Sandbox-derived  gamemodes and acts as an override.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player aiming at us

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow the entity to be picked up

GravGunPunt.DESCRIPTION:
Called when this entity is about to be punted with the gravity gun (primary fire).

Only works in Sandbox derived gamemodes and only if [GM:GravGunPunt](/gmod/GM:GravGunPunt) is not overridden.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player pressing left-click with the gravity gun at an entity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true or false to enable or disable punting respectively.

HandleAnimEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Called before firing serverside animation events, such as weapon reload, drawing and holstering for NPCs, scripted sequences, etc.

See [ENTITY:FireAnimationEvent](/gmod/ENTITY:FireAnimationEvent) for the clientside version.
NOTES: This hook only works on "anim", "ai" and "nextbot" type entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The event ID of happened even. See [this page](http://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Animation_Events).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: eventTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The absolute time this event occurred using [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cycle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frame this event occurred as a number between 0 and 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Event type. See [the Source SDK](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/master/mp/src/game/shared/eventlist.h#L14-L23).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name or options of this event.

ImpactTrace.DESCRIPTION: Called when a bullet trace hits this entity and allows you to override the default behavior by returning true.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: traceResult
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The trace that hit this entity as a [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage bits associated with the trace, see [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: customImpactName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The effect name to override the impact effect with.
Possible arguments are ImpactJeep, AirboatGunImpact, HelicopterImpact, ImpactGunship.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to override the default impact effects.

Initialize.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the entity is created. This is called when you [Entity:Spawn](/gmod/Entity:Spawn) the custom entity.

This is called **after** [ENTITY:SetupDataTables](/gmod/ENTITY:SetupDataTables) and [GM:OnEntityCreated](/gmod/GM:OnEntityCreated).

IsJumpLegal.DESCRIPTION: Called when deciding if the Scripted NPC should be able to perform a certain jump or not.
NOTES: This is only called for "ai" type entities

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Start of the jump

ARGUMENTS.NAME: apex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Apex point of the jump

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The landing position

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Return true if this jump should be allowed to be performed, false otherwise.

Not returning anything, or returning a non boolean will perform the default action.

KeyValue.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the engine sets a value for this scripted entity.

This hook is called **before** [ENTITY:Initialize](/gmod/ENTITY:Initialize) when the key-values are set by the map.

Otherwise this hook will be called whenever [Entity:SetKeyValue](/gmod/Entity:SetKeyValue) is called on the entity.

See [GM:EntityKeyValue](/gmod/GM:EntityKeyValue) for a hook that works for all entities.

See [WEAPON:KeyValue](/gmod/WEAPON:KeyValue) for a hook that works for scripted weapons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that was affected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress this KeyValue or return false or nothing to apply this key value.

NextTask.DESCRIPTION: Start the next task in specific schedule.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sched
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The schedule to start next task in.

OnChangeActivity.DESCRIPTION: Called when the NPC has changed its activity.
NOTES: This hook only works for `ai` type entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new activity. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

OnCondition.DESCRIPTION: Called each time the NPC updates its condition.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: conditionID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of condition. See [NPC:ConditionName](/gmod/NPC:ConditionName).

OnDuplicated.DESCRIPTION:
Called on any entity after it has been created by the [duplicator](/gmod/duplicator) and before any bone/entity modifiers have been applied.

This hook is called after [ENTITY:Initialize](/gmod/ENTITY:Initialize) and before [ENTITY:PostEntityPaste](/gmod/ENTITY:PostEntityPaste).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [EntityCopyData](/gmod/Structures/EntityCopyData) of the source entity.

OnEntityCopyTableFinish.DESCRIPTION:
Called after duplicator finishes saving the entity, allowing you to modify the save data.

This is called after [ENTITY:PostEntityCopy](/gmod/ENTITY:PostEntityCopy).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The save [EntityCopyData](/gmod/Structures/EntityCopyData) that you can modify.

OnReloaded.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity is reloaded by the lua auto-refresh system, i.e. when the developer edits the lua file for the entity while the game is running.

OnRemove.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the entity is about to be removed.

See also [Entity:CallOnRemove](/gmod/Entity:CallOnRemove), which can even be used on engine (non-Lua) entities.

OnRestore.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the entity is reloaded from a Source Engine save (not the Sandbox saves or dupes) or on a changelevel (for example Half-Life 2 campaign level transitions).

For the [duplicator](/gmod/duplicator) callbacks, see [ENTITY:OnDuplicated](/gmod/ENTITY:OnDuplicated).

OnTakeDamage.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity is taking damage.
WARNINGS: Calling Entity:TakeDamage, Entity:TakeDamageInfo, Entity:DispatchTraceAttack, or Player:TraceHullAttack (if the entity is hit) in this hook on the victim entity can cause infinite loops since the hook will be called again. Make sure to setup recursion safeguards like the example below.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage to be applied to the entity.

OnTaskComplete.DESCRIPTION:
Called from the engine when TaskComplete is called.

This allows us to move onto the next task - even when TaskComplete was called from an engine side task.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

PassesTriggerFilters.DESCRIPTION: Polls whenever the entity should trigger the brush.
WARNINGS: This hook is broken and will not work without code below

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that is about to trigger.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should trigger or not.

PhysicsCollide.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity collides with anything. The move type and solid type must be VPHYSICS for the hook to be called.
NOTES: If you want to use this hook on default/engine/non-Lua entites ( like prop_physics ), use Entity:AddCallback instead! This page describes a hook for Lua entities

ARGUMENTS.NAME: colData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Information regarding the collision. See [CollisionData](/gmod/Structures/CollisionData).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: collider
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object that collided.

PhysicsSimulate.DESCRIPTION:
Called from the Entity's motion controller to simulate physics.

This will only be called after using [Entity:StartMotionController](/gmod/Entity:StartMotionController) on a scripted entity of "anim" type.
NOTES: This hook can work on the CLIENT if you call Entity:StartMotionController and use Entity:AddToMotionController on the physics objects you want to control
WARNINGS: Do not use functions such as PhysObj:EnableCollisions or PhysObj:EnableGravity in this hook as they're very likely to crash your game. You may want to use ENTITY:PhysicsUpdate instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: phys
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: deltaTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Time since the last call.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Angular force
Linear force
One of the [SIM](/gmod/Enums/SIM).

PhysicsUpdate.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the physics of the entity are updated.
WARNINGS: This hook won't be called if the Entity's PhysObj goes asleep

ARGUMENTS.NAME: phys
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object of the entity.

PostEntityCopy.DESCRIPTION:
Called after the duplicator finished copying the entity.

See also [ENTITY:PreEntityCopy](/gmod/ENTITY:PreEntityCopy) and [ENTITY:PostEntityPaste](/gmod/ENTITY:PostEntityPaste).

PostEntityPaste.DESCRIPTION:
Called after the [duplicator](/gmod/duplicator) pastes the entity, after the bone/entity modifiers have been applied to the entity.

This hook is called after [ENTITY:OnDuplicated](/gmod/ENTITY:OnDuplicated).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who pasted the entity.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will be nil for invalid players.

WARNINGS: This may not be a valid player in some circumstances. For example, when a save is loaded from the main menu, this hook will be called before the player is spawned. This argument will be a NULL entity in that case.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity itself. Same as 'self'.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: createdEntities
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: All entities that are within the placed dupe.
NOTES: The keys of each value in this table are the original entity indexes when the duplication was created. This can be utilized to restore entity references that don't get saved in duplications.

PreEntityCopy.DESCRIPTION:
Called before the duplicator copies the entity.

If you are looking for a way to make the duplicator spawn another entity when duplicated. ( For example, you duplicate a "prop_physics", but you want the duplicator to spawn "prop_physics_my" ), you should add prop_physics.ClassOverride = "prop_physics_my". The duplication table should be also stored on that prop_physics, not on prop_physics_my.

RenderOverride.DESCRIPTION:
Called instead of the engine drawing function of the entity. This hook works on any entity (scripted or not) it is applied on.

This does not work on "physgun_beam", use [GM:DrawPhysgunBeam](/gmod/GM:DrawPhysgunBeam) instead.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Drawing a viewmodel in this function will cause [GM:PreDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PreDrawViewModel), [WEAPON:PreDrawViewModel](/gmod/WEAPON:PreDrawViewModel), [WEAPON:ViewModelDrawn](/gmod/WEAPON:ViewModelDrawn), [GM:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PostDrawViewModel), and [WEAPON:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/WEAPON:PostDrawViewModel) to be called twice.
This is called before PrePlayerDraw for players. If this function exists at all on a player, their worldmodel will always be rendered regardless of PrePlayerDraw's return.

NOTES: As a downside of this implementation, only one RenderOverride may be applied at a time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [STUDIO_](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO) flags for this render operation.

RunAI.DESCRIPTION: Called from the engine every 0.1 seconds.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

RunEngineTask.DESCRIPTION: Called when an engine task is ran on the entity.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task ID, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task data.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true to prevent default action

RunTask.DESCRIPTION:
Called every think on running task.

The actual task function should tell us when the task is finished.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: task
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task to run

ScheduleFinished.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a schedule is finished.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

SelectSchedule.DESCRIPTION: Set the schedule we should be playing right now.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

SetAutomaticFrameAdvance.DESCRIPTION:
Toggles automatic frame advancing for animated sequences on an entity.

This has the same effect as setting the ``ENT.AutomaticFrameAdvance`` property. (See [ENT](/gmod/Structures/ENT))

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to set automatic frame advancing.

NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: task
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task to set.

SetupDataTables.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the entity should set up its [Data Tables](/gmod/Networking_Entities).

This is a much better option than using Set/Get Networked Values.

This hook is called after [GM:OnEntityCreated](/gmod/GM:OnEntityCreated) and [GM:NetworkEntityCreated](/gmod/GM:NetworkEntityCreated).

SpawnFunction.DESCRIPTION:
This is the spawn function. It's called when a player spawns the entity from the spawnmenu.

If you want to make your SENT spawnable you need this function to properly create the entity.
WARNINGS: Unlike other ENTITY functions, the "self" parameter of this function is not an entity but rather the table used to generate the SENT. This table is equivalent to scripted_ents.GetStored("ent_name").

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that is spawning this SENT

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult) from player eyes to their aim position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ClassName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname of your entity

NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scheduleID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Schedule ID to start. See [SCHED](/gmod/Enums/SCHED)

StartEngineTask.DESCRIPTION: Called when an engine task has been started on the entity.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task ID to start, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: TaskData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task data

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true to stop default action

StartSchedule.DESCRIPTION:
Starts a schedule previously created by [ai_schedule.New](/gmod/ai_schedule.New).

Not to be confused with [ENTITY:StartEngineSchedule](/gmod/ENTITY:StartEngineSchedule) or [NPC:SetSchedule](/gmod/NPC:SetSchedule) which start an Engine-based schedule.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sched
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Schedule to start.

NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: task
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task to start, created by [ai_task.New](/gmod/ai_task.New).

StartTouch.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity starts touching another entity.
WARNINGS: This only works for **brush** entities and for entities that have Entity:SetTrigger set to true.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity which is being touched.

StoreOutput.DESCRIPTION:
Used to store an output so it can be triggered with [ENTITY:TriggerOutput](/gmod/ENTITY:TriggerOutput).

Outputs compiled into a map are passed to entities as key/value pairs through [ENTITY:KeyValue](/gmod/ENTITY:KeyValue).

TriggerOutput will do nothing if this function has not been called first.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of output to store

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Output info

TaskFinished.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the current running Task is finished.
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the current running Task is finished or not.

TaskTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns how many seconds we've been doing this current task
NOTES: This hook only exists for **ai** type SENTs

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: How many seconds we've been doing this current task

TestCollision.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override trace result when a trace hits the entitys Bounding Box.
NOTES: This hook is called for `anim` type only.
Your entity must have Entity:EnableCustomCollisions enabled for this hook to work.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startpos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Start position of the trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delta
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Offset from startpos to the endpos of the trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isbox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is the trace a hull trace?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: extents
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Size of the hull trace?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mask
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS) mask.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Returning a `table` will allow you to override trace results. Table should contain the following keys, all optional:

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) `HitPos` - The new hitpos of the trace.

* [number](/gmod/number) `Fraction` - A number from `0` to `1`, describing how far the trace went from its origin point, `1` = did not hit.

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) `Normal` - A unit vector (length=1) describing the direction perpendicular to the hit surface.

Returning `true` will allow "normal" collisions to happen for `SOLID_VPHYSICS` and `SOLID_BBOX` entities.

Returning `nothing` or `false` allows the trace to ignore the entity completely.

Think.DESCRIPTION:
Called every frame on the client.

Called every tick on the server.
NOTES: You may need to call Entity:Spawn to get this hook to run server side.
By default, it runs about 5-6 times per second on the server, but you can force it to run at servers tickrate using the example below.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if you used [Entity:NextThink](/gmod/Entity:NextThink) to override the next execution time.

Touch.DESCRIPTION:
Called every tick for every entity being "touched".

See also [ENTITY:StartTouch](/gmod/ENTITY:StartTouch) and [ENTITY:EndTouch](/gmod/ENTITY:EndTouch).
NOTES: For physics enabled entities, this hook will **not** be ran while the entity's physics is asleep. See PhysObj:Wake.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that touched it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: output
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of output to fire

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Activator entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data to give to the output.

UpdateTransmitState.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the transmit state should be updated.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Transmit state to set, see [TRANSMIT](/gmod/Enums/TRANSMIT).

Use.DESCRIPTION:
Called when an entity "uses" this entity, for example a player pressing their `+use` key (default ) on this entity.

To change how often the hook is called, see [Entity:SetUseType](/gmod/Entity:SetUseType).
NOTES: This hook only works for `nextbot`, `ai` and `anim` scripted entity types.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that caused this input. This will usually be the player who pressed their use key

ARGUMENTS.NAME: caller
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity responsible for the input. This will typically be the same as `activator` unless some other entity is acting as a proxy

ARGUMENTS.NAME: useType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Use type, see [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Any passed value.

ENT.DESCRIPTION:
A list of hooks **only** available for [Scripted Entities](/gmod/Scripted Entities).

The exceptions to this rule are documented at [Custom Entity Fields](/gmod/Custom Entity Fields), which can be applied to all entities.

Some more "hooks" are available for all entities (including engine entities) with the function [Entity:AddCallback](/gmod/Entity:AddCallback).

See also: [ENT](/gmod/Structures/ENT)
NOTES: The hooks listed here are also dependent on the scripted entity type. For instance, a base scripted entity will not use ENTITY:DoSchedule at all, that is only for scripted NPCs

AcceptInput.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a map I/O event occurs.

See also [Entity:Fire](/gmod/Entity:Fire) and [Entity:Input](/gmod/Entity:Input) for functions to fire Inputs on entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity that receives the input

ARGUMENTS.NAME: input
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The input name. Is not guaranteed to be a valid input on the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Activator of the input

ARGUMENTS.NAME: caller
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Caller of the input

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Data provided with the input. Will be either a [string](/gmod/string), a [number](/gmod/number), a [boolean](/gmod/boolean) or a [nil](/gmod/nil).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent this input from being processed. Do not return otherwise.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: You cannot use [hook.Add](/gmod/hook.Add) on this hook yet.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the attacker

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attackerTeam
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team of the attacker

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inflictor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the entity inflicting the damage

ARGUMENTS.NAME: victim
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the victim

ARGUMENTS.NAME: victimTeam
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Team of the victim

AdjustMouseSensitivity.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to adjust the mouse sensitivity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: defaultSensitivity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The old sensitivity

In general it will be 0, which is equivalent to a sensitivity of 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A fraction of the normal sensitivity (0.5 would be half as sensitive).

Return -1 to not override and prevent subsequent hooks and [WEAPON:AdjustMouseSensitivity](/gmod/WEAPON:AdjustMouseSensitivity) from running.  

Return [nil](/gmod/nil) to not override and allow subsequent hooks and [WEAPON:AdjustMouseSensitivity](/gmod/WEAPON:AdjustMouseSensitivity) to run.

AllowPlayerPickup.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player tries to pick up something using the "use" key, return to override.

This hook will not be called if `sv_playerpickupallowed` is set to 0.

See [GM:GravGunPickupAllowed](/gmod/GM:GravGunPickupAllowed) for the Gravity Gun pickup variant.

See [GM:PhysgunPickup](/gmod/GM:PhysgunPickup) for the Physics Gun pickup variant.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player trying to pick up something.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Entity the player attempted to pick up.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allow the player to pick up the entity or not.

CalcMainActivity.DESCRIPTION: This hook is used to calculate animations for a player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can return the incorrect velocity when on a moving object.

WARNINGS: This hook must return the same values at the same time on both, client **and** server. On client for players to see the animations, on server for hit detection to work properly.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to apply the animation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The velocity of the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT) for the activity the player should use. A nil return will be treated as ACT_INVALID.
Sequence for the player to use. This takes precedence over the activity (the activity is still used for layering). Return -1 or nil to let the activity determine the sequence.

CalcVehicleView.DESCRIPTION:
Called from [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView) when player is in driving a vehicle.

This hook may not be called in gamemodes that override [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: veh
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle the player is driving

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle driver

ARGUMENTS.NAME: view
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The view data containing players FOV, view position and angles, see [CamData](/gmod/Structures/CamData)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The modified view table containing new values, see [CamData](/gmod/Structures/CamData)

CalcView.DESCRIPTION: Allows override of the default view.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The local player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's view position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's view angles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Field of view.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: znear
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Distance to near clipping plane.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: zfar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Distance to far clipping plane.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: View data table. See [CamData](/gmod/Structures/CamData)

CalcViewModelView.DESCRIPTION: Allows overriding the position and angle of the viewmodel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The viewmodel entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Original position (before viewmodel bobbing and swaying)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldAng
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Original angle (before viewmodel bobbing and swaying)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current angle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New position
New angle

CanEditVariable.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a variable is edited on an Entity (called by `Edit Properties...` menu), to determine if the edit should be permitted.

See [Editable entities](/gmod/Editable_Entities) for more details about the system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity being edited.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player doing the editing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the variable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: val
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new value, as a string which will later be converted to its appropriate type.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: editor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The edit table defined in [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow editing.

CanExitVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the player can exit the vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: veh
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the player can exit the vehicle.

CanPlayerEnterVehicle.DESCRIPTION:
Determines whether or not the player can enter the vehicle.

Called just before [GM:PlayerEnteredVehicle](/gmod/GM:PlayerEnteredVehicle).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vehicle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: role
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The seat number.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `false` if the player is not allowed to enter the vehicle.

CanPlayerSuicide.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the player can kill themselves using the concommands `kill` or `explode`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if they can suicide.

CanPlayerUnfreeze.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the player can unfreeze the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: phys
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object of the entity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if they can unfreeze.

CanUndo.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a players tries to undo.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who tried to undo something.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: undo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The undo table as a [Undo](/gmod/Structures/Undo).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow the undo.

CaptureVideo.DESCRIPTION: Called each frame to record demos to video using [IVideoWriter](/gmod/IVideoWriter).
NOTES: This hook is called every frame regardless of whether or not a demo is being recorded

ChatText.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a message is printed to the chat box. Note, that this isn't working with player messages even though there are arguments for it.

For player messages see [GM:PlayerSay](/gmod/GM:PlayerSay) and [GM:OnPlayerChat](/gmod/GM:OnPlayerChat)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text that is being sent.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Chat filter type. Possible values are:

* `joinleave` - Player join and leave messages

* `namechange` - Player name change messages

* `servermsg` - Server messages such as convar changes

* `teamchange` - Team changes?

* `chat` - (Obsolete?) Player chat?

* `none` - A fallback value

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress the chat message.

ChatTextChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the content of the user's chat input box is changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new contents of the input box

CheckPassword.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a non local player connects to allow the Lua system to check the password.

The default behaviour in the base gamemodes emulates what would normally happen. If sv_password is set and its value matches the password passed in by the client - then they are allowed to join. If it isn't set it lets them in too.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamID64
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The 64bit Steam ID of the joining player, use [util.SteamIDFrom64](/gmod/util.SteamIDFrom64) to convert it to a `STEAM_0:` one.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ipAddress
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The IP of the connecting client

ARGUMENTS.NAME: svPassword
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The current value of sv_password (the password set by the server)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: clPassword
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The password provided by the client

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the joining player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the hook returns false then the player is disconnected

If returning false in the first argument, then this should be the disconnect message. This will default to `#GameUI_ServerRejectBadPassword`, which is `Bad Password.` translated to the client's language.

CloseDermaMenus.DESCRIPTION: Called when derma menus are closed with [CloseDermaMenus](/gmod/Global.CloseDermaMenus).

CreateClientsideRagdoll.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever an entity becomes a clientside ragdoll.

See [GM:CreateEntityRagdoll](/gmod/GM:CreateEntityRagdoll) for serverside ragdolls.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Entity that created the ragdoll

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ragdoll
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ragdoll being created.

CreateEntityRagdoll.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a serverside ragdoll of an entity has been created.

See [GM:CreateClientsideRagdoll](/gmod/GM:CreateClientsideRagdoll) for clientside ragdolls.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: owner
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity that owns the ragdoll

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ragdoll
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ragdoll entity

CreateMove.DESCRIPTION:
Allows you to change the players movements before they're sent to the server.

See [Game Movement](/gmod/Game Movement) for an explanation on the move system.
NOTES: Due to this hook being clientside only, it could be overridden by the user allowing them to completely skip your logic, it is recommended to use GM:StartCommand in a shared file instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cmd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The User Command data

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Return true to:
* Disable Sandbox C menu "screen clicking"
* Disable Teammate nocollide (verification required)
* Prevent calling of C_BaseHLPlayer::CreateMove & subsequently C_BasePlayer::CreateMove

CreateTeams.DESCRIPTION: Teams are created within this hook using [team.SetUp](/gmod/team.SetUp).
NOTES: This hook is called before GM:PreGamemodeLoaded.

DoAnimationEvent.DESCRIPTION: Called upon an animation event, this is the ideal place to call player animation functions such as [Player:AddVCDSequenceToGestureSlot](/gmod/Player:AddVCDSequenceToGestureSlot), [Player:AnimRestartGesture](/gmod/Player:AnimRestartGesture) and so on.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who is being animated

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Animation event. See [PLAYERANIMEVENT](/gmod/Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data for the event. This is interpreted as an [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT) by `PLAYERANIMEVENT_CUSTOM` and `PLAYERANIMEVENT_CUSTOM_GESTURE`, or a sequence by `PLAYERANIMEVENT_CUSTOM_SEQUENCE`.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The translated activity to send to the weapon. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT). Return `ACT_INVALID` if you don't want to send an activity.

DoPlayerDeath.DESCRIPTION:
Handles the player's death.

This hook is **not** called if the player is killed by [Player:KillSilent](/gmod/Player:KillSilent). See [GM:PlayerSilentDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerSilentDeath) for that.

* [GM:PlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerDeath) is called after this hook

* [GM:PostPlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PostPlayerDeath) is called after that
NOTES: Player:Alive returns true when this is called

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that killed the player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmg
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage info

DrawDeathNotice.DESCRIPTION: This hook is called every frame to draw all of the current death notices.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X position to draw death notices as a ratio

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y position to draw death notices as a ratio

DrawMonitors.DESCRIPTION: Called every frame before drawing the in-game monitors ( Breencast, in-game TVs, etc ), but doesn't seem to be doing anything, trying to render 2D or 3D elements fail.

DrawOverlay.DESCRIPTION:
Called after all other 2D draw hooks are called. Draws over all VGUI Panels and HUDs.

Unlike [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint), this hook is called with the game paused and while the Camera SWEP is equipped.
NOTES: Only gets called when r_drawvgui is enabled.

DrawPhysgunBeam.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override physgun beam drawing.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is still called when physgun_drawbeams is disabled.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Physgun owner

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physgun
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physgun

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enabled
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is the beam enabled

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity we are grabbing. This will be NULL if nothing is being held

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physBone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: ID of the physics bone ([PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)) we are grabbing at. Use [Entity:TranslatePhysBoneToBone](/gmod/Entity:TranslatePhysBoneToBone) to translate to an actual bone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Beam hit position relative to the physics bone ([PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)) we are grabbing.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to hide default beam

EndEntityDriving.DESCRIPTION: Called right before an entity stops driving. Overriding this hook will cause it to not call [drive.End](/gmod/drive.End) and the player will not stop driving.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity being driven

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player driving the entity

EntityEmitSound.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a sound has been played. This will not be called clientside if the server played the sound without the client also calling [Entity:EmitSound](/gmod/Entity:EmitSound).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not called for scripted sequences.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Information about the played sound. Changes done to this table can be applied by returning `true` from this hook.

See [EmitSoundInfo](/gmod/Structures/EmitSoundInfo).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
* Return `true` to apply all changes done to the data table.

* Return `false` to prevent the sound from playing.

* Return `nil` or nothing to play the sound without altering it.

EntityFireBullets.DESCRIPTION: Called every time a bullet is fired from an entity.
WARNINGS: This hook is called directly from Entity:FireBullets. Due to this, you cannot call Entity:FireBullets inside this hook or an infinite loop will occur crashing the game.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that fired the bullet

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bullet data. See [Bullet](/gmod/Structures/Bullet).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
* Return `true` to apply all changes done to the bullet table.

* Return `false` to suppress the bullet.

EntityKeyValue.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a key-value pair is set on an entity, either by the engine (for example when map spawns) or [Entity:SetKeyValue](/gmod/Entity:SetKeyValue).

See [ENTITY:KeyValue](/gmod/ENTITY:KeyValue) for a hook that works for scripted entities.

See [WEAPON:KeyValue](/gmod/WEAPON:KeyValue) for a hook that works for scripted weapons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity that the keyvalue is being set on

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Key of the key/value pair

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value of the key/value pair

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the value of the key-value pair will be overridden by this string.

EntityNetworkedVarChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when an NWVar is changed.
NOTES: Currently this hook only works for the NW2Var system (accessed by adding a 2 in between NW and Var for most NWVar functions), which will replace the original one at some point in the future
This hook is fired before the client value is actually changed. Calling the GetNW function for the specified variable name within this hook will return the old value, not the current/updated one.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The owner entity of changed NWVar

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name if changed NWVar

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldval
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The old value of the NWVar

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newval
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new value of the NWVar

EntityRemoved.DESCRIPTION: Called right before the removal of an entity.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This hook is called during clientside full updates. See [ENTITY:OnRemove#clientsidebehaviourremarks](/gmod/ENTITY:OnRemove#clientsidebehaviourremarks) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity being removed

EntityTakeDamage.DESCRIPTION: Called when an entity takes damage. You can modify all parts of the damage info in this hook.
WARNINGS: Applying damage from this hook to the entity taking damage will lead to infinite loop/crash.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity taking damage

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmg
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage info

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to completely block the damage event

FindUseEntity.DESCRIPTION: This hook polls the entity the player use action should be applied to.
NOTES: The default behavior of this hook is in [CBasePlayer::FindUseEntity](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/0d8dceea4310fde5706b3ce1c70609d72a38efdf/mp/src/game/shared/baseplayer_shared.cpp#L1068-L1270). Despite CBasePlayer::FindUseEntity being defined shared, it is only called serverside in practice, so this hook will be only called serverside, as well. It is possible for modules to call it clientside, so the Lua code should still be treated as shared.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who initiated the use action.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: defaultEnt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that was chosen by the engine.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to use instead of default entity

FinishMove.DESCRIPTION:
Called after [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move), applies all the changes from the [CMoveData](/gmod/CMoveData) to the player.

See [Game Movement](/gmod/Game Movement) for an explanation on the move system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Movement data

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default engine behavior, i.e. declare that you have already moved the player according to the move data in a custom way.

ForceDermaSkin.DESCRIPTION: Called to allow override of the default Derma skin for all panels.
NOTES: This hook is only called on Lua start up, changing its value (or adding new hooks) after it has been already called will not have any effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A **case sensitive** Derma skin name to be used as default, registered previously via [derma.DefineSkin](/gmod/derma.DefineSkin).

Returning nothing, nil or invalid name will make it fallback to the "Default" skin.

GameContentChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called to refresh menu content once it has initialized or something has been mounted.

GetFallDamage.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player takes damage from falling, allows to override the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The fall speed

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New fall damage

GetGameDescription.DESCRIPTION: Called when the game(server) needs to update the text shown in the server browser as the gamemode.
NOTES: This hook (and the sv_gamename_override command) may not work on some popular gamemodes like DarkRP or Trouble Terrorist Town. This is not a bug, it's just how it works. See [here](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-issues/issues/4637#issuecomment-677884989) for more information.
WARNINGS: This hook only works on dedicated servers.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The text to be shown in the server browser as the gamemode.

GetMotionBlurValues.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to modify the Source Engine's motion blur shaders.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: horizontal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of horizontal blur.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vertical
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of vertical  blur.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: forward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of forward/radial blur.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rotational
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of rotational blur.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New amount of horizontal blur.
New amount of vertical blur.
New amount of forward/radial blur.
New amount of rotational blur.

GetPreferredCarryAngles.DESCRIPTION: Called to determine preferred carry angles for the entity. It works for both, +use pickup and gravity gun pickup.
NOTES: This hook can **not** override preferred carry angles of props such as the sawblade and the harpoon.
WARNINGS: Due to nature of the gravity gun coding in multiplayer, this hook **MAY** seem to not work ( but rest assured it does ), due to clientside prediction not knowing the carry angles. The +use pickup doesn't present this issue as it doesn't predict the player carrying the object clientside ( as you may notice by the prop lagging behind in multiplayer )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to generate carry angles for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The preferred carry angles for the entity.

GetTeamColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color for the given entity's team. This is used in chat and deathnotice text.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Team [Color](/gmod/Global.Color)

GetTeamNumColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the team color for the given team index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: team
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Team index

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Team [Color](/gmod/Global.Color)

GrabEarAnimation.DESCRIPTION: Override this hook to disable/change ear-grabbing in your gamemode.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player

GravGunOnDropped.DESCRIPTION:
Called when an entity is released by a gravity gun.

See [GM:PhysgunDrop](/gmod/GM:PhysgunDrop) for the Physics Gun drop variant.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who is wielding the gravity gun

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that has been dropped

GravGunOnPickedUp.DESCRIPTION: Called when an entity is picked up by a gravity gun.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player wielding the gravity gun

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that has been picked up by the gravity gun

GravGunPickupAllowed.DESCRIPTION:
Called every tick to poll whether a player is allowed to pick up an entity with the gravity gun or not.

See [GM:AllowPlayerPickup](/gmod/GM:AllowPlayerPickup) for the +USE pickup variant.

See [GM:PhysgunPickup](/gmod/GM:PhysgunPickup) for the Physics Gun pickup variant.

Calls [ENTITY:GravGunPickupAllowed](/gmod/ENTITY:GravGunPickupAllowed) on the entity being hovered every frame in Sandbox-derived gamemodes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player wielding the gravity gun

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the player is attempting to pick up

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow entity pick up

GravGunPunt.DESCRIPTION:
Called when an entity is about to be punted with the gravity gun (primary fire).

By default this function makes [ENTITY:GravGunPunt](/gmod/ENTITY:GravGunPunt) work in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player wielding the gravity gun

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the player is attempting to punt

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow and false to disallow.

GUIMouseDoublePressed.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the mouse has been double clicked on any panel derived from CGModBase, such as the panel used by [gui.EnableScreenClicker](/gmod/gui.EnableScreenClicker) and the panel used by [Panel:ParentToHUD](/gmod/Panel:ParentToHUD).

By default this hook calls [GM:GUIMousePressed](/gmod/GM:GUIMousePressed).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mouseCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The code of the mouse button pressed, see [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: aimVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A normalized vector pointing in the direction the client has clicked

GUIMousePressed.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever a players presses a mouse key on the context menu in Sandbox or on any panel derived from CGModBase, such as the panel used by [gui.EnableScreenClicker](/gmod/gui.EnableScreenClicker) and the panel used by [Panel:ParentToHUD](/gmod/Panel:ParentToHUD).

See [GM:VGUIMousePressed](/gmod/GM:VGUIMousePressed) for a hook that is called on all VGUI elements.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mouseCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that the player pressed using [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: aimVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A normalized direction vector local to the camera. Internally, this is  [gui.ScreenToVector](/gmod/gui.ScreenToVector)( [gui.MousePos](/gmod/gui.MousePos)() ).

GUIMouseReleased.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a players releases a mouse key on the context menu in Sandbox or on any panel derived from CGModBase, such as the panel used by [gui.EnableScreenClicker](/gmod/gui.EnableScreenClicker) and the panel used by [Panel:ParentToHUD](/gmod/Panel:ParentToHUD).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mouseCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key the player released, see [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: aimVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A normalized direction vector local to the camera. Internally this is  [gui.ScreenToVector](/gmod/gui.ScreenToVector)( [gui.MousePos](/gmod/gui.MousePos)() ).

HandlePlayerDriving.DESCRIPTION: Allows to override player driving animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player to process

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HandlePlayerDucking.DESCRIPTION: Allows to override player crouch animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players velocity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HandlePlayerJumping.DESCRIPTION: Called every frame by the player model animation system. Allows to override player jumping animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players velocity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HandlePlayerLanding.DESCRIPTION: Allows to override player landing animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players velocity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: onGround
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Was the player on ground?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HandlePlayerNoClipping.DESCRIPTION: Allows to override player noclip animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players velocity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HandlePlayerSwimming.DESCRIPTION: Allows to override player swimming animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players velocity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HandlePlayerVaulting.DESCRIPTION: Allows to override player flying ( in mid-air, not noclipping ) animations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players velocity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we've changed/set the animation, false otherwise

HUDAmmoPickedUp.DESCRIPTION: Called when the client has picked up ammo. Override to disable default HUD notification.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: itemName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the item (ammo) picked up

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of the item (ammo) picked up

HUDDrawPickupHistory.DESCRIPTION: Renders the HUD pick-up history. Override to hide default or draw your own HUD.

HUDDrawScoreBoard.DESCRIPTION:
Called every frame to render the scoreboard.

It is recommended to use Derma and VGUI for this job instead of this hook. Called right after [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint).

HUDDrawTargetID.DESCRIPTION: Called from [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint) to draw player info when you hover over a player with your crosshair or mouse.

HUDItemPickedUp.DESCRIPTION: Called when an item has been picked up. Override to disable the default HUD notification.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: itemName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the picked up item

HUDPaint.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever the HUD should be drawn. Called right before [GM:HUDDrawScoreBoard](/gmod/GM:HUDDrawScoreBoard) and after [GM:HUDPaintBackground](/gmod/GM:HUDPaintBackground).

Not called when the Camera SWEP is equipped. See also [GM:DrawOverlay](/gmod/GM:DrawOverlay).
NOTES: Gets called only when r_drawvgui and GM:HUDShouldDraw are enabled and the game is not paused

HUDPaintBackground.DESCRIPTION:
Called before [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint) when the HUD background is being drawn.

Things rendered in this hook will **always** appear behind things rendered in [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint).

HUDShouldDraw.DESCRIPTION: Called when the Gamemode is about to draw a given element on the client's HUD (heads-up display).
WARNINGS: This hook is called HUNDREDS of times per second (more than 5 times per frame on average). You shouldn't be performing any computationally intensive operations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the HUD element. You can find a full list of HUD elements for this hook [here](/gmod/HUD_Element_List).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to prevent the given element from being drawn on the client's screen.

HUDWeaponPickedUp.DESCRIPTION: Called when a weapon has been picked up. Override to disable the default HUD notification.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The picked up weapon

Initialize.DESCRIPTION: Called after the gamemode loads and starts.

InitPostEntity.DESCRIPTION: Called after all the entities are initialized. Starting from this hook [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer) will return valid object.
NOTES: When this hook is called on the client, net messages will reliably be received.

At this point the client only knows about the entities that are within the spawnpoints' [PVS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potentially_visible_set). For instance, if the server sends an entity that is not within this PVS, the client will receive it as NULL entity.

InputMouseApply.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to modify the supplied User Command with mouse input. This could be used to make moving the mouse do funky things to view angles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cmd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: User command.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of mouse movement across the X axis this frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of mouse movement across the Y axis this frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The current view angle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if we modified something.

IsSpawnpointSuitable.DESCRIPTION: Check if a player can spawn at a certain spawnpoint.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who is spawned

ARGUMENTS.NAME: spawnpoint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The spawnpoint entity (on the map).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: makeSuitable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If this is true, it'll kill any players blocking the spawnpoint.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to indicate that the spawnpoint is suitable (Allow for the player to spawn here), false to prevent spawning.

KeyPress.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever a player pressed a key included within the IN keys.

For a more general purpose function that handles all kinds of input, see [GM:PlayerButtonDown](/gmod/GM:PlayerButtonDown).
WARNINGS: Due to this being a predicted hook, Global.ParticleEffects created only serverside from this hook will not be networked to the client, so make sure to do that on both realms.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player pressing the key. If running client-side, this will always be [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that the player pressed using [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN).

KeyRelease.DESCRIPTION:
Runs when a IN key was released by a player.

For a more general purpose function that handles all kinds of input, see [GM:PlayerButtonUp](/gmod/GM:PlayerButtonUp).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player releasing the key. If running client-side, this will always be [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that the player released using [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN).

LoadGModSave.DESCRIPTION: Called from gm_load when the game should load a map.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Compressed save data

ARGUMENTS.NAME: map
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the map the save was created on

ARGUMENTS.NAME: timestamp
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time the save was created on. Will always be 0.

MouthMoveAnimation.DESCRIPTION: Override this gamemode function to disable mouth movement when talking on voice chat.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player in question

Move.DESCRIPTION:
The Move hook is called for you to manipulate the player's MoveData. 

You shouldn't adjust the player's position in any way in the move hook. This is because due to prediction errors, the netcode might run the move hook multiple times as packets arrive late. Therefore you should only adjust the movedata construct in this hook.

Generally you shouldn't have to use this hook - if you want to make a custom move type you should look at the drive system.

This hook is called after [GM:PlayerTick](/gmod/GM:PlayerTick).

See [Game Movement](/gmod/Game Movement) for an explanation on the move system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Movement information

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default engine action.

NeedsDepthPass.DESCRIPTION: Returning true in this hook will cause it to render depth buffers defined with [render.GetResolvedFullFrameDepth](/gmod/render.GetResolvedFullFrameDepth).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Render depth buffer

NetworkEntityCreated.DESCRIPTION: Called when an entity has been created over the network.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Created entity

NetworkIDValidated.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has been validated by Steam.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player SteamID

NotifyShouldTransmit.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever this entity changes its transmission state for this [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer), such as exiting or re entering the [PVS](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PVS).
NOTES:
This is the best place to handle the reset of Entity:SetPredictable, as this would be usually called when the player lags and requests a full packet update.

	When the entity stops transmitting, Entity:IsDormant will only return true **after** this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that changed its transmission state.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldtransmit
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `True` if we started transmitting to this client and `false` if we stopped.

OnAchievementAchieved.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has achieved an achievement. You can get the name and other information from an achievement ID with the [achievements](/gmod/achievements) library.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that earned the achievement

ARGUMENTS.NAME: achievement
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the achievement

OnChatTab.DESCRIPTION: Called when the local player presses TAB while having their chatbox opened.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The currently typed into chatbox text

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: What should be placed into the chatbox instead of what currently is when player presses tab

OnCleanup.DESCRIPTION: Called when the player cleans up something.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the cleanup type

RETURNS.NAME: suppress
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to suppress the cleanup notification.

OnContextMenuClose.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the context menu keybind (+menu_context) is released, which by default is C.

This hook will not run if [input.IsKeyTrapping](/gmod/input.IsKeyTrapping) returns true.

See also [GM:OnContextMenuOpen](/gmod/GM:OnContextMenuOpen).

OnContextMenuOpen.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the context menu keybind (`+menu_context`) is pressed, which by default is .

See also [GM:OnContextMenuClose](/gmod/GM:OnContextMenuClose).

OnCrazyPhysics.DESCRIPTION: Called when the crazy physics detection detects an entity with Crazy Physics.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that was detected as crazy

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physobj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object that is going crazy

OnDamagedByExplosion.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has been hurt by an explosion. Override to disable default sound effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who has been hurt

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmginfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage info from explsion

OnEntityCreated.DESCRIPTION: Called when the entity is created.
NOTES: Some entities on initial map spawn are passed through this hook, and then removed in the same frame. This is used by the engine to precache things like models and sounds, so always check their validity with Global.IsValid.
WARNINGS: Removing the created entity during this event can lead to unexpected problems. Use timer.Simple( 0, .... ) to safely remove the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity

OnEntityWaterLevelChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when the [Entity:WaterLevel](/gmod/Entity:WaterLevel) of an entity is changed.
WARNINGS: This hook can be considered a physics callback, so changing collision rules (Entity:SetSolidFlags) in it may lead to a crash!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: old
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Previous water level.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: new
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new water level.

OnGamemodeLoaded.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the gamemode is loaded.

[LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer)() returns NULL at the time this is run.

OnLuaError.DESCRIPTION: Called when a Lua error occurs, only works in the Menu realm.
WARNINGS: Modify menu state Lua code at your own risk!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: error
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The error that occurred.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: realm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Where the Lua error took place

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stack
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Lua error stack trace

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Title of the addon that is creating the Lua errors.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
