ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Steam Workshop ID of the addon creating Lua errors, if it is an addon.

OnNPCKilled.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever an NPC is killed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: npc
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The killed NPC

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPCs attacker, the entity that gets the kill credit, for example a player or an NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inflictor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Death inflictor. The entity that did the killing. Not necessarily a weapon.

OnPhysgunFreeze.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player freezes an entity with the physgun.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not called for players or NPCs being held with the physgun.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon that was used to freeze the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physobj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Physics object of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who tried to freeze the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override whether the player can freeze the entity

OnPhysgunPickup.DESCRIPTION:
Called to when a player has successfully picked up an entity with their Physics Gun.

Not to be confused with [GM:PhysgunPickup](/gmod/GM:PhysgunPickup) which is called multiple times to ask if the player should be able to pick up an entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that has picked up something using the physics gun.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that was picked up.

OnPhysgunReload.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player reloads with the physgun. Override this to disable default unfreezing behavior.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physgun
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physgun in question

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player wielding the physgun

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player can reload with the physgun or not

DEPRECATED: Use GM:PlayerChangedTeam instead, which works for every Player:SetTeam call.
OnPlayerChangedTeam.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has changed team using [GM:PlayerJoinTeam](/gmod/GM:PlayerJoinTeam).
WARNINGS: This hook will not work with hook.Add and it is only called manually from GM:PlayerJoinTeam by the base gamemode

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who has changed team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldTeam
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team the player was originally in

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newTeam
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team the player has changed to

OnPlayerChat.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a player sends a chat message. For the serverside equivalent, see [GM:PlayerSay](/gmod/GM:PlayerSay).
NOTES: The text input of this hook depends on GM:PlayerSay. If it is suppressed on the server, it will be suppressed on the client. This also means, that a message surpressed with this hook will be still visible to other clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The message's text

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamChat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is the player typing in team chat?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isDead
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is the player dead?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should the message be suppressed?

OnPlayerHitGround.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player makes contact with the ground after a jump or a fall.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inWater
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Did the player land in water?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: onFloater
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Did the player land on an object floating in the water?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The speed at which the player hit the ground

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action

OnReloaded.DESCRIPTION: Called when gamemode has been reloaded by auto refresh.
NOTES: It seems that this event can be triggered more than once for a single refresh event.

OnScreenSizeChanged.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the player's screen resolution of the game changes.

[ScrW](/gmod/Global.ScrW) and [ScrH](/gmod/Global.ScrH) will return the new values when this hook is called.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The previous width of the game's window.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldHeight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The previous height of the game's window.

OnSpawnMenuClose.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player releases the `+menu` bind on their keyboard, which is bound to Q by default.

OnSpawnMenuOpen.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player presses the `+menu` bind on their keyboard, which is bound to Q by default.

OnTextEntryGetFocus.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry) gets focus.

This hook is run from [DTextEntry:OnGetFocus](/gmod/DTextEntry:OnGetFocus) and [PANEL:OnMousePressed](/gmod/PANEL:OnMousePressed) of [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that got focus

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that lost focus

OnUndo.DESCRIPTION: Called when the player undoes something.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the undo action

ARGUMENTS.NAME: customText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The custom text for the undo, set by [undo.SetCustomUndoText](/gmod/undo.SetCustomUndoText)

RETURNS.NAME: suppress
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to suppress the undo notification.

OnViewModelChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when the player changes their weapon to another one - and their viewmodel model changes.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not always called clientside.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewmodel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The viewmodel that is changing

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldModel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The old model

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newModel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new model

PhysgunDrop.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player drops an entity with the Physgun.

See [GM:GravGunOnDropped](/gmod/GM:GravGunOnDropped) for the Gravity Gun drop variant.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who dropped an entitiy

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The dropped entity

PhysgunPickup.DESCRIPTION:
Called to determine if a player should be able to pick up an entity with the Physics Gun.

See [GM:OnPhysgunPickup](/gmod/GM:OnPhysgunPickup) for a hook which is called when a player has successfully picked up an entity.

See [GM:GravGunPickupAllowed](/gmod/GM:GravGunPickupAllowed) for the Gravity Gun pickup variant.

See [GM:AllowPlayerPickup](/gmod/GM:AllowPlayerPickup) for the +USE pickup variant.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that is picking up using the Physics Gun.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that is being picked up.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player can pick up the entity or not.

PlayerAmmoChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when player's reserve ammo count changes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player whose ammo is being affected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ammo type ID.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldCount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The old ammo count.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newCount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new ammo count.

PlayerAuthed.DESCRIPTION: Called once when the player is authenticated.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime) returns 0 in this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's SteamID

ARGUMENTS.NAME: uniqueid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's UniqueID

PlayerBindPress.DESCRIPTION: Runs when a bind has been pressed. Allows to block commands.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The third argument will always be true.
This does not run for function keys binds (F1-F12).

NOTES:
By using the "alias" console command, this hook can be effectively circumvented. To prevent this use input.TranslateAlias.

To stop the user from using `+attack`, `+left` and any other movement commands of the sort, please look into using GM:StartCommand instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who used the command; this will always be equal to [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bind
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bind command.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pressed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the bind was activated or deactivated.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `true` to prevent the bind.

PlayerButtonDown.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player presses a button.

This will not be called if player has a panel opened with keyboard input enabled, use [PANEL:OnKeyCodePressed](/gmod/PANEL:OnKeyCodePressed) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who pressed the button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: button
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The button, see [BUTTON_CODE](/gmod/Enums/BUTTON_CODE)

PlayerButtonUp.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player releases a button.

This will not be called if player has a panel opened with keyboard input enabled, use [PANEL:OnKeyCodeReleased](/gmod/PANEL:OnKeyCodeReleased) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who released the button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: button
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The button, see [BUTTON_CODE](/gmod/Enums/BUTTON_CODE)

PlayerCanHearPlayersVoice.DESCRIPTION: Decides whether a player can hear another player using voice chat.
NOTES: This hook is called **several** times a tick, so ensure your code is efficient.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: listener
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The listening player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: talker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The talking player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `true` if the listener should hear the talker, `false` if they shouldn't.
3D sound. If set to `true`, will fade out the sound the further away listener is from the  talker, the voice will also be in stereo, and not mono.

PlayerCanJoinTeam.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not a player is allowed to join a team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player attempting to switch teams

ARGUMENTS.NAME: team
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allowed to switch

PlayerCanPickupItem.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not a player is allowed to pick an item up. (ammo, health, armor)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player attempting to pick up

ARGUMENTS.NAME: item
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The item the player is attempting to pick up

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allow pick up

PlayerCanPickupWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not a player is allowed to pick up a weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player attempting to pick up the weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon entity in question.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allowed pick up or not.

PlayerCanSeePlayersChat.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the player can see the other player's chat.
NOTES: The **speaker** parameter does not have to be a valid Player object which happens when console messages are displayed for example.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The chat text

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamOnly
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the message is team-only

ARGUMENTS.NAME: listener
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player receiving the message

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speaker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player sending the message.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can see other player's chat

PlayerChangedTeam.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has changed team using [Player:SetTeam](/gmod/Player:SetTeam).
WARNINGS: Avoid calling Player:SetTeam in this hook as it may cause an infinite loop!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player whose team has changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldTeam
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team the player was originally in. See [team.GetName](/gmod/team.GetName) and the [team](/gmod/team) library.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newTeam
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team the player has changed to.

PlayerCheckLimit.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a player is about to spawn something to see if they hit a limit for whatever they are spawning.
NOTES: This hook will not be called in singleplayer, as singleplayer does not have limits.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who is trying to spawn something.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: limitName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The limit's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: current
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of whatever player is trying to spawn that the player already has spawned.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: defaultMax
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The default maximum count, as dictated by the `sbox_max

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to indicate the limit was hit, or nothing otherwise

PlayerClassChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a player's class is changed on the server-side with [player_manager.SetPlayerClass](/gmod/player_manager.SetPlayerClass).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player whose class has been changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The network ID of the player class's name string, or `0` if we are clearing a player class from the player.

Pass this into [util.NetworkIDToString](/gmod/util.NetworkIDToString) to retrieve the proper name of the player class.

PlayerConnect.DESCRIPTION: Executes when a player connects to the server. Called before the player has been assigned a [UserID](/gmod/Player:UserID) and entity. See the [player_connect gameevent](/gmod/Game_Events) for a version of this hook called after the player entity has been created.
NOTES: This is not called clientside for the local player.
This is only called clientside for listen server hosts.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ip
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's IP address. Will be "none" for bots.
NOTES: This argument will only be passed serverside.

PlayerDeath.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player is killed by [Player:Kill](/gmod/Player:Kill) or any other normal means.

This hook is **not** called if the player is killed by [Player:KillSilent](/gmod/Player:KillSilent). See [GM:PlayerSilentDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerSilentDeath) for that.

* [GM:DoPlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:DoPlayerDeath) is called **before** this hook.

* [GM:PostPlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PostPlayerDeath) is called **after** this hook.

See [Player:LastHitGroup](/gmod/Player:LastHitGroup) if you need to get the last hit hitgroup of the player.
NOTES: Player:Alive will return true in this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: victim
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who died

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inflictor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Item used to kill the victim

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player or entity that killed the victim

PlayerDeathSound.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the default death sound should be muted.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Mute death sound

PlayerDeathThink.DESCRIPTION:
Called every think while the player is dead. The return value will determine if the player respawns.

Overwriting this function will prevent players from respawning by pressing space or clicking.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This hook is not called for players with the [FL_FROZEN](/gmod/Enums/FL) flag applied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player affected in the hook.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allow spawn

PlayerDisconnected.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player leaves the server. See the [player_disconnect gameevent](/gmod/Game_Events) for a shared version of this hook.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not called in single-player or listen servers for the host.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: the player

PlayerDriveAnimate.DESCRIPTION: Called to update the player's animation during a drive.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The driving player

PlayerDroppedWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a weapon is dropped by a player via [Player:DropWeapon](/gmod/Player:DropWeapon).

Also called when a weapon is removed from a player via [Player:StripWeapon](/gmod/Player:StripWeapon).

See also [GM:WeaponEquip](/gmod/GM:WeaponEquip) for a hook when a player picks up a weapon.

The weapon's [Entity:GetOwner](/gmod/Entity:GetOwner) will be NULL at the time this hook is called.

[WEAPON:OnDrop](/gmod/WEAPON:OnDrop) will be called before this hook is.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: owner
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who owned this weapon before it was dropped

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon that was dropped

PlayerEndVoice.DESCRIPTION: Called when player stops using voice chat.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who stopped talking

PlayerEnteredVehicle.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player enters a vehicle.

Called just after [GM:CanPlayerEnterVehicle](/gmod/GM:CanPlayerEnterVehicle).

See also [GM:PlayerLeaveVehicle](/gmod/GM:PlayerLeaveVehicle).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who entered vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: veh
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vehicle the player entered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: role
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The seat number.

PlayerFireAnimationEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Called before firing clientside animation events on a player model.

See [GM:PlayerHandleAnimEvent](/gmod/GM:PlayerHandleAnimEvent) for the serverside version.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who has triggered the event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle of the effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The event ID of happened even. See [this page](http://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Animation_Events).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the event

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to disable the effect

PlayerFootstep.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a player steps. Return true to mute the normal sound.
NOTES: This hook is called on all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The stepping player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the step

ARGUMENTS.NAME: foot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Foot that is stepped. 0 for left, 1 for right

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sound
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sound that is going to play

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Volume of the footstep

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Recipient filter of players who can hear the footstep

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Prevent default step sound

PlayerFrozeObject.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player freezes an object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who has frozen an object

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frozen object

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physobj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frozen physics object of the frozen entity ( For ragdolls )

PlayerHandleAnimEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Called before firing serverside animation events on the player models.

See [GM:PlayerFireAnimationEvent](/gmod/GM:PlayerFireAnimationEvent) for the clientside version.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who has triggered the event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The event ID of happened even. See [this page](http://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Animation_Events).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: eventTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The absolute time this event occurred using [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cycle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frame this event occurred as a number between 0 and 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Event type. See [the Source SDK](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/master/mp/src/game/shared/eventlist.h#L14-L23).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name or options of this event.

PlayerHurt.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player gets hurt.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: victim
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Victim

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attacker Entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: healthRemaining
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Remaining Health

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageTaken
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage Taken

PlayerInitialSpawn.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the player spawns for the first time.

See [GM:PlayerSpawn](/gmod/GM:PlayerSpawn) for a hook called every player spawn.
NOTES: This hook is called before the player has fully loaded, when the player is still in seeing the `Starting Lua` screen. For example, trying to use the Entity:GetModel function will return the default model (`models/player.mdl`).
WARNINGS:
Due to the above note, sending net messages to the spawned player in this hook are highly unreliable, and they most likely won't be received. See https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-requests/issues/718.

Current dirty hack without networking:

```

hook.Add( "PlayerInitialSpawn", "FullLoadSetup", function( ply )

	hook.Add( "SetupMove", ply, function( self, ply, _, cmd )

		if self == ply and not cmd:IsForced() then

			hook.Run( "PlayerFullLoad", self )

			hook.Remove( "SetupMove", self )

		end

	end )

end )

```

With networking:

```

-- CLIENT

hook.Add( "InitPostEntity", "Ready", function()

	net.Start( "cool_addon_client_ready" )

	net.SendToServer()

end )

```

```

-- SERVER

util.AddNetworkString( "cool_addon_client_ready" )

net.Receive( "cool_addon_client_ready", function( len, ply )

	-- Send what you need here!

end )

```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who spawned.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: transition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If `true`, the player just spawned from a map transition.

PlayerJoinTeam.DESCRIPTION: Makes the player join a specified team. This is a convenience function that calls [Player:SetTeam](/gmod/Player:SetTeam) and runs the [GM:OnPlayerChangedTeam](/gmod/GM:OnPlayerChangedTeam) hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player to force

ARGUMENTS.NAME: team
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team to put player into

PlayerLeaveVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player leaves a vehicle.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not called when a different vehicle is immediately entered with [Player:EnterVehicle](/gmod/Player:EnterVehicle).

NOTES: For vehicles with exit animations, this will be called **at the end** of the animation, **not at the start**!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who left a vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: veh
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vehicle the player left.

PlayerLoadout.DESCRIPTION: Called to give players the default set of weapons.
NOTES: This function may not work in your custom gamemode if you have overridden your GM:PlayerSpawn and you do not use self.BaseClass.PlayerSpawn or hook.Call.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player to give weapons to.

PlayerNoClip.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player tries to switch noclip mode.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The person who entered/exited noclip

ARGUMENTS.NAME: desiredState
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Represents the noclip state (on/off) the user will enter if this hook allows them to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow the switch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

PlayerRequestTeam.DESCRIPTION:
Request a player to join the team. This function will check if the team is available to join or not.

This hook is called when the player runs "changeteam" in the console.

To prevent the player from changing teams, see [GM:PlayerCanJoinTeam](/gmod/GM:PlayerCanJoinTeam)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to try to put into a team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: team
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Team to put the player into if the checks succeeded

PlayerSay.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player dispatched a chat message. For the clientside equivalent, see [GM:OnPlayerChat](/gmod/GM:OnPlayerChat).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sender
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player which sent the message.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The message's content

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamChat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is team chat?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: What to show instead of original text. Set to "" to stop the message from displaying.

PlayerSelectSpawn.DESCRIPTION: Called to determine a spawn point for a player to spawn at.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who needs a spawn point

ARGUMENTS.NAME: transition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If true, the player just spawned from a map transition. You probably want to not return an entity for that case to not override player's position.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The spawnpoint entity to spawn the player at

PlayerSelectTeamSpawn.DESCRIPTION: Find a team spawn point entity for this player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: team
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to use as a spawn point.

PlayerSetHandsModel.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever view model hands needs setting a model. By default this calls [PLAYER:GetHandsModel](/gmod/PLAYER:GetHandsModel) and if that fails, sets the hands model according to his player model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player whose hands needs a model set

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hands to set model of

PlayerSetModel.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a player spawns and must choose a model. A good place to assign a model to a player.
NOTES: This function may not work in your custom gamemode if you have overridden your GM:PlayerSpawn and you do not use self.BaseClass.PlayerSpawn or hook.Call.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player being chosen

PlayerShouldTakeDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the player should take damage from the given attacker.
WARNINGS: Applying damage from this hook to the player taking damage will lead to infinite loop/crash.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The attacker

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allow damage

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who tried to taunt

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Act ID of the taunt player tries to do, see [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow player taunting

PlayerSilentDeath.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the player is killed by [Player:KillSilent](/gmod/Player:KillSilent).

The player is already considered dead when this hook is called.

* See [GM:PlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerDeath) for a hook which handles all other death causes.

* [GM:PostPlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PostPlayerDeath) is called **after** this hook.
NOTES: Player:Alive will return true in this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who was killed

PlayerSpawn.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever a player spawns, including respawns.

See [GM:PlayerInitialSpawn](/gmod/GM:PlayerInitialSpawn) for a hook called only the first time a player spawns.

See the [player_spawn gameevent](/gmod/Game_Events) for a shared version of this hook.
WARNINGS: By default, in "base" derived gamemodes, this hook will also call GM:PlayerLoadout and GM:PlayerSetModel, which may override your Entity:SetModel and Player:Give calls. Consider using the other hooks or a 0-second timer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who spawned.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: transition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If true, the player just spawned from a map transition. You probably want to not touch player's weapons if this is set to true from this hook.

PlayerSpawnAsSpectator.DESCRIPTION: Called to spawn the player as a spectator.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to spawn as a spectator

PlayerSpray.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the player can spray using the `impulse 201` console command.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sprayer
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to allow spraying, return `true` to prevent spraying.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who is taunting

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence ID of the taunt

ARGUMENTS.NAME: length
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Length of the taunt

PlayerStartVoice.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player starts using voice chat.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who started using voice chat

PlayerStepSoundTime.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override the time between footsteps.
NOTES: This hook is called on all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who is walking

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The type of footsteps, see [STEPSOUNDTIME](/gmod/Enums/STEPSOUNDTIME)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: walking
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is the player walking or not ( +walk? )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Time between footsteps, in ms

PlayerSwitchFlashlight.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a player attempts to either turn on or off their flashlight, returning false will deny the change.
NOTES: Also gets called when using Player:Flashlight.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempts to change their flashlight state.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enabled
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new state the player requested, true for on, false for off.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can toggle the flashlight or not

PlayerSwitchWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a player attempts to switch their weapon.

Primary usage of this hook is to prevent/allow weapon switching, **not** to detect weapon switching. It will not be called for [Player:SetActiveWeapon](/gmod/Player:SetActiveWeapon).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player switching weapons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldWeapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The previous weapon. Will be `NULL` if the previous weapon was removed or the player is switching from nothing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newWeapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon the player switched to. Will be `NULL` if the player is switching to nothing.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can be `NULL` on the client if the weapon hasn't been created over the network yet.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `true` to prevent weapon switch.

PlayerTick.DESCRIPTION: The Move hook is called for you to manipulate the player's [CMoveData](/gmod/CMoveData). This hook is called moments before [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move) and [GM:PlayerNoClip](/gmod/GM:PlayerNoClip).
WARNINGS: This hook will not run when inside a vehicle. GM:VehicleMove will be called instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The current movedata for the player.

PlayerTraceAttack.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has been hit by a trace and damaged (such as from a bullet). Returning true overrides the damage handling and prevents [GM:ScalePlayerDamage](/gmod/GM:ScalePlayerDamage) from being called.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that has been hit

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmginfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage info of the bullet

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Normalized vector direction of the bullet's path

ARGUMENTS.NAME: trace
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The trace of the bullet's path, see [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Override engine handling

PlayerUnfrozeObject.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player unfreezes an object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who has unfrozen an object

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unfrozen object

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physobj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frozen physics object of the unfrozen entity ( For ragdolls )

PlayerUse.DESCRIPTION: Triggered when the player presses use on an object. Continuously runs until USE is released but will not activate other Entities until the USE key is released; dependent on activation type of the Entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player pressing the "use" key.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity which the player is looking at / activating USE on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Return false if the player is not allowed to USE the entity.

Do not return true if using a hook, otherwise other mods may not get a chance to block a player's use.

PopulateMenuBar.DESCRIPTION: Called when it's time to populate the context menu menu bar at the top.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: menubar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [DMenuBar](/gmod/DMenuBar) itself.

PostCleanupMap.DESCRIPTION:
Called right after the map has cleaned up (usually because [game.CleanUpMap](/gmod/game.CleanUpMap) was called)

See also [GM:PreCleanupMap](/gmod/GM:PreCleanupMap).

PostDraw2DSkyBox.DESCRIPTION: Called right after the 2D skybox has been drawn - allowing you to draw over it.

PostDrawEffects.DESCRIPTION: Called after rendering effects. This is where halos are drawn. Called just before [GM:PreDrawHUD](/gmod/GM:PreDrawHUD).

PostDrawOpaqueRenderables.DESCRIPTION:
Called after drawing opaque entities.

See also [GM:PostDrawTranslucentRenderables](/gmod/GM:PostDrawTranslucentRenderables) and  [GM:PreDrawOpaqueRenderables](/gmod/GM:PreDrawOpaqueRenderables).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bDrawingDepth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current draw is writing depth.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bDrawingSkybox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current draw is drawing the skybox.

PostDrawPlayerHands.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player hands are drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hands
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the gmod_hands entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the view model entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The the owner of the view model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the weapon that is from the view model.

PostDrawSkyBox.DESCRIPTION:
Called after drawing the 3D skybox. This will not be called if skybox rendering was prevented via the [GM:PreDrawSkyBox](/gmod/GM:PreDrawSkyBox) hook.

See also [GM:PostDraw2DSkyBox](/gmod/GM:PostDraw2DSkyBox).

PostDrawTranslucentRenderables.DESCRIPTION:
Called after all translucent entities are drawn.

See also [GM:PostDrawOpaqueRenderables](/gmod/GM:PostDrawOpaqueRenderables) and  [GM:PreDrawTranslucentRenderables](/gmod/GM:PreDrawTranslucentRenderables).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is still called when r_drawentities or r_drawopaquerenderables is disabled.
This is not called when r_drawtranslucentworld is disabled.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bDrawingDepth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current call is writing depth.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bDrawingSkybox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current call is drawing skybox.

PostDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Called after view model is drawn.
NOTES: The 3D rendering context in this event is different from the main view. Every render operation will only be accurate with the view model entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewmodel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players view model

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The owner of the weapon/view model

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon the player is currently holding

PostEntityTakeDamage.DESCRIPTION: Called when an entity receives a damage event, after passing damage filters, etc.
WARNINGS: Applying damage from this hook to the entity taking damage will lead to infinite loop/crash.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that took the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: took
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity actually took the damage. (For example, shooting a Strider will generate this event, but it won't take bullet damage).

PostGamemodeLoaded.DESCRIPTION: Called after the gamemode has loaded.

PostPlayerDeath.DESCRIPTION:
Called right after [GM:DoPlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:DoPlayerDeath), [GM:PlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerDeath) and [GM:PlayerSilentDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerSilentDeath).

This hook will be called for all deaths, including [Player:KillSilent](/gmod/Player:KillSilent)
NOTES: The player is considered dead when this is hook is called, Player:Alive will return false.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

PostPlayerDraw.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player was drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that was drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [STUDIO_](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO) flags for this render operation.

PostProcessPermitted.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to suppress post processing effect drawing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ppeffect
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname of Post Processing effect

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true/false depending on whether this post process should be allowed

PostRender.DESCRIPTION: Called after the frame has been rendered.

PostRenderVGUI.DESCRIPTION: Called after the VGUI has been drawn.

PreCleanupMap.DESCRIPTION:
Called right before the map cleans up (usually because [game.CleanUpMap](/gmod/game.CleanUpMap) was called)

See also [GM:PostCleanupMap](/gmod/GM:PostCleanupMap).

PreDrawEffects.DESCRIPTION: Called just after [GM:PreDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PreDrawViewModel) and can technically be considered "PostDrawAllViewModels".

PreDrawHalos.DESCRIPTION: Called before rendering the halos. This is the place to call [halo.Add](/gmod/halo.Add). This hook is actually running inside of [GM:PostDrawEffects](/gmod/GM:PostDrawEffects).

PreDrawHUD.DESCRIPTION: Called just after [GM:PostDrawEffects](/gmod/GM:PostDrawEffects). Drawing anything in it seems to work incorrectly.

PreDrawOpaqueRenderables.DESCRIPTION:
Called before all opaque entities are drawn.

See also [GM:PreDrawTranslucentRenderables](/gmod/GM:PreDrawTranslucentRenderables) and  [GM:PostDrawOpaqueRenderables](/gmod/GM:PostDrawOpaqueRenderables).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isDrawingDepth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current draw is writing depth.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isDrawSkybox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current draw is drawing the skybox.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent opaque renderables from drawing.

PreDrawPlayerHands.DESCRIPTION: Called before the player hands are drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hands
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the gmod_hands entity before it is drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the view model entity before it is drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The the owner of the view model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the weapon that is from the view model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent the viewmodel hands from rendering

PreDrawSkyBox.DESCRIPTION:
Called before the 3D sky box is drawn. This will not be called for maps with no 3D skybox, or when the 3d skybox is disabled. (`r_3dsky 0`)

See also [GM:PostDrawSkyBox](/gmod/GM:PostDrawSkyBox)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to disable skybox drawing (both 2D and 3D skybox)

PreDrawTranslucentRenderables.DESCRIPTION:
Called before all the translucent entities are drawn.

See also [GM:PreDrawOpaqueRenderables](/gmod/GM:PreDrawOpaqueRenderables) and  [GM:PostDrawTranslucentRenderables](/gmod/GM:PostDrawTranslucentRenderables).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is still called when r_drawentities or r_drawopaquerenderables is disabled.
This is not called when r_drawtranslucentworld is disabled.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isDrawingDepth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current draw is writing depth.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isDrawSkybox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current draw is drawing the skybox.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent translucent renderables from drawing.

PreDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION:
Called before the view model has been drawn. This hook by default also calls this on weapons, so you can use [WEAPON:PreDrawViewModel](/gmod/WEAPON:PreDrawViewModel).

You can use [GM:PreDrawEffects](/gmod/GM:PreDrawEffects) as a "PostDrawViewModel" hook as it is called just after the view model(s) are drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the view model entity before it is drawn. On server-side, this entity is the predicted view model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The owner of the view model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the weapon that is from the view model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent the default view model rendering. This also affects [GM:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PostDrawViewModel).

PreDrawViewModels.DESCRIPTION:
Called before view models and entities with `RENDERGROUP_VIEWMODEL` are drawn.

You can use [GM:PreDrawEffects](/gmod/GM:PreDrawEffects) as a `PostDrawViewModel` hook as it is called just after the view model(s) are drawn.

PreGamemodeLoaded.DESCRIPTION: Called before the gamemode is loaded.

PrePlayerDraw.DESCRIPTION: Called before the player is drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that is about to be drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [STUDIO_](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO) flags for this render operation.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Prevent default player rendering. Return true to hide the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity table to be registered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class name to be assigned.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to prevent the entity from being registered. Returning any other value has no effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: swep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The SWEP table to be registered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class name to be assigned.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to prevent the weapon from being registered. Returning any other value has no effect.

PreRender.DESCRIPTION: Called before the renderer is about to start rendering the next frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent all rendering. This can make the whole game stop rendering anything.

PreventScreenClicks.DESCRIPTION: This will prevent  from sending to server when player tries to shoot from C menu.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent screen clicks.

PropBreak.DESCRIPTION: Called when a prop has been destroyed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The person who broke the prop.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: prop
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that has been broken by the attacker.

RenderScene.DESCRIPTION: Render the scene. Used by the `Stereoscopy` post-processing effect.
NOTES: Materials rendered in this hook require `$ignorez` parameter to draw properly.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: View origin

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: View angles

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: View FOV

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `true` to override drawing the scene.

RenderScreenspaceEffects.DESCRIPTION: Used to render post processing effects.

Restored.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the game is reloaded from a Source Engine save system ( not the Sandbox saves or dupes ).

See [GM:Saved](/gmod/GM:Saved) for a hook that is called when such a save file is created.

Saved.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the game is saved using the Source Engine save system (not the Sandbox saves or dupes).

See [GM:Restored](/gmod/GM:Restored) for a hook that is called when such a save file is loaded.

See also the [saverestore](/gmod/saverestore) for relevant functions.

ScaleNPCDamage.DESCRIPTION: Called when an NPC takes damage.
NOTES: This hook is called only when a specific hit group of the NPC is hit. In cases where the hitgroup doesn't matter, you should use GM:EntityTakeDamage instead!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: npc
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC that takes damage

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitgroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hitgroup (hitbox) enum where the NPC took damage. See [HITGROUP](/gmod/Enums/HITGROUP)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmginfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage info

ScalePlayerDamage.DESCRIPTION: This hook allows you to change how much damage a player receives when one takes damage to a specific body part.
NOTES: This is called only for bullet damage a player receives, you should use GM:EntityTakeDamage instead if you need to detect *ALL* damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player taking damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitgroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hitgroup where the player took damage. See [HITGROUP](/gmod/Enums/HITGROUP)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmginfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage info.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Return true to prevent damage that this hook is called for, stop blood particle effects and blood decals.

It is possible to return true only on client ( This will work **only in multiplayer** ) to stop the effects but still take damage.

ScoreboardHide.DESCRIPTION: Called when player released the scoreboard button. ( TAB by default )

ScoreboardShow.DESCRIPTION: Called when player presses the scoreboard button. ( TAB by default )

SetPlayerSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Sets player run and sprint speeds.
WARNINGS: This is not a hook. Treat this as a utility function to set the player's speed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to set the speed of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: walkSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The walk speed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: runSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The run speed.

SetupMove.DESCRIPTION:
SetupMove is called before the engine process movements. This allows us to override the players movement.

See [Game Movement](/gmod/Game Movement) for an explanation on the move system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player whose movement we are about to process

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The move data to override/use

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cmd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The command data

SetupPlayerVisibility.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to add extra positions to the player's PVS. This is the place to call [AddOriginToPVS](/gmod/Global.AddOriginToPVS).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewEntity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players [Player:GetViewEntity](/gmod/Player:GetViewEntity)

SetupSkyboxFog.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to use render.Fog* functions to manipulate skybox fog.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The scale of 3D skybox

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to tell the engine that fog is set up

SetupWorldFog.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to use render.Fog* functions to manipulate world fog.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to tell the engine that fog is set up

ShouldCollide.DESCRIPTION:
Called to decide whether a pair of entities should collide with each other. This is only called if [Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck](/gmod/Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck) was used on one or both entities.

Where applicable, consider using [constraint.NoCollide](/gmod/constraint.NoCollide) or a [logic_collision_pair](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Logic_collision_pair) entity instead - they are considerably easier to use and may be more appropriate in some situations.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This hook can cause all physics to break under certain conditions.

WARNINGS: This hook **must** return the same value consistently for the same pair of entities. If an entity changed in such a way that its collision rules change, you **must** call Entity:CollisionRulesChanged on that entity immediately - **not in this hook.**

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent1
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The first entity in the collision poll.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent2
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The second entity in the collision poll.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entities should collide.

ShouldDrawLocalPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Called to determine if the [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer) should be drawn.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION:
Due to an [optimization](https://garry.tv/2012/10/30/optimising-gmod/), this hook is only called once per frame.

This is problematic if you need to have the player drawn only in certain contexts, such as within [render.RenderView](/gmod/render.RenderView) or based on the render target. As a workaround, you can call [cam.Start3D](/gmod/cam.Start3D) and [cam.End3D](/gmod/cam.End3D) within this hook to force the engine to call it every time.

NOTES: If you're using this hook to draw a player for a GM:CalcView hook, then you may want to consider using the drawviewer variable you can use in your Structures/CamData table instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True to draw the player, false to hide.

ShowHelp.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player executes gm_showhelp console command. ( Default bind is F1 )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who executed the command

ShowSpare1.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player executes gm_showspare1 console command. ( Default bind is F3 )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who executed the command

ShowSpare2.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player executes gm_showspare2 console command. ( Default bind is F4 )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who executed the command

ShowTeam.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player executes gm_showteam console command. ( Default bind is F2 )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who executed the command

ShutDown.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the Lua environment is about to be shut down, for example on map change, or when the server is going to shut down.
WARNINGS: Player:SteamID, Player:SteamID64, and the like will return nil for the listen host here but work fine for other players.

SpawniconGenerated.DESCRIPTION: Called when spawn icon is generated.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lastmodel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: File path of previously generated model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: imagename
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: File path of the generated icon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelsleft
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of models left to generate.

StartChat.DESCRIPTION: Runs when the user tries to open the chat box.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Returning true won't stop the chatbox from taking VGUI focus.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isTeamChat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the message was sent through team chat.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to hide the default chat box.

StartCommand.DESCRIPTION:
Allows you to change the players inputs before they are processed by the server.

This is basically a shared version of [GM:CreateMove](/gmod/GM:CreateMove).
NOTES: This function is also called for bots, making it the best solution to control them so far

This hook is predicted, but not by usual means, this hook is called when a CUserCmd is generated on the client, and on the server when it is received, so it is necessary for this hook to be called clientside even on singleplayer

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ucmd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The usercommand

StartEntityDriving.DESCRIPTION: Called right before an entity starts driving. Overriding this hook will cause it to not call [drive.Start](/gmod/drive.Start) and the player will not begin driving the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that is going to be driven

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that is going to drive the entity

StartGame.DESCRIPTION: Called when you start a new game via the menu.

Think.DESCRIPTION:
Called every frame on client and server. This will be the same as [GM:Tick](/gmod/GM:Tick) on the server when there is no lag, but will only be called once every processed server frame during lag.

See [GM:Tick](/gmod/GM:Tick) for a hook that runs every tick on both the client and server.
NOTES: This hook **WILL NOT** run if the server is empty, unless you set the ConVar `sv_hibernate_think` to 1

Tick.DESCRIPTION: Called every server tick. Serverside, this is similar to [GM:Think](/gmod/GM:Think).
NOTES: This hook **WILL NOT** run if the server is empty, unless you set the ConVar `sv_hibernate_think` to 1

TranslateActivity.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to translate player activities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The activity. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new, translated activity

UpdateAnimation.DESCRIPTION: Animation updates (pose params etc) should be done here.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to update the animation info for.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player's velocity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxSeqGroundSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Speed of the animation - used for playback rate scaling.

VariableEdited.DESCRIPTION: Called when a variable is edited on an Entity (called by Edit Properties... menu). See [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity being edited

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player doing the editing

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the variable

ARGUMENTS.NAME: val
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new value, as a string which will later be converted to its appropriate type

ARGUMENTS.NAME: editor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The edit table defined in [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar)

VehicleMove.DESCRIPTION:
Called when you are driving a vehicle. This hook works just like [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move).

This hook is called before [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move) and will be called when [GM:PlayerTick](/gmod/GM:PlayerTick) is not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player who is driving the vehicle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: veh
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle being driven

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Move data

VGUIMousePressAllowed.DESCRIPTION: Called when user clicks on a VGUI panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: button
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The button that was pressed, see [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true if the mouse click should be ignored or not.

VGUIMousePressed.DESCRIPTION: Called when a mouse button is pressed on a VGUI element or menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel that currently has focus.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mouseCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that the player pressed using [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE).

WeaponEquip.DESCRIPTION:
Called as a weapon entity is picked up by a player.

See also [GM:PlayerDroppedWeapon](/gmod/GM:PlayerDroppedWeapon).
NOTES: At the time when this hook is called Entity:GetOwner will return `NULL`. The owner is set on the next frame.
This will not be called when picking up a weapon you already have as the weapon will be removed and WEAPON:EquipAmmo will be called instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The equipped weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: owner
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that is picking up the weapon.

WorkshopDownloadedFile.DESCRIPTION: Called when an addon from the Steam workshop finishes downloading. Used by default to update details on the workshop downloading panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Workshop ID of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of addon.

WorkshopDownloadFile.DESCRIPTION: Called when an addon from the Steam workshop begins downloading. Used by default to place details on the workshop downloading panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Workshop ID of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: imageID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
ID of addon's preview image.

For example, for **Extended Spawnmenu** addon, the image URL is

```

http://cloud-4.steamusercontent.com/ugc/702859018846106764/9E7E1946296240314751192DA0AD15B6567FF92D/

```

So, the value of this argument would be **702859018846106764**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: size
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: File size of addon in bytes.

WorkshopDownloadProgress.DESCRIPTION: Called while an addon from the Steam workshop is downloading. Used by default to update details on the fancy workshop download panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Workshop ID of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: imageID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
ID of addon's preview image.

For example, for **Extended Spawnmenu** addon, the image URL is

```

http://cloud-4.steamusercontent.com/ugc/702859018846106764/9E7E1946296240314751192DA0AD15B6567FF92D/

```

So, the value of this argument would be **702859018846106764**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: downloaded
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current bytes of addon downloaded.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: expected
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Expected file size of addon in bytes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: remain
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Remaining addons to download

ARGUMENTS.NAME: total
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Total addons needing to be downloaded

WorkshopEnd.DESCRIPTION: Called when downloading content from Steam workshop ends. Used by default to hide fancy workshop downloading panel.

WorkshopExtractProgress.DESCRIPTION: Called while an addon from the Steam workshop is extracting. Used by default to update details on the fancy workshop download panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Workshop ID of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ImageID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
ID of addon's preview image.

For example, for **Extended Spawnmenu** addon, the image URL is

```

http://cloud-4.steamusercontent.com/ugc/702859018846106764/9E7E1946296240314751192DA0AD15B6567FF92D/

```

So, the value of this argument would be **702859018846106764**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: percent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current bytes of addon extracted.

WorkshopStart.DESCRIPTION:
Called when downloading content from Steam workshop begins. Used by default to show fancy workshop downloading panel.

The order of Workshop hooks is this:
* WorkshopStart
* WorkshopDownloadTotals
* * These are called for each new item:
*** WorkshopDownloadFile
*** WorkshopDownloadProgress - This is called until the file is finished
*** WorkshopDownloadedFile
* WorkshopEnd

WorkshopSubscriptionsProgress.DESCRIPTION: Called by the engine when the game initially fetches subscriptions to be displayed on the bottom of the main menu screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: num
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of subscribed addons that have info retrieved.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Total amount of subscribed addons that need their info retrieved.

GM.DESCRIPTION:
Hooks that are available for all gamemodes based on base gamemode.

	

	See also: [GM](/gmod/Structures/GM)

BehaveStart.DESCRIPTION:
Called to initialize the behaviour.

		This is called automatically when the NextBot is created, you should not call it manually.
NOTES: You shouldn't override this unless you know what you are doing - it's used to kick off the coroutine that runs the bot's behaviour. See NEXTBOT:RunBehaviour instead.

BehaveUpdate.DESCRIPTION: Called to update the bot's behaviour.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: interval
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long since the last update

BodyUpdate.DESCRIPTION: Called to update the bot's animation.

OnContact.DESCRIPTION: Called when the nextbot touches another entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the nextbot came in contact with.

OnEntitySight.DESCRIPTION: Called when the nextbot NPC sees another Nextbot NPC or a Player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This hook is not called in some scenarios.

NOTES: This hook will only run after NextBot:SetFOV or other vision related function is called on the nextbot. See NextBot:IsAbleToSee for more details.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: the entity that was seen

OnEntitySightLost.DESCRIPTION: Called when the nextbot NPC loses sight of another Nextbot NPC or a Player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This hook is not called in some scenarios.

NOTES: This hook will only run after NextBot:SetFOV or other vision related function is called on the nextbot. See NextBot:IsAbleToSee for more details.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: the entity that we lost sight of

OnIgnite.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot is ignited.

OnInjured.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot gets hurt. This is a good place to play hurt sounds or voice lines.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage info

OnKilled.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot gets killed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage info

OnLandOnGround.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot's feet return to the ground.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the nextbot has landed on.

OnLeaveGround.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot's feet leave the ground - for whatever reason.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the bot "jumped" from.

OnNavAreaChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when the nextbot enters a new navigation area.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: old
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The navigation area the bot just left

ARGUMENTS.NAME: new
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The navigation area the bot just entered

OnOtherKilled.DESCRIPTION: Called when someone else or something else has been killed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: victim
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The victim that was killed

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage info

OnStuck.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot thinks it is stuck.

OnTraceAttack.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a trace attack is done against the nextbot, allowing override of the damage being dealt by altering the [CTakeDamageInfo](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo).

This is called before [NEXTBOT:OnInjured](/gmod/NEXTBOT:OnInjured).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage info

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction the damage goes in

ARGUMENTS.NAME: trace
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult) of the attack, containing the hitgroup.

OnUnStuck.DESCRIPTION: Called when the bot thinks it is un-stuck.

RunBehaviour.DESCRIPTION:
A hook called to process nextbot logic.

This hook runs in a [coroutine](/gmod/coroutine) by default. It will only be called if [NEXTBOT:BehaveStart](/gmod/NEXTBOT:BehaveStart) is not overriden.

NEXTBOT.DESCRIPTION: The list of hooks for nextbot NPCs.

ActionSignal.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever a panel receives a command signal from one of its children.

This hook is called when using [Panel:Command](/gmod/Panel:Command), when clicking a [Button](/gmod/Button) with [Panel:SetCommand](/gmod/Panel:SetCommand) set, and when clicking text within a [RichText](/gmod/RichText) panel that is marked as click-able.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: signalName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the signal, usually the sender of the signal or the command name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: signalValue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the signal, usually a command argument.

AnimationThink.DESCRIPTION:
Called every frame unless [Panel:IsVisible](/gmod/Panel:IsVisible) is set to false. Similar to [PANEL:Think](/gmod/PANEL:Think), but can be disabled by [Panel:SetAnimationEnabled](/gmod/Panel:SetAnimationEnabled) as explained below.

If you are overriding this, you must call [Panel:AnimationThinkInternal](/gmod/Panel:AnimationThinkInternal) every frame, else animations will cease to work.

If you want to "disable" this hook with [Panel:SetAnimationEnabled](/gmod/Panel:SetAnimationEnabled), you must call it after defining this hook. Once disabled, a custom hook **will not** be re-enabled by [Panel:SetAnimationEnabled](/gmod/Panel:SetAnimationEnabled) again - the hook will have to be re-defined.

ApplySchemeSettings.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever the panel should apply its scheme (colors, fonts, style).

It is called a few frames after Panel's creation once.

DragHoverClick.DESCRIPTION:
Called when an object is dragged and hovered over this panel for 0.1 seconds.

This is used by [DPropertySheet](/gmod/DPropertySheet) and [DTree](/gmod/DTree), for example to open a tab or expand a node when an object is hovered over it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hoverTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time the object was hovered over this panel.

DroppedOn.DESCRIPTION:
Called when this panel is dropped onto another panel.

Only works for panels derived from [DDragBase](/gmod/DDragBase).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel we are dropped onto

GenerateExample.DESCRIPTION: Called when the panel should generate example use case / example code to use for this panel. Used in the panel opened by **derma_controls** console command.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname of the panel to generate example for. This will be the class name of your panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dpropertysheet
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [DPropertySheet](/gmod/DPropertySheet) to add your example to. See examples below.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the property sheet?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the property sheet?

Init.DESCRIPTION: Called when the panel is created. This is called for each base type that the panel has.

LoadCookies.DESCRIPTION: Called after [Panel:SetCookieName](/gmod/Panel:SetCookieName) is called on this panel to apply the just loaded cookie values for this panel.

OnActivate.DESCRIPTION: Called when we are activated during level load. Used by the loading screen panel.

OnChangeTargetURL.DESCRIPTION: Called by HTML panels when the target URL of the frame has changed, this happens when you hover over a link.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetURL
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New target URL.

OnChangeTitle.DESCRIPTION: Called by HTML panels when the title of the loaded page has been changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newTitle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new title of the page.

OnChildAdded.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a child was parented to the panel.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is called before the panel's metatable is set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: child
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The child which was added.

OnChildRemoved.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a child of the panel is about to removed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: child
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The child which is about to be removed.

OnChildViewCreated.DESCRIPTION: Called by HTML panels when the page attempts to open a new child view (such as a popup or new tab).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sourceURL
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page requesting to create a child.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetURL
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the requested child.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isPopup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True if the requested view is a popup.

OnCursorEntered.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the cursor entered the panels bounds.

OnCursorExited.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the cursor left the panels bounds.

OnCursorMoved.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the cursor was moved with the panels bounds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cursorX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new x position of the cursor relative to the panels origin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cursorY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new y position of the cursor relative to the panels origin.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action.

OnDeactivate.DESCRIPTION: Called when we are deactivated during level load. Used by the loading screen panel.

OnDocumentReady.DESCRIPTION: Called by HTML panels when the panel's DOM has been set up. You can run JavaScript in here.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: url
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the current page.

OnDrop.DESCRIPTION:
We're being dropped on something
We can create a new panel here and return it, so that instead of dropping us - it drops the new panel instead! We remain where we are!

Only works for panels derived from [DDragBase](/gmod/DDragBase).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to drop instead of us. By default you should return self.

OnFocusChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the panel gained or lost focus.
NOTES: Panel:HasFocus will only be updated on the next frame and will return the "old" value at the time this hook is run. Same goes for vgui.GetKeyboardFocus.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gained
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the focus was gained ( true ) or lost ( false )

OnKeyCodePressed.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a keyboard key was pressed while the panel is focused.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not run for ESC/"cancelselect" binding.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key code of the pressed key, see [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action.

OnKeyCodeReleased.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a keyboard key was released while the panel is focused.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not run for TILDE/"toggleconsole" binding.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key code of the released key, see [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action.

OnMousePressed.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a mouse key was pressed while the panel is focused.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: They key code of the key pressed, see [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action such as right click opening edit menu for [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry).

OnMouseReleased.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a mouse key was released while the panel is focused.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: They key code of the key released, see [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action.

OnMouseWheeled.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the mouse wheel was used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scrollDelta
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The scroll delta, indicating how much the user turned the mouse wheel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress default action.

OnRemove.DESCRIPTION: Called when the panel is about to be removed.

OnScreenSizeChanged.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the player's screen resolution of the game changes.

[ScrW](/gmod/Global.ScrW) and [ScrH](/gmod/Global.ScrH) will return the new values when this hook is called.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The previous width  of the game's window

ARGUMENTS.NAME: oldHeight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The previous height of the game's window

OnSizeChanged.DESCRIPTION:
Called just after the panel size changes.

All size functions will return the new values when this hook is called.
WARNINGS: Changing the panel size in this hook will cause an infinite loop!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new width of the panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newHeight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new height of the panel

OnStartDragging.DESCRIPTION: Called by [dragndrop.StartDragging](/gmod/dragndrop.StartDragging) when the panel starts being dragged.

OnStopDragging.DESCRIPTION: Called by [Panel:DragMouseRelease](/gmod/Panel:DragMouseRelease) when the panel object is released after being dragged.

Paint.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever the panel should be drawn. 

You can create panels with a customized appearance by overriding their Paint() function, which will prevent the default appearance from being drawn.
NOTES: This hook will not run if the panel is completely off the screen. The hook will still run however if any parts of the panel are still on screen.
Render operations from the surface (and consequentially the draw) are always offset by the global position of this panel, as seen in the example below

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel's width.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel's height.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returning true prevents the background from being drawn.

PaintOver.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the panel and all its children were drawn, return true to override the default drawing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panels current width.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panels current height.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should we disable default PaintOver rendering? This is useful in case with Derma panels that use Derma hooks.

PerformLayout.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the panels layout was invalidated. This means all child panels must be re-positioned to fit the possibly new size of this panel.
WARNINGS: Do **NOT** call this function directly. Use Panel:InvalidateLayout instead!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panels current width.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panels current height.

PostAutoRefresh.DESCRIPTION:
Only works on elements defined with [derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl) and only if the panel has **AllowAutoRefresh** set to true.

Called after [derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl) is called with panel's class name.

See also [PANEL:PreAutoRefresh](/gmod/PANEL:PreAutoRefresh)

PreAutoRefresh.DESCRIPTION:
Only works on elements defined with [derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl) and only if the panel has **AllowAutoRefresh** set to true.

Called when [derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl) is called with this panel's class name before applying changes to this panel.

See also [PANEL:PostAutoRefresh](/gmod/PANEL:PostAutoRefresh)

TestHover.DESCRIPTION: Called to test if the panel is being `hovered` by the mouse. This will only be called if the panel's parent is being hovered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate of the cursor, in screen space.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate of the cursor, in screen space.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false when the cursor is not considered on the panel, true if it is considered on the panel. Do not return anything for default behavior.

Think.DESCRIPTION: Called every frame while [Panel:IsVisible](/gmod/Panel:IsVisible) is true.

PANEL.DESCRIPTION:
This is a list of hooks that are available on all panels.

Specific panels can have their own hooks, they are listed on their category.
NOTES: These hooks are called on your panel. They can't be hook.Add

ClassChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when the player's class was changed from this class.

NOTES: This hook is run after the drive.FinishMove has been called.
WARNINGS: This hook will not work if the current gamemode overrides GM:FinishMove and does not call this hook.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent default action

GetHandsModel.DESCRIPTION: Called on player spawn to determine which hand model to use

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing info about view model hands model to be set. See examples.

Init.DESCRIPTION: Called when the class object is created

Loadout.DESCRIPTION: Called on spawn to give the player their default loadout

NOTES: This hook is run after the drive.Move has been called.
WARNINGS: This hook will not work if the current gamemode overrides GM:Move and does not call this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Movement information

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent default action

PostDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Called after the viewmodel has been drawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewmodel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The viewmodel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon

PreDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Called before the viewmodel is drawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewmodel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The viewmodel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon

SetModel.DESCRIPTION: Called when we need to set player model from the class.
NOTES: This will only be called if you have not overridden GM:PlayerSetModel or call this function from it or anywhere else using player_manager.RunClass
This hook is run after the drive.StartMove has been called.
WARNINGS: This hook will not work if the current gamemode overrides GM:SetupMove and does not call this hook.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to prevent default action

ViewModelChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when the player changes their weapon to another one causing their viewmodel model to change

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewmodel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The viewmodel that is changing

ARGUMENTS.NAME: old
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The old model

ARGUMENTS.NAME: new
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new model

PLAYER.DESCRIPTION: A list of hooks available in player classes.
NOTES: These hooks are used in player_manager thus can't be hook.Add

AddGamemodeToolMenuCategories.DESCRIPTION:
This hook is used to add default categories to spawnmenu tool tabs.

Do not override or hook this function, use [SANDBOX:AddToolMenuCategories](/gmod/SANDBOX:AddToolMenuCategories)!

AddGamemodeToolMenuTabs.DESCRIPTION:
This hook is used to add default tool tabs to spawnmenu.

Do not override or hook this function, use [SANDBOX:AddToolMenuTabs](/gmod/SANDBOX:AddToolMenuTabs)!

AddToolMenuCategories.DESCRIPTION: This hook is used to add new categories to spawnmenu tool tabs.

AddToolMenuTabs.DESCRIPTION: This hook is used to add new tool tabs to spawnmenu.

CanArmDupe.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to "arm" a duplication with the Duplicator tool. Return false to prevent the player from sending data to server, and to ignore data if it was somehow sent anyway.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to arm a dupe.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can the player arm a dupe or not.

CanDrive.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to drive a prop via Prop Drive

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to use Prop Drive.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the player is attempting to drive

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow driving, false to disallow

CanProperty.DESCRIPTION: Controls if a property can be used or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player, that tried to use the property

ARGUMENTS.NAME: property
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class of the property that is tried to use, for example - bonemanipulate
WARNINGS: This is not guaranteed to be the internal property name used in properties.Add!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity, on which property is tried to be used on

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow using that property

CanTool.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to fire their tool gun. Return true to specifically allow the attempt, false to block it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to use their toolgun.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A trace from the players eye to where in the world their crosshair/cursor is pointing. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tool
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The tool mode the player currently has selected.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can use toolgun or not.

ContentSidebarSelection.DESCRIPTION: Called when player selects an item on the spawnmenu sidebar at the left.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that holds spawnicons and the sidebar of spawnmenu

ARGUMENTS.NAME: node
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The item player selected

ContextMenuClosed.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the context menu is supposedly closed.

This is simply an alias of [GM:OnContextMenuClose](/gmod/GM:OnContextMenuClose).

This hook **will** be called even if the Sandbox's context menu doesn't actually exist, i.e. [SANDBOX:ContextMenuEnabled](/gmod/SANDBOX:ContextMenuEnabled) blocked its creation.

ContextMenuCreated.DESCRIPTION: Called when the context menu is created.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g_ContextMenu
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The created context menu panel

ContextMenuEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Allows to prevent the creation of the context menu. If the context menu is already created, this will have no effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to prevent the context menu from being created.

ContextMenuOpen.DESCRIPTION: Called when the context menu is trying to be opened.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `false` to block the opening.

ContextMenuOpened.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the context menu is supposedly opened.

This is simply an alias of [GM:OnContextMenuOpen](/gmod/GM:OnContextMenuOpen) but will **not** be called if [SANDBOX:ContextMenuOpen](/gmod/SANDBOX:ContextMenuOpen) prevents the context menu from opening.

This hook **will** be called even if the context menu doesn't actually exist, i.e. [SANDBOX:ContextMenuEnabled](/gmod/SANDBOX:ContextMenuEnabled) blocked its creation.

PaintNotes.DESCRIPTION: Called from [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint); does nothing by default.
NOTES: This cannot be used with hook.Add

PaintWorldTips.DESCRIPTION:
Called from [GM:HUDPaint](/gmod/GM:HUDPaint) to draw world tips. By default, enabling cl_drawworldtooltips will stop world tips from being drawn here.

See [AddWorldTip](/gmod/Global.AddWorldTip) for more information.
NOTES: This cannot be used with hook.Add

PersistenceLoad.DESCRIPTION: Called when persistent props are loaded.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Save from which to load.

PersistenceSave.DESCRIPTION: Called when persistent props are saved.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Where to save. By default is convar "sbox_persist".

PlayerGiveSWEP.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to give themselves a weapon from the Q menu. ( Left mouse clicks on an icon )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to give themselves a weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the weapon the player tried to give themselves.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: swep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The swep table of this weapon, see [SWEP](/gmod/Structures/SWEP)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can the SWEP be given to the player

PlayerSpawnedEffect.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player spawned an effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that spawned the effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model of spawned effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The spawned effect itself
