PlayerSpawnedNPC.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player spawned an NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that spawned the NPC

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The spawned NPC itself

PlayerSpawnedProp.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player has successfully spawned a prop from the Q menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who spawned a prop.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the model of the prop the player is attempting to spawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that was spawned.

PlayerSpawnedRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player spawned a ragdoll.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that spawned the ragdoll

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ragdoll model that player wants to spawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The spawned ragdoll itself

PlayerSpawnedSENT.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player has spawned a scripted entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that spawned the SENT

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The spawned SENT

PlayerSpawnedSWEP.DESCRIPTION:
Called after the player has spawned a scripted weapon from the spawnmenu with a middle mouse click.

For left mouse click spawns, see [SANDBOX:PlayerGiveSWEP](/gmod/SANDBOX:PlayerGiveSWEP).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that spawned the SWEP

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The SWEP itself

PlayerSpawnedVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Called after the player spawned a vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that spawned the vehicle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle itself

PlayerSpawnEffect.DESCRIPTION: Called to ask if player allowed to spawn a particular effect or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that wants to spawn an effect

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The effect model that player wants to spawn

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow spawning that effect

PlayerSpawnNPC.DESCRIPTION: Called to ask if player allowed to spawn a particular NPC or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that wants to spawn that NPC

ARGUMENTS.NAME: npc_type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The npc type that player is trying to spawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon of that NPC

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow spawning that NPC

PlayerSpawnObject.DESCRIPTION: Called to ask whether player is allowed to spawn a given model. This includes props, effects, and ragdolls and is called before the respective PlayerSpawn* hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player in question

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Model path

ARGUMENTS.NAME: skin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Skin number

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow the player to spawn the given model.

PlayerSpawnProp.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to spawn a prop from the Q menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to spawn a prop.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the model of the prop the player is attempting to spawn.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should the player be able to spawn the prop or not.

PlayerSpawnRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to spawn a ragdoll from the Q menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to spawn a ragdoll.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the model of the ragdoll the player is attempting to spawn.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should the player be able to spawn the ragdoll or not.

PlayerSpawnSENT.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to spawn an Entity from the Q menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to spawn the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the entity the player tried to spawn.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: can_spawn

PlayerSpawnSWEP.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player attempts to spawn a weapon from the Q menu. ( Mouse wheel clicks on an icon )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who attempted to spawn a weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the weapon the player tried to spawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: swep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Information about the weapon the player is trying to spawn, see [SWEP](/gmod/Structures/SWEP)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can the SWEP be spawned

PlayerSpawnVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Called to ask if player allowed to spawn a particular vehicle or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that wants to spawn that vehicle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle model that player wants to spawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vehicle name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table of that vehicle, containing info about it

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to disallow spawning that vehicle

PopulatePropMenu.DESCRIPTION:
This hook makes the engine load the spawnlist text files.
It calls [spawnmenu.PopulateFromEngineTextFiles](/gmod/spawnmenu.PopulateFromEngineTextFiles) by default.

DEPRECATED: This hook is never called. Use SANDBOX:PopulateToolMenu instead.
PopulateSTOOLMenu.DESCRIPTION: Called to populate the Scripted Tool menu.

PopulateToolMenu.DESCRIPTION: Add the STOOLS to the tool menu. You want to call [spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption](/gmod/spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption) in this hook.

PostReloadToolsMenu.DESCRIPTION: Called right after the Lua Loaded tool menus are reloaded. This is a good place to set up any [ControlPanel](/gmod/ControlPanel)s.

PreReloadToolsMenu.DESCRIPTION: Called right before the Lua Loaded tool menus are reloaded.

SpawnlistOpenGenericMenu.DESCRIPTION: Called when there's one or more items selected in the spawnmenu by the player, to open the multi selection right click menu ([DMenu](/gmod/DMenu))

ARGUMENTS.NAME: canvas
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The canvas that has the selection. ([SANDBOX:SpawnlistOpenGenericMenu](/gmod/SANDBOX:SpawnlistOpenGenericMenu))

SpawnMenuEnabled.DESCRIPTION: If false is returned then the spawn menu is never created. This saves load times if your mod doesn't actually use the spawn menu for any reason.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to create spawnmenu or not.

SpawnMenuOpen.DESCRIPTION: Called when spawnmenu is trying to be opened.
NOTES: Hiding the spawnmenu will not stop people from being able to use the various console commands to spawn in items, etc. See GM:PlayerSpawn* hooks for blocking actual spawning.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to dissallow opening the spawnmenu

SANDBOX.DESCRIPTION:
This is a list of hooks that are only available in Sandbox or Sandbox derived gamemodes.

Easiest way to tell if a gamemode is Sandbox derived is to check if this variable exists:

```

-- Replace GAMEMODE with GM if you are in gamemode files.

if ( GAMEMODE.IsSandboxDerived ) then

	-- Do stuff

end

```
NOTES: This function or feature is only available in the Sandbox gamemode and its Global.DeriveGamemode.

Deploy.DESCRIPTION:
Called when [WEAPON:Deploy](/gmod/WEAPON:Deploy) of the toolgun is called.

This is also called when switching from another tool on the server.

DrawHUD.DESCRIPTION: Called when [WEAPON:DrawHUD](/gmod/WEAPON:DrawHUD) of the toolgun is called, only when the user has this tool selected.

DrawToolScreen.DESCRIPTION: Called after the default tool screen has been drawn from [WEAPON:RenderScreen](/gmod/WEAPON:RenderScreen).
NOTES: Materials rendered in this hook require $ignorez parameter to draw properly.
If this method exists on the TOOL object table, the default scrolling text will not be drawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the tool's screen in pixels.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the tool's screen in pixels.

FreezeMovement.DESCRIPTION: Called when [WEAPON:Think](/gmod/WEAPON:Think) of the toolgun is called, only when the user has this tool selected.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to freeze the player

Holster.DESCRIPTION: Called when [WEAPON:Holster](/gmod/WEAPON:Holster) of the toolgun is called, as well as when switching between different toolguns.

LeftClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when the user left clicks with the tool

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A trace from users eyes to wherever he aims at. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to make the tool gun beam and play fire animations, false otherwise

Reload.DESCRIPTION: Called when the user presses the reload key with the tool out.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A trace from users eyes to wherever he aims at. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to make the tool gun beam and play fire animations, false otherwise

RightClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when the user right clicks with the tool.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A trace from users eyes to wherever he aims at. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to make the tool gun beam and play fire animations, false otherwise

Think.DESCRIPTION: Called when [WEAPON:Think](/gmod/WEAPON:Think) of the toolgun is called. This only happens when the tool gun is currently equipped/selected by the player and the selected tool is this tool.

TOOL.DESCRIPTION:
A list of hooks (or callbacks) that are available for you to override in a tool. This is only applicable to sandbox and sandbox-derived gamemodes.

See also: [TOOL](/gmod/Structures/TOOL) and [Tool](/gmod/Tool).
NOTES: This function or feature is only available in the Sandbox gamemode and its Global.DeriveGamemode.

AcceptInput.DESCRIPTION: Called when another entity fires an event to this entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inputName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the input that was triggered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The initial cause for the input getting triggered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: called
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that directly trigger the input.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data passed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should we suppress the default action for this input?

AdjustMouseSensitivity.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to adjust the mouse sensitivity. This hook only works if you haven't overridden [GM:AdjustMouseSensitivity](/gmod/GM:AdjustMouseSensitivity).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Sensitivity scale

Ammo1.DESCRIPTION: Returns how much of primary ammo the player has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of primary ammo player has

Ammo2.DESCRIPTION: Returns how much of secondary ammo the player has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of secondary ammo player has

CalcView.DESCRIPTION:
Allows you to adjust player view while this weapon in use.

This hook is called from the default implementation of [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView) which is [here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/base/gamemode/cl_init.lua#L376-L383). Therefore, it will not be called if any other hook added to CalcView returns any value, or if the current gamemode overrides the default hook and does not call the SWEP function.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: SWEPs that define this function will not work with the [taunt camera.](/gmod/Global.TauntCamera)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The owner of weapon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current position of players view

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current angles of players view

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current FOV of players view

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New position of players view
New angle of players view
New FOV of players view

CalcViewModelView.DESCRIPTION: Allows overriding the position and angle of the viewmodel. This hook only works if you haven't overridden [GM:CalcViewModelView](/gmod/GM:CalcViewModelView).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ViewModel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The viewmodel entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: OldEyePos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Original position (before viewmodel bobbing and swaying)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: OldEyeAng
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Original angle (before viewmodel bobbing and swaying)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: EyePos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: EyeAng
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current angle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New position
New angle

CanBePickedUpByNPCs.DESCRIPTION: Called when a Citizen NPC is looking around to a (better) weapon to pickup.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow this weapon to be picked up by NPCs.

CanPrimaryAttack.DESCRIPTION: Helper function for checking for no ammo.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can use primary attack

CanSecondaryAttack.DESCRIPTION: Helper function for checking for no ammo.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Can use secondary attack

CustomAmmoDisplay.DESCRIPTION:
Allows you to use any numbers you want for the ammo display on the HUD.

Can be useful for weapons that don't use standard ammo.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The new ammo display settings. A table with 4 possible keys:

* [boolean](/gmod/boolean) Draw - Whether to draw the ammo display or not

* [number](/gmod/number) PrimaryClip - Amount of primary ammo in the clip

* [number](/gmod/number) PrimaryAmmo - Amount of primary ammo in the reserves

* [number](/gmod/number) SecondaryAmmo - Amount of secondary ammo. It is shown like alt-fire for SMG1 and AR2 are shown.

There is **no** SecondaryClip!

Deploy.DESCRIPTION: Called when player has just switched to this weapon.
NOTES: Due to this hook being predicted, it is not called clientside in singleplayer at all, and in multiplayer it will not be called clientside if the weapon is switched with Player:SelectWeapon or the "use" console command, however it will be called clientside with the default weapon selection menu and when using CUserCmd:SelectWeapon

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to allow switching away from this weapon using lastinv command

DoDrawCrosshair.DESCRIPTION: Called when the crosshair is about to get drawn, and allows you to override it.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The arguments passed to this function are not affected by **SWEP.AccurateCrosshair**.

NOTES: This function will not be called if **SWEP.DrawCrosshair** set to false.
This function will not be called if player was affected by Player:CrosshairDisable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X coordinate of the crosshair.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y coordinate of the crosshair.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to override the default crosshair.

DoImpactEffect.DESCRIPTION: Called so the weapon can override the impact effects it makes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult) from player's eyes to the impact point

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage type of bullet. See [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to not do the default thing - which is to call UTIL_ImpactTrace in C++

DrawHUD.DESCRIPTION:
This hook allows you to draw on screen while this weapon is in use.

If you want to draw a custom crosshair, consider using [WEAPON:DoDrawCrosshair](/gmod/WEAPON:DoDrawCrosshair) instead.

DrawHUDBackground.DESCRIPTION: This hook allows you to draw on screen while this weapon is in use. This hook is called **before** [WEAPON:DrawHUD](/gmod/WEAPON:DrawHUD) and is equivalent of [GM:HUDPaintBackground](/gmod/GM:HUDPaintBackground).

DrawWeaponSelection.DESCRIPTION: This hook draws the selection icon in the weapon selection menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X coordinate of the selection panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y coordinate of the selection panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the selection panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the selection panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Alpha value of the selection panel

DrawWorldModel.DESCRIPTION: Called when we are about to draw the world model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [STUDIO_](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO) flags for this render operation.

DrawWorldModelTranslucent.DESCRIPTION: Called when we are about to draw the translucent world model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [STUDIO_](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO) flags for this render operation.

Equip.DESCRIPTION: Called when a player or NPC has picked the weapon up.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: NewOwner
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The one who picked the weapon up. Can be [Player](/gmod/Player) or [NPC](/gmod/NPC).

EquipAmmo.DESCRIPTION:
The player has picked up the weapon and has taken the ammo from it.
The weapon will be removed immidiately after this call.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who picked up the weapon

FireAnimationEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Called before firing animation events, such as muzzle flashes or shell ejections.

This will only be called serverside for 3000-range events, and clientside for 5000-range  and other events.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The event ID of happened even. See [this page](http://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Animation_Events).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name or options of the event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: source
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The source entity. This will be a viewmodel on the client and the weapon itself on the server

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to disable the effect.

FreezeMovement.DESCRIPTION: This hook allows you to freeze players screen.
NOTES: Player will still be able to move or shoot

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to freeze moving the view

GetCapabilities.DESCRIPTION: This hook is for NPCs, you return what they should try to do with it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A number defining what NPC should do with the weapon. Use the [CAP](/gmod/Enums/CAP).

GetNPCBulletSpread.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the weapon is used by NPCs to determine how accurate the bullets fired should be.

The inaccuracy is simulated by changing the [NPC:GetAimVector](/gmod/NPC:GetAimVector) based on the value returned from this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: proficiency
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How proficient the NPC is with this gun. See [WEAPON_PROFICIENCY](/gmod/Enums/WEAPON_PROFICIENCY)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: An amount of degrees the bullets should deviate from the NPC's [NPC:GetAimVector](/gmod/NPC:GetAimVector). Default is 15.

GetNPCBurstSettings.DESCRIPTION: Called when the weapon is used by NPCs to tell the NPC how to use this weapon. Controls how long the NPC can or should shoot continuously.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Minimum amount of bullets per burst. Default is 1.
Maximum amount of bullets per burst. Default is 1.
Delay between each shot, aka firerate. Default is 1.

GetNPCRestTimes.DESCRIPTION: Called when the weapon is used by NPCs to tell the NPC how to use this weapon. Controls amount of time the NPC can rest (not shoot) between bursts.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Minimum amount of time the NPC can rest (not shoot) between bursts in seconds. Default is `0.3` seconds.
Maximum amount of time the NPC can rest (not shoot) between bursts in seconds. Default is `0.66` seconds.

GetTracerOrigin.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to override where the tracer effect comes from. ( Visual bullets )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new position to start tracer effect from

GetViewModelPosition.DESCRIPTION: This hook allows you to adjust view model position and angles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: EyePos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: EyeAng
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Current angle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New position
New angle

Holster.DESCRIPTION: Called when weapon tries to holster.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is called twice for every holster clientside, one in [Prediction](/gmod/Prediction) and one not.
Before [WEAPON:OnRemove](/gmod/WEAPON:OnRemove) is called, this function is only called serverside.

NOTES: This will only be called serverside when using Player:SelectWeapon as that function immidiately switches the weapon out of prediction.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon we are trying switch to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Return true to allow weapon to holster.

This will not have an effect if weapon was switched away from using [Player:SetActiveWeapon](/gmod/Player:SetActiveWeapon)

HUDShouldDraw.DESCRIPTION: This hook determines which parts of the HUD to draw.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: element
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The HUD element in question

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to hide this HUD element

Initialize.DESCRIPTION: Called when the weapon entity is created.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is sometimes not called clientside. You can work around this by setting a variable in Initialize and check if it exists in [WEAPON:Think](/gmod/WEAPON:Think). See the example below.
This is not called serverside after a quicksave.

NOTES: Entity:GetOwner will return NULL at this point because the weapon is not equpped by a player or NPC yet. Use WEAPON:Equip or WEAPON:Deploy if you need the owner to be valid.

KeyValue.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the engine sets a value for this scripted weapon.

See [GM:EntityKeyValue](/gmod/GM:EntityKeyValue) for a hook that works for all entities.

See [ENTITY:KeyValue](/gmod/ENTITY:KeyValue) for an  hook that works for scripted entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that was affected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to suppress this KeyValue or return false or nothing to apply this key value.

OnDrop.DESCRIPTION:
Called when weapon is dropped by [Player:DropWeapon](/gmod/Player:DropWeapon).

See also [WEAPON:OwnerChanged](/gmod/WEAPON:OwnerChanged).

OnReloaded.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the weapons Lua script is reloaded.

OnRemove.DESCRIPTION: Called when the swep is about to be removed.

OnRestore.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the weapon entity is reloaded from a Source Engine save (not the Sandbox saves or dupes) or on a changelevel (for example Half-Life 2 campaign level transitions).

For the [duplicator](/gmod/duplicator) callbacks, see [ENTITY:OnDuplicated](/gmod/ENTITY:OnDuplicated).

See also [saverestore](/gmod/saverestore) for relevant functions.

OwnerChanged.DESCRIPTION:
Called when weapon is dropped or picked up by a new player.

See also [WEAPON:OnDrop](/gmod/WEAPON:OnDrop).

PostDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION:
Called after the view model has been drawn while the weapon in use. This hook is called from the default implementation of [GM:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PostDrawViewModel), and as such, will not occur if it has been overridden.

[WEAPON:ViewModelDrawn](/gmod/WEAPON:ViewModelDrawn) is an alternative hook which is always called before [GM:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PostDrawViewModel).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the view model entity after it is drawn

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the weapon that is from the view model (same as self)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The owner of the view model

PreDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to modify viewmodel while the weapon in use before it is drawn. This hook only works if you haven't overridden [GM:PreDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PreDrawViewModel).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the view model entity before it is drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the weapon that is from the view model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The the owner of the view model.

PrimaryAttack.DESCRIPTION:
Called when primary attack button ( +attack ) is pressed.

When in singleplayer, this function is only called in the server realm. When in multiplayer, the hook will be called on both the server and the client in order to allow for [Prediction](/gmod/Prediction).

You can force the hook to always be called on client like this:

```

if ( game.SinglePlayer() ) then self:CallOnClient( "PrimaryAttack" ) end

```

Note that due to prediction, in multiplayer SWEP:PrimaryAttack is called multiple times per one "shot" with the gun. To work around that, use [IsFirstTimePredicted](/gmod/Global.IsFirstTimePredicted).

PrintWeaponInfo.DESCRIPTION: A convenience function that draws the weapon info box, used in [WEAPON:DrawWeaponSelection](/gmod/WEAPON:DrawWeaponSelection).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x co-ordinate of box position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y co-ordinate of box position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Alpha value for the box

Reload.DESCRIPTION: Called when the reload key ( +reload ) is pressed.

RenderScreen.DESCRIPTION:
Called every frame just before [GM:RenderScene](/gmod/GM:RenderScene).

Used by the Tool Gun to render view model screens ([TOOL:DrawToolScreen](/gmod/TOOL:DrawToolScreen)).
NOTES: Materials rendered in this hook require $ignorez parameter to draw properly.

SecondaryAttack.DESCRIPTION:
Called when secondary attack button ( +attack2 ) is pressed.

For issues with this hook being called rapidly on the client side, see the global function [IsFirstTimePredicted](/gmod/Global.IsFirstTimePredicted).

SetDeploySpeed.DESCRIPTION: Sets the weapon deploy speed. This value needs to match on client and server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set deploy speed to. Negative will slow down playback.

SetupDataTables.DESCRIPTION: Called when the SWEP should set up its [Data Tables](/gmod/Networking_Entities).

SetWeaponHoldType.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the hold type of the weapon. This must be called on **both** the server and the client to work properly.

**NOTE:** You should avoid calling this function and call [Weapon:SetHoldType](/gmod/Weapon:SetHoldType) now.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the hold type. You can find all default hold types [here](/gmod/Hold_Types)

ShootBullet.DESCRIPTION: A convenient function to shoot bullets.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage of the bullet

ARGUMENTS.NAME: num_bullets
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of bullets to shoot

ARGUMENTS.NAME: aimcone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Spread of bullets

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammo_type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo type of the bullets

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Force of the bullets

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tracer
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Show a tracer on every x bullets

ShootEffects.DESCRIPTION: A convenience function to create shoot effects.

ShouldDrawViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Called to determine if the view model should be drawn or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to draw the view model, false otherwise.

ShouldDropOnDie.DESCRIPTION:
Should this weapon be dropped when its owner dies?

This only works if the player has [Player:ShouldDropWeapon](/gmod/Player:ShouldDropWeapon) set to true.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return true to drop the weapon, false otherwise. Default ( if you don't return anything ) is false.

TakePrimaryAmmo.DESCRIPTION: A convenience function to remove primary ammo from clip.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of primary ammo to remove

TakeSecondaryAmmo.DESCRIPTION: A convenience function to remove secondary ammo from clip.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much of secondary ammo to remove

Think.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the swep thinks.

This hook won't be called during the deploy animation and when using [Weapon:DefaultReload](/gmod/Weapon:DefaultReload).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will not be run during deploy animations after a serverside-only deploy. This usually happens after picking up and dropping an object with +use.

NOTES: This hook will be called before Player movement is processed on the client, and after on the server.
Despite being a predicted hook, this hook is called clientside in single player, however it will not be recognized as a predicted hook to Player:GetCurrentCommand.

TranslateActivity.DESCRIPTION:
Translate a player's Activity into a weapon's activity, depending on how you want the player to be holding the weapon.

For example, ACT_MP_RUN becomes ACT_HL2MP_RUN_PISTOL.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The activity to translate

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The translated activity

TranslateFOV.DESCRIPTION: Allows to change players field of view while player holds the weapon.
NOTES: This hook must be defined shared and return same value on both to properly affect Area Portals.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The current/default FOV.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The target FOV.

ViewModelDrawn.DESCRIPTION: Called straight after the view model has been drawn. This is called before [GM:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/GM:PostDrawViewModel) and [WEAPON:PostDrawViewModel](/gmod/WEAPON:PostDrawViewModel).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ViewModel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Players view model

SWEP.DESCRIPTION:
Default weapon methods, that are available for use in SWEPs. These hooks **will not work** on non-scripted weapons, such as the Half-Life 2 weapons.

You can find all available SWEP fields here: [SWEP](/gmod/Structures/SWEP)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: See [Color](/gmod/Color)

GetContentType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the content type used to save and restore the content icon in a spawnlist.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The content type, for example "entity" or "weapon".

GetNPCWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of weapon classes for the content icon with "NPC" content type to be randomly chosen from when user tries to spawn the NPC.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of weapon classes to be chosen from when user tries to spawn the NPC.

GetSpawnName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the internal "name" for the content icon, usually a class name for an entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Internal "name" to be used when user left clicks the icon.

OpenMenu.DESCRIPTION: A hook for override, by default does nothing. Called when user right clicks on the content icon, you are supposed to open a [DermaMenu](/gmod/Global.DermaMenu) here with additional options.

SetAdminOnly.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the content item is admin only. This makes the icon to display a admin icon in the top left corner of the icon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: adminOnly
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this content should be admin only or not

SetColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color for the content icon. Currently is not used by the content icon panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: clr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color to set. See [Color](/gmod/Color)

SetContentType.DESCRIPTION: Sets the content type used to save and restore the content icon in a spawnlist.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The content type, for example "entity" or "weapon"

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Sets the material to be displayed as the content icon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the icon to use.

SetName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the tool tip and the "nice" name to be displayed by the content icon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: "Nice" name to display.

SetNPCWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Sets a table of weapon classes for the content icon with "NPC" content type to be randomly chosen from when user tries to spawn the NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapons
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of weapon classes to be chosen from when user tries to spawn the NPC.

SetSpawnName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the internal "name" for the content icon, usually a class name for an entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Internal "name" to be used when user left clicks the icon.

ContentIcon.DESCRIPTION:
The spawn icon used for SWEPs and other SENTs, commonly featured as part of the spawn menu. Do note that at least one of your ContentIcon's parents must either be an [EditablePanel](/gmod/EditablePanel) or derived from it (like a [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame), for example), else it won't be able to focus and thus be unclickable.

This control only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

ControlValues.DESCRIPTION: Called by spawnmenu functions (when creating a context menu) to fill this control with data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: contextData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A two-membered table:

* [string](/gmod/string) convar - The console variable to use. Calls [ContextBase:SetConVar](/gmod/ContextBase:SetConVar).

* [string](/gmod/string) label - The text to display inside the control's label.

ConVar.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) for the panel to change/handle, set by [ContextBase:SetConVar](/gmod/ContextBase:SetConVar)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) for the panel to change.

SetConVar.DESCRIPTION: Sets the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) for the panel to change/handle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cvar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) for the panel to change.

TestForChanges.DESCRIPTION: You should override this function and use it to check whether your convar value changed.

ContextBase.DESCRIPTION: A base for all context menu panels ( The ones used for tool options in sandbox )

AddControl.DESCRIPTION: Adds a control to the control panel.
DEPRECATED: It is recommended to use DForm's members instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The control type to add. The complete list is:

* header

* textbox

* label

* checkbox/toggle

* slider

* propselect

* matselect

* ropematerial

* button

* numpad

* color

* combobox

* listbox

* materialgallery

ARGUMENTS.NAME: controlinfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Each control takes their own table structure. You may search "AddControl" on GitHub for examples.

Here is a full list of each type and the table members it requires:

* header

	* description

* textbox:

	* label (def: "Untitled")

	* command

* label:

	* text

* checkbox, toggle (same thing):

	* label (def: "Untitled")

	* command

	* help (boolean, if true assumes label is a language string (`#tool.toolname.stuff`) and adds `.help` at the end)

* slider: ([DForm:NumSlider](/gmod/DForm:NumSlider))

	* type (optional string, if equals `float` then 2 digits after the decimal will be used, otherwise 0)

	* label (def: `Untitled`)

	* command

	* min (def: `0`)

	* max (def: `100`)

	* help (boolean, see above)

* propselect:

	* (data goes directly to PropSelect's :ControlValues(data))

* matselect:

	* (data goes directly to MatSelect's :ControlValues(data))

* ropematerial:

	* convar (notice: NOT called command this time!)

* button:

	* label / text (if label is missing will use text. Def: `No Label`)

	* command

* numpad:

	* command

	* command2

	* label

	* label2

* color:

	* label

	* red (convar)

	* green (convar)

	* blue (convar)

	* alpha (convar)

* combobox:

	* menubutton (if doesn't equal "1", becomes a listbox)

	* folder

	* options (optional, ha)

	* cvars (optional)

* listbox:

	* height (if set, becomes [DListView](/gmod/DListView), otherwise is [CtrlListBox](/gmod/CtrlListBox))

	* label (def: `unknown`)

	* options (optional)

* materialgallery:

	* width (def: `32`)

	* height (def: `32`)

	* rows (def: `4`)

	* convar

	* options

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to add as an item to the control panel.

ControlValues.DESCRIPTION: Sets control values of the control panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A two-membered table:
* [boolean](/gmod/boolean) closed - Sets if the control panel should be unexpanded.
* [string](/gmod/string) label - The text to display inside the control's label.

FillViaFunction.DESCRIPTION: Calls the given function with this panel as the only argument. Used by the spawnmenu to populate the control panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A function that takes one argument:
* [ControlPanel](/gmod/ControlPanel) panelToPopulate

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The same control panel the function is being called on.

MatSelect.DESCRIPTION: Creates a [MatSelect](/gmod/MatSelect) panel and adds it as an [item](/gmod/ControlPanel:AddPanel).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Calls [MatSelect](/gmod/MatSelect):[SetConVar](/gmod/ContextBase:SetConVar) with this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If specified, calls [MatSelect:AddMaterial](/gmod/MatSelect:AddMaterial)(key, value) for each table entry. If the table key is a number, the function will instead be called with the value as both arguments.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: autostretch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If specified, calls [MatSelect:SetAutoHeight](/gmod/MatSelect:SetAutoHeight) with this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If specified, calls [MatSelect:SetItemWidth](/gmod/MatSelect:SetItemWidth) with this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If specified, calls [MatSelect:SetItemHeight](/gmod/MatSelect:SetItemHeight) with this value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created MatSelect panel.

ControlPanel.DESCRIPTION: Used by the context menu in sandbox.

AddConVar.DESCRIPTION: Adds a convar to be managed by this control.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The convar to add.

GetConVars.DESCRIPTION: Get a list of all Console Variables being managed by this panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: numbered table of convars

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to put in the label

ControlPresets.DESCRIPTION:
A preset manager, found at the top of almost every default tool's C-menu.

This control only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

CaptureMouse.DESCRIPTION: Used by the panel to perform mouse capture operations when adjusting the model.

FirstPersonControls.DESCRIPTION: Used to adjust the perspective in the model panel via the keyboard, when the right mouse button is used.

GetFirstPerson.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether mouse and keyboard-based adjustment of the perspective has been enabled. See [DAdjustableModelPanel:SetFirstPerson](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel:SetFirstPerson) for more information.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether first person controls are enabled. See [DAdjustableModelPanel:FirstPersonControls](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel:FirstPersonControls).

SetFirstPerson.DESCRIPTION:
Enables mouse and keyboard-based adjustment of the perspective.

This is set to `true` automatically each time mouse capture is enabled, and hence doesn't serve as a usable setting, other than to disable this functionality after the [PANEL:OnMousePressed](/gmod/PANEL:OnMousePressed) event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to enable/disable first person controls. See [DAdjustableModelPanel:FirstPersonControls](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel:FirstPersonControls).

DAdjustableModelPanel.DESCRIPTION:
A derivative of the DModelPanel in which the user may modify the perspective of the model with their mouse and keyboard by clicking and dragging.

The keyboard keys          and  can be used when the right mouse is held down, with  acting as a speed multiplier. When the left mouse is used, the Shift key holds the current `y` angle steady.

This is used by [IconEditor](/gmod/IconEditor) for modifying spawn icons.

GetBarColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the base color of the alpha bar. This is the color for which the alpha channel is being modified.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current base color.

GetValue.DESCRIPTION: Returns the alpha value of the alpha bar.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current alpha value.

OnChange.DESCRIPTION: Called when user changes the desired alpha value with the control.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new alpha value

SetBarColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the base color of the alpha bar. This is the color for which the alpha channel is being modified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: clr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new [Color](/gmod/Color) to set. See [Color](/gmod/Global.Color).

SetValue.DESCRIPTION: Sets the alpha value or the alpha bar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new alpha value to set

DAlphaBar.DESCRIPTION: A bar to select the opacity (alpha level) of a color.

GetSelectedNumber.DESCRIPTION: Gets the code of the key currently bound by the DBinder. Same as [DBinder:GetValue](/gmod/DBinder:GetValue).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The key code of the bound key. See [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

GetValue.DESCRIPTION: Gets the code of the key currently bound by the DBinder. Same as [DBinder:GetSelectedNumber](/gmod/DBinder:GetSelectedNumber).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The key code of the bound key. See [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

OnChange.DESCRIPTION: Called when the player selects a new bind.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: iNum
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new bound key. See [input.GetKeyName](/gmod/input.GetKeyName).

SetSelectedNumber.DESCRIPTION: Sets the current key bound by the [DBinder](/gmod/DBinder), and updates the button's text as well as the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key code of the key to bind. See [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key code of the key to bind. See [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

UpdateText.DESCRIPTION: Used to set the text of the DBinder to the current key binding, or `NONE`.

DBinder.DESCRIPTION: Input which can bind a command to a key. Used for binding inputs and outputs of TOOLs.

OpenForPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets the speech bubble position and size along with the dialog point position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x position of the dialog point. If this is set to a value greater than half of the set width, the entire bubble container will be moved in addition to the dialog point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y position of the bubble container. Has no effect unless set to a value greater than the set height + 64 pixels.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the bubble container.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the bubble container.

DBubbleContainer.DESCRIPTION: A transparent gray speech bubble panel made up of a rounded box and point coming from the bottom.

GetDrawBorder.DESCRIPTION: Returns value set by [DButton:SetDrawBorder](/gmod/DButton:SetDrawBorder). See that page for more info.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: value set by [DButton:SetDrawBorder](/gmod/DButton:SetDrawBorder).

IsDown.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the DButton is currently depressed (a user is clicking on it).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the button is depressed.

SetConsoleCommand.DESCRIPTION:
Sets a console command to be called when the button is clicked.

This overrides the button's `DoClick` method.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: command
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The console command to be called.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The arguments for the command.

SetDisabled.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether or not the DButton is disabled.

When disabled, the button is `greyed out` and cannot be clicked.
DEPRECATED: Use Panel:SetEnabled instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: disable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: When true Enable the button, when false Disable the button.

SetDrawBorder.DESCRIPTION: Does absolutely nothing at all. Default value is automatically set to true.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: draw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Does nothing.

SetIcon.DESCRIPTION: Sets an image to be displayed as the button's background. Alias of [DButton:SetImage](/gmod/DButton:SetImage)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: img
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The image file to use, relative to `/materials`. If this is nil, the image background is removed.

SetImage.DESCRIPTION:
Sets an image to be displayed as the button's background.

See [DButton:SetMaterial](/gmod/DButton:SetMaterial) for equivalent function that uses [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial) instead.

Also see: [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: img
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The image file to use, relative to `/materials`. If this is nil, the image background is removed.

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Sets an image to be displayed as the button's background.

See [DButton:SetImage](/gmod/DButton:SetImage) for equivalent function that uses file paths instead. Also see [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: img
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to use. If this is nil, the image background is removed.

UpdateColours.DESCRIPTION: A hook called from within [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)'s [PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings](/gmod/PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings) to determine the color of the text on display.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: skin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table supposed to contain the color values listed above.

DButton.DESCRIPTION:
A standard Derma button.

By default, a [DButton](/gmod/DButton) is 22px tall.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: categoryName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the category to add.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DCollapsibleCategory](/gmod/DCollapsibleCategory)

AddItem.DESCRIPTION: Adds an element to the list.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: element
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: VGUI element to add to the list.

UnselectAll.DESCRIPTION: Calls [Panel:UnselectAll](/gmod/Panel:UnselectAll) on all child elements, if they have it.

DCategoryList.DESCRIPTION: A host for multiple [DCollapsibleCategory](/gmod/DCollapsibleCategory) panels. As the name suggests, each one of them can be collapsed or expanded on demand by the user.

GetChecked.DESCRIPTION: Gets the checked state of the checkbox.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the box is checked or not.

IsEditing.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the state of the checkbox is being edited. This means whether the user is currently clicking (mouse-down) on the checkbox, and applies to both the left and right mouse buttons.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the checkbox is being clicked.

OnChange.DESCRIPTION: Called when the "checked" state is changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bVal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the CheckBox is checked or not.

SetChecked.DESCRIPTION: Sets the checked state of the checkbox. Does not call the checkbox's [DCheckBox:OnChange](/gmod/DCheckBox:OnChange) and [Panel:ConVarChanged](/gmod/Panel:ConVarChanged) methods, unlike [DCheckBox:SetValue](/gmod/DCheckBox:SetValue).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: checked
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the box should be checked or not.

SetValue.DESCRIPTION: Sets the checked state of the checkbox, and calls the checkbox's [DCheckBox:OnChange](/gmod/DCheckBox:OnChange) and [Panel:ConVarChanged](/gmod/Panel:ConVarChanged) methods.

DCheckBox.DESCRIPTION: The DCheckBox is a checkbox. It allows you to get a boolean value from the user (true/false - yes/no)

NOTES: Calling this when using a color that isn't 100% saturated and valued (Global.HSVToColor with saturation and value set to 1) causes the color cube to look inaccurate compared to the color that's returned by methods like DColorCube:GetRGB and DColorCube:OnUserChanged. You should use DColorCube:SetColor instead

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The given x position.
The given y position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x position to set color to/the percentage of saturation to remove from the color (ranges from 0.0 to 1.0).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y position to set color to/the percentage of brightness or value to remove from the color (ranges from 0.0 to 1.0).

DColorPalette.DESCRIPTION:
The **DColorPalette** allows the player to select a color from a list of given colors.

This panel supports saving across sessions via the panel cookie system.

Use [Panel:SetCookieName](/gmod/Panel:SetCookieName) to change "save files".

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the column/tab

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to be used as contents of the tab. This normally would be a [DPanel](/gmod/DPanel)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Icon for the tab. This will ideally be a [silkicon](/gmod/Silkicons), but any material name can be used.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table containing the following keys:
* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) Button - The created tab button that will switch to the given panel
* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) Panel - The given panel to switch to when the button is pressed

GetActiveButton.DESCRIPTION: Returns the active button of this [DColumnSheet](/gmod/DColumnSheet).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The active button

SetActiveButton.DESCRIPTION: Makes a button an active button for this [DColumnSheet](/gmod/DColumnSheet).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: active
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The button to make active button

UseButtonOnlyStyle.DESCRIPTION: Makes the tabs/buttons show only the image and no text.

DColumnSheet.DESCRIPTION: Similar to [DPropertySheet](/gmod/DPropertySheet), but with tabs on the left.

AddChoice.DESCRIPTION: Adds a choice to the combo box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text show to the user.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The data accompanying this string. If left empty, the value argument is used instead.

Can be accessed with the second argument of [DComboBox:GetSelected](/gmod/DComboBox:GetSelected), [DComboBox:GetOptionData](/gmod/DComboBox:GetOptionData) and as an argument of [DComboBox:OnSelect](/gmod/DComboBox:OnSelect).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: select
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should this be the default selected text show to the user or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Adds an icon for this choice.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the new option.

ChooseOption.DESCRIPTION: Selects a combo box option by its index and changes the text displayed at the top of the combo box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to display at the top of the combo box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The option index.

ChooseOptionID.DESCRIPTION: Selects an option within a combo box based on its table index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Selects the option with given index.

Clear.DESCRIPTION: Clears the combo box's text value, choices, and data values.

CloseMenu.DESCRIPTION: Closes the combo box menu. Called when the combo box is clicked while open.

GetOptionData.DESCRIPTION: Returns an option's data based on the given index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The option index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The option's data value.

GetOptionText.DESCRIPTION: Returns an option's text based on the given index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The option index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The option's text value.

GetOptionTextByData.DESCRIPTION: Returns an option's text based on the given data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The data to look up the name of.

If given a [number](/gmod/number) and no matching data was found, the function will test given data against each [tonumber](/gmod/Global.tonumber)'d data entry.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The option's text value.

If no matching data was found, the data itself will be returned. If multiple identical data entries exist, the first instance will be returned.

GetSelected.DESCRIPTION: Returns the currently selected option's text and data

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The option's text value.
The option's stored data.

GetSelectedID.DESCRIPTION: Returns the index (ID) of the currently selected option.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the currently selected option.

GetSortItems.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an whether the items in the dropdown will be alphabetically sorted or not.

See [DComboBox:SetSortItems](/gmod/DComboBox:SetSortItems).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if enabled, false otherwise.

IsMenuOpen.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the combo box's menu is opened.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the menu is open, false otherwise.

OnSelect.DESCRIPTION: Called when an option in the combo box is selected. This function does nothing by itself, you're supposed to overwrite it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the option for use with other [DComboBox](/gmod/DComboBox) functions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the option.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data assigned to the option.

OpenMenu.DESCRIPTION: Opens the combo box drop down menu. Called when the combo box is clicked.

SetSortItems.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether or not the items should be sorted alphabetically in the dropdown menu of the [DComboBox](/gmod/DComboBox). If set to false, items will appear in the order they were added by [DComboBox:AddChoice](/gmod/DComboBox:AddChoice) calls.

This is enabled by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sort
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to enable, false to disable

SetValue.DESCRIPTION: Sets the text shown in the combo box when the menu is not collapsed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text in the DComboBox.

DComboBox.DESCRIPTION: A field with multiple selectable values.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the DnD family.

MakeDroppable.DESCRIPTION: Makes the panel a receiver for any droppable panel with the same DnD name. Internally calls [Panel:Receiver](/gmod/Panel:Receiver).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique name for the receiver slot. Only droppable panels with the same DnD name as this can be dropped on the panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allowCopy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to allow droppable panels to be copied when the  key is held down.

OnModified.DESCRIPTION: Called when anything is dropped on or rearranged within the [DDragBase](/gmod/DDragBase).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the DnD family.

SetDropPos.DESCRIPTION:
Determines where you can drop stuff.
"4" for left
"5" for center
"6" for right
"8" for top
"2" for bottom

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Where you're allowed to drop things.

DDragBase.DESCRIPTION: A VGUI base panel providing drag/drop functionality. Used by [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout), [DListLayout](/gmod/DListLayout) and [DTileLayout](/gmod/DTileLayout).

GetOpenSize.DESCRIPTION: Return the Open Size of DDrawer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Open size.

GetOpenTime.DESCRIPTION: Return the Open Time of DDrawer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Time in seconds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of DDrawer. Default is 100.

SetOpenTime.DESCRIPTION: Set the time (in seconds) for DDrawer to open.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Length in seconds. Default is 0.3

EntityLost.DESCRIPTION:
Called internally when an entity being edited became invalid.

You should use [DEntityProperties:OnEntityLost](/gmod/DEntityProperties:OnEntityLost) instead.

OnEntityLost.DESCRIPTION: Called when we were editing an entity and then it became invalid (probably removed)

RebuildControls.DESCRIPTION: Called internally by [DEntityProperties:SetEntity](/gmod/DEntityProperties:SetEntity) to rebuild the controls.

SetEntity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the entity to be edited by this panel. The entity must support the [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities) system or nothing will happen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to edit

DEntityProperties.DESCRIPTION: A panel used by the [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities) system.

GetExpanded.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this DExpandButton is expanded or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if expanded, false otherwise

SetExpanded.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether this DExpandButton should be expanded or not. Only changes appearance.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: expanded
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to expand ( visually will show a "-" )

DExpandButton.DESCRIPTION: The little "+" button used by [DProperties](/gmod/DProperties) and [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node).

Clear.DESCRIPTION: Clears the file tree and list, and resets all values.

GetBaseFolder.DESCRIPTION: Returns the root directory/folder of the file tree.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the root folder.

GetCurrentFolder.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current directory/folder being displayed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The directory the file list is currently displaying.

GetFileTypes.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current file type filter on the file list.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current filter applied to the file list.

GetFolderNode.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the [DTree Node](/gmod/DTree Node) that the file tree stems from.

This is a child of the root node of the [DTree](/gmod/DTree).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) used for the tree.

GetModels.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the model viewer mode is enabled. In this mode, files are displayed as [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon)s instead of a list.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not files will be displayed using [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon)s.

GetName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name being used for the file tree.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name used for the root of the file tree.

GetOpen.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the file tree is open.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the file tree is open.

GetPath.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the access path of the file tree. This is `GAME` unless changed with [DFileBrowser:SetPath](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetPath).

See [file.Read](/gmod/file.Read) for how paths work.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current access path i.e. "GAME", "LUA", "DATA" etc.

GetSearch.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current search filter on the file tree.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The filter in use on the file tree.

OnDoubleClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when a file is double-clicked.
NOTES: Double-clicking a file or icon will trigger **both** this and DFileBrowser:OnSelect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the file that was double-clicked.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: selectedPanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that was double-clicked to select this file.This will either be a [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) or [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon) depending on whether the model viewer mode is enabled. See [DFileBrowser:SetModels](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetModels).

OnRightClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when a file is right-clicked.
NOTES: When not in model viewer mode, DFileBrowser:OnSelect will also be called if the file is not already selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the file that was right-clicked.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: selectedPanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The panel that was right-clicked to select this file.

This will either be a [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) or [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon) depending on whether the model viewer mode is enabled. See [DFileBrowser:SetModels](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetModels).

OnSelect.DESCRIPTION: Called when a file is selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the file that was selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: selectedPanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that was clicked to select this file.This will either be a [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) or [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon) depending on whether the model viewer mode is enabled. See [DFileBrowser:SetModels](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetModels).

SetBaseFolder.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the root directory/folder of the file tree.

This needs to be set for the file tree to be displayed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: baseDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the folder to use as the root.

SetCurrentFolder.DESCRIPTION: Sets the directory/folder from which to display the file list.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: currentDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The directory to display files from.

SetFileTypes.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the file type filter for the file list.

This accepts the same file extension wildcards as [file.Find](/gmod/file.Find).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileTypes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A list of file types to display, separated by spaces e.g.

```

"*.lua *.txt *.mdl"

```

SetModels.DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables the model viewer mode. In this mode, files are displayed as [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon)s instead of a list.
NOTES: This should only be used for `.mdl` files; the spawn icons will display error models for others. See DFileBrowser:SetFileTypes

ARGUMENTS.NAME: showModels
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to display files using [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon)s.

SetName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the name to use for the file tree.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: treeName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name for the root of the file tree. Passing no value causes this to be the base folder name. See [DFileBrowser:SetBaseFolder](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetBaseFolder).

SetOpen.DESCRIPTION: Opens or closes the file tree.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: open
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `true` to open the tree, `false` to close it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: useAnim
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If `true`, the [DTree](/gmod/DTree)'s open/close animation is used.

SetPath.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the access path for the file tree. This is set to `GAME` by default.

See [file.Read](/gmod/file.Read) for how paths work.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The access path i.e. "GAME", "LUA", "DATA" etc.

SetSearch.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the search filter for the file tree.

This accepts the same wildcards as [file.Find](/gmod/file.Find).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The filter to use on the file tree.

Setup.DESCRIPTION:
Called to set up the [DTree](/gmod/DTree) and file viewer when a base path has been set.

Calls [DFileBrowser:SetupTree](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetupTree) and [DFileBrowser:SetupFiles](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetupFiles).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the variables needed to set up have been defined.

SetupFiles.DESCRIPTION:
Called to set up the [DListView](/gmod/DListView) or [DIconBrowser](/gmod/DIconBrowser) by [DFileBrowser:Setup](/gmod/DFileBrowser:Setup).

The icon browser is used when in models mode. See [DFileBrowser:SetModels](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetModels).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the files pane was set up successfully.

SetupTree.DESCRIPTION: Called to set up the [DTree](/gmod/DTree) by [DFileBrowser:Setup](/gmod/DFileBrowser:Setup).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the tree was set up successfully.

ShowFolder.DESCRIPTION:
Builds the file or icon list for the current directory.

You should use [DFileBrowser:SetCurrentFolder](/gmod/DFileBrowser:SetCurrentFolder) to change the directory.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: currentDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The directory to populate the list from.

NOTES: This is only functional when not using the model viewer. See DFileBrowser:SetModels

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sort order. `true` for descending (z-a), `false` for ascending (a-z).

DFileBrowser.DESCRIPTION:
A tree and list-based file browser.

It allows filtering by folder (directory) name and file extension, and can display models as [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon)s.

AddItem.DESCRIPTION:
Adds one or two items to the DForm.
If this method is called with only one argument, it is added to the bottom of the form. If two arguments are passed, they are placed side-by-side at the bottom of the form.

Internally, this function is used by the various DForm functions to, for example, add labels to the left of buttons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: left
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Left-hand element to add to the DForm.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: right
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Right-hand element to add to the DForm.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text on the button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: concommand
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The concommand to run when the button is clicked

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The arguments to pass on to the concommand when the button is clicked

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DButton](/gmod/DButton)

NOTES: This will run DCheckBoxLabel:OnChange when being added. This is caused by Panel:SetConVar being used when this function is used. To avoid this, use DForm:AddItem with a DCheckBoxLabel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The label to be set next to the check box

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The console variable to change when this is changed

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DCheckBoxLabel](/gmod/DCheckBoxLabel)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Text to the left of the combo box

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Console variable to change when the user selects something from the dropdown.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DComboBox](/gmod/DComboBox)
The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

ControlHelp.DESCRIPTION: Adds a [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) onto the [DForm](/gmod/DForm). Unlike [DForm:Help](/gmod/DForm:Help), this is indented and is colored blue, depending on the derma skin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: help
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The help message to be displayed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

Help.DESCRIPTION: Adds a [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) onto the [DForm](/gmod/DForm) as a helper

ARGUMENTS.NAME: help
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The help message to be displayed

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

DEPRECATED: Use DListView with DForm:AddItem instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The label to set on the DListBox

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DListBox](/gmod/DListBox)
The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The label to be placed next to the DNumberWang

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The console variable to change when the slider is changed

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value of the slider

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value of the slider

ARGUMENTS.NAME: decimals
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of decimals to allow in the slider (Optional)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DNumberWang](/gmod/DNumberWang)
The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The label of the DNumSlider

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The console variable to change when the slider is changed

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value of the slider

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value of the slider

ARGUMENTS.NAME: decimals
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of decimals to allow on the slider. (Optional)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DNumSlider](/gmod/DNumSlider)

PanelSelect.DESCRIPTION: Creates a [DPanelSelect](/gmod/DPanelSelect) and docks it to the top of the DForm.
DEPRECATED: This is derived from the deprecated DPanelSelect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created DPanelSelect.

SetName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the title (header) name of the DForm. This is `Label` until set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new header name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The label to be next to the text entry

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The console variable to be changed when the text entry is changed

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry)
The created [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel)

DForm.DESCRIPTION: An easy form with functions to quickly add form elements

Center.DESCRIPTION: Centers the frame relative to the whole screen and invalidates its layout. This overrides [Panel:Center](/gmod/Panel:Center).

Close.DESCRIPTION:
Hides or removes the DFrame, and calls [DFrame:OnClose](/gmod/DFrame:OnClose).

To set whether the frame is hidden or removed, use [DFrame:SetDeleteOnClose](/gmod/DFrame:SetDeleteOnClose).

GetBackgroundBlur.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether the background behind the frame is being blurred.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not background blur is enabled.

GetDeleteOnClose.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether or not the DFrame will be removed when it is closed. This is set with [DFrame:SetDeleteOnClose](/gmod/DFrame:SetDeleteOnClose).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the frame will be removed on close.

GetDraggable.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether or not the frame is draggable by the user.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the frame is draggable or not.

GetIsMenu.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether or not the frame is part of a derma menu. This is set with [DFrame:SetIsMenu](/gmod/DFrame:SetIsMenu).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not this frame is a menu component.

GetMinHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the minimum height the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

You must call [DFrame:SetSizable](/gmod/DFrame:SetSizable) before the user can resize the frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height the user can resize the frame to.

GetMinWidth.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the minimum width the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

You must call [DFrame:SetSizable](/gmod/DFrame:SetSizable) before the user can resize the frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width the user can resize the frame to.

GetPaintShadow.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether or not the shadow effect bordering the DFrame is being drawn.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the shadow is being drawn.

GetScreenLock.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether or not the DFrame is restricted to the boundaries of the screen resolution.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the frame is restricted.

GetSizable.DESCRIPTION:
Gets whether or not the DFrame can be resized by the user.

This is achieved by clicking and dragging in the bottom right corner of the frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the frame can be resized or not.

GetTitle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the title of the frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Title of the frame.

IsActive.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the frame or one of its children has the screen focus.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the frame has focus.

OnClose.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the DFrame is closed with [DFrame:Close](/gmod/DFrame:Close). This applies when the `close` button in the DFrame's control box is clicked.

This is **not** called when the DFrame is removed with [Panel:Remove](/gmod/Panel:Remove).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blur
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to create background blur or not.

SetDeleteOnClose.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether or not the DFrame is removed when it is closed with [DFrame:Close](/gmod/DFrame:Close).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldDelete
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to delete the frame on close. This is `true` by default.

SetDraggable.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the frame should be draggable by the user. The DFrame can only be dragged from its title bar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: draggable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to be draggable or not.

SetIcon.DESCRIPTION: Adds or removes an icon on the left of the [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame)'s title.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Set to nil to remove the icon.

Otherwise, set to file path to create the icon.

SetIsMenu.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether the frame is part of a derma menu or not.

If this is set to `true`, [CloseDermaMenus](/gmod/Global.CloseDermaMenus) will not be called when the frame is clicked, and thus any open menus will remain open.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isMenu
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not this frame is a menu component.

SetMinHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the minimum height the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

This only applies to users attempting to resize the frame; [Panel:SetTall](/gmod/Panel:SetTall) and similar methods will not be affected. You must call [DFrame:SetSizable](/gmod/DFrame:SetSizable) before the user can resize the frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minH
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height the user can resize the frame to.

SetMinWidth.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the minimum width the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

This only applies to users attempting to resize the frame; [Panel:SetWide](/gmod/Panel:SetWide) and similar methods will not be affected. You must call [DFrame:SetSizable](/gmod/DFrame:SetSizable) before the user can resize the frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minW
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width the user can resize the frame to.

SetPaintShadow.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not the shadow effect bordering the DFrame should be drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldPaint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to draw the shadow. This is `true` by default.

SetScreenLock.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the DFrame is restricted to the boundaries of the screen resolution.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lock
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If `true`, the frame cannot be dragged outside of the screen bounds

SetSizable.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether or not the [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame) can be resized by the user.

This is achieved by clicking and dragging in the bottom right corner of the frame.

You can set the minimum size using [DFrame:SetMinWidth](/gmod/DFrame:SetMinWidth) and [DFrame:SetMinHeight](/gmod/DFrame:SetMinHeight).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sizeable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the frame should be resizeable or not.

SetTitle.DESCRIPTION: Sets the title of the frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: title
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New title of the frame.

ShowCloseButton.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether the DFrame's control box (close, minimise and maximise buttons) is displayed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: show
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `false` hides the control box; this is `true` by default.

DFrame.DESCRIPTION: The DFrame is the moma of basically all VGUI elements. 98% of the time you will parent your element to this.

AddItem.DESCRIPTION: Adds a new item to the grid.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: item
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The item to add. It will be forced visible and parented to the [DGrid](/gmod/DGrid).

GetCols.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of columns of this [DGrid](/gmod/DGrid). Set by [DGrid:SetCols](/gmod/DGrid:SetCols).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of columns of this [DGrid](/gmod/DGrid)

GetColWide.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width of each column of the [DGrid](/gmod/DGrid), which is set by [DGrid:SetColWide](/gmod/DGrid:SetColWide).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The width of each column

GetItems.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of panels in the grid.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A list of [Panel](/gmod/Panel)s.

GetRowHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of each row of the [DGrid](/gmod/DGrid), which is set by [DGrid:SetRowHeight](/gmod/DGrid:SetRowHeight).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of each row

ARGUMENTS.NAME: item
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Item to remove from the grid

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bDontDelete
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true, the actual panel will not be removed via [Panel:Remove](/gmod/Panel:Remove).

SetCols.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the number of columns this panel should have.

The [DGrid](/gmod/DGrid) will resize its width to match this value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cols
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The desired number of columns

SetColWide.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the width of each column.

The cell panels (grid items) will not be resized or centered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: colWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of each column.

SetRowHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the height of each row. 

The cell panels (grid items) will not be resized or centered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rowHeight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of each row

SortByMember.DESCRIPTION: Sorts the items in the grid. Does not visually update the grid, use [Panel:InvalidateLayout](/gmod/Panel:InvalidateLayout) for that.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A key in the panel from [DGrid:GetItems](/gmod/DGrid:GetItems). The key's value must be numeric.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: desc
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True for descending order, false for ascending.

DGrid.DESCRIPTION: A really simple grid layout panel.
NOTES: This panel will set its size automatically based on set column count. This makes it play badly with Panel:Dock and cause a PANEL:PerformLayout call every frame.

GetDividerWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width of the horizontal divider bar, set by [DHorizontalDivider:SetDividerWidth](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider:SetDividerWidth).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the horizontal divider bar

GetDragging.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the player is currently dragging the middle divider bar.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the player is currently dragging the middle divider bar.

GetHoldPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the local X coordinate of where the player started dragging the thing

GetLeft.DESCRIPTION: Returns the left side content of the [DHorizontalDivider](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The content on the left side

GetLeftMin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum width of the left side, set by [DHorizontalDivider:SetLeftMin](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider:SetLeftMin).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of the left side

GetLeftWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current width of the left side, set by [DHorizontalDivider:SetLeftWidth](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider:SetLeftWidth) or by the user.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current width of the left side

GetMiddle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the middle content, set by [DHorizontalDivider:SetMiddle](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider:SetMiddle).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The middle content
The right side content

GetRightMin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum width of the right side, set by [DHorizontalDivider:SetRightMin](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider:SetRightMin).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of the right side

SetDividerWidth.DESCRIPTION: Sets the width of the horizontal divider bar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the horizontal divider bar.

SetDragging.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the player is dragging the divider or not

SetHoldPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets the local X coordinate of where the player started dragging the thing

SetLeft.DESCRIPTION: Sets the left side content of the [DHorizontalDivider](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to set as the left side

SetLeftMin.DESCRIPTION: Sets the minimum width of the left side

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of the left side

SetLeftWidth.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the current/starting width of the left side.

The width of the right side is automatically calculated by subtracting this from the total width of the [DHorizontalDivider](/gmod/DHorizontalDivider).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The current/starting width of the left side

SetMiddle.DESCRIPTION: Sets the middle content, over the draggable divider bar panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: middle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The middle content

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The right side content

SetRightMin.DESCRIPTION: Sets the minimum width of the right side

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of the right side

DHorizontalDivider.DESCRIPTION: Creates an invisible vertical divider between two GUI elements.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to add. It will be automatically parented.

GetCanvas.DESCRIPTION: Returns the internal canvas panel where the content of [DHorizontalScroller](/gmod/DHorizontalScroller) are placed on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [DDragBase](/gmod/DDragBase) panel.

MakeDroppable.DESCRIPTION:
Same as [DDragBase:MakeDroppable](/gmod/DDragBase:MakeDroppable).
TODO: Transclude or whatever to here?

OnDragModified.DESCRIPTION: Called when the panel is scrolled.

ScrollToChild.DESCRIPTION: Scrolls the [DHorizontalScroller](/gmod/DHorizontalScroller) to given child panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target child panel. Must be a child of [DHorizontalScroller:GetCanvas](/gmod/DHorizontalScroller:GetCanvas)

SetOverlap.DESCRIPTION: Controls the spacing between elements of the horizontal scroller.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: overlap
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Overlap in pixels. Positive numbers will make elements `overlap` each other, negative will add spacing.

SetScroll.DESCRIPTION: Sets the scroll amount, automatically clamping the value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scroll
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new scroll amount

DHorizontalScroller.DESCRIPTION:
A very basic horizontal scrollable panel, similar to [DScrollPanel](/gmod/DScrollPanel).

Used internally in [DPropertySheet](/gmod/DPropertySheet).

AddFunction.DESCRIPTION: Defines a Javascript function that when called will call a Lua callback.
NOTES: Must be called after the HTML document has fully loaded.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: library
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Library name of the JS function you are defining.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the JS function you are defining.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function called when the JS function is called. Arguments passed to the JS function will be passed here.

Call.DESCRIPTION: Runs/Executes a string as JavaScript code in a panel.
NOTES: This function is an alias of DHTML:QueueJavascript ([source](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/lua/vgui/dhtml.lua#L62)).

This function does **NOT** evaluate expression (i.e. allow you to pass variables from JavaScript (JS) to Lua context).Because a return value is nil/no value (a.k.a. void).If you wish to pass/return values from JS to Lua, you may want to use DHTML:AddFunction function to accomplish that job.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: js
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Specify JavaScript code to be executed.
