ConsoleMessage.DESCRIPTION: Called when the page inside the [DHTML](/gmod/DHTML) window runs `console.log`. This can also be called within the Lua environment to emulate `console.log`. If the contained message begins with `RUNLUA:` the following text will be executed as code within the Lua environment (this is how Lua is called from DHTML windows).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: msg
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The message to be logged (or Lua code to be executed; see above).

GetAllowLua.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the loaded page can run Lua code, set by [DHTML:SetAllowLua](/gmod/DHTML:SetAllowLua)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not Lua code can be called from the loaded page.

OpenURL.DESCRIPTION:
Instructs a HTML control to download and parse a HTML script using the passed URL.

This function can also be used on [HTML](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/HTML).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: URL
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: URL to open

QueueJavascript.DESCRIPTION: Runs/Executes a string as JavaScript code in a panel.
NOTES: If Panel:IsVisible is `false`, PANEL:Think will **NOT** run, meaning the Javascript Queue will not be processed.Consider overriding PANEL:Paint to stop the panel from drawing instead.

This function does **NOT** evaluate expression (i.e. allow you to pass variables from JavaScript (JS) to Lua context).Because a return value is nil/no value (a.k.a. void).If you wish to pass/return values from JS to Lua, you may want to use DHTML:AddFunction function to accomplish that job.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: js
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Specify JavaScript code to be executed.

SetAllowLua.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether the loaded page can run Lua code or not. See [DHTML](/gmod/DHTML) for how to run Lua from a DHTML window.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allow
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to allow Lua.

SetScrollbars.DESCRIPTION: Sets if the loaded window should display scrollbars when the webpage is larger than the viewing window. This is similar to the CSS `overflow` rule.
DEPRECATED: Broken. Use the CSS `overflow` rule instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: show
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True if scrollbars should be visible.

StopLoading.DESCRIPTION: Stops the loading of the HTML panel's current page.

DHTML.DESCRIPTION: The DHTML control wraps the internal Awesomium framework, supports calling Javascript functions from Lua, as well as running Lua from within the HTML. Running Lua code is disabled by default.

SetButtonColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color of the navigation buttons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: clr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [Color](/gmod/Color)

SetHTML.DESCRIPTION: Sets the [DHTML](/gmod/DHTML) element to control with these [DHTMLControls](/gmod/DHTMLControls).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dhtml
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The HTML panel

UpdateHistory.DESCRIPTION: Basically adds an URL to the history.

DHTMLControls.DESCRIPTION: An element providing navigation controls for a [DHTML](/gmod/DHTML) window.

Fill.DESCRIPTION: Automatically called to fill the browser with icons. Will not work if [DIconBrowser:SetManual](/gmod/DIconBrowser:SetManual) is set to true.

FilterByText.DESCRIPTION: A simple unused search feature, hides all icons that do not contain given text in their file path.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to search for

GetManual.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the browser should fill itself with icons.

GetSelectedIcon.DESCRIPTION: Returns the currently selected icon's file path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The currently selected icon's file path.

OnChange.DESCRIPTION: Called when the selected icon was changed. Use [DIconBrowser:GetSelectedIcon](/gmod/DIconBrowser:GetSelectedIcon) to get the selected icon's filepath.

ScrollToSelected.DESCRIPTION: Scrolls the browser to the selected icon

SelectIcon.DESCRIPTION: Selects an icon from file path

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file path of the icon to select. Do not include the "materials/" part.

SetManual.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not the browser should automatically fill itself with icons.

SetSelectedIcon.DESCRIPTION: Set the currently selected file path. Do not use. Use [DIconBrowser:SelectIcon](/gmod/DIconBrowser:SelectIcon) instead.

DIconBrowser.DESCRIPTION: Simply a [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout) which automatically displays all of the [Silkicons](/gmod/silkicons). Used as a way to get the user to select an icon.

Copy.DESCRIPTION: Creates a replica of the DIconLayout it is called on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The replica.

CopyContents.DESCRIPTION: Copies the contents (Child elements) of another [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout) to itself.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: from
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout) to copy from.

GetBorder.DESCRIPTION: Returns the size of the border.

GetLayoutDir.DESCRIPTION: Returns the direction that it will be layed out, using the DOCK enumerations.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Layout direction.

GetSpaceX.DESCRIPTION: Returns the distance between two 'icons' on the X axis.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Distance between two 'icons' on the X axis.

GetSpaceY.DESCRIPTION: Returns distance between two "Icons" on the Y axis.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: distance between two "Icons" on the Y axis.

GetStretchHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the icon layout will stretch its height to fit all the children.

See also [DIconLayout:GetStretchWidth](/gmod/DIconLayout:GetStretchWidth)

GetStretchWidth.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the icon layout will stretch its width to fit all the children.

See also [DIconLayout:GetStretchHeight](/gmod/DIconLayout:GetStretchHeight)

Layout.DESCRIPTION: Resets layout vars before calling [Panel:InvalidateLayout](/gmod/Panel:InvalidateLayout). This is called when children are added or removed, and must be called when the spacing, border or layout direction is changed.

LayoutIcons_LEFT.DESCRIPTION: Used internally to layout the child elements if the [DIconLayout:SetLayoutDir](/gmod/DIconLayout:SetLayoutDir) is set to LEFT (See [DOCK](/gmod/Enums/DOCK)).

LayoutIcons_TOP.DESCRIPTION: Used internally to layout the child elements if the [DIconLayout:SetLayoutDir](/gmod/DIconLayout:SetLayoutDir) is set to TOP (See [DOCK](/gmod/Enums/DOCK)).

OnModified.DESCRIPTION: Called when the panel is modified.

SetBorder.DESCRIPTION: Sets the internal border (padding) within the DIconLayout. This will not change its size, only the positioning of children. You must call [DIconLayout:Layout](/gmod/DIconLayout:Layout) in order for the changes to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The border (padding) inside the DIconLayout.

SetLayoutDir.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the direction that it will be layed out, using the [DOCK](/gmod/Enums/DOCK).

Currently only TOP and LEFT are supported.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: direction
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [DOCK](/gmod/Enums/DOCK)

SetSpaceX.DESCRIPTION: Sets the horizontal (x) spacing between children within the DIconLayout. You must call [DIconLayout:Layout](/gmod/DIconLayout:Layout) in order for the changes to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: xSpacing
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the gap between child objects.

SetSpaceY.DESCRIPTION: Sets the vertical (y) spacing between children within the DIconLayout. You must call [DIconLayout:Layout](/gmod/DIconLayout:Layout) in order for the changes to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ySpacing
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vertical gap between rows in the DIconLayout.

SetStretchHeight.DESCRIPTION:
If set to true, the icon layout will stretch its height to fit all the children.

See also [DIconLayout:SetStretchWidth](/gmod/DIconLayout:SetStretchWidth)

SetStretchWidth.DESCRIPTION:
If set to true, the icon layout will stretch its width to fit all the children.

See also [DIconLayout:SetStretchHeight](/gmod/DIconLayout:SetStretchHeight)

DIconLayout.DESCRIPTION:
DIconLayout is what replaced [DPanelList](/gmod/DPanelList) in Garry's Mod 13. DPanelList still exists in GMod but is deprecated and does not support the new GWEN skin.

[DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout) is used to make a list of panels. Unlike DPanelList, DIconLayout does not automatically add a scroll bar - the example below shows you how you can do this.

DoLoadMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Actually loads the [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial) to render it. Called from [DImage:LoadMaterial](/gmod/DImage:LoadMaterial).

FixVertexLitMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
"Fixes" the current material of the [DImage](/gmod/DImage) if it has VertexLit shader by creating a new one with the same name and a prefix of "_DImage" and automatically calling [DImage:SetMaterial](/gmod/DImage:SetMaterial) with the new material.

This fixes the problem where using materials using shaders that expect lighting information causing "weird" flickering when displayed in 2D/Unlit environment.

GetFailsafeMatName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the texture path set by [DImage:SetFailsafeMatName](/gmod/DImage:SetFailsafeMatName).

GetImage.DESCRIPTION: Returns the image loaded in the image panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the image that is loaded.

GetImageColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color override of the image panel.

RETURNS.NAME: col
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color override of the image. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetKeepAspect.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the [DImage](/gmod/DImage) should keep the aspect ratio of its image when being resized.

See [DImage:SetKeepAspect](/gmod/DImage:SetKeepAspect) for more info on how it works.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the [DImage](/gmod/DImage) should keep the aspect ratio of its image when being resized.

GetMatName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the texture path set by [DImage:SetMatName](/gmod/DImage:SetMatName).

LoadMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Initializes the loading process of the material to render if it is not loaded yet.

You do not need to call this function. It is done for you automatically.

PaintAt.DESCRIPTION: Paints a ghost copy of the DImage panel at the given position and dimensions. This function overrides [Panel:PaintAt](/gmod/Panel:PaintAt).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: posX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate to draw the panel from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: posY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate to draw the panel from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the panel image to be drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the panel image to be drawn.

SetFailsafeMatName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the backup material to be loaded when the image is first rendered. Used by [DImage:SetOnViewMaterial](/gmod/DImage:SetOnViewMaterial).

SetImage.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the image to load into the frame. If the first image can't be loaded and `strBackup` is set, that image will be loaded instead.

This eventually calls [DImage:SetMaterial](/gmod/DImage:SetMaterial).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strImage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path of the image to load. When no file extension is supplied the VMT file extension is used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strBackup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path of the backup image.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: col
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color override of the image. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

SetKeepAspect.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether the [DImage](/gmod/DImage) should keep the aspect ratio of its image when being resized.

Note that this will not try to fit the image inside the button, but instead it will fill the button with the image.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to keep the aspect ratio, false not to

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Sets a [Material](/gmod/Global.Material) directly as an image.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to set

SetMatName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the material to be loaded when the image is first rendered. Used by [DImage:SetOnViewMaterial](/gmod/DImage:SetOnViewMaterial).

SetOnViewMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Similar to [DImage:SetImage](/gmod/DImage:SetImage), but will only do the expensive part of actually loading the textures/material if the material is about to be rendered/viewed.

Useful for cases like [DIconBrowser](/gmod/DIconBrowser), where there are hundreds of small icons in 1 panel in a list that do not need all to be loaded at the same time.

Unloaded.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the image is **not** yet loaded.

DImage.DESCRIPTION:
[DImage](/gmod/DImage) is an advanced, more robust version of the [Material](/gmod/Material) panel.

See [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton) for a click-able version of this panel.

GetImage.DESCRIPTION: Returns the "image" of the [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton). Equivalent of [DImage:GetImage](/gmod/DImage:GetImage).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the image that is loaded.

GetStretchToFit.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the image inside the button should be stretched to fit it or not

See [DImageButton:SetStretchToFit](/gmod/DImageButton:SetStretchToFit)

SetColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color of the image. Equivalent of [DImage:SetImageColor](/gmod/DImage:SetImageColor)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) to set

SetImage.DESCRIPTION: Sets the "image" of the [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton). Equivalent of [DImage:SetImage](/gmod/DImage:SetImage).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strImage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path of the image to load. When no file extension is supplied the VMT file extension is used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strBackup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path of the backup image.

SetImageVisible.DESCRIPTION: Hides or shows the image of the image button. Internally this calls [Panel:SetVisible](/gmod/Panel:SetVisible) on the internal [DImage](/gmod/DImage).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: visible
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Set true to make it visible ( default ), or false to hide the image

SetKeepAspect.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether the [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton) should keep the aspect ratio of its image. Equivalent of [DImage:SetKeepAspect](/gmod/DImage:SetKeepAspect).

Note that this will not try to fit the image inside the button, but instead it will fill the button with the image.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to keep the aspect ratio, false not to

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Sets a [Material](/gmod/Global.Material) directly as an image. Equivalent of [DImage:SetMaterial](/gmod/DImage:SetMaterial).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to set

SetStretchToFit.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether the image inside the [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton) should be stretched to fill the entire size of the button, without preserving aspect ratio.

If set to false, the image will not be resized at all.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stretch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to stretch, false to not to stretch

DImageButton.DESCRIPTION:
An image button.

This panel inherits all methods of [DButton](/gmod/DButton), such as [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the killicon currently being displayed.

SetName.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the killicon to be displayed. You should call [DKillIcon:SizeToContents](/gmod/DKillIcon:SizeToContents) following this.

Killicons can be added with [killicon.Add](/gmod/killicon.Add) and [killicon.AddFont](/gmod/killicon.AddFont).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: iconName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the killicon to be displayed.

DKillIcon.DESCRIPTION: Uses the [killicon](/gmod/killicon) to persistently draw a killicon.

DoClick.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the label is left clicked (on key release) by the player.

This will be called after [DLabel:OnDepressed](/gmod/DLabel:OnDepressed) and [DLabel:OnReleased](/gmod/DLabel:OnReleased).

This can be overridden; by default, it calls [DLabel:Toggle](/gmod/DLabel:Toggle).

See also [DLabel:DoRightClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoRightClick), [DLabel:DoMiddleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoMiddleClick) and [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

DoDoubleClick.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the label is double clicked by the player with left clicks.

[DLabel:SetDoubleClickingEnabled](/gmod/DLabel:SetDoubleClickingEnabled) must be set to true for this hook to work, which it is by default.

This will be called after [DLabel:OnDepressed](/gmod/DLabel:OnDepressed) and [DLabel:OnReleased](/gmod/DLabel:OnReleased) and [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick).

See also [DLabel:DoRightClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoRightClick) and [DLabel:DoMiddleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoMiddleClick).

DoMiddleClick.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the label is middle mouse (Mouse wheel, also known as mouse 3) clicked (on key release) by the player.

This will be called after [DLabel:OnDepressed](/gmod/DLabel:OnDepressed) and [DLabel:OnReleased](/gmod/DLabel:OnReleased).

See also [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick), [DLabel:DoRightClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoRightClick) and [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

DoRightClick.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the label is right clicked (on key release) by the player.

This will be called after [DLabel:OnDepressed](/gmod/DLabel:OnDepressed) and [DLabel:OnReleased](/gmod/DLabel:OnReleased).

See also [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick), [DLabel:DoMiddleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoMiddleClick) and [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

OnDepressed.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the player presses the label with any mouse button.

This works as an alternative to [PANEL:OnMousePressed](/gmod/PANEL:OnMousePressed) as that hook is used heavily by [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) and overriding it will break functionality.

See also [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick), [DLabel:DoMiddleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoMiddleClick), [DLabel:DoRightClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoRightClick), [DLabel:OnReleased](/gmod/DLabel:OnReleased) and [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

OnReleased.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the player releases any mouse button on the label. This is always called after [DLabel:OnDepressed](/gmod/DLabel:OnDepressed).

This works as an alternative to [PANEL:OnMouseReleased](/gmod/PANEL:OnMouseReleased) as that hook is used heavily by [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) and overriding it will break functionality.

See also [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick), [DLabel:DoMiddleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoMiddleClick), [DLabel:DoRightClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoRightClick) and [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

OnToggled.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the toggle state of the label is changed by [DLabel:Toggle](/gmod/DLabel:Toggle).

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call [DLabel:SetIsToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetIsToggle) with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: toggleState
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new toggle state.

DoClickInternal.DESCRIPTION:
Called just before [DLabel:DoClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoClick).

In [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) does nothing and is safe to override. Used by [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) and [DCollapsibleCategory](/gmod/DCollapsibleCategory)'s tabs.

DoDoubleClickInternal.DESCRIPTION: Called just before [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick). In [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) does nothing and is safe to override.

GetAutoStretchVertical.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the label stretches vertically or not.

Set by [DLabel:SetAutoStretchVertical](/gmod/DLabel:SetAutoStretchVertical).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the label stretches vertically or not.

GetBright.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) should set its text color to the current skin's bright text color.

See [DLabel:SetBright](/gmod/DLabel:SetBright).

GetColor.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the actual color of the text.

See also [DLabel:GetTextColor](/gmod/DLabel:GetTextColor) and [DLabel:GetTextStyleColor](/gmod/DLabel:GetTextStyleColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The the actual color of the text.

GetDark.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) should set its text color to the current skin's dark text color.

See [DLabel:SetDark](/gmod/DLabel:SetDark).

GetDisabled.DESCRIPTION: Gets the disabled state of the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel). This is set with [DLabel:SetDisabled](/gmod/DLabel:SetDisabled).
DEPRECATED: Use Panel:IsEnabled instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The disabled state of the label.

GetDoubleClickingEnabled.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether or not double clicking will call [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

See [DLabel:SetDoubleClickingEnabled](/gmod/DLabel:SetDoubleClickingEnabled).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true = enabled, false means disabled

GetFont.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current font of the DLabel. This is set with [DLabel:SetFont](/gmod/DLabel:SetFont).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the font in use.

GetHighlight.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) should set its text color to the current skin's highlighted text color.

See [DLabel:SetHighlight](/gmod/DLabel:SetHighlight).

GetIsToggle.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the toggle functionality is enabled for a label. Set with [DLabel:SetIsToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetIsToggle).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not toggle functionality is enabled.

GetTextColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the "override" text color, set by [DLabel:SetTextColor](/gmod/DLabel:SetTextColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the text, or nil.

GetTextStyleColor.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the "internal" or fallback color of the text.

See also [DLabel:GetTextColor](/gmod/DLabel:GetTextColor) and [DLabel:SetTextStyleColor](/gmod/DLabel:SetTextStyleColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The "internal" color of the text

GetToggle.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the current toggle state of the label. This can be set with [DLabel:SetToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetToggle) and toggled with [DLabel:Toggle](/gmod/DLabel:Toggle).

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call [DLabel:SetIsToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetIsToggle) with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current toggle state.

SetAutoStretchVertical.DESCRIPTION: Automatically adjusts the height of the label dependent of the height of the text inside of it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stretch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whenever to stretch the label vertically or not.

SetBright.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the color of the text to the bright text color defined in the skin.

See also [DLabel:SetDark](/gmod/DLabel:SetDark) and [DLabel:SetHighlight](/gmod/DLabel:SetHighlight).

You should only consider using this if you are using background elements that are not manually painted and are using the skin colors.
DEPRECATED: You really should use DLabel:SetTextColor.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bright
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whenever to set the text to bright or not.

SetColor.DESCRIPTION: Changes color of label. Alias of [DLabel:SetTextColor](/gmod/DLabel:SetTextColor).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color to set. Uses the Color structure.

SetDark.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the color of the text to the dark text color defined in the skin.

See also [DLabel:SetBright](/gmod/DLabel:SetBright) and [DLabel:SetHighlight](/gmod/DLabel:SetHighlight).

You should only consider using this if you are using background elements that are not manually painted and are using the skin colors.
DEPRECATED: You really should use DLabel:SetTextColor.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dark
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whenever to set the text to dark or not.

SetDisabled.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the disabled state of the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel).

When disabled, the label does not respond to click, toggle or drag & drop actions.
DEPRECATED: Use Panel:SetEnabled instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: disable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: `true` to disable the DLabel, `false` to enable it.

SetDoubleClickingEnabled.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether or not double clicking should call [DLabel:DoDoubleClick](/gmod/DLabel:DoDoubleClick).

This is enabled by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to enable, false to disable

SetFont.DESCRIPTION: Sets the font of the label.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fontName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the font.

See [here](/gmod/Default_Fonts) for a list of existing fonts.
Alternatively, use [surface.CreateFont](/gmod/surface.CreateFont) to create your own custom font.

SetHighlight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the color of the text to the highlight text color defined in the skin.

For the default Derma skin this makes the label red.

See also [DLabel:SetBright](/gmod/DLabel:SetBright) and [DLabel:SetDark](/gmod/DLabel:SetDark).

You should only consider using this if you are using background elements that are not manually painted and are using the skin colors.
DEPRECATED: You really should use DLabel:SetTextColor.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: highlight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to set the label's color to skins's text highlight color, false otherwise.

SetIsToggle.DESCRIPTION:
Enables or disables toggle functionality for a label. Retrieved with [DLabel:GetIsToggle](/gmod/DLabel:GetIsToggle).

You must call this before using [DLabel:SetToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetToggle), [DLabel:GetToggle](/gmod/DLabel:GetToggle) or [DLabel:Toggle](/gmod/DLabel:Toggle).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allowToggle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to enable toggle functionality.

SetTextColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the text color of the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel). This will take precedence over [DLabel:SetTextStyleColor](/gmod/DLabel:SetTextStyleColor).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text color. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

SetTextStyleColor.DESCRIPTION: Used by [DLabel:SetDark](/gmod/DLabel:SetDark), [DLabel:SetBright](/gmod/DLabel:SetBright) and [DLabel:SetHighlight](/gmod/DLabel:SetHighlight) to set the text color without affecting [DLabel:SetTextColor](/gmod/DLabel:SetTextColor) calls.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text color. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

SetToggle.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the toggle state of the label. This can be retrieved with [DLabel:GetToggle](/gmod/DLabel:GetToggle) and toggled with [DLabel:Toggle](/gmod/DLabel:Toggle).

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call [DLabel:SetIsToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetIsToggle) with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: toggleState
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The toggle state to be set.

Toggle.DESCRIPTION:
Toggles the label's state. This can be set and retrieved with [DLabel:SetToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetToggle) and [DLabel:GetToggle](/gmod/DLabel:GetToggle).

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call [DLabel:SetIsToggle](/gmod/DLabel:SetIsToggle) with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

UpdateColours.DESCRIPTION: A hook called from within [PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings](/gmod/PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings) to determine the color of the text on display.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: skin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table supposed to contain the color values listed above.

UpdateFGColor.DESCRIPTION: Called internally to update the color of the text.

DLabel.DESCRIPTION: A standard Derma text label. A lot of this panels functionality is a base for button elements, such as [DButton](/gmod/DButton)

GetAutoStretch.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the editable label will stretch to the text entered or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the editable label will stretch to the text entered or not.

OnLabelTextChanged.DESCRIPTION:
A hook called when the player presses Enter (i.e. the finished editing the label) and the text has changed.

Allows you to override/modify the text that will be set to display.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: txt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The original user input text

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If provided, will override the text that will be applied to the label itself.

SetAutoStretch.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the editable label should stretch to the text entered or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stretch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the editable label should stretch to the text entered or not.

DLabelEditable.DESCRIPTION:
An editable [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel), double click on it to edit.

This is used in the spawnmenu spawnlist headers.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Gets the current text color of the [DLabelURL](/gmod/DLabelURL). Alias as [DLabelURL:GetTextColor](/gmod/DLabelURL:GetTextColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current text [Color](/gmod/Global.Color).

GetTextColor.DESCRIPTION: Gets the current text color of the [DLabelURL](/gmod/DLabelURL) set by [DLabelURL:SetTextColor](/gmod/DLabelURL:SetTextColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current text [Color](/gmod/Global.Color).
The [Color](/gmod/Color)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: col
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) to use.

SetTextColor.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the text color of the [DLabelURL](/gmod/DLabelURL). Overrides [DLabelURL:SetTextStyleColor](/gmod/DLabelURL:SetTextStyleColor).

This should only be used immediately after it is created, and otherwise [Panel:SetFGColor](/gmod/Panel:SetFGColor).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: col
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) to use.

SetTextStyleColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the base text color of the [DLabelURL](/gmod/DLabelURL). This is overridden by [DLabelURL:SetTextColor](/gmod/DLabelURL:SetTextColor).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) to set

DLabelURL.DESCRIPTION:
Underlined link label without a DoClick function. When a valid URL is set and the label is clicked, it will open a browser window and navigate to the address.

This panel uses [gui.OpenURL](/gmod/gui.OpenURL) internally and its restrictions apply.

DoDoubleClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when a line in the DListView is double clicked.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lineID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The line number of the double clicked line.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: line
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The double clicked [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line).

OnRowSelected.DESCRIPTION: Called internally by [DListView:OnClickLine](/gmod/DListView:OnClickLine) when a line is selected. This is the function you should override to define the behavior when a line is selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rowIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the row/line that the user clicked on.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: row
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) that the user clicked on.

AddColumn.DESCRIPTION: Adds a column to the listview.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the column to add.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sets the ordering of this column compared to other columns.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created [DListView_Column](/gmod/DListView_Column).

AddLine.DESCRIPTION: Adds a line to the list view.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Values for a new row in the DListView, If several arguments are supplied, each argument will correspond to a respective column in the DListView.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line).

Clear.DESCRIPTION: Removes all lines that have been added to the DListView.

ClearSelection.DESCRIPTION: Clears the current selection in the DListView.

ColumnWidth.DESCRIPTION: Gets the width of a column.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The column to get the width of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the column.

DataLayout.DESCRIPTION: Creates the lines and gets the height of the contents, in a DListView.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the contents

FixColumnsLayout.DESCRIPTION: Internal helper function called from the [PANEL:PerformLayout](/gmod/PANEL:PerformLayout) of [DListView](/gmod/DListView).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The canvas.

GetDataHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the height of the data of the [DListView](/gmod/DListView).

See also [DListView:SetDataHeight](/gmod/DListView:SetDataHeight).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the data of the [DListView](/gmod/DListView).

GetHeaderHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the height of the header of the [DListView](/gmod/DListView).

See also [DListView:SetHeaderHeight](/gmod/DListView:SetHeaderHeight).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the header of the [DListView](/gmod/DListView).

GetHideHeaders.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the header line should be visible on not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the header line should be visible on not.

GetInnerTall.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the height of [DListView:GetCanvas](/gmod/DListView:GetCanvas).

Intended to represent the height of all data lines.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of [DListView:GetCanvas](/gmod/DListView:GetCanvas).

GetLine.DESCRIPTION: Gets the [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) at the given index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the line to get.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) at the given index.

GetLines.DESCRIPTION: Gets all of the lines added to the DListView.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The lines added to the DListView.

GetMultiSelect.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether multiple lines can be selected or not.

See [DListView:SetMultiSelect](/gmod/DListView:SetMultiSelect).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether multiple lines can be selected or not.

GetSelected.DESCRIPTION: Gets all of the lines that are currently selected.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line)s.

GetSelectedLine.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the currently selected [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) index.

If [DListView:SetMultiSelect](/gmod/DListView:SetMultiSelect) is set to true, only the first line of all selected lines will be returned. Use [DListView:GetSelected](/gmod/DListView:GetSelected) instead to get all of the selected lines.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the currently selected line.
The currently selected [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line).

GetSortable.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether sorting of columns by clicking their headers is allowed or not.

See also [DListView:SetSortable](/gmod/DListView:SetSortable).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether sorting of columns by clicking their headers is allowed or not

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lineId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [DListView_Line:GetID](/gmod/DListView_Line:GetID) of a line to look up

OnClickLine.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever a line is clicked.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: line
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The selected line.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isSelected
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Boolean indicating whether the line is selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The column which initialized the resize

OnRowRightClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when a row is right-clicked

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lineID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The line ID of the right clicked line

ARGUMENTS.NAME: line
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The line panel itself, a [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line).

RemoveLine.DESCRIPTION: Removes a line from the list view.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: line
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Removes the given row, by row id (same number as [DListView:GetLine](/gmod/DListView:GetLine)).

SelectFirstItem.DESCRIPTION: Selects the line at the first index of the DListView if one has been added.

SelectItem.DESCRIPTION: Selects a line in the listview.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Line
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The line to select.

SetDataHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the height of all lines of the [DListView](/gmod/DListView) except for the header line.

See also [DListView:SetHeaderHeight](/gmod/DListView:SetHeaderHeight).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new height to set. Default value is 17.

SetDirty.DESCRIPTION: Used internally to signify if the [DListView](/gmod/DListView) needs a rebuild.

SetHeaderHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the height of the header line of the [DListView](/gmod/DListView).

See also [DListView:SetDataHeight](/gmod/DListView:SetDataHeight).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new height to set. Default value is 16.

SetHideHeaders.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the header line should be visible on not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hide
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the header line should be visible on not.

SetMultiSelect.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether multiple lines can be selected by the user by using the  or  keys. When set to false, only one line can be selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allowMultiSelect
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether multiple lines can be selected or not

SetSortable.DESCRIPTION: Enables/disables the sorting of columns by clicking.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isSortable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether sorting columns with clicking is allowed or not.

SortByColumn.DESCRIPTION: Sorts the items in the specified column.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: columnIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the column that should be sorted.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the items should be sorted in descending order or not.

SortByColumns.DESCRIPTION:
Sorts the list based on given columns.

All arguments are optional

DListView.DESCRIPTION: A data view with rows and columns.

GetColumnText.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the string held in the specified column of a [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) panel.

This is the same thing as doing [DListView_Line:GetValue](/gmod/DListView_Line:GetValue)( column_number ).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the column to retrieve the text from, starts with 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The contents of the specified column.

SetColumnText.DESCRIPTION: Sets the string held in the specified column of a [DListView_Line](/gmod/DListView_Line) panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the column to write the text from, starts with 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Column text you want to set

RETURNS.NAME: label
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The DLabel in which the text was set.

AddCVar.DESCRIPTION: Creates a [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar) and adds it as an option into the menu. Checking and unchecking the option will alter the given console variable's value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text of the button

ARGUMENTS.NAME: convar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The console variable to change

ARGUMENTS.NAME: on
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the console variable to set when the option is checked

ARGUMENTS.NAME: off
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the console variable to set when the option is unchecked

ARGUMENTS.NAME: funcFunction
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
If set, the function will be called every time the option is pressed/clicked/selected.

It will have only one argument:

[Panel](/gmod/Panel) pnl - The created [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar)

AddOption.DESCRIPTION: Add an option to the DMenu

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the option.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to execute when this option is clicked.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns the created [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) panel.

AddPanel.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a panel to the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) as if it were an option.

This invokes [DScrollPanel:AddItem](/gmod/DScrollPanel:AddItem) and will not create a new panel if a class name is passed, unlike [Panel:Add](/gmod/Panel:Add).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that you want to add.

AddSubMenu.DESCRIPTION: Add a sub menu to the DMenu

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the sub menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to execute when this sub menu is clicked.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created sub [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu)
The created [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption)

ChildCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of child elements of [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu)'s [DScrollPanel:GetCanvas](/gmod/DScrollPanel:GetCanvas).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of child elements

ClearHighlights.DESCRIPTION:
Clears all highlights made by [DMenu:HighlightItem](/gmod/DMenu:HighlightItem).

Doesn't appear to be used or do anything.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: menu
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The menu to close

GetChild.DESCRIPTION: Gets a child by its index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: childIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the child to get.
NOTES: Unlike Panel:GetChild, this index starts at 1.

GetDrawColumn.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) should draw the icon column with a different color or not.

See [DMenu:SetDrawColumn](/gmod/DMenu:SetDrawColumn)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to draw the column or not

GetMaxHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum height of the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height in pixels

GetMinimumWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum width of the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) in pixels

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: the minimum width of the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu)

GetOpenSubMenu.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the currently opened submenu.

Used internally to store the open submenu by [DMenu:Hide](/gmod/DMenu:Hide), [DMenu:OpenSubMenu](/gmod/DMenu:OpenSubMenu).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The currently opened submenu, if any.

Hide.DESCRIPTION: Used to safely hide (not remove) the menu. This will also hide any opened submenues recursively.

HighlightItem.DESCRIPTION:
Highlights selected item in the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) by setting the item's key "Highlight" to true.

Doesn't appear to be working or used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: item
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The item to highlight.

Open.DESCRIPTION: Opens the DMenu at the current mouse position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position (X coordinate) to open the menu at.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position (Y coordinate) to open the menu at.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: skipanimation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This argument does nothing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ownerpanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If `x` and `y` are not set manually, setting this argument will offset the `y` position of the opened menu by the height of given panel.

OpenSubMenu.DESCRIPTION: Closes any active sub menus, and opens a new one.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: item
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) to open the submenu at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: menu
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The submenu to open. If set to nil, the function just closes existing submenus.

OptionSelected.DESCRIPTION: Called when a option has been selected

ARGUMENTS.NAME: option
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) that was selected

ARGUMENTS.NAME: optionText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The options text

ARGUMENTS.NAME: option
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) that called this function

SetDeleteSelf.DESCRIPTION:
Set to true by default. IF set to true, the menu will be deleted when it is closed, not simply hidden.

This is used by [DMenuBar](/gmod/DMenuBar)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newState
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to delete menu on close, false to simply hide.

SetDrawColumn.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) should draw the icon column with a different color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: draw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to draw the column or not

SetMaxHeight.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum height the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) can have. If the height of all menu items exceed this value, a scroll bar will be automatically added.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxHeight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height of the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) to set, in pixels

SetMinimumWidth.DESCRIPTION: Sets the minimum width of the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu). The menu will be stretched to match the given value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) in pixels

SetOpenSubMenu.DESCRIPTION: Used internally to store the open submenu by [DMenu:Hide](/gmod/DMenu:Hide), [DMenu:OpenSubMenu](/gmod/DMenu:OpenSubMenu), [DMenu:CloseSubMenu](/gmod/DMenu:CloseSubMenu)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: item
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The menu to store

DMenu.DESCRIPTION: A simple menu with sub menu, icon and convar support.

AddMenu.DESCRIPTION:
Creates a new [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) object tied to a [DButton](/gmod/DButton) with the given label on the menu bar.

This will create a new menu regardless of whether or not one with the same label exists. To add **or** get a menu, use [DMenuBar:AddOrGetMenu](/gmod/DMenuBar:AddOrGetMenu).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name (label) of the derma menu to create.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) which will be opened when the button is clicked.

AddOrGetMenu.DESCRIPTION:
Retrieves a [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) object from the menu bar. If one with the given label doesn't exist, a new one is created.

To add a DMenu without checking, use [DMenuBar:AddMenu](/gmod/DMenuBar:AddMenu).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: label
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name (label) of the derma menu to get or create.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) with the given label.
The background's color. See [Color](/gmod/Color)

GetDisabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the DMenuBar is disabled

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is disabled

GetDrawBackground.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as [DMenuBar:GetPaintBackground](/gmod/DMenuBar:GetPaintBackground)
DEPRECATED: Use DMenuBar:GetPaintBackground instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should the background be painted

GetIsMenu.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the panel is a menu. Used for closing menus when another panel is selected.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is a menu

GetOpenMenu.DESCRIPTION: If a menu is visible/opened, then the menu is returned.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns the visible/open menu or nil.

GetPaintBackground.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as [DMenuBar:GetDrawBackground](/gmod/DMenuBar:GetDrawBackground)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should the background be painted

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: See [Color](/gmod/Color)

SetDisabled.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not the panel is disabled

ARGUMENTS.NAME: disable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should be disabled or not

SetDrawBackground.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as [DMenuBar:SetPaintBackground](/gmod/DMenuBar:SetPaintBackground)
DEPRECATED: Use DMenuBar:SetPaintBackground

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldPaint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should the background be painted

SetIsMenu.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not the panel is a menu. Used for closing menus when another panel is selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isMenu
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Is this a menu

SetPaintBackground.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as [DMenuBar:SetDrawBackground](/gmod/DMenuBar:SetDrawBackground)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldPaint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should the background be painted

AddSubMenu.DESCRIPTION: Creates a sub [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) and returns it. Has no duplicate call protection.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) to add options to.
Are we checked or not

GetIsCheckable.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) is a checkbox option or a normal button option.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu)

OnChecked.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption)'s checked state changes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: checked
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new checked state

SetChecked.DESCRIPTION: Sets the checked state of the [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption). Does not invoke [DMenuOption:OnChecked](/gmod/DMenuOption:OnChecked).

SetIsCheckable.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) is a checkbox option or a normal button option.

SetSubMenu.DESCRIPTION: Used internally by [DMenuOption:AddSubMenu](/gmod/DMenuOption:AddSubMenu) to create the submenu arrow and assign the created submenu to be opened this this option is hovered.

ToggleCheck.DESCRIPTION: Toggles the checked state of [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption). Does not respect [DMenuOption:GetIsCheckable](/gmod/DMenuOption:GetIsCheckable).

DMenuOption.DESCRIPTION: Internal subpanel that represents an option used by [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu).

GetConVar.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) used by the [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) used

GetValueOff.DESCRIPTION: Returns the value of the [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) when the [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar) is not checked.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value

GetValueOn.DESCRIPTION: Return the value of the [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) when the [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar) is checked.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value

SetConVar.DESCRIPTION: Sets the [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) to be used by [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cvar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) name to set

SetValueOff.DESCRIPTION: Sets the value of the [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) when the [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar) is not checked.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value

SetValueOn.DESCRIPTION: Sets the value of the [console variable](/gmod/ConVars) when the [DMenuOptionCVar](/gmod/DMenuOptionCVar) is checked.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value

DMenuOptionCVar.DESCRIPTION:
An internal panel used by [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu). It acts as a menu option that can be checked. It automatically sets and reads the given console variable.

It can be right clicked to toggle without closing the [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu).

Use [DMenu:AddCVar](/gmod/DMenu:AddCVar) instead.

DrawModel.DESCRIPTION: Used by the DModelPanel's paint hook to draw the model and background.

GetAmbientLight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the ambient lighting used on the rendered entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the ambient lighting.

GetAnimated.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the panel entity should be animated when the default [DModelPanel:LayoutEntity](/gmod/DModelPanel:LayoutEntity) function is called.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the panel entity can be animated with [Entity:SetSequence](/gmod/Entity:SetSequence) directly, false otherwise.

GetAnimSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns the animation speed of the panel entity, see [DModelPanel:SetAnimSpeed](/gmod/DModelPanel:SetAnimSpeed).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The animation speed.

GetCamPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of the model viewing camera.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the camera.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color of the rendered entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the entity, see [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity being rendered by the model panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The rendered entity (client-side)

GetFOV.DESCRIPTION: Returns the FOV (field of view) the camera is using.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The FOV of the camera.

GetLookAng.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angles of the model viewing camera. Is **nil** until changed with [DModelPanel:SetLookAng](/gmod/DModelPanel:SetLookAng).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the camera.

GetLookAt.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position the viewing camera is pointing toward.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position the camera is pointing toward.

GetModel.DESCRIPTION: Gets the model of the rendered entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The model of the rendered entity.

LayoutEntity.DESCRIPTION:
By default, this function slowly rotates and animates the entity being rendered.

If you want to change this behavior, you should override it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that is being rendered.

PostDrawModel.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the entity of the [DModelPanel](/gmod/DModelPanel) was drawn.

This is a rendering hook with 3d drawing context.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The clientside entity of the [DModelPanel](/gmod/DModelPanel) that has been drawn.

PreDrawModel.DESCRIPTION: Called **before** the entity of the [DModelPanel](/gmod/DModelPanel) is drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The clientside entity of the [DModelPanel](/gmod/DModelPanel) that has been drawn.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return false to stop the entity from being drawn. This will also cause [DModelPanel:PostDrawModel](/gmod/DModelPanel:PostDrawModel) to stop being called.

RunAnimation.DESCRIPTION: This function is used in the **DModelPanel:LayoutEntity**. It will set the active model to the last set animation using [Entity:SetSequence](/gmod/Entity:SetSequence). By default, it is the walking animation.

SetAmbientLight.DESCRIPTION: Sets the ambient lighting used on the rendered entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the ambient lighting.

SetAnimated.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not to animate the entity when the default [DModelPanel:LayoutEntity](/gmod/DModelPanel:LayoutEntity) is called.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: animated
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to animate, false otherwise.

SetAnimSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Sets the speed used by [DModelPanel:RunAnimation](/gmod/DModelPanel:RunAnimation) to advance frame on an entity sequence.
NOTES: Entity:FrameAdvance doesn't seem to have any functioning arguments and therefore changing this will not have any affect on the panel entity's sequence speed without reimplementation. It only affects the value returned by DModelPanel:GetAnimSpeed

ARGUMENTS.NAME: animSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The animation speed.

SetCamPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets the position of the camera.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to set the camera at.

SetColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color of the rendered entity.
NOTES: This does not work on Garry's Mod player models since they use a different color system. To modify a player model color, see Example 2 on the DModelPanel page

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The render color of the entity.

SetDirectionalLight.DESCRIPTION: Sets the directional lighting used on the rendered entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: direction
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The light direction, see [BOX](/gmod/Enums/BOX).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the directional lighting.

SetEntity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the entity to be rendered by the model panel.
NOTES: If you set `ent` to a shared entity you must set `ent` to nil before removing this panel or else a "Trying to remove server entity on client!" error is thrown

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new panel entity.

SetFOV.DESCRIPTION: Sets the panel camera's FOV (field of view).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The field of view value.

SetLookAng.DESCRIPTION: Sets the angles of the camera.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angles to set the camera to.

SetLookAt.DESCRIPTION: Makes the panel's camera face the given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to orient the camera toward.

SetModel.DESCRIPTION: Sets the model of the rendered entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model to apply to the entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the scene file. (.vcd)

DModelPanel.DESCRIPTION: DModelPanel is a VGUI element that projects a 3D model onto a 2D plane.

SetHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the height of the panel **in the amount of 64px spawnicons**.

Overrides [Panel:SetHeight](/gmod/Panel:SetHeight).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: num
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Basically how many rows of 64x64 px spawnicons should fit in this DModelSelect

SetModelList.DESCRIPTION: Called to set the list of models within the panel element.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: models
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Each key is a model path, the value is a kay-value table where they key is a convar name and value is the value to set to that convar.

DEPRECATED: This is derived from the deprecated DPanelList.

AddItem.DESCRIPTION: Adds a panel to the notification

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, overrides [DNotify:SetLife](/gmod/DNotify:SetLife).

GetAlignment.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current alignment of this notification panel. Set by [DNotify:SetAlignment](/gmod/DNotify:SetAlignment).

GetItems.DESCRIPTION: Returns all the items added with [DNotify:AddItem](/gmod/DNotify:AddItem).

GetLife.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the display time in seconds of the DNotify. This is set with 
[DNotify:SetLife](/gmod/DNotify:SetLife).

GetSpacing.DESCRIPTION: Returns the spacing between items set by [DNotify:SetSpacing](/gmod/DNotify:SetSpacing).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alignment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: It's the Numpad alignment, 6 is right, 9 is top left, etc.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time in seconds.

SetSpacing.DESCRIPTION: Sets the spacing between child elements of the notification panel.

DNotify.DESCRIPTION: A panel that fades its contents in and out once, like a notification.

Returns the value of the [DNumberScratch](/gmod/DNumberScratch) as a fraction, a value between 0 and 1 where 0 is the minimum and 1 is the maximum value of the [DNumberScratch](/gmod/DNumberScratch).

DNumberWang.DESCRIPTION: DNumberWang is a VGUI element that allows you to input a numeric value using up and down arrows or direct entry.

GetDecimals.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of numbers after the decimal point.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: 0 for whole numbers only, 1 for one number after the decimal point, etc.

The value of the slider.

OnValueChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called when the value of the slider is changed, through code or changing the slider.

ResetToDefaultValue.DESCRIPTION:
Resets the slider to the default value, if one was set by [DNumSlider:SetDefaultValue](/gmod/DNumSlider:SetDefaultValue).

This function is called by the [DNumSlider](/gmod/DNumSlider) when user middle mouse clicks on the draggable knob of the slider.

SetConVar.DESCRIPTION: Sets the console variable to be updated when the value of the slider is changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cvar

SetDark.DESCRIPTION: Calls [DLabel:SetDark](/gmod/DLabel:SetDark) on the [DLabel](/gmod/DLabel) part of the [DNumSlider](/gmod/DNumSlider).

NOTES: This doesn't affect values passed to DNumSlider:OnValueChanged.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value of the slider.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: val
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The second passed argument.

ValueChanged.DESCRIPTION:
Called when the value has been changed. This will also be called when the user manually changes the value through the text panel.

This is an internal function. Override [DNumSlider:OnValueChanged](/gmod/DNumSlider:OnValueChanged) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value

DNumSlider.DESCRIPTION: The DNumSlider allows you to create a slider, allowing the user to slide it to set a value, or changing the value in the box.

NOTES: By default this returns **nil** even though the default background color is white

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Color of the panel's background.

GetDisabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the panel is disabled.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the panel is disabled (mouse input disabled and background alpha set to 75), false if its enabled (mouse input enabled and background alpha set to 255).

DEPRECATED: You should use DPanel:GetPaintBackground instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the panel background is drawn, false otherwise.

GetPaintBackground.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the panel background is being drawn.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the panel background is drawn, false otherwise.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The background color.

SetDisabled.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not to disable the panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: disabled
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to disable the panel (mouse input disabled and background alpha set to 75), false to enable it (mouse input enabled and background alpha set to 255).

SetDrawBackground.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not to draw the panel background. Alias of [DPanel:SetPaintBackground](/gmod/DPanel:SetPaintBackground).
DEPRECATED: You should use DPanel:SetPaintBackground instead.

SetPaintBackground.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether or not to paint/draw the panel background.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to show the panel's background, false to hide it.

DPanel.DESCRIPTION: A simple rectangular box, commonly used for parenting other elements to. Pretty much all elements are based on this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: state

DPanelList.DESCRIPTION:
Displays elements in a horizontal or vertical list. A scrollbar is automatically shown if necessary.

	

[DPanelList](/gmod/DPanelList) was succeeded in version 13 by more specialised layout elements.
DEPRECATED: Use a combination of DIconLayout, DListLayout and DScrollPanel instead.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the border color of the [DPanelOverlay](/gmod/DPanelOverlay) set by [DPanelOverlay:SetColor](/gmod/DPanelOverlay:SetColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The set color. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the type of the [DPanelOverlay](/gmod/DPanelOverlay) set by [DPanelOverlay:SetType](/gmod/DPanelOverlay:SetType).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The set type.

PaintDifferentColours.DESCRIPTION: Used internally by the panel for type 3.

PaintInnerCorners.DESCRIPTION: Used internally by the panel for types 1 and 2.

SetColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the border color of the [DPanelOverlay](/gmod/DPanelOverlay).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color to set. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The type to set.

Possible value are:
* 1 - 8px corners of given color
* 2 - 4px corners of given type
* 3 - 2 top? corners of hardcoded color, 2 other corners of given color

GetFraction.DESCRIPTION: Returns the progress bar's fraction. 0 is 0% and 1 is 100%.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fraction of the progress bar. Range is 0 to 1 (0% to 100%).

DProgress.DESCRIPTION: A progressbar, works with a fraction between 0 and 1 where 0 is 0% and 1 is 100%.

DProperties.DESCRIPTION:
A grid for editing the properties of something using names and values. Properties can be categorized and strongly typed.

![](http://wiki.garrysmod.com/images/9/99/DProperties.png)

##  Associated controls 

* [DProperty_VectorColor](/gmod/DProperty_VectorColor)

* [DProperty_Boolean](/gmod/DProperty_Boolean)

* [DProperty_Generic](/gmod/DProperty_Generic)

* [DProperty_Combo](/gmod/DProperty_Combo)

* [DProperty_Float](/gmod/DProperty_Float)

* [DProperty_Int](/gmod/DProperty_Int)

AddChoice.DESCRIPTION: Add a choice to your combo control.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Shown text.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Stored Data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: select
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Select this element?

DataChanged.DESCRIPTION: Called after the user selects a new value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new data that was selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Id of the choice to be selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: prop
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of DProperty sub control to add.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Data to use to set up the combo box control.

Structure:

* [string](/gmod/string) text - The default label for this combo box

* [table](/gmod/table) values - The values to add to the combo box

Setup.DESCRIPTION: Called by a property row to setup a color selection control.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: settings
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of settings. None of the values are used for this property. See [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities).

SetValue.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color value of the property.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color to use in a [DProperty_VectorColor](/gmod/DProperty_VectorColor).

DProperty_VectorColor.DESCRIPTION:
Color picker control for a DProperties panel. Opens a [DColorCombo](/gmod/DColorCombo) if the color preview is clicked.

See [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities) for how this is used ingame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the tab

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to be used as contents of the tab. This normally should be a [DPanel](/gmod/DPanel)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Icon for the tab. This will ideally be a [silkicon](/gmod/Silkicons), but any material name can be used.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should [DPropertySheet](/gmod/DPropertySheet) try to fill itself with given panel vertically.

A table containing the following keys:
* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) Tab - The created [DTab.](/gmod/DTab.)
* [string](/gmod/string) Name - Name of the created tab
* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) Panel - The contents panel of the tab

ARGUMENTS.NAME: removePanel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Set to true to remove the associated panel object as well.

Each table contains 3 key-value pairs:

* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) Tab - The [DTab](/gmod/DTab) associated with the tab.

* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) Panel - The [Panel](/gmod/Panel) associated with the tab.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color

DRGBPicker.DESCRIPTION:
DRGBPicker is an interactive panel which can be used to select a color hue.

See [DColorCube](/gmod/DColorCube) for a color picker which controls brightness and saturation.

See [DColorMixer](/gmod/DColorMixer) for a color picker that allows control over hue, saturation, and brightness at once.

AddItem.DESCRIPTION: Parents the passed panel to the DScrollPanel's canvas.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to add.

Clear.DESCRIPTION: Clears the `DScrollPanel`'s canvas, removing all added items.

GetCanvas.DESCRIPTION: Returns the canvas ( The panel all child panels are parented to ) of the DScrollPanel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The canvas
DScrollPanels padding

GetVBar.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vertical scroll bar of the panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [DVScrollBar](/gmod/DVScrollBar).

InnerWidth.DESCRIPTION: Return the width of the DScrollPanel's canvas.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the DScrollPanel's canvas

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to scroll to, must be a child of the DScrollPanel.

SetCanvas.DESCRIPTION: Sets the canvas of the DScrollPanel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: canvas
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new canvas

SetPadding.DESCRIPTION: Sets the DScrollPanel's padding. This function appears to be unused.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: padding
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The padding of the DScrollPanel.

DScrollPanel.DESCRIPTION:
DScrollPanel is a VGUI Element similar to DPanel however it has a vertical scrollbar docked to the right which can be used to put more content in a smaller area. DScrollPanels are essentially [DPanel](/gmod/DPanel)s with the Scroll Bar.

This can be used to replace the [DPanelList](/gmod/DPanelList) with [DPanelList:EnableVerticalScrollbar](/gmod/DPanelList:EnableVerticalScrollbar) and get similar functionality as well as using a non-deprecated element.

If you would like to paint or edit the elements of the scrollbar use [DScrollPanel:GetVBar](/gmod/DScrollPanel:GetVBar). If you want to see if the scrollbar is visible then use the VBar.Enabled variable on the scrollbar's VBar.
NOTES: Panel:DockPadding will not have an effect on children of this panel. Use the function on DScrollPanel:GetCanvas instead.

GetBorderColor.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the current type of shape this panel is set to display.

See [DShape:SetBorderColor](/gmod/DShape:SetBorderColor).

The border color 

See [Color](/gmod/Color)

GetLockY.DESCRIPTION:

See [DSlider:SetLockY](/gmod/DSlider:SetLockY) for more info.

Set by [DSlider:SetSlideX](/gmod/DSlider:SetSlideX).

GetSlideY.DESCRIPTION:

Set by [DSlider:SetSlideY](/gmod/DSlider:SetSlideY).

DSprite.DESCRIPTION:
A panel that draws a sprite on the player's HUD with the given [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial), [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) and rotation.

A shortcut for this is [CreateSprite](/gmod/Global.CreateSprite)().

AllowInput.DESCRIPTION:
Called whenever the value of the panel has been updated (whether by user input or otherwise).

It allows you to determine whether a user can modify the [TextEntry](/gmod/TextEntry)'s text.

By default, this only checks whether the panel disallows numeric characters, preventing it from being edited if the value contains any.

This is actually an engine hook that only works on [TextEntry](/gmod/TextEntry) derived elements.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: char
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The last character entered into the panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Return `true` to prevent the value from changing, `false` to allow it.

CheckNumeric.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether a string is numeric or not.
Always returns false if the [DTextEntry:SetNumeric](/gmod/DTextEntry:SetNumeric) is set to false.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strValue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the string is numeric or not.

GetAutoComplete.DESCRIPTION: Called by the DTextEntry when a list of autocompletion options is requested. Meant to be overridden.
NOTES: Options can be selected by arrow keys, it doesn't support mouse clicks. **Fixed in the next update.**

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inputText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player's current input.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If a table is returned, the values of the table will show up as autocomplete suggestions for the user.

GetCursorColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the cursor color of a DTextEntry.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the cursor as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetEnterAllowed.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether pressing Enter can cause the panel to lose focus. Note that a multiline DTextEntry cannot be escaped using the Enter key even when this function returns true.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether pressing the Enter key can cause the panel to lose focus.

GetFloat.DESCRIPTION: Returns the contents of the DTextEntry as a number.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Text of the DTextEntry as a float, or nil if it cannot be converted to a number using [tonumber](/gmod/Global.tonumber).

GetInt.DESCRIPTION: Similar to [DTextEntry:GetFloat](/gmod/DTextEntry:GetFloat), but rounds the value to the nearest integer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Text of the DTextEntry as a round number, or nil if it cannot be converted to a number.

GetNumeric.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether only numeric characters (123456789.-) can be entered into the DTextEntry.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the DTextEntry is numeric or not.

GetPlaceholderColor.DESCRIPTION: Return current color of panel placeholder

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current placeholder color

GetTextColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the text color of a DTextEntry.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the text as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetUpdateOnType.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry) is set to run [DTextEntry:OnValueChange](/gmod/DTextEntry:OnValueChange) every time a character is typed or deleted or only when Enter is pressed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this DTextEntry is being edited or not

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the object is in multi-line mode or not.

OnChange.DESCRIPTION:
Called internally by [DTextEntry:OnTextChanged](/gmod/DTextEntry:OnTextChanged) when the user modifies the text in the DTextEntry.

You should override this function to define custom behavior when the DTextEntry text changes.

OnEnter.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever enter is pressed on a DTextEntry.
NOTES: DTextEntry:IsEditing will still return true in this callback!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The current text of the [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry)

OnGetFocus.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the DTextEntry gains focus.

OnKeyCode.DESCRIPTION: Called from DTextEntry's [TextEntry:OnKeyCodeTyped](/gmod/TextEntry:OnKeyCodeTyped) override whenever a valid character is typed while the text entry is focused.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: They key code of the key pressed, see [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

OnLoseFocus.DESCRIPTION: Called whenever the DTextEntry lose focus.

OnTextChanged.DESCRIPTION:
Called internally when the text inside the DTextEntry changes.

You should not override this function. Use [DTextEntry:OnValueChange](/gmod/DTextEntry:OnValueChange) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: noMenuRemoval
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether to remove the autocomplete menu (false) or not (true).

OnValueChange.DESCRIPTION:
Called internally when the text changes of the [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry) are applied. (And set to the attached console variable, if one is given)

See also [DTextEntry:OnChange](/gmod/DTextEntry:OnChange) for a function that is called on every text change, even if the console variable is not updated.

You should override this function to define custom behavior when the text changes.

This method is called:
* When Enter is pressed after typing
* When [DTextEntry:SetValue](/gmod/DTextEntry:SetValue) is used
* For every key typed - only if [DTextEntry:SetUpdateOnType](/gmod/DTextEntry:SetUpdateOnType) was set to true (default is false)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The DTextEntry text.

DTextEntry.DESCRIPTION: A form which may be used to display text the player is meant to select and copy or alternately allow them to enter some text of their own . Do note that at least one of your DTextEntry's parents must either be an [EditablePanel](/gmod/EditablePanel) or derived from it (like a [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame), for example), else it won't be able to focus and thus be unselectable. You must also call [Panel:MakePopup](/gmod/Panel:MakePopup) on said panel or the DTextEntry will not work.
