ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate of the tile.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The occupied state of the tile, normally `1` or `nil`.

Layout.DESCRIPTION: Resets the last width/height info, and invalidates the panel's layout, causing it to recalculate all child positions. It is called whenever a child is added or removed, and can be called to refresh the panel.

LayoutTiles.DESCRIPTION: Called by [PANEL:PerformLayout](/gmod/PANEL:PerformLayout) to arrange and lay out the child panels, if it has changed in size.

OnModified.DESCRIPTION: Called when anything is dropped on or rearranged within the DTileLayout.

SetBaseSize.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the size of a single tile. If a child panel is larger than this size, it will occupy several tiles.

If you are setting the size of the children properly then you probably don't need to change this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: size
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The size of each tile. It is recommended you use `2ⁿ` (`16, 32, 64...`) numbers, and those above `4`, as numbers lower than this will result in many tiles being processed and therefore slow operation.

SetBorder.DESCRIPTION: Sets the spacing between the border/edge of the [DTileLayout](/gmod/DTileLayout) and all the elements inside.

SetMinHeight.DESCRIPTION: Determines the minimum height the DTileLayout will resize to. This is useful if child panels will be added/removed often.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minH
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height the panel can shrink to.

SetSpaceX.DESCRIPTION: Sets the spacing between 2 elements in the [DTileLayout](/gmod/DTileLayout) on the X axis.

SetSpaceY.DESCRIPTION: Sets the spacing between 2 elements in the [DTileLayout](/gmod/DTileLayout) on the Y axis.

SetTile.DESCRIPTION: Called to set the occupied state of a tile.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate of the tile.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate of the tile.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: state
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new state of the tile, normally `1` or `nil`.

DTileLayout.DESCRIPTION:
Similarly to [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout), this lays out panels in two dimensions as tiles. The difference between this and [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout) is that [DIconLayout](/gmod/DIconLayout) items all have the same height while [DTileLayout](/gmod/DTileLayout) items do not have this enforcement. [DTileLayout](/gmod/DTileLayout) will find the best way to "pack" its chidren. For example, in a two column layout, a item of height 2 units will be placed in one column while two items of height 1 unit will be placed in the other column. It is worth noting however that because this panel iterates through its children in an undefined order and lays out while it is iterating, there is no guarentee that this packing will lead to the lowest possible height.

This is used by the spawnmenu to arrange spawnicons.

The base size defines the smallest a tile can be, and it will resize vertically to accommodate all child panels. The number of elements in each row is determinded by the base size and width.

It also optionally permits the rearrangement of these tiles. To enable this functionality, call [DDragBase:MakeDroppable](/gmod/DDragBase:MakeDroppable) on the DTileLayout with a unique identifier. All panels added following this will be moveable.

Close.DESCRIPTION: Forces the tooltip to close. This will remove the panel.

DrawArrow.DESCRIPTION: Used to draw a triangle beneath the [DTooltip](/gmod/DTooltip)
NOTES: Requires DTooltip:SetContents, without this it will error

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: arrow location on the x axis

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: arrow location on the y axis

OpenForPanel.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up the tooltip for display for given panel and starts the timer.

Normally you wouldn't call this and you'd use [Panel:SetTooltip](/gmod/Panel:SetTooltip), [Panel:SetTooltipPanel](/gmod/Panel:SetTooltipPanel) or [Panel:SetTooltipPanelOverride](/gmod/Panel:SetTooltipPanelOverride).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to open the tooltip for.

PositionTooltip.DESCRIPTION: Positions the [DTooltip](/gmod/DTooltip) so it doesn't stay in the same draw position.

SetContents.DESCRIPTION: What Panel you want put inside of the [DTooltip](/gmod/DTooltip)
NOTES: You can only have one Panel at a time; use Parenting to add more

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Contents

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bDelete
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true, the panel in the first argument will be automatically removed when [DTooltip](/gmod/DTooltip) is closed via [DTooltip:Close](/gmod/DTooltip:Close).

DTooltip.DESCRIPTION: The panel used internally for tool tips. See [Panel:SetTooltip](/gmod/Panel:SetTooltip).

AddNode.DESCRIPTION: Add a node to the DTree

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the option.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The icon that will show nexto the node in the DTree.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns the created [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) panel.

ChildExpanded.DESCRIPTION:
Calls directly to [Panel:InvalidateLayout](/gmod/Panel:InvalidateLayout).
Called by [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node)s when a sub element has been expanded or collapsed.

Used as a placeholder function alongside [DTree:ExpandTo](/gmod/DTree:ExpandTo), [DTree:SetExpanded](/gmod/DTree:SetExpanded) and [DTree:MoveChildTo](/gmod/DTree:MoveChildTo).

The [DTree](/gmod/DTree) acts a root node and methods with the same name in [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) call to the parent.

DoClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when the any node is clicked. Called by [DTree_Node:DoClick](/gmod/DTree_Node:DoClick).

DoRightClick.DESCRIPTION: Called when the any node is right clicked. Called by [DTree_Node:DoRightClick](/gmod/DTree_Node:DoRightClick).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: node
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The right clicked node.

ExpandTo.DESCRIPTION:
Does nothing. Used as a placeholder empty function alongside [DTree:MoveChildTo](/gmod/DTree:MoveChildTo), [DTree:SetExpanded](/gmod/DTree:SetExpanded) and [DTree:ChildExpanded](/gmod/DTree:ChildExpanded).

The [DTree](/gmod/DTree) acts a root node and methods with the same name in [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) call to the parent.

GetClickOnDragHover.DESCRIPTION: Returns the status of [DTree:SetClickOnDragHover](/gmod/DTree:SetClickOnDragHover). See that for more info.

GetIndentSize.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the indentation size of the [DTree](/gmod/DTree), the distance between each "level" of the tree is offset on the left from the previous level.

Currently this feature has no effect on the [DTree](/gmod/DTree) element.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The indentation size.

GetLineHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of each [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) in the tree.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of each [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) in the tree.
Curently selected node.

GetShowIcons.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether or not the [Silkicons](/gmod/Silkicons) next to each node of the DTree will be displayed.

Individual icons can be set with [DTree_Node:SetIcon](/gmod/DTree_Node:SetIcon) or passed as the second argument in [DTree:AddNode](/gmod/DTree:AddNode).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the silkicons next to each node will be displayed.

MoveChildTo.DESCRIPTION:
Moves given node to the top of [DTree](/gmod/DTree)s children. (Makes it the topmost mode)

Used as a placeholder function alongside [DTree:ExpandTo](/gmod/DTree:ExpandTo), [DTree:SetExpanded](/gmod/DTree:SetExpanded) and [DTree:ChildExpanded](/gmod/DTree:ChildExpanded).

The [DTree](/gmod/DTree) acts a root node and methods with the same name in [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) call to the parent.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: child
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The node to move

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Unused, does nothing.

OnNodeSelected.DESCRIPTION: This function is called when a node within a tree is selected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: node
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The node that was selected.

Root.DESCRIPTION: Returns the root [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node), the node that is the parent to all other nodes of the DTree.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Root node.

SetClickOnDragHover.DESCRIPTION:
Enables the "click when drag-hovering" functionality.

If enabled, when hovering over any [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) of this [DTree](/gmod/DTree) while dragging a panel, the node will be automatically clicked on (and subsequently [DTree:OnNodeSelected](/gmod/DTree:OnNodeSelected) will be called) to open any attached panels, such as spawnlists in spawnmenu.

See also: [PANEL:DragHoverClick](/gmod/PANEL:DragHoverClick).

SetExpanded.DESCRIPTION:
Does nothing. Is not called by the [DTree](/gmod/DTree) itself.

Used as a placeholder empty function alongside [DTree:ExpandTo](/gmod/DTree:ExpandTo), [DTree:MoveChildTo](/gmod/DTree:MoveChildTo) and [DTree:ChildExpanded](/gmod/DTree:ChildExpanded) to prevent errors when [DTree_Node:SetExpanded](/gmod/DTree_Node:SetExpanded) is incorrectly used on a [DTree](/gmod/DTree).

SetIndentSize.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the indentation size of the [DTree](/gmod/DTree), the distance between each "level" of the tree is offset on the left from the previous level.

Currently this feature has no effect on the [DTree](/gmod/DTree) element.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: size
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new indentation size.

SetLineHeight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the height of each [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) in the tree.

The default value is 17.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height to set.

SetSelectedItem.DESCRIPTION: Set the currently selected top-level node.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: node
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) to select.

SetShowIcons.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether or not the [Silkicons](/gmod/Silkicons) next to each node of the DTree will be displayed.

Individual icons can be set with [DTree_Node:SetIcon](/gmod/DTree_Node:SetIcon) or passed as the second argument in [DTree:AddNode](/gmod/DTree:AddNode).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: show
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to show icons.

ShowIcons.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether or not the [Silkicons](/gmod/Silkicons) next to each node of the DTree will be displayed.

Alias of [DTree:GetShowIcons](/gmod/DTree:GetShowIcons).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the silkicons next to each node will be displayed.

DTree.DESCRIPTION:
A tree view element for Derma.

See also [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node).

GetBottomMin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum height of the bottom content panel.

GetDividerHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of the divider bar between the top and bottom content panels of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the divider bar.

GetDragging.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the divider is being dragged or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If true, mouse movement will alter the size of the divider.

GetHoldPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the local Y position of where the user starts dragging the divider.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The local Y position where divider dragging has started.

GetMiddle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the middle content panel of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The middle content panel.

GetTop.DESCRIPTION: Returns the top content panel of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The top content panel.

GetTopHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current height of the top content panel set by [DVerticalDivider:SetTopHeight](/gmod/DVerticalDivider:SetTopHeight) or by the user.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current height of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

GetTopMax.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum height of the top content panel. See [DVerticalDivider:SetTopMax](/gmod/DVerticalDivider:SetTopMax) for more information.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height of the top content panel.

GetTopMin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum height of the top content panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height of the top content panel.

SetBottom.DESCRIPTION: Sets the passed panel as the bottom content of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to set as the bottom content.

SetBottomMin.DESCRIPTION: Sets the minimum height of the bottom content panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height of the bottom content panel. Default is 50.

SetDividerHeight.DESCRIPTION: Sets the height of the divider bar between the top and bottom content panels of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the divider bar.

SetDragging.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the divider is being dragged or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isDragging
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Setting this to true causes cursor movement to alter the position of the divider.

SetHoldPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets the local Y position of where the user starts dragging the divider.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The local Y position where divider dragging has started.

SetMiddle.DESCRIPTION: Places the passed panel in between the top and bottom content panels of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to set as the middle content.

SetTop.DESCRIPTION: Sets the passed panel as the top content of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to set as the top content.

Sets the height of the top content panel.

The height of the bottom content panel is automatically calculated by taking the total height of the [DVerticalDivider](/gmod/DVerticalDivider) and subtracting it with the height of the top content panel and the divider bar.

SetTopMin.DESCRIPTION: Sets the minimum height of the top content panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height of the top content panel. Default is 50.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the scroll level was changed (i.e. if we did or did not scroll)

GetHideButtons.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the manual up/down scroll buttons are visible or not. Set by [DVScrollBar:SetHideButtons](/gmod/DVScrollBar:SetHideButtons).

GetScroll.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of scroll level from the top in pixels

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to hide

SetUp.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up the scrollbar for use.

The scrollbar will automatically disable itself if the total height of the canvas is lower than the height of the panel that holds the canvas during this function call.

DVScrollBar.DESCRIPTION:
A scrollbar used in [DScrollPanel](/gmod/DScrollPanel).

The scrollbar notably contains **DVScrollBar.btnUp, DVScrollBar.btnDown, and DVScrollBar.btnGrip** which are the up button, down button, and grip respectively. Editing the paint functions of these allows custom scrollbar styling. See [DScrollPanel:GetVBar](/gmod/DScrollPanel:GetVBar) for an example.

AboveLayout.DESCRIPTION:
Applies the top-down view camera settings for the model in the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel).

Called when a user clicks the `Above` (third) button (See [IconEditor](/gmod/IconEditor)).

BestGuessLayout.DESCRIPTION:
Applies the best camera settings for the model in the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel), using the values returned by [PositionSpawnIcon](/gmod/Global.PositionSpawnIcon).

Called when a user clicks the `wand` button (See the ) and when [IconEditor:Refresh](/gmod/IconEditor:Refresh) is called.

FillAnimations.DESCRIPTION: Fills the [DListView](/gmod/DListView) on the left of the editor with the model entity's animation list. Called by [IconEditor:Refresh](/gmod/IconEditor:Refresh).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity being rendered within the model panel.

FullFrontalLayout.DESCRIPTION:
Applies the front view camera settings for the model in the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel).

Called when a user clicks the `Front` (second) button (See the ).

OriginLayout.DESCRIPTION:
Places the camera at the origin (0,0,0), relative to the entity, in the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel).

Called when a user clicks the `Center` (fifth) button (See the ).

Refresh.DESCRIPTION:
Updates the internal [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel) and [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon). 

This should be called immediately after setting the SpawnIcon with [IconEditor:SetIcon](/gmod/IconEditor:SetIcon).

RenderIcon.DESCRIPTION:
Re-renders the [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon).

Called when a user clicks the `RENDER` button, this retrieves the render data from the internal [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel) and passes it as a table to [Panel:RebuildSpawnIconEx](/gmod/Panel:RebuildSpawnIconEx).

RightLayout.DESCRIPTION:
Applies the right side view camera settings for the model in the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel).

Called when a user clicks the `Right` (fourth) button (See the ). (Note: The icon for this points left.)

SetDefaultLighting.DESCRIPTION: Sets up the default ambient and directional lighting for the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel). Called by [IconEditor:Refresh](/gmod/IconEditor:Refresh).

SetFromEntity.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the editor's model and icon from an entity. Alternative to [IconEditor:SetIcon](/gmod/IconEditor:SetIcon), with uses a [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon).

You do not need to call [IconEditor:Refresh](/gmod/IconEditor:Refresh) after this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to retrieve the model and skin from.

SetIcon.DESCRIPTION: Sets the [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon) to modify. You should call [Panel:Refresh](/gmod/Panel:Refresh) immediately after this, as the user will not be able to make changes to the icon beforehand.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon) object to be modified.

UpdateEntity.DESCRIPTION: Updates the entity being rendered in the internal [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel). Called by the model panel's [DModelPanel:LayoutEntity](/gmod/DModelPanel:LayoutEntity) method.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity being rendered within the model panel.

IconEditor.DESCRIPTION:
An icon editor that permits a user to modify a [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon) and re-render it. This is used by the spawn menu and is what is shown when you right-click an icon and select `Edit Icon`.

This makes use of the [DAdjustableModelPanel](/gmod/DAdjustableModelPanel) element.
NOTES: This panel is only available in Sandbox and Sandbox derived gamemodes!

GetChecked.DESCRIPTION: Returns the checked state of the [ImageCheckBox](/gmod/ImageCheckBox)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true for checked, false otherwise

Set.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the checked state of the checkbox.

Checked state can be obtained by [ImageCheckBox](/gmod/ImageCheckBox).State.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: OnOff
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true for checked, false otherwise

SetChecked.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the checked state of the checkbox.

Checked state can be obtained via [ImageCheckBox:GetChecked](/gmod/ImageCheckBox:GetChecked)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bOn
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true for checked, false otherwise

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the material that will be visible when the [ImageCheckBox](/gmod/ImageCheckBox) is checked.

Internally calls [Material:SetMaterial](/gmod/Material:SetMaterial).
NOTES: Will error if no material was set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file path of the material to set (relative to "garrysmod/materials/").

ImageCheckBox.DESCRIPTION:
A checkbox panel similar to [DCheckBox](/gmod/DCheckBox) and [DImageButton](/gmod/DImageButton) with customizable checked state image.

Uses the [Material](/gmod/Material) panel internally. Can't have a label.
NOTES: Will error if no material was set.

SetAlpha.DESCRIPTION: Sets the alpha value of the Material panel.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The alpha value, from 0 to 255.

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Sets the material used by the panel.
NOTES: If the material is not showing up as the correct size, try setting the Material panel's `AutoSize` variable to **false**

ARGUMENTS.NAME: matname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file path of the material to set (relative to "garrysmod/materials/").

Material.DESCRIPTION: Material is a VGUI element that renders a VMT material.

LoadTGAImage.DESCRIPTION: Sets a new image to be loaded by a [TGAImage](/gmod/TGAImage).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: imageName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file path.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: strPath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The PATH to search in. See [File Search Paths](/gmod/File Search Paths).

This isn't used internally.

Panel.DESCRIPTION:
This is the base panel for every other VGUI panel.

It contains all of the basic methods, some of which may only work on certain VGUI elements. As their functionality is provided at the game's C/C++ level rather than by its Lua script extension, they are unfortunately unavailable for most practical purposes, however, they can still be obtained in a way similar to that provided by the [baseclass](/gmod/baseclass) library:

```

-- Create a new panel type NewPanel that inherits all of its functionality from DLabel,

-- but has a different SetText method than DLabel does - all without the hassle of that

-- old DLabel's default text getting in the way. Fun stuff.

local PANEL = {}

function PANEL:Init()

	self:SetText_Base( "" )

	self:SetText( "Time for something different!" )

end

function PANEL:Paint( aWide, aTall )

	local TextX, TextY = 0, 0

	local TextColor = Color( 255, 0, 0, 255 )

	surface.SetFont( self:GetFont() or "default" )

	surface.SetTextColor( TextColor )

	surface.SetTextPos( TextX, TextY )

	surface.DrawText( self:GetText() )

end

-- And here we go:

PANEL.SetText_Base = FindMetaTable( "Panel" ).SetText

function PANEL:SetText( aText ) 

	self.Text = tostring( aText ) 

end

function PANEL:GetText() 

	return self.Text or "" 

end

vgui.Register( "NewPanel", PANEL, "DLabel" )

```

GetBodyGroup.DESCRIPTION: Returns the currently set body groups of the spawn icon. This is set by [SpawnIcon:SetBodyGroup](/gmod/SpawnIcon:SetBodyGroup).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The bodygroups of the spawnicon

GetModelName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the currently set model name. This is set by [SpawnIcon:SetModelName](/gmod/SpawnIcon:SetModelName).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The model name

GetSkinID.DESCRIPTION: Returns the currently set skin of the spawnicon. This is set by [SpawnIcon:SetSkinID](/gmod/SpawnIcon:SetSkinID).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current skin ID

OpenMenu.DESCRIPTION: Called when right clicked on the SpawnIcon. It will not be called if there is a selection ([Panel:GetSelectionCanvas](/gmod/Panel:GetSelectionCanvas)), in which case [SANDBOX:SpawnlistOpenGenericMenu](/gmod/SANDBOX:SpawnlistOpenGenericMenu) is called.

SetBodyGroup.DESCRIPTION: Sets the bodygroups, so it can be retrieved with [SpawnIcon:GetBodyGroup](/gmod/SpawnIcon:GetBodyGroup). Use [Panel:SetModel](/gmod/Panel:SetModel) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bodygroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Body groups to set. It must be 9 character long string of 0-9 characters.

SetModelName.DESCRIPTION: Sets the model name, so it can be retrieved with [SpawnIcon:GetModelName](/gmod/SpawnIcon:GetModelName). Use [Panel:SetModel](/gmod/Panel:SetModel) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mdl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model name to set

SetSkinID.DESCRIPTION: Sets the skin id of the spawn icon, so it can be retrieved with [SpawnIcon:GetSkinID](/gmod/SpawnIcon:GetSkinID). Use [Panel:SetModel](/gmod/Panel:SetModel) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: skin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Skin ID to set

SpawnIcon.DESCRIPTION: A "spawn icon" displays an image for the given model path. It is mostly used in the Spawn Menu (). It uses [ModelImage](/gmod/ModelImage) internally.

OnKeyCodeTyped.DESCRIPTION:
Called from engine whenever a valid character is typed while the text entry is focused.

Used internally for functionality of [DTextEntry](/gmod/DTextEntry)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyCode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: They key code of the key pressed, see [KEY](/gmod/Enums/KEY).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether you've handled the key press. Returning true prevents the default text entry behavior from occurring.

AchievementIcon.DESCRIPTION:
Used to show an icon for any of the [Garry's Mod Steam achievements](http://steamcommunity.com/stats/GarrysMod/achievements).

If the viewer has not unlocked the achievement on Steam, the icon will be grayed out.

AvatarImage.DESCRIPTION: Used to show a player's Steam avatar. You are recommended but not limited to pick one of the following sizes: 16, 32, 64, 84, 128, 184.

Awesomium.DESCRIPTION: Base panel for elements using the [Awesomium](http://www.awesomium.com) UI engine.

Button.DESCRIPTION: Creates a button that players can click on.
DEPRECATED: Only exists for backwards compatibility with Panel:SetActionFunction. Use DButton instead.

CtrlListBox.DESCRIPTION:
A [DComboBox](/gmod/DComboBox) based dropdown menu with build in easy [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) support.

This control only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

DListBox.DESCRIPTION: A simple list box with optional multi-select. As this is deprecated, it is recommended that you use [DListView](/gmod/DListView), which contains the same functionality with multi-column options.
DEPRECATED: Derived from the deprecated DPanelList.

DListLayout.DESCRIPTION:
A vertical list of panels that optionally allows child elements to be rearranged with the mouse cursor.

Child panels' widths are set to the width of the DListLayout, and it resizes vertically to accommodate the heights of all children. You can place this inside a [DScrollPanel](/gmod/DScrollPanel) when adding many panels.

To enable the drag & drop rearrangement functionality, call [DDragBase:MakeDroppable](/gmod/DDragBase:MakeDroppable) on the DListLayout with a unique identifier. All panels added following this will be moveable.

DNumPad.DESCRIPTION: GMod 12 style "number pad" panel used by tools for binding keys to tool actions. Deprecated in favor of [DBinder](/gmod/DBinder).
DEPRECATED: You should use DBinder instead.

DPanelSelect.DESCRIPTION: A base panel for things like [DModelSelect](/gmod/DModelSelect). Basically, a list of panels that can be selected. Selected panel can be retrieved and has visual indication of being selected.
DEPRECATED: This is derived from the deprecated DPanelList.

DProperty_Generic.DESCRIPTION: A base for other controls for [DProperties](/gmod/DProperties). Acts as a generic text input on its own.

DScrollBarGrip.DESCRIPTION: An internal panel used by [DVScrollBar](/gmod/DVScrollBar) as the grip (middle) part of the scrollbar.

DSizeToContents.DESCRIPTION: A helper panel that will automatically resize itself to fit all its children using [Panel:SizeToChildren](/gmod/Panel:SizeToChildren).

DTab.DESCRIPTION: A tab for internal use on the [DPropertySheet](/gmod/DPropertySheet).

DTree_Node.DESCRIPTION:
This panel is created whenever you add a node to a [DTree](/gmod/DTree).

The root node of a [DTree](/gmod/DTree) is also a [DTree_Node](/gmod/DTree_Node) and controls much of its action; it can be accessed with [DTree:Root](/gmod/DTree:Root).

EditablePanel.DESCRIPTION: Base panel used by [DFrame](/gmod/DFrame), this panel is needed so that elements such as the [TextEntry](/gmod/TextEntry) can obtain focus.

fingerposer.DESCRIPTION: A panel used by Sandbox's Finger Poser tool.

FingerVar.DESCRIPTION: A panel used by Sandbox's Finger Poser tool.

Frame.DESCRIPTION: A window that in which you can place just about every other component and even another frame.

HTML.DESCRIPTION:
The HTML control can be used to display HTML code just like an internet browser. Unlike [DHTML](/gmod/DHTML), this control cannot accept user input or complex interaction, such as retrieving image data.

**Blocked URL Extentions**

`This means your url cannot end in any of these extensions, e.g.: (http://yourdomain.com/garry.exe)`
* .exe
* .bat
* .dll
* .zip
* .mp3
* .swf

Label.DESCRIPTION: A basic label or "single line text area" that is non-editable.

MatSelect.DESCRIPTION: The panel used by Material & Lamp Sandbox tools for texture selection.

ModelImage.DESCRIPTION: Panel used to display models, used by [SpawnIcon](/gmod/SpawnIcon).

PanelList.DESCRIPTION: A panel list with a custom vertical scroll bar that doesn't have up/down buttons and has a momentum to scrolling.
DEPRECATED: You should use DScrollPanel instead

PresetEditor.DESCRIPTION:
A preset editor, which can be opened by [ControlPresets](/gmod/ControlPresets).

This control only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

RadioButton.DESCRIPTION: Currently there are no functions to retrieve checked state of a Radio Button, and their visuals are seemingly broken.

RichText.DESCRIPTION:
A very versatile text display element that's used to power the default chat and console.

Rich Text panels allows multicolored, highlight-able, and interactive text using individual text segment markup (segments are defined by the [Panel:AppendText](/gmod/Panel:AppendText) method).

DEPRECATED: Used in deprecated  PanelList. Use DVScrollBar (Used in DScrollPanel).

Slider.DESCRIPTION: A simple slider featuring an numeric display.
DEPRECATED: Only exists for backwards compatibility with Panel:SetActionFunction and Panel:PostMessage. Use DNumSlider instead.

TGAImage.DESCRIPTION: A panel capable of loading .tga images.

URLLabel.DESCRIPTION: A panel similar to [Label](/gmod/Label) used by [DLabelURL](/gmod/DLabelURL).

CONTINUOUS_USE.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [Entity:SetUseType](/gmod/Entity:SetUseType). Affects when [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) is triggered.

Not to be confused with [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE) used for [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) and others.
CONTINUOUS_USE.DESCRIPTION: Fire a [USE_ON](/gmod/Enums/USE) signal every tick as long as the player holds their use key and aims at the target.

ONOFF_USE.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [Entity:SetUseType](/gmod/Entity:SetUseType). Affects when [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) is triggered.

Not to be confused with [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE) used for [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) and others.
ONOFF_USE.DESCRIPTION: Fires a [USE_ON](/gmod/Enums/USE) signal when starting to use an entity, and a [USE_OFF](/gmod/Enums/USE) signal when letting go.
WARNINGS:
There is no guarantee to receive both ON and OFF signals. A signal will only be sent when pushing or letting go of the use key while actually aiming at the entity, so an ON signal might not be followed by an OFF signal if the player is aiming somewhere else when releasing the key, and similarly, an OFF signal may not be preceded by an ON signal if the player started aiming at the entity only after pressing the key.

Therefore, this method of input is unreliable and should not be used.

DIRECTIONAL_USE.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [Entity:SetUseType](/gmod/Entity:SetUseType). Affects when [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) is triggered.

Not to be confused with [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE) used for [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) and others.

SIMPLE_USE.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [Entity:SetUseType](/gmod/Entity:SetUseType). Affects when [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) is triggered.

Not to be confused with [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE) used for [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use) and others.
SIMPLE_USE.DESCRIPTION: Fire a [USE_ON](/gmod/Enums/USE) signal only once when player presses their use key while aiming at the target.

AMMO_FORCE_DROP_IF_CARRIED.DESCRIPTION: Forces player to drop the object they are carrying if the object was hit by this ammo type.

AMMO_INTERPRET_PLRDAMAGE_AS_DAMAGE_TO_PL.DESCRIPTION: Uses [AmmoData](/gmod/Structures/AmmoData).plydmg of the ammo type as the damage to deal to shot players instead of [Bullet](/gmod/Structures/Bullet).Damage.

BLEND_ZERO.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [render.OverrideBlend](/gmod/render.OverrideBlend) to determine how texture RGBA information should be interpreted when rendered. 

For more information refer to OpenGL's glBlendFunc page here: https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL-Refpages/gl4/html/glBlendFunc.xhtml  

Clientside only.

BONE_USED_BY_HITBOX.DESCRIPTION: A hitbox is attached to this bone

BONE_USED_BY_ATTACHMENT.DESCRIPTION: An attachment is attached to this bone

BONE_USED_BY_ANYTHING.DESCRIPTION:
Is this bone used by anything?

( If any BONE_USED_BY_* flags are true )

BOX_FRONT.DESCRIPTION: Place the light from the front

BOX_RIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Place the light to the right

BOX_LEFT.DESCRIPTION: Place the light to the left

BOX_TOP.DESCRIPTION: Place the light to the top

BOX_BOTTOM.DESCRIPTION: Place the light to the bottom

CHAN_REPLACE.DESCRIPTION: Used when playing sounds through console commands.

CHAN_ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Channel for items ( Health kits, etc )

CHAN_BODY.DESCRIPTION: Clothing, ragdoll impacts, footsteps, knocking/pounding/punching etc.

CHAN_STREAM.DESCRIPTION: Stream channel from the static or dynamic area

CHAN_STATIC.DESCRIPTION:
A constant/background sound that doesn't require any reaction.

**This channel allows same sounds files to play multiple times without cutting out.**

CHAN_VOICE_BASE.DESCRIPTION:
Channels 8-135 (128 channels) are allocated for player voice chat

**This channel allows same sounds files to play multiple times without cutting out.**

CHAN_USER_BASE.DESCRIPTION: Channels from this and onwards are allocated to game code

CLASS_PLAYER_ALLY.DESCRIPTION: HL2 player allies - monster_barney, npc_citizen, hacked npc_manhack, and friendly npc_turret_floor.

CLASS_PLAYER_ALLY_VITAL.DESCRIPTION: HL2 vital player allies - npc_magnusson, npc_gman, npc_fisherman, npc_eli, npc_barney, npc_kleiner, npc_mossman, npc_alyx, npc_monk, npc_dog, and npc_vortigaunt at the end of EP2 (controlled by "MakeGameEndAlly" input).

CLASS_ANTLION.DESCRIPTION: HL2 antlions - npc_antlion, npc_antlionguard, and npc_ichthyosaur.

CLASS_CITIZEN_PASSIVE.DESCRIPTION: HL2 passive/non-rebel citizens - npc_citizen in the beginning of HL2.

CLASS_COMBINE.DESCRIPTION: HL2 combine troops - npc_combine, npc_advisor, apc_missile, npc_apcdriver, hostile npc_turret_floor, hostile npc_rollermine, npc_turret_ground when active, npc_turret_ceiling when active, and npc_strider when active (not being carried by the gunship).

CLASS_COMBINE_GUNSHIP.DESCRIPTION: HL2 combine aircrafts - npc_combinegunship, npc_combinedropship, and npc_helicopter.

CLASS_MANHACK.DESCRIPTION: HL2 manhacks - hostile npc_manhack not held by the gravity gun.

CLASS_METROPOLICE.DESCRIPTION: HL2 metro police - npc_metropolice and npc_vehicledriver.

CLASS_MILITARY.DESCRIPTION: HL2 combine military objects - func_guntarget, npc_spotlight, and active npc_combine_camera.

CLASS_SCANNER.DESCRIPTION: HL2 combine scanners - npc_cscanner and npc_clawscanner.

CLASS_VORTIGAUNT.DESCRIPTION: HL2 vortigaunts - npc_vortigaunt before the end of EP2 (controlled by "MakeGameEndAlly" input).

CLASS_ZOMBIE.DESCRIPTION: HL2 zombies - unslumped npc_zombie, npc_poisonzombie, npc_fastzombie, npc_fastzombie_torso, and npc_zombine.

CLASS_MISSILE.DESCRIPTION: HL2 missiles - rpg_missile, apc_missile, and grenade_pathfollower.

CLASS_EARTH_FAUNA.DESCRIPTION: HL2 animals - npc_crow, npc_seagull, and npc_pigeon.

CLASS_HUMAN_MILITARY.DESCRIPTION: HL:S human military - monster_human_grunt and monster_apache.

CLASS_ALIEN_MILITARY.DESCRIPTION: HL:S alien military - monster_alien_controller, monster_vortigaunt, monster_alien_grunt, monster_nihilanth, and monster_snark if it has an enemy of class CLASS_PLAYER, CLASS_HUMAN_PASSIVE, or CLASS_HUMAN_MILITARY.

CLASS_ALIEN_MONSTER.DESCRIPTION: HL:S monsters - monster_tentacle, monster_barnacle, monster_zombie, monster_gargantua, monster_houndeye, monster_ichthyosaur, and monster_bigmomma.

CLASS_ALIEN_PREDATOR.DESCRIPTION: HL:S alien predators - monster_bullsquid, xen_tree, and xen_hull.

CLASS_PLAYER_BIOWEAPON.DESCRIPTION: HL:S player bioweapons - hornet fired by a player.

CLASS_ALIEN_BIOWEAPON.DESCRIPTION: HL:S enemy bioweapons - hornet fired by anyone but a player, or monster_snark with no enemy or an enemy without the class CLASS_PLAYER, CLASS_HUMAN_PASSIVE, or CLASS_HUMAN_MILITARY.

COLLISION_GROUP_DEBRIS.DESCRIPTION: Collides with nothing but world and static stuff

COLLISION_GROUP_DEBRIS_TRIGGER.DESCRIPTION: Same as debris, but hits triggers. Useful for an item that can be shot, but doesn't collide.

COLLISION_GROUP_INTERACTIVE_DEBRIS.DESCRIPTION: Collides with everything except other interactive debris or debris

COLLISION_GROUP_INTERACTIVE.DESCRIPTION: Collides with everything except interactive debris or debris

COLLISION_GROUP_BREAKABLE_GLASS.DESCRIPTION: NPCs can see straight through an Entity with this applied.

COLLISION_GROUP_PLAYER_MOVEMENT.DESCRIPTION: For HL2, same as Collision_Group_Player, for TF2, this filters out other players and CBaseObjects

COLLISION_GROUP_IN_VEHICLE.DESCRIPTION: Doesn't collide with anything, no traces

COLLISION_GROUP_WEAPON.DESCRIPTION: Doesn't collide with players and vehicles

COLLISION_GROUP_DOOR_BLOCKER.DESCRIPTION: Blocks entities not permitted to get near moving doors

COLLISION_GROUP_PASSABLE_DOOR.DESCRIPTION: Lets the Player through, nothing else.

COLLISION_GROUP_DISSOLVING.DESCRIPTION: Things that are dissolving are in this group

COLLISION_GROUP_PUSHAWAY.DESCRIPTION: Nonsolid on client and server, pushaway in player code

DMG_CRUSH.DESCRIPTION:
Caused by physics interaction and ignored by airboat drivers. This is used by the Rollermine and an unused animation attack called 'Fireattack' by the Antlion Guard [ACT_RANGE_ATTACK1](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Enums/ACT)

* 4202501 is the same DMG type as 1 but has a different value and its only used by the Barnacle when it kills an NPC

* 8197 is the same DMG type as 1 but has a different value and its only used by the Barnacle when its hurting a player

DMG_BULLET.DESCRIPTION:
Bullet damage from Ceiling Turrets, the Strider, Turrets and most guns 

* 4098 is the same DMG type as 2 but has a different value and its only used by the Helicopter & Gunship

DMG_SLASH.DESCRIPTION: Used by the Stunstick, Manhacks, Antlions, Antlion Guards, Headcrabs, Fast Headcrabs, all Zombies types, Hunter, and potentially other NPCs attacks

DMG_VEHICLE.DESCRIPTION: Hit by a vehicle (This will need to be set for passengers of some vehicle to receive damage)

DMG_BLAST.DESCRIPTION:
Explosion damage like grenades, helicopter bombs, combine mines, Will be ignored by most vehicle passengers

* 134217792 is the same as 64 but has a different value and its used by the Explosive Oil Drum

DMG_CLUB.DESCRIPTION: Blunt attacks such as from the Crowbar, Antlion Guard & Hunter

DMG_SHOCK.DESCRIPTION: Electrical damage, shows smoke at the damage position and its used by Stalkers & Vortigaunts

DMG_SONIC.DESCRIPTION: Sonic damage, used by the Gargantua and Houndeye NPCs

DMG_PREVENT_PHYSICS_FORCE.DESCRIPTION:
Prevent a physics force

* 4196352 is the same as 2048 but has a different value and its only used by the Hunter when it kills a player via the flechettes

DMG_NEVERGIB.DESCRIPTION:
Crossbow damage, never creates gibs

* 67112960 is the same as 4096 but has a different value and its used by the Hunter's flechettes when initial contact is made to the entity

DMG_POISON.DESCRIPTION:
Poison damage used by Antlion Workers & Poison Headcrabs

* 134348800 is the same as 131072 but has a different value and its only used by the Antlion Worker's death damage

DMG_RADIATION.DESCRIPTION: Radiation damage & it will be ignored by most vehicle passengers

DMG_DROWNRECOVER.DESCRIPTION: Damage applied to the player to restore health after drowning

DMG_ACID.DESCRIPTION: Toxic chemical or acid burn damage used by the Antlion Workers

DMG_REMOVENORAGDOLL.DESCRIPTION: Don't create a ragdoll on death

DMG_PHYSGUN.DESCRIPTION:
Damage done by the gravity gun

* 8388609 is the same as 8388608 but has a different value and its damage done by the gravity gun to NPCs

DMG_DISSOLVE.DESCRIPTION:
Forces the entity to dissolve on death. This is what the combine ball uses when it hits a target

* 67108865 is the same as 67108864 but has a different value and its when an npc dies to a combine ball

* 67110912 is the same as 67108864 but has a different value and its used by the Hunter's flechettes when they explode

DMG_BLAST_SURFACE.DESCRIPTION: This won't hurt the player underwater

DMG_DIRECT.DESCRIPTION: Direct damage to the entity that does not go through any damage value modifications

DMG_BUCKSHOT.DESCRIPTION: The pellets fired from a shotgun

DMG_MISSILEDEFENSE.DESCRIPTION: Damage from npc_missiledefense, npc_combinegunship, or monster_mortar

EF_BONEMERGE.DESCRIPTION: Performs bone merge on client side

EF_BONEMERGE_FASTCULL.DESCRIPTION: For use with EF_BONEMERGE. If this is set, then it places this ents origin at its parent and uses the parent's bbox + the max extents of the aiment. Otherwise, it sets up the parent's bones every frame to figure out where to place the aiment, which is inefficient because it'll setup the parent's bones even if the parent is not in the PVS.

EF_NODRAW.DESCRIPTION: Prevents the entity from drawing and networking.

EF_PARENT_ANIMATES.DESCRIPTION: Always assume that the parent entity is animating

EF_FOLLOWBONE.DESCRIPTION: Internal flag that is set by [Entity:FollowBone](/gmod/Entity:FollowBone)

EFL_BOT_FROZEN.DESCRIPTION: This is set on bots that are frozen

EFL_DIRTY_ABSANGVELOCITY.DESCRIPTION: Some dirty bits with respect to abs computations

EFL_DIRTY_SHADOWUPDATE.DESCRIPTION: (Client only) need shadow manager to update the shadow

EFL_DONTWALKON.DESCRIPTION: NPCs should not walk on this entity

EFL_DORMANT.DESCRIPTION: Entity is dormant, no updates to client

EFL_FORCE_CHECK_TRANSMIT.DESCRIPTION: The default behavior in ShouldTransmit is to not send an entity if it doesn't have a model. Certain entities want to be sent anyway because all the drawing logic is in the client DLL. They can set this flag and the engine will transmit them even if they don't have model

EFL_HAS_PLAYER_CHILD.DESCRIPTION: One of the child entities is a player

EFL_IN_SKYBOX.DESCRIPTION: This is set if the entity detects that it's in the skybox. This forces it to pass the "in PVS" for transmission

EFL_KEEP_ON_RECREATE_ENTITIES.DESCRIPTION: This is a special entity that should not be deleted when we restart entities only

EFL_KILLME.DESCRIPTION: This entity is marked for death -- This allows the game to actually delete ents at a safe time.
WARNINGS: You should never set this flag manually.

EFL_NOCLIP_ACTIVE.DESCRIPTION: Lets us know when the noclip command is active

EFL_NOTIFY.DESCRIPTION: Another entity is watching events on this entity (used by teleport)

EFL_NO_DAMAGE_FORCES.DESCRIPTION: Doesn't accept forces from physics damage

EFL_NO_MEGAPHYSCANNON_RAGDOLL.DESCRIPTION: Mega physcannon can't ragdoll these guys

EFL_NO_PHYSCANNON_INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Physcannon can't pick these up or punt them

EFL_NO_WATER_VELOCITY_CHANGE.DESCRIPTION: Don't adjust this entity's velocity when transitioning into water

EFL_SETTING_UP_BONES.DESCRIPTION: Set while a model is setting up its bones

EFL_TOUCHING_FLUID.DESCRIPTION: Used to determine if an entity is floating

EFL_USE_PARTITION_WHEN_NOT_SOLID.DESCRIPTION: Entities with this flag set show up in the partition even when not solid

FCVAR_ARCHIVE.DESCRIPTION:
Save the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) value into config.vdf

Reported as "a" by `cvarlist`, except Lua [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)s

FCVAR_ARCHIVE_XBOX.DESCRIPTION: Save the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) value into config.vdf on XBox

FCVAR_CHEAT.DESCRIPTION:
Requires sv_cheats to be enabled to change the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) or run the command

Reported as "cheat" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_CLIENTCMD_CAN_EXECUTE.DESCRIPTION:
IVEngineClient::ClientCmd is allowed to execute this command

Reported as "clientcmd_can_execute" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_CLIENTDLL.DESCRIPTION:
[ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) is defined by the client DLL.

This flag is set automatically

Reported as "cl" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_DEMO.DESCRIPTION:
Force the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) to be recorded by demo recordings.

Reported as "demo" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_DONTRECORD.DESCRIPTION:
Opposite of FCVAR_DEMO, ensures the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) is not recorded in demos

Reported as "norecord" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_GAMEDLL.DESCRIPTION:
[ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) is defined by the game DLL.

This flag is set automatically

Reported as "sv" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_LUA_CLIENT.DESCRIPTION:
Set automatically on all ConVars and console commands created by the client Lua state.

Reported as "lua_client" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_LUA_SERVER.DESCRIPTION:
Set automatically on all ConVars and console commands created by the server Lua state.

Reported as "lua_server" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_NEVER_AS_STRING.DESCRIPTION:
Tells the engine to never print this variable as a string. This is used for variables which may contain control characters.

Reported as "numeric" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_NOTIFY.DESCRIPTION:
For serverside [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)s, notifies all players with blue chat text when the value gets changed

Reported as "nf" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_NOT_CONNECTED.DESCRIPTION: Makes the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) not changeable while connected to a server or in singleplayer

FCVAR_PRINTABLEONLY.DESCRIPTION:
Forces the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) to only have printable characters ( No control characters )

Reported as "print" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_PROTECTED.DESCRIPTION:
Makes the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) value hidden from all clients ( For example sv_password )

Reported as "prot" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_REPLICATED.DESCRIPTION:
For serverside [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)s, it will send its value to all clients. The [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) with the same name must also exist on the client!

Reported as "rep" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_SERVER_CANNOT_QUERY.DESCRIPTION: Prevents the server from querying value of this [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)

FCVAR_SERVER_CAN_EXECUTE.DESCRIPTION:
The server is allowed to execute this command on clients.

Reported as "server_can_execute" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_SPONLY.DESCRIPTION:
Executing the command or changing the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) is only allowed in singleplayer

Reported as "sp" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_UNLOGGED.DESCRIPTION:
Don't log the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) changes to console/log files/users

Reported as "log" by `cvarlist`

FCVAR_UNREGISTERED.DESCRIPTION: If this is set, the convar will become anonymous and won't show up in the 'find' results.

FCVAR_USERINFO.DESCRIPTION:
For clientside commands, sends the value to the server

Reported as "user" by `cvarlist`

FL_ONGROUND.DESCRIPTION: Is the entity on ground or not

FL_ANIMDUCKING.DESCRIPTION: Is the player in the process of ducking or standing up

FL_WATERJUMP.DESCRIPTION: The player is jumping out of water

FL_ONTRAIN.DESCRIPTION: This player is controlling a func_train

FL_INRAIN.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the entity is standing in rain

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Bots will still be able to look around.

FL_ATCONTROLS.DESCRIPTION: This player is controlling something UI related in the world, this prevents his movement, but doesn't freeze mouse movement, jumping, etc.

FL_CLIENT.DESCRIPTION: Is this entity a player or not

FL_INWATER.DESCRIPTION: Is the player in water or not

FL_NPC.DESCRIPTION: NPCs have this flag (NPC: Ignore player push)

FL_GODMODE.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player has god mode enabled

FL_NOTARGET.DESCRIPTION: Makes the entity invisible to AI

FL_AIMTARGET.DESCRIPTION: This entity can be aimed at

FL_GRAPHED.DESCRIPTION: worldgraph has this ent listed as something that blocks a connection

FL_GRENADE.DESCRIPTION: This entity is a grenade, unused

FL_STEPMOVEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Changes the SV_Movestep() behavior to not do any processing

FL_DONTTOUCH.DESCRIPTION: Doesn't generate touch functions, calls [ENTITY:EndTouch](/gmod/ENTITY:EndTouch) when this flag gets set during a touch callback

FL_BASEVELOCITY.DESCRIPTION: Base velocity has been applied this frame (used to convert base velocity into momentum)

FL_WORLDBRUSH.DESCRIPTION: This entity is a brush and part of the world

FL_OBJECT.DESCRIPTION: This entity can be seen by NPCs

FL_KILLME.DESCRIPTION: This entity is about to get removed

FL_TRANSRAGDOLL.DESCRIPTION: This entity is about to become a ragdoll

FL_UNBLOCKABLE_BY_PLAYER.DESCRIPTION: This moving door can't be blocked by the player

FORCE_STRING.DESCRIPTION: Forces the function to take [string](/gmod/string)s only

FORCE_NUMBER.DESCRIPTION: Forces the function to take [number](/gmod/number)s only

FORCE_BOOL.DESCRIPTION: Forces the function to take [boolean](/gmod/boolean)s only

FSOLID_CUSTOMRAYTEST.DESCRIPTION: Ignore solid type + always call into the entity for ray tests

FSOLID_CUSTOMBOXTEST.DESCRIPTION: Ignore solid type + always call into the entity for swept box tests

FSOLID_NOT_SOLID.DESCRIPTION: The object is currently not solid

FSOLID_TRIGGER.DESCRIPTION: This is something may be collideable but fires touch functions even when it's not collideable (when the FSOLID_NOT_SOLID flag is set)

FSOLID_NOT_STANDABLE.DESCRIPTION: The player can't stand on this

FSOLID_FORCE_WORLD_ALIGNED.DESCRIPTION: Forces the collision representation to be world-aligned even if it's SOLID_BSP or SOLID_VPHYSICS

FSOLID_USE_TRIGGER_BOUNDS.DESCRIPTION: Uses a special trigger bounds separate from the normal OBB

FSOLID_ROOT_PARENT_ALIGNED.DESCRIPTION: Collisions are defined in root parent's local coordinate space

FSOLID_TRIGGER_TOUCH_DEBRIS.DESCRIPTION: This trigger will touch debris objects

FSOLID_MAX_BITS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of bits needed to store the all the flags in a variable/sent over network.

FVPHYSICS_CONSTRAINT_STATIC.DESCRIPTION: Won't receive physics forces from collisions and won't collide with other [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) with the same flag set.

FVPHYSICS_DMG_DISSOLVE.DESCRIPTION: Colliding with entities will cause 1000 damage with DMG_DISSOLVE as the damage type, but only if EFL_NO_DISSOLVE is not set.

FVPHYSICS_DMG_SLICE.DESCRIPTION: Does slice damage, not just blunt damage.

FVPHYSICS_HEAVY_OBJECT.DESCRIPTION: Will deal high physics damage even with a small mass.

FVPHYSICS_MULTIOBJECT_ENTITY.DESCRIPTION: This [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) is part of an entity with multiple [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) , such as a ragdoll or a vehicle , and will be considered during collision damage events.

FVPHYSICS_NO_IMPACT_DMG.DESCRIPTION: Colliding with entities won't cause physics damage.

FVPHYSICS_NO_NPC_IMPACT_DMG.DESCRIPTION: Like FVPHYSICS_NO_NPC_IMPACT_DMG, but only checks for NPCs. Usually set on Combine Balls fired by Combine Soldiers.

FVPHYSICS_NO_PLAYER_PICKUP.DESCRIPTION: Doesn't allow the player to pick this [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) with the Gravity Gun or +use pickup.

FVPHYSICS_NO_SELF_COLLISIONS.DESCRIPTION: We won't collide with other [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) associated to the same entity, only used for vehicles and ragdolls held by the Super Gravity Gun.

FVPHYSICS_PART_OF_RAGDOLL.DESCRIPTION: This [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) is part of a ragdoll.

FVPHYSICS_PENETRATING.DESCRIPTION: Set by the physics engine when two [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) are penetrating each other. This is only automatically updated for non-static physics objects.

FVPHYSICS_PLAYER_HELD.DESCRIPTION: Set when the player is holding this [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) with the Physics Gun, Gravity Gun or +use pickup.

FVPHYSICS_WAS_THROWN.DESCRIPTION: This object was thrown by the Gravity Gun , stuns Antlion guards, Hunters, and squashes Antlion grubs.

GLOBAL_OFF.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [game.SetGlobalState](/gmod/game.SetGlobalState) and [game.GetGlobalState](/gmod/game.GetGlobalState).

Serverside only.
GLOBAL_OFF.DESCRIPTION: Initial state, the global state is off.

GLOBAL_ON.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [game.SetGlobalState](/gmod/game.SetGlobalState) and [game.GetGlobalState](/gmod/game.GetGlobalState).

Serverside only.

GLOBAL_DEAD.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by [game.SetGlobalState](/gmod/game.SetGlobalState) and [game.GetGlobalState](/gmod/game.GetGlobalState).

Serverside only.
GLOBAL_DEAD.DESCRIPTION: The global state is dead and is no longer active. It will be cleared.

HITGROUP_GENERIC.BASE_DESCRIPTION: Enumerations used by [GM:ScalePlayerDamage](/gmod/GM:ScalePlayerDamage) and [GM:ScaleNPCDamage](/gmod/GM:ScaleNPCDamage) and returned by [Player:LastHitGroup](/gmod/Player:LastHitGroup).
HITGROUP_GENERIC.DESCRIPTION:
1:1 damage. Melee weapons and fall damage typically hit this hitgroup.

This hitgroup is not present on default player models.

It is unknown how this is generated in [GM:ScalePlayerDamage](/gmod/GM:ScalePlayerDamage), but it occurs when shot by NPCs ( npc_combine_s ) for example.

IN_ATTACK.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Unlike [BUTTON_CODE](/gmod/Enums/BUTTON_CODE), these enums are abstracted to allow the user to bind actions to any key they might prefer.

Keybinds using these actions work with two console commands, one starting with a plus and one with a minus symbol. A key press or release will call either the plus or minus command, adding or removing the corresponding enum in the current [CUserCmd](/gmod/CUserCmd).

Enumerations used by:

* [Player:KeyDown](/gmod/Player:KeyDown)

kRenderFxNone.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

Most of these require alpha value of entitys color to be less than 255 to have any visible effect.

kRenderFxPulseSlow.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

Most of these require alpha value of entitys color to be less than 255 to have any visible effect.
kRenderFxPulseSlow.DESCRIPTION: Slowly pulses the entitys transparency, +-15 to the current alpha.

kRenderFxPulseFast.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

Most of these require alpha value of entitys color to be less than 255 to have any visible effect.
kRenderFxPulseFast.DESCRIPTION: Quickly pulses the entitys transparency, +-15 to the current alpha.

kRenderFxPulseSlowWide.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

kRenderFxPulseSlowWide.DESCRIPTION: Slowly pulses the entitys transparency, +-60 to the current alpha.

kRenderFxPulseFastWide.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

Most of these require alpha value of entitys color to be less than 255 to have any visible effect.
kRenderFxPulseFastWide.DESCRIPTION: Quickly pulses the entitys transparency, +-60 to the current alpha.

kRenderFxFadeSlow.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

Most of these require alpha value of entitys color to be less than 255 to have any visible effect.
kRenderFxFadeSlow.DESCRIPTION:
Slowly fades away the entity, making it completely invisible.

Starts from whatever alpha the entity currently has set.

kRenderFxFadeFast.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Used by [Entity:SetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderFX) and returned by [Entity:GetRenderFX](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderFX).

kRenderFxFadeFast.DESCRIPTION:

kRenderFxSolidSlow.DESCRIPTION:

MAT_BLOODYFLESH.DESCRIPTION: Similar to MAT_FLESH, only used by "bloodyflesh" surface property, has different impact sound

MAT_EGGSHELL.DESCRIPTION: The egg sacs in the antlion tunnels in HL2: EP2

MAT_FOLIAGE.DESCRIPTION: Plants, only used by the "foliage" surface property

MAT_COMPUTER.DESCRIPTION: Electronics, only used by "computer" surface property

MATERIAL_FOG_NONE.BASE_DESCRIPTION: Enumerations used by [render.GetFogMode](/gmod/render.GetFogMode) and [render.FogMode](/gmod/render.FogMode). Clientside only.

MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR.BASE_DESCRIPTION: Enumerations used by [render.GetFogMode](/gmod/render.GetFogMode) and [render.FogMode](/gmod/render.FogMode). Clientside only.

MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR_BELOW_FOG_Z.BASE_DESCRIPTION: Enumerations used by [render.GetFogMode](/gmod/render.GetFogMode) and [render.FogMode](/gmod/render.FogMode). Clientside only.
MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR_BELOW_FOG_Z.DESCRIPTION: For use in conjunction with [render.SetFogZ](/gmod/render.SetFogZ). Does not work if start distance is bigger than end distance. Ignores density setting. Seems to be broken? Used for underwater fog by the engine.

MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SHARED.DESCRIPTION: Do not create a depth-stencil buffer.Use the default depth-stencil buffer if used as render target 0.

MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SEPARATE.DESCRIPTION: Create a depth-stencil buffer.Use the created depth-stencil buffer if used as render target 0.

MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_NONE.DESCRIPTION: Do not create a depth-stencil buffer.Disable depth and stencil buffer usage if used as render target 0.

MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_ONLY.DESCRIPTION:
Create a depth-stencil buffer.Use the created depth-stencil buffer if used as render target 0.

Creates a color texture despite the name.

Seems to behave the same as MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SEPARATE.

MOUSE_FIRST.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations used by:

* [input.IsMouseDown](/gmod/input.IsMouseDown)

* [input.WasMousePressed](/gmod/input.WasMousePressed)

* [input.WasMouseDoublePressed](/gmod/input.WasMouseDoublePressed)

It's also part of the [BUTTON_CODE](/gmod/Enums/BUTTON_CODE).

# Catch mouse wheel

You can catch the mouse wheel's value by:

```

local testVal = 0

hook.Add("InputMouseApply", "testMouseWheel", function(cmd, x, y, ang)

    testVal = testVal + cmd:GetMouseWheel() * 2 --any scale number you want to use

    print(testVal)

end)

```

MOVECOLLIDE_FLY_BOUNCE.DESCRIPTION: Entity bounces, reflects, based on elasticity of surface and object - applies friction (adjust velocity)

MOVECOLLIDE_FLY_CUSTOM.DESCRIPTION: [ENTITY:Touch](/gmod/ENTITY:Touch) will modify the velocity however it likes

MOVECOLLIDE_FLY_SLIDE.DESCRIPTION: Entity slides along surfaces (no bounce) - applies friciton (adjusts velocity)

MOVETYPE_ISOMETRIC.DESCRIPTION: For players, in TF2 commander view, etc

MOVETYPE_WALK.DESCRIPTION: Player only, moving on the ground

MOVETYPE_PUSH.DESCRIPTION: No clip to world, but pushes and crushes things. Need ent:SetSaveValue("m_flMoveDoneTime", somenumberbiggerthancurtime) or the entity won't move.

MOVETYPE_LADDER.DESCRIPTION: For players, when moving on a ladder

MOVETYPE_OBSERVER.DESCRIPTION: Spectator movetype. DO **NOT** use this to make player spectate

MOVETYPE_CUSTOM.DESCRIPTION: Custom movetype, can be applied to the player to prevent the default movement code from running, while still calling the related hooks

NAV_MESH_CROUCH.DESCRIPTION: Must crouch to use this node/area

NAV_MESH_JUMP.DESCRIPTION: Must jump to traverse this area (only used during generation)

NAV_MESH_PRECISE.DESCRIPTION: Do not adjust for obstacles, just move along area

NAV_MESH_STOP.DESCRIPTION: Must stop when entering this area

NAV_MESH_RUN.DESCRIPTION: Must run to traverse this area

NAV_MESH_WALK.DESCRIPTION: Must walk to traverse this area

NAV_MESH_AVOID.DESCRIPTION: Avoid this area unless alternatives are too dangerous

NAV_MESH_TRANSIENT.DESCRIPTION: Area may become blocked, and should be periodically checked

NAV_MESH_DONT_HIDE.DESCRIPTION: Area should not be considered for hiding spot generation

NAV_MESH_STAND.DESCRIPTION: Bots hiding in this area should stand

NAV_MESH_STAIRS.DESCRIPTION: This area represents stairs, do not attempt to climb or jump them - just walk up

NAV_MESH_NO_MERGE.DESCRIPTION: Don't merge this area with adjacent areas

NAV_MESH_OBSTACLE_TOP.DESCRIPTION: This nav area is the climb point on the tip of an obstacle

NAV_MESH_CLIFF.DESCRIPTION: This nav area is adjacent to a drop of at least CliffHeight

NAV_MESH_FUNC_COST.DESCRIPTION: Area has designer specified cost controlled by func_nav_cost entities

NAV_MESH_HAS_ELEVATOR.DESCRIPTION: Area is in an elevator's path

NORTH_WEST.BASE_DESCRIPTION:

RENDERGROUP_OPAQUE_BRUSH.BASE_DESCRIPTION: Enumerations used by [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel), ENT.RenderGroup in [ENT](/gmod/Structures/ENT) and [Entity:GetRenderGroup](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderGroup).

RENDERGROUP_OTHER.BASE_DESCRIPTION: Enumerations used by [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel), ENT.RenderGroup in [ENT](/gmod/Structures/ENT) and [Entity:GetRenderGroup](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderGroup).

RENDERMODE_NORMAL.DESCRIPTION: Default render mode. Transparently has no effect.

RENDERMODE_TRANSCOLOR.DESCRIPTION:
Supports transparency.

Use this to make alpha of [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) work for your entity. For players, it must be set for their active weapon aswell.

RENDERMODE_GLOW.DESCRIPTION:
Intended for glowing sprites. Allows transparency, and forces the sprite or model to be rendered unlit.

The size of a sprite rendered with Glow is consistent with the screen size (unlike the alternative World Space Glow), making it appear larger at a distance, in comparison to the world.

The GlowProxySize keyvalue affects this Render Mode on sprites.

RENDERMODE_TRANSALPHA.DESCRIPTION: Enables Alphatesting. Legacy port from Goldsource. Obsolete in Source due to Alphatesting being handled in materials. Does not allow transparency.

RENDERMODE_TRANSADD.DESCRIPTION: Add the material's color values to the existing image, instead of performing a multiplication. Sprites will appear through world geometry and the sprite/model will always brighten the world. Allows transparency.

RENDERMODE_ENVIROMENTAL.DESCRIPTION: Causes the material to be not be drawn at all, similarly to Don't Render.

RENDERMODE_TRANSADDFRAMEBLEND.DESCRIPTION: Functions like Additive, but also blends between animation frames. Requires the material to have a functioning animating texture. Allows transparency.

RENDERMODE_TRANSALPHADD.DESCRIPTION: Functions similarly to Additive, except that the alpha channel controls the opacity of the sprite. An example of use is for dark sprites, with an example material being sprites/strider_blackball.vmt.

RENDERMODE_WORLDGLOW.DESCRIPTION:
Functions similarly to Glow, with the exception that the size of the sprite is relative to the world rather than the screen.

The GlowProxySize keyvalue affects this Render Mode on sprites.

RENDERMODE_NONE.DESCRIPTION:
The entity is still being drawn and networked albeit invisible, therefore not making this Render Mode ideal for performance reasons.

To completely avoid drawing and networking an entity, see EF_NODRAW.

RT_SIZE_NO_CHANGE.DESCRIPTION: Only allowed for render targets that don't want a depth buffer (because if they have a depth buffer, the render target must be less than or equal to the size of the framebuffer).

RT_SIZE_DEFAULT.DESCRIPTION: Don't play with the specified width and height other than making sure it fits in the framebuffer.

RT_SIZE_PICMIP.DESCRIPTION: Apply picmip to the render target's width and height.

RT_SIZE_FULL_FRAME_BUFFER.DESCRIPTION: Same size as frame buffer, or next lower power of 2 if we can't do that.

RT_SIZE_OFFSCREEN.DESCRIPTION: Target of specified size, don't mess with dimensions

RT_SIZE_FULL_FRAME_BUFFER_ROUNDED_UP.DESCRIPTION: Same size as the frame buffer, rounded up if necessary for systems that can't do non-power of two textures.

RT_SIZE_REPLAY_SCREENSHOT.DESCRIPTION: Rounded down to power of 2, essentially

RT_SIZE_LITERAL.DESCRIPTION: Use the size passed in. Don't clamp it to the frame buffer size. Really.

SF_CITIZEN_AMMORESUPPLIER.BASE_DESCRIPTION:
Enumerations describing certain spawnflags. Everything except for SF_PHYS* and SF_WEAPON* is serverside only.

Spawnflags are set using [Entity:SetKeyValue](/gmod/Entity:SetKeyValue) with **"spawnflags"** as the key.

* SF_CITIZEN_* spawnflags represent spawnflags only usable on [npc_citizen](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Npc_citizen).

* SF_NPC_* - Usable on all NPCs

* SF_PHYSBOX_* - Usable on [func_physbox](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Func_physbox)

* SF_PHYSPROP_* - Usable on [prop_physics](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Prop_physics) entities

* SF_WEAPON_* - Usable on [Weapons](/gmod/Weapon)

SOLID_BSP.DESCRIPTION: The entity has a brush model defined by the map. Does not collide with other SOLID_BSP entities.

SOLID_BBOX.DESCRIPTION: Uses the entity's axis-aligned bounding box for collisions.

SOLID_OBB.DESCRIPTION: Uses the entity's object-aligned bounding box for collisions.

SOLID_OBB_YAW.DESCRIPTION: Same as SOLID_OBB but restricts orientation to the Z-axis.
NOTES: Seems to be broken.

SOLID_CUSTOM.DESCRIPTION: Always call the entity's `ICollideable::TestCollision` method for traces regardless of the presence of `FSOLID_CUSTOMRAYTEST` or `FSOLID_CUSTOMBOXTEST`. This will only be called back to Lua as [Entity:TestCollision](/gmod/Entity:TestCollision) for `"anim"` type SENTs.

SOUND_CONTEXT_COMBINE_ONLY.DESCRIPTION: Only combine can hear sounds marked this way

SOUND_CONTEXT_REACT_TO_SOURCE.DESCRIPTION: React to sound source's origin, not sound's location

SOUND_CONTEXT_DANGER_APPROACH.DESCRIPTION: Treat as a normal danger sound if you see the source, otherwise turn to face source.

SOUND_CONTEXT_ALLIES_ONLY.DESCRIPTION: Only player allies can hear this sound

SOUND_CONTEXT_PLAYER_VEHICLE.DESCRIPTION: HACK: need this because we're not treating the SOUND_xxx values as true bit values! See switch in OnListened.

STUDIO_RENDER.DESCRIPTION: The current render is for opaque renderables only

STUDIO_DRAWTRANSLUCENTSUBMODELS.DESCRIPTION: The current render is for translucent renderables only

STUDIO_TWOPASS.DESCRIPTION: The current render is for both opaque and translucent renderables

STUDIO_GENERATE_STATS.DESCRIPTION: Not a studio flag, but used to flag when we want studio stats

STUDIO_SSAODEPTHTEXTURE.DESCRIPTION: Not a studio flag, but used to flag model as using shadow depth material override

SURF_LIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Value will hold the light strength

SURF_SKY.DESCRIPTION: This surface is a skybox, equivalent to HitSky in [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

SURF_NOPORTAL.DESCRIPTION: This surface cannot have portals placed on, used by Portal's gun

SURF_NODRAW.DESCRIPTION: This surface is an invisible entity, equivalent to HitNoDraw in [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

SURF_SKIP.DESCRIPTION: This surface can be ignored by impact effects

SURF_NOLIGHT.DESCRIPTION: This surface has no lights calculated

SURF_BUMPLIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Calculate three lightmaps for the surface for bumpmapping

SURF_NOSHADOWS.DESCRIPTION: No shadows are cast on this surface

SURF_NODECALS.DESCRIPTION: No decals are applied to this surface

SURF_NOCHOP.DESCRIPTION: Don't subdivide patches on this surface

SURF_HITBOX.DESCRIPTION: This surface is part of an entity's hitbox
