WEAPON_PROFICIENCY_POOR.DESCRIPTION: The NPC will miss a large majority of their shots.

WEAPON_PROFICIENCY_AVERAGE.DESCRIPTION: The NPC will miss about half of their shots.

WEAPON_PROFICIENCY_GOOD.DESCRIPTION: The NPC will sometimes miss their shots.

WEAPON_PROFICIENCY_VERY_GOOD.DESCRIPTION: The NPC will rarely miss their shots.

WEAPON_PROFICIENCY_PERFECT.DESCRIPTION: The NPC will almost never miss their shots.

Add.DESCRIPTION:
Adds the values of the argument angle to the orignal angle. 

This functions the same as angle1 + angle2 without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to add.

Div.DESCRIPTION: Divides all values of the original angle by a scalar. This functions the same as angle1 / num without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scalar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number to divide by.

Forward.DESCRIPTION: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that the angle points.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The forward direction of the angle

IsZero.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the pitch, yaw and roll are 0 or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the pitch, yaw and roll are 0 or not.

Mul.DESCRIPTION: Multiplies a scalar to all the values of the orignal angle. This functions the same as num * angle without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scalar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number to multiply.

Normalize.DESCRIPTION: Normalizes the angles by applying a module with 360 to pitch, yaw and roll.

Right.DESCRIPTION: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points right relative to the angle's direction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The right direction of the angle

RotateAroundAxis.DESCRIPTION: Rotates the angle around the specified axis by the specified degrees.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: axis
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The axis to rotate around.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rotation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The degrees to rotate around the specified axis.

Set.DESCRIPTION: Copies pitch, yaw and roll from the second angle to the first.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: originalAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to copy the values from.

SetUnpacked.DESCRIPTION: Sets the p, y, and r of the angle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: p
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pitch component of the Angle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The yaw component of the Angle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The roll component of the Angle

SnapTo.DESCRIPTION: Snaps the angle to nearest interval of degrees.
NOTES: This will modify the original angle too!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: axis
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The component/axis to snap. Can be either "p"/"pitch", "y"/"yaw" or "r"/"roll".

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target angle snap interval

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The snapped angle.

Sub.DESCRIPTION: Subtracts the values of the argument angle to the orignal angle. This functions the same as angle1 - angle2 without creating a new angle object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to subtract.

ToTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angle as a table with three elements.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table with elements 1 = p, 2 = y, 3 = r.

Unpack.DESCRIPTION: Returns the pitch, yaw, and roll components of the angle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: p, pitch, x, or Angle[1].
y, yaw, or Angle[2].
r, roll, r, or Angle[3].

Up.DESCRIPTION: Returns a normal vector facing in the direction that points up relative to the angle's direction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The up direction of the angle.

Zero.DESCRIPTION:
Sets pitch, yaw and roll to 0.
This function is faster than doing it manually.

Angle.DESCRIPTION:
List of all possible functions to manipulate angles.

Created by [Angle](/gmod/Global.Angle).

| Type                | Name                                 | Description                      |

| ------------------- | ------------------------------------ | -------------------------------- |

| [number](/gmod/number) | `p` or `pitch` or `x` or `1` | The pitch component of the angle |

| [number](/gmod/number) | `y` or `yaw` or `y` or `2` | The yaw component of the angle |

| [number](/gmod/number) | `r` or `roll`  or `z` or `3` | The roll  component of the angle |

Metamethod | Second Operand | Description

---------- | -------------- | -----------

`__add` | [Angle](/gmod/Angle) | Returns new [Angle](/gmod/Angle) with the result of addition.

`__div` | [number](/gmod/number) | Returns new [Angle](/gmod/Angle) with the result of division.

`__eq` | [any](/gmod/any) | Compares 2 operands, if they both are [Angle](/gmod/Angle), compares each individual component. Doesn't normalize the angles (360 is not equal to 0).

`__index` | [number](/gmod/number) or [string](/gmod/string) | Gets the component of the [angle](/gmod/angle). Returns a number.

`__mul` | [number](/gmod/number) | Returns new [Angle](/gmod/Angle) with the result of multiplication.

`__newindex` | [number](/gmod/number) or [string](/gmod/string) | Sets the component of the [angle](/gmod/angle). Accepts [number](/gmod/number) and [string](/gmod/string).

`__sub` | [Angle](/gmod/Angle) | Returns new [Angle](/gmod/Angle) with the result of subtraction.

`__tostring` | | Returns `p y r`.

`__unm` | | Returns new Vector with the result of negation.

ReadAngle.DESCRIPTION: Reads an returns an angle object from the bitstream.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The read angle

ReadBool.DESCRIPTION: Reads 1 bit an returns a bool representing the bit.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: bit

ReadChar.DESCRIPTION: Reads a signed char and returns a number from -127 to 127 representing the ascii value of that char.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: asciiVal

ReadEntity.DESCRIPTION: Reads a short representing an entity index and returns the matching entity handle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: ent

ReadFloat.DESCRIPTION: Reads a 4 byte float from the bitstream and returns it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: float

ReadLong.DESCRIPTION: Reads a 4 byte long from the bitstream and returns it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: int

ReadShort.DESCRIPTION: Reads a 2 byte short from the bitstream and returns it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: short

ReadString.DESCRIPTION: Reads a null terminated string from the bitstream.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: str

ReadVector.DESCRIPTION: Reads a special encoded vector from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send normals.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: vec

ReadVectorNormal.DESCRIPTION: Reads a special encoded vector normal from the bitstream and returns it, this function is not suitable to send vectors that represent a position.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: normal

Reset.DESCRIPTION: Rewinds the bitstream so it can be read again.

bf_read.DESCRIPTION: This is the object passed to [usermessage.Hook](/gmod/usermessage.Hook) when a message is received. It contains each value stored in the message in sequential order. You should read values from it in the order you wrote them.
DEPRECATED: You should be using net instead

GetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angles of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the effect

GetAttachment.DESCRIPTION: Returns the attachment ID for the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The attachment ID of the effect.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns byte which represents the color of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the effect

GetDamageType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the damage type of the effect

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Damage type of the effect, see [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG)

GetEntIndex.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity index of the entity set for the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity index of the entity set for the effect.

GetEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity assigned to the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity assigned to the effect

GetFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns the flags of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The flags of the effect.

GetHitBox.DESCRIPTION: Returns the hit box ID of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hit box ID of the effect.

GetMagnitude.DESCRIPTION: Returns the magnitude of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The magnitude of the effect.

GetMaterialIndex.DESCRIPTION: Returns the material ID of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The material ID of the effect.

GetNormal.DESCRIPTION: Returns the normalized direction vector of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The normalized direction vector of the effect.

GetOrigin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the origin position of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The origin position of the effect.

GetRadius.DESCRIPTION: Returns the radius of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The radius of the effect.

GetScale.DESCRIPTION: Returns the scale of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The scale of the effect

GetStart.DESCRIPTION: Returns the start position of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the effect

GetSurfaceProp.DESCRIPTION: Returns the surface property index of the effect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The surface property index of the effect

SetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets the angles of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new angles to be set.

SetAttachment.DESCRIPTION: Sets the attachment id of the effect to be created with this effect data.
NOTES: This is internally stored as an integer, but only the first 5 bits will be networked, effectively limiting this function to 0-31 range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New attachment ID of the effect.

SetColor.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the "color" of the effect.

All this does is provide an addition 8 bits of data for the effect to use. What this will actually do will vary from effect to effect, depending on how a specific effect uses this given data, if at all.
NOTES: Internally stored as an integer, but only first 8 bits are networked, effectively limiting this function to 0-255 range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Color represented by a byte.

SetDamageType.DESCRIPTION: Sets the damage type of the effect to be created with this effect data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage type, see [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG).

SetEntIndex.DESCRIPTION: Sets the entity of the effect via its index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity index to be set.

SetEntity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the entity of the effect to be created with this effect data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity of the effect, mostly used for parenting.

SetFlags.DESCRIPTION: Sets the flags of the effect.
NOTES: Internally stored as an integer, but only first 8 bits are networked, effectively limiting this function to 0-255 range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flags of the effect. Each effect has their own flags.

SetHitBox.DESCRIPTION: Sets the hit box index of the effect.
NOTES: Internally stored as an integer, but only first 11 bits are networked, effectively limiting this function to 0-2047 range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitBoxIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hit box index of the effect.

SetMagnitude.DESCRIPTION: Sets the magnitude of the effect.
NOTES: Internally stored as a float with 12 bit precision for networking purposes, limited to range of 0-1023.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: magnitude
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The magnitude of the effect.

SetMaterialIndex.DESCRIPTION: Sets the material index of the effect.
NOTES: Internally stored as an integer, but only first 12 bits are networked, effectively limiting this function to 0-4095 range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material index of the effect.

SetNormal.DESCRIPTION: Sets the normalized (length=1) direction vector of the effect to be created with this effect data. This **must** be a normalized vector for networking purposes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: normal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The normalized direction vector of the effect.

SetOrigin.DESCRIPTION: Sets the origin of the effect to be created with this effect data.
NOTES: Limited to world bounds (+-16386 on every axis) and has horrible networking precision. (17 bit float per component)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Origin of the effect.

SetRadius.DESCRIPTION: Sets the radius of the effect to be created with this effect data.
NOTES: Internally stored as a float, but networked as a 10bit float, and is clamped to 0-1023 range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Radius of the effect.

SetScale.DESCRIPTION: Sets the scale of the effect to be created with this effect data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Scale of the effect.

SetStart.DESCRIPTION: Sets the start of the effect to be created with this effect data.
NOTES: Limited to world bounds (+-16386 on every axis) and has horrible networking precision. (17 bit float per component)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: start
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Start of the effect.

SetSurfaceProp.DESCRIPTION: Sets the surface property index of the effect.
NOTES: Internally stored as an integer, but only first 8 bits are networked, effectively limiting this function to `-1`-`254` range.(yes, that's not a mistake)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: surfaceProperties
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The surface property index of the effect.

CEffectData.DESCRIPTION: List of all possible functions available for effect data. This is the object returned by the [EffectData](/gmod/Global.EffectData) function and is required for [util.Effect](/gmod/util.Effect) function.

Add.DESCRIPTION: Creates a new [CLuaParticle](/gmod/CLuaParticle) with the given material and position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The particles material. Can also be an [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to spawn the particle on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created particle, if any.

Draw.DESCRIPTION: Manually renders all particles the emitter has created.

Finish.DESCRIPTION: Removes the emitter, making it no longer usable from Lua. If particles remain, the emitter will be removed when all particles die.

GetNumActiveParticles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of active particles of this emitter.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of active particles of this emitter

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of this emitter. This is set when creating the emitter with [ParticleEmitter](/gmod/Global.ParticleEmitter).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Position of this particle emitter.

Is3D.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this emitter is 3D or not. This is set when creating the emitter with [ParticleEmitter](/gmod/Global.ParticleEmitter).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this emitter is 3D or not.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CLuaEmitter](/gmod/CLuaEmitter) is valid or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CLuaEmitter](/gmod/CLuaEmitter) is valid or not.

SetBBox.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the bounding box for this emitter.

Usually the bounding box is automatically determined by the particles, but this function overrides it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum position of the box

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum position of the box

SetNearClip.DESCRIPTION: This function sets the the distance between the render camera and the emitter at which the particles should start fading and at which distance fade ends ( alpha becomes 0 ).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distanceMin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Min distance where the alpha becomes 0.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distanceMax
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Max distance where the alpha starts fading.

SetNoDraw.DESCRIPTION: Prevents all particles of the emitter from automatically drawing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: noDraw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we should draw the particles ( false ) or not ( true )

SetParticleCullRadius.DESCRIPTION: The function name has not much in common with its actual function, it applies a radius to every particles that affects the building of the bounding box, as it, usually is constructed by the particle that has the lowest x, y and z and the highest x, y and z, this function just adds/subtracts the radius and inflates the bounding box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Particle radius.

SetPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets the position of the particle emitter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New position.

CLuaEmitter.DESCRIPTION: List of all possible functions available for LuaEmitters. This is the object returned by the [ParticleEmitter](/gmod/Global.ParticleEmitter) function.

Approach.DESCRIPTION: Sets the location we want to get to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: goal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector we want to get to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: goalweight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If unsure then set this to 1

ClearStuck.DESCRIPTION: Removes the stuck status from the bot

FaceTowards.DESCRIPTION: Sets the direction we want to face

ARGUMENTS.NAME: goal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector we want to face

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current acceleration speed

GetCurrentAcceleration.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current acceleration as a vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current acceleration

GetDeathDropHeight.DESCRIPTION: Gets the height the bot is scared to fall from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current death drop height
Current deceleration speed
The gravity.

GetGroundMotionVector.DESCRIPTION: Return unit vector in XY plane describing our direction of motion - even if we are currently not moving

GetJumpHeight.DESCRIPTION: Gets the height of the bot's jump

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current jump height

GetMaxJumpHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns maximum jump height of this [CLuaLocomotion](/gmod/CLuaLocomotion).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum jump height.

GetMaxYawRate.DESCRIPTION: Returns the max rate at which the NextBot can visually rotate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Maximum yaw rate

GetNextBot.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [NextBot](/gmod/NextBot) this locomotion is associated with.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The nextbot

GetStepHeight.DESCRIPTION: Gets the max height the bot can step up

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current step height

GetVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current movement velocity as a vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current velocity

IsAreaTraversable.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CLuaLocomotion](/gmod/CLuaLocomotion) can reach and/or traverse/move in given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The area to test

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CLuaLocomotion](/gmod/CLuaLocomotion) can traverse given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

IsAttemptingToMove.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if we're trying to move.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we're trying to move or not.

IsClimbingOrJumping.DESCRIPTION: Returns true of the locomotion engine is jumping or climbing

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we're climbing or jumping or not

IsOnGround.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the nextbot this locomotion is attached to is on ground or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the nextbot is on ground or not.
Whether we're stuck or not

IsUsingLadder.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the target in question is on a ladder or not.

Jump.DESCRIPTION: Makes the bot jump. It must be on ground ([Entity:IsOnGround](/gmod/Entity:IsOnGround)) and its model must have `ACT_JUMP` activity.

JumpAcrossGap.DESCRIPTION: Makes the bot jump across a gap. The bot must be on ground ([Entity:IsOnGround](/gmod/Entity:IsOnGround)) and its model must have `ACT_JUMP` activity.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Speed acceleration (default is 400)

CLuaLocomotion.DESCRIPTION: This class is essentially what controls a [NextBot](/gmod/NextBot) NPC. You can access it in a [NextBot](/gmod/NextBot) NPC by using **self.loco** variable.

GetAirResistance.DESCRIPTION: Returns the air resistance of the particle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The air resistance of the particle

GetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current orientation of the particle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the particle

GetAngleVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angular velocity of the particle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angular velocity of the particle

The 'bounciness' of the particle

2 means it will gain 100% of its previous velocity,

1 means it will not lose velocity,

0.5 means it will lose half of its velocity with each bounce.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color of the particle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Red part of the color
Green part of the color
Blue part of the color

GetDieTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of time in seconds after which the particle will be destroyed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of time in seconds after which the particle will be destroyed

GetEndAlpha.DESCRIPTION: Returns the alpha value that the particle will reach on its death.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The alpha value the particle will fade to

GetEndLength.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length that the particle will reach on its death.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The length the particle will reach

GetEndSize.DESCRIPTION: Returns the size that the particle will reach on its death.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The size the particle will reach

GetGravity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the gravity of the particle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The gravity of the particle.

GetLifeTime.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the 'life time' of the particle, how long the particle existed since its creation.

This value will always be between 0 and [CLuaParticle:GetDieTime](/gmod/CLuaParticle:GetDieTime).

It changes automatically as time goes.

It can be manipulated using [CLuaParticle:SetLifeTime](/gmod/CLuaParticle:SetLifeTime).

If the life time of the particle will be more than [CLuaParticle:GetDieTime](/gmod/CLuaParticle:GetDieTime), it will be removed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: How long the particle existed, in seconds.

GetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current material of the particle.

RETURNS.NAME: mat
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The material.

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the absolute position of the particle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The absolute position of the particle.

GetRoll.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current rotation of the particle in radians, this should only be used for 2D particles.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current rotation of the particle in radians

GetRollDelta.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current rotation speed of the particle in radians, this should only be used for 2D particles.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current rotation speed of the particle in radians

GetStartAlpha.DESCRIPTION: Returns the alpha value which the particle has when it's created.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The alpha value which the particle has when it's created.

GetStartLength.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length which the particle has when it's created.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The length which the particle has when it's created.

GetStartSize.DESCRIPTION: Returns the size which the particle has when it's created.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The size which the particle has when it's created.

GetVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current velocity of the particle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current velocity of the particle.

New 'bounciness' of the particle

2 means it will gain 100% of its previous velocity,

1 means it will not lose velocity,

0.5 means it will lose half of its velocity with each bounce.

SetMaxClientSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the maximum player speed. Player won't be able to run or sprint faster then this value.

This also automatically sets [CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed) when used in the [GM:SetupMove](/gmod/GM:SetupMove) hook. You must set it manually in the [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move) hook.

This must be called on both client and server to avoid prediction errors.

This will **not** reduce speed in air.
NOTES: Setting this to 0 will not make the player stationary. It won't do anything.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum speed

SetMaxSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the maximum speed of the player. This must match with [CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed](/gmod/CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed) both, on server and client.

Doesn't seem to be doing anything on it's own, use [CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed](/gmod/CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed) instead.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum speed

CMoveData.DESCRIPTION:
A class used to store the inputs from [CUserCmd](/gmod/CUserCmd) and other information related to the current movement simulation, such as velocity, position and so on.

This can only be accessed during [GM:SetupMove](/gmod/GM:SetupMove) , [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move) , [GM:PlayerTick](/gmod/GM:PlayerTick) and [GM:FinishMove](/gmod/GM:FinishMove).

AddHidingSpot.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a hiding spot onto this nav area.

There's a limit of 255 hiding spots per area.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position on the nav area

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Flags describing what kind of hiding spot this is.
* 0 = None (Not recommended)
* 1 = In Cover/basically a hiding spot, in a corner with good hard cover nearby
* 2 = good sniper spot, had at least one decent sniping corridor
* 4 = perfect sniper spot, can see either very far, or a large area, or both
* 8 = exposed, spot in the open, usually on a ledge or cliff

Values over 255 will be clamped.

AddToClosedList.DESCRIPTION:
Adds this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to the closed list, a list of areas that have been checked by A* pathfinding algorithm.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

AddToOpenList.DESCRIPTION:
Adds this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to the Open List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

ClearSearchLists.DESCRIPTION:
Clears the open and closed lists for a new search.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

ComputeAdjacentConnectionHeightChange.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height difference between the edges of two connected navareas.

ComputeDirection.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir) direction that the given vector faces on this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to compute direction towards.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The direction the vector is in relation to this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea). See [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir).

ComputeGroundHeightChange.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height difference on the Z axis of the two [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s. This is calculated from the center most point on both [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navArea
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The nav area to test against.

ConnectTo.DESCRIPTION:
Connects this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to another [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) or [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) with a one way connection. ( From this area to the target )

See [CNavLadder:ConnectTo](/gmod/CNavLadder:ConnectTo) for making the connection from ladder to area.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) or [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) this area leads to.

Contains.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) contains the given vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to test.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the vector was inside and false otherwise.

Disconnect.DESCRIPTION: Disconnects this nav area from given area or ladder. (Only disconnects one way)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) or [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) this to disconnect from.

Draw.DESCRIPTION: Draws this navarea on debug overlay.

DrawSpots.DESCRIPTION: Draws the hiding spots on debug overlay. This includes sniper/exposed spots too!

GetAdjacentAreas.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of all the [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a  ( one and two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

If an area has a one-way incoming connection to this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea), then it will **not** be returned from this function, use [CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections](/gmod/CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections) to get all one-way incoming connections.

See [CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreasAtSide](/gmod/CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreasAtSide) for a function that only returns areas from one side/direction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of all [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) that have a ( one and two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea). 

Returns an empty table if this area has no outgoing connections to any other areas.

GetAdjacentAreasAtSide.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of all the [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a ( one and two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

If an area has a one-way incoming connection to this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea), then it will **not** be returned from this function, use [CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections](/gmod/CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections) to get all incoming connections.

See [CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas](/gmod/CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas) for a function that returns all areas from all sides/directions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction, in which to look for [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s, see [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of all [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) that have a ( one and two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

Returns an empty table if this area has no outgoing connections to any other areas in given direction.

GetAdjacentCount.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the amount of [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a connection ( one and two way ) **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

See [CNavArea:GetAdjacentCountAtSide](/gmod/CNavArea:GetAdjacentCountAtSide) for a function that only returns area count from one side/direction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a connection ( one and two way ) **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

GetAdjacentCountAtSide.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the amount of [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a connection ( one or two way ) **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

See [CNavArea:GetAdjacentCount](/gmod/CNavArea:GetAdjacentCount) for a function that returns [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) count from/in all sides/directions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction, in which to look for [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s, see [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a connection ( one or two way ) **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

GetAttributes.DESCRIPTION: Returns the attribute mask for the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Attribute mask for this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea), see [NAV_MESH](/gmod/Enums/NAV_MESH) for the specific flags.
NOTES: A navmesh that was generated with nav_quicksave set to 1 will have all CNavAreas attribute masks set to 0

GetCenter.DESCRIPTION: Returns the center most vector point for the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The center vector.

GetClosestPointOnArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the closest point of this Nav Area from the given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The given position, can be outside of the Nav Area bounds.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The closest position on this Nav Area.

GetCorner.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vector position of the corner for the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cornerid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target corner to get the position of, takes [NavCorner](/gmod/Enums/NavCorner).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The corner position.

GetCostSoFar.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the cost from starting area this area when pathfinding. Set by [CNavArea:SetCostSoFar](/gmod/CNavArea:SetCostSoFar).

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The cost so far.

GetExposedSpots.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of very bad hiding spots in this area.

See also [CNavArea:GetHidingSpots](/gmod/CNavArea:GetHidingSpots).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of [Vector](/gmod/Vector)s

GetExtentInfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns size info about the nav area.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table containing the following keys:
* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) hi|
* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) lo|
* [number](/gmod/number) SizeX|
* [number](/gmod/number) SizeY|
* [number](/gmod/number) SizeZ|

GetHidingSpots.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of good hiding spots in this area.

See also [CNavArea:GetExposedSpots](/gmod/CNavArea:GetExposedSpots).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The type of spots to include.

* 0 = None (Not recommended)
* 1 = In Cover/basically a hiding spot, in a corner with good hard cover nearby
* 2 = good sniper spot, had at least one decent sniping corridor
* 4 = perfect sniper spot, can see either very far, or a large area, or both
* 8 = exposed, spot in the open, usually on a ledge or cliff, same as GetExposedSpots
* Values over 255 and below 0 will be clamped.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of [Vector](/gmod/Vector)s
The unique ID.

GetIncomingConnections.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of all the [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a one-way connection **to** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

If a [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has a two-way connection **to or from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) then it will not be returned from this function, use [CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas](/gmod/CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas) to get outgoing ( one and two way ) connections.

See [CNavArea:GetIncomingConnectionsAtSide](/gmod/CNavArea:GetIncomingConnectionsAtSide) for a function that returns one-way incoming connections from  only one side/direction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of all [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s with one-way connection **to** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

Returns an empty table if there are no one-way incoming connections **to** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

GetIncomingConnectionsAtSide.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of all the [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s that have a one-way connection **to** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) from given direction.

If a [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has a two-way connection **to or from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) then it will not be returned from this function, use [CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas](/gmod/CNavArea:GetAdjacentAreas) to get outgoing ( one and two way ) connections.

See [CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections](/gmod/CNavArea:GetIncomingConnections) for a function that returns one-way incoming connections from  all sides/directions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction, from which to look for [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s, see [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of all [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s with one-way connection **to** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) from given direction.

Returns an empty table if there are no one-way incoming connections **to** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) from given direction.

GetLadders.DESCRIPTION:
Returns all [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder)s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

See [CNavArea:GetLaddersAtSide](/gmod/CNavArea:GetLaddersAtSide) for a function that only returns [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder)s in given direction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder)s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

GetLaddersAtSide.DESCRIPTION:
Returns all [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder)s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** ( one and two way ) this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

See [CNavArea:GetLadders](/gmod/CNavArea:GetLadders) for a function that returns [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) from/in all sides/directions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The direction, in which to look for [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder)s.

0 = Up ( LadderDirectionType::LADDER_UP )
1 = Down ( LadderDirectionType::LADDER_DOWN )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder)s that have a ( one or two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.
The parent [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)

GetParentHow.DESCRIPTION: Returns how this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) is connected to its parent.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: See [NavTraverseType](/gmod/Enums/NavTraverseType)

GetPlace.DESCRIPTION: Returns the Place of the nav area.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The place of the nav area, or no value if it doesn't have a place set.

GetRandomAdjacentAreaAtSide.DESCRIPTION: Returns a random [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) that has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction, in which to look for [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea)s, see [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The random [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) that has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **from** this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction, if any.

GetRandomPoint.DESCRIPTION: Returns a random point on the nav area.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The random point on the nav area.

GetSizeX.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width this Nav Area.

GetSizeY.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of this Nav Area.

GetTotalCost.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the total cost when passing from starting area to the goal area through this node. Set by [CNavArea:SetTotalCost](/gmod/CNavArea:SetTotalCost).

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The total cost

GetZ.DESCRIPTION: Returns the elevation of this Nav Area at the given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to get the elevation from, the z value from this position is ignored and only the X and Y values are used to this task.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The elevation.

HasAttributes.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has this attribute flag set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attribs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attribute mask to check for, see [NAV_MESH](/gmod/Enums/NAV_MESH)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) matches the given mask. False otherwise.

IsBlocked.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the nav area is blocked or not, i.e. whether it can be walked through or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The team ID to test, -2 = any team.

Only 2 actual teams are available, 0 and 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ignoreNavBlockers
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to ignore [func_nav_blocker](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Func_nav_blocker) entities.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the area is blocked or not

IsClosed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether this node is in the Closed List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this node is in the Closed List.

IsCompletelyVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) can completely (i.e. all corners of this area can see all corners of the given area) see the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to test.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the given area is visible from this area

IsConnected.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

See [CNavArea:IsConnectedAtSide](/gmod/CNavArea:IsConnectedAtSide) for a function that only checks for outgoing connections in one direction.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navArea
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to test against.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

IsConnectedAtSide.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

See [CNavArea:IsConnected](/gmod/CNavArea:IsConnected) for a function that checks all sides.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navArea
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to test against.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDirType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction, in which to look for the connection. See [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

IsCoplanar.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this Nav Area is in the same plane as the given one.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navArea
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Nav Area to test.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we're coplanar or not.

IsFlat.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this Nav Area is flat within the tolerance of the **nav_coplanar_slope_limit_displacement** and **nav_coplanar_slope_limit** convars.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this CNavArea is mostly flat.

IsOpen.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether this area is in the Open List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this area is in the Open List.

IsOpenListEmpty.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the Open List is empty or not.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the Open List is empty or not.

IsOverlapping.DESCRIPTION: Returns if this position overlaps the Nav Area within the given tolerance.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The overlapping position to test.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tolerance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The tolerance of the overlapping, set to 0 for no tolerance.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the given position overlaps the Nav Area or not.

IsOverlappingArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) is overlapping the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navArea
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to test against.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) overlaps this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) at any point.

IsPartiallyVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) can see given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to test.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ignoreEnt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, the given entity will be ignored when doing LOS tests

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the given position is visible from this area

IsPotentiallyVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) can potentially see the given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to test.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the given area is visible from this area

IsRoughlySquare.DESCRIPTION: Returns if we're shaped like a square.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If we're a square or not.

IsUnderwater.DESCRIPTION: Whether this Nav Area is placed underwater.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we're underwater or not.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) is valid or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) is valid or not.

IsVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether we can be seen from the given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we can be seen or not.
If we can be seen, this is returned with either the center or one of the corners of the Nav Area.

PlaceOnGround.DESCRIPTION: Drops a corner or all corners of a [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to the ground below it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: corner
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The corner(s) to drop, uses [NavCorner](/gmod/Enums/NavCorner)

PopOpenList.DESCRIPTION:
Removes a CNavArea from the Open List with the lowest cost to traverse to from the starting node, and returns it.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The CNavArea from the Open List with the lowest cost to traverse to from the starting node.

RemoveFromClosedList.DESCRIPTION:
Removes this node from the Closed List.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

SetAttributes.DESCRIPTION: Sets the attributes for given CNavArea.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attribs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The attribute bitflag. See [NAV_MESH](/gmod/Enums/NAV_MESH)

SetCorner.DESCRIPTION: Sets the position of a corner of a nav area.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: corner
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The corner to set, uses [NavCorner](/gmod/Enums/NavCorner)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new position to set.

SetCostSoFar.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the cost from starting area this area when pathfinding.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cost
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The cost so far

SetParent.DESCRIPTION: Sets the new parent of this [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new parent to set

SetPlace.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the Place of the nav area.

There is a limit of 256 Places per nav file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: place
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Set to "" to remove place from the nav area.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true of operation succeeded, false otherwise.

SetTotalCost.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the total cost when passing from starting area to the goal area through this node.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cost
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The total cost of the path to set.

Must be above or equal 0.

UpdateOnOpenList.DESCRIPTION:
Moves this open list to appropriate position based on its [CNavArea:GetTotalCost](/gmod/CNavArea:GetTotalCost) compared to the total cost of other areas in the open list.

Used in pathfinding via the [A* algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm).

More information can be found on the [Simple Pathfinding](/gmod/Simple Pathfinding) page.

ConnectTo.DESCRIPTION:
Connects this ladder to a [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) with a one way connection. ( From this ladder to the target area ).

See [CNavArea:ConnectTo](/gmod/CNavArea:ConnectTo) for making the connection from area to ladder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The area this ladder leads to.

Disconnect.DESCRIPTION: Disconnects this ladder from given area in a single direction.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: area
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) this to disconnect from.

GetBottom.DESCRIPTION: Returns the bottom most position of the ladder.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The bottom most position of the ladder.

GetBottomArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the bottom area of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The unique ID.

GetLength.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length of the ladder.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The length of the ladder.

GetNormal.DESCRIPTION: Returns the direction of this [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder). ( The direction in which players back will be facing if they are looking directly at the ladder )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The direction of this [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

GetPosAtHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the world position based on given height relative to the ladder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Z position in world space coordinates.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The closest point on the ladder to that height.

GetTop.DESCRIPTION: Returns the topmost position of the ladder.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The topmost position of the ladder.

GetTopBehindArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the top behind [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The top behind [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

GetTopForwardArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the top forward [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The top forward [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

GetTopLeftArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the top left [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The top left [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

GetTopRightArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the top right [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The top right [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

GetWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width of the ladder in Hammer Units.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the ladder in Hammer Units.

IsConnectedAtSide.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navArea
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) to test against.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: navDirType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction, in which to look for the connection. See [NavDir](/gmod/Enums/NavDir)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) has an outgoing ( one or two way ) connection **to** given [CNavArea](/gmod/CNavArea) in given direction.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) is valid or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder) is valid or not.

SetBottomArea.DESCRIPTION: Sets the bottom area of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

SetTopBehindArea.DESCRIPTION: Sets the top behind area of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

SetTopForwardArea.DESCRIPTION: Sets the top forward area of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

SetTopLeftArea.DESCRIPTION: Sets the top left area of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

SetTopRightArea.DESCRIPTION: Sets the top right area of the [CNavLadder](/gmod/CNavLadder).

CNavLadder.DESCRIPTION: An object that represents a ladder for Nextbots.

AddControlPoint.DESCRIPTION: Adds a control point to the particle system.
NOTES: This function will not work if the CNewParticleEffect:GetOwner entity is not valid

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cpID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to attach the control point to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: partAttachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: See [PATTACH](/gmod/Enums/PATTACH).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entAttachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The attachment ID on the entity to attach the particle system to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: offset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The offset from the [Entity:GetPos](/gmod/Entity:GetPos) of the entity we are attaching this CP to.

GetEffectName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the particle effect this system is set to emit.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the particle effect.

GetHighestControlPoint.DESCRIPTION: Returns the highest control point number for given particle system.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The highest control point number for given particle system, 0 to 63.

GetOwner.DESCRIPTION: Returns the owner of the particle system, the entity the particle system is attached to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The owner of the particle system.

IsFinished.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the particle system has finished emitting particles or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the particle system has finished emitting particles or not.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the particle system is valid or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the particle system is valid or not.

IsViewModelEffect.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the particle system is intended to be used on a view model?

Render.DESCRIPTION:
Forces the particle system to render using current rendering context.

Can be used to render the particle system in vgui panels, etc.

Used in conjunction with [CNewParticleEffect:SetShouldDraw](/gmod/CNewParticleEffect:SetShouldDraw).

Restart.DESCRIPTION: Forces the particle system to restart emitting particles.

SetControlPoint.DESCRIPTION: Sets a value for given control point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cpID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set for given control point.

SetControlPointEntity.DESCRIPTION: Essentially makes child control point follow the parent entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: child
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The child control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The parent entity to follow.

SetControlPointForwardVector.DESCRIPTION: Sets the forward direction for given control point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cpID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: forward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The forward direction for given control point

SetControlPointOrientation.DESCRIPTION: Sets the orientation for given control point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cpID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: forward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The forward direction for given control point

ARGUMENTS.NAME: right
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The right direction for given control point

ARGUMENTS.NAME: up
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The up direction for given control point

SetControlPointParent.DESCRIPTION: Essentially makes child control point follow the parent control point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: child
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The child control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The parent control point ID, 0 to 63.

SetControlPointRightVector.DESCRIPTION: Sets the right direction for given control point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cpID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: right
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The right direction for given control point.

SetControlPointUpVector.DESCRIPTION: Sets the upward direction for given control point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cpID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The control point ID, 0 to 63.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: upward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The upward direction for given control point

SetShouldDraw.DESCRIPTION:
Forces the particle system to stop automatically rendering.

Used in conjunction with [CNewParticleEffect:Render](/gmod/CNewParticleEffect:Render).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: should
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to automatically draw the particle effect or not.

SetSortOrigin.DESCRIPTION: Sets the sort origin for given particle system. This is used as a helper to determine which particles are in front of which.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new sort origin.

StopEmissionAndDestroyImmediately.DESCRIPTION:
Stops particle emission and destroys all particles instantly. Also detaches the particle effect from the entity it was attached to.

Consider using [CNewParticleEffect:StopEmission](/gmod/CNewParticleEffect:StopEmission)( false, true ) instead, which has same effect, but doesn't require owner entity, and does't detach the particle system from its entity.
NOTES: This function will work identically to CNewParticleEffect:StopEmission( false, true ) if  CNewParticleEffect:GetOwner entity is not valid.

CNewParticleEffect.DESCRIPTION: This object represents a .pcf ( Orange Box ) particle system. Created by [Entity:CreateParticleEffect](/gmod/Entity:CreateParticleEffect) and [CreateParticleSystem](/gmod/Global.CreateParticleSystem).

SetUnpacked.DESCRIPTION: Sets the red, green, blue, and alpha of the color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red component

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green component

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue component

ARGUMENTS.NAME: a
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The alpha component

ToHSL.DESCRIPTION: Converts a [Color](/gmod/Color) into HSL color space. This calls [ColorToHSL](/gmod/Global.ColorToHSL) internally.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hue in degrees [0, 360).
The saturation in the range [0, 1].
The lightness in the range [0, 1].

ToHSV.DESCRIPTION: Converts a [Color](/gmod/Color) into HSV color space. This calls [ColorToHSV](/gmod/Global.ColorToHSV) internally.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hue in degrees [0, 360).
The saturation in range [0, 1].
The value in range [0, 1].

ToTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color as a table with four elements.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table with elements 1 = r, 2 = g, 3 = b, 4 = a.

ToVector.DESCRIPTION:
Translates the [Color](/gmod/Color) into a [Vector](/gmod/Vector), losing the alpha channel.

This will also range the values from 0 - 255 to 0 - 1

r / 255 -> x

g / 255 -> y

b / 255 -> z

This is the opposite of [Vector:ToColor](/gmod/Vector:ToColor)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [Vector](/gmod/Vector)

Unpack.DESCRIPTION: Returns the red, green, blue, and alpha of the color.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Red
Green
Blue
Alpha

Color.DESCRIPTION:
List of all possible functions to manipulate colors.

Colors are implemented in Lua thus [type](/gmod/Global.type)(color) == "table" and [TypeID](/gmod/Global.TypeID)(color) == [TYPE_TABLE](/gmod/Enums/TYPE#table).

For type checking use [IsColor](/gmod/Global.IsColor).

Created by [Color](/gmod/Global.Color), [HSVToColor](/gmod/Global.HSVToColor), and [HSLToColor](/gmod/Global.HSLToColor).

| Type                | Name  | Description                       |

| ------------------- | ----- | --------------------------------- |

| [number](/gmod/number) | **r** | The red component of the color.   |

| [number](/gmod/number) | **g** | The green component of the color. |

| [number](/gmod/number) | **b** | The blue component of the color.  |

| [number](/gmod/number) | **a** | The alpha component of the color. |

GetBool.DESCRIPTION: Tries to convert the current string value of a [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) to a boolean.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The boolean value of the console variable. If the variable is numeric and not 0, the result will be true. Otherwise the result will be false.

GetDefault.DESCRIPTION: Returns the default value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The default value of the console variable.

GetFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [FCVAR](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR) flags of the ConVar

RETURNS.NAME: flag
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The bitflag. See [FCVAR](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR)

GetFloat.DESCRIPTION: Attempts to convert the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) value to a float

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The float value of the console variable.

If the value cannot be converted to a float, it will return 0.

GetHelpText.DESCRIPTION: Returns the help text assigned to that convar.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The help text

GetInt.DESCRIPTION: Attempts to convert the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) value to a integer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The integer value of the console variable.

If it fails to convert to an integer, it will return 0.

All float/decimal values will be rounded down. ( With [math.floor](/gmod/math.floor) )

GetMax.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)

GetMin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)
The name of the console variable.

GetString.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) value as a string.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current console variable value as a string.

IsFlagSet.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the specified flag is set on the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [FCVAR](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR) flag to test

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the flag is set or not

SetBool.DESCRIPTION: Sets a ConVar's value to 1 or 0 based on the input boolean. This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to set the ConVar to.

SetFloat.DESCRIPTION: Sets a ConVar's value to the input number.
NOTES: This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to set the ConVar to.

SetInt.DESCRIPTION: Sets a ConVar's value to the input number after converting it to an integer.
NOTES: This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to set the ConVar to.

SetString.DESCRIPTION: Sets a ConVar's value to the input string. This can only be ran on ConVars created from within Lua.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to set the ConVar to.

ConVar.DESCRIPTION: An object returned by [CreateConVar](/gmod/Global.CreateConVar), [CreateClientConVar](/gmod/Global.CreateClientConVar) (which uses [CreateConVar](/gmod/Global.CreateConVar) internally), and [GetConVar](/gmod/Global.GetConVar). It represents a console variable. See [this](/gmod/ConVars) page for more information.

AddAllPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Adds all players to the recipient filter.

AddPAS.DESCRIPTION: Adds all players that are in the same [PAS (Potentially Audible Set)](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PAS "PAS - Valve Developer Community") as this position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A position that players may be able to hear, usually the position of an entity the sound is playing played from.

AddPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Adds a player to the recipient filter

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player to add to the recipient filter.

AddPVS.DESCRIPTION: Adds all players that are in the same [PVS(Potential Visibility Set)](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PVS "PVS - Valve Developer Community") as this position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: PVS position that players may be able to see.

AddRecipientsByTeam.DESCRIPTION: Adds all players that are on the given team to the filter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Team index to add players from.

GetCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of valid players in the recipient filter.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of valid players in the recipient filter.

GetPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of all valid players currently in the recipient filter.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of all valid players currently in the recipient filter.

RemoveAllPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Removes all players from the recipient filter.

RemovePAS.DESCRIPTION: Removes all players from the filter that are in Potentially Audible Set for given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to test

RemovePlayer.DESCRIPTION: Removes the player from the recipient filter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player that should be in the recipient filter if you call this function.

RemovePVS.DESCRIPTION: Removes all players that can see this PVS from the recipient filter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position that players may be able to see.

RemoveRecipientsByTeam.DESCRIPTION: Removes all players that are on the given team from the filter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Team index to remove players from.

RemoveRecipientsNotOnTeam.DESCRIPTION: Removes all players that are not on the given team from the filter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Team index.

CRecipientFilter.DESCRIPTION: List of all possible functions to manipulate Recipient Filters. Can be created with [RecipientFilter](/gmod/Global.RecipientFilter).

CSEnt.DESCRIPTION:
CSEnt is a client-side only entity which can be created with [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel), [ClientsideRagdoll](/gmod/Global.ClientsideRagdoll) and [ClientsideScene](/gmod/Global.ClientsideScene).

Its base class is [Entity](/gmod/Entity) so it inherits all of the client and shared functions used by [Entity](/gmod/Entity).

ChangePitch.DESCRIPTION:
Adjust the pitch, alias the speed at which the sound is being played.

This invokes the [GM:EntityEmitSound](/gmod/GM:EntityEmitSound).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pitch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pitch can range from 0-255.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: deltaTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time to fade from previous to the new pitch.

ChangeVolume.DESCRIPTION:
Adjusts the volume of the sound played.

Appears to only work while the sound is being played.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume ranges from 0 to 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: deltaTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Time to fade the volume from previous to new value from.

FadeOut.DESCRIPTION: Fades out the volume of the sound from the current volume to 0 in the given amount of seconds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: seconds
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fade time.

GetDSP.DESCRIPTION: Returns the DSP ( Digital Signal Processor ) effect for the sound.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The DSP effects of the sound
List of DSP's are Pick from the [here](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets).
The current pitch, can range from 0-255.
The current sound level, see [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL).
The current volume, ranging from 0 to 1.

IsPlaying.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the sound is being played.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is playing or not

Play.DESCRIPTION: Starts to play the sound. This will reset the sound's volume and pitch to their default values. See [CSoundPatch:PlayEx](/gmod/CSoundPatch:PlayEx)

PlayEx.DESCRIPTION: Same as [CSoundPatch:Play](/gmod/CSoundPatch:Play) but with 2 extra arguments allowing to set volume and pitch directly.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume ranges from 0 to 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pitch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pitch can range from 0-255.

SetDSP.DESCRIPTION: Sets the DSP (Digital Signal Processor) effect for the sound. Similar to [Player:SetDSP](/gmod/Player:SetDSP) but for individual sounds.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will only apply if the sound is not playing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dsp
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The DSP effect to set.
Pick from the [list of DSP's](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

SetSoundLevel.DESCRIPTION: Sets the sound level in decibel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: level
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound level in decibel. See [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL)

Stop.DESCRIPTION: Stops the sound from being played.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will not work if the entity attached to this sound patch (specified by [CreateSound](/gmod/Global.CreateSound)) is invalid.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageIncrease
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage to add.

GetAmmoType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the ammo type used by the weapon that inflicted the damage.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo type ID

GetAttacker.DESCRIPTION: Returns the attacker ( character who originated the attack ), for example a player or an NPC that shot the weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The attacker

GetBaseDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns the initial unmodified by skill level ( [game.GetSkillLevel](/gmod/game.GetSkillLevel) ) damage.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: baseDamage
damage
Bonus damage

GetDamageCustom.DESCRIPTION: Gets the custom damage type. This is used by Day of Defeat: Source and Team Fortress 2 for extended damage info, but isn't used in Garry's Mod by default.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The custom damage type

GetDamageForce.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a vector representing the damage force.

Can be set with [CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamageForce](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamageForce).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The damage force

GetDamagePosition.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the position where the damage was or is going to be applied to.

Can be set using [CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamagePosition](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamagePosition).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The damage position

GetDamageType.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a bitflag which indicates the damage type(s) of the damage.

Consider using [CTakeDamageInfo:IsDamageType](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:IsDamageType) instead. Value returned by this function can contain multiple damage types.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Damage type(s), a combination of [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG)

GetInflictor.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the inflictor of the damage. This is not necessarily a weapon.

For hitscan weapons this is the weapon.

For projectile weapons this is the projectile.

For a more reliable method of getting the weapon that damaged an entity, use [GetAttacker](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:GetAttacker) with [GetActiveWeapon](/gmod/Player:GetActiveWeapon).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The inflictor
maxDmg

GetReportedPosition.DESCRIPTION: Returns the initial, unmodified position where the damage occured.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: position

IsBulletDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the damage was caused by a bullet.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isBulletDmg

IsDamageType.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains the damage type specified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmgType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage type to test. See [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this damage contains specified damage type or not

IsExplosionDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains explosion damage.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isExplDamage

IsFallDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the damageinfo contains fall damage.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isFallDmg

ScaleDamage.DESCRIPTION: Scales the damage by the given value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to scale the damage with.

SetAmmoType.DESCRIPTION: Changes the ammo type used by the weapon that inflicted the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo type ID

SetAttacker.DESCRIPTION: Sets the attacker ( character who originated the attack ) of the damage, for example a player or an NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be set as the attacker.

SetBaseDamage.DESCRIPTION: Sets the initial unmodified by skill level ( [game.GetSkillLevel](/gmod/game.GetSkillLevel) ) damage. This function will not update or touch [CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamage](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamage).

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: baseDamage

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set the absolute damage to.

SetDamageBonus.DESCRIPTION: Sets the bonus damage. Bonus damage isn't automatically applied, so this will have no outer effect by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The extra damage to be added.

SetDamageCustom.DESCRIPTION: Sets the custom damage type. This is used by Day of Defeat: Source and Team Fortress 2 for extended damage info, but isn't used in Garry's Mod by default.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: DamageType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Any integer - can be based on your own custom enums.

SetDamageForce.DESCRIPTION: Sets the directional force of the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to set the force to.

SetDamagePosition.DESCRIPTION: Sets the position of where the damage gets applied to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position where the damage will be applied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage type, see [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG).

SetInflictor.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the inflictor of the damage for example a weapon.

For hitscan/bullet weapons this should the weapon.

For projectile ( rockets, etc ) weapons this should be the projectile.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inflictor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new inflictor.

SetMaxDamage.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum damage the object can cause.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxDamage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Maximum damage value.

SetReportedPosition.DESCRIPTION: Sets the origin of the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The location of where the damage is originating

SubtractDamage.DESCRIPTION: Subtracts the specified amount from the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to subtract.

CTakeDamageInfo.DESCRIPTION:
A class used to store and modify all the data concerning a damage event.

An empty CTakeDamageInfo object can be created with [DamageInfo](/gmod/Global.DamageInfo)

List of hooks that this object is passed to:

* [ENTITY:OnTakeDamage](/gmod/ENTITY:OnTakeDamage)

* [GM:DoPlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:DoPlayerDeath)

* [GM:EntityTakeDamage](/gmod/GM:EntityTakeDamage)

* [GM:PostEntityTakeDamage](/gmod/GM:PostEntityTakeDamage)

* [GM:OnDamagedByExplosion](/gmod/GM:OnDamagedByExplosion)

* [GM:ScaleNPCDamage](/gmod/GM:ScaleNPCDamage)

* [GM:ScalePlayerDamage](/gmod/GM:ScalePlayerDamage)

* [NEXTBOT:OnInjured](/gmod/NEXTBOT:OnInjured)

* [NEXTBOT:OnKilled](/gmod/NEXTBOT:OnKilled)

* [NEXTBOT:OnOtherKilled](/gmod/NEXTBOT:OnOtherKilled)

List of functions that use this object:

* [util.BlastDamageInfo](/gmod/util.BlastDamageInfo)

* [Entity:TakeDamageInfo](/gmod/Entity:TakeDamageInfo)

* [Entity:TakePhysicsDamage](/gmod/Entity:TakePhysicsDamage)

* [Entity:DispatchTraceAttack](/gmod/Entity:DispatchTraceAttack)

ClearButtons.DESCRIPTION: Removes all keys from the command.
NOTES: If you are looking to affect player movement, you may need to use CUserCmd:ClearMovement instead of clearing the buttons.

ClearMovement.DESCRIPTION:
Clears the movement from the command.

See also [CUserCmd:SetForwardMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetForwardMove), [CUserCmd:SetSideMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetSideMove) and  [CUserCmd:SetUpMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetUpMove).

CommandNumber.DESCRIPTION: Returns an increasing number representing the index of the user cmd.
WARNINGS: The value returned is occasionally 0 inside GM:CreateMove and GM:StartCommand. It is advised to check for a non-zero value if you wish to get the correct number.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The command number

GetButtons.DESCRIPTION: Returns a bitflag indicating which buttons are pressed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Pressed buttons, see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN)

GetForwardMove.DESCRIPTION: The speed the client wishes to move forward with, negative if the clients wants to move backwards.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The desired speed

GetImpulse.DESCRIPTION: Gets the current impulse from the client, usually 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The impulse

GetMouseWheel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the scroll delta as whole number.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Scroll delta

GetMouseX.DESCRIPTION: Returns the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: xDelta

GetMouseY.DESCRIPTION: Returns the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: yDelta

GetSideMove.DESCRIPTION: The speed the client wishes to move sideways with, positive if it wants to move right, negative if it wants to move left.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: requestSpeed

GetUpMove.DESCRIPTION: The speed the client wishes to move up with, negative if the clients wants to move down.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: requestSpeed

GetViewAngles.DESCRIPTION: Gets the direction the player is looking in.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: requestDir

IsForced.DESCRIPTION:
When players are not sending usercommands to the server (often due to lag), their last usercommand will be executed multiple times as a backup. This function returns true if that is happening.

This will never return true clientside.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isForced

KeyDown.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the specified button(s) is pressed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag representing which button to check, see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is key down or not

RemoveKey.DESCRIPTION: Removed a key bit from the current key bitflag.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: button
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag to be removed from the key bitflag, see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN).

SelectWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Forces the associated player to select a weapon. This is used internally in the default HL2 weapon selection HUD.

This may not work immediately if the current command is in prediction. Use [input.SelectWeapon](/gmod/input.SelectWeapon) to switch the weapon from the client when the next available command can do so.
NOTES: This is the ideal function to use to create a custom weapon selection HUD, as it allows prediction to run properly for WEAPON:Deploy and GM:PlayerSwitchWeapon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon entity to select.

SetButtons.DESCRIPTION: Sets the buttons as a bitflag. See also [CUserCmd:GetButtons](/gmod/CUserCmd:GetButtons).
NOTES: If you are looking to affect player movement, you may need to use CUserCmd:SetForwardMove instead of setting the keys.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: buttons
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag representing which buttons are "down", see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN).

SetForwardMove.DESCRIPTION:
Sets speed the client wishes to move forward with, negative if the clients wants to move backwards.

See also [CUserCmd:ClearMovement](/gmod/CUserCmd:ClearMovement), [CUserCmd:SetSideMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetSideMove) and [CUserCmd:SetUpMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetUpMove).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new speed to request. The client will not be able to move faster than their set walk/sprint speed.

SetImpulse.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the impulse command to be sent to the server.

Here are a few examples of impulse numbers:

- `100` toggles their flashlight

- `101` gives the player all Half-Life 2 weapons with `sv_cheats` set to `1`

- `200` toggles holstering / restoring the current weapon  

  When holstered, the `EF_NODRAW` flag is set on the active weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The impulse to send.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The scroll delta.

SetMouseX.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the delta of the angular horizontal mouse movement of the player.

See also [CUserCmd:SetMouseY](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetMouseY).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angular horizontal move delta.

SetMouseY.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the delta of the angular vertical mouse movement of the player.

See also [CUserCmd:SetMouseX](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetMouseX).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angular vertical move delta.

SetSideMove.DESCRIPTION:
Sets speed the client wishes to move sidewards with, positive to move right, negative to move left.

See also [CUserCmd:SetForwardMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetForwardMove) and  [CUserCmd:SetUpMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetUpMove).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new speed to request.

SetUpMove.DESCRIPTION:
Sets speed the client wishes to move upwards with, negative to move down.

See also [CUserCmd:SetSideMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetSideMove) and  [CUserCmd:SetForwardMove](/gmod/CUserCmd:SetForwardMove).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new speed to request.

SetViewAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets the direction the client wants to move in.
NOTES: The pitch (vertical) angle should be clamped to +/- 89° to prevent the player's view from glitching.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New view angles.

TickCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns tick count since joining the server.
NOTES: This will always return 0 for bots.

Returns 0 clientside during prediction calls. If you are trying to use CUserCmd:Set*() on the client in a movement or command hook, keep doing so till TickCount returns a non-zero number to maintain prediction.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of ticks passed since joining the server.

CUserCmd.DESCRIPTION:
A class used to store the player inputs, such as mouse movement, view angles, [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN) buttons pressed and analog movement, the data from this class is then transfered to a [CMoveData](/gmod/CMoveData) during actual movement simulation.

Can be modified during [GM:CreateMove](/gmod/GM:CreateMove), [GM:StartCommand](/gmod/GM:StartCommand) and used in read only with [GM:SetupMove](/gmod/GM:SetupMove) and [Player:GetCurrentCommand](/gmod/Player:GetCurrentCommand).

Activate.DESCRIPTION: Activates the entity. This needs to be used on some entities (like constraints) after being spawned.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This crashes the game with scaled vehicles.

NOTES:
