For some entity types when this function is used after Entity:SetModelScale, the physics object will be recreated with the new scale. [Source-sdk-2013](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/baseanimating.cpp#L321-L327).

Calling this method after Entity:SetModelScale will recreate a new scaled `SOLID_VPHYSICS` PhysObj on scripted entities. This can be a problem if you made a properly scaled PhysObj of another kind (using Entity:PhysicsInitSphere for instance) or if you edited the PhysObj's properties. This is especially the behavior of the Sandbox spawn menu.

AddCallback.DESCRIPTION:
Add a callback function to a specific event. This is used instead of hooks to avoid calling empty functions unnecessarily.

This also allows you to use certain hooks in engine entities (non-scripted entities).
WARNINGS: This method does not check if the function has already been added to this object before, so if you add the same callback twice, it will be run twice! Make sure to add your callback only once.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hook
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hook name to hook onto. See [Entity Callbacks](/gmod/Entity Callbacks)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to call

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The callback ID that was just added, which can later be used in [Entity:RemoveCallback](/gmod/Entity:RemoveCallback).

Returns nothing if the passed callback function was invalid or when asking for a non-existent hook.

AddEffects.DESCRIPTION:
Applies an engine effect to an entity.

See also [Entity:IsEffectActive](/gmod/Entity:IsEffectActive) and  [Entity:RemoveEffects](/gmod/Entity:RemoveEffects).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effect
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The effect to apply, see [EF](/gmod/Enums/EF).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Engine flag to add, see [EFL](/gmod/Enums/EFL)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Flag to add, see [FL](/gmod/Enums/FL)

AddGesture.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a gesture animation to the entity and plays it.

See [Entity:AddGestureSequence](/gmod/Entity:AddGestureSequence) and [Entity:AddLayeredSequence](/gmod/Entity:AddLayeredSequence) for functions that takes sequences instead of [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entites!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The activity to play as the gesture. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Layer ID of the started gesture, used to manipulate the played gesture by other functions.

AddGestureSequence.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a gesture animation to the entity and plays it.

See [Entity:AddGesture](/gmod/Entity:AddGesture) for a function that takes [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

See also [Entity:AddLayeredSequence](/gmod/Entity:AddLayeredSequence).
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entites!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequence
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence ID to play as the gesture. See [Entity:LookupSequence](/gmod/Entity:LookupSequence).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Layer ID of the started gesture, used to manipulate the played gesture by other functions.

AddLayeredSequence.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a gesture animation to the entity and plays it.

See [Entity:AddGestureSequence](/gmod/Entity:AddGestureSequence) for a function that doesn't take priority.

See [Entity:AddGesture](/gmod/Entity:AddGesture) for a function that takes [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entites!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequence
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence ID to play as the gesture. See [Entity:LookupSequence](/gmod/Entity:LookupSequence).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Layer ID of created layer

AddSolidFlags.DESCRIPTION: Adds solid flag(s) to the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flag(s) to apply, see [FSOLID](/gmod/Enums/FSOLID).

AddToMotionController.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)ect to the entity's motion controller so that [ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate](/gmod/ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate) will be called for given [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)ect as well.

You must first create a motion controller with [Entity:StartMotionController](/gmod/Entity:StartMotionController).

You can remove added [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)ects by using [Entity:RemoveFromMotionController](/gmod/Entity:RemoveFromMotionController).
NOTES: Only works on a scripted Entity of anim type

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physObj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) to add to the motion controller.

AlignAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns an angle based on the ones inputted that you can use to align an object.
NOTES: This function doesn't change the angle of the entity on its own (see example).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: from
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle you want to align from

ARGUMENTS.NAME: to
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle you want to align to

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The resulting aligned angle

BecomeRagdollOnClient.DESCRIPTION:
Spawns a clientside ragdoll for the entity, positioning it in place of the original entity, and makes the entity invisible. It doesn't preserve flex values (face posing) as CSRagdolls don't support flex.

It does not work on players. Use [Player:CreateRagdoll](/gmod/Player:CreateRagdoll) instead.

The original entity is not removed, and neither are any ragdolls previously generated with this function.

To make the entity re-appear, run [Entity:SetNoDraw](/gmod/Entity:SetNoDraw)( false )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created ragdoll. (class C_ClientRagdoll])

BeingLookedAtByLocalPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the entity is being looked at by the local player and is within 256 units of distance.
NOTES: This function is only available in entities that are based off of sandbox's base_gmodentity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the entity being looked at by the local player and within 256 units.

Blocked.DESCRIPTION: Dispatches blocked events to this entity's blocked handler. This function is only useful when interacting with entities like func_movelinear.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that is blocking us

BodyTarget.DESCRIPTION: Returns a centered vector of this entity, NPCs use this internally to aim at their targets.
NOTES: This only works on players and NPCs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector of where the the attack comes from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: noisy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Decides if it should return the centered vector with a random offset to it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The centered vector.

BoneHasFlag.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity's bone has the flag or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bone ID to test flag of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flag to test, see [BONE](/gmod/Enums/BONE)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the bone has that flag or not

BoneLength.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length between given bone's position and the position of given bone's parent.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the bone you want the length of. You may want to get the length of the next bone ( boneID + 1 ) for decent results

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The length of the bone

BoundingRadius.DESCRIPTION: Returns the distance between the center of the bounding box and the furthest bounding box corner.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The radius of the bounding box.

CallOnRemove.DESCRIPTION: Causes a specified function to be run if the entity is removed by any means. This can later be undone by [Entity:RemoveCallOnRemove](/gmod/Entity:RemoveCallOnRemove) if you need it to not run.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This hook is called during clientside full updates. See [ENTITY:OnRemove#clientsidebehaviourremarks](/gmod/ENTITY:OnRemove#clientsidebehaviourremarks) for more information.
Using players with this function will provide a gimped entity to the callback.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the function within CallOnRemove

ARGUMENTS.NAME: removeFunc
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to be called on remove

ARGUMENTS.NAME: argn...
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Optional arguments to pass to removeFunc. Do note that the first argument passed to the function will always be the entity being removed, and the arguments passed on here start after that.

ClearPoseParameters.DESCRIPTION: Resets all pose parameters such as aim_yaw, aim_pitch and rotation.

CollisionRulesChanged.DESCRIPTION: Declares that the collision rules of the entity have changed, and subsequent calls for [GM:ShouldCollide](/gmod/GM:ShouldCollide) with this entity may return a different value than they did previously.
WARNINGS: Failure to use this function correctly will result in a crash of the physics engine.
This function must **not** be called inside of GM:ShouldCollide. Instead, it must be called in advance when the condition is known to change.

CreatedByMap.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity was created by map or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is created by map?

CreateParticleEffect.DESCRIPTION: Creates a clientside particle system attached to the entity. See also [CreateParticleSystem](/gmod/Global.CreateParticleSystem)
NOTES: The particle effect must be precached with Global.PrecacheParticleSystem and the file its from must be added via game.AddParticles before it can be used!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: particle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The particle name to create

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attachment ID to attach the particle to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of tables ( IDs 1 to 64 ) having the following structure:

* [number](/gmod/number) attachtype - The particle attach type. See [PATTACH](/gmod/Enums/PATTACH). **Default:** PATTACH_ABSORIGIN

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) entity - The parent entity? **Default:** NULL

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) position - The offset position for given control point. **Default:**  nil

This only affects the control points of the particle effects and will do nothing if the effect doesn't use control points.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created particle system.

CreateShadow.DESCRIPTION: Draws the shadow of an entity.

DeleteOnRemove.DESCRIPTION: Whenever the entity is removed, entityToRemove will be removed also.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entityToRemove
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be removed

DestroyShadow.DESCRIPTION:
Removes the shadow for the entity.

The shadow will be recreated as soon as the entity wakes.

Doesn't affect shadows from flashlight/lamps/env_projectedtexture.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: matrixType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the matrix type to disable.

The only known matrix type is "RenderMultiply".

WARNINGS: Calling this function on the victim entity in ENTITY:OnTakeDamage can cause infinite loops.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageInfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage to apply.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: traceRes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Trace result to use to deal damage. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Direction of the attack.

DontDeleteOnRemove.DESCRIPTION: This removes the argument entity from an ent's list of entities to 'delete on remove'

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entityToUnremove
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be removed from the list of entities to delete

DrawModel.DESCRIPTION:
Draws the entity or model.

If called inside [ENTITY:Draw](/gmod/ENTITY:Draw) or [ENTITY:DrawTranslucent](/gmod/ENTITY:DrawTranslucent), it only draws the entity's model itself.

If called outside of those hooks, it will call both of said hooks depending on [Entity:GetRenderGroup](/gmod/Entity:GetRenderGroup), drawing the entire entity again.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Calling this on entities with [EF_BONEMERGE](/gmod/Enums/EF) and [EF_NODRAW](/gmod/Enums/EF) applied causes a crash.
Using this with a map model ([game.GetWorld](/gmod/game.GetWorld)():[GetModel](/gmod/Entity:GetModel)()) crashes the game.

NOTES: When drawing an entity more than once per frame in different positions, you should call Entity:SetupBones before each draw; Otherwise, the entity will retain its first drawn position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The optional [STUDIO_](/gmod/Enums/STUDIO) flags, usually taken from [ENTITY:Draw](/gmod/ENTITY:Draw) and similar hooks.

DrawShadow.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether an entity's shadow should be drawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldDraw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to enable, false to disable shadow drawing.

DropToFloor.DESCRIPTION: Move an entity down until it collides with something.
WARNINGS: The entity needs to already have something below it within 256 units.

DTVar.DESCRIPTION: Sets up a self.dt.NAME alias for a Data Table variable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The type of the DTVar being set up. It can be one of the following: 'Int', 'Float', 'Vector', 'Angle', 'Bool', 'Entity' or 'String'

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the DTVar. Can be between 0 and 3 for strings, 0 and 31 for everything else.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name by which you will refer to DTVar. It must be a valid variable name. (No spaces!)

EmitSound.DESCRIPTION:
Plays a sound on an entity. If run clientside, the sound will only be heard locally.

If used on a player or NPC character with the mouth rigged, the character will "lip-sync". This does not work with all sound files.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not respond to [SuppressHostEvents](/gmod/Global.SuppressHostEvents).

NOTES: When using this function with weapons, use the Weapon itself as the entity, not its owner!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the sound to be played.
WARNINGS: The string cannot have whitespace at the start or end. You can remove this with string.Trim.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundLevel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A modifier for the distance this sound will reach, acceptable range is 0 to 511. 100 means no adjustment to the level. See [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL)

Will not work if a [sound script](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Soundscripts) is used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pitchPercent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pitch applied to the sound. The acceptable range is from 0 to 255. 100 means the pitch is not changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume, from 0 to 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: channel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The sound channel, see [CHAN](/gmod/Enums/CHAN).

Will not work if a [sound script](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Soundscripts) is used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flags of the sound, see [SND](/gmod/Enums/SND)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dsp
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The DSP preset for this sound. [List of DSP presets](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

EnableConstraints.DESCRIPTION: Toggles the constraints of this ragdoll entity on and off.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: toggleConstraints
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Set to true to enable the constraints and false to disable them.

Disabling constraints will delete the constraint entities.

EnableCustomCollisions.DESCRIPTION:
Flags an entity as using custom lua defined collisions. Fixes entities having spongy player collisions or not hitting traces, such as after [Entity:PhysicsFromMesh](/gmod/Entity:PhysicsFromMesh)

Internally identical to `Entity:AddSolidFlags( bit.bor( FSOLID_CUSTOMRAYTEST, FSOLID_CUSTOMBOXTEST ) )`

Do not confuse this function with [Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck](/gmod/Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck), they are not the same.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: useCustom
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to flag this entity

EnableMatrix.DESCRIPTION:
Can be used to apply a custom [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) to the entity, mostly used for scaling the model by a [Vector](/gmod/Vector).

To disable it, use [Entity:DisableMatrix](/gmod/Entity:DisableMatrix).

If your old scales are wrong due to a recent update, use [Entity:SetLegacyTransform](/gmod/Entity:SetLegacyTransform) as a quick fix.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not scale procedural bones.
This disables inverse kinematics of an entity.

NOTES: The matrix can also be modified to apply a custom rotation and offset via the VMatrix:SetAngles and VMatrix:SetTranslation functions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: matrixType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the matrix type. 

The only implemented matrix type is "RenderMultiply".

ARGUMENTS.NAME: matrix
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The matrix to apply before drawing the entity.

EntIndex.DESCRIPTION: Gets the unique entity index of an entity.
NOTES: Entity indices are marked as unused after deletion, and can be reused by newly-created entities

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The index of the entity.

-1 for clientside-only or serverside-only entities.

Extinguish.DESCRIPTION:
Extinguishes the entity if it is on fire.

Has no effect if called inside [GM:EntityTakeDamage](/gmod/GM:EntityTakeDamage) (and the attacker is the flame that's hurting the entity)

See also [Entity:Ignite](/gmod/Entity:Ignite).

EyeAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the direction a player/npc/ragdoll is looking as a world-oriented angle.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can return an incorrect value in pods.
This can return an incorrect value in jeeps when used with [Player:EnterVehicle](/gmod/Player:EnterVehicle).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: eyeAng

EyePos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of an Player/NPC's view.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: View position of the entity.

FindBodygroupByName.DESCRIPTION: Searches for bodygroup with given name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bodygroup name to search for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Bodygroup ID, -1 if not found

FindTransitionSequence.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a transition from the given start and end sequence.

This function was only used by HL1 entities and NPCs, before the advent of sequence blending and gestures.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: currentSequence
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The currently playing sequence

ARGUMENTS.NAME: goalSequence
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The goal sequence.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The transition sequence, -1 if not available.

Fire.DESCRIPTION:
Fires an entity's input, conforming to the map IO event queue system. You can find inputs for most entities on the [Valve Developer Wiki](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Output)

See also [Entity:Input](/gmod/Entity:Input) for a function that bypasses the event queue and [GM:AcceptInput](/gmod/GM:AcceptInput).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: input
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the input to fire

ARGUMENTS.NAME: param
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to give to the input, can also be a [number](/gmod/number) or a [boolean](/gmod/boolean).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Delay in seconds before firing

FireBullets.DESCRIPTION:
Fires a bullet.

When used in a  hook such as [WEAPON:Think](/gmod/WEAPON:Think) or [WEAPON:PrimaryAttack](/gmod/WEAPON:PrimaryAttack), it will use [Player:LagCompensation](/gmod/Player:LagCompensation) internally.
NOTES: Lag compensation will not work if this function is called in a timer, regardless if the timer was made in a  hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bulletInfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bullet data to be used. See the [Bullet](/gmod/Structures/Bullet).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: suppressHostEvents
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Has the effect of encasing the FireBullets call in [SuppressHostEvents](/gmod/Global.SuppressHostEvents), only works in multiplayer.

NOTES: If the entity vibrates or stops following the parent, you probably need to run Entity:SetPredictable( true ) clientside.
WARNINGS: This function will not work if the target bone's parent bone is invalid or if the bone is not used by VERTEX LOD0

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to follow the bone of. If unset, removes the FollowBone effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone to follow

ForcePlayerDrop.DESCRIPTION: Forces the Entity to be dropped, when it is being held by a player's gravitygun or physgun.

FrameAdvance.DESCRIPTION:
Advances the cycle of an animated entity.

Animations that loop will automatically reset the cycle so you don't have to - ones that do not will stop animating once you reach the end of their sequence.
WARNINGS:
Do not call this function multiple times a frame, as it can cause unexpected results, such as animations playing at increased rate, etc.

NextBot:BodyMoveXY calls this internally, so do not call this function before or after NextBot:BodyMoveXY.

NOTES: Actually binds to CBaseEntity::GetLocalVelocity() which retrieves the velocity of the entity due to its movement in the world from forces such as gravity. Does not include velocity from entity-on-entity collision.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The velocity of the entity.

GetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Gets the angles of given entity.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This returns incorrect results for the local player clientside.
This will return the local player's [EyeAngles](/gmod/Global.EyeAngles) in [rendering hooks](/gmod/Category:3D_Rendering_Hooks).
This will return [Angle](/gmod/Global.Angle)(0,0,0) in [rendering hooks](/gmod/Category:3D_Rendering_Hooks) while paused in single-player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the entity.

GetAnimInfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table containing the number of frames, flags, name, and FPS of an entity's animation ID.
NOTES: Animation ID is not the same as sequence ID.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: animIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The animation ID to look up

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Information about the animation, or nil if the index is out of bounds

GetAnimTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last time the entity had an animation update. Returns 0 if the entity doesn't animate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The last time the entity had an animation update.

GetAttachment.DESCRIPTION: Gets the orientation and position of the attachment by its ID, returns nothing if the attachment does not exist.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will return improper values for viewmodels if used in [GM:CalcView](/gmod/GM:CalcView).

NOTES: The update rate of this function is limited by the setting of ENT.AutomaticFrameAdvance for Scripted Entities!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachmentId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The internal ID of the attachment.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angle and position of the attachment. See the [AngPos](/gmod/Structures/AngPos). Most notably, the table contains the keys "Ang" and "Pos".

GetAttachments.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table containing all attachments of the given entitys model.

Returns an empty table or **nil** in case it's model has no attachments.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can have inconsistent results in single-player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Attachment data. See [AttachmentData](/gmod/Structures/AttachmentData).

GetBaseVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's base velocity which is their velocity due to forces applied by other entities. This includes entity-on-entity collision or riding a treadmill.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The base velocity of the entity.

GetBloodColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the blood color of this entity. This can be set with [Entity:SetBloodColor](/gmod/Entity:SetBloodColor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Color from [BLOOD_COLOR](/gmod/Enums/BLOOD_COLOR)

GetBodygroup.DESCRIPTION: Gets the exact value for specific bodygroup of given entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of bodygroup to get value of. Starts from 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current bodygroup. Starts from 0.

GetBodygroupCount.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the count of possible values for this bodygroup.

This is **not** the maximum value, since the bodygroups start with 0, not 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bodygroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of bodygroup to retrieve count of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Count of values of passed bodygroup.

GetBodygroupName.DESCRIPTION: Gets the name of specific bodygroup for given entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of bodygroup to get the name of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the bodygroup

GetBodyGroups.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of all bodygroups of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Bodygroups as a table of [BodyGroupData](/gmod/Structures/BodyGroupData)s if the entity can have bodygroups.

GetBoneContents.DESCRIPTION: Returns the contents of the specified bone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone id. See [Entity:LookupBone](/gmod/Entity:LookupBone).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The contents as a [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS) or 0 on failure.

GetBoneController.DESCRIPTION: Returns the value of the bone controller with the specified ID.
NOTES: This is the precursor of pose parameters, and only works for Half Life 1: Source models supporting it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: ID of the bone controller. Goes from 0 to 3.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value set on the bone controller.

GetBoneCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of bones in the entity.
NOTES: Will return -1 for Global.ClientsideModel or undrawn entities until Entity:SetupBones is called on the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of bones in given entity; -1 on failure.

GetBoneMatrix.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the transformation matrix of a given bone on the entity's model. The matrix contains the transformation used to position the bone in the world. It is not relative to the parent bone.

This is equivalent to constructing a [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) using [Entity:GetBonePosition](/gmod/Entity:GetBonePosition).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can return the server's matrix during server lag.
This can return garbage serverside or a 0,0,0 fourth column (represents position) for v49 models.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The bone to retrieve matrix of.

* Bones clientside and serverside will differ

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The matrix

* Some entities don't update animation every frame such as prop_physics and won't have accurate bone matrix.

GetBoneName.DESCRIPTION: Returns name of given bone id.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: ID of bone to lookup name of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of given bone.

* `nil` in case we failed or entity doesn't have a model.

* `__INVALIDBONE__` in case the name cannot be read or the index is out of range.

GetBoneParent.DESCRIPTION: Returns parent bone of given bone.
NOTES: Will return -1 for Global.ClientsideModel until Entity:SetupBones is called on the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bode ID of the bone to get parent of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Parent bone ID or -1 if we failed for some reason.

GetBonePosition.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position and angle of the given attachment, relative to the world.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can return the server's position during server lag.
This can return garbage serverside or [Vector](/gmod/Global.Vector)(0,0,0) for v49 models.
This can return garbage if a trace passed through the target bone during bone matrix access.

WARNINGS:
This function can return entity's `GetPos()` instead if the entity doesn't have it's bone cache set up.

To ensure the bone position is correct use this:

```lua

local pos = ent:GetBonePosition(0)

if pos == ent:GetPos() then

	pos = ent:GetBoneMatrix(0):GetTranslation()

end

```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone index of the bone to get the position of. See [Entity:LookupBone](/gmod/Entity:LookupBone).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The bone's position relative to the world. It can return nothing if the requested bone is out of bounds, or the entity has no model.
The bone's angle relative to the world.

GetBoneSurfaceProp.DESCRIPTION: Returns the surface property of the specified bone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone id. See [Entity:LookupBone](/gmod/Entity:LookupBone).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The surface property of the bone to be used with [util.GetSurfaceIndex](/gmod/util.GetSurfaceIndex) or an empty string on failure.

GetBrushPlane.DESCRIPTION: Returns info about given plane of non-nodraw brush model surfaces of the entity's model. Works on worldspawn as well.
WARNINGS: This only works on entities with brush models.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the plane to get info of. Starts from 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The origin of the plane.

This will be either the first vertex's position (if available) or the plane's normal multiplied by the plane's distance.
The normal of the plane.

The "distance" of the plane.

The distance is the dot product of the plane's normal and the point it was initialized with.

GetBrushPlaneCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of planes of non-nodraw brush model surfaces of the entity's model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of brush model planes of the entity's model. This will be 0 for any non-brush model.

GetBrushSurfaces.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of brushes surfaces for brush model entities.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of [SurfaceInfo](/gmod/SurfaceInfo)s if the entity has a brush model, or [no value](/gmod/no value) otherwise.

GetCallbacks.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the specified hook callbacks for this entity added with [Entity:AddCallback](/gmod/Entity:AddCallback)

The callbacks can then be removed with [Entity:RemoveCallback](/gmod/Entity:RemoveCallback).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hook
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hook to retrieve the callbacks from, see [Entity Callbacks](/gmod/Entity Callbacks) for the possible hooks.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing the callbackid and function of all the callbacks for the specified hook

GetChildBones.DESCRIPTION: Returns ids of child bones of given bone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bone id to lookup children of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of bone ids

GetChildren.DESCRIPTION: Gets the children of the entity - that is, every entity whose move parent is this entity.
NOTES:
This function returns Entity:SetMoveParent children, **NOT** Entity:SetParent!

Entity:SetParent however also calls Entity:SetMoveParent.

This means that some entities in the returned list might have a NULL Entity:GetParent.

This also means that using this function on players will return their weapons on the client but not the server.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A list of movement children entities

GetClass.DESCRIPTION: Returns the classname of a entity. This is often the name of the Lua file or folder containing the files for the entity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's classname

GetCollisionBounds.DESCRIPTION: Returns an entity's collision bounding box. In most cases, this will return the same bounding box as [Entity:GetModelBounds](/gmod/Entity:GetModelBounds) unless the entity does not have a physics mesh or it has a [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) different from the default.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can be out-of-sync between the client and server for weapons.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum vector of the collision bounds
The maximum vector of the collision bounds
The collision group. See [COLLISION_GROUP](/gmod/Enums/COLLISION_GROUP)

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color the entity is set to.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the entity as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetConstrainedEntities.DESCRIPTION: Returns the two entities involved in a constraint ent, or nil if the entity is not a constraint.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: ent1
ent2

GetConstrainedPhysObjects.DESCRIPTION: Returns the two entities physobjects involved in a constraint ent, or no value if the entity is not a constraint.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: phys1
phys2

GetCreationID.DESCRIPTION: Returns entity's creation ID. Unlike [Entity:EntIndex](/gmod/Entity:EntIndex) or  [Entity:MapCreationID](/gmod/Entity:MapCreationID), it will always increase and old values won't be reused.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The creation ID

GetCreationTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the time the entity was created on, relative to [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The time the entity was created on.

GetCreator.DESCRIPTION: Gets the creator of the SENT.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The creator, NULL for no creator.

GetCustomCollisionCheck.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this entity uses custom collision check set by [Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck](/gmod/Entity:SetCustomCollisionCheck).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this entity uses custom collision check or not

GetCycle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the frame of the currently played sequence. This will be a number between 0 and 1 as a representation of sequence progress.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The frame of the currently played sequence

GetDTAngle.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get an angle stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 31.

Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Requested angle.

GetDTBool.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a boolean stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 31.

Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Requested boolean.

GetDTEntity.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Returns an entity stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 31.

Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Requested entity.

GetDTFloat.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a float stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 31.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Requested float.

GetDTInt.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get an integer stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 31.

Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: 32-bit signed integer

GetDTString.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a string stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 3.
Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Requested string.

GetDTVector.DESCRIPTION:
This is called internally by the [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar) system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Get a vector stored in the datatable of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Goes from 0 to 31.

Specifies what key to grab from datatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Requested vector.

GetEditingData.DESCRIPTION:
Returns internal data about editable [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar)s.

		This is used internally by [DEntityProperties](/gmod/DEntityProperties) and [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities) system.
NOTES: This function will only work on entities which had Entity:InstallDataTable called on them, which is done automatically for players and all Scripted Entities

RETURNS.NAME: data
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The internal data

GetEffects.DESCRIPTION: Returns a bit flag of all engine effect flags of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Engine effect flags, see [EF](/gmod/Enums/EF)

GetEFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns a bit flag of all engine flags of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Engine flags, see [EFL](/gmod/Enums/EFL)

GetElasticity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the elasticity of this entity, used by some flying entities such as the Helicopter NPC to determine how much it should bounce around when colliding.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: elasticity

GetFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns all flags of given entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Flags of given entity as a bitflag, see [FL](/gmod/Enums/FL)

GetFlexBounds.DESCRIPTION: Returns acceptable value range for the flex.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the flex to look up bounds of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value for this flex
The maximum value for this flex

GetFlexIDByName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the ID of the flex based on given name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the flex to get the ID of. Case sensitive.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The ID of flex
* nil if no flex with given name was found

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flex id to look up name of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The flex name

GetFlexNum.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of flexes this entity has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of flexes.

GetFlexScale.DESCRIPTION: Returns the flex scale of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The flex scale

GetFlexWeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns current weight ( value ) of the flex.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the flex to get weight of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current weight of the flex

GetForward.DESCRIPTION: Returns the forward vector of the entity, as a normalized direction vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: forwardDir

GetFriction.DESCRIPTION: Returns how much friction an entity has. Entities default to 1 (100%) and can be higher or even negative.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: friction

GetGravity.DESCRIPTION: Gets the gravity multiplier of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: gravityMultiplier

GetGroundEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the object the entity is standing on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ground entity.

GetGroundSpeedVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's ground speed velocity, which is based on the entity's walk/run speed and/or the ground speed of their sequence ( [Entity:GetSequenceGroundSpeed](/gmod/Entity:GetSequenceGroundSpeed) ). Will return an empty [Vector](/gmod/Vector) if the entity isn't moving on the ground.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ground speed velocity.

GetHitBoxBone.DESCRIPTION: Gets the bone the hit box is attached to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitbox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the hit box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hboxset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The number of the hit box set. This should be 0 in most cases.

Numbering for these sets start from 0. The total amount of sets can be found with [Entity:GetHitBoxSetCount](/gmod/Entity:GetHitBoxSetCount).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the bone. Will be nil if the hit box index was out of range.

GetHitBoxBounds.DESCRIPTION: Gets the bounds (min and max corners) of a hit box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitbox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the hit box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: group
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The group of the hit box. This should be 0 in most cases.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Hit box mins. Will be nil if the hit box index was out of range.
Hit box maxs. Will be nil if the hit box index was out of range.

GetHitBoxCount.DESCRIPTION: Gets how many hit boxes are in a given hit box group.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: group
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the hit box group.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of hit boxes.

GetHitBoxGroupCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of hit box sets that an entity has. Functionally identical to [Entity:GetHitboxSetCount](/gmod/Entity:GetHitboxSetCount)
DEPRECATED: You should use Entity:GetHitboxSetCount instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: number of hit box sets

GetHitBoxHitGroup.DESCRIPTION: Gets the hit group of a given hitbox in a given hitbox set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitbox
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of the hit box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitboxset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The number of the hit box set. This should be 0 in most cases.

Numbering for these sets start from 0. The total group count can be found with [Entity:GetHitBoxSetCount](/gmod/Entity:GetHitBoxSetCount).

RETURNS.NAME: group
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hitbox group of given hitbox. See [HITGROUP](/gmod/Enums/HITGROUP)

GetHitboxSet.DESCRIPTION: Returns entity's current hit box set

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current hit box set id, or no value if the entity doesn't have hit boxes
The current hit box set name, or no value if the entity doesn't have hit boxes

GetHitboxSetCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of hitbox sets in the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of hitbox sets in the entity.

GetInternalVariable.DESCRIPTION:
An interface for accessing internal key values on entities.

See [Entity:GetSaveTable](/gmod/Entity:GetSaveTable) for a more detailed explanation. See [Entity:SetSaveValue](/gmod/Entity:SetSaveValue) for the opposite of this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: variableName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of variable corresponding to an entity save value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The internal variable value.

GetKeyValues.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table containing all key values the entity has.

Single key values can usually be retrieved with [Entity:GetInternalVariable](/gmod/Entity:GetInternalVariable).

Here's a list of keyvalues that will not appear in this list, as they are not stored/defined as actual keyvalues internally:

* rendercolor - [Entity:GetColor](/gmod/Entity:GetColor) (Only RGB)

* rendercolor32 - [Entity:GetColor](/gmod/Entity:GetColor) (RGBA)

* renderamt - [Entity:GetColor](/gmod/Entity:GetColor) (Alpha)

* disableshadows - EF_NOSHADOW

* mins - [Entity:GetCollisionBounds](/gmod/Entity:GetCollisionBounds)

* maxs - [Entity:GetCollisionBounds](/gmod/Entity:GetCollisionBounds)

* disablereceiveshadows - EF_NORECEIVESHADOW

* nodamageforces - EFL_NO_DAMAGE_FORCES

* angle - [Entity:GetAngles](/gmod/Entity:GetAngles)

* angles - [Entity:GetAngles](/gmod/Entity:GetAngles)

* origin - [Entity:GetPos](/gmod/Entity:GetPos)

* targetname - [Entity:GetName](/gmod/Entity:GetName)
NOTES: This only includes engine defined key values. For custom key values, use GM:EntityKeyValue or ENTITY:KeyValue to capture and store them.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of key values.

GetLayerCycle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the animation cycle/frame for given layer.
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: layerID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Layer ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The animation cycle/frame for given layer.

GetLayerDuration.DESCRIPTION: Returns the duration of given layer.
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: layerID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Layer ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The duration of the layer

GetLayerPlaybackRate.DESCRIPTION: Returns the layer playback rate. See also [Entity:GetLayerDuration](/gmod/Entity:GetLayerDuration).
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: layerID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Layer ID

RETURNS.NAME: rate
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current playback rate.

GetLayerSequence.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sequence id of given layer.
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: layerID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Layer ID.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The sequenceID of the layer.

GetLayerWeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current weight of the layer. See [Entity:SetLayerWeight](/gmod/Entity:SetLayerWeight) for more information.
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: layerID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Layer ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current weight of the layer

GetLightingOriginEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity that is being used as the light origin position for this entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The lighting entity. This will usually be NULL.

GetLocalAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the rotation of the entity relative to its parent entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Relative angle

GetLocalAngularVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the non-VPhysics angular velocity of the entity relative to its parent entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The velocity

GetLocalPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns entity's position relative to it's parent.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Relative position

GetManipulateBoneAngles.DESCRIPTION: Gets the entity's angle manipulation of the given bone. This is relative to the default angle, so the angle is zero when unmodified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone's ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's angle manipulation of the given bone.

GetManipulateBoneJiggle.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the jiggle amount of the entity's bone.

See [Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle) for more info.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns a value ranging from 0 to 255 depending on the value set with [Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle).

GetManipulateBonePosition.DESCRIPTION: Gets the entity's position manipulation of the given bone. This is relative to the default position, so it is zero when unmodified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone's ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's position manipulation of the given bone.

GetManipulateBoneScale.DESCRIPTION: Gets the entity's scale manipulation of the given bone. Normal scale is Vector( 1, 1, 1 )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone's ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's scale manipulation of the given bone

GetMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the material override for this entity. 

Returns an empty string if no material override exists. Use [Entity:GetMaterials](/gmod/Entity:GetMaterials) to list it's default materials.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The server's value takes priority on the client.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: material

GetMaterials.DESCRIPTION:
Returns all materials of the entity's model.

This function is unaffected by [Entity:SetSubMaterial](/gmod/Entity:SetSubMaterial) as it returns the original materials.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The server's values take priority on the client.

The table returned by this function will not contain materials if they are missing from the disk/repository. This means that if you are attempting to find the ID of a material to replace with [Entity:SetSubMaterial](/gmod/Entity:SetSubMaterial) and there are missing materials on the model, all subsequent materials will be offset in the table, meaning that the ID you are trying to get will be incorrect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing full paths to the materials of the model.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This table is limited to 127 materials, even if the entity has more.

GetMaterialType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the surface material of this entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Surface material. See [MAT](/gmod/Enums/MAT)

GetMaxHealth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the max health that the entity was given. It can be set via [Entity:SetMaxHealth](/gmod/Entity:SetMaxHealth).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Max health.

GetModel.DESCRIPTION: Gets the model of given entity.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not necessarily return the model's path, as is the case for brush and virtual models. This is intentional behaviour, however, there is currently no way to retrieve the actual file path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The entity's model. Will be a filesystem path for most models.

This will be [nil](/gmod/nil) for entities which cannot have models, such as point entities.

GetModelBounds.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's model bounds. This is different than the collision bounds/hull. This is not scaled with [Entity:SetModelScale](/gmod/Entity:SetModelScale), and will return the model's original, unmodified mins and maxs. This can be used to get world bounds.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum vector of the bounds
The maximum vector of the bounds

GetModelContents.DESCRIPTION: Returns the contents of the entity's current model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The contents of the entity's model. See [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS).

GetModelPhysBoneCount.DESCRIPTION: Gets the physics bone count of the entity's model. This is only applicable to `anim` type [Scripted Entities](/gmod/Scripted Entities) with ragdoll models.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: How many physics bones exist on the model.
The radius of the model

GetModelRenderBounds.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's model render bounds. By default this will return the same bounds as [Entity:GetModelBounds](/gmod/Entity:GetModelBounds).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum vector of the bounds
The maximum vector of the bounds

GetModelScale.DESCRIPTION: Gets the selected entity's model scale.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Scale of that entity's model.

GetMomentaryRotButtonPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount a momentary_rot_button entity is turned based on the given angle. 0 meaning completely turned closed, 1 meaning completely turned open.
WARNINGS: This only works on momentary_rot_button entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: turnAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle of rotation to compare - usually should be [Entity:GetAngles](/gmod/Entity:GetAngles).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount the momentary_rot_button is turned, ranging from 0 to 1, or nil if the entity is not a momentary_rot_button.

GetMoveCollide.DESCRIPTION: Returns the move collide type of the entity. The move collide is the way a physics object reacts to hitting an object - will it bounce, slide?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The move collide type, see [MOVECOLLIDE](/gmod/Enums/MOVECOLLIDE)

GetMoveParent.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the movement parent of this entity.

See [Entity:SetMoveParent](/gmod/Entity:SetMoveParent) for more info.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The movement parent of this entity.
Move type. See [MOVETYPE](/gmod/Enums/MOVETYPE)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the Entity
angle

GetNWString.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a networked string value at specified index on the entity that is set by [Entity:SetNWString](/gmod/Entity:SetNWString).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that is associated with the value

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if we failed to retrieve the value. (If it isn't set)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value associated with the key

GetNWVarProxy.DESCRIPTION: Returns callback function for given NWVar of this entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key of the NWVar to get callback of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The callback of given NWVar, or nil if not found.

GetNWVarTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns all the networked variables in an entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Key-Value table of all networked variables.

GetNWVector.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a networked vector value at specified index on the entity that is set by [Entity:SetNWVector](/gmod/Entity:SetNWVector).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key that is associated with the value

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to return if we failed to retrieve the value. (If it isn't set)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value associated with the key

GetOwner.DESCRIPTION: Returns the owner entity of this entity. See [Entity:SetOwner](/gmod/Entity:SetOwner) for more info.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The owner entity of this entity.

GetParent.DESCRIPTION: Returns the parent entity of this entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: parentEntity

GetParentAttachment.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the attachment index of the entity's parent. Returns 0 if the entity is not parented to a specific attachment or if it isn't parented at all.

This is set by second argument of [Entity:SetParent](/gmod/Entity:SetParent) or the **SetParentAttachment** input.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The parented attachment index

GetParentPhysNum.DESCRIPTION: If the entity is parented to an entity that has a model with multiple physics objects (like a ragdoll), this is used to retrieve what physics object number the entity is parented to on it's parent.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object id, or nil if the entity has no parent

GetParentWorldTransformMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position and angle of the entity's move parent as a 3x4 matrix ([VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The position and angle matrix.

If the entity has no move parent, an identity matrix will be returned.

If the entity is [parented to attachment](/gmod/Entity:GetParentAttachment) 0 or the parent isn't a BaseAnimating entity, the equivalent of [Entity](/gmod/Entity):[GetMoveParent()](/gmod/Entity:GetMoveParent):[GetWorldTransformMatrix()](/gmod/Entity:GetWorldTransformMatrix) will be returned.

GetPersistent.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the entity is persistent or not.

See [Entity:SetPersistent](/gmod/Entity:SetPersistent) for more information on persistence.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the entity is set to be persistent.

GetPhysicsAttacker.DESCRIPTION: Returns player who is claiming kills of physics damage the entity deals.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: timeLimit
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time to check if the entity was still a proper physics attacker.
NOTES: Some entities such as the Combine Ball disregard the time limit and always return the physics attacker.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player. If entity that was set is not a player, it will return NULL entity.

GetPhysicsObject.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's physics object, if the entity has physics.
NOTES: Entities don't have clientside physics objects by default, so this will return [NULL PHYSOBJ] on the client in most cases.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity's physics object.

GetPhysicsObjectCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of physics objects an entity has (usually 1 for non-ragdolls)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: numObjects

GetPhysicsObjectNum.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a specific physics object from an entity with multiple [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)ects (like ragdolls)

See also [Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone](/gmod/Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physNum
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number corresponding to the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) to grab. Starts at 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object

GetPlaybackRate.DESCRIPTION: Returns the playback rate of the main sequence on this entity, with 1.0 being the default speed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The playback rate.

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Gets the position of entity in world.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Pose parameter name to look up

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Value of given pose parameter.
WARNINGS: This value will be from 0 - 1 on the client and from minimum range to maximum range on the server! You'll have to math.Remap this value clientside to Entity:GetPoseParameterRange's returns if you want get the actual pose parameter value. See Entity:SetPoseParameter's example.

GetPoseParameterName.DESCRIPTION: Returns name of given pose parameter

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Id of the pose paremeter

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Name of given pose parameter

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Pose parameter ID to look up

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value
The maximum value

GetPredictable.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether this entity is predictable or not.

See [Entity:SetPredictable](/gmod/Entity:SetPredictable) for more information

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this entity is predictable or not.

GetRagdollOwner.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity which the ragdoll came from. The opposite of [Player:GetRagdollEntity](/gmod/Player:GetRagdollEntity).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity who owns the ragdoll.

GetRenderAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's render angles, set by [Entity:SetRenderAngles](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderAngles) in a drawing hook.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entitys render angles

GetRenderBounds.DESCRIPTION:
Returns render bounds of the entity. Can be overridden by [Entity:SetRenderBounds](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderBounds).

If the render bounds are not inside players view, the entity will not be drawn!

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum vector of the bounds
The maximum vector of the bounds.

GetRenderFX.DESCRIPTION: Returns current render FX of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current render FX of the entity. See [kRenderFx](/gmod/Enums/kRenderFx)

GetRenderGroup.DESCRIPTION: Returns the render group of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The render group. See [RENDERGROUP](/gmod/Enums/RENDERGROUP)

GetRenderMode.DESCRIPTION: Returns the render mode of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The render Mode. See [RENDERMODE](/gmod/Enums/RENDERMODE)

GetRenderOrigin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity's render origin, set by [Entity:SetRenderOrigin](/gmod/Entity:SetRenderOrigin) in a drawing hook.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entitys render origin

GetRight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the rightward vector of the entity, as a normalized direction vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: rightDir

GetRotatedAABB.DESCRIPTION: Returns the min and max of the entity's axis-aligned bounding box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Minimum extent of the bounding box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Maximum extent of the bounding box.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Minimum extent of the AABB
Maximum extent of the AABB

GetSaveTable.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of save values for an entity.

These tables are not the same between the client and the server, and different entities may have different fields.

You can get the list different fields an entity has by looking at it's source code (the 2013 SDK can be found [online](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013)). Accessible fields are defined by each `DEFINE_FIELD` and `DEFINE_KEYFIELD` inside the `DATADESC` block.

Take the headcrab, for example:

```

BEGIN_DATADESC( CBaseHeadcrab )

	// m_nGibCount - don't save

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHidden, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_flTimeDrown, FIELD_TIME ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCommittedToJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_vecCommittedJumpPos, FIELD_POSITION_VECTOR ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_flNextNPCThink, FIELD_TIME ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIgnoreWorldCollisionTime, FIELD_TIME ),

	

	DEFINE_KEYFIELD( m_bStartBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN, "startburrowed" ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_bBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_flBurrowTime, FIELD_TIME ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_nContext, FIELD_INTEGER ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCrawlFromCanister, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_bMidJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_nJumpFromCanisterDir, FIELD_INTEGER ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHangingFromCeiling, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),

	DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIlluminatedTime, FIELD_TIME ),

		

	DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Burrow", InputBurrow ),

	DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "BurrowImmediate", InputBurrowImmediate ),

	DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Unburrow", InputUnburrow ),

	DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "StartHangingFromCeiling", InputStartHangingFromCeiling ),

	DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "DropFromCeiling", InputDropFromCeiling ),

	

	// Function Pointers

	DEFINE_THINKFUNC( EliminateRollAndPitch ),

	DEFINE_THINKFUNC( ThrowThink ),

	DEFINE_ENTITYFUNC( LeapTouch ),

END_DATADESC()

```

* For each **DEFINE_FIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of **first** argument.

* For each **DEFINE_KEYFIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of the **third** argument.

See [Entity:GetInternalVariable](/gmod/Entity:GetInternalVariable) for only retrieving one key of the save table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: showAll
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, shows all variables, not just the ones for save.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table containing all save values in key/value format.

The value may be a sequential table (starting to **1**) if the field in question is an array in engine.

GetSequence.DESCRIPTION: Return the index of the model sequence that is currently active for the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the model sequence.

GetSequenceActivity.DESCRIPTION: Return activity id out of sequence id. Opposite of [Entity:SelectWeightedSequence](/gmod/Entity:SelectWeightedSequence).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: seq
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The activity ID, ie [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

GetSequenceActivityName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the activity name for the given sequence id.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence id.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT) as a string, returns "Not Found!" with an invalid sequence and "No model!" when no model is set.

GetSequenceCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of sequences ( animations ) the entity's model has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of sequences ( animations ) the entity's model has.

GetSequenceGroundSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns the ground speed of the entity's sequence.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence ID.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ground speed of this sequence.

GetSequenceInfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of information about an entity's sequence.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence id of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of information about the entity's sequence, or nil is ID is out of range. See [SequenceInfo](/gmod/Structures/SequenceInfo)

GetSequenceList.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of all sequences ( animations ) the model has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The list of all sequences ( animations ) the model has. The indices start with 0!

GetSequenceMoveDist.DESCRIPTION: Returns an entity's sequence move distance (the change in position over the course of the entire sequence).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The move distance of the sequence.

GetSequenceMovement.DESCRIPTION: Returns the delta movement and angles of a sequence of the entity's model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence index. See [Entity:GetSequenceName](/gmod/Entity:GetSequenceName).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startCycle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence start cycle. 0 is the start of the animation, 1 is the end.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endCyclnde
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence end cycle. 0 is the start of the animation, 1 is the end. Values like 2, etc are allowed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the operation was successful
The delta vector of the animation, how much the model's origin point moved.
The delta angle of the animation.

GetSequenceMoveYaw.DESCRIPTION: Returns the change in heading direction in between the start and the end of the sequence.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: seq
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence index. See [Entity:LookupSequence](/gmod/Entity:LookupSequence).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The yaw delta. Returns 99999 for no movement.

GetSequenceName.DESCRIPTION:
Return the name of the sequence for the index provided.
Refer to [Entity:GetSequence](/gmod/Entity:GetSequence) to find the current active sequence on this entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the sequence to look up.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the sequence.

GetShouldPlayPickupSound.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity plays a sound when picked up by a player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will return nil if [Entity:SetShouldPlayPickupSound](/gmod/Entity:SetShouldPlayPickupSound) has not been called.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if it plays the pickup sound, false otherwise.

GetShouldServerRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Returns if entity should create a server ragdoll on death or a client one.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if ragdoll will be created on server, false if on client

GetSkin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the skin index of the current skin.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: skinIndex

GetSolid.DESCRIPTION: Returns solid type of an entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The solid type. See the [SOLID](/gmod/Enums/SOLID).

GetSolidFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns solid flag(s) of an entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The flag(s) of the entity, see [FSOLID](/gmod/Enums/FSOLID).

GetSpawnEffect.DESCRIPTION: Returns if we should show a spawn effect on spawn on this entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The flag to allow or disallow the spawn effect.

GetSpawnFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns the bitwise spawn flags used by the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The spawn flags of the entity, see [SF_Enums](/gmod/Enums/SF).

GetSubMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the material override for the given index. 

Returns "" if no material override exists. Use [Entity:GetMaterials](/gmod/Entity:GetMaterials) to list it's default materials.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The server's value takes priority on the client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the sub material. Acceptable values are from 0 to 31.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The material that overrides this index, if any.

GetSubModels.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of models included into the entity's model in the .qc file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The list of models included into the entity's model in the .qc file.

GetTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns the table that contains all values saved within the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: entTable

GetTouchTrace.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last trace used in the collision callbacks such as [ENTITY:StartTouch](/gmod/ENTITY:StartTouch), [ENTITY:Touch](/gmod/ENTITY:Touch) and [ENTITY:EndTouch](/gmod/ENTITY:EndTouch).
NOTES: This returns the last collision trace used, regardless of the entity that caused it. As such, it's only reliable when used in the hooks mentioned above

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

GetTransmitWithParent.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the TransmitWithParent flag is set or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the TransmitWithParent flag is set or not

GetUnFreezable.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the entity is unfreezable, meaning it can't be frozen with the physgun. By default props are freezable, so this function will typically return false.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will return nil if [Entity:SetUnFreezable](/gmod/Entity:SetUnFreezable) has not been called.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the entity is unfreezable, false otherwise.

GetUp.DESCRIPTION: Returns the upward vector of the entity, as a normalized direction vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: upDir

GetVar.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a value from entity's [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable). Set by [Entity:SetVar](/gmod/Entity:SetVar).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Key of the value to retrieve

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A default value to fallback to if we couldn't retrieve the value from entity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Retrieved value

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can become out-of-sync on the client if the server has been up for a long time.

NOTES: Actually binds to CBaseEntity::GetAbsVelocity() on the server and C_BaseEntity::EstimateAbsVelocity() on the client. This returns the total velocity of the entity and is equal to local velocity + base velocity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The velocity of the entity.

GetWorkshopID.DESCRIPTION: Returns ID of workshop addon that the entity is from.
WARNINGS: The function **currently** does nothing and always returns nil

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The workshop ID

GetWorldTransformMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position and angle of the entity as a 3x4 matrix ([VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This returns incorrect results for the angular component (columns 1-3) for the local player clientside.
This will use the local player's [EyeAngles](/gmod/Global.EyeAngles) in [rendering hooks](/gmod/Category:3D_Rendering_Hooks).
Columns 1-3 will be all 0 (angular component) in [rendering hooks](/gmod/Category:3D_Rendering_Hooks) while paused in single-player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position and angle matrix.

GibBreakClient.DESCRIPTION:
Causes the entity to break into its current models gibs, if it has any.

You must call [Entity:PrecacheGibs](/gmod/Entity:PrecacheGibs) on the entity before using this function, or it will not create any gibs.

If called on server, the gibs will be spawned on the currently connected clients and will not be synchronized. Otherwise the gibs will be spawned only for the client the function is called on.

Note, that this function will not remove or hide the entity it is called on.

For more expensive version of this function see [Entity:GibBreakServer](/gmod/Entity:GibBreakServer).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The force to apply to the created gibs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: clr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, this will be color of the broken gibs instead of the entity's color.

GibBreakServer.DESCRIPTION:
Causes the entity to break into its current models gibs, if it has any.

You must call [Entity:PrecacheGibs](/gmod/Entity:PrecacheGibs) on the entity before using this function, or it will not create any gibs.

The gibs will be spawned on the server and be synchronized with all clients.

Note, that this function will not remove or hide the entity it is called on.

This function is affected by `props_break_max_pieces_perframe` and `props_break_max_pieces` console variables.
NOTES: Despite existing on client, it doesn't actually do anything on client.
WARNINGS:
Large numbers of serverside gibs will cause lag.

You can avoid this cost by spawning the gibs on the client using Entity:GibBreakClient

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The force to apply to the created gibs

HasBoneManipulations.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether or not the bone manipulation functions have ever been called on given  entity.

Related functions are [Entity:ManipulateBonePosition](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBonePosition), [Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles), [Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle), and [Entity:ManipulateBoneScale](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneScale).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will return true if the entity's bones have ever been manipulated. Resetting the position/angles/jiggle/scaling to 0,0,0 will not affect this function.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the entity has been bone manipulated, false otherwise.

HasFlexManipulatior.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the the entity has had flex manipulations performed with [Entity:SetFlexWeight](/gmod/Entity:SetFlexWeight) or [Entity:SetFlexScale](/gmod/Entity:SetFlexScale).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the entity has flex manipulations, false otherwise.

HasSpawnFlags.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this entity has the specified spawnflags bits set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: spawnFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The spawnflag bits to check, see [SF](/gmod/Enums/SF).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity has that spawnflag set or not.

HeadTarget.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of the head of this entity, NPCs use this internally to aim at their targets.
NOTES: This only works on players and NPCs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector of where the attack comes from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The head position.

Health.DESCRIPTION: Returns the health of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: health

Ignite.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the entity on fire.

See also [Entity:Extinguish](/gmod/Entity:Extinguish).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: length
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long to keep the entity ignited, in seconds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The radius of the ignition, will ignite everything around the entity that is in this radius.

InitializeAsClientEntity.DESCRIPTION:
Initializes this entity as being clientside only.

Only works on entities fully created clientside, and as such it has currently no use due this being automatically called by [ents.CreateClientProp](/gmod/ents.CreateClientProp), [ents.CreateClientside](/gmod/ents.CreateClientside), [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel) and [ClientsideScene](/gmod/Global.ClientsideScene).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Calling this on a clientside entity will crash the game.

Input.DESCRIPTION:
Fires input to the entity with the ability to make another entity responsible, bypassing the event queue system.

You should only use this function over [Entity:Fire](/gmod/Entity:Fire) if you know what you are doing.

See also [Entity:Fire](/gmod/Entity:Fire) for a function that conforms to the internal map IO event queue and [GM:AcceptInput](/gmod/GM:AcceptInput) for a hook that can intercept inputs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: input
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the input to fire

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that caused this input (i.e. the player who pushed a button)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: caller
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that is triggering this input (i.e. the button that was pushed)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: param
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to give to the input. Can be either a [string](/gmod/string), a [number](/gmod/number) or a [boolean](/gmod/boolean).

InstallDataTable.DESCRIPTION: Sets up Data Tables from entity to use with [Entity:NetworkVar](/gmod/Entity:NetworkVar).

InvalidateBoneCache.DESCRIPTION:
Resets the entity's bone cache values in order to prepare for a model change.

This should be called after calling [Entity:SetPoseParameter](/gmod/Entity:SetPoseParameter).

IsConstrained.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the entity has constraints attached to it

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will only update clientside if the server calls it first. This only checks constraints added through the [constraint](/gmod/constraint) so this will not react to map constraints.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is constrained or not.

IsConstraint.DESCRIPTION: Returns if entity is constraint or not

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the entity a constraint or not

IsDormant.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity is dormant or not. Client/server entities become dormant when they leave the PVS on the server. Client side entities can decide for themselves whether to become dormant. This mainly applies to PVS.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is dormant or not.

IsEffectActive.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether an entity has engine effect applied or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effect
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The effect to check for, see [EF](/gmod/Enums/EF).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity has the engine effect applied or not.

IsEFlagSet.DESCRIPTION: Checks if given flag is set or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The engine flag to test, see [EFL](/gmod/Enums/EFL)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is set or not

IsFlagSet.DESCRIPTION: Checks if given flag(s) is set or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The engine flag(s) to test, see [FL](/gmod/Enums/FL)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is set or not

IsInWorld.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity is inside a wall or outside of the map.
NOTES: Internally this function uses util.IsInWorld, that means that this function only checks Entity:GetPos of the entity. If an entity is only partially inside a wall, or has a weird GetPos offset, this function may not give reliable output.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the entity in world

IsLagCompensated.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity is lag compensated or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is lag compensated or not.

IsLineOfSightClear.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the target is in line of sight.
NOTES: This will only work when called on CBaseCombatCharacter entities. This includes players, NPCs, grenades, RPG rockets, crossbow bolts, and physics cannisters.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target to test. You can also supply an [Entity](/gmod/Entity) instead of a [Vector](/gmod/Vector)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the line of sight is clear

IsMarkedForDeletion.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the entity is going to be deleted in the next frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the entity is going to be deleted.

IsNextBot.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity is a [NextBot](/gmod/NextBot) or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is an NextBot entity or not.

IsNPC.DESCRIPTION:
Checks if the entity is an NPC or not.

This will return false for [NextBot](/gmod/NextBot)s, see [Entity:IsNextBot](/gmod/Entity:IsNextBot) for that.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is an NPC.

IsOnFire.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity is on fire.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is on fire or not.

IsOnGround.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the entity is on ground or not.

Internally, this checks if [FL_ONGROUND](/gmod/Enums/FL) is set on the entity.

This function is an alias of [Entity:OnGround](/gmod/Entity:OnGround).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is on ground or not.

IsPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity is a player or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is a player.

IsPlayerHolding.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the entity is being held by a player. Either by physics gun, gravity gun or use-key (+use).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: If multiple players are holding an object and one drops it, this will return false despite the object still being held.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: IsBeingHeld

IsPlayingGesture.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether there's a gesture is given activity being played.
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entites!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The activity to test. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether there's a gesture is given activity being played.

IsRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity is a ragdoll.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is ragdoll or not

IsScripted.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity is a SENT or a built-in entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if entity is scripted ( SENT ), false if not ( A built-in engine entity )

IsSequenceFinished.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity's current sequence is finished or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity's sequence is finished or not.

IsSolid.DESCRIPTION:
Returns if the entity is solid or not.
Very useful for determining if the entity is a trigger or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is solid or not.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the entity is a valid entity or not.

An entity is valid if:

* It is not a [NULL](/gmod/Global_Variables) entity

* It is not the worldspawn entity ([game.GetWorld](/gmod/game.GetWorld))

It will check whether the given variable contains an object (an Entity) or nothing at all for you. See examples.

This might be a cause for a lot of headache. Usually happening during networking etc., when completely valid entities suddenly become invalid on the client, but are never filtered with IsValid(). See [GM:InitPostEntity](/gmod/GM:InitPostEntity) for more details.
NOTES: Instead of calling this method directly, it's a good idea to call the global Global.IsValid instead, however if you're sure the variable you're using is always an entity object it's better to use this method
WARNINGS: NULL entities can still be assigned with key/value pairs, but they will be instantly negated. See example 3

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true if the entity is valid, false otherwise

IsValidLayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the given layer ID is valid and exists on this entity.
NOTES: This function only works on BaseAnimatingOverlay entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: layerID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Layer ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the given layer ID is valid and exists on this entity.

IsVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity is a vehicle or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is a vehicle.

IsWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the entity is a weapon or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is a weapon

IsWidget.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the entity is a widget or not.

This is used by the "Edit Bones" context menu property.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is a widget or not.

IsWorld.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the entity is the map's Entity[0] worldspawn

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isWorld

LocalToWorld.DESCRIPTION: Converts a vector local to an entity into a worldspace vector

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lpos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The local vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The translated to world coordinates vector

LocalToWorldAngles.DESCRIPTION: Converts a local angle (local to the entity) to a world angle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The local angle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The world angle

LookupAttachment.DESCRIPTION: Returns the attachment index of the given attachment name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachmentName
