Stops all particle effects parented to the entity.

This is ran automatically on every client by [Entity:StopParticles](/gmod/Entity:StopParticles) if called on the server.

StopParticles.DESCRIPTION:
Stops any attached to the entity .pcf particles using [ParticleEffectAttach](/gmod/Global.ParticleEffectAttach).

On client, this is the same as [Entity:StopParticleEmission](/gmod/Entity:StopParticleEmission). ( and you should use StopParticleEmission instead )

On server, this is the same as running [Entity:StopParticleEmission](/gmod/Entity:StopParticleEmission) on every client.

StopParticlesNamed.DESCRIPTION: Stops all particle effects parented to the entity with given name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the particle to stop.

StopParticlesWithNameAndAttachment.DESCRIPTION: Stops all particle effects parented to the entity with given name on given attachment.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the particle to stop.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The attachment of the entity to stop particles on.

StopSound.DESCRIPTION: Stops emitting the given sound from the entity, especially useful for looping sounds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sound
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the sound script or the filepath to stop playback of.

TakeDamage.DESCRIPTION: Applies the specified amount of damage to the entity with [DMG_GENERIC](/gmod/Enums/DMG) flag.
WARNINGS: Calling this function on the victim entity in ENTITY:OnTakeDamage can cause infinite loops.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageAmount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of damage to be applied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attacker
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that initiated the attack that caused the damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inflictor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that applied the damage, eg. a weapon.

TakeDamageInfo.DESCRIPTION: Applies the damage specified by the damage info to the entity.
WARNINGS: Calling this function on the victim entity in ENTITY:OnTakeDamage can cause infinite loops.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageInfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage to apply.

TakePhysicsDamage.DESCRIPTION: Applies forces to our physics object in response to damage.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dmginfo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damageinfo to apply. Only [CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamageForce](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamageForce) and [CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamagePosition](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamagePosition) are used.

TestPVS.DESCRIPTION:
Check if the given position or entity is within this entity's PVS.

See also [Entity:IsDormant](/gmod/Entity:IsDormant).
NOTES: The function won't take in to account Global.AddOriginToPVS and the like.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: testPoint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [Entity](/gmod/Entity) or [Vector](/gmod/Vector) to test against. If an entity is given, this function will test using its bounding box.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the testPoint is within our PVS.

TranslateBoneToPhysBone.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the ID of a [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) attached to the given bone. To be used with [Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum).

See [Entity:TranslatePhysBoneToBone](/gmod/Entity:TranslatePhysBoneToBone) for reverse function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of a bone to look up the "physics root" bone of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) ID of the given bone.

* -1 if we somehow cannot translate

TranslatePhysBoneToBone.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the boneID of the bone the given [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) is attached to.

See [Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone](/gmod/Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone) for reverse function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physNum
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) number on the entity

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The boneID of the bone the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) is attached to.

Use.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a `+use` action on an entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that caused this input. This will usually be the player who pressed their use key

ARGUMENTS.NAME: caller
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity responsible for the input. This will typically be the same as `activator` unless some other entity is acting as a proxy

ARGUMENTS.NAME: useType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Use type, see [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Any value.

UseClientSideAnimation.DESCRIPTION: Animations will be handled purely clientside instead of a fixed animtime, enabling interpolation. This does not affect layers and gestures.
NOTES: Does nothing on server.

UseTriggerBounds.DESCRIPTION:
Enables or disables trigger bounds.

This will give the entity a "trigger box" that extends around its bounding box by boundSize units in X/Y and (boundSize / 2) in +Z (-Z remains the same).
The trigger box is world aligned and will work regardless of the object's solidity and collision group.

Valve use trigger boxes for all pickup items. Their bloat size is 24, a surprisingly large figure.
NOTES:
The trigger boxes can be made visible as a light blue box by using the **ent_bbox** console command while looking at the entity. Alternatively a classname or entity index can be used as the first argument.

This requires **developer** to be set to **1**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the bounds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boundSize
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance/size of the trigger bounds.

ViewModelIndex.DESCRIPTION: Returns the index of this view model, it can be used to identify which one of the player's view models this entity is.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: View model index, ranges from 0 to 2, nil if the entity is not a view model

Visible.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the target/given entity is visible from the this entity.

This is meant to be used only with NPCs.

Differences from a simple trace include:
* If target has **FL_NOTARGET**, returns false
* If **ai_ignoreplayers** is turned on and target is a player, returns false
* Reacts to **ai_LOS_mode**:
* * If 1, does a simple trace with **COLLISION_GROUP_NONE** and **MASK_BLOCKLOS**
* * If not, does a trace with **MASK_BLOCKLOS_AND_NPCS** ( - **CONTENTS_BLOCKLOS** is target is player ) and a custom LOS filter ( **CTraceFilterLOS** )
* Returns true if hits a vehicle the target is driving

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity to check for visibility to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the entities can see each other.

VisibleVec.DESCRIPTION:
Returns true if supplied vector is visible from the entity's line of sight.

This is achieved similarly to a trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to check for visibility

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Within line of sight

WaterLevel.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an integer that represents how deep in water the entity is.

* **0** - The entity isn't in water.

* **1** - Slightly submerged (at least to the feet).

* **2** - The majority of the entity is submerged (at least to the waist).

* **3** - Completely submerged.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The water level.

Weapon_SetActivity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the activity of the entity's active weapon.
NOTES: This does nothing on the client.
Only works for CBaseCombatCharacter entities, which includes players and NPCs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Activity number. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: duration
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long the animation should take in seconds.

Weapon_TranslateActivity.DESCRIPTION:
Calls and returns [WEAPON:TranslateActivity](/gmod/WEAPON:TranslateActivity) on the weapon the entity ( player or NPC ) carries.

Despite existing on client, it doesn't actually do anything on client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The activity to translate

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The translated activity

WorldSpaceAABB.DESCRIPTION: Returns two vectors representing the minimum and maximum extent of the entity's bounding box.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum vector for the entity's bounding box.
The maximum vector for the entity's bounding box.

WorldSpaceCenter.DESCRIPTION: Returns the center of the entity according to its collision model.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The center of the entity

WorldToLocal.DESCRIPTION: Converts a worldspace vector into a vector local to an entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wpos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The world vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The local vector

WorldToLocalAngles.DESCRIPTION: Converts world angles to local angles ( local to the entity )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The world angles

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The local angles

Entity.DESCRIPTION:
This is a list of all available methods for all entities, which includes [Players](/gmod/Player), [Weapons](/gmod/Weapon), [NPCs](/gmod/NPC) and [Vehicles](/gmod/Vehicle).

For a list of possible members of [Scripted Entities](/gmod/Scripted Entities) see [ENT Structure](/gmod/Structures/ENT)

Close.DESCRIPTION: Dumps the file changes to disk and closes the file handle which makes the handle useless.

EndOfFile.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the [File](/gmod/File) object has reached the end of file or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the file has reached end or not.

Flush.DESCRIPTION: Dumps the file changes to disk and saves the file.

Read.DESCRIPTION: Reads the specified amount of chars and returns them as a binary string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: length
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Reads the specified amount of chars.

ReadBool.DESCRIPTION: Reads one byte of the file and returns whether that byte was not 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: val

ReadByte.DESCRIPTION: Reads one unsigned 8-bit integer from the file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The unsigned 8-bit integer from the file.

ReadDouble.DESCRIPTION: Reads 8 bytes from the file converts them to a double and returns them.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: value

ReadFloat.DESCRIPTION: Reads 4 bytes from the file converts them to a float and returns them.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The read value

ReadLine.DESCRIPTION: Returns the contents of the file from the current position up until the end of the current line.
NOTES: This function will not return more than 8192 characters.
This function will look specifically for `Line Feed` characters `\n` and will **completely ignore `Carriage Return` characters** `\r`.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The string of data from the read line.

ReadLong.DESCRIPTION: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A signed 32-bit integer

ReadShort.DESCRIPTION: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: int16

ReadULong.DESCRIPTION: Reads a unsigned 32-bit integer from the file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: An unsigned 32-bit integer

ReadUShort.DESCRIPTION: Reads a unsigned 16-bit integer from the file.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The 16-bit integer

Seek.DESCRIPTION: Sets the file pointer to the specified position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Pointer position, in bytes.

Size.DESCRIPTION: Returns the size of the file in bytes.

Skip.DESCRIPTION: Moves the file pointer by the specified amount of chars.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of chars to skip, can be negative to skip backwards.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: amount

Tell.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current position of the file pointer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: pos

Write.DESCRIPTION: Writes the given string into the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Binary data to write to the file.

WriteBool.DESCRIPTION: Writes a boolean value to the file as one **byte**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bool
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bool to be written to the file.

WriteByte.DESCRIPTION: Write an 8-bit unsigned integer to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: uint8
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The 8-bit unsigned integer to be written to the file.

WriteDouble.DESCRIPTION: Writes a 8byte floating point double to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: double
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The double to be written to the file.

WriteFloat.DESCRIPTION: Writes a 4byte float to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: float
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The float to be written to the file.

WriteLong.DESCRIPTION: Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: int32
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The 32-bit signed integer to be written to the file.

WriteShort.DESCRIPTION: Writes a 16-bit signed integer to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: int16
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The 16-bit signed integer to be written to the file.

WriteULong.DESCRIPTION: Writes an unsigned 32-bit integer to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: uint32
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unsigned 32-bit integer to be written to the file.

WriteUShort.DESCRIPTION: Writes an unsigned 16-bit integer to the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: uint16
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unsigned 16-bit integer to the file.

File.DESCRIPTION:
This is the file object. It used used primarily to read or write binary data from files.

		The object is returned by [file.Open](/gmod/file.Open).

EnableLooping.DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables looping of audio channel, requires noblock flag.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable looping of this audio channel.

FFT.DESCRIPTION:
Computes the [DFT (discrete Fourier transform)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_Fourier_transform) of the sound channel.

The size parameter specifies the number of consecutive audio samples to use as the input to the DFT and is restricted to a power of two. A [Hann window](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hann_function) is applied to the input data.

The computed DFT has the same number of frequency bins as the number of samples. Only half of this DFT is returned, since [the DFT magnitudes are symmetric for real input data](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_Fourier_transform#The_real-input_DFT). The magnitudes of the DFT (values from 0 to 1) are used to fill the output table, starting at index 1.

**Visualization protip:** For a size N DFT, bin k (1-indexed) corresponds to a frequency of (k - 1) / N * sampleRate.

**Visualization protip:** Sound energy is proportional to the square of the magnitudes. Adding magnitudes together makes no sense physically, but adding energies does.

**Visualization protip:** The human ear works on a logarithmic amplitude scale. You can convert to [decibels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decibel) by taking 20 * [math.log10](/gmod/math.log10) of frequency magnitudes, or 10 * [math.log10](/gmod/math.log10) of energy. The decibel values will range from -infinity to 0.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to output the DFT magnitudes (numbers between 0 and 1) into. Indices start from 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: size
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of samples to use. See [FFT](/gmod/Enums/FFT)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of frequency bins that have been filled in the output table.

Get3DCone.DESCRIPTION: Returns 3D cone of the sound channel. See [IGModAudioChannel:Set3DCone](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Set3DCone).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angle of the inside projection cone in degrees.
The angle of the outside projection cone in degrees.
The delta-volume outside the outer projection cone.

Get3DEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the sound channel is currently in 3D mode or not. This value will be affected by [IGModAudioChannel:Set3DEnabled](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Set3DEnabled).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is currently 3D or not.

Get3DFadeDistance.DESCRIPTION: Returns 3D fade distances of a sound channel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum distance. The channel's volume is at maximum when the listener is within this distance
The maximum distance. The channel's volume stops decreasing when the listener is beyond this distance

GetAverageBitRate.DESCRIPTION: Returns the average bit rate of the sound channel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The average bit rate of the sound channel.

GetBitsPerSample.DESCRIPTION:
Retrieves the number of bits per sample of the sound channel.

Doesn't work for mp3 and ogg files.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of bits per sample, or 0 if unknown.

GetFileName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the filename for the sound channel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The file name. This will not be always what you have put into the [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL) as first argument.

GetLength.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length of sound played by the sound channel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The length of the sound. This value seems to be less then 0 for continuous radio streams.

GetLevel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the right and left levels of sound played by the sound channel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The left sound level. The value is between 0 and 1.
The right sound level. The value is between 0 and 1.

GetPan.DESCRIPTION: Gets the relative volume of the left and right channels.

RETURNS.NAME: pan
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Relative volume between the left and right channels. `-1` means only in left channel, `0` is center and `1` is only in the right channel. `0` by default.

GetPlaybackRate.DESCRIPTION: Returns the playback rate of the sound channel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current playback rate of the sound channel

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns position of the sound channel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the sound channel, previously set by [IGModAudioChannel:SetPos](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:SetPos)

GetSamplingRate.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sample rate for currently playing sound.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The sample rate in Hz. This should always be 44100.

GetState.DESCRIPTION: Returns the state of a sound channel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The state of the sound channel, see [GMOD_CHANNEL](/gmod/Enums/GMOD_CHANNEL)

GetTagsHTTP.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves HTTP headers from a bass stream channel created by [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL), if available.

RETURNS.NAME: info
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of HTTP headers.Returns nil if no information is available.

GetTagsID3.DESCRIPTION:
Retrieves the ID3 version 1 info from a bass channel created by [sound.PlayFile](/gmod/sound.PlayFile) or [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL), if available.

ID3v2 is not supported.

RETURNS.NAME: info
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table containing the information.

Returns nil if no information is available.

GetTagsMeta.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves meta stream info from a bass stream channel created by [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL), if available.

RETURNS.NAME: info
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a string containing the information.

Returns nil if no information is available.

GetTagsOGG.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves OGG media info tag, from a bass channel created by [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL) or [sound.PlayFile](/gmod/sound.PlayFile), if available.

RETURNS.NAME: info
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table containing the information.

Returns nil if no information is available.

GetTagsVendor.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves OGG Vendor tag, usually containing the application that created the file, from a bass channel created by [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL) or [sound.PlayFile](/gmod/sound.PlayFile), if available.

RETURNS.NAME: info
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a string containing the information.

Returns nil if no information is available.

GetTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current time of the sound channel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current time of the stream

GetVolume.DESCRIPTION: Returns volume of a sound channel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the sound channel

Is3D.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the sound channel is in 3D mode or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is 3D or not.

IsBlockStreamed.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the audio stream is block streamed or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the audio stream block streamed or not.

IsLooping.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the sound channel is looping or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is looping or not.

IsOnline.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the sound channel is streamed from the Internet or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is online or not.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the sound channel is valid or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the sound channel valid or not

Pause.DESCRIPTION: Pauses the stream. It can be started again using [IGModAudioChannel:Play](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Play)

Set3DCone.DESCRIPTION: Sets 3D cone of the sound channel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: innerAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The angle of the inside projection cone in degrees.

Range is from 0 (no cone) to 360 (sphere), -1 = leave current.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: outerAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The angle of the outside projection cone in degrees.

Range is from 0 (no cone) to 360 (sphere), -1 = leave current.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: outerVolume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The delta-volume outside the outer projection cone.

Range is from 0 (silent) to 1 (same as inside the cone), less than 0 = leave current.

Set3DEnabled.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the 3D mode of the channel. This will affect [IGModAudioChannel:Get3DEnabled](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Get3DEnabled) but not [IGModAudioChannel:Is3D](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Is3D).

This feature **requires** the channel to be initially created in 3D mode, i.e. [IGModAudioChannel:Is3D](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Is3D) should return true or this function will do nothing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to enable, false to disable 3D.

Set3DFadeDistance.DESCRIPTION: Sets 3D fade distances of a sound channel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The minimum distance. The channel's volume is at maximum when the listener is within this distance.

0 or less = leave current.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The maximum distance. The channel's volume stops decreasing when the listener is beyond this distance.

0 or less = leave current.

SetPan.DESCRIPTION: Sets the relative volume of the left and right channels.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pan
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Relative volume between the left and right channels. -1 means only in left channel, 0 is center and 1 is only in the right channel.

SetPlaybackRate.DESCRIPTION: Sets the playback rate of the sound channel. May not work with high values for radio streams.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rate
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Playback rate to set to. 1 is normal speed, 0.5 is half the normal speed, etc.

SetPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets position of sound channel in case the sound channel has a 3d option set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to put the sound into

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction of the sound

SetTime.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the sound channel to specified time ( Rewind to that position of the song ). Does not work on online radio streams.

Streamed sounds must have "noblock" parameter for this to work and [IGModAudioChannel:IsBlockStreamed](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:IsBlockStreamed) must return false.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: secs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time to set the stream to, in seconds.

SetVolume.DESCRIPTION: Sets the volume of a sound channel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Volume to set. 1 meaning 100% volume, 0.5 is 50% and 3 is 300%, etc.

Stop.DESCRIPTION: Stop the stream. It can be started again using [IGModAudioChannel:Play](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:Play).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Calling this invalidates the IGModAudioChannel object rendering it unusable for further functions.

IGModAudioChannel.DESCRIPTION: A sound channel returned by a callback of [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL) and [sound.PlayFile](/gmod/sound.PlayFile).

GetColor.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the color of the specified pixel of the $basetexture, only works for materials created from PNG files.

Basically identical to [ITexture:GetColor](/gmod/ITexture:GetColor) used on [IMaterial:GetTexture](/gmod/IMaterial:GetTexture)( "$basetexture" ).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The X coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y coordinate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the pixel as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetFloat.DESCRIPTION: Returns the specified material value as a float, or nil if the value is not set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialFloat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: float

GetInt.DESCRIPTION: Returns the specified material value as a int, rounds the value if its a float, or nil if the value is not set.
NOTES: Please note that certain material flags such as `$model` are stored in the `$flags` variable and cannot be directly retrieved with this function. See the full list here: Material Flags

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialInt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material integer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The retrieved value as an integer

GetKeyValues.DESCRIPTION: Gets all the key values defined for the material.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The material's key values.

GetMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Returns the specified material matrix as a int, or nil if the value is not set or is not a matrix.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialMatrix
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material matrix.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: matrix

GetName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the material, in most cases the path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Material name/path

GetShader.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the materials shader.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function does not work serverside on Linux SRCDS.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: shaderName

GetString.DESCRIPTION: Returns the specified material string, or nil if the value is not set or if the value can not be converted to a string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialString
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material string.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value as a string

GetTexture.DESCRIPTION: Returns an [ITexture](/gmod/ITexture) based on the passed shader parameter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: param
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [shader parameter](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Category:List_of_Shader_Parameters) to retrieve. This should normally be `$basetexture`.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the shader parameter. Returns nothing if the param doesn't exist.

GetVector.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the specified material vector, or nil if the value is not set.

See also [IMaterial:GetVectorLinear](/gmod/IMaterial:GetVectorLinear)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color vector

GetVector4D.DESCRIPTION: Returns the specified material vector as a 4 component vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material vector to retrieve.

RETURNS.NAME: x
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The x component of the vector.

RETURNS.NAME: y
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The y component of the vector.

RETURNS.NAME: z
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The z component of the vector.

RETURNS.NAME: w
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The w component of the vector.

GetVectorLinear.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the specified material linear color vector, or nil if the value is not set.

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamma_correction

See also [IMaterial:GetVector](/gmod/IMaterial:GetVector)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The linear color vector

Height.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of the member texture set for $basetexture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: height

IsError.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the material is valid, i.e. whether it was not loaded successfully from disk or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is this material the error material? (___error)

Recompute.DESCRIPTION:
Recomputes the material's snapshot. This needs to be called if you have changed variables on your material and it isn't changing. 

Be careful though - this function is slow - so try to call it only when needed!

SetFloat.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material float to the specified float, does nothing on a type mismatch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialFloat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material float.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: float
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new float value.

SetInt.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material value to the specified int, does nothing on a type mismatch.
NOTES: Please note that certain material flags such as `$model` are stored in the `$flags` variable and cannot be directly set with this function. See the full list here: Material Flags

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialInt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material int.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: int
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new int value.

SetMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material value to the specified matrix, does nothing on a type mismatch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialMatrix
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material int.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: matrix
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new matrix.

SetShader.DESCRIPTION: The functionality of this function was removed due to the amount of crashes it caused.
DEPRECATED: This function does nothing

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shaderName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the shader

SetString.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material value to the specified string, does nothing on a type mismatch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialString
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new string.

SetTexture.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material texture to the specified texture, does nothing on a type mismatch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialTexture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the keyvalue on the material to store the texture on.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new texture. This can also be a string, the name of the new texture.

SetUndefined.DESCRIPTION: Unsets the value for the specified material value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialValueName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material value to be unset.

SetVector.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material vector to the specified vector, does nothing on a type mismatch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: MaterialVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new vector.

SetVector4D.DESCRIPTION: Sets the specified material vector to the specified 4 component vector, does nothing on a type mismatch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x component of the new vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y component of the new vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: z
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The z component of the new vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The w component of the new vector.

Width.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width of the member texture set for $basetexture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: width

IMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
A Material object. It represents a game material, similarly to how a .vmt file does.

It can be created with [Material](/gmod/Global.Material) or [CreateMaterial](/gmod/Global.CreateMaterial).

BuildFromTriangles.DESCRIPTION:
Builds the mesh from a table mesh vertexes.

See [Mesh](/gmod/Global.Mesh) and [util.GetModelMeshes](/gmod/util.GetModelMeshes) for examples.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vertexes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table consisting of [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex)s.

Destroy.DESCRIPTION: Deletes the mesh and frees the memory used by it.

Draw.DESCRIPTION: Renders the mesh with the active matrix.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this [IMesh](/gmod/IMesh) is valid or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this [IMesh](/gmod/IMesh) is valid or not.

IMesh.DESCRIPTION: Renderable mesh object, can be used to create models on the fly. The only way to create your own IMesh object is to call [Mesh](/gmod/Global.Mesh).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: IMeshes only respond to one projected texture.

EndBlock.DESCRIPTION:
Ends current data block started with [IRestore:StartBlock](/gmod/IRestore:StartBlock) and returns to the parent block.

To avoid all sorts of errors, you **must** end all blocks you start.

ReadAngle.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an [Angle](/gmod/Angle).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angle that has been read

ReadBool.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a [boolean](/gmod/boolean).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The boolean that has been read

ReadEntity.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an [Entity](/gmod/Entity).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that has been read.

ReadFloat.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a floating point [number](/gmod/number).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The read floating point number.

ReadInt.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an integer [number](/gmod/number).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The read integer number.

ReadString.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a [string](/gmod/string).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The read string. Maximum length is 1024.

ReadVector.DESCRIPTION: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a [Vector](/gmod/Vector).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The read vector.

StartBlock.DESCRIPTION: Loads next block of data to be read inside current block. Blocks **must** be ended with [IRestore:EndBlock](/gmod/IRestore:EndBlock).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the next data block to be read.

IRestore.DESCRIPTION:
The object used in the [saverestore](/gmod/saverestore), mainly in [saverestore.AddRestoreHook](/gmod/saverestore.AddRestoreHook).

It allows you to read blocks directly from the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is loaded.

EndBlock.DESCRIPTION:
Ends current data block started with [ISave:StartBlock](/gmod/ISave:StartBlock) and returns to the parent block.

To avoid all sorts of errors, you **must** end all blocks you start.

StartBlock.DESCRIPTION: Starts a new block of data that you can write to inside current block. Blocks **must** be ended with [ISave:EndBlock](/gmod/ISave:EndBlock).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the new block. Used for determining which block is which, returned by [IRestore:StartBlock](/gmod/IRestore:StartBlock) during game load.

WriteAngle.DESCRIPTION: Writes an [Angle](/gmod/Angle) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to write.

WriteBool.DESCRIPTION: Writes a [boolean](/gmod/boolean) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bool
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The boolean to write.

WriteEntity.DESCRIPTION: Writes an [Entity](/gmod/Entity) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to write.

WriteFloat.DESCRIPTION: Writes a floating point [number](/gmod/number) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: float
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The floating point number to write.

WriteInt.DESCRIPTION: Writes an integer [number](/gmod/number) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: int
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The integer number to write.

WriteString.DESCRIPTION: Writes a [string](/gmod/string) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: str
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to write. Maximum length is 1024.

WriteVector.DESCRIPTION: Writes a [Vector](/gmod/Vector) to the save object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to write.

ISave.DESCRIPTION:
The object used in the [saverestore](/gmod/saverestore), mainly in [saverestore.AddSaveHook](/gmod/saverestore.AddSaveHook).

It allows you to write blocks directly into the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is being saved.

Download.DESCRIPTION: Invokes the generator of the texture. Reloads file based textures from disk and clears render target textures.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color of the specified pixel, only works for textures created from PNG files.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The X coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y coordinate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the pixel as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetMappingHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the true unmodified height of the texture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: height

GetMappingWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the true unmodified width of the texture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: width

GetName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the texture, in most cases the path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: name

GetNumAnimationFrames.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of animation frames in this texture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of animation frames in this texture.

Height.DESCRIPTION: Returns the modified height of the texture, this value may be affected by mipmapping and other factors.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: height

IsError.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the texture is valid. (i.e. was loaded successfully or not)
NOTES: The "error" texture is a valid texture, and therefore this function will return false when used on it. Use ITexture:IsErrorTexture, instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the texture was loaded successfully or not.

IsErrorTexture.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the texture is the error texture (pink and black checkerboard pattern).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the texture is the error texture or not.

Width.DESCRIPTION: Returns the modified width of the texture, this value may be affected by mipmapping and other factors.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: width

ITexture.DESCRIPTION: An object representing game texture, like a .vtf file. Do not confuse with [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial). Returned by [IMaterial:GetTexture](/gmod/IMaterial:GetTexture)

AddFrame.DESCRIPTION: Adds the current framebuffer to the video stream.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: frameTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Usually set to what [FrameTime](/gmod/Global.FrameTime) is, or simply 1/fps.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: downsample
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If true it will downsample the whole screenspace to the videos width and height, otherwise it will just record from the top left corner to the given width and height and therefor not the whole screen.

Finish.DESCRIPTION: Ends the video recording and dumps it to disk.

Height.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of the video stream.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: height

SetRecordSound.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether to record sound or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: record
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Record.

Width.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width of the video stream.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: width

Draw.DESCRIPTION: Draws the computed markupobject to the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: xOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The X coordinate on the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: yOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y coordinate on the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: xAlign
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The alignment of the x coordinate using [TEXT_ALIGN](/gmod/Enums/TEXT_ALIGN)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: yAlign
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The alignment of the y coordinate using [TEXT_ALIGN](/gmod/Enums/TEXT_ALIGN)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alphaoverride
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sets the alpha of all drawn objects to this.

GetHeight.DESCRIPTION: Gets computed the height of the markupobject.

RETURNS.NAME: Height
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The computed height.

GetWidth.DESCRIPTION: Gets computed the width of the markupobject.

RETURNS.NAME: Width
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The computed width.

Size.DESCRIPTION: Gets computed the width and height of the markupobject.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The computed width.
The computed height.

MarkupObject.DESCRIPTION: Object containing parsed markup for later rendering. Created by [markup.Parse](/gmod/markup.Parse).

BecomeRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Become a ragdoll and remove the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: info
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Damage info passed from an onkilled event

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created ragdoll, if any.

BodyMoveXY.DESCRIPTION: Should only be called in [NEXTBOT:BodyUpdate](/gmod/NEXTBOT:BodyUpdate). This sets the `move_x` and `move_y` pose parameters of the bot to fit how they're currently moving, sets the animation speed ([Entity:GetPlaybackRate](/gmod/Entity:GetPlaybackRate)) to suit the ground speed, and calls [Entity:FrameAdvance](/gmod/Entity:FrameAdvance).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function might cause crashes with some activities.

FindSpot.DESCRIPTION: Like [NextBot:FindSpots](/gmod/NextBot:FindSpots) but only returns a vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Either "random", "near", "far"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
This table should contain the search info.

[string](/gmod/string) type - The type (Only'hiding' for now)

[Vector](/gmod/Vector) pos - the position to search.

[number](/gmod/number) radius - the radius to search.

[number](/gmod/number) stepup - the highest step to step up.

[number](/gmod/number) stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If it finds a spot it will return a vector. If not it will return nil.

FindSpots.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of hiding spots.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: specs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
This table should contain the search info.

[string](/gmod/string) type - The type (optional, only 'hiding' supported)

[Vector](/gmod/Vector) pos - the position to search.

[number](/gmod/number) radius - the radius to search.

[number](/gmod/number) stepup - the highest step to step up.

[number](/gmod/number) stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
An unsorted table of tables containing:

[Vector](/gmod/Vector) vector - The position of the hiding spot

[number](/gmod/number) distance - the distance to that position
The current activity

GetFOV.DESCRIPTION: Returns the Field of View of the Nextbot NPC, used for its vision functionality, such as [NextBot:IsAbleToSee](/gmod/NextBot:IsAbleToSee).

RETURNS.NAME: fov
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current FOV of the nextbot

GetMaxVisionRange.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum range the nextbot can see other nextbots/players at. See [NextBot:IsAbleToSee](/gmod/NextBot:IsAbleToSee).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current vision range

GetRangeSquaredTo.DESCRIPTION:
Returns squared distance to an entity or a position.

See also [NextBot:GetRangeTo](/gmod/NextBot:GetRangeTo).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: to
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The squared distance

GetRangeTo.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the distance to an entity or position.

See also [NextBot:GetRangeSquaredTo](/gmod/NextBot:GetRangeSquaredTo).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: to
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The distance

GetSolidMask.DESCRIPTION: Returns the solid mask for given NextBot.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The solid mask, see [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS) and [MASK](/gmod/Enums/MASK)

HandleStuck.DESCRIPTION:
Called from Lua when the NPC is stuck. This should only be called from the behaviour coroutine - so if you want to override this function and do something special that yields - then go for it.

You should always call self.loco:ClearStuck() in this function to reset the stuck status - so it knows it's unstuck. See [CLuaLocomotion:ClearStuck](/gmod/CLuaLocomotion:ClearStuck).

IsAbleToSee.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the Nextbot NPC can see the give entity or not.
WARNINGS: Using this function creates the nextbot vision interface which will cause a significant performance hit!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to test if we can see

ARGUMENTS.NAME: useFOV
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to use the Field of View of the Nextbot

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the nextbot can see or not

MoveToPos.DESCRIPTION: To be called in the behaviour coroutine only! Will yield until the bot has reached the goal or is stuck

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position we want to get to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: options
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A table containing a bunch of tweakable options.

[number](/gmod/number) lookahead - Minimum look ahead distance.

[number](/gmod/number) tolerance - How close we must be to the goal before it can be considered complete.

[boolean](/gmod/boolean) draw - Draw the path. Only visible on listen servers and single player.

[number](/gmod/number) maxage - Maximum age of the path before it times out.

[number](/gmod/number) repath - Rebuilds the path after this number of seconds.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Either "failed", "stuck", "timeout" or "ok" - depending on how the NPC got on

PlaySequenceAndWait.DESCRIPTION: To be called in the behaviour coroutine only! Plays an animation sequence and waits for it to end before returning.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Playback Rate of that sequence

SetFOV.DESCRIPTION: Sets the Field of View for the Nextbot NPC, used for its vision functionality, such as [NextBot:IsAbleToSee](/gmod/NextBot:IsAbleToSee).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new FOV

SetMaxVisionRange.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum range the nextbot can see other nextbots/players at. See [NextBot:IsAbleToSee](/gmod/NextBot:IsAbleToSee).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: range
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new vision range to set.

SetSolidMask.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the solid mask for given NextBot.

The default solid mask of a NextBot is [MASK_NPCSOLID](/gmod/Enums/MASK).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mask
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new mask, see [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS) and [MASK](/gmod/Enums/MASK)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: One of the [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

NextBot.DESCRIPTION:
NextBots are a new system to create NPCs in the Source Engine, utilizing the more powerful [navmesh](/gmod/navmesh) system for navigation over the old node based system.

This page lists all possible functions usable with NextBots.

See [NextBot NPC Creation](/gmod/NextBot NPC Creation) for more information on how to create NextBot NPCs.

AddEntityRelationship.DESCRIPTION: Makes the NPC like, hate, feel neutral towards, or fear the entity in question. If you want to setup relationship towards a certain entity `class`, use [NPC:AddRelationship](/gmod/NPC:AddRelationship).
NOTES: NPCs do not see NextBots by default. This can be fixed by adding the Enums/FL flag to the NextBot.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity for the relationship to be applied to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: disposition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A [D](/gmod/Enums/D) representing the relationship type.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: priority
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How strong the relationship is.

AddRelationship.DESCRIPTION: Changes how an NPC feels towards another NPC.  If you want to setup relationship towards a certain `entity`, use [NPC:AddEntityRelationship](/gmod/NPC:AddEntityRelationship).
WARNINGS: Avoid using this in GM:OnEntityCreated to prevent crashing due to infinite loops. This function may create an entity with given class and delete it immediately after.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: relationstring
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A string representing how the relationship should be set up.

Should be formatted as `"npc_class `[D](/gmod/Enums/D)` numberPriority"`.

AlertSound.DESCRIPTION: Force an NPC to play his Alert sound.

CapabilitiesAdd.DESCRIPTION: Adds a capability to the NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: capabilities
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Capabilities to add, see [CAP](/gmod/Enums/CAP).

CapabilitiesClear.DESCRIPTION: Removes all of Capabilities the NPC has.

CapabilitiesGet.DESCRIPTION: Returns the NPC's capabilities along the ones defined on its weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The capabilities as a bitflag.
See [CAP](/gmod/Enums/CAP)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: capabilities
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Capabilities to remove, see [CAP](/gmod/Enums/CAP)

Classify.DESCRIPTION: Returns the NPC class. Do not confuse with [Entity:GetClass](/gmod/Entity:GetClass)!

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: See [CLASS](/gmod/Enums/CLASS)

ClearCondition.DESCRIPTION: Clears out the specified [COND](/gmod/Enums/COND) on this NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: condition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [COND](/gmod/Enums/COND) to clear out.

ClearEnemyMemory.DESCRIPTION: Clears the Enemy from the NPC's memory, effectively forgetting it until met again with either the NPC vision or with [NPC:UpdateEnemyMemory](/gmod/NPC:UpdateEnemyMemory).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to mark

ClearExpression.DESCRIPTION: Clears the NPC's current expression which can be set with [NPC:SetExpression](/gmod/NPC:SetExpression).

ClearGoal.DESCRIPTION: Clears the current NPC goal or target.

ClearSchedule.DESCRIPTION: Stops the current schedule that the NPC is doing.

ConditionName.DESCRIPTION: Translates condition ID to a string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cond
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPCs condition ID, see [COND](/gmod/Enums/COND)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A human understandable string equivalent of that condition.

Disposition.DESCRIPTION: Returns the way the NPC "feels" about the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to get the disposition from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The NPCs disposition, see [D](/gmod/Enums/D).

DropWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Forces the NPC to drop the specified weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

ExitScriptedSequence.DESCRIPTION: Makes an NPC exit a scripted sequence, if one is playing.

FearSound.DESCRIPTION: Force an NPC to play his Fear sound.

FoundEnemySound.DESCRIPTION: Force an NPC to play its FoundEnemy sound.

GetActiveWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns the weapon the NPC is currently carrying, or [NULL](/gmod/Global_Variables).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The NPCs current weapon
Current activity, see [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

GetAimVector.DESCRIPTION: Returns the aim vector of the NPC. NPC alternative of [Player:GetAimVector](/gmod/Player:GetAimVector).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The aim direction of the NPC.

GetArrivalActivity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the activity to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal

GetArrivalSequence.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sequence to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Sequence ID to be played, or -1 if there's no sequence.

GetBlockingEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity blocking the NPC along its path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Blocking entity
The NPCs schedule, see [SCHED](/gmod/Enums/SCHED) or -1 if we failed for some reason

GetCurrentWeaponProficiency.DESCRIPTION: Returns how proficient (skilled) an NPC is with its current weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: NPC's proficiency for current weapon. See [WEAPON_PROFICIENCY](/gmod/Enums/WEAPON_PROFICIENCY).

GetCurWaypointPos.DESCRIPTION: Gets the NPC's current waypoint position (where NPC is currently moving towards), if any is available.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the current NPC waypoint.

GetEnemy.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity that this NPC is trying to fight.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This returns nil if the NPC has no enemy. You should use [IsValid](/gmod/Global.IsValid) (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the enemy.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Enemy NPC.

GetEnemyFirstTimeSeen.DESCRIPTION: Returns the first time an NPC's enemy was seen by the NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to check.

RETURNS.NAME: time
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: First time the given enemy was seen.

GetEnemyLastKnownPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last known position of an NPC's enemy.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to check.

RETURNS.NAME: pos
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The last known position.

GetEnemyLastSeenPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last seen position of an NPC's enemy.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to check.

RETURNS.NAME: pos
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The last seen position.

GetEnemyLastTimeSeen.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last time an NPC's enemy was seen by the NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to check.

RETURNS.NAME: time
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Last time the given enemy was seen.

GetExpression.DESCRIPTION: Returns the expression file the NPC is currently playing.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The file path of the expression.

GetHullType.DESCRIPTION: Returns NPCs hull type set by [NPC:SetHullType](/gmod/NPC:SetHullType).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Hull type, see [HULL](/gmod/Enums/HULL)

GetMovementActivity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the NPC's current movement activity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current NPC movement activity, see [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

GetMovementSequence.DESCRIPTION: Returns the index of the sequence the NPC uses to move.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The movement sequence index

GetNextWaypointPos.DESCRIPTION: Gets the NPC's next waypoint position, where NPC will be moving after reaching current waypoint, if any is available.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the next NPC waypoint.
The NPC's current state, see [NPC_STATE](/gmod/Enums/NPC_STATE).

GetPathDistanceToGoal.DESCRIPTION: Returns the distance the NPC is from Target Goal.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of hammer units the NPC is away from the Goal.

GetPathTimeToGoal.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of time it will take for the NPC to get to its Target Goal.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of time to get to the target goal.

GetShootPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the shooting position of the NPC.
NOTES: This only works properly when called on an NPC that can hold weapons, otherwise it will return the same value as Entity:GetPos.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC's shooting position.

GetTarget.DESCRIPTION: Returns the NPC's current target set by [NPC:SetTarget](/gmod/NPC:SetTarget).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This returns nil if the NPC has no target. You should use [IsValid](/gmod/Global.IsValid) (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the target.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Target entity

GetWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns a specific weapon the NPC owns.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A classname of the weapon to try to get.

RETURNS.NAME: wep
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon for the specified class, or NULL of the NPC doesn't have given weapon.

GetWeapons.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of the NPC's weapons.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A list of the weapons the NPC currently has.

Give.DESCRIPTION: Used to give a weapon to an already spawned NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the weapon to equip to the NPC.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon entity given to the NPC.

HasCondition.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the NPC has the given condition.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: condition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The condition index, see [COND](/gmod/Enums/COND).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the NPC has the given condition, false otherwise.

HasEnemyEluded.DESCRIPTION: Polls the enemy memory to check if the given entity has eluded us or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to test.

RETURNS.NAME: eluded
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the enemy has eluded us.

HasEnemyMemory.DESCRIPTION: Polls the enemy memory to check if the NPC has any memory of given enemy.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to test.

RETURNS.NAME: eluded
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If we have any memory on given enemy.

IdleSound.DESCRIPTION: Force an NPC to play his Idle sound.

IsCurrentSchedule.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the NPC is performing the given schedule.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: schedule
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The schedule number, see [SCHED](/gmod/Enums/SCHED).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the NPC is performing the given schedule, false otherwise.

IsMoving.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the NPC is moving or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the NPC is moving or not.

IsRunningBehavior.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the NPC is running an **ai_goal**. ( e.g. An npc_citizen NPC following the Player. )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if running an ai_goal, otherwise returns false.

IsUnreachable.DESCRIPTION:
Returns true if the entity was remembered as unreachable. The memory is updated automatically from following engine tasks if they failed:

* TASK_GET_CHASE_PATH_TO_ENEMY

* TASK_GET_PATH_TO_ENEMY_LKP

* TASK_GET_PATH_TO_INTERACTION_PARTNER

* TASK_ANTLIONGUARD_GET_CHASE_PATH_ENEMY_TOLERANCE

* SCHED_FAIL_ESTABLISH_LINE_OF_FIRE - Combine NPCs, also when failing to change their enemy

ARGUMENTS.NAME: testEntity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to test.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the entity is reachable or not.

LostEnemySound.DESCRIPTION: Force an NPC to play his LostEnemy sound.

MaintainActivity.DESCRIPTION: Tries to achieve our ideal animation state, playing any transition sequences that we need to play to get there.

MarkEnemyAsEluded.DESCRIPTION: Causes the NPC to temporarily forget the current enemy and switch on to a better one.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to mark

MoveOrder.DESCRIPTION:
Makes the NPC walk toward the given position. The NPC will return to the player after amount of time set by **player_squad_autosummon_time** [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

Only works on Citizens (npc_citizen) and is a part of the Half-Life 2 squad system.

The NPC **must** be in the player's squad for this to work.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target position for the NPC to walk to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin to calculate a path from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: length
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target length of the path to calculate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction in which to look for a new path end goal.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether path generation was successful or not.

NavSetGoalTarget.DESCRIPTION: Set the goal target for an NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The targeted entity to set the goal to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: offset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The offset to apply to the targeted entity's position.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether path generation was successful or not

NavSetRandomGoal.DESCRIPTION: Creates a random path of specified minimum length between a closest start node and random node in the specified direction. This won't actually force the NPC to move.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minPathLength
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Minimum length of path in units

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Unit vector pointing in the direction of the target random node

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether path generation was successful or not

NavSetWanderGoal.DESCRIPTION: Sets a goal in x, y offsets for the NPC to wander to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: xOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X offset

ARGUMENTS.NAME: yOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y offset

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether path generation was successful or not

PickupWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Forces the NPC to pickup an existing weapon entity. The NPC will not pick up the weapon if they already own a weapon of given type, or if the NPC could not normally have this weapon in their inventory.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon to try to pick up.

RETURNS.NAME: result
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the NPC succeeded in picking up the weapon or not.

PlaySentence.DESCRIPTION: Forces the NPC to play a sentence from scripts/sentences.txt

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sentence
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sentence string to speak.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Delay in seconds until the sentence starts playing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the sentence, from 0 to 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sentence index, -1 if the sentence couldn't be played.

RememberUnreachable.DESCRIPTION: Makes the NPC remember an entity or an enemy as unreachable, for a specified amount of time. Use [NPC:IsUnreachable](/gmod/NPC:IsUnreachable) to check if an entity is still unreachable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to mark as unreachable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: For how long to remember the entity as unreachable. Negative values will act as `3` seconds.

RemoveMemory.DESCRIPTION:
This function crashes the game no matter how it is used and will be removed in a future update.

Use [NPC:ClearEnemyMemory](/gmod/NPC:ClearEnemyMemory) instead.

RunEngineTask.DESCRIPTION:
Starts an engine task.

Used internally by the [ai_task](/gmod/ai_task).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task ID, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task data.

SelectWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Forces the NPC to switch to a specific weapon the NPC owns. See [NPC:GetWeapons](/gmod/NPC:GetWeapons).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A classname of the weapon or a [Weapon](/gmod/Weapon) entity to switch to.

SentenceStop.DESCRIPTION:
Stops any sounds (speech) the NPC is currently palying.

Equivalent to `Entity:EmitSound( "AI_BaseNPC.SentenceStop" )`

SetArrivalDistance.DESCRIPTION: Sets the distance to goal at which the NPC should stop moving and continue to other business such as doing the rest of their tasks in a schedule.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dist
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance to goal that is close enough for the NPC

ARGUMENTS.NAME: condition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The condition index, see [COND](/gmod/Enums/COND).

SetCurrentWeaponProficiency.DESCRIPTION: Sets the weapon proficiency of an NPC (how skilled an NPC is with its current weapon).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: proficiency
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The proficiency for the NPC's current weapon. See [WEAPON_PROFICIENCY](/gmod/Enums/WEAPON_PROFICIENCY).

SetEnemy.DESCRIPTION: Sets the target for an NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy that the NPC should target

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newenemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Calls [NPC:SetCondition](/gmod/NPC:SetCondition)(COND_NEW_ENEMY) if the new enemy is valid and not equal to the last enemy.

SetExpression.DESCRIPTION: Sets the NPC's .vcd expression. Similar to [Entity:PlayScene](/gmod/Entity:PlayScene) except the scene is looped until it's interrupted by default NPC behavior or [NPC:ClearExpression](/gmod/NPC:ClearExpression).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: expression
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The expression filepath.

SetHullSizeNormal.DESCRIPTION: Updates the NPC's hull and physics hull in order to match its model scale. [Entity:SetModelScale](/gmod/Entity:SetModelScale) seems to take care of this regardless.

SetHullType.DESCRIPTION: Sets the hull type for the NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hullType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Hull type. See [HULL](/gmod/Enums/HULL)

SetIdealYawAndUpdate.DESCRIPTION: Sets the ideal yaw angle (left-right rotation) for the NPC and forces them to turn to that angle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The aim direction to set, the `yaw` component.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The turn speed. Special values are:

* `-1` - Calculate automatically

* `-2` - Keep the previous yaw speed

SetLastPosition.DESCRIPTION: Sets the last registered or memorized position for an npc. When using scheduling, the NPC will focus on navigating to the last position via nodes.
NOTES: The navigation requires ground nodes to function properly, otherwise the NPC could only navigate in a small area. (https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Info_node)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Where the NPC's last position will be set.

SetMaxRouteRebuildTime.DESCRIPTION: Sets how long to try rebuilding path before failing task.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long to try rebuilding path before failing task

SetMovementActivity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the activity the NPC uses when it moves.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The movement activity, see [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

SetMovementSequence.DESCRIPTION: Sets the sequence the NPC navigation path uses for speed calculation. Doesn't seem to have any visible effect on NPC movement.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The movement sequence index

SetNPCState.DESCRIPTION: Sets the state the NPC is in to help it decide on a ideal schedule.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: state
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New NPC state, see [NPC_STATE](/gmod/Enums/NPC_STATE)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: schedule
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC schedule, see [SCHED](/gmod/Enums/SCHED).

SetTarget.DESCRIPTION: Sets the NPC's target. This is used in some engine schedules.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target of the NPC.

StartEngineTask.DESCRIPTION: Forces the NPC to start an engine task, this has different results for every NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: task
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the task to start, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task data as a float, not all tasks make use of it.

StopMoving.DESCRIPTION: Resets the NPC's movement animation and velocity. Does not actually stop the NPC from moving.

TargetOrder.DESCRIPTION:
Cancels [NPC:MoveOrder](/gmod/NPC:MoveOrder) basically.

Only works on Citizens (npc_citizen) and is a part of the Half-Life 2 squad system.

The NPC **must** be in the player's squad for this to work.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Must be a player, does nothing otherwise.

TaskComplete.DESCRIPTION:
Marks the current NPC task as completed.

This is meant to be used alongside [NPC:TaskFail](/gmod/NPC:TaskFail) to complete or fail custom Lua defined tasks. ([Schedule:AddTask](/gmod/Schedule:AddTask))

TaskFail.DESCRIPTION:
Marks the current NPC task as failed.

This is meant to be used alongside [NPC:TaskComplete](/gmod/NPC:TaskComplete) to complete or fail custom Lua defined tasks. ([Schedule:AddTask](/gmod/Schedule:AddTask))

ARGUMENTS.NAME: task
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A string most likely defined as a Source Task, for more information on Tasks go to https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Task

UpdateEnemyMemory.DESCRIPTION: Force the NPC to update information on the supplied enemy, as if it had line of sight to it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enemy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The enemy to update.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The last known position of the enemy.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If we succeeded setting the behavior.
If we succeeded setting the behavior.

UseNoBehavior.DESCRIPTION:
Undoes the other Use*Behavior functions.

Only usable on "ai" base entities.

NPC.DESCRIPTION: This is a list of all methods only available for NPCs. It is also possible to call [Entity](http://wiki.garrysmod.com/index.php?title=Category:Entity) functions on NPCs.

Chase.DESCRIPTION: If you created your path with type "Chase" this functions should be used in place of [PathFollower:Update](/gmod/PathFollower:Update) to cause the bot to chase the specified entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bot to update along the path

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity we want to chase

Compute.DESCRIPTION: Compute shortest path from bot to 'goal' via A* algorithm.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: from
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The nextbot we're generating for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: to
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: To point

ARGUMENTS.NAME: generator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A funtion that allows you to alter the path generation. See example below for the default function.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
* If returns true, path was found to the goal position.
* If returns false, path may either be invalid (use IsValid() to check), or valid but doesn't reach all the way to the goal.

Draw.DESCRIPTION: Draws the path. This is meant for debugging - and uses debug overlay.

FirstSegment.DESCRIPTION: Returns the first segment of the path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table with [PathSegment](/gmod/Structures/PathSegment).

GetAge.DESCRIPTION: Returns the age since the path was built

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Path age

GetAllSegments.DESCRIPTION: Returns all of the segments of the given path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of tables with [PathSegment](/gmod/Structures/PathSegment).

GetClosestPosition.DESCRIPTION: The closest position along the path to a position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The point we're querying for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The closest position on the path

GetCurrentGoal.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current goal data. Can return nil if the current goal is invalid, for example immediately after [PathFollower:Update](/gmod/PathFollower:Update).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table with [PathSegment](/gmod/Structures/PathSegment).

A table with 3 keys:
[number](/gmod/number) curvature

[Vector](/gmod/Vector) forward

[Vector](/gmod/Vector) pos

GetCursorPosition.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current progress along the path

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current progress
The end position

GetGoalTolerance.DESCRIPTION: Returns how close we can get to the goal to call it done.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The distance we're setting it to

GetLength.DESCRIPTION: Returns the total length of the path

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The length of the path

GetMinLookAheadDistance.DESCRIPTION: Returns the minimum range movement goal must be along path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum look ahead distance

GetPositionOnPath.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vector position of distance along path

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance along the path to query

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position
The start position

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the path is valid

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Wether the path is valid or not.

LastSegment.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last segment of the path.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table with [PathSegment](/gmod/Structures/PathSegment).

MoveCursor.DESCRIPTION:
Moves the cursor by give distance.

For a function that sets the distance, see [PathFollower:MoveCursorTo](/gmod/PathFollower:MoveCursorTo).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance to move the cursor (in relative world units)

MoveCursorTo.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the cursor position to given distance.

For relative distance, see [PathFollower:MoveCursor](/gmod/PathFollower:MoveCursor).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance to move the cursor (in world units)

MoveCursorToClosestPosition.DESCRIPTION: Moves the cursor of the path to the closest position compared to given vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Seek type

0 = SEEK_ENTIRE_PATH - Search the entire path length

1 = SEEK_AHEAD - Search from current cursor position forward toward end of path

2 = SEEK_BEHIND - Search from current cursor position backward toward path start

MoveCursorToEnd.DESCRIPTION: Moves the cursor to the end of the path

MoveCursorToStart.DESCRIPTION: Moves the cursor to the end of the path

ResetAge.DESCRIPTION: Resets the age which is retrieved by [PathFollower:GetAge](/gmod/PathFollower:GetAge) to 0.

SetGoalTolerance.DESCRIPTION: How close we can get to the goal to call it done

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance we're setting it to

SetMinLookAheadDistance.DESCRIPTION: Sets minimum range movement goal must be along path

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mindist
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum look ahead distance

Update.DESCRIPTION: Move the bot along the path.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bot to update along the path

PathFollower.DESCRIPTION: Path object for a NextBot NPC. Returned by [Path](/gmod/Global.Path).

IsValid.DESCRIPTION:
Checks whether this [PhysCollide](/gmod/PhysCollide) object is valid or not.

You should just use [IsValid](/gmod/Global.IsValid) instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is valid or not.

TraceBox.DESCRIPTION: Performs a trace against this PhysCollide with the given parameters. This can be used for both line traces and box traces.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin for the PhysCollide during the trace

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angles for the PhysCollide during the trace

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayStart
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the trace

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayEnd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the trace

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayMins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The mins of the trace's bounds

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayMaxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maxs of the trace's bounds

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Hit position of the trace. This is false if the trace did not hit.
Hit normal of the trace
Fraction of the trace. This is calculated from the distance between startPos, hitPos, and endPos.

PhysCollide.DESCRIPTION:
A PhysCollide holds collision data from VPhysics. These objects can be used to run (currently quite limited) collision tests, but do not represent actual physics objects.

Created by [CreatePhysCollideBox](/gmod/Global.CreatePhysCollideBox) or [CreatePhysCollidesFromModel](/gmod/Global.CreatePhysCollidesFromModel).

AddAngleVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Adds the specified velocity to the current.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angularVelocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Additional velocity.

AddGameFlag.DESCRIPTION: Adds one or more bit flags.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag, see [FVPHYSICS](/gmod/Enums/FVPHYSICS).

AddVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Adds the specified velocity to the current.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Additional velocity.

AlignAngles.DESCRIPTION: Rotates the object so that it's angles are aligned to the ones inputted.

ApplyForceCenter.DESCRIPTION: Applies the specified force to the physics object (in [Newtons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newton_(unit))).
NOTES: This will not work on players, use Entity:SetVelocity instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The force to be applied.

ApplyForceOffset.DESCRIPTION: Applies the specified force on the physics object at the specified position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The force to be applied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position in world coordinates where the force is applied to the physics object.

ApplyTorqueCenter.DESCRIPTION: Applies specified angular impulse to the physics object. See [PhysObj:CalculateForceOffset](/gmod/PhysObj:CalculateForceOffset)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: torque
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angular impulse to be applied in `kg * degrees / s` (verification needed).

CalculateForceOffset.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the force and torque on the center of mass for an offset force impulse. The outputs can be directly passed to [PhysObj:ApplyForceCenter](/gmod/PhysObj:ApplyForceCenter) and [PhysObj:ApplyTorqueCenter](/gmod/PhysObj:ApplyTorqueCenter), respectively.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The initial force

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The location of the force in world coordinates

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The calculated force on the physics object's center of mass
The calculated torque on the physics object's center of mass

CalculateVelocityOffset.DESCRIPTION: Calculates the linear and angular velocities on the center of mass for an offset force impulse. The outputs can be directly passed to [PhysObj:AddVelocity](/gmod/PhysObj:AddVelocity) and [PhysObj:AddAngleVelocity](/gmod/PhysObj:AddAngleVelocity), respectively.
WARNINGS: This will return zero length vectors if the physics object's motion is disabled. See PhysObj:IsMotionEnabled.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: force
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The initial force

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The location of the force in world coordinates

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The calculated linear velocity from the force on the physics object's center of mass
The calculated angular velocity from the force on the physics object's center of mass

ClearGameFlag.DESCRIPTION: Removes one of more specified flags.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag, see [FVPHYSICS](/gmod/Enums/FVPHYSICS).

ComputeShadowControl.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to move a PhysObj to a point and angle in 3D space.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shadowparams
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The parameters for the shadow. See example code to see how its used.

EnableCollisions.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the physics object should collide with anything or not, including world.
WARNINGS:
This function currently has major problems with player collisions, and as such should be avoided at all costs.

A better alternative to this function would be using Entity:SetCollisionGroup( COLLISION_GROUP_WORLD ).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to enable, false to disable.

EnableDrag.DESCRIPTION: Sets whenever the physics object should be affected by drag.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to enable, false to disable.

EnableGravity.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the PhysObject should be affected by gravity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to enable, false to disable.

EnableMotion.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether the physobject should be able to move or not.

This is the exact method the Physics Gun uses to freeze props. If a motion-disabled physics object is grabbed with the physics gun, the object will be able to move again. To disallow this, use [GM:PhysgunPickup](/gmod/GM:PhysgunPickup).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to enable, false to disable.

GetAABB.DESCRIPTION: Returns the mins and max of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Mins
Maxs

GetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angles of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the physics object.

GetAngleVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Gets the angular velocity of the object in degrees per second.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angular velocity

GetContents.DESCRIPTION: Returns the contents flag of the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS).

GetDamping.DESCRIPTION: Returns the linear and angular damping of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The linear damping
The angular damping

GetEnergy.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sum of the linear and rotational kinetic energies of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The kinetic energy

GetEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the parent entity of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: parent

GetFrictionSnapshot.DESCRIPTION: Returns the friction snapshot of this physics object. This is useful for determining if an object touching ground for example.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of tables containing the following data:

* [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) Other - The other physics object we came in contact with

* [number](/gmod/number) EnergyAbsorbed - 

* [number](/gmod/number) FrictionCoefficient - 

* [number](/gmod/number) NormalForce - 

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) Normal - Direction of the friction event

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) ContactPoint - Contact point of the friction event

* [number](/gmod/number) Material - Surface Property ID of our physics obj

* [number](/gmod/number) MaterialOther - Surface Property ID of the physics obj we came in contact with

GetInertia.DESCRIPTION: Returns the directional inertia of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: directionalInertia
The inverted inertia

GetInvMass.DESCRIPTION: Returns 1 divided by the physics object's mass.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The inverted mass.

GetMass.DESCRIPTION: Returns the mass of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The mass in kilograms.

GetMassCenter.DESCRIPTION: Returns the center of mass of the physics object as a local vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The center of mass of the physics object.

GetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Returns the physical material of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The physical material

GetMesh.DESCRIPTION: Returns the physics mesh of the object which is used for physobj-on-physobj collision.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex)s where each three vertices represent a triangle. Returns nil if the physics object is a sphere.

GetMeshConvexes.DESCRIPTION: Returns all convex physics meshes of the object. See [Entity:PhysicsInitMultiConvex](/gmod/Entity:PhysicsInitMultiConvex) for more information.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex)s where each [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex) is an independent convex mesh and each three vertices represent a triangle. Returns nil if the physics object is a sphere.

GetName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the physics object.

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position
