GetPositionMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position and angle of the physics object as a 3x4 matrix ([VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position and angle matrix.

GetRotDamping.DESCRIPTION: Returns the rotation damping of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The rotation damping

GetShadowAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angles of the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) shadow. See [PhysObj:UpdateShadow](/gmod/PhysObj:UpdateShadow).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) shadow.

GetShadowPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) shadow. See [PhysObj:UpdateShadow](/gmod/PhysObj:UpdateShadow).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) shadow.

GetSpeedDamping.DESCRIPTION: Returns the speed damping of the physics object.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: speedDamping

GetStress.DESCRIPTION: Returns the stress of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: exertedStress

GetSurfaceArea.DESCRIPTION: Returns the surface area of the physics object in source-units². Or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The surface area or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

GetVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the absolute directional velocity of the physobject.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: velocity

GetVelocityAtPoint.DESCRIPTION: Returns the world velocity of a point in world coordinates about the object. This is useful for objects rotating around their own axis/origin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: point
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A point to test in world space coordinates

RETURNS.NAME: velocity
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Velocity at the given point

GetVolume.DESCRIPTION: Returns the volume in source units³. Or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The volume or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

HasGameFlag.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the specified flag(s) is/are set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag, see [FVPHYSICS](/gmod/Enums/FVPHYSICS).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If flag was set or not

IsAsleep.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the physics object is "sleeping".

See [PhysObj:Sleep](/gmod/PhysObj:Sleep) for more information.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the physics object is sleeping.

IsCollisionEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the entity is able to collide or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isCollisionEnabled

IsDragEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the entity is affected by drag.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: dragEnabled

IsGravityEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the entity is affected by gravity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the gravity is enabled, `false` otherwise

IsMotionEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the physics object can move itself (by velocity, acceleration)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the motion is enabled, `false` otherwise.

IsMoveable.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the entity is able to move.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: movable

IsPenetrating.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whenever the physics object is penetrating another physics object.

This is internally implemented as `PhysObj:HasGameFlag( FVPHYSICS_PENETRATING )` and thus is only updated for non-static physics objects.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the physics object is penetrating another object.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the physics object is valid/not NULL.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isValid

LocalToWorld.DESCRIPTION: Mapping a vector in local frame of the physics object to world frame.
NOTES: this function does translation and rotation, with translation done first.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: LocalVec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A vector in the physics object's local frame

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The corresponding vector in world frame

LocalToWorldVector.DESCRIPTION: Rotate a vector from the local frame of the physics object to world frame.
NOTES: This function only rotates the vector, without any translation operation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: LocalVec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A vector in the physics object's local frame

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The corresponding vector in world frame

OutputDebugInfo.DESCRIPTION: Prints debug info about the state of the physics object to the console.

RecheckCollisionFilter.DESCRIPTION: Call this when the collision filter conditions change due to this object's state (e.g. changing solid type or collision group)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dir
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Direction, around which we will rotate

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of rotation, in degrees

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The resulting angle

SetAngleDragCoefficient.DESCRIPTION: Sets the amount of [drag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_(physics)) to apply to a physics object when attempting to rotate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: coefficient
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [Drag coefficient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_coefficient). The bigger this value is, the slower the angles will change.

SetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets the angles of the physobject.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new angles of the physobject.

SetBuoyancyRatio.DESCRIPTION: Sets the buoyancy ratio of the physics object. (How well it floats in water)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: buoyancy
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Buoyancy ratio, where 0 is not buoyant at all (like a rock), and 1 is very buoyant (like wood). You can set values larger than 1 for greater effect.

SetContents.DESCRIPTION: Sets the contents flag of the [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: contents
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS).

SetDamping.DESCRIPTION: Sets the linear and angular damping of the physics object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: linearDamping
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Linear damping.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angularDamping
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angular damping.

SetDragCoefficient.DESCRIPTION: Modifies how much drag (air resistance) affects the object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: drag
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The drag coefficient
It can be positive or negative.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: directionalInertia
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The directional inertia of the object.

A value of Vector(0,0,0) makes the physobject go invalid.

SetMass.DESCRIPTION: Sets the mass of the physics object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mass
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The mass in kilograms.

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION: Sets the material of the physobject.
NOTES: Impact sounds will only change if this is called on client

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the phys material to use. From this list: [Valve Developer](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Material_surface_properties)

SetPos.DESCRIPTION: Sets the position of the physobject.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new position of the physobject.

SetVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the velocity of the physics object for the next iteration.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new velocity of the physics object.

SetVelocityInstantaneous.DESCRIPTION: Sets the velocity of the physics object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new velocity of the physics object.

Sleep.DESCRIPTION:
Makes the physics object "sleep".

The physics object will no longer be moving unless it is "woken up" by either a collision with another moving object, or by [PhysObj:Wake](/gmod/PhysObj:Wake). This is an optimization feature of the physics engine.

UpdateShadow.DESCRIPTION:
Unlike [PhysObj:SetPos](/gmod/PhysObj:SetPos) and [PhysObj:SetAngles](/gmod/PhysObj:SetAngles), this allows the movement of a physobj while leaving physics interactions intact.

This is used internally by the motion controller of the Gravity Gun , the +use pickup and the Physics Gun, and entities such as the crane.
NOTES: This is the ideal function to move a physics shadow created with Entity:PhysicsInitShadow or Entity:MakePhysicsObjectAShadow.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetPosition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position we should move to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetAngles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle we should rotate towards.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: frameTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The frame time to use for this movement, can be generally filled with [FrameTime](/gmod/Global.FrameTime) or [ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate](/gmod/ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate) with the deltaTime. 

Can be set to 0 when you need to update the physics object just once.

Wake.DESCRIPTION:
Wakes the physics object.

See [PhysObj:Sleep](/gmod/PhysObj:Sleep) for more information.

WorldToLocal.DESCRIPTION: Converts a vector to a relative to the physics object coordinate system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector in world space coordinates.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The vector local to [PhysObj:GetPos](/gmod/PhysObj:GetPos).

WorldToLocalVector.DESCRIPTION: Rotate a vector from the world frame to the local frame of the physics object.
NOTES: This function only rotates the vector, without any translation operation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: WorldVec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A vector in the world frame

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The corresponding vector relative to the PhysObj

PhysObj.DESCRIPTION:
This is the object returned by [Entity:GetPhysicsObject](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObject) and [Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum).

It represents a physics object.

AccountID.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's AccountID aka SteamID3.

For bots this will return values starting with 0 for the first bot, 1 for the second bot and so on.  

In singleplayer, this will return no value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Player's SteamID3 aka AccountID.

AddCleanup.DESCRIPTION: Adds an entity to the players clean up list.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Cleanup type

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity to add

AddCount.DESCRIPTION: Adds an entity to the total count of entities of same class.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: str
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity type

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity

AddDeaths.DESCRIPTION: Add a certain amount to the player's death count

ARGUMENTS.NAME: count
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: number of deaths to add

AddFrags.DESCRIPTION: Add a certain amount to the player's frag count (or kills count)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: count
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: number of frags to add

AddFrozenPhysicsObject.DESCRIPTION: Adds a entity to the players list of frozen objects.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physobj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Physics object belonging to ent

AddPlayerOption.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up the voting system for the player.

This is a really barebone system. By calling this a vote gets started, when the player presses 0-9 the callback function gets called along with the key the player pressed. Use the draw callback to draw the vote panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the vote

ARGUMENTS.NAME: timeout
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Time until the vote expires

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vote_callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to be run when the player presses 0-9 while a vote is active.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: draw_callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Used to draw the vote panel.

AddVCDSequenceToGestureSlot.DESCRIPTION: Plays a sequence directly from a sequence number, similar to [Player:AnimRestartGesture](/gmod/Player:AnimRestartGesture). This function has the advantage to play sequences that haven't been bound to an existing [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: slot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Gesture slot using [GESTURE_SLOT](/gmod/Enums/GESTURE_SLOT)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceId
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sequence ID to play, can be retrieved with [Entity:LookupSequence](/gmod/Entity:LookupSequence).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cycle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The cycle to start the animation at, ranges from 0 to 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: autokill
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the animation should not loop. true = stops the animation, false = the animation keeps playing.

Alive.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the player is alive.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player is alive

AllowFlashlight.DESCRIPTION: Sets if the player can toggle his flashlight. Function exists on both the server and client but has no effect when ran on the client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: canFlashlight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True allows flashlight toggling

AllowImmediateDecalPainting.DESCRIPTION: Lets the player spray his decal without delay

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allow
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Allow or disallow

AnimResetGestureSlot.DESCRIPTION: Resets player gesture in selected slot.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: slot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Slot to reset. See the [GESTURE_SLOT](/gmod/Enums/GESTURE_SLOT).

AnimRestartGesture.DESCRIPTION: Restart a gesture on a player, within a gesture slot.
WARNINGS: This is not automatically networked. This function has to be called on the client to be seen by said client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: slot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Gesture slot using [GESTURE_SLOT](/gmod/Enums/GESTURE_SLOT)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The activity ( see [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT) ) or sequence that should be played

ARGUMENTS.NAME: autokill
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the animation should be automatically stopped. true = stops the animation, false = the animation keeps playing/looping

AnimRestartMainSequence.DESCRIPTION: Restarts the main animation on the player, has the same effect as calling [Entity:SetCycle](/gmod/Entity:SetCycle)( 0 ).

AnimSetGestureSequence.DESCRIPTION: Sets the sequence of the animation playing in the given gesture slot.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: slot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The gesture slot. See [GESTURE_SLOT](/gmod/Enums/GESTURE_SLOT)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sequenceID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sequence ID to set.

AnimSetGestureWeight.DESCRIPTION: Sets the weight of the animation playing in the given gesture slot.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: slot
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The gesture slot. See [GESTURE_SLOT](/gmod/Enums/GESTURE_SLOT)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weight this slot should be set to. Value must be ranging from 0 to 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's armor.

Ban.DESCRIPTION: Bans the player from the server for a certain amount of minutes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minutes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Duration of the ban in minutes (0 is permanent)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: kick
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to kick the player after banning them or not

CanUseFlashlight.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the player's flashlight hasn't been disabled by [Player:AllowFlashlight](/gmod/Player:AllowFlashlight).
NOTES: This is not synchronized between clients and server automatically!

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player can use flashlight.

ChatPrint.DESCRIPTION: Prints a string to the chatbox of the client.
WARNINGS: Just like the usermessage, this function is affected by the 255 byte limit!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: message
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: String to be printed

CheckLimit.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the limit is hit or not. If it is, it will throw a notification saying so.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: limitType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Limit type. In unmodified Sandbox possible values are:
* "props"
* "ragdolls"
* "vehicles"
* "effects"
* "balloons"
* "cameras"
* "npcs"
* "sents"
* "dynamite"
* "lamps"
* "lights"
* "wheels"
* "thrusters"
* "hoverballs"
* "buttons"
* "emitters"

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if limit is not hit, false if it is hit

ConCommand.DESCRIPTION:
Runs the concommand on the player. This does not work on bots.

If you wish to directly modify the movement input of bots, use [GM:StartCommand](/gmod/GM:StartCommand) instead.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: On clientside running a ConCommand on an other player will not throw any warnings or errors but will run the ConCommand on LocalPlayer() instead.

NOTES: Some commands/convars are blocked from being ran/changed using this function, usually to prevent harm/annoyance to clients. For a list of blocked commands, see Blocked ConCommands.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: command
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: command to run

CreateRagdoll.DESCRIPTION:
Creates the player's death ragdoll entity and deletes the old one.

This is normally used when a player dies, to create their death ragdoll.

The ragdoll will be created with the player's properties such as [Position](/gmod/Entity:GetPos), [Angles](/gmod/Entity:GetAngles), [PlayerColor](/gmod/Player:GetPlayerColor), [Velocity](/gmod/Entity:GetVelocity) and [Model](/gmod/Entity:GetModel).

You can retrieve the entity this creates with [Player:GetRagdollEntity](/gmod/Player:GetRagdollEntity).

CrosshairDisable.DESCRIPTION: Disables the default player's crosshair. Can be reenabled with [Player:CrosshairEnable](/gmod/Player:CrosshairEnable). This will affect [WEAPON:DoDrawCrosshair](/gmod/WEAPON:DoDrawCrosshair).

CrosshairEnable.DESCRIPTION: Enables the player's crosshair, if it was previously disabled via [Player:CrosshairDisable](/gmod/Player:CrosshairDisable).

Crouching.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player is crouching or not ([FL_DUCKING](/gmod/Enums/FL) flag).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player is crouching.
The number of deaths the player has had.

DebugInfo.DESCRIPTION: Prints the players' name and position to the console.

DetonateTripmines.DESCRIPTION: Detonates all tripmines belonging to the player.

DoAnimationEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Sends a third person animation event to the player.

Calls [GM:DoAnimationEvent](/gmod/GM:DoAnimationEvent) with [PLAYERANIMEVENT_CUSTOM_GESTURE](/gmod/Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT) as the event, data as the given data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data to send.

DoAttackEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Starts the player's attack animation. The attack animation is determined by the weapon's HoldType.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls [GM:DoAnimationEvent](/gmod/GM:DoAnimationEvent) with [PLAYERANIMEVENT_ATTACK_PRIMARY](/gmod/Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT) as the event and no extra data.

DoCustomAnimEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Sends a specified third person animation event to the player.

Calls [GM:DoAnimationEvent](/gmod/GM:DoAnimationEvent) with specified arguments.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: event
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The event to send. See [PLAYERANIMEVENT](/gmod/Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data to send alongside the event.

DoReloadEvent.DESCRIPTION:
Sends a third person reload animation event to the player.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls [GM:DoAnimationEvent](/gmod/GM:DoAnimationEvent) with [PLAYERANIMEVENT_RELOAD](/gmod/Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT) as the event and no extra data.

DoSecondaryAttack.DESCRIPTION:
Sends a third person secondary fire animation event to the player.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls [GM:DoAnimationEvent](/gmod/GM:DoAnimationEvent) with [PLAYERANIMEVENT_ATTACK_SECONDARY](/gmod/Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT) as the event and no extra data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: draw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should draw

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Which view model to show/hide, 0-2.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: draw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should draw

DropNamedWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Drops the players' weapon of a specific class.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class to drop.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

DropObject.DESCRIPTION: Drops any object the player is currently holding with either gravitygun or +Use (E key)

DropWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Forces the player to drop the specified weapon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: velocity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

EnterVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Enters the player into specified vehicle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vehicle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vehicle the player will enter

EquipSuit.DESCRIPTION:
Equips the player with the HEV suit.

Allows the player to zoom, walk slowly, sprint, pickup armor batteries, use the health and armor stations and also shows the HUD.

The player also emits a flatline sound on death, which can be overridden with [GM:PlayerDeathSound](/gmod/GM:PlayerDeathSound).

The player is automatically equipped with the suit on spawn, if you wish to stop that, use [Player:RemoveSuit](/gmod/Player:RemoveSuit).

ExitVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Makes the player exit the vehicle if they're in one.

Flashlight.DESCRIPTION: Enables/Disables the player's flashlight.[Player:CanUseFlashlight](/gmod/Player:CanUseFlashlight) must be true in order for the player's flashlight to be changed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isOn
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Turns the flashlight on/off

FlashlightIsOn.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the player's flashlight is on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player's flashlight is on.

Frags.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of kills a player has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: kills

Freeze.DESCRIPTION:
Freeze the player. Frozen players cannot move, look around, or attack. Key bindings are still called. Similar to [Player:Lock](/gmod/Player:Lock) but the player can still take damage.

Adds or removes the [FL_FROZEN](/gmod/Enums/FL) flag from the player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Frozen bots will still be able to look around.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: frozen
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player should be frozen.

GetActiveWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's active weapon.

If used on a [LocalPlayer](/gmod/Global.LocalPlayer)() and the player is spectating another player with `OBS_MODE_IN_EYE`, the weapon returned will be of the spectated player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon the player is currently has equipped.

GetAimVector.DESCRIPTION: Returns the direction that the player is aiming.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The direction vector of players aim

GetAllowFullRotation.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the players' model is allowed to rotate around the pitch and roll axis.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Allowed

GetAllowWeaponsInVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player is allowed to use his weapons in a vehicle or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player is allowed to use his weapons in a vehicle or not.

GetAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of all ammo the player has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table with the following format

* [number](/gmod/number) Key - AmmoID to be used with functions like [game.GetAmmoName](/gmod/game.GetAmmoName).

* [number](/gmod/number) Value - Amount of ammo the player has of this kind.

GetAmmoCount.DESCRIPTION: Gets the amount of ammo the player has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammotype
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ammunition type. Can be either [number](/gmod/number) ammo ID or [string](/gmod/string) ammo name.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of ammo player has in reserve.

GetAvoidPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Gets if the player will be pushed out of nocollided players.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: pushed

GetCanWalk.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the player is able to walk using the (default) alt key.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: AbleToWalk

GetCanZoom.DESCRIPTION: Determines whenever the player is allowed to use the zoom functionality.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: canZoom
The player's class id.

GetCount.DESCRIPTION: Gets total count of entities of same class.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity type to get count of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: minus
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If specified, it will reduce the counter by this value. Works only serverside.

RETURNS.NAME: count
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The returned count.

GetCrouchedWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the crouched walk speed multiplier.

See also [Player:GetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetWalkSpeed) and [Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The crouched walk speed multiplier.

GetCurrentCommand.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last command which was sent by the specified player. This can only be called on the player which [GetPredictionPlayer](/gmod/Global.GetPredictionPlayer)() returns.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will fail in [GM:StartCommand](/gmod/GM:StartCommand).

NOTES: When called clientside in singleplayer during WEAPON:Think, it will return nothing as the hook is not technically predicted in that instance. See the note on the page.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Last user commands

GetCurrentViewOffset.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the **actual** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

Do not confuse with [Player:GetViewOffset](/gmod/Player:GetViewOffset) and [Player:GetViewOffsetDucked](/gmod/Player:GetViewOffsetDucked)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The actual view offset.

GetDrivingEntity.DESCRIPTION: Gets the entity the player is currently driving.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: DriveEntity

GetDrivingMode.DESCRIPTION: Returns driving mode of the player. See [Entity Driving](/gmod/Entity Driving).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The drive mode ID or 0 if player doesn't use the drive system.

GetDuckSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns a player's duck speed (in seconds)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: duckspeed

GetEntityInUse.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity the player is currently using, like func_tank mounted turrets or +use prop pickups.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Entity in use, or NULL entity otherwise. For +use prop pickups, this will be NULL clientside.

GetEyeTrace.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table with information of what the player is looking at.

The results of this function are **cached** clientside every frame.

Uses [util.GetPlayerTrace](/gmod/util.GetPlayerTrace) internally and is therefore bound by its limits.

See also [Player:GetEyeTraceNoCursor](/gmod/Player:GetEyeTraceNoCursor).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Trace information, see [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

GetEyeTraceNoCursor.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the trace according to the players view direction, ignoring their mouse (holding  and moving the mouse in Sandbox).

The results of this function are **cached** clientside every frame.

Uses [util.GetPlayerTrace](/gmod/util.GetPlayerTrace) internally and is therefore bound by its limits.

See also [Player:GetEyeTrace](/gmod/Player:GetEyeTrace).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Trace result. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

GetFOV.DESCRIPTION: Returns the FOV of the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Field of view as a float

GetFriendStatus.DESCRIPTION: Returns the steam "relationship" towards the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should return one of four different things depending on their status on your friends list: "friend", "blocked", "none" or "requested".

GetHands.DESCRIPTION: Gets the hands entity of a player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hands entity if players has one

GetHoveredWidget.DESCRIPTION: Returns the widget the player is hovering with his mouse.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hovered widget.

GetHull.DESCRIPTION: Gets the bottom base and the top base size of the player's hull.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Player's hull bottom base size.
Player's hull top base size.

GetHullDuck.DESCRIPTION: Gets the bottom base and the top base size of the player's crouch hull.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Player's crouch hull bottom base size.
Player's crouch hull top base size.

GetInfo.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves the value of a client-side [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar). The [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) must have a [FCVAR_USERINFO](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR) flag for this to work.
WARNINGS: The returned value is truncated to 31 bytes.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cVarName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the client-side [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

GetInfoNum.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves the numeric value of a client-side convar, returns nil if value is not convertible to a number. The [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) must have a [FCVAR_USERINFO](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR) flag for this to work.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cVarName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) to query the value of

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Default value if we failed to retrieve the number.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) or the default value

GetJumpPower.DESCRIPTION: Returns the jump power of the player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Jump power

GetLadderClimbSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's ladder climbing speed.

See [Player:GetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetWalkSpeed) for normal walking speed, [Player:GetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetRunSpeed) for sprinting speed and [Player:GetSlowWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetSlowWalkSpeed) for slow walking speed.

RETURNS.NAME: speed
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ladder climbing speed.

GetLaggedMovementValue.DESCRIPTION: Returns the timescale multiplier of the player movement.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The timescale multiplier, defaults to `1`.

GetMaxArmor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum amount of armor the player should have. Default value is 100.

RETURNS.NAME: maxarmor
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new max armor value

GetMaxSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's maximum movement speed.

See also [Player:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetMaxSpeed), [Player:GetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetWalkSpeed) and [Player:GetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetRunSpeed).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum movement speed the player can go at.

GetName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the player's name, this is an alias of [Player:Nick](/gmod/Player:Nick).
NOTES: This function overrides Entity:GetName (in the Lua metatable, not in c++), keep it in mind when dealing with ents.FindByName or any engine function which requires the mapping name.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's name.

GetNoCollideWithTeammates.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the player is set not to collide with their teammates.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: noCollideWithTeammates

GetObserverMode.DESCRIPTION: Returns the the observer mode of the player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Observe mode of that player, see [OBS_MODE](/gmod/Enums/OBS_MODE).

GetObserverTarget.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the entity the player is currently observing.

Set using [Player:SpectateEntity](/gmod/Player:SpectateEntity).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the player is currently spectating, or [NULL](/gmod/Global_Variables) if the player has no target.

GetPData.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a **P**layer **Data** key-value pair from the SQL database. (sv.db when called on server,  cl.db when called on client)

Internally uses the [sql](/gmod/sql).
NOTES: PData is not networked from servers to clients!
WARNINGS: This function internally uses Player:UniqueID, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the PData key

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Default value if PData key doesn't exist.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The data in the SQL database or the default value given.

GetPlayerColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns a player model's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: color

GetPlayerInfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table containing player information.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing player information.

GetPreferredCarryAngles.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the preferred carry angles of an object, if any are set.

Calls [GM:GetPreferredCarryAngles](/gmod/GM:GetPreferredCarryAngles) with the target entity and returns the carry angles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: carryEnt
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity to retrieve the carry angles of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Carry angles or nil if the entity has no preferred carry angles.

GetPressedWidget.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the widget entity the player is using.

Having a pressed widget stops the player from firing his weapon to allow input to be passed onto the widget.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The pressed widget.

GetPreviousWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns the weapon the player previously had equipped.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The previous weapon of the player.
WARNINGS: This is not guaranteed to be a weapon entity so it should be checked with Entity:IsWeapon for safety.

GetPunchAngle.DESCRIPTION: Returns players screen punch effect angle.
DEPRECATED: You should use Player:GetViewPunchAngles instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The punch angle

GetRagdollEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns players death ragdoll. The ragdoll is created by [Player:CreateRagdoll](/gmod/Player:CreateRagdoll).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The ragdoll.

Unlike normal clientside ragdolls (`C_ClientRagdoll`), this will be a `C_HL2MPRagdoll` on the client, and `hl2mp_ragdoll` on the server.

GetRenderAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the render angles for the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The render angles of the player. Only **yaw** part of the angle seems to be present.

GetRunSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's sprint speed.

See also [Player:SetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetRunSpeed), [Player:GetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetWalkSpeed) and [Player:GetMaxSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetMaxSpeed).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The sprint speed

GetShootPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of a Player's view
NOTES: This is the same as calling Entity:EyePos on the player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: aim pos

GetSlowWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's slow walking speed, which is activated via  keybind.

See [Player:GetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetWalkSpeed) for normal walking speed, [Player:GetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetRunSpeed) for sprinting speed and [Player:GetLadderClimbSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetLadderClimbSpeed) for ladder climb speed.

RETURNS.NAME: speed
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new slow walking speed.

GetStepSize.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum height player can step onto.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height player can get up onto without jumping, in hammer units.

GetSuitPower.DESCRIPTION: Returns the player's HEV suit power.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will only work for the local player when used clientside.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current suit power.

GetTimeoutSeconds.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of seconds that the player has been timing out for. You can check if a player is timing out with [Player:IsTimingOut](/gmod/Player:IsTimingOut).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Timeout seconds.

GetTool.DESCRIPTION: Returns TOOL table of players current tool, or of the one specified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Classname of the tool to retrieve. ( Filename of the tool in gmod_tool/stools/ )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: TOOL table, or nil if the table wasn't found or the player doesn't have a tool gun.

GetUnDuckSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns a player's unduck speed (in seconds)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: unduck speed

GetUseEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity the player would use if they would press their `+use` keybind.

RETURNS.NAME: ent
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity that would be used or NULL.
The user group of the player. This will return "user" if player has no user group.

GetVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Gets the vehicle the player is driving, returns NULL ENTITY if the player is not driving.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: vehicle

GetViewEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity the player is using to see from (such as the player itself, the camera, or another entity).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the player is using to see from

GetViewModel.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's view model entity by the index.
Each player has 3 view models by default, but only the first one is used.

To use the other viewmodels in your SWEP, see [Entity:SetWeaponModel](/gmod/Entity:SetWeaponModel).
NOTES: In the Client States, other players' viewmodels are not available unless they are being spectated.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: optional index of the view model to return, can range from 0 to 2

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The view model entity

GetViewOffset.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the view offset of the player which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view.

See also [Player:GetViewOffsetDucked](/gmod/Player:GetViewOffsetDucked).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New view offset, must be local vector to players [Entity:GetPos](/gmod/Entity:GetPos)

GetViewOffsetDucked.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the view offset of the player which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when ducked.

See also [Player:GetViewOffset](/gmod/Player:GetViewOffset).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New crouching view offset, must be local vector to players [Entity:GetPos](/gmod/Entity:GetPos)

GetViewPunchAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns players screen punch effect angle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The punch angle

GetViewPunchVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Returns client's view punch velocity. See [Player:ViewPunch](/gmod/Player:ViewPunch) and [Player:SetViewPunchVelocity](/gmod/Player:SetViewPunchVelocity)

RETURNS.NAME: punchVel
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current view punch angle velocity.

GetWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's normal walking speed. Not sprinting, not slow walking. (+walk)

See also [Player:SetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetWalkSpeed), [Player:GetMaxSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetMaxSpeed) and [Player:GetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetRunSpeed).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The normal walking speed.

GetWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns the weapon for the specified class

ARGUMENTS.NAME: className
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of weapon

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon for the specified class.

GetWeaponColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns a player's weapon color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: color

GetWeapons.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of the player's weapons.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: All the weapons the player currently has.

NOTES: While this function is meant for weapons/pickupables only, it is **not** restricted to weapons. Any entity can be spawned using this function, including NPCs and SENTs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weaponClassName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of weapon to give the player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bNoAmmo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Set to true to not give any ammo on weapon spawn. (Reserve ammo set by DefaultClip)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon given to the player, if one was given. It will return NULL if the player already has the weapon, or the weapon entity (entity with given classname) doesn't exist.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of ammo

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Type of ammo.

This can also be a number for ammo ID, useful for custom ammo types.

You can find a list of default ammo types [here](/gmod/Default_Ammo_Types).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hidePopup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Hide display popup when giving the ammo

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo given.

GodDisable.DESCRIPTION: Disables god mode on the player.

GodEnable.DESCRIPTION: Enables god mode on the player.

HasGodMode.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player has god mode or not, contolled by [Player:GodEnable](/gmod/Player:GodEnable) and [Player:GodDisable](/gmod/Player:GodDisable).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This is not synced between the client and server. This will cause the client to always return false even in godmode.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player has god mode or not.

HasWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the player has the specified weapon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: className
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of the weapon

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the player has the weapon

InVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the player is in a vehicle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player is in a vehicle.

IPAddress.DESCRIPTION: Returns the player's IP address and connection port in ip:port form

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's IP address and connection port

IsAdmin.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player is an admin or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the player is an admin.

IsBot.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the player is an bot or not

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the player is a bot.

IsConnected.DESCRIPTION: Returns true from the point when the player is sending client info but not fully in the game until they disconnect.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isConnected

IsDrivingEntity.DESCRIPTION: Used to find out if a player is currently 'driving' an entity (by which we mean 'right click > drive' ).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A value representing whether or not the player is 'driving' an entity.

IsFrozen.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the players movement is currently frozen, controlled by [Player:Freeze](/gmod/Player:Freeze).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the players movement is currently frozen or not.

IsFullyAuthenticated.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player identity was confirmed by the steam network.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Whether the player has been fully authenticated or not.

This will always be true for singleplayer and the listen server host.
This will always be false for bots.

IsListenServerHost.DESCRIPTION: Returns if a player is the host of the current session.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
True if the player is the listen server host, false otherwise.

This will always be true in single player, and false on a dedicated server.

IsMuted.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the player is muted locally.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: whether or not the player is muted locally.

IsPlayingTaunt.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the player is playing a taunt.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player is playing a taunt.

IsSpeaking.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the player is heard by the local player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the player speaking or not.

IsSprinting.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the player is currently sprinting or not, specifically if they are holding their sprint key and are allowed to sprint.

This will not check if the player is currently sprinting into a wall. (i.e. holding their sprint key but not moving)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the player sprinting or not

IsSuitEquipped.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the player is equipped with the suit item.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will only work for the local player when used clientside.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the suit equipped or not.

IsSuperAdmin.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player is a superadmin.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the player is a superadmin.

IsTimingOut.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the player is timing out (i.e. is losing connection), false otherwise.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isTimingOut

IsTyping.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the player is typing in their chat.

This may not work properly if the server uses a custom chatbox.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player is typing in their chat or not.

IsUserGroup.DESCRIPTION: Returns true/false if the player is in specified group or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: groupname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Group to check the player for.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isInUserGroup

IsVoiceAudible.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the player can be heard by the local player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isAudible

IsWorldClicking.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the player is in the context menu.
NOTES: Although this is shared, it will only work properly on the CLIENT for the local player. Using this serverside or on other players will return false.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the player world clicking or not.

KeyDown.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether a key is down. This is not networked to other players, meaning only the local client can see the keys they are pressing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key, see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isDown ?

KeyDownLast.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether a key was down one tick ago.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key, see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is key down ?

KeyPressed.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether a key was just pressed this tick.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Corresponds to an [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Was pressed or not

KeyReleased.DESCRIPTION: Gets whether a key was just released this tick.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key, see [IN](/gmod/Enums/IN)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Was released or not

Kick.DESCRIPTION: Kicks the player from the server.
NOTES: This can not be run before the player has fully joined in. Use game.KickID for that.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: reason
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Reason to show for disconnection.
WARNINGS: This will be shortened to ~512 chars, though this includes the command itself and the player index so will realistically be more around ~498. It is recommended to avoid going near the limit to avoid truncation.

KillSilent.DESCRIPTION:
Kills a player without notifying the rest of the server.

This will call [GM:PlayerSilentDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerSilentDeath) instead of [GM:PlayerDeath](/gmod/GM:PlayerDeath).

LagCompensation.DESCRIPTION:
This allows the server to mitigate the lag of the player by moving back all the entities that can be lag compensated to the time the player attacked with his weapon.

This technique is most commonly used on things that hit other entities instantaneously, such as traces.

Lag compensation only works for players and entities that have been enabled with [Entity:SetLagCompensated](/gmod/Entity:SetLagCompensated)

Despite being defined shared, it can only be used server-side in a [Predicted Hook](/gmod/~search:%3Cpredicted%3EYes).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Lag compensation does not support pose parameters.

NOTES: Entity:FireBullets calls this function internally.
WARNINGS: This function NEEDS to be disabled after you're done with it or it will break the movement of the entities affected!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lagCompensation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The state of the lag compensation, true to enable and false to disable.

LastHitGroup.DESCRIPTION: Returns the hitgroup where the player was last hit.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Hitgroup, see [HITGROUP](/gmod/Enums/HITGROUP)

NOTES: This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Type of hit limit.

Lock.DESCRIPTION:
Stops a player from using any inputs, such as moving, turning, or attacking. Key binds are still called. Similar to [Player:Freeze](/gmod/Player:Freeze) but the player takes no damage.

Adds the [FL_FROZEN](/gmod/Enums/FL) and [FL_GODMODE](/gmod/Enums/FL) flags to the player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Frozen bots will still be able to look around.

MotionSensorPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of a Kinect bone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bone to get the position of. Must be from 0 to 19.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the bone.

Name.DESCRIPTION: Returns the players name. Identical to [Player:Nick](/gmod/Player:Nick) and [Player:GetName](/gmod/Player:GetName).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Player's Steam name.
Player's Steam name

OwnerSteamID64.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the 64-bit SteamID aka CommunityID of the Steam Account that owns the Garry's Mod license this player is using. This is useful for detecting players using Steam Family Sharing.

If player is not using Steam Family Sharing, this will return the player's actual SteamID64().
NOTES: This data will only be available after the player has fully authenticated with Steam. See Player:IsFullyAuthenticated.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The 64bit SteamID

PacketLoss.DESCRIPTION: Returns the packet loss of the client. It is not networked so it only returns 0 when run clientside.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Packets lost

PhysgunUnfreeze.DESCRIPTION: Unfreezes the props player is looking at. This is essentially the same as pressing reload with the physics gun, including double press for unfreeze all.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of props unfrozen.

PickupObject.DESCRIPTION: This makes the player hold ( same as pressing  on a small prop ) the provided entity.
NOTES: Don't get this confused with picking up items like ammo or health kits
This picks up the passed entity regardless of its mass or distance from the player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity to pick up.

PickupWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Forces the player to pickup an existing weapon entity. The player will not pick up the weapon if they already own a weapon of given type, or if the player could not normally have this weapon in their inventory.

This function **will** bypass [GM:PlayerCanPickupWeapon](/gmod/GM:PlayerCanPickupWeapon).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wep
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon to try to pick up.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoOnly
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true, the player will only attempt to pick up the ammo from the weapon. The weapon will not be picked up even if the player doesn't have a weapon of this type, and the weapon will be removed if the player picks up any ammo from it.

RETURNS.NAME: result
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the player succeeded in picking up the weapon or not.

Ping.DESCRIPTION: Returns the player's ping to server.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's ping.

PlayStepSound.DESCRIPTION: Plays the correct step sound according to what the player is staying on.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Volume for the sound, in range from 0 to 1

PrintMessage.DESCRIPTION: Displays a message either in their chat, console, or center of the screen. See also [PrintMessage](/gmod/Global.PrintMessage).
NOTES:
When called serverside, this uses the archaic user message system (the umsg) and hence is limited to ≈250 characters.

`HUD_PRINTCENTER` will not work when this is called clientside.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Which type of message should be sent to the player ([HUD](/gmod/Enums/HUD)).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: message
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Message to be sent to the player.

RemoveAllAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Removes all ammo from a certain player

RemoveAllItems.DESCRIPTION: Removes all weapons and ammo from the player.

RemoveAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Removes the amount of the specified ammo from the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoCount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of ammunition to remove.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the ammunition to remove from. This can also be a [number](/gmod/number) ammoID.

RemovePData.DESCRIPTION:
Removes a **P**layer **Data** key-value pair from the SQL database. (sv.db when called on server,  cl.db when called on client)

Internally uses the [sql](/gmod/sql).
WARNINGS: This function internally uses Player:UniqueID, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Key to remove

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true is succeeded, false otherwise

ResetHull.DESCRIPTION: Resets both normal and duck hulls to their default values.

Say.DESCRIPTION: Forces the player to say whatever the first argument is. Works on bots too.
NOTES: This function ignores the default chat message cooldown

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to force the player to say.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamOnly
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to send this message to our own team only.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fade flags defined with [SCREENFADE](/gmod/Enums/SCREENFADE).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: clr
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the screenfade

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fadeTime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fade(in/out) effect transition time ( From no fade to full fade and vice versa )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fadeHold
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fade effect hold time

SelectWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Sets the active weapon of the player by its class name.
NOTES: This will trigger the weapon switch event and associated animations. To switch weapons silently, use Player:SetActiveWeapon.
WARNINGS: This will switch the weapon out of prediction, causing delay on the client and WEAPON:Deploy and WEAPON:Holster to be called out of prediction. Try using CUserCmd:SelectWeapon or input.SelectWeapon, instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: className
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The class name of the weapon to switch to.

If the player doesn't have the specified weapon, nothing will happen. You can use [Player:Give](/gmod/Player:Give) to give the weapon first.

SendHint.DESCRIPTION: Sends a hint to a player.
NOTES: This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives. Since this adds `#Hint_` to the beginning of each message, you should only use it with default hint messages, or those cached with language.Add. For hints with custom text, look at notification.AddLegacy.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name/class/index of the hint. The text of the hint will contain this value. ( "#Hint_" .. name ) An example is `PhysgunFreeze`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Delay in seconds before showing the hint

SendLua.DESCRIPTION: Executes a simple Lua string on the player.
NOTES: The string is limited to 254 bytes. Consider using the Net_Library_Usage for more advanced server-client interaction.
If you need to use this function more than once consider using net library. Send net message and make the entire code you want to execute in net.Receive on client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: script
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The script to execute.

SetActiveWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the player's active weapon. You should use [CUserCmd:SelectWeapon](/gmod/CUserCmd:SelectWeapon) or [Player:SelectWeapon](/gmod/Player:SelectWeapon), instead in most cases.

This function will not trigger the weapon switch events or associated equip animations. It will bypass 

 [GM:PlayerSwitchWeapon](/gmod/GM:PlayerSwitchWeapon) and the currently active weapon's [WEAPON:Holster](/gmod/WEAPON:Holster) return value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon to equip.

SetAllowFullRotation.DESCRIPTION: Set if the players' model is allowed to rotate around the pitch and roll axis.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Allowed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Allowed to rotate

SetAllowWeaponsInVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Allows player to use his weapons in a vehicle. You need to call this before entering a vehicle.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Shooting in a vehicle fires two bullets.
Weapon viewpunch does not decay while in a vehicle, leading to incorrect aim angles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allow
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Show we allow player to use his weapons in a vehicle or not.

SetAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Sets the amount of the specified ammo for the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoCount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of ammunition to set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ammunition type. Can be either [number](/gmod/number) ammo ID or [string](/gmod/string) ammo name.

SetArmor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the player armor to the argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount that the player armor is going to be set to.

SetAvoidPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Pushes the player away from another player whenever it's inside the other players bounding box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: avoidPlayers
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Avoid or not avoid.

SetCanWalk.DESCRIPTION: Set if the player should be allowed to walk using the (default) alt key.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: abletowalk
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True allows the player to walk.

SetCanZoom.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the player can use the HL2 suit zoom ("+zoom" bind) or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: canZoom
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to make the player able or unable to zoom.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class id the player is being set with.

SetCrouchedWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the crouched walk speed multiplier.

Doesn't work for values above 1.

See also [Player:SetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetWalkSpeed) and [Player:GetCrouchedWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetCrouchedWalkSpeed).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The walk speed multiplier that crouch speed should be.

SetCurrentViewOffset.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the **actual** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

Do not confuse with [Player:SetViewOffset](/gmod/Player:SetViewOffset) and [Player:SetViewOffsetDucked](/gmod/Player:SetViewOffsetDucked)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new view offset.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: deathcount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of deaths (positive or negative)

SetDrivingEntity.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the driving entity and driving mode.

Use [drive.PlayerStartDriving](/gmod/drive.PlayerStartDriving) instead, see [Entity Driving](/gmod/Entity Driving).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: drivingEntity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the player should drive.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: drivingMode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The driving mode index.

SetDSP.DESCRIPTION: Applies the specified sound filter to the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundFilter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The index of the sound filter to apply.
Pick from the [list of DSP's](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fastReset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true the sound filter will be removed faster.

SetDuckSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Sets how quickly a player ducks.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will not work for values >= 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: duckSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How quickly the player will duck.

SetEyeAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets the angle of the player's view (may rotate body too if angular difference is large)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle to set the view to

SetFOV.DESCRIPTION: Set a player's FOV (Field Of View) over a certain amount of time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: the angle of perception (FOV). Set to 0 to return to default user FOV. ( Which is ranging from 75 to 90, depending on user settings )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: the time it takes to transition to the FOV expressed in a floating point.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: requester
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The requester or "owner" of the zoom event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fragcount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of frags (positive or negative)

SetHands.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the hands entity of a player.

The hands entity is an entity introduced in Garry's Mod 13 and it's used to show the player's hands attached to the viewmodel.
This is similar to the approach used in L4D and CS:GO, for more information on how to implement this system in your gamemode visit [Using Viewmodel Hands](/gmod/Using Viewmodel Hands).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hands
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hands entity to set

SetHoveredWidget.DESCRIPTION: Sets the widget that is currently hovered by the player's mouse.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: widget
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The widget entity that the player is hovering.

SetHull.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the mins and maxs of the AABB of the players collision.

See [Player:SetHullDuck](/gmod/Player:SetHullDuck) for the hull while crouching/ducking.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Setting both the mins and maxs to [Vector](/gmod/Global.Vector)(0,0,0) will crash the game.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hullMins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The min coordinates of the hull.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hullMaxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The max coordinates of the hull.

SetHullDuck.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the mins and maxs of the AABB of the players collision when ducked.

See [Player:SetHull](/gmod/Player:SetHull) for setting the hull while standing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hullMins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The min coordinates of the hull.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hullMaxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The max coordinates of the hull.

SetJumpPower.DESCRIPTION: Sets the jump power, eg. the velocity the player will applied to when he jumps.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: jumpPower
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new jump velocity.

SetLadderClimbSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the player's ladder climbing speed.

See [Player:SetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetWalkSpeed) for normal walking speed, [Player:SetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetRunSpeed) for sprinting speed and [Player:SetSlowWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetSlowWalkSpeed) for slow walking speed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ladder climbing speed.

SetLaggedMovementValue.DESCRIPTION:
Slows down the player movement simulation by the timescale, this is used internally in the HL2 weapon stripping sequence.

It achieves such behavior by multiplying the [FrameTime](/gmod/Global.FrameTime) by the specified timescale at the start of the movement simulation and then restoring it afterwards.
NOTES:
This is reset to 1 on spawn.

There is no weapon counterpart to this, you'll have to hardcode the multiplier in the weapon or call Weapon:SetNextPrimaryFire / Weapon:SetNextSecondaryFire manually from a.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: timescale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The timescale multiplier.

SetLastHitGroup.DESCRIPTION: Sets the hitgroup where the player was last hit.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hitgroup
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hitgroup to set as the "last hit", see [HITGROUP](/gmod/Enums/HITGROUP).

SetMaxArmor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum amount of armor the player should have. This affects default built-in armor pickups, but not [Player:SetArmor](/gmod/Player:SetArmor).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This limit isn't reset after a player respawn. For example, this means if you set the max armor to 50 and the player dies, the limit will always be 50 instead of the limit set by the player's class (like [Entity:SetMaxHealth](/gmod/Entity:SetMaxHealth)). **This will be fixed in the next update.**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxarmor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new max armor value.

SetMaxSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum speed which the player can move at.
NOTES: This is called automatically by the engine. If you wish to limit player speed without setting their run/sprint speeds, see CMoveData:SetMaxClientSpeed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: walkSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum speed.

SetMuted.DESCRIPTION: Sets if the player should be muted locally.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mute
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Mute or unmute.

SetNoCollideWithTeammates.DESCRIPTION: Sets whenever the player should not collide with their teammates.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldNotCollide
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to disable, false to enable collision.

SetNoTarget.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the players visibility towards NPCs.

Internally this toggles the [FL_NOTARGET](/gmod/Enums/FL) flag, which you can manually test for using [Entity:IsFlagSet](/gmod/Entity:IsFlagSet)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: visibility
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The visibility.

SetObserverMode.DESCRIPTION: Sets the players observer mode. You must start the spectating first with [Player:Spectate](/gmod/Player:Spectate).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Spectator mode using [OBS_MODE](/gmod/Enums/OBS_MODE).

SetPData.DESCRIPTION:
Writes a **P**layer **Data** key-value pair to the SQL database. (sv.db when called on server,  cl.db when called on client)

Internally uses the [sql](/gmod/sql).
NOTES: PData is not networked from servers to clients!
WARNINGS: This function internally uses Player:UniqueID, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the PData key

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to write to the key (**must** be an SQL valid data type, such as a string or integer)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the operation was successful or not

SetPlayerColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the player model's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the color to be set. The format is Vector(r, g, b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

SetPressedWidget.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the widget that is currently in use by the player's mouse.

Having a pressed widget stops the player from firing his weapon to allow input to be passed onto the widget.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pressedWidget
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The widget the player is currently using.

SetRenderAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets the render angles of a player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ang
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new render angles to set

SetRunSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the player's sprint speed.

See also [Player:GetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetRunSpeed), [Player:SetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetWalkSpeed) and [Player:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetMaxSpeed).
NOTES: player_default class run speed is: 600

ARGUMENTS.NAME: runSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The new sprint speed when sv_friction is below 10. Higher sv_friction values will result in slower speed.

Has to be 7 or above or the player won't be able to move.

SetSlowWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the player's slow walking speed, which is activated via  keybind.

See [Player:SetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetWalkSpeed) for normal walking speed, [Player:SetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetRunSpeed) for sprinting speed and [Player:SetLadderClimbSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetLadderClimbSpeed) for ladder climb speed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new slow walking speed.

SetStepSize.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum height a player can step onto without jumping.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stepHeight
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum height the player can step onto without jumping

SetSuitPower.DESCRIPTION: Sets the player's HEV suit power.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will only work for the local player when used clientside.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: power
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new suit power.

SetSuppressPickupNotices.DESCRIPTION: Sets whenever to suppress the pickup notification for the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: doSuppress
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whenever to suppress the notice or not.

SetTeam.DESCRIPTION: Sets the player to the chosen team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Team
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team that the player is being set to.

SetUnDuckSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Sets how quickly a player un-ducks

ARGUMENTS.NAME: UnDuckSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How quickly the player will un-duck

SetupHands.DESCRIPTION: Sets up the players view model hands. Calls [GM:PlayerSetHandsModel](/gmod/GM:PlayerSetHandsModel) to set the model of the hands.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the player is spectating an entity, this should be the entity the player is spectating, so we can use its hands model instead.

SetUserGroup.DESCRIPTION: Sets the usergroup of the player.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: groupName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The user group of the player.

SetViewEntity.DESCRIPTION: Attaches the players view to the position and angles of the specified entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewEntity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to attach the player view to.

SetViewOffset.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the **desired** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

If you want to set **actual** view offset, use [Player:SetCurrentViewOffset](/gmod/Player:SetCurrentViewOffset)

See also [Player:SetViewOffsetDucked](/gmod/Player:SetViewOffsetDucked) for **desired** view offset when crouching.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new desired view offset when standing.

SetViewOffsetDucked.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the **desired** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when crouching.

If you want to set **actual** view offset, use [Player:SetCurrentViewOffset](/gmod/Player:SetCurrentViewOffset)

See also [Player:SetViewOffset](/gmod/Player:SetViewOffset) for **desired** view offset when standing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new desired view offset when crouching.

SetViewPunchAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets client's view punch angle, but not the velocity. See [Player:ViewPunch](/gmod/Player:ViewPunch)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: punchAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to set.

SetViewPunchVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Sets client's view punch velocity. See [Player:ViewPunch](/gmod/Player:ViewPunch) and [Player:SetViewPunchAngles](/gmod/Player:SetViewPunchAngles)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: punchVel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle velocity to set.

SetWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the player's normal walking speed. Not sprinting, not slow walking .

See also [Player:SetSlowWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetSlowWalkSpeed), [Player:GetWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:GetWalkSpeed), [Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed), [Player:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetMaxSpeed) and [Player:SetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetRunSpeed).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Using a speed of 0 can lead to prediction errors.

NOTES: player_default class run speed is: 400

ARGUMENTS.NAME: walkSpeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The new walk speed when sv_friction is below 10. Higher sv_friction values will result in slower speed.

Has to be 7 or above or the player won't be able to move.

SetWeaponColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the player weapon's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This is the color to be set. The format is Vector(r,g,b), and each color should be between 0 and 1.

ShouldDrawLocalPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player's player model will be drawn at the time the function is called.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the player's playermodel is visible

ShouldDropWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the player's current weapon should drop on death.
NOTES: This is reset on spawn to the Player_Classes's **DropWeaponOnDie** field by player_manager.OnPlayerSpawn.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: drop
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to drop the player's current weapon or not

ShowProfile.DESCRIPTION: Opens the player steam profile page in the steam overlay browser.

SimulateGravGunDrop.DESCRIPTION: Signals the entity that it was dropped by the gravity gun.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity that was dropped.

SimulateGravGunPickup.DESCRIPTION: Signals the entity that it was picked up by the gravity gun. This call is only required if you want to simulate the situation of picking up objects.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity picked up

Spectate.DESCRIPTION: Starts spectate mode for given player. This will also affect the players movetype in some cases.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Using this function while spectating the player's own ragdoll will cause it to teleport it to the center of the map. You will spectate the ragdoll even after it's been teleported. This only happens on the client of the player spectating the ragdoll and is purely client-side.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Spectate mode, see [OBS_MODE](/gmod/Enums/OBS_MODE).

SpectateEntity.DESCRIPTION:
Makes the player spectate the entity.

To get the applied spectated entity, use [Player:GetObserverTarget](/gmod/Player:GetObserverTarget).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity to spectate.

SprayDecal.DESCRIPTION: Makes a player spray their decal.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sprayOrigin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The location to spray from

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sprayEndPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The location to spray to

SprintDisable.DESCRIPTION: Disables the sprint on the player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Not working - use [Player:SetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetRunSpeed) or [CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed) in a [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move) hook, instead.

SprintEnable.DESCRIPTION: Enables the sprint on the player.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Not working - use [Player:SetRunSpeed](/gmod/Player:SetRunSpeed) or [CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed) in a [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move) hook, instead.

DEPRECATED: This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.

StartWalking.DESCRIPTION: When used in a [GM:SetupMove](/gmod/GM:SetupMove) hook, this function will force the player to walk, as well as preventing the player from sprinting.
DEPRECATED: This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.

SteamID.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's SteamID. In singleplayer, this will be STEAM_ID_PENDING serverside.

For Bots this will return `BOT` on the server and on the client it returns `NULL`.

Use [Player:AccountID](/gmod/Player:AccountID) for a shorter version of the SteamID.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: SteamID

SteamID64.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's 64-bit SteamID aka CommunityID.

See [Player:AccountID](/gmod/Player:AccountID) for a shorter version of the SteamID.
NOTES:
For bots, this will return `90071996842377216` (equivalent to `STEAM_0:0:0`) for the first bot to join.

For each additional bot, the number increases by 1. So the next bot will be `90071996842377217` (`STEAM_0:1:0`) then `90071996842377218` (`STEAM_0:0:1`) and so on.

It returns `no value` for bots clientside.
WARNINGS:
In singleplayer, this will return `no value` serverside.

In a `-multirun` environment, this will return `no value` serverside for all "copies" of a player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Player's 64-bit SteamID aka CommunityID.

StopSprinting.DESCRIPTION:
When used in a [GM:SetupMove](/gmod/GM:SetupMove) hook, this function will prevent the player from sprinting.

When +walk is engaged, the player will still be able to sprint to half speed (normal run speed) as opposed to full sprint speed without this function.
DEPRECATED: This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.

StopWalking.DESCRIPTION: When used in a [GM:SetupMove](/gmod/GM:SetupMove) hook, this function behaves unexpectedly by preventing the player from sprinting similar to [Player:StopSprinting](/gmod/Player:StopSprinting).
DEPRECATED: This appears to be a direct binding to internal functionality that is overridden by the engine every frame so calling these functions may not have any or expected effect.

StopZooming.DESCRIPTION:
Turns off the zoom mode of the player. (+zoom console command)

Basically equivalent of entering "-zoom" into player's console.

StripAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Removes all ammo from the player.

StripWeapon.DESCRIPTION: Removes the specified weapon class from a certain player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon class to remove

StripWeapons.DESCRIPTION: Removes all weapons from a certain player

SuppressHint.DESCRIPTION: Prevents a hint from showing up.
NOTES: This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Hint name/class/index to prevent from showing up

SwitchToDefaultWeapon.DESCRIPTION:
Attempts to switch the player weapon to the one specified in the "cl_defaultweapon" convar, if the player does not own the specified weapon nothing will happen.

If you want to switch to a specific weapon, use: [Player:SetActiveWeapon](/gmod/Player:SetActiveWeapon)

Team.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's team ID.

Returns 0 clientside when the game is not fully loaded.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's team's index number, as in the [TEAM](/gmod/Enums/TEAM) or a custom team defined in [team.SetUp](/gmod/team.SetUp).

TimeConnected.DESCRIPTION: Returns the time in seconds since the player connected.
NOTES: Bots will always return value 0.

TraceHullAttack.DESCRIPTION: Performs a trace hull and applies damage to the entities hit, returns the first entity hit.
WARNINGS: Hitting the victim entity with this function in ENTITY:OnTakeDamage can cause infinite loops.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the hull trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the hull trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum coordinates of the hull.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum coordinates of the hull.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The damage to be applied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageFlags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Bitflag specifying the damage type, see [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageForce
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The force to be applied to the hit object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: damageAllNPCs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether to apply damage to all hit NPCs or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hit entity

TranslateWeaponActivity.DESCRIPTION: Translates [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT) according to the holdtype of players currently held weapon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The initial [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Translated [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT)

UnfreezePhysicsObjects.DESCRIPTION: Unfreezes all objects the player has frozen with their Physics Gun. Same as double pressing R while holding Physics Gun.

UniqueID.DESCRIPTION: Returns a 32 bit integer that remains constant for a player across joins/leaves and across different servers. This can be used when a string is inappropriate - e.g. in a database primary key.
NOTES: In Singleplayer, this function will always return 1.
WARNINGS: **This function has collisions,** where more than one player has the same UniqueID. It is **highly** recommended to use Player:AccountID, Player:SteamID or Player:SteamID64 instead, which are guaranteed to be unique to each player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's Unique ID

UniqueIDTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table that will stay allocated for the specific player between connects until the server shuts down. Note, that this table is not synchronized between client and server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Unique table key.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table that contains any info you have put in it.

UnLock.DESCRIPTION:
Unlocks the player movement if locked previously.

Will disable godmode for the player if locked previously.

UnSpectate.DESCRIPTION: Stops the player from spectating another entity.

UserID.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the player's ID.
You can use [Player](/gmod/Global.Player)() to get the player by their ID.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The player's user ID

ViewPunch.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a push on the client's screen. This **adds** view punch velocity, and does not touch the current view punch angle, for which you can use [Player:SetViewPunchAngles](/gmod/Player:SetViewPunchAngles).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: PunchAngle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle in which to push the player's screen.

ViewPunchReset.DESCRIPTION: Resets the player's view punch (and the view punch velocity, read more at [Player:ViewPunch](/gmod/Player:ViewPunch)) effect back to normal.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tolerance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Reset all ViewPunch below this threshold.

VoiceVolume.DESCRIPTION: Returns the players voice volume, how loud the player's voice communication currently is, as a normal number. Doesn't work on local player unless the voice_loopback convar is set to 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The voice volume.

Player.DESCRIPTION: This is a list of all methods only available for players. It is also possible to call [Entity](/gmod/Entity) functions on the Player.

GetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angle of the ProjectedTexture, which were previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetAngles](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetAngles)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the ProjectedTexture.

GetBrightness.DESCRIPTION: Returns the brightness of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetBrightness](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetBrightness)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The brightness of the ProjectedTexture.

GetColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the color of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetColor](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetColor).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: [Color](/gmod/Color), the color of the ProjectedTexture.

GetConstantAttenuation.DESCRIPTION: Returns the constant attenuation of the projected texture, which can also be set by [ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The constant attenuation
