GetEnableShadows.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether shadows are enabled for this ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetEnableShadows](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetEnableShadows)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether shadows are enabled.

GetFarZ.DESCRIPTION: Returns the projection distance of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetFarZ](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetFarZ)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The projection distance of the ProjectedTexture.

GetHorizontalFOV.DESCRIPTION: Returns the horizontal FOV of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetHorizontalFOV](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetHorizontalFOV) or [ProjectedTexture:SetFOV](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetFOV)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The horizontal FOV of the ProjectedTexture.

GetLinearAttenuation.DESCRIPTION: Returns the linear attenuation of the projected texture, which can also be set by [ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The linear attenuation.

GetNearZ.DESCRIPTION: Returns the NearZ value of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetNearZ](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetNearZ)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: NearZ of the ProjectedTexture.

GetOrthographic.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current orthographic settings of the Projected Texture. To set these values, use [ProjectedTexture:SetOrthographic](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetOrthographic).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not this projected texture is orthographic. When false, nothing else is returned.
left
top
right
bottom

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns the position of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetPos](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetPos)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the ProjectedTexture.

GetQuadraticAttenuation.DESCRIPTION: Returns the quadratic attenuation of the projected texture, which can also be set by [ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The quadratic attenuation

GetTexture.DESCRIPTION: Returns the texture of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetTexture](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetTexture)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The texture of the ProjectedTexture.

GetTextureFrame.DESCRIPTION: Returns the texture frame of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetTextureFrame](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetTextureFrame)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The texture frame.

GetVerticalFOV.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vertical FOV of the ProjectedTexture, which was previously set by [ProjectedTexture:SetVerticalFOV](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetVerticalFOV) or [ProjectedTexture:SetFOV](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetFOV)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The vertical FOV of the ProjectedTexture.

IsValid.DESCRIPTION:
Returns true if the projected texture is valid (i.e. has not been removed), false otherwise.

Instead of calling this directly it's a good idea to call [IsValid](/gmod/Global.IsValid) in case the variable is nil.

```
IsValid( ptexture )
```

This not only checks whether the projected texture is valid - but also checks whether it's nil.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the projected texture is valid.

Remove.DESCRIPTION: Removes the projected texture. After calling this, [ProjectedTexture:IsValid](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:IsValid) will return false, and any hooks with the projected texture as the identifier will be automatically deleted.

SetAngles.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the angles (direction) of the projected texture.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

SetBrightness.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the brightness of the projected texture.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: brightness
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The brightness to give the projected texture.

SetColor.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the color of the projected texture.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Must be a [Color](/gmod/Color).

Unlike other projected textures, this color can only go up to 255.

SetConstantAttenuation.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the constant attenuation of the projected texture.

See also [ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation) and [ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation).

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

SetEnableShadows.DESCRIPTION:
Enable or disable shadows cast from the projected texture.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.
NOTES: as with all types of projected textures (including the player's flashlight and env_projectedtexture), there can only be 8 projected textures with shadows enabled in total. This limit can be increased with the launch parameter: -numshadowtextures limit where limit is the new limit. Naturally, many projected lights with shadows enabled will drastically decrease framerate.

SetFarZ.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the distance at which the projected texture ends.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

SetFOV.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the angle of projection.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Must be higher than 0 and lower than 180

SetHorizontalFOV.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the horizontal angle of projection without affecting the vertical angle.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hFOV
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new horizontal Field Of View for the projected texture. Must be in range between 0 and 180.

SetLinearAttenuation.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the linear attenuation of the projected texture.

See also [ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation) and [ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetQuadraticAttenuation).

The default value of linear attenuation when the projected texture is created is 100. (others are 0, as you are not supposed to mix them)

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

SetNearZ.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the distance at which the projected texture begins its projection.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.
NOTES: Setting this to 0 will disable the projected texture completely! This may be useful if you want to disable a projected texture without actually removing it

This seems to affect the rendering of shadows - a higher Near Z value will have shadows begin to render closer to their casting object. Comparing a low Near Z value (like 1) with a normal one (12) or high one (1000) is the easiest way to understand this artifact

SetOrthographic.DESCRIPTION:
Changes the current projected texture between orthographic and perspective projection.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: orthographic
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: When false, all other arguments are ignored and the texture is reset to perspective projection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: left
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of units left from the projected texture's origin to project.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: top
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of units upwards from the projected texture's origin to project.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: right
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of units right from the projected texture's origin to project.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bottom
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of units downwards from the projected texture's origin to project.

SetPos.DESCRIPTION:
Move the Projected Texture to the specified position.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

SetQuadraticAttenuation.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the quadratic attenuation of the projected texture.

See also [ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetLinearAttenuation) and [ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:SetConstantAttenuation).

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

SetTexture.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the texture to be projected.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the texture. Can also be an [ITexture](/gmod/ITexture).

SetTextureFrame.DESCRIPTION:
For animated textures, this will choose which frame in the animation will be projected.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: frame
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frame index to use.

SetVerticalFOV.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the vertical angle of projection without affecting the horizontal angle.

You must call [ProjectedTexture:Update](/gmod/ProjectedTexture:Update) after using this function for it to take effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vFOV
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new vertical Field Of View for the projected texture. Must be in range between 0 and 180.

Update.DESCRIPTION: Updates the Projected Light and applies all previously set parameters.

ProjectedTexture.DESCRIPTION: A client side projected texture, created by [ProjectedTexture](/gmod/Global.ProjectedTexture).

AddTask.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a task to the schedule. See also [Schedule:AddTaskEx](/gmod/Schedule:AddTaskEx) if you wish to customize task start and run function names.

See also [ENTITY:StartSchedule](/gmod/ENTITY:StartSchedule), [NPC:StartEngineTask](/gmod/NPC:StartEngineTask), and [NPC:RunEngineTask](/gmod/NPC:RunEngineTask).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Custom task name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskdata
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task data to be passed into the NPC's functions

AddTaskEx.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a task to the schedule with completely custom function names.

See also [Schedule:AddTask](/gmod/Schedule:AddTask).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: start
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The full name of a function on the entity's table to be ran when the task is started.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: run
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The full name of a function on the entity's table to be ran when the task is continuously running.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task data to be passed into the NPC's functions

EngTask.DESCRIPTION: Adds an engine task to the schedule.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task name, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskdata
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task data, can be a float.

GetTask.DESCRIPTION: Returns the task at the given index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: num
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Task index.

Init.DESCRIPTION: Initialises the Schedule. Called by [ai_schedule.New](/gmod/ai_schedule.New) when the Schedule is created.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: debugName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name passed from [ai_schedule.New](/gmod/ai_schedule.New).

NumTasks.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of tasks in the schedule.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of tasks in this schedule.

Pop.DESCRIPTION: Pop an item from the stack

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of items you want to pop.

Push.DESCRIPTION: Push an item onto the stack

ARGUMENTS.NAME: object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The item you want to push

Size.DESCRIPTION: Returns the size of the stack

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The size of the stack

Top.DESCRIPTION: Get the item at the top of the stack

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The item at the top of the stack

Stack.DESCRIPTION:
An object returned by [util.Stack](/gmod/util.Stack).

Like a Lua table, a Stack is a container. It follows the principle of LIFO (last in, first out).

The Stack works like a stack of papers: the first page you put down (push) will be the last one you remove (pop). That also means that the last page you put down, will be the first to be removed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Material of one portion of a brush model.

GetVertices.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of vertices the brush surface is built from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A list of [Vector](/gmod/Vector) points. This will usually be 4 corners of a quadrilateral in counter-clockwise order.

IsNoDraw.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the brush surface is a nodraw surface, meaning it will not be drawn by the engine.
NOTES: This internally checks the SURFDRAW_NODRAW flag.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if this surface won't be drawn.

IsSky.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the brush surface is displaying the skybox.
NOTES: This internally checks the SURFDRAW_SKY flag.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the surface is the sky.

IsWater.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the brush surface is water.
NOTES: This internally checks the SURFDRAW_WATER flag.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the surface is water.

SurfaceInfo.DESCRIPTION:
A brush surface object returned by [Entity:GetBrushSurfaces](/gmod/Entity:GetBrushSurfaces).

Brush surfaces are a part of what makes up the map geometry aside from displacements. Any primitive brush model, including most breakable windows, can be represented by this object.
NOTES: This object internally uses the SurfaceHandle_t class, which is an alias for msurface2_t*.

Init.DESCRIPTION: Initialises the AI task. Called by [ai_task.New](/gmod/ai_task.New).

InitEngine.DESCRIPTION: Initialises the AI task as an engine task.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: taskname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the task.

InitFunctionName.DESCRIPTION: Initialises the AI task as NPC method-based.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the NPC method to call on task start.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: runname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the NPC method to call on task run.

IsEngineType.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the task is an engine task (`TYPE_ENGINE`, 1).

IsFNameType.DESCRIPTION: Determines if the task is an NPC method-based task (`TYPE_FNAME`, 2).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC to run the task on.

Run_FName.DESCRIPTION: Runs the AI task as an NPC method. This requires the task to be of type `TYPE_FNAME`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC to run the task on.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC to start the task on.

Start_FName.DESCRIPTION: Starts the AI task as an NPC method.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The NPC to start the task on.

Task.DESCRIPTION: A single AI task. Returned by [ai_task.New](/gmod/ai_task.New).

Allowed.DESCRIPTION:
Checks whether the tool is allowed on the server. This will always return true clientside and will not be affected by [SANDBOX:CanTool](/gmod/SANDBOX:CanTool).

This function uses **TOOL.AllowedCVar** which is a [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) object pointing to  **toolmode_allow_`*toolname***` convar.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the tool is allowed.

BuildConVarList.DESCRIPTION: Builds a list of all ConVars set via the ClientConVar variable on the [TOOL](/gmod/Structures/TOOL) and their default values. This is used for the preset system.

RETURNS.NAME: convars
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A list of all convars and their default values.

CheckObjects.DESCRIPTION: Checks all added objects to see if they're still valid, if not, clears the list of objects.

ClearObjects.DESCRIPTION: Clears all objects previously set with [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.NAME: tool
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created tool object.

CreateConVars.DESCRIPTION: Creates clientside ConVars based on the ClientConVar table specified in the tool structure. Also creates the 'toolmode_allow_X' ConVar.

GetBone.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a physics bone number previously stored using [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object which was set in [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Associated physics bone with given id.

GetClientInfo.DESCRIPTION: Attempts to grab a clientside tool [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the convar to retrieve. The function will automatically add the "mytoolfilename_" part to it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the requested [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

GetClientNumber.DESCRIPTION: Attempts to grab a clientside tool [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the convar to retrieve. The function will automatically add the "mytoolfilename_" part to it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The default value to return in case the lookup fails.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the requested [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

GetEnt.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves an Entity previously stored using [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object which was set in [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Associated Entity with given id.

GetHelpText.DESCRIPTION: Returns a language key based on this tool's name and the current stage it is on.

RETURNS.NAME: key
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The returned language key, for example `"#tool.weld.1"`

GetLocalPos.DESCRIPTION:
Retrieves an local vector previously stored using [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).
See also [Tool:GetPos](/gmod/Tool:GetPos).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object which was set in [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Associated local vector with given id.

GetMode.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the current tool mode.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current tool mode.

GetNormal.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves an normal vector previously stored using [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object which was set in [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Associated normal vector with given id.

GetOperation.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current operation of the tool set by [Tool:SetOperation](/gmod/Tool:SetOperation).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current operation the tool is at.

GetOwner.DESCRIPTION: Returns the owner of this tool.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Player using the tool

GetPhys.DESCRIPTION:
Retrieves an [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) previously stored using [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).
See also [Tool:GetEnt](/gmod/Tool:GetEnt).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object which was set in [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Associated PhysObj with given id. If it wasn't specified, returns current [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) of associated Entity

GetPos.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves an vector previously stored using [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject). See also [Tool:GetLocalPos](/gmod/Tool:GetLocalPos).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object which was set in [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Associated vector with given id. The vector is converted from [Tool:GetLocalPos](/gmod/Tool:GetLocalPos).

GetServerInfo.DESCRIPTION:
Attempts to grab a serverside tool [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).
This will not do anything on client, despite the function being defined shared.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the convar to retrieve. The function will automatically add the "mytoolfilename_" part to it.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the requested [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar).

GetStage.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current stage of the tool set by [Tool:SetStage](/gmod/Tool:SetStage).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current stage of the current operation the tool is at.

MakeGhostEntity.DESCRIPTION:
Initializes the ghost entity with the given model. Removes any old ghost entity if called multiple times.

The ghost is a regular prop_physics entity in singleplayer games, and a clientside prop in multiplayer games.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model of the new ghost entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position to initialize the ghost entity at, usually not needed since this is updated in [Tool:UpdateGhostEntity](/gmod/Tool:UpdateGhostEntity).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle to initialize the ghost entity at, usually not needed since this is updated in [Tool:UpdateGhostEntity](/gmod/Tool:UpdateGhostEntity).

NumObjects.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of stored objects ( [Entity](/gmod/Entity)s ) the tool has.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of stored objects, or [Tool:GetStage](/gmod/Tool:GetStage) clientide.

ReleaseGhostEntity.DESCRIPTION: Removes any ghost entity created for this tool.

SetObject.DESCRIPTION:
Stores an [Entity](/gmod/Entity) for later use in the tool.

The stored values can be retrieved by [Tool:GetEnt](/gmod/Tool:GetEnt), [Tool:GetPos](/gmod/Tool:GetPos), [Tool:GetLocalPos](/gmod/Tool:GetLocalPos), [Tool:GetPhys](/gmod/Tool:GetPhys), [Tool:GetBone](/gmod/Tool:GetBone) and [Tool:GetNormal](/gmod/Tool:GetNormal)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The id of the object to store.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to store.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to store.
NOTES: this position is in **global space** and is internally converted to **local space** relative to the object, so when you retrieve it later it will be corrected to the object's new position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: phys
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The physics object to store.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bone
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hit bone to store.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: normal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hit normal to store.

SetOperation.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the current operation of the tool. Does nothing clientside. See also [Tool:SetStage](/gmod/Tool:SetStage).

Operations and stages work as follows:
* Operation 1
* * Stage 1
* * Stage 2
* * Stage 3
* Operation 2
* * Stage 1
* * Stage 2
* * Stage ...

ARGUMENTS.NAME: operation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new operation ID to set.

SetStage.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the current stage of the tool. Does nothing clientside.

See also [Tool:SetOperation](/gmod/Tool:SetOperation).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stage
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new stage to set.

StartGhostEntity.DESCRIPTION: Initializes the ghost entity based on the supplied entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to copy ghost parameters off

UpdateData.DESCRIPTION: Sets the tool's stage to how many stored objects the tool has.

UpdateGhostEntity.DESCRIPTION:
Updates the position and orientation of the ghost entity based on where the toolgun owner is looking along with data from object with id 1 set by [Tool:SetObject](/gmod/Tool:SetObject).

This should be called in the tool's [TOOL:Think](/gmod/TOOL:Think) hook.

This command is only used for tools that move props, such as easy weld, axis and motor. If you want to update a ghost like the thruster tool does it for example, check its [source code](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/sandbox/entities/weapons/gmod_tool/stools/thruster.lua#L179).

Tool.DESCRIPTION:
A list of functions available inside a Sandbox Toolgun tool.

You can find the hooks  and members [here](/gmod/Structures/TOOL).

Add.DESCRIPTION: Adds the values of the argument vector to the orignal vector. This functions the same as vector1 + vector2 without creating a new vector object, skipping object construction and garbage collection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to add.

Angle.DESCRIPTION: Returns an angle representing the normal of the vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angle/direction of the vector.

AngleEx.DESCRIPTION: Returns the angle of the vector, but instead of assuming that up is [Vector](/gmod/Global.Vector)( 0, 0, 1 ) (Like [Vector:Angle](/gmod/Vector:Angle) does) you can specify which direction is 'up' for the angle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: up
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The up direction vector

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The angle

Cross.DESCRIPTION:
Calculates the cross product of this vector and the passed one.

The cross product of two vectors is a 3-dimensional vector with a direction perpendicular (at right angles) to both of them (according to the right-hand rule), and magnitude equal to the area of parallelogram they span. This is defined as the product of the magnitudes, the sine of the angle between them, and unit (normal) vector `n` defined by the right-hand rule:
:**a** × **b** = |**a**| |**b**| sin(θ) **n̂**
where **a** and **b** are vectors, and **n̂** is a unit vector (magnitude of 1) perpendicular to both.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: otherVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vector to calculate the cross product with.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The cross product of the two vectors.

Distance.DESCRIPTION: Returns the euclidean distance between the vector and the other vector.
WARNINGS: This is a relatively expensive process since it uses the square root. It is recommended that you use Vector:DistToSqr whenever possible. (Benchmarking shows Vector:DistToSqr was at most 153 nanoseconds faster.)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: otherVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to get the distance to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Distance between the vectors.

DistToSqr.DESCRIPTION: Returns the squared distance of 2 vectors, this is faster than [Vector:Distance](/gmod/Vector:Distance) as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: otherVec
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to calculate the distance to.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Squared distance to the vector

Div.DESCRIPTION: Divide the vector by the given number, that means x, y and z are divided by that value. This will change the value of the original vector, see example 2 for division without changing the value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: divisor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to divide the vector with.

Dot.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the [dot product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot_product#Geometric_definition)  of this vector and the passed one.

The dot product of two vectors is the product of their magnitudes (lengths), and the cosine of the angle between them:

**a · b** = |**a**| |**b**| cos(θ) 

where **a** and **b** are vectors.

See [Vector:Length](/gmod/Vector:Length) for obtaining magnitudes.

A dot product returns just the cosine of the angle if both vectors are normalized, and zero if the vectors are at right angles to each other.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: otherVector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to calculate the dot product with

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The dot product between the two vectors

DotProduct.DESCRIPTION: Returns the dot product of the two vectors.
DEPRECATED: This is an alias of Vector:Dot. Use that instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Vector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The other vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Dot Product

GetNormal.DESCRIPTION: Returns a normalized version of the vector. This is a alias of [Vector:GetNormalized](/gmod/Vector:GetNormalized).
DEPRECATED: Use Vector:GetNormalized instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Normalized version of the vector.

GetNormalized.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a normalized version of the vector. Normalized means vector with same direction but with length of 1.

This does not affect the vector you call it on; to do this, use [Vector:Normalize](/gmod/Vector:Normalize).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Normalized version of the vector.

IsEqualTol.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the vector is equal to another vector with the given tolerance.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: compare
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to compare to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tolerance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The tolerance range.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Are the vectors equal or not.

IsZero.DESCRIPTION: Checks whenever all fields of the vector are 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Do all fields of the vector equal 0 or not

Length.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [Euclidean length](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_vector#Length) of the vector: √(x² + y² + z²).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Length of the vector.

Length2D.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length of the vector in two dimensions, without the Z axis.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Length of the vector in two dimensions, √(x² + y²)

Length2DSqr.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the squared length of the vectors x and y value, x² + y².

This is faster than [Vector:Length2D](/gmod/Vector:Length2D) as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Squared length of the vector in two dimensions

LengthSqr.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the squared length of the vector, x² + y² + z².

This is faster than [Vector:Length](/gmod/Vector:Length) as calculating the square root is an expensive process.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Squared length of the vector

Mul.DESCRIPTION: Scales the vector by the given number, that means x, y and z are multiplied by that value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: multiplier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to scale the vector with.

Normalize.DESCRIPTION: Normalizes the given vector. This changes the vector you call it on, if you want to return a normalized copy without affecting the original, use [Vector:GetNormalized](/gmod/Vector:GetNormalized).

Rotate.DESCRIPTION:
Rotates a vector by the given angle.
Doesn't return anything, but rather changes the original vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rotation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to rotate the vector by.

Set.DESCRIPTION: Copies the values from the second vector to the first vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vector to copy from.

SetUnpacked.DESCRIPTION: Sets the x, y, and z of the vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x component

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y component

ARGUMENTS.NAME: z
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The z component

Sub.DESCRIPTION: Substracts the values of the second vector from the orignal vector, this function can be used to avoid garbage collection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: vector
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The other vector.

ToColor.DESCRIPTION:
Translates the [Vector](/gmod/Vector) (values ranging from 0 to 1) into a [Color](/gmod/Color). This will also range the values from 0 - 1 to 0 - 255.

x * 255 -> r

y * 255 -> g

z * 255 -> b

This is the opposite of [Color:ToVector](/gmod/Color:ToVector)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [Color](/gmod/Color).

ToScreen.DESCRIPTION: Returns where on the screen the specified position vector would appear. A related function is [gui.ScreenToVector](/gmod/gui.ScreenToVector), which converts a 2D coordinate to a 3D direction.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Errors in a render hook can make this value incorrect until the player restarts their game.

[cam.Start3D](/gmod/cam.Start3D) or 3D context [cam.Start](/gmod/cam.Start) with non-default parameters incorrectly sets the reference FOV for this function, causing incorrect return values. This can be fixed by creating and ending a default 3D context ([cam.Start3D](/gmod/cam.Start3D) with no arguments).

NOTES: Should be called from a 3D rendering environment or after cam.Start3D or it may not work correctly.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created [ToScreenData](/gmod/Structures/ToScreenData).

ToTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vector as a table with three elements.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table with elements 1 = x, 2 = y, 3 = z.

Unpack.DESCRIPTION: Returns the x, y, and z of the vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: x or Vector[1].
y or Vector[2].
z or Vector[3].

WithinAABox.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the given vector is in a box created by the 2 other vectors.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxStart
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The first vector.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxEnd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The second vector.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the vector in the box or not

Zero.DESCRIPTION: Sets x, y and z to 0.

Vector.DESCRIPTION:
List of all possible functions to manipulate vectors.

Created by [Vector](/gmod/Global.Vector).

 Type   | Name           | Description                    

 ------ | -------------- | ------------------------------ 

 [number](/gmod/number) | `x` or `1` | The X component of the vector. 

 [number](/gmod/number) | `y` or `2` | The Y component of the vector. 

 [number](/gmod/number) | `z` or `3` | The Z component of the vector.

Metamethod | Second Operand | Description

---------- | -------------- | -----------

`__add` | [Vector](/gmod/Vector) | Returns new [Vector](/gmod/Vector) with the result of addition.

`__div` | [number](/gmod/number) | Returns new [Vector](/gmod/Vector) with the result of division.

`__eq` | [any](/gmod/any) | Compares 2 operands, if they both are [Vector](/gmod/Vector), compares each individual component.

`__index` | [number](/gmod/number) or [string](/gmod/string) | Gets the component of the [Vector](/gmod/Vector). Returns a [number](/gmod/number).

`__mul` | [number](/gmod/number) or [Vector](/gmod/Vector)| Returns new [Vector](/gmod/Vector) with the result of multiplication.

`__newindex` | [number](/gmod/number) or [string](/gmod/string) | Sets the component of the [Vector](/gmod/Vector). Accepts [number](/gmod/number) and [string](/gmod/string).

`__sub` | [Vector](/gmod/Vector) | Returns new [Vector](/gmod/Vector) with the result of subtraction.

`__tostring` | | Returns `x y z`.

`__unm` | | Returns new [Vector](/gmod/Vector) with the result of negation.

BoostTimeLeft.DESCRIPTION: Returns the remaining boosting time left.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The remaining boosting time left

CheckExitPoint.DESCRIPTION: Tries to find an Exit Point for leaving vehicle, if one is unobstructed in the direction given.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: yaw
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Yaw/roll from vehicle angle to check for exit

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Distance from origin to drop player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vector for exit position or nil if cannot exit that way.

EnableEngine.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the engine is enabled or disabled, i.e. can be started or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the engine

GetAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Returns information about the ammo of the vehicle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo type of the vehicle ammo
Clip size
Count
Camera distance

GetDriver.DESCRIPTION: Gets the driver of the vehicle, returns `NULL` if no driver is present.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The driver of the vehicle.

GetHLSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current speed of the vehicle in Half-Life Hammer Units (in/s). Same as [Entity:GetVelocity](/gmod/Entity:GetVelocity) + [Vector:Length](/gmod/Vector:Length).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The speed of the vehicle

GetMaxSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns the max speed of the vehicle in MPH.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The max speed of the vehicle in MPH

GetOperatingParams.DESCRIPTION: Returns some info about the vehicle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The operating params. See [OperatingParams](/gmod/Structures/OperatingParams).

GetPassenger.DESCRIPTION: Gets the passenger of the vehicle, returns NULL if no drivers is present.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: passenger
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the passenger

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The passenger

GetPassengerSeatPoint.DESCRIPTION: Returns the seat position and angle of a given passenger seat.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: role
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The passenger role. ( 1 is the driver )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The seat position
The seat angle

GetRPM.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current RPM of the vehicle. This value is fake and doesn't actually affect the vehicle movement.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The RPM.

GetSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current speed of the vehicle in MPH.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The speed of the vehicle in MPH

GetSteering.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current steering of the vehicle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current steering of the vehicle.

GetSteeringDegrees.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum steering degree of the vehicle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum steering degree of the vehicle

GetThirdPersonMode.DESCRIPTION: Returns if vehicle has thirdperson mode enabled or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if third person mode enabled, false otherwise

GetThrottle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current throttle of the vehicle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The current throttle of the vehicle

GetVehicleClass.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vehicle class name. This is only useful for Sandbox spawned vehicles or any vehicle that properly sets the vehicle class with [Vehicle:SetVehicleClass](/gmod/Vehicle:SetVehicleClass).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The class name of the vehicle.

GetVehicleParams.DESCRIPTION: Returns the vehicle parameters of given vehicle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle parameters. See [VehicleParams](/gmod/Structures/VehicleParams)

GetVehicleViewPosition.DESCRIPTION: Returns the view position and forward angle of a given passenger seat.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: role
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The passenger role. 0 is the driver. This parameter seems to be ignored by the game engine and is therefore optional.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The view position, will be 0, 0, 0 on failure
The view angles, will be 0, 0, 0 on failure
The field of view, will be 0 on failure

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wheel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel to retrieve

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wheel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel to get the base wheel height of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The base wheel height.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wheel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel to check

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The contact position
The Surface Properties ID of hit surface.
Whether the wheel is on ground or not

GetWheelCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the wheel count of the vehicle

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of wheels

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wheel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel to get the base wheel height of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The total wheel height.

HasBoost.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this vehicle has boost at all.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this vehicle has boost at all.

HasBrakePedal.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this vehicle has a brake pedal. See [Vehicle:SetHasBrakePedal](/gmod/Vehicle:SetHasBrakePedal).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this vehicle has a brake pedal or not.

IsBoosting.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

IsEngineEnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the engine is enabled or not, i.e. whether it can be started.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the engine is enabled

IsEngineStarted.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the engine is started or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the engine is started or not.

IsValidVehicle.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the vehicle object is a valid or not. This will return false when [Vehicle](/gmod/Vehicle) functions are not usable on the vehicle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the vehicle a valid vehicle or not

IsVehicleBodyInWater.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether this vehicle's engine is underwater or not. ( Internally the attachment point "engine" or "vehicle_engine" is checked )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this vehicle's engine is underwater or not.

ReleaseHandbrake.DESCRIPTION:
Releases the vehicle's handbrake (Jeep) so it can roll without any passengers.

This will be overwritten if the vehicle has a driver. Same as [Vehicle:SetHandbrake](/gmod/Vehicle:SetHandbrake)( false )

SetBoost.DESCRIPTION: Sets the boost. It is possible that this function does not work while the vehicle has a valid driver in it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boost
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new boost value

SetCameraDistance.DESCRIPTION: Sets the third person camera distance of the vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Camera distance to set to

SetHandbrake.DESCRIPTION:
Turns on or off the Jeep handbrake so it can roll without a driver inside.

Does nothing while the vehicle has a driver in it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: handbrake
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to turn on, false to turn off.

SetHasBrakePedal.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether this vehicle has a brake pedal.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: brakePedal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether this vehicle has a brake pedal

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxRevThrottle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum throttle. This number must be negative.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxThrottle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum throttle.

SetSpringLength.DESCRIPTION: Sets spring length of given wheel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wheel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel to change spring length of

ARGUMENTS.NAME: length
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new spring length

SetSteering.DESCRIPTION: Sets the steering of the vehicle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: front
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle of the front wheels (-1 to 1)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rear
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angle of the rear wheels (-1 to 1)

SetSteeringDegrees.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum steering degrees of the vehicle

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steeringDegrees
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum steering degree

SetThirdPersonMode.DESCRIPTION: Sets the third person mode state.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the third person mode for this vehicle

SetThrottle.DESCRIPTION: Sets the throttle of the vehicle. It is possible that this function does not work with a valid driver in it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: throttle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new throttle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The vehicle class name to set

SetVehicleEntryAnim.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether the entry or exit camera animation should be played or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bOn
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entry or exit camera animation should be played or not.

SetVehicleParams.DESCRIPTION: Sets the vehicle parameters for given vehicle.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION:
Because this method uses miles per hour but [Vehicle:GetVehicleParams](/gmod/Vehicle:GetVehicleParams) returns Hammer units per second, this method incorrectly modifies the vehicle engine's "boostMaxSpeed", "maxRevSpeed" and "maxSpeed" even when not explicitly set in a call to this method.

**Workaround**: In order to retain the original values for these fields, call [Vehicle:GetVehicleParams](/gmod/Vehicle:GetVehicleParams) yourself, convert the mentioned fields from Hammer units per second to miles per hour (1 MPH ≈ 17.6 HU/s in this case) and add them to the table passed into the call to this setter. Avoid doing this repeatedly to avoid floating point inaccuracies over time (store the ready-calculated value for next time if possible).

NOTES: Not all variables from the Structures/VehicleParams can be set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: params
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new new vehicle parameters. See [VehicleParams](/gmod/Structures/VehicleParams)

SetWheelFriction.DESCRIPTION: Sets friction of given wheel.  This function may be broken.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: wheel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wheel to change the friction of

ARGUMENTS.NAME: friction
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new friction to set

ARGUMENTS.NAME: start
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to start, false to stop.

Vehicle.DESCRIPTION: This is a list of all methods only available for vehicles. It is also possible to call [Entity](http://wiki.garrysmod.com/index.php?title=Category:Entity) functions on vehicles.

GetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Returns the absolute rotation of the matrix.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Absolute rotation of the matrix

GetField.DESCRIPTION: Returns a specific field in the matrix.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: row
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Row of the field whose value is to be retrieved, from 1 to 4

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Column of the field whose value is to be retrieved, from 1 to 4

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the specified field

GetForward.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the forward direction of the matrix.

ie. The first column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The forward direction of the matrix.

GetInverse.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix.

Inverting the matrix will fail if its [determinant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Determinant) is 0 or close to 0. (ie. its "scale" in any direction is 0.)

See also [VMatrix:GetInverseTR](/gmod/VMatrix:GetInverseTR).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The inverted matrix if possible, nil otherwise

GetInverseTR.DESCRIPTION:
Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

Using this function on a matrix with modified scale may return an incorrect inverted matrix.

To get the inverse of a matrix that contains other modifications, see [VMatrix:GetInverse](/gmod/VMatrix:GetInverse).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The inverted matrix.

GetRight.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the right direction of the matrix.

ie. The second column of the matrix, negated, excluding the w coordinate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The right direction of the matrix.

GetScale.DESCRIPTION: Returns the absolute scale of the matrix.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Absolute scale of the matrix

GetTranslation.DESCRIPTION: Returns the absolute translation of the matrix.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Absolute translation of the matrix

GetUp.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the up direction of the matrix.

ie. The third column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The up direction of the matrix.

Identity.DESCRIPTION: Initializes the matrix as Identity matrix.

Invert.DESCRIPTION:
Inverts the matrix.

Inverting the matrix will fail if its [determinant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Determinant) is 0 or close to 0. (ie. its "scale" in any direction is 0.)

If the matrix cannot be inverted, it does not get modified.

See also [VMatrix:InvertTR](/gmod/VMatrix:InvertTR).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the matrix was inverted or not

InvertTR.DESCRIPTION:
Inverts the matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

Using this function on a matrix with modified scale may return an incorrect inverted matrix.

To invert a matrix that contains other modifications, see [VMatrix:Invert](/gmod/VMatrix:Invert).

IsIdentity.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the matrix is equal to Identity matrix or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the matrix an Identity matrix or not

IsRotationMatrix.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether the matrix is a rotation matrix or not.

Technically it checks if the forward, right and up vectors are orthogonal and normalized.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the matrix a rotation matrix or not

IsZero.DESCRIPTION: Checks whenever all fields of the matrix are 0, aka if this is a [null matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_matrix).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the matrix is a null matrix.

Rotate.DESCRIPTION:
Rotates the matrix by the given angle.

Postmultiplies the matrix by a rotation matrix (A = AR).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rotation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Rotation.

Scale.DESCRIPTION:
Scales the matrix by the given vector.

Postmultiplies the matrix by a scaling matrix (A = AS).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vector to scale with matrix with.

ScaleTranslation.DESCRIPTION: Scales the absolute translation with the given value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to scale the translation with.

Set.DESCRIPTION: Copies values from the given matrix object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: src
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The matrix to copy values from.

SetAngles.DESCRIPTION: Sets the absolute rotation of the matrix.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New angles.

SetField.DESCRIPTION: Sets a specific field in the matrix.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: row
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Row of the field to be set, from 1 to 4

ARGUMENTS.NAME: column
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Column of the field to be set, from 1 to 4

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set in that field

SetForward.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the forward direction of the matrix.

ie. The first column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: forward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The forward direction of the matrix.

SetRight.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the right direction of the matrix.

ie. The second column of the matrix, negated, excluding the w coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: forward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The right direction of the matrix.

SetScale.DESCRIPTION: Modifies the scale of the matrix while preserving the rotation and translation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The scale to set.

SetTranslation.DESCRIPTION: Sets the absolute translation of the matrix.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: translation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New translation.

SetUnpacked.DESCRIPTION: Sets each component of the matrix.

SetUp.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the up direction of the matrix.

ie. The third column of the matrix, excluding the w coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: forward
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The up direction of the matrix.

ToTable.DESCRIPTION: Converts the matrix to a 4x4 table. See [Matrix](/gmod/Global.Matrix) function.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The 4x4 table.

Translate.DESCRIPTION:
Translates the matrix by the given vector aka. adds the vector to the translation.

Postmultiplies the matrix by a translation matrix (A = AT).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: translation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Vector to translate the matrix by.

Unpack.DESCRIPTION: Returns each component of the matrix, expanding rows before columns.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: [VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(1, 1)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(1, 2)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(1, 3)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(1, 4)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(2, 1)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(2, 2)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(2, 3)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(2, 4)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(3, 1)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(3, 2)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(3, 3)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(3, 4)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(4, 1)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(4, 2)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(4, 3)
[VMatrix:GetField](/gmod/VMatrix:GetField)(4, 4)

Zero.DESCRIPTION:
Sets all components of the matrix to 0, also known as a [null matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_matrix).

This function is more efficient than setting each element manually.

VMatrix.DESCRIPTION:
List of all possible functions to manipulate matrices.

This object can be created by [Matrix](/gmod/Global.Matrix).

Metamethod | Second Operand | Description

---------- | -------------- | -----------

`__add` | [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) | Returns new [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) with the result of addition.

`__eq` | [any](/gmod/any) | Compares 2 operands, if they both are [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix), compares each individual component.

`__mul` | [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) or [Vector](/gmod/Vector) | Returns new [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) with the result of multiplication.

`__sub` | [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) | Returns new [VMatrix](/gmod/VMatrix) with the result of subtraction.

`__tostring` |  | Returns a [string](/gmod/string) in format `[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]\n[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]\n[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]\n[%f,\t%f,\t%f,\t%f]`.

AllowsAutoSwitchFrom.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the weapon allows to being switched from when a better ( [Weapon:GetWeight](/gmod/Weapon:GetWeight) ) weapon is being picked up.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the weapon allows to being switched from.

AllowsAutoSwitchTo.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the weapon allows to being switched to when a better ( [Weapon:GetWeight](/gmod/Weapon:GetWeight) ) weapon is being picked up.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the weapon allows to being switched to.

CallOnClient.DESCRIPTION: Calls a SWEP function on client.
WARNINGS: This uses the usermessage internally, because of that, the combined length of the arguments of this function may not exceed 254 bytes/characters or the function will cease to function!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: functionName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of function to call. If you want to call SWEP:MyFunc() on client, you type in "MyFunc"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments for the function, separated by spaces.
NOTES: Only the second argument is passed as argument and must be a string

Clip1.DESCRIPTION: Returns how much primary ammo is in the magazine.
NOTES: This is not shared between clients and will instead return the maximum primary clip size.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of primary ammo in the magazine.

Clip2.DESCRIPTION: Returns how much secondary ammo is in the magazine.
NOTES: This is not shared between clients and will instead return the maximum secondary clip size.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of secondary ammo in the magazine.

DefaultReload.DESCRIPTION: Forces the weapon to reload while playing given animation.
NOTES: This will stop the Weapon:Think function from getting called while the weapon is reloading!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sequence to use as reload animation. Uses the [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Did reloading actually take place

GetActivity.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sequence enumeration number that the weapon is playing.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This can return inconsistent results between the server and client.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current activity, see [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT). Returns 0 if the weapon doesn't have active sequence.

GetHoldType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the hold type of the weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The hold type of the weapon. You can find a list of default hold types [here](/gmod/Hold_Types).
Maximum primary clip size
Maximum secondary clip size

GetNextPrimaryFire.DESCRIPTION: Gets the next time the weapon can primary fire. ( Can call [WEAPON:PrimaryAttack](/gmod/WEAPON:PrimaryAttack) )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The time, relative to [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime)

GetNextSecondaryFire.DESCRIPTION: Gets the next time the weapon can secondary fire. ( Can call [WEAPON:SecondaryAttack](/gmod/WEAPON:SecondaryAttack) )

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The time, relative to [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime)

GetPrimaryAmmoType.DESCRIPTION: Gets the primary ammo type of the given weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ammo type ID, or -1 if not found.

GetPrintName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the non-internal name of the weapon, that should be for displaying.
NOTES: If that returns an untranslated message (#HL2_XX), use language.GetPhrase to see the "nice" name.
If SWEP.PrintName is not set in the Weapon or the Weapon Base then "<MISSING SWEP PRINT NAME>" will be returned.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The "nice" name of the weapon.

GetSecondaryAmmoType.DESCRIPTION: Gets the ammo type of the given weapons secondary fire.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The secondary ammo type ID, or -1 if not found.

GetSlot.DESCRIPTION: Returns the slot of the weapon.
NOTES: The slot numbers start from 0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The slot of the weapon.

GetSlotPos.DESCRIPTION: Returns slot position of the weapon

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The slot position of the weapon

GetWeaponViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the view model of the weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The view model of the weapon.

GetWeaponWorldModel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the world model of the weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The world model of the weapon.

GetWeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the "weight" of the weapon, which is used when deciding which [Weapon](/gmod/Weapon) is better by the engine.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon "weight".

HasAmmo.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the weapon has ammo left or not. It will return false when there's no ammo left in the magazine **and** when there's no reserve ammo left.
NOTES: This will return true for weapons like crowbar, gravity gun, etc.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the weapon has ammo or not.

IsCarriedByLocalPlayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the weapon is carried by the local player.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the weapon is carried by the local player or not

IsScripted.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the weapon is a SWEP or a built-in weapon.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if weapon is scripted ( SWEP ), false if not ( A built-in HL2 weapon )

IsWeaponVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the weapon is visible. The term visibility is not exactly what gets checked here, first it checks if the owner is a player, then checks if the active view model has EF_NODRAW flag NOT set.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is visible or not

LastShootTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the time since this weapon last fired a bullet with [Entity:FireBullets](/gmod/Entity:FireBullets) in seconds. It is not networked.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The time in seconds when the last bullet was fired.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: act
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Activity to play. See the [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT) (specifically ACT_VM_).

SetClip1.DESCRIPTION: Lets you change the number of bullets in the given weapons primary clip.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of bullets the clip should contain

SetClip2.DESCRIPTION: Lets you change the number of bullets in the given weapons secondary clip.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammo
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of bullets the clip should contain

SetHoldType.DESCRIPTION: Sets the hold type of the weapon. This function also calls [WEAPON:SetWeaponHoldType](/gmod/WEAPON:SetWeaponHoldType) and properly networks it to all clients.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Using this function on weapons held by bots will not network holdtype changes to clients if the world model is set to an empty string (SWEP.WorldModel = "").

NOTES: This only works on scripted weapons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the hold type. You can find all default hold types [here](/gmod/Hold_Types)

SetLastShootTime.DESCRIPTION: Sets the time since this weapon last fired in seconds. Used in conjunction with [Weapon:LastShootTime](/gmod/Weapon:LastShootTime)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The time in seconds when the last time the weapon was fired.

SetNextPrimaryFire.DESCRIPTION: Sets when the weapon can fire again. Time should be based on [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will fire extra bullets if the time is set to less than [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Time when player should be able to use primary fire again

SetNextSecondaryFire.DESCRIPTION: Sets when the weapon can alt-fire again. Time should be based on [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Time when player should be able to use secondary fire again

Weapon.DESCRIPTION: This is a list of all methods only available for weapons. It is also possible to call [Entity](/gmod/Entity) functions on weapons.
NOTES: A list of available methods has been expanded in your navigation bar.

BalloonPopped.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of balloons burst. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Popper' achievement is unlocked.

Count.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of achievements in Garry's Mod.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of achievements available.

EatBall.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of balls eaten. Once this count reaches 200, the 'Ball Eater' achievement is unlocked.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: achievementID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: achievementID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of achievement to retrieve description of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Description of an achievement

GetGoal.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves progress goal of given achievement

ARGUMENTS.NAME: achievementID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of achievement to retrieve goal of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Progress goal of an achievement

ARGUMENTS.NAME: achievementID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of achievement to retrieve name of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Name of an achievement

IncBaddies.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of baddies killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'War Zone' achievement is unlocked.

IncBystander.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of innocent animals killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Innocent Bystander' achievement is unlocked.

IncGoodies.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of friendly NPCs killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Bad Friend' achievement is unlocked.

IsAchieved.DESCRIPTION: Used in GMod 12 in the achievements menu to show the user if they have unlocked certain achievements.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: AchievementID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Internal Achievement ID number

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the given achievementID is achieved.

Remover.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of things removed. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Destroyer' achievement is unlocked.

SpawnedNPC.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of NPCs spawned. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Procreator' achievement is unlocked.

SpawnedProp.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of props spawned. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Creator' achievement is unlocked.

SpawnedRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of ragdolls spawned. Once this count reaches 2000, the 'Dollhouse' achievement is unlocked.

SpawnMenuOpen.DESCRIPTION: Adds one to the count of how many times the spawnmenu has been opened. Once this count reaches 100,000, the 'Menu User' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.DESCRIPTION: This library is used internally by Garry's Mod to help keep track of achievement progress and unlock the appropriate achievements once a certain number is reached.

GetScheduleID.DESCRIPTION: Translates a schedule name to its corresponding ID.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sched
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Then schedule name. In most cases, this will be the same as the [SCHED](/gmod/Enums/SCHED) name.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The schedule ID, see [SCHED](/gmod/Enums/SCHED). Returns -1 if the schedule name isn't valid.

GetTaskID.DESCRIPTION: Translates a task name to its corresponding ID.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: task
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The task name.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The task ID, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502). Returns -1 if the schedule name isn't valid.

New.DESCRIPTION: Creates a schedule for scripted NPC.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the schedule.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing schedule information to be used with [ENTITY:StartSchedule](/gmod/ENTITY:StartSchedule).

ai_schedule.DESCRIPTION: Allows you to set up a schedule for NPCs to follow. This lets you dictate their actions.

New.DESCRIPTION: Create a new empty task. Used by [Schedule:AddTask](/gmod/Schedule:AddTask) and [Schedule:EngTask](/gmod/Schedule:EngTask).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The new task object.

ai_task.DESCRIPTION: Used to create tasks for scripted NPCs.

Get.DESCRIPTION:
Gets the base class of an an object.

This is used not just by entities, but also by widgets, panels, drive modes, weapons and gamemodes (with "gamemode_" prefix).

The keyword **DEFINE_BASECLASS** translates into a call to this function. In the engine, it is replaced with:

```
local BaseClass = baseclass.Get
```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The child class.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The base class's meta table.

Set.DESCRIPTION:
Add a new base class that can be derived by others. This is done automatically for:
* widgets
* panels
* drive modes
* entities
* weapons
* gamemodes (with prefix "gamemode_")

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of this base class. Must be completely unique.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The base class.

baseclass.DESCRIPTION: The baseclass library. Used to lookup a field from a metatable.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: shiftedValue

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Result of bitwise "and" operation.

bit.DESCRIPTION:
The bitwise library contains useful functions for bitwise operations.

Make sure you're familiar with [Bitwise Operators](https://code.tutsplus.com/articles/understanding-bitwise-operators--active-11301)

ApplyShake.DESCRIPTION: Shakes the screen at a certain position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Origin of the shake.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angles of the shake.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: factor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The shake factor.

End.DESCRIPTION:
Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

This function is an alias of [cam.End3D](/gmod/cam.End3D).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will crash the game if there is no context to end.

End2D.DESCRIPTION: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D context.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will crash the game if there is no context to end.

End3D.DESCRIPTION: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will crash the game if there is no context to end.

End3D2D.DESCRIPTION: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D2D context.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will crash the game if there is no context to end.

EndOrthoView.DESCRIPTION: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D orthographic rendering context.

GetModelMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Returns the currently active model matrix.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The currently active matrix.

IgnoreZ.DESCRIPTION:
Tells the renderer to ignore the depth buffer and draw any upcoming operation "ontop" of everything that was drawn yet.

This is identical to calling `render.DepthRange( 0, 0.01 )` for `true` and  `render.DepthRange( 0, 1 )` for `false`. See [render.DepthRange](/gmod/render.DepthRange).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ignoreZ
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Determines whenever to ignore the depth buffer or not.

PopModelMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Pops the current active rendering matrix from the stack and reinstates the previous one.

PushModelMatrix.DESCRIPTION: Pushes the specified matrix onto the render matrix stack. Unlike opengl, this will replace the current model matrix.
NOTES: This does not work with cam.Start3D2D if `multiply` is false.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: matrix
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The matrix to push.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: multiply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, multiplies given matrix with currently active matrix ([cam.GetModelMatrix](/gmod/cam.GetModelMatrix)) before pushing.

Start.DESCRIPTION: Sets up a new rendering context. This is an extended version of [cam.Start3D](/gmod/cam.Start3D) and [cam.Start2D](/gmod/cam.Start2D). Must be finished by [cam.End3D](/gmod/cam.End3D) or [cam.End2D](/gmod/cam.End2D).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will not update current view properties for 3D contexts.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dataTbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Render context config. See [RenderCamData](/gmod/Structures/RenderCamData)

Start2D.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by [cam.End2D](/gmod/cam.End2D).

This is almost always used with a render target from the [render](/gmod/render). To set its position use [render.SetViewPort](/gmod/render.SetViewPort) with a target already stored.
NOTES: This will put an identity matrix at the top of the model matrix stack. If you are trying to use cam.PushModelMatrix, call it after this function and not before.

Start3D.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up a new 3D rendering context. Must be finished by [cam.End3D](/gmod/cam.End3D).

For more advanced settings such as an orthographic view, use [cam.Start](/gmod/cam.Start) instead.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Negative x/y values won't work.
This will not update current view properties.

NOTES:
Both zNear and zFar need a value before any of them work.

zNear also requires a value higher than 0.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Render cam position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Render cam angles.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fov
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Field of view.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X coordinate of where to start the new view port.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y coordinate of where to start the new view port.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the new viewport.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the new viewport.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: zNear
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Distance to near clipping plane.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: zFar
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Distance to far clipping plane.

Start3D2D.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by [cam.End3D2D](/gmod/cam.End3D2D). This function pushes a new matrix onto the stack. ([cam.PushModelMatrix](/gmod/cam.PushModelMatrix))

Matrix formula:

```

local m = Matrix()

m:SetAngles(angles)

m:SetTranslation(pos)

m:SetScale(Vector(scale, -scale, 1))

```
WARNINGS: This should be closed by cam.End3D2D otherwise the game crashes

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Origin of the 3D2D context, ie. the top left corner, (0, 0).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Angles of the 3D2D context.

+x in the 2d context corresponds to +x of the angle (its forward direction).

+y in the 2d context corresponds to -y of the angle (its right direction).

If (dx, dy) are your desired (+x, +y) unit vectors, the angle you want is dx:AngleEx(dx:Cross(-dy)).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The scale of the render context.

If scale is 1 then 1 pixel in 2D context will equal to 1 unit in 3D context.

StartOrthoView.DESCRIPTION: Sets up a new 3d context using orthographic projection.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: leftOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The left plane offset.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: topOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The top plane offset.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rightOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The right plane offset.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bottomOffset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bottom plane offset.

cam.DESCRIPTION:
This directs all drawing to be done to a certain 2D or 3D plane or position, until the corresponding "End" function is called.

The matrix functions exist, but are mostly unusable unless you're familiar with the source engine's layout for each aspect.

AddText.DESCRIPTION: Adds text to the local player's chat box (which only they can read).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The arguments. Arguments can be:
* [table](/gmod/table) - [Color](/gmod/Color). Will set the color for all following strings until the next Color argument.
* [string](/gmod/string) - Text to be added to the chat box.
* [Player](/gmod/Player) - Adds the name of the player in the player's team color to the chat box.
* [any](/gmod/any) - Any other type, such as [Entity](/gmod/Entity) will be converted to string and added as text.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The X coordinate of the chatbox's position.
The Y coordinate of the chatbox's position.
The width of the chatbox.
The height of the chatbox.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If equals 1, opens public chat, otherwise opens team chat

chat.DESCRIPTION: The chat library's purpose is to interface with the default chatbox.

cleanup.DESCRIPTION: The cleanup library allows you to control what happens to custom entities when the clean-up buttons are pressed in the Utilities tab of the Spawn menu (default Q).

Add.DESCRIPTION: Creates a console command that runs a function in lua with optional autocompletion function and help text.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will fail if the concommand was previously removed with [concommand.Remove](/gmod/concommand.Remove) in a different realm (creating a command on the client that was removed from the server and vice-versa).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The command name to be used in console.

This cannot be a name of existing console command or console variable. It will silently fail if it is.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to run when the concommand is executed. Arguments passed are:

* [Player](/gmod/Player) ply - The player that ran the concommand. NULL entity if command was entered with the dedicated server console.

* [string](/gmod/string) cmd - The concommand string (if one callback is used for several concommands).

* [table](/gmod/table) args - A table of all string arguments.

* [string](/gmod/string) argStr - The arguments as a string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: autoComplete
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to call which should return a table of options for autocompletion. ([Autocompletion Tutorial](/gmod/Autocomplete_Tutorial))

This only properly works on the client since it is **not** networked. Arguments passed are:

* [string](/gmod/string) cmd - The concommand this autocompletion is for.

* [string](/gmod/string) args - The arguments typed so far.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: helpText
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The text to display should a user run 'help cmdName'.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Concommand modifier flags. See [FCVAR](/gmod/Enums/FCVAR).

AutoComplete.DESCRIPTION: Used by the engine to call the autocomplete function for a console command, and retrieve returned options.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: command
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of command

ARGUMENTS.NAME: arguments
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments given to the command

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Possibilities for auto-completion. This is the return value of the auto-complete callback.

GetTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns the tables of all console command callbacks, and autocomplete functions, that were added to the game with [concommand.Add](/gmod/concommand.Add).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of command callback functions.
Table of command autocomplete functions.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will not always remove the command from auto-complete.

[concommand.Add](/gmod/concommand.Add) will fail if the concommand was previously removed with this function in a different realm (creating a command on the client that was removed from the server and vice-versa).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the command to be removed.

Run.DESCRIPTION:
Used by the engine to run a console command's callback function. This will only be called for commands that were added with [AddConsoleCommand](/gmod/Global.AddConsoleCommand), which [concommand.Add](/gmod/concommand.Add) calls internally. An error is sent to the player's chat if no callback is found.

This will still be called for concommands removed with [concommand.Remove](/gmod/concommand.Remove) but will return false.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player to run concommand on

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cmd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Command name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Command arguments.
Can be table or string

ARGUMENTS.NAME: argumentString
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: string of all arguments sent to the command

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the console command with the given name exists, and `false` if it doesn't.

concommand.DESCRIPTION: The concommand library is used to create console commands which can be used to network (basic) information & events between the client and the server.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: ControlPanel

Delete.DESCRIPTION: Deletes a cookie on the client.

Set.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the value of a cookie, which is saved automatically by the [sql](/gmod/sql).

These are stored in the *.db files - cl.db for clients, mn.db for menu state and sv.db for servers.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the cookie that you want to set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to store in the cookie.

cookie.DESCRIPTION: Used to store permanent variables/settings on clients that will persist between servers. They are stored in the `cl.db`, `sv.db`, or `mn.db` SQLite databases depending on the realm, located in the root Garry's Mod folder.

create.DESCRIPTION: Creates a coroutine of the given function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function for the coroutine to use.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: coroutine

resume.DESCRIPTION: Resumes the given coroutine and passes the given vararg to either the function arguments or the [coroutine.yield](/gmod/coroutine.yield) that is inside that function and returns whatever yield is called with the next time or by the final return in the function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: coroutine
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Coroutine to resume.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments to be returned by [coroutine.yield](/gmod/coroutine.yield).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: If the executed thread code had no errors occur within it.
If an error occured, this will be a string containing the error message. Otherwise, this will be arguments that were yielded.

running.DESCRIPTION: Returns the active coroutine or nil if we are not within a coroutine.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: coroutine

status.DESCRIPTION: Returns the status of the coroutine passed to it, the possible statuses are "suspended", "running", and "dead".

ARGUMENTS.NAME: coroutine
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Coroutine to check the status of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: status

wait.DESCRIPTION:
Yields the coroutine for the given duration before continuing.

This only works inside a coroutine.

This function uses [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime) instead of [RealTime](/gmod/Global.RealTime).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: duration
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of seconds to wait

wrap.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a function which calling is equivalent with calling [coroutine.resume](/gmod/coroutine.resume) with the coroutine and all extra parameters.

The values returned by the returned function only contain the values passed to the inner [coroutine.yield](/gmod/coroutine.yield) call and do not include the *no error* status that [coroutine.resume](/gmod/coroutine.resume) provides. In case of failure, an error is thrown instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: coroutine
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Coroutine to resume.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: func

yield.DESCRIPTION: Pauses the active coroutine and passes all additional variables to the call of [coroutine.resume](/gmod/coroutine.resume) that resumed the coroutine last time, and returns all additional variables that were passed to the previous call of resume.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: returnValue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments to be returned by the last call of [coroutine.resume](/gmod/coroutine.resume)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Arguments that were set previously by [coroutine.resume](/gmod/coroutine.resume)

coroutine.DESCRIPTION: Coroutines are similar to threads, however they do not run simultaneously. They offer a way to split up tasks and dynamically pause & resume functions.

AddChangeCallback.DESCRIPTION: Adds a callback to be called when the named convar changes.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not callback convars in the menu state.
This does not callback convars on the client with FCVAR_GAMEDLL and convars on the server without FCVAR_GAMEDLL.
This does not callback convars on the client with FCVAR_REPLICATED.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the convar to add the change callback to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to be called when the convar changes. The arguments passed are:
* [string](/gmod/string) convar - The name of the convar.
* [string](/gmod/string) oldValue - The old value of the convar.
* [string](/gmod/string) newValue - The new value of the convar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, you will be able to remove the callback using [cvars.RemoveChangeCallback](/gmod/cvars.RemoveChangeCallback).

Bool.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves console variable as a boolean.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: cvar

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Retrieved value

ARGUMENTS.NAME: createIfNotFound
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Whether or not to create the internal callback table for given [ConVar](/gmod/ConVar) if there isn't one yet.

This argument is internal and should not be used.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of the convar's callbacks, or nil if the convar doesn't exist.

Number.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves console variable as a number.
