RemoveChangeCallback.DESCRIPTION: Removes a callback for a convar using the the callback's identifier. The identifier should be the third argument specified for [cvars.AddChangeCallback](/gmod/cvars.AddChangeCallback).

cvars.DESCRIPTION: The cvars library allows you to control what happens when a cvar (console variable) is changed.

debug.DESCRIPTION:
Enters an interactive mode with the user, running each string that the user enters. Using simple commands and other debug facilities, the user can inspect global and local variables, change their values, evaluate expressions, and so on. A line containing only the word cont finishes this function, so that the caller continues its execution.

* Commands for debug.debug are not lexically nested within any function, and so have no direct access to local variables.
* This only works on the source dedicated server.
* To exit this interactive mode, you can press Ctrl + Z then Enter OR type the word 'cont' on a single line and press enter.

getfenv.DESCRIPTION: Returns the environment of the passed object. This can be set with [debug.setfenv](/gmod/debug.setfenv)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Object to get environment of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Environment

gethook.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current hook settings of the passed thread. The thread argument can be omitted. This is unrelated to . More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html

ARGUMENTS.NAME: thread
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Which thread to retrieve its hook from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Hook function
Hook mask
Hook count

getinfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns debug information about a function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: funcOrStackLevel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Takes either a function or a number representing the stack level as an argument. Stack level 0 always corresponds to the debug.getinfo call, 1 would be the function calling debug.getinfo, and so on.

Returns useful information about that function in a table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fields
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A string whose characters specify the information to be retrieved.

* f - Populates the func field.

* l - Populates the currentline field.

* L - Populates the activelines field.

* n - Populates the name and namewhat fields - only works if stack level is passed rather than function pointer.

* S - Populates the location fields (lastlinedefined, linedefined, short_src, source and what).

* u - Populates the argument and upvalue fields (isvararg, nparams, nups)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table as a [DebugInfo](/gmod/Structures/DebugInfo) containing information about the function you passed. Can return nil if the stack level didn't point to a valid stack frame.

getlocal.DESCRIPTION: Gets the name and value of a local variable indexed from the level.
WARNINGS: When a function has a tailcall return, you cannot access the locals of this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: thread
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The thread

ARGUMENTS.NAME: level
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The level above the thread. 

* 0 = the function that was called (most always this function)'s arguments

* 1 = the thread that had called this function.

* 2 = the thread that had called the function that started the thread that called this function.

A function defined in Lua can also be passed as the level. The index will specify the parameter's name to be returned (a parameter will have a value of nil).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The variable's index you want to get.

* 1 = the first local defined in the thread

* 2 = the second local defined in the thread

* etc...

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the variable.

Sometimes this will be `(*temporary)` if the local variable had no name.
NOTES: Variables with names starting with **(** are **internal variables**.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the local variable.

getmetatable.DESCRIPTION: Returns the metatable of an object. This function ignores the metatable's __metatable field.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The object to retrieve the metatable from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The metatable of the given object.

getregistry.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the internal Lua registry table.

The Lua registry is used by the engine and binary modules to create references to Lua values. Avoid creating entries into the registry with a number as the key, as they are reserved for the reference system.
WARNINGS: Improper editing of the registry can result in unintended side effects, including crashing of the game.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The Lua registry

getupvalue.DESCRIPTION: Used for getting variable values in an index from the passed function. This does nothing for C functions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to get the upvalue indexed from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index in the upvalue array. The max number of entries can be found in [debug.getinfo](/gmod/debug.getinfo)'s "[nups](/gmod/Structures/DebugInfo)" key.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the upvalue. Will be nil if the index was out of range (< 1 or > [debug.getinfo](/gmod/debug.getinfo).nups), or the function was defined in C.
Value of the upvalue.

setfenv.DESCRIPTION: Sets the environment of the passed object.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Object to set environment of

ARGUMENTS.NAME: env
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Environment to set

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The object

sethook.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the given function as a Lua hook. This is completely different to gamemode hooks. The thread argument can be completely omitted and calling this function with no arguments will remove the current hook. This is used by default for infinite loop detection. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html

Hooks are not always ran when code that has been compiled by LuaJIT's JIT compiler is being executed. This means that relying on them for infinite loop protection is unwise.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: thread
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Thread to set the hook on. This argument can be omited

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hook
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function for the hook to call

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mask
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hook's mask

ARGUMENTS.NAME: count
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How often to call the hook (in instructions). 0 for every instruction

DEPRECATED: This function was removed due to security concerns.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: thread
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The thread

ARGUMENTS.NAME: level
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The level above the thread. 
0 is the function that was called (most always this function)'s arguments

1 is the thread that had called this function.

2 is the thread that had called the function that started the thread that called this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The variable's index you want to get.

1 = the first local defined in the thread

2 = the second local defined in the thread

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set the local to

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the local variable if the local at the index exists, otherwise nil is returned.

setmetatable.DESCRIPTION: Sets the object's metatable. Unlike [setmetatable](/gmod/Global.setmetatable), this function works regardless of whether the first object passed is a valid table or not; this function even works on primitive datatypes such as numbers, functions, and even nil.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: object
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Object to set the metatable for.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: metatable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The metatable to set for the object.
If this argument is nil, then the object's metatable is removed.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true if the object's metatable was set successfully.

setupvalue.DESCRIPTION: Sets the variable indexed from func

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index from func

Color.DESCRIPTION: Gets the color from a Derma skin of a panel and returns default color if not found

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The default color in case of failure.

DefineControl.DESCRIPTION:
Defines a new Derma control with an optional base.

This calls [vgui.Register](/gmod/vgui.Register) internally, but also does the following:
* Adds the control to [derma.GetControlList](/gmod/derma.GetControlList)
* Adds a key "Derma" - This is returned by [derma.GetControlList](/gmod/derma.GetControlList)
* Makes a global table with the name of the control (This is technically deprecated and should not be relied upon)
* If reloading (i.e. called this function with name of an existing panel), updates all existing instances of panels with this name. (Updates functions, calls [PANEL:PreAutoRefresh](/gmod/PANEL:PreAutoRefresh) and [PANEL:PostAutoRefresh](/gmod/PANEL:PostAutoRefresh), etc.)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the newly created control

ARGUMENTS.NAME: description
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Description of the control

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table containing control methods and properties

ARGUMENTS.NAME: base
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Derma control to base the new control off of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing the new control's methods and properties

DefineSkin.DESCRIPTION: Defines a new skin so that it is usable by Derma. The default skin can be found in `garrysmod/lua/skins/default.lua`

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the skin

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descriptions
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Description of the skin

ARGUMENTS.NAME: skin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table containing skin data

GetControlList.DESCRIPTION: Returns the [derma.Controls](/gmod/derma.Controls) table, a list of all derma controls registered with [derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A listing of all available derma-based controls. See [derma.Controls](/gmod/derma.Controls) for structure and contents.

GetDefaultSkin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the default skin table, which can be changed with the hook [GM:ForceDermaSkin](/gmod/GM:ForceDermaSkin)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Skin table

GetNamedSkin.DESCRIPTION: Returns the skin table of the skin with the supplied name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of skin

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Skin table

GetSkinTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns a copy of the table containing every Derma skin

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of every Derma skin

RefreshSkins.DESCRIPTION: Clears all cached panels so that they reassess which skin they should be using.

SkinChangeIndex.DESCRIPTION: Returns how many times [derma.RefreshSkins](/gmod/derma.RefreshSkins) has been called.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of times [derma.RefreshSkins](/gmod/derma.RefreshSkins) has been called.

SkinHook.DESCRIPTION: Calls the specified hook for the given panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The type of hook to run

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the hook to run

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The panel to call the hook for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the panel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The returned variable from the skin hook

SkinTexture.DESCRIPTION: Returns a function to draw a specified texture of panels skin.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The identifier of the texture

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pnl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Panel to get the skin of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: What to return if we failed to retrieve the texture

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A function that is created with the [GWEN](/gmod/GWEN) to draw a texture.

Controls.DESCRIPTION:
[derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl).

Use [derma.GetControlList](/gmod/derma.GetControlList) to retrieve this list.

It's a list of tables, each having 3 keys, all from [derma.DefineControl](/gmod/derma.DefineControl) arguments:

* [string](/gmod/string) ClassName - The class name of the panel

* [string](/gmod/string) Description - The description of the panel

* [string](/gmod/string) BaseClass - The base class of the panel

derma.DESCRIPTION: The derma library allows you to add custom derma controls and create & modify derma skins.

dragndrop.DESCRIPTION: The drag'n'drop library, used internally by certain base panels to allow for drag'n'drop functionality, like spawnmenu's customizations.

drive.DESCRIPTION: The drive library is for adding custom control modes to the new "remote control" entity piloting system in Garry's Mod 13.

Allow.DESCRIPTION: Allow this entity to be duplicated

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An entity's classname

ApplyBoneModifiers.DESCRIPTION: Calls every function registered with [duplicator.RegisterBoneModifier](/gmod/duplicator.RegisterBoneModifier) on each bone the ent has.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player whose entity this is

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity in question

ApplyEntityModifiers.DESCRIPTION: Calls every function registered with [duplicator.RegisterEntityModifier](/gmod/duplicator.RegisterEntityModifier) on the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player whose entity this is

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity in question

ClearEntityModifier.DESCRIPTION: Clears/removes the chosen entity modifier from the entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity the modification is stored on

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key of the stored entity modifier

Copy.DESCRIPTION: Copies the entity, and all of its constraints and entities, then returns them in a table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to duplicate. The function will automatically copy all constrained entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tableToAdd
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A preexisting table to add entities and constraints in from.

Uses the same table format as the table returned from this function.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table containing duplication info which includes the following members:

* [table](/gmod/table) Entities

* [table](/gmod/table) Constraints

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) Mins

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) Maxs

The values of Mins & Maxs from the table are returned from [duplicator.WorkoutSize](/gmod/duplicator.WorkoutSize)

CopyEnts.DESCRIPTION: Copies the passed table of entities to save for later.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ents
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of entities to save/copy.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table containing duplication info which includes the following members:

* [table](/gmod/table) Entities

* [table](/gmod/table) Constraints

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) Mins

* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) Maxs

CopyEntTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table with some entity data that can be used to create a new entity with [duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable](/gmod/duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity table to save

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: See [EntityCopyData](/gmod/Structures/EntityCopyData)

CreateConstraintFromTable.DESCRIPTION: Creates a constraint from a saved/copied constraint table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: constraint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Saved/copied constraint table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entityList
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The list of entities that are to be constrained

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created constraint entity

CreateEntityFromTable.DESCRIPTION:
"Create an entity from a table." 

This creates an entity using the data in EntTable.

If an entity factory has been registered for the entity's Class, it will be called. 

Otherwise, [duplicator.GenericDuplicatorFunction](/gmod/duplicator.GenericDuplicatorFunction) will be called instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who wants to create something

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The duplication data to build the entity with. See [EntityCopyData](/gmod/Structures/EntityCopyData)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created entity

DoBoneManipulator.DESCRIPTION:
"Restores the bone's data."

Loops through Bones and calls [Entity:ManipulateBoneScale](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneScale), [Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles) and [Entity:ManipulateBonePosition](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBonePosition) on ent with the table keys and the subtable values s, a and p respectively.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be bone manipulated

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bones
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table with a [BoneManipulationData](/gmod/Structures/BoneManipulationData) for every bone (that has manipulations applied) using the bone ID as the table index.

DoFlex.DESCRIPTION: Restores the flex data using [Entity:SetFlexWeight](/gmod/Entity:SetFlexWeight) and [Entity:SetFlexScale](/gmod/Entity:SetFlexScale)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to restore the flexes on

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flexes to restore

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The flex scale to apply. (Flex scale is unchanged if omitted)

DoGeneric.DESCRIPTION:
"Applies generic every-day entity stuff for ent from table data."

Depending on the values of Model, Angle, Pos, Skin, Flex, Bonemanip, ModelScale, ColGroup, Name, and BodyG ([table](/gmod/table) of multiple values) in the data table, this calls [Entity:SetModel](/gmod/Entity:SetModel), [Entity:SetAngles](/gmod/Entity:SetAngles), [Entity:SetPos](/gmod/Entity:SetPos), [Entity:SetSkin](/gmod/Entity:SetSkin), [duplicator.DoFlex](/gmod/duplicator.DoFlex), [duplicator.DoBoneManipulator](/gmod/duplicator.DoBoneManipulator), [Entity:SetModelScale](/gmod/Entity:SetModelScale), [Entity:SetCollisionGroup](/gmod/Entity:SetCollisionGroup), [Entity:SetName](/gmod/Entity:SetName), [Entity:SetBodygroup](/gmod/Entity:SetBodygroup) on ent.

If ent has a RestoreNetworkVars function, it is called with data.DT.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be applied upon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data to be applied onto the entity

DoGenericPhysics.DESCRIPTION:
"Applies bone data, generically."

If data contains a PhysicsObjects table, it moves, re-angles and if relevent freezes all specified bones, first converting from local coordinates to world coordinates.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to be applied upon

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who owns the entity. Unused in function as of early 2013

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The data to be applied onto the entity

FindEntityClass.DESCRIPTION: Returns the entity class factory registered with [duplicator.RegisterEntityClass](/gmod/duplicator.RegisterEntityClass).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the entity class factory

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Is compromised of the following members:

* [function](/gmod/function) Func - The function that creates the entity

* [table](/gmod/table) Args - Arguments to pass to the function

GenericDuplicatorFunction.DESCRIPTION:
"Generic function for duplicating stuff" 

This is called when [duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable](/gmod/duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable) can't find an entity factory to build with. It calls [duplicator.DoGeneric](/gmod/duplicator.DoGeneric) and [duplicator.DoGenericPhysics](/gmod/duplicator.DoGenericPhysics) to apply standard duplicator stored things such as the model and position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who wants to create something

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The duplication data to build the entity with

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The newly created entity

GetAllConstrainedEntitiesAndConstraints.DESCRIPTION: Fills entStorageTable with all of the entities in a group connected with constraints. Fills constraintStorageTable with all of the constrains constraining the group.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to start from

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entStorageTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table the entities will be inserted into

ARGUMENTS.NAME: constraintStorageTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table the constraints will be inserted into

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: entStorageTable
constraintStorageTable

IsAllowed.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the entity can be duplicated or not

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An entity's classname

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the entity can be duplicated (nil otherwise)

Paste.DESCRIPTION:
"Given entity list and constraint list, create all entities and return their tables"

Calls [duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable](/gmod/duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable) on each sub-table of EntityList. If an entity is actually created, it calls [ENTITY:OnDuplicated](/gmod/ENTITY:OnDuplicated) with the entity's duplicator data, then [duplicator.ApplyEntityModifiers](/gmod/duplicator.ApplyEntityModifiers), [duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers](/gmod/duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers) and finally  [ENTITY:PostEntityPaste](/gmod/ENTITY:PostEntityPaste) is called.

The constraints are then created with [duplicator.CreateConstraintFromTable](/gmod/duplicator.CreateConstraintFromTable).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Player
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player who wants to create something

ARGUMENTS.NAME: EntityList
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of duplicator data to create the entities from

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ConstraintList
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of duplicator data to create the constraints from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: List of created entities
List of created constraints

RegisterBoneModifier.DESCRIPTION: Registers a function to be called on each of an entity's bones when [duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers](/gmod/duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers) is called.
NOTES: This function is available to call on the client, but registered functions aren't used anywhere!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The type of the key doesn't appear to matter, but it is preferable to use a string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneModifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Function called on each bone that an ent has. Called during [duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers](/gmod/duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers).

Function parameters are:

* [Player](/gmod/Player) ply

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent

* [number](/gmod/number) boneID

* [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) bone

* [table](/gmod/table) data

The data table that is passed to boneModifier is set with [duplicator.StoreBoneModifier](/gmod/duplicator.StoreBoneModifier)

RegisterConstraint.DESCRIPTION: Register a function used for creating a duplicated constraint.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique name of new constraint

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function to be called when this constraint is created
Arguments passed to the callback function

RegisterEntityClass.DESCRIPTION: This allows you to specify a specific function to be run when your SENT is pasted with the duplicator, instead of relying on the generic automatic functions.
NOTES: Automatically calls duplicator.Allow for the entity class.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ClassName of the entity you wish to register a factory for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: function
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The factory function you want to have called. It should have the arguments (Player, ...) where ... is whatever arguments you request to be passed. It also should return the entity created, otherwise [duplicator.Paste](/gmod/duplicator.Paste) result will not include it!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Strings of the names of arguments you want passed to function the from the [EntityCopyData](/gmod/Structures/EntityCopyData). As a special case, "Data" will pass the whole structure.

RegisterEntityModifier.DESCRIPTION:
This allows you to register tweaks to entities. For instance, if you were making an "unbreakable" addon, you would use this to enable saving the "unbreakable" state of entities between duplications.

This function registers a piece of generic code that is run on all entities with this modifier. In order to have it actually run, use [duplicator.StoreEntityModifier](/gmod/duplicator.StoreEntityModifier).

This function does nothing when run clientside.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for your modification. This is not limited, so be verbose. `Person's 'Unbreakable' mod` is far less likely to cause conflicts than `unbreakable`

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to be called for your modification. It should have the arguments (`Player`, `Entity`, `Data`), where data is what you pass to [duplicator.StoreEntityModifier](/gmod/duplicator.StoreEntityModifier).

RemoveMapCreatedEntities.DESCRIPTION:
Help to remove certain map created entities before creating the saved entities

This is obviously so we don't get duplicate props everywhere.

It should be called before calling Paste.

SetLocalAng.DESCRIPTION:
"When a copy is copied it will be translated according to these.

If you set them - make sure to set them back to 0 0 0!"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: v
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angle to offset all pastes from

SetLocalPos.DESCRIPTION:
"When a copy is copied it will be translated according to these.

If you set them - make sure to set them back to 0 0 0!"

ARGUMENTS.NAME: v
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to offset all pastes from

StoreBoneModifier.DESCRIPTION: Stores bone mod data for a registered bone modification function

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to add bone mod data to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boneID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The bone ID.

See [Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: key
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key for the bone modification

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bone modification data that is passed to the bone modification function

StoreEntityModifier.DESCRIPTION: Stores an entity modifier into an entity for saving

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to store modifier in

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Unique modifier name as defined in [duplicator.RegisterEntityModifier](/gmod/duplicator.RegisterEntityModifier)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Modifier data

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Ents
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of entity duplication datums.

duplicator.DESCRIPTION: The duplicator library allows you to specify what should be saved when someone attempts to duplicate your custom entity with the duplicator tool. It can also be used by 3rd party duplicator tools to make use of the built in system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin position of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lifetime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long the effect will be drawing for, in seconds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startRad
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Initial radius of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endRad
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Final radius of the effect, at the end of the effect's lifetime.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How thick the beam should be.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amplitude
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How noisy the beam should be.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Beam's [Color](/gmod/Global.Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: extra
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Extra info, all optional. A table with the following keys: (any combination)

* [number](/gmod/number) speed - ?

* [number](/gmod/number) spread - ?

* [number](/gmod/number) delay - Delay in seconds after which the effect should appear.

* [number](/gmod/number) flags- Beam flags.

* [number](/gmod/number) framerate - texture framerate.

* [string](/gmod/string) material - The material to use instead of the default one.

Bubbles.DESCRIPTION: Creates a bunch of bubbles inside a defined box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The lowest extents of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The highest extents of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: count
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How many bubbles to spawn. There's a hard limit of 500 tempents at any time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How high the bubbles can fly up before disappearing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How quickly the bubbles move.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Delay in seconds after the function call and before the effect actually spawns.

BubbleTrail.DESCRIPTION: Creates a bubble trail effect, the very same you get when shooting underwater.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the effects.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: count
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How many bubbles to spawn. There's a hard limit of 500 tempents at any time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How high the bubbles can fly up before disappearing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: speed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How quickly the bubbles move.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Delay in seconds after the function call and before the effect actually spawns.

Create.DESCRIPTION: Returns the table of the effect specified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Effect name.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Effect table.

GetList.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of all Lua-defined effects.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The effects table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effect_table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Effect table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Effect name.

effects.DESCRIPTION: The effects library allows you to manually add scripted effects.

ActiveGamemode.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the currently running gamemode.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The active gamemode's name. This is the name of the gamemode's folder.

CloseServer.DESCRIPTION:
Closes the server and completely exits.

This is only functional when running in server test mode (launch option -systemtest). Server test mode is used internally at Facepunch as part of the build process to make sure that the dedicated servers aren't crashing on startup.

GetAddons.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a list of addons the player have subscribed to on the workshop.

This list will also include "Floating" .gma addons that are mounted by the game, but not the folder addons.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table with 8 keys (downloaded, models, title, file, mounted, wsid, size, updated)

GetDemoPlaybackStartTick.DESCRIPTION: When starting playing a demo, [engine.GetDemoPlaybackTick](/gmod/engine.GetDemoPlaybackTick) will be reset and its old value will be added to this functions return value.

GetDemoPlaybackTick.DESCRIPTION:
Current tick of currently loaded demo.

If not playing a demo, it will return amount of ticks since last demo playback.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of ticks of currently loaded demo.

GetDemoPlaybackTimeScale.DESCRIPTION:
Returns time scale of demo playback.

If not during demo playback, returns 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The time scale of demo playback, value of demo_timescale console variable.

GetDemoPlaybackTotalTicks.DESCRIPTION:
Returns total amount of ticks of currently loaded demo.

If not playing a demo, returns 0 or the value of last played demo.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Total amount of ticks of currently loaded demo.

GetGamemodes.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table containing info for all installed gamemodes

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: gamemodes

GetGames.DESCRIPTION: Returns an array of tables corresponding to all games from which Garry's Mod supports mounting content.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of tables containing all mountable games

GetUserContent.DESCRIPTION: Returns the UGC (demos, saves and dupes) the player have subscribed to on the workshop.
DEPRECATED: Used internally for in-game menus, may be merged in the future into engine.GetAddons.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table with 6 keys (title, type, tags, wsid, timeadded)

IsPlayingDemo.DESCRIPTION:
Returns true if we're currently playing a demo.

You will notice that there's no server-side version of this. That's because there is no server when playing a demo. Demos are both recorded and played back purely clientside.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the game is currently playing a demo or not.

IsRecordingDemo.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the game is currently recording a demo file (.dem) using gm_demo

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the game is currently recording a demo or not.

LightStyle.DESCRIPTION: This is a direct binding to the function `engine->LightStyle`. This function allows you to change the default light style of the map - so you can make lighting lighter or darker. You’ll need to call [render.RedownloadAllLightmaps](/gmod/render.RedownloadAllLightmaps) clientside to refresh the lightmaps to this new color.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Calling this function with arguments 0 and "a" will cause dynamic lights such as those produced by the Light tool to stop working.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lightstyle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The lightstyle to edit. 0 to 63. If you want to edit map lighting, you want to set this to 0.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pattern
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The pattern to change the lightstyle to. `a` is the darkest, `z` is the brightest. You can use stuff like "abcxyz" to make flashing patterns. The normal brightness for a map is `m`. Values over `z` are allowed, `~` for instance.

OpenDupe.DESCRIPTION: Loads a duplication from the local filesystem.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dupeName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the file. e.g, engine.OpenDupe("dupes/8b809dd7a1a9a375e75be01cdc12e61f.dupe")

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Compressed dupeData. Use util.JSONToTable to make it into a format useable by the duplicator tool.

ServerFrameTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns an estimate of the server's performance. Equivalent to calling [FrameTime](/gmod/Global.FrameTime) from the server, according to source code.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Frame time.
Server Framerate Std Deviation.

SetMounted.DESCRIPTION: Sets the mounting options for mountable content.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: depotID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The depot id of the game to mount.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: doMount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The mount state, true to mount, false to unmount

TickCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of ticks since the game server started.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of ticks since the game server started.

TickInterval.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of seconds between each gametick.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of seconds between each gametick.

VideoSettings.DESCRIPTION: Returns video recording settings set by [video.Record](/gmod/video.Record). Used by Demo-To-Video feature.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The video recording settings, see [VideoData](/gmod/Structures/VideoData).

WriteDupe.DESCRIPTION: Saves a duplication as a file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dupe
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Dupe table, encoded by [util.TableToJSON](/gmod/util.TableToJSON) and compressed by [util.Compress](/gmod/util.Compress)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: jpeg
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The dupe icon, created by [render.Capture](/gmod/render.Capture)

WriteSave.DESCRIPTION: Stores savedata into the game (can be loaded using the LoadGame menu)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: saveData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Data generated by gmsave.SaveMap

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name the save will have.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: time
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: When the save was saved during the game (Put CurTime here)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: map
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The map the save is used for.

engine.DESCRIPTION: The engine library provides functions to access various features in the game's engine, most are related to the demo and save systems.

Create.DESCRIPTION: Creates an entity. This function will fail and return `NULL` if the networked-edict limit is hit (around **8176**), or the provided entity class doesn't exist.
WARNINGS:
Do not use before GM:InitPostEntity has been called, otherwise the server will crash!

If you need to perform entity creation when the game starts, create a hook for GM:InitPostEntity and do it there.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname of the entity to create.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The created entity, or `NULL` if failed.

CreateClientProp.DESCRIPTION:
Creates a clientside only prop. See also [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel).

For physics to work you **must** use the _model_ argument, a simple `SetModel` call will not be enough.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model for the entity to be created.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created entity. (C_PhysPropClientside)

CreateClientside.DESCRIPTION: Creates a clientside only scripted entity. The scripted entity must be of "anim" type.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class name of the entity to create.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created entity.

FindAlongRay.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of all entities along the ray. The ray does not stop on collisions, meaning it will go through walls/entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: start
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the ray

ARGUMENTS.NAME: end
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the ray

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The mins corner of the ray

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maxs corner of the ray

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of the found entities.

FindByClass.DESCRIPTION: Gets all entities with the given class, supports wildcards. This works internally by iterating over [ents.GetAll](/gmod/ents.GetAll). Even if internally ents.GetAll is used, It is faster to use ents.FindByClass than ents.GetAll with a single class comparison.
NOTES: Asterisks (*) are the only wildcard supported.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class of the entities to find.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing all found entities

FindByClassAndParent.DESCRIPTION: Finds all entities that are of given class and are children of given entity. This works internally by iterating over [ents.GetAll](/gmod/ents.GetAll).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The class of entities to search for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Parent of entities that are being searched for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of found entities or nil if none are found

FindByModel.DESCRIPTION: Gets all entities with the given model, supports wildcards. This works internally by iterating over [ents.GetAll](/gmod/ents.GetAll).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This currently only supports trailing asterisks (*) for wildcards.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model of the entities to find.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of all found entities.

FindByName.DESCRIPTION:
Gets all entities with the given hammer targetname. This works internally by iterating over [ents.GetAll](/gmod/ents.GetAll).

Doesn't do anything on client.
NOTES: A player's Name is his nickname, see Player:GetName

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The targetname to look for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of all found entities

FindInBox.DESCRIPTION: Returns all entities within the specified box.
NOTES: Clientside entities will not be returned by this function.
WARNINGS: There is a limit of 512 entities for the output!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxMins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The box minimum coordinates.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxMaxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The box maximum coordinates.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of all found entities.

FindInCone.DESCRIPTION:
Finds and returns all entities within the specified cone. Only entities whose [Entity:WorldSpaceCenter](/gmod/Entity:WorldSpaceCenter) is within the cone are considered to be in it.

The "cone" is actually a conical "slice" of an axis-aligned box (see: [ents.FindInBox](/gmod/ents.FindInBox)). The image to the right shows approximately how this function would look in 2D. Due to this, the entity may be farther than the specified range!
NOTES: Clientside entities will not be returned by this function.
WARNINGS: If there are more than 512 entities in the axis-aligned box around the origin, then the result may be incomplete!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The tip of the cone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: normal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Direction of the cone.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: range
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The range of the cone/box around the origin.
NOTES: The function internally adds 1 to this argument before using it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle_cos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The [cosine](/gmod/math.cos) of the angle between the center of the cone to its edges, which is half the overall angle of the cone.

1 makes a 0° cone, 0.707 makes approximately 90°, 0 makes 180°, and so on.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of all found [Entity](/gmod/Entity)s.

FindInPVS.DESCRIPTION: Finds all entities that lie within a [PVS](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PVS).
NOTES: The function won't take in to account Global.AddOriginToPVS and the like.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: viewPoint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: [Entity](/gmod/Entity) or [Vector](/gmod/Vector) to find entities within the PVS of. If a player is given, this function will use the player's view entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The found [Entity](/gmod/Entity)s.

FindInSphere.DESCRIPTION: Gets all entities within the specified sphere.
NOTES: Clientside entities will not be returned by this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Center of the sphere.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Radius of the sphere.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of all found [Entity](/gmod/Entity)s. Has a limit of 1024 entities.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the target entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: activator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Activator of the event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: caller
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Caller of the event.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: usetype
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Use type. See the [USE](/gmod/Enums/USE).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: This value is passed to [ENTITY:Use](/gmod/ENTITY:Use), but isn't used by any default entities in the engine.

GetAll.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of all existing entities. The table is sequential

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of all existing [Entity](/gmod/Entity)s.

GetByIndex.DESCRIPTION: Returns an entity by its index. Same as [Entity](/gmod/Global.Entity).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entIdx
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the entity.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The entity if it exists.

GetCount.DESCRIPTION: Gives you the amount of currently existing entities.
NOTES: Similar to **#**ents.GetAll() but with better performance since the entity table doesn't have to be generated. If ents.GetAll is already being called for iteration, than using the **#** operator on the table will be faster than calling this function since it is JITted.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: IncludeKillMe
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Include entities with the FL_KILLME flag. This will skip an internal loop, and the function will be more efficient as a byproduct.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of entities

GetEdictCount.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of networked entities, which is limited to 8192. [ents.Create](/gmod/ents.Create) will fail somewhere between 8064 and 8176 - this can vary based on the amount of existing temp ents.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Number of networked entities

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity's creation id

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Found entity

ents.DESCRIPTION: The ents library provides functions for creating and finding entities in the game.

Append.DESCRIPTION: Appends a file relative to the `data` folder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: content
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The content which should be appended to the file.

CreateDir.DESCRIPTION: Creates a directory that is relative to the `data` folder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The directory's name.

Delete.DESCRIPTION: Deletes a file or `empty` folder that is relative to the **data** folder. You can't remove any files outside of **data** folder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file name.

Exists.DESCRIPTION: Returns a boolean of whether the file or directory exists or not.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will sometimes return false clientside for directories received from the server via a clientside lua file. You can work around this by using [file.Find](/gmod/file.Find) with the path to the directory followed by a wildcard (no trailing forward slash) and see if the directory is inside the returned directories table (**see second example)**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file or directory's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns `true` if the file exists and `false` if it does not.

Find.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of files and directories inside a single folder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The wildcard to search for. `models/*.mdl` will list **.mdl** files in the `models/` folder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sorting
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The sorting to be used, **optional**.

* `nameasc` sort the files ascending by name.

* `namedesc` sort the files descending by name.

* `dateasc` sort the files ascending by date.

* `datedesc` sort the files descending by date.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of found files, or `nil` if the path is invalid
A table of found directories, or `nil` if the path is invalid

IsDir.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the given file is a directory or not.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will sometimes return false clientside for directories received from the server via a clientside lua file. You can work around this by using [file.Find](/gmod/file.Find) with the path to the directory followed by a wildcard (no trailing forward slash) and see if the directory is inside the returned directories table (**see second example)**.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file or directory's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the given path is a directory or `false` if it's a file.

Open.DESCRIPTION: Attempts to open a file with the given mode.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The files name. See [file.Write](/gmod/file.Write) for details on filename restrictions when writing to files.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileMode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The mode to open the file in. Possible values are:

* **r** - read mode

* **w** - write mode

* **a** - append mode

* **rb** - binary read mode

* **wb** - binary write mode

* **ab** - binary append mode

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

RETURNS.NAME: File
RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The opened file object, or `nil` if it failed to open due to it not existing or being used by another process.

Read.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the content of a file.

Beware of casing -- some filesystems are case-sensitive. SRCDS on Linux seems to force file/directory creation to lowercase, but will not modify read operations.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The data from the file as a string, or `nil` if the file isn't found

Rename.DESCRIPTION:
Attempts to rename a file with the given name to another given name.

This function is constrained to the `data/` folder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: orignalFileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The original file or folder name. See [file.Write](/gmod/file.Write) for details on filename restrictions when writing to files.

**This argument will be forced lowercase.**

ARGUMENTS.NAME: targetFileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The target file or folder name. See [file.Write](/gmod/file.Write) for details on filename restrictions when writing to files.

**This argument will be forced lowercase.**

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` on success, `false` otherwise.

Size.DESCRIPTION: Returns the file's size in bytes. If the file is not found, returns `-1`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file's name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

Time.DESCRIPTION: Returns when the file or folder was lasted modified in Unix time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The **file** or **folder** path.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gamePath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to look for the files and directories in. See [this list](/gmod/File_Search_Paths) for a list of valid paths.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Seconds passed since Unix epoch.

Write.DESCRIPTION: Writes the given string to a file. Erases all previous data in the file. To add data without deleting previous data, use [file.Append](/gmod/file.Append).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the file being written into. The path is relative to the **data/** folder.

This argument will be forced lowercase.

The filename **must** end with one of the following:

* .txt

* .jpg

* .png

* .vtf

* .dat

* .json

* .vmt

Restricted symbols are: `" :`

ARGUMENTS.NAME: content
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The content that will be written into the file.

file.DESCRIPTION:
The file library provides functions for finding, reading and writing to files. 

The following path values are most commonly used:

* `LUA` searches the lua files (in /lua/, in your gamemodes, in all the addons).

* `GAME` searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc).

* `MOD` searches only the garrysmod folder.

* `DATA` searches in the data folder.

See [File Search Paths](/gmod/File Search Paths) for the descriptive list of path values.

For the full list of path values, type `path` in the console.

AddFrame.DESCRIPTION: Adds a frame to the blend. Calls [frame_blend.CompleteFrame](/gmod/frame_blend.CompleteFrame) once enough frames have passed since last [frame_blend.CompleteFrame](/gmod/frame_blend.CompleteFrame) call.

CompleteFrame.DESCRIPTION: Renders the frame onto internal render target.

DrawPreview.DESCRIPTION: Actually draws the frame blend effect.

IsActive.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether frame blend post processing effect is enabled or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is frame blend enabled or not

IsLastFrame.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the current frame is the last frame?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the current frame is the last frame?

RenderableFrames.DESCRIPTION: Returns amount of frames needed to render?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of frames needed to render?

ShouldSkipFrame.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether we should skip frame or not

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should the frame be skipped or not

AddAmmoType.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a new ammo type to the game.

You can find a list of default ammo types [here](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Default_Ammo_Types).
NOTES: There is a limit of 256 ammo types, including the default ones.
WARNINGS: This function **must** be called on both the client and server in GM:Initialize or you will have unexpected problems.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ammoData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The attributes of the ammo. See the [AmmoData](/gmod/Structures/AmmoData).

WARNINGS: There's a rather low limit of around 256 for decal materials that may be registered and they are not cleared on map load.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: decalName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the decal.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: materialName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to be used for the decal. May also be a list of material names, in which case a random material from that list will be chosen every time the decal is placed.

NOTES: You will still need to call this function clientside regardless if you create the particle effects serverside.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: particleFileName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path of the file to add. Must be (file).pcf.

BuildAmmoTypes.DESCRIPTION: Called by the engine to retrieve the ammo types.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: All ammo types registered via [game.AddAmmoType](/gmod/game.AddAmmoType), sorted by its name value.

CleanUpMap.DESCRIPTION:
If called serverside it will remove **ALL** entities which were not created by the map (not players or weapons held by players).

On the client it will remove decals, sounds, gibs, dead NPCs, and entities created via [ents.CreateClientProp](/gmod/ents.CreateClientProp).

This function calls [GM:PreCleanupMap](/gmod/GM:PreCleanupMap) before cleaning up the map and [GM:PostCleanupMap](/gmod/GM:PostCleanupMap) after cleaning up the map.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Calling this in a [ENTITY:StartTouch](/gmod/ENTITY:StartTouch) or [ENTITY:Touch](/gmod/ENTITY:Touch) hook will crash the game.
Calling this destroys all BASS streams.
This can crash when removing _firesmoke entities. **You can use the example below to workaround this issue.**

ARGUMENTS.NAME: dontSendToClients
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to `true`, don't run this functions on all clients.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: extraFilters
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity classes not to reset during cleanup.

ConsoleCommand.DESCRIPTION:
Runs a console command.

Make sure to add a newline ("\n") at the end of the command.
WARNINGS:
If you use data that were received from a client, you should avoid using this function because newline and semicolon (at least) allow the client to run arbitrary commands!

For safety, you are urged to prefer using Global.RunConsoleCommand in this case.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stringCommand
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: String containing the command and arguments to be ran.

GetAmmoDamageType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the damage type of given ammo type.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo ID to retrieve the damage type of. Starts from 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: See [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: ID of the ammo type to look up the data for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The [AmmoData](/gmod/Structures/AmmoData) containing all ammo data

GetAmmoForce.DESCRIPTION: Returns the ammo bullet force that is applied when an entity is hit by a bullet of given ammo type.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo ID to retrieve the force of. Starts from 1.

GetAmmoID.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the ammo type ID for given ammo type name.

See [game.GetAmmoName](/gmod/game.GetAmmoName) for reverse.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the ammo type to look up ID of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The ammo type ID of given ammo type name, or -1 if not found

GetAmmoMax.DESCRIPTION: Returns the real maximum amount of ammo of given ammo ID, regardless of the setting of `gmod_maxammo` convar.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo type ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum amount of reserve ammo a player can hold of this ammo type.

GetAmmoName.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the ammo name for given ammo type ID.

See [game.GetAmmoID](/gmod/game.GetAmmoID) for reverse.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo ID to retrieve the name of. Starts from 1.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of given ammo type ID or nil if ammo type ID is invalid.

GetAmmoNPCDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns the damage given ammo type should do to NPCs.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo ID to retrieve the damage info of. Starts from 1.

GetAmmoPlayerDamage.DESCRIPTION: Returns the damage given ammo type should do to players.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Ammo ID to retrieve the damage info of. Starts from 1.

GetAmmoTypes.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of all ammo types currently registered.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing all ammo types. The keys are ammo IDs, the values are the names associated with those IDs.

GetGlobalCounter.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the counter of a Global State.

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the Global State to set. 

If the Global State by that name does not exist, it will be created.

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for a list of default global states.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value of the given Global State, 0 if the global state doesn't exist.

GetGlobalState.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether a Global State is off, active or dead ( inactive )

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the Global State to retrieve the state of. 

If the Global State by that name does not exist, **GLOBAL_DEAD** will be returned.

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for a list of default global states.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The state of the Global State. See [GLOBAL](/gmod/Enums/GLOBAL)

GetIPAddress.DESCRIPTION: Returns the public IP address and port of the current server. This will return the IP/port that you are connecting through when ran clientside.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Returns "0.0.0.0:`port`" on the server when called too early, including in [GM:Initialize](/gmod/GM:Initialize) and [GM:InitPostEntity](/gmod/GM:InitPostEntity). This bug seems to only happen the first time a server is launched, and will return the correct value after switching maps.

NOTES: Returns "0.0.0.0:0" in singleplayer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The IP address and port in the format "x.x.x.x:x"

GetMap.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the name of the current map, without a file extension.

On the menu state, returns "menu".
WARNINGS: In Multiplayer this does not return the current map in the CLIENT realm before GM:Initialize.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the current map, without a file extension.

GetMapNext.DESCRIPTION: Returns the next map that would be loaded according to the file that is set by the mapcyclefile convar.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: nextMap

GetMapVersion.DESCRIPTION: Returns the VBSP version of the current map.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: VBSP version of the currently loaded map, will be either 19, 20 or 21 for L4D1+ maps

GetSkillLevel.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the difficulty level of the game.

**TIP:** You can use this function in your scripted NPCs or Nextbots to make them harder, however, it is a good idea to lock powerful attacks behind the highest difficulty instead of just increasing the health.
NOTES: Internally this is tied to the gamerules entity, so you'll have to wait to wait until GM:InitPostEntity is called to return the skill level

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The difficulty level, Easy( 1 ), Normal( 2 ), Hard( 3 ).

GetTimeScale.DESCRIPTION: Returns the time scale of the game

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The time scale
The world

IsDedicated.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the server is a dedicated server, false if it is a listen server or a singleplayer game.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This always returns false on the client.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the server dedicated or not.

KickID.DESCRIPTION: Kicks a player from the server. This can be ran before the player has spawned.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: UserID or SteamID of the player to kick.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: reason
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Reason to display to the player. This can span across multiple lines.
WARNINGS: This will be shortened to ~512 chars, though this includes the command itself and the player index so will realistically be more around ~498. It is recommended to avoid going near the limit to avoid truncation.

LoadNextMap.DESCRIPTION: Loads the next map according to the nextlevel convar, or from the current mapcycle file set by the respective convar.

MapLoadType.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the map load type of the current map.

After changing the map with the console command `changelevel`, "newgame" is returned. With `changelevel2` (single player only), "transition" is returned.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The load type. Possible values are: "newgame", "loadgame", "transition", "background".

MaxPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum amount of players (including bots) that the server can have.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum amount of players

MountGMA.DESCRIPTION:
Mounts a GMA addon from the disk.

Can be used with [steamworks.DownloadUGC](/gmod/steamworks.DownloadUGC)
NOTES:
Any error models currently loaded that the mounted addon provides will be reloaded.

Any error materials currently loaded that the mounted addon provides will NOT be reloaded. That means that this cannot be used to fix missing map materials, as the map materials are loaded before you are able to call this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Location of the GMA file to mount, retrieved from [steamworks.DownloadUGC](/gmod/steamworks.DownloadUGC). This file does not have to end with the .gma extension, but will be interpreted as a GMA.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: success
If successful, a table of files that have been mounted

SetGlobalCounter.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the counter of a Global State.

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the Global State to set. 

If the Global State by that name does not exist, it will be created.

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for a list of default global states.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: count
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to set for that Global State.

SetGlobalState.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether a Global State is off, active or dead ( inactive )

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the Global State to set. 

If the Global State by that name does not exist, it will be created.

See [Global States](/gmod/Global States) for a list of default global states.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: state
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The state of the Global State. See [GLOBAL](/gmod/Enums/GLOBAL)

SetSkillLevel.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the difficulty level of the game, can be retrieved with [game.GetSkillLevel](/gmod/game.GetSkillLevel).

This will automatically change whenever the "skill" convar is modified serverside.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function will not work if the skill convar doesn't match the targeted value. To work around this, you must use RunConsoleCommand("skill", num) alongside this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: level
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The difficulty level, Easy( 1 ), Normal( 2 ), Hard( 3 ).

SetTimeScale.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the time scale of the game.

This function is supposed to remove the need of using the host_timescale convar, which is cheat protected.

To slow down or speed up the movement of a specific player, use [Player:SetLaggedMovementValue](/gmod/Player:SetLaggedMovementValue) instead.
NOTES: Like host_timescale, this method does not affect sounds, if you wish to change that, look into GM:EntityEmitSound.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: timeScale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new timescale, minimum value is 0.001 and maximum is 5.

SinglePlayer.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the current session is a single player game.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isSinglePlayer

StartSpot.DESCRIPTION: Returns position the player should start from, this is not the same thing as spawn points, it is used to properly transit the player between maps.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: startSpot

game.DESCRIPTION: The game library provides functions to access various features in the game's engine, most of it's functions are related to controlling the map.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: eventName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The event to listen to, travels through hooks with eventName as event.

List of valid events can be found [here](/gmod/Game_Events).

gameevent.DESCRIPTION: Used to interface with the built in game events system.

Call.DESCRIPTION:
Called by the engine to call a hook within the loaded gamemode.

The supplied event 'name' must be defined in the active gamemode. Otherwise, nothing will happen - not even hooks added with [hook.Add](/gmod/hook.Add) will be called.

This is similar to [hook.Run](/gmod/hook.Run) and [hook.Call](/gmod/hook.Call), except the hook library will call hooks created with hook.Add even if there is no corresponding gamemode function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the hook to call.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: args
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The arguments

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The result of the hook function - can be up to 6 values. Returns false if the gamemode function doesn't exist (i.e. nothing happened), but remember - a hook can also return false.

Get.DESCRIPTION: This returns the internally stored gamemode table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the gamemode you want to get

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The gamemode's table

Register.DESCRIPTION: Called by the engine when a gamemode is being loaded.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: gm
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Your GM table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of your gamemode, lowercase, no spaces.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: derived
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The gamemode name that your gamemode is derived from

gamemode.DESCRIPTION: The gamemode library provides functions relating to the gamemode system in Garry's Mod.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: GAMEMODE

gmod.DESCRIPTION: Similar purpose to the [game](/gmod/game) and [engine](/gmod/engine), allows access to various features of the game's engine.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mapData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The JSON encoded string containing all the map data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to load positions for

PlayerLoad.DESCRIPTION: Sets player position and angles from supplied table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to "load" values for

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing Origin and Angle keys for position and angles to set.

PlayerSave.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table containing player position and angles. Used by [gmsave.SaveMap](/gmod/gmsave.SaveMap).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player to "save"

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing player position ( Origin ) and angles ( Angle )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player, whose position should be saved for loading the save

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The encoded to JSON string containing save data

ShouldSaveEntity.DESCRIPTION: Returns if we should save this entity in a duplication or a map save or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: t
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing classname key with entities classname.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Should save entity or not

gmsave.DESCRIPTION: The gmsave library provides functions relating to the singleplayer save system in Garry's Mod.

EnableScreenClicker.DESCRIPTION: Enables the mouse cursor without restricting player movement, like using Sandbox's context menu.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enabled
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the cursor should be enabled or not. (true = enable, false = disable)

InternalCursorMoved.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a mouse move with the given deltas.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: deltaY

InternalKeyCodeReleased.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a key release for the given key.

InternalKeyCodeTyped.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a key type typing to the specified key.

Simulates an ASCII symbol writing.

Doesn't work while the main menu is open!

InternalMouseDoublePressed.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a double mouse key press for the given mouse key.

InternalMousePressed.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a mouse key press for the given mouse key.

InternalMouseReleased.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a mouse key release for the given mouse key.

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key, see [MOUSE](/gmod/Enums/MOUSE).

InternalMouseWheeled.DESCRIPTION: Simulates a mouse wheel scroll with the given delta.

IsConsoleVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the console is visible or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the console is visible or not.

IsGameUIVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the game menu overlay ( main menu ) is open or not.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whenever the game menu overlay ( main menu ) is open or not

mouseY

MouseY.DESCRIPTION: Returns y component of the mouse position.

OpenURL.DESCRIPTION: Opens specified URL in the steam overlay browser. The URL has to start with either http:// or https://

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: You can't click the confirmation if a model panel has focus.
Will silently fail if the URL is more than 512 characters long.

NOTES: When called clientside, user will be asked for confirmation before the website will open.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: url
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: URL to open

ScreenToVector.DESCRIPTION:
Converts the specified screen position to a **direction** vector local to the player's view. A related function is [Vector:ToScreen](/gmod/Vector:ToScreen), which translates a 3D position to a screen coordinate.

[util.AimVector](/gmod/util.AimVector) is a more generic version of this, using a custom view instead of the player's current view.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X coordinate on the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y coordinate on the screen.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Direction

DEPRECATED: Use input.SetCursorPos instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mouseX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The X coordinate to move the cursor to.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mouseY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y coordinate to move the cursor to.

ShowConsole.DESCRIPTION: Shows console in the game UI.

gui.DESCRIPTION: The gui library is similar to the [input](/gmod/input) but features functions that are more focused on the mouse's interaction with GUI panels.

CreateTextureBorder.DESCRIPTION: Used in derma skins to create a bordered rectangle drawing function from an image. The texture is taken either from last argument or from SKIN.GwenTexture

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y coordinate on the texture

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the area on texture

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the area on texture

ARGUMENTS.NAME: left
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Left width of border

ARGUMENTS.NAME: top
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Top width of border

ARGUMENTS.NAME: right

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bottom

The drawing function. Arguments are:

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the area on texture
