ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true, when rendering a poster the quad will be properly drawn in parts in the poster. This is used internally by some Post Processing effects. Certain special textures (frame buffer like textures) do not need this adjustment.

DrawScreenQuadEx.DESCRIPTION:
Draws the the current material set by [render.SetMaterial](/gmod/render.SetMaterial) to the area specified. Color cannot be customized.

See also [render.DrawScreenQuad](/gmod/render.DrawScreenQuad).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X start position of the rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y start position of the rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the rect.

DrawSphere.DESCRIPTION:
Draws a sphere in 3D space. The material previously set with [render.SetMaterial](/gmod/render.SetMaterial) will be applied the sphere's surface.

See also [render.DrawWireframeSphere](/gmod/render.DrawWireframeSphere) for a wireframe equivalent.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the sphere.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Radius of the sphere. Negative radius will make the sphere render inwards rather than outwards.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: longitudeSteps
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of longitude steps. This controls the quality of the sphere. Higher quality will lower performance significantly. 50 is a good number to start with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: latitudeSteps
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of latitude steps. This controls the quality of the sphere. Higher quality will lower performance significantly. 50 is a good number to start with.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the sphere. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the sprite.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the sprite.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the sprite.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Color of the sprite. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

DrawTextureToScreen.DESCRIPTION: Draws a texture over the whole screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The texture to draw

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The texture to draw

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate of the rectangle to draw.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate of the rectangle to draw.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The width of the rectangle to draw.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The height of the rectangle to draw.

DrawWireframeBox.DESCRIPTION: Draws a wireframe box in 3D space.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: angle
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Angles of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The lowest corner of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The highest corner of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the box. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: writeZ
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sets whenever to write to the zBuffer.

DrawWireframeSphere.DESCRIPTION: Draws a wireframe sphere in 3d space.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position of the sphere.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The size of the sphere.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: longitudeSteps
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The amount of longitude steps. 

The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: latitudeSteps
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The amount of latitude steps. 

The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The color of the wireframe. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: writeZ
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to consider the Z buffer. If false, the wireframe will be drawn over everything currently drawn. If true, it will be drawn with depth considered, as if it were a regular object in 3D space.

EnableClipping.DESCRIPTION: Sets the status of the clip renderer, returning previous state.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Reloading the map does not reset the previous value of this function.

WARNINGS: To prevent unintended rendering behavior of other mods/the game, you must reset the clipping state to its previous value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: state
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: New clipping state.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Previous clipping state.

EndBeam.DESCRIPTION: Ends the beam mesh of a beam started with [render.StartBeam](/gmod/render.StartBeam).

FogColor.DESCRIPTION: Sets the color of the fog.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: red
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Red channel of the fog color, 0 - 255.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: green
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Green channel of the fog color, 0 - 255.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Blue channel of the fog color, 0 - 255.

FogEnd.DESCRIPTION: Sets the at which the fog reaches its max density.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance at which the fog reaches its max density.
NOTES: If used in GM:SetupSkyboxFog, this value **must** be scaled by the first argument of the hook

FogMaxDensity.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum density of the fog.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxDensity
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum density of the fog, 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fogMode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fog mode, see [MATERIAL_FOG](/gmod/Enums/MATERIAL_FOG).

FogStart.DESCRIPTION: Sets the distance at which the fog starts showing up.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fogStart
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance at which the fog starts showing up.
NOTES: If used in GM:SetupSkyboxFog, this value **must** be scaled by the first argument of the hook

GetAmbientLightColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the ambient color of the map.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: color
blend
The bloom texture

GetColorModulation.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current color modulation values as normals.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: r
g
b

GetDXLevel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum available directX version.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: dxLevel
Red part of the color.
Green part of the color
Blue part of the color

GetFogDistances.DESCRIPTION: Returns the fog start and end distance.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Fog start distance set by [render.FogStart](/gmod/render.FogStart)
For end distance set by [render.FogEnd](/gmod/render.FogEnd)
Fog Z distance set by [render.SetFogZ](/gmod/render.SetFogZ)
Fog mode, see [MATERIAL_FOG](/gmod/Enums/MATERIAL_FOG)

GetHDREnabled.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether HDR is currently enabled or not. This takes into account hardware support, current map and current client settings.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the player currently has HDR enabled.

GetLightColor.DESCRIPTION: Gets the light exposure on the specified position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the surface to get the light from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: lightColor

GetPowerOfTwoTexture.DESCRIPTION: Returns the render target's power of two texture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The power of two texture, which is **_rt_poweroftwofb** by default.

GetRenderTarget.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the currently active render target.

Instead of saving the current render target using this function and restoring to it later, it is generally better practice to use [render.PushRenderTarget](/gmod/render.PushRenderTarget) and [render.PopRenderTarget](/gmod/render.PopRenderTarget).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The currently active Render Target

GetResolvedFullFrameDepth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the _rt_ResolvedFullFrameDepth texture for SSAO depth.

GetScreenEffectTexture.DESCRIPTION:
Obtain an [ITexture](/gmod/ITexture) of the screen. You must call [render.UpdateScreenEffectTexture](/gmod/render.UpdateScreenEffectTexture) in order to update this texture with the currently rendered scene.

This texture is mainly used within [GM:RenderScreenspaceEffects](/gmod/GM:RenderScreenspaceEffects)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: textureIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Max index is 3, but engine only creates the first two for you.

GetSuperFPTex.DESCRIPTION: Returns a floating point texture the same resolution as the screen.
NOTES: The gmodscreenspace doesn't behave as expected when drawing a floating-point texture to an integer texture (e.g. the default render target). Use an UnlitGeneric material instead

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Render target named "__rt_supertexture1"
Render target named "__rt_supertexture2"

GetSurfaceColor.DESCRIPTION: Performs a render trace and returns the color of the surface hit, this uses a low res version of the texture.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position to trace from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the trace.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: color

GetToneMappingScaleLinear.DESCRIPTION: Returns a vector representing linear tone mapping scale.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The vector representing linear tone mapping scale.

MaterialOverride.DESCRIPTION: Sets the render material override for all next calls of [Entity:DrawModel](/gmod/Entity:DrawModel). Also overrides [render.MaterialOverrideByIndex](/gmod/render.MaterialOverrideByIndex).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to use as override, use nil to disable.

MaterialOverrideByIndex.DESCRIPTION:
Similar to [render.MaterialOverride](/gmod/render.MaterialOverride), but overrides the materials per index.

[render.MaterialOverride](/gmod/render.MaterialOverride) overrides effects of this function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Starts with 0, the index of the material to override

ARGUMENTS.NAME: material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to override with

MaxTextureHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum texture height the renderer can handle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: maxTextureHeight

MaxTextureWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the maximum texture width the renderer can handle.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: maxTextureWidth

Model.DESCRIPTION: Creates a new [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel), renders it at the specified pos/ang, and removes it. Can also be given an existing [CSEnt](/gmod/CSEnt) to reuse instead.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Using this with a map model ([game.GetWorld](/gmod/game.GetWorld)():[GetModel](/gmod/Entity:GetModel)()) crashes the game.

NOTES: This function is only meant to be used in a single render pass kind of scenario, if you need to render a model continuously, use a cached Global.ClientsideModel and provide it as a second argument.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: settings
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Requires:
* [string](/gmod/string) model - The model to draw
* [Vector](/gmod/Vector) pos - The position to draw the model at
* [Angle](/gmod/Angle) angle - The angles to draw the model at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If provided, this entity will be reused instead of creating a new one with [ClientsideModel](/gmod/Global.ClientsideModel). Note that the ent's model, position and angles will be changed, and [Entity:SetNoDraw](/gmod/Entity:SetNoDraw) will be set to true.

ModelMaterialOverride.DESCRIPTION: Sets a material to override a model's default material. Similar to [Entity:SetMaterial](/gmod/Entity:SetMaterial) except it uses an [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial) argument and it can be used to change materials on models which are part of the world geometry.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material override.

OverrideAlphaWriteEnable.DESCRIPTION:
Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the alpha channel of the current render target.

See also [render.OverrideBlend](/gmod/render.OverrideBlend).
NOTES: Doing surface draw calls with alpha set to 0 is a no-op and will never have any effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the override.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldWrite
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the previous argument is true, sets whether the next rendering operations should write to the alpha channel or not. Has no effect if the previous argument is false.

OverrideBlend.DESCRIPTION:
Overrides the internal graphical functions used to determine the final color and alpha of a rendered texture.

See also [render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable](/gmod/render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable).
NOTES: Doing surface draw calls with alpha set to 0 is a no-op and won't have an effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enabled
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to enable, false to disable. No other arguments are required when disabling.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: srcBlend
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The source color blend function [BLEND](/gmod/Enums/BLEND). Determines how a rendered texture's final color should be calculated.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: destBlend
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The destination color blend function [BLEND](/gmod/Enums/BLEND).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blendFunc
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blend mode used for drawing the color layer [BLENDFUNC](/gmod/Enums/BLENDFUNC).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: srcBlendAlpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The source alpha blend function [BLEND](/gmod/Enums/BLEND). Determines how a rendered texture's final alpha should be calculated.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: destBlendAlpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The destination alpha blend function [BLEND](/gmod/Enums/BLEND).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blendFuncAlpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blend mode used for drawing the alpha layer [BLENDFUNC](/gmod/Enums/BLENDFUNC).

OverrideBlendFunc.DESCRIPTION:
Overrides the internal graphical functions used to determine the final color and alpha of a rendered texture.

See also [render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable](/gmod/render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable).
DEPRECATED: Use render.OverrideBlend instead.
NOTES: Doing surface draw calls with alpha set to 0 is a no-op and will never have any effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enabled
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: true to enable, false to disable. No other arguments are required when disabling.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: srcBlend
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The source color blend function [BLEND](/gmod/Enums/BLEND). Determines how a rendered texture's final color should be calculated.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: srcBlendAlpha
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The source alpha blend function [BLEND](/gmod/Enums/BLEND). Determines how a rendered texture's final alpha should be calculated.

OverrideColorWriteEnable.DESCRIPTION: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the color channel of the current render target.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the override.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldWrite
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the previous argument is true, sets whether the next rendering operations should write to the color channel or not. Has no effect if the previous argument is false.

OverrideDepthEnable.DESCRIPTION: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the depth buffer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the override.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shouldWrite
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If the previous argument is true, sets whether the next rendering operations should write to the depth buffer or not. Has no effect if the previous argument is false.

PopCustomClipPlane.DESCRIPTION: Removes the current active clipping plane from the clip plane stack.

PopFilterMag.DESCRIPTION:
Pops the current texture magnification filter from the filter stack.

See [render.PushFilterMag](/gmod/render.PushFilterMag)

PopFilterMin.DESCRIPTION:
Pops the current texture minification filter from the filter stack.

See [render.PushFilterMin](/gmod/render.PushFilterMin)

PopFlashlightMode.DESCRIPTION: Pops the current flashlight mode from the flashlight mode stack.

PopRenderTarget.DESCRIPTION:
Pops the last render target and viewport from the RT stack and sets them as the current render target and viewport.

This is should be called to restore the previous render target and viewport after a call to [render.PushRenderTarget](/gmod/render.PushRenderTarget).

PushCustomClipPlane.DESCRIPTION: Pushes a new clipping plane of the clip plane stack and sets it as active.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: A max of 2 clip planes are supported on Linux/POSIX, and 6 on Windows.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: normal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The normal of the clipping plane.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: distance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The distance of the plane from the world origin. You can use [Vector:Dot](/gmod/Vector:Dot) between the normal and any point on the plane to find this.

PushFilterMag.DESCRIPTION: Pushes a texture filter onto the magnification texture filter stack.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texFilterType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The texture filter type, see [TEXFILTER](/gmod/Enums/TEXFILTER)

PushFilterMin.DESCRIPTION: Pushes a texture filter onto the minification texture filter stack.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texFilterType
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The texture filter type, see [TEXFILTER](/gmod/Enums/TEXFILTER)

PushFlashlightMode.DESCRIPTION: Enables the flashlight projection for the upcoming rendering.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will leave models lit under specific conditions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the flashlight mode should be enabled or disabled.

PushRenderTarget.DESCRIPTION:
Pushes the current render target and viewport to the RT stack then sets a new current render target and viewport. If the viewport is not specified, the dimensions of the render target are used instead.

This is similar to a call to [render.SetRenderTarget](/gmod/render.SetRenderTarget) and [render.SetViewPort](/gmod/render.SetViewPort) where the current render target and viewport have been saved beforehand, except the viewport isn't clipped to screen bounds.

See also [render.PopRenderTarget](/gmod/render.PopRenderTarget).
NOTES: If you want to render to the render target in 2d mode and it is not the same size as the screen, use cam.Start2D and cam.End2D.
If the render target is bigger than the screen, rendering done with the surface library will be clipped to the screen bounds unless you call Global.DisableClipping

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new render target to be used.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X origin of the viewport.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y origin of the viewport.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the viewport.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the viewport

ReadPixel.DESCRIPTION: Reads the color of the specified pixel from the RenderTarget sent by [render.CapturePixels](/gmod/render.CapturePixels)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: r
g
b

RedownloadAllLightmaps.DESCRIPTION: This applies the changes made to map lighting using [engine.LightStyle](/gmod/engine.LightStyle).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: DoStaticProps
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: When true, this will also apply lighting changes to static props. This is really slow on large maps.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: UpdateStaticLighting
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Forces all props to update their static lighting. Can be slow.

RenderHUD.DESCRIPTION: Renders the HUD on the screen.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X position for the HUD draw origin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y position for the HUD draw origin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the HUD draw.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the HUD draw.

RenderView.DESCRIPTION: Renders the scene with the specified viewData to the current active render target.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Static props and LODs are rendered improperly due to incorrectly perceived distance.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: view
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The view data to be used in the rendering. See [ViewData](/gmod/Structures/ViewData). Any missing value is assumed to be that of the current view. Similarly, you can make a normal render by simply not passing this table at all.

ResetModelLighting.DESCRIPTION:
Resets the model lighting to the specified color.

Calls [render.SetModelLighting](/gmod/render.SetModelLighting) for every direction with given color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red part of the color, 0-1

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green part of the color, 0-1

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue part of the color, 0-1

ResetToneMappingScale.DESCRIPTION:
Resets the HDR tone multiplier to the specified value.

This will only work on HDR maps, and the value will automatically fade to what it was ( or whatever [render.SetGoalToneMappingScale](/gmod/render.SetGoalToneMappingScale) is ) if called only once.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value which should be used as multiplier.

SetAmbientLight.DESCRIPTION: Sets the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red part of the color, 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green part of the color, 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue part of the color, 0-1.

SetBlend.DESCRIPTION: Sets the alpha blending for every upcoming render operation.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not affect non-model render.Draw* functions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Blending value from 0-1.

SetColorMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the current drawing material to "color".

The material is defined as:

```

 "UnlitGeneric"

 {

 	"$basetexture" "color/white"

 	"$model" 		1

 	"$translucent" 	1

 	"$vertexalpha" 	1

 	"$vertexcolor" 	1

 }

```

SetColorMaterialIgnoreZ.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the current drawing material to `color_ignorez`.

The material is defined as:

```

 "UnlitGeneric"

 {

 	"$basetexture" "color/white"

  	"$model" 		1

 	"$translucent" 	1

 	"$vertexalpha" 	1

 	"$vertexcolor" 	1

 	"$ignorez"		1

 }

```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red channel multiplier normal ranging from 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green channel multiplier normal ranging from 0-1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue channel multiplier normal ranging from 0-1.

SetFogZ.DESCRIPTION: If the fog mode is set to [MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR_BELOW_FOG_Z](/gmod/Enums/MATERIAL_FOG), the fog will only be rendered below the specified height.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fogZ
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The fog Z.

SetGoalToneMappingScale.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the goal HDR tone mapping scale.

Use this in a rendering/think hook as it is reset every frame.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scale
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The target scale.

SetLightingMode.DESCRIPTION: Sets lighting mode when rendering something.
NOTES: **Do not forget to restore the default value** to avoid unexpected behavior, like the world and the HUD/UI being affected

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Mode
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Lighting render mode

Possible values are:
* 0 - Default
* 1 - Total fullbright, similar to `mat_fullbright 1` but excluding some weapon view models
* 2 - Increased brightness(?), models look fullbright

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not work for prop_physics.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lightingOrigin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position from which the light should be "emitted".

SetLightmapTexture.DESCRIPTION: Sets the texture to be used as the lightmap in upcoming rendering operations. This is required when rendering meshes using a material with a lightmapped shader such as LightmappedGeneric.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The texture to be used as the lightmap.

SetLocalModelLights.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up the local lighting for any upcoming render operation. Up to 4 local lights can be defined, with one of three different types (point, directional, spot).

Disables all local lights if called with no arguments.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lights
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing up to 4 tables for each light source that should be set up. Each of these tables should contain the properties of its associated light source, see [LocalLight](/gmod/Structures/LocalLight).

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the material to be used in any upcoming render operation using the [render](/gmod/render).

Not to be confused with [surface.SetMaterial](/gmod/surface.SetMaterial).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mat
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to be used.

SetModelLighting.DESCRIPTION:
Sets up the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation. Ambient lighting can be seen as a cube enclosing the object to be drawn, each of its faces representing a directional light source that shines towards the object. Thus, there is a total of six different light sources that can be configured separately.

Light color components are not restricted to a specific range (i.e. 0-255), instead, higher values will result in a brighter light.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lightDirection
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The light source to edit, see [BOX](/gmod/Enums/BOX).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: red
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red component of the light color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: green
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green component of the light color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue component of the light color.

SetRenderTarget.DESCRIPTION: Sets the render target to the specified rt.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new render target to be used.

SetRenderTargetEx.DESCRIPTION: Sets the render target with the specified index to the specified rt.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rtIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the rt to set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new render target to be used.

SetScissorRect.DESCRIPTION: Sets a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X start coordinate of the scissor rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y start coordinate of the scissor rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endX
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X end coordinate of the scissor rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endY
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y end coordinate of the scissor rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: enable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Enable or disable the scissor rect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: red
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red channel of the shadow color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: green
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green channel of the shadow color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: blue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue channel of the shadow color.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shadowDirections
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new shadow direction.

SetShadowDistance.DESCRIPTION: Sets the maximum shadow projection range.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: shadowDistance
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new maximum shadow distance.

SetShadowsDisabled.DESCRIPTION: Sets whether any future render operations will ignore shadow drawing.

SetStencilCompareFunction.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the compare function of the stencil.

Pixels which fail the stencil comparison function are not written to the render target. The operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values for these pixels can be set using [render.SetStencilFailOperation](/gmod/render.SetStencilFailOperation).

Pixels which pass the stencil comparison function are written to the render target unless they fail the depth buffer test (where applicable). The operation to perform on the stencil buffer values for these pixels can be set using [render.SetStencilPassOperation](/gmod/render.SetStencilPassOperation) and [render.SetStencilZFailOperation](/gmod/render.SetStencilZFailOperation).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: compareFunction
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Compare function, see [STENCILCOMPARISONFUNCTION](/gmod/Enums/STENCILCOMPARISONFUNCTION), and [STENCIL](/gmod/Enums/STENCIL) for short.

SetStencilEnable.DESCRIPTION:
Sets whether stencil tests are carried out for each rendered pixel.

Only pixels passing the stencil test are written to the render target.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: newState
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new state.

SetStencilFailOperation.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was not successful.

Note that this takes place **before** depth testing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: failOperation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Fail operation function, see [STENCILOPERATION](/gmod/Enums/STENCILOPERATION).

SetStencilPassOperation.DESCRIPTION: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was successful.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: passOperation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Pass operation function, see [STENCILOPERATION](/gmod/Enums/STENCILOPERATION).

SetStencilReferenceValue.DESCRIPTION: Sets the reference value which will be used for all stencil operations. This is an unsigned integer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: referenceValue
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Reference value.

SetStencilTestMask.DESCRIPTION: Sets the unsigned 8-bit test bitflag mask to be used for any stencil testing.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mask
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The mask bitflag.

SetStencilWriteMask.DESCRIPTION: Sets the unsigned 8-bit write bitflag mask to be used for any writes to the stencil buffer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mask
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The mask bitflag.

SetStencilZFailOperation.DESCRIPTION: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the stencil test is passed but the depth buffer test fails.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: zFailOperation
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Z fail operation function, see [STENCILOPERATION](/gmod/Enums/STENCILOPERATION)

SetViewPort.DESCRIPTION:
Changes the view port position and size. The values will be clamped to the game's screen resolution.

If you are looking to render something to a texture (render target), you should use [render.PushRenderTarget](/gmod/render.PushRenderTarget).
NOTES: This function will override values of Global.ScrW and Global.ScrH with the ones you set.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: X origin of the view port.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Y origin of the view port.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: w
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the view port.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: h
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Height of the view port.

Spin.DESCRIPTION:
Swaps the frame buffers/cycles the frame. In other words, this updates the screen.

If you take a really long time during a single frame render, it is a good idea to use this and let the user know that the game isn't stuck.

StartBeam.DESCRIPTION: Start a new beam draw operation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: segmentCount
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount of beam segments that are about to be drawn.

SupportsHDR.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the player's hardware supports HDR. (High Dynamic Range) HDR can still be disabled by the `mat_hdr_level` console variable or just not be supported by the map.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if the player's hardware supports HDR.

SupportsPixelShaders_1_4.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 1.4.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether Pixel Shaders 1.4 are supported or not.

SupportsPixelShaders_2_0.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 2.0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether Pixel Shaders 2.0 are supported or not.

SupportsVertexShaders_2_0.DESCRIPTION: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of vertex shaders 2.0.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether Vertex Shaders 2.0 are supported or not.

SuppressEngineLighting.DESCRIPTION: Suppresses or enables any engine lighting for any upcoming render operation.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This does not affect [IMesh](/gmod/IMesh)es.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: suppressLighting
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: True to suppress false to enable.

TurnOnToneMapping.DESCRIPTION: Enables HDR tone mapping which influences the brightness.

UpdateFullScreenDepthTexture.DESCRIPTION:
Updates the texture returned by [render.GetFullScreenDepthTexture](/gmod/render.GetFullScreenDepthTexture).

Silently fails if [render.SupportsPixelShaders_2_0](/gmod/render.SupportsPixelShaders_2_0) returns false.

UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture.DESCRIPTION: Updates the power of two texture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns [render.GetPowerOfTwoTexture](/gmod/render.GetPowerOfTwoTexture).

UpdateRefractTexture.DESCRIPTION: Pretty much alias of [render.UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture](/gmod/render.UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture) but does not return the texture.

UpdateScreenEffectTexture.DESCRIPTION: Copies the entire screen to the screen effect texture, which can be acquired via [render.GetScreenEffectTexture](/gmod/render.GetScreenEffectTexture). This function is mainly intended to be used in [GM:RenderScreenspaceEffects](/gmod/GM:RenderScreenspaceEffects)

render.DESCRIPTION: The render library is a powerful set of functions that let you control how the world and its contents are rendered. It can also be used to draw some 3D clientside effects such as beams, boxes and spheres.

AddFile.DESCRIPTION:
Adds the specified and all related files to the files the client should download.

For convenience, this function will automatically add any other files that are related to the selected one, and throw an error if it can't find them. For example, a `.vmt` file will automatically add the `.vtf` with the same name, and a `.mdl` file will automatically add all `.vvd`, `.ani`, `.dx80.vtx`, `.dx90.vtx`, `.sw.vtx`, `.phy` and `.jpg` files with the same name, with a separate error for each missing file.

If you do not want it to do this, use [resource.AddSingleFile](/gmod/resource.AddSingleFile).
NOTES: The file must exist on the server or players will not download it!

Running this function using a path relative to the main `garrysmod/` folder will not work for files in addons and gamemodes. Instead, the files must be added relative to their respective content folders. For example, a sound file from an addon would use the path "sound/[FILENAME_AND_EXTENSION]," despite the file being located in "addons/[ADDON_NAME]/sound/[FILENAME_AND_EXTENSION]"
WARNINGS: There's a 8192 downloadable file limit. If you need more, consider using Workshop addons - resource.AddWorkshop. You should also consider the fact that you have way too many downloads. This limit is shared among all resource.Add functions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Virtual path of the file to be added, relative to `garrysmod/`. Do not add `.bz2` to the filepath. Do not put `gamemodes/*gamemodename*/content/` or `addons/

AddSingleFile.DESCRIPTION:
Adds the specified file to the files the client should download.

If you wish to add textures or models, consider using [resource.AddFile](/gmod/resource.AddFile) to add all the files required for a texture/model.
NOTES: The file must exist on the server or players will not download it!

If you need more than 8192, consider using Workshop addons - resource.AddWorkshop. You should also consider the fact that you have way too many downloads. This limit is shared among all resource.Add functions.
WARNINGS: There's a 8192 downloadable file limit.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path of the file to be added, relative to garrysmod/

AddWorkshop.DESCRIPTION:
Adds a workshop addon for the client to download before entering the server.

Having the raw files from a workshop item does not count as having already downloaded it.

So players who previously downloaded a map through Fast Download will have to re-download it if you use the workshop.

You should try to only add addons that have custom content ( models, sounds, etc ).

Gamemodes that are [workshop enabled](/gmod/Gamemode_Creation#Gamemode_Text_File) are automatically added to this list - so there's no need to add them.

The server's current map is also automatically added, if it is loaded from a workshop addon.
WARNINGS: This will not "install" the addon on your server, see Workshop for Dedicated Servers for installing Steam Workshop addons onto your servers

ARGUMENTS.NAME: workshopid
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The workshop id of the file. This cannot be a collection.

resource.DESCRIPTION: The resource library is used to control what files are sent to clients who join a server, this includes models, materials, sounds, text files but not Lua files.

AddRestoreHook.DESCRIPTION: Adds a restore/load hook for the Half-Life 2 save system.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to be called when an engine save is being loaded. It has one argument:

[IRestore](/gmod/IRestore) save - The restore object to be used to read data from save file that is being loaded

You can also use those functions to read data:

[saverestore.ReadVar](/gmod/saverestore.ReadVar)

[saverestore.ReadTable](/gmod/saverestore.ReadTable)

[saverestore.LoadEntity](/gmod/saverestore.LoadEntity)

AddSaveHook.DESCRIPTION: Adds a save hook for the Half-Life 2 save system. You can this to carry data through level transitions in Half-Life 2.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for this hook.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to be called when an engine save is being saved. It has one argument:

[ISave](/gmod/ISave) save - The save object to be used to write data to the save file that is being saved

You can also use those functions to save data:

[saverestore.WriteVar](/gmod/saverestore.WriteVar)

[saverestore.WriteTable](/gmod/saverestore.WriteTable)

[saverestore.SaveEntity](/gmod/saverestore.SaveEntity)

LoadEntity.DESCRIPTION: Loads [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable) from the save game file that is being loaded and merges it with the given entitys [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity which will receive the loaded values from the save.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The restore object to read the [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable) from.

LoadGlobal.DESCRIPTION:
Called by engine when a save is being loaded.

This handles loading gamemode and calls all of the hooks added with [saverestore.AddRestoreHook](/gmod/saverestore.AddRestoreHook).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The restore object to read data from the save file with.

PreRestore.DESCRIPTION: Called by the engine just before [saverestore.LoadGlobal](/gmod/saverestore.LoadGlobal) is.

PreSave.DESCRIPTION: Called by the engine just before [saverestore.SaveGlobal](/gmod/saverestore.SaveGlobal) is.

ReadTable.DESCRIPTION: Reads a table from the save game file that is being loaded.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The restore object to read the table from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table that has been read, if any

ReadVar.DESCRIPTION:
Loads a variable from the save game file that is being loaded.

Variables will be read in the save order you have saved them.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The restore object to read variables from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The variable that was read, if any.

SaveEntity.DESCRIPTION: Saves entitys [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable) to the save game file that is being saved.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to save [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable) of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The save object to save [Entity:GetTable](/gmod/Entity:GetTable) to.

SaveGlobal.DESCRIPTION:
Called by engine when a save is being saved.

This handles saving gamemode and calls all of the hooks added with [saverestore.AddSaveHook](/gmod/saverestore.AddSaveHook).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The save object to write data into the save file.

WritableKeysInTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns how many writable keys are in the given table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to test.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of keys that can be written with [saverestore.WriteTable](/gmod/saverestore.WriteTable).

WriteTable.DESCRIPTION: Write a table to a save game file that is being saved.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to write

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The save object to write the table to.

WriteVar.DESCRIPTION: Writes a variable to the save game file that is being saved.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The value to save.

It can be one of the following types: [number](/gmod/number), [boolean](/gmod/boolean), [string](/gmod/string), [Entity](/gmod/Entity), [Angle](/gmod/Angle), [Vector](/gmod/Vector) or [table](/gmod/table).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: save
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The save object to write the variable to.

saverestore.DESCRIPTION: The saverestore library contains functions relating to the singleplayer save system built into the game.

Alias.DESCRIPTION: Defines an alias string that can be used to refer to another classname

ARGUMENTS.NAME: alias
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A new string which can be used to refer to another classname

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname the alias should refer to

Get.DESCRIPTION: Returns a copy of the ENT table for a class, including functions defined by the base class

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname of the ENT table to return, can be an alias

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: entTable

GetList.DESCRIPTION: Returns a copy of the list of all ENT tables registered

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of all entities in the following format: (table keys are the classnames)

* [table](/gmod/table) t - The [ENT](/gmod/Structures/ENT) table associated with the entity

* [boolean](/gmod/boolean) isBaseType - Always true

* [string](/gmod/string) Base - The entity base (note capital B in the key name)

* [string](/gmod/string) type - The entity type

GetMember.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a member of entity's table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity's class name

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of member to retrieve

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The member or nil if failed

GetSpawnable.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of all ENT tables which contain either ENT.Spawnable or ENT.AdminSpawnable

GetStored.DESCRIPTION: Returns the actual ENT table for a class. Modifying functions/variables in this table will change newly spawned entities

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname of the ENT table to return

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: entTable

GetType.DESCRIPTION: Returns the 'type' of a class, this will one of the following: 'anim', 'ai', 'brush', 'point'.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname to check

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: type

IsBasedOn.DESCRIPTION: Checks if name is based on base

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity's class name to be checked

ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Base class name to be checked

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if class name is based on base, else false.

OnLoaded.DESCRIPTION:
Called after all ENTS have been loaded and runs [baseclass.Set](/gmod/baseclass.Set) on each one.

You can retrieve all the currently registered ENTS with [scripted_ents.GetList](/gmod/scripted_ents.GetList).
NOTES: This is not called after an ENT auto refresh, and thus the inherited baseclass functions retrieved with baseclass.Get will not be updated

Register.DESCRIPTION: Registers an ENT table with a classname. Reregistering an existing classname will automatically update the functions of all existing entities of that class.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Sub-tables provided in the first argument will not carry over their metatable, and will receive a BaseClass key if the table was merged with the base's. Userdata references, which includes Vectors, Angles, Entities, etc. will not be copied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ENT
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ENT table to register.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The classname to register.

scripted_ents.DESCRIPTION: The scripted_ents library allows you to access information about any scripted entities loaded into the game, as well as register your own entities.

AddProvider.DESCRIPTION: Adds a search result provider. For examples, see gamemodes/sandbox/gamemode/cl_search_models.lua

ARGUMENTS.NAME: provider
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Provider function. It has one argument: [string](/gmod/string) searchQuery
You must return a list of tables structured like this:
* [string](/gmod/string) text - Text to "Copy to clipboard"
* [function](/gmod/function) func - Function to use/spawn the item
* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) icon - A panel to add to spawnmenu
* [table](/gmod/table) words - A table of words?

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If provided, ensures that only one provider exists with the given ID at a time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: query
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Search query

ARGUMENTS.NAME: types
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set, only searches given provider type(s), instead of everything. For example `"tool"` will only search tools in Sandbox. Can be a table for multiple types.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: maxResults
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How many results to stop at

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of results

AddCurrentServerToFavorites.DESCRIPTION: Adds current server the player is on to their favorites.

PlayerList.DESCRIPTION: Queries a server for its player list.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ip
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The IP address of the server, including the port.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to be called if and when the request finishes. Function has one argument, a table containing tables with player info. 

Each table with player info has next fields:

[number](/gmod/number) time - The amount of time the player is playing on the server, in seconds

[string](/gmod/string) name - The player name

[number](/gmod/number) score - The players score

Query.DESCRIPTION: Queries the master server for server list.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: data
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The information about what kind of servers we want. See [ServerQueryData](/gmod/Structures/ServerQueryData).

serverlist.DESCRIPTION: Menu state library to query the master server list.

Add.DESCRIPTION: Creates a sound script. It can also override sounds, which seems to only work when set on the server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sounds properties. See [SoundData](/gmod/Structures/SoundData)

AddSoundOverrides.DESCRIPTION: Overrides sounds defined inside of a txt file; typically used for adding map-specific sounds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filepath
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the script file to load.

EmitHint.DESCRIPTION: Emits a sound hint to the game elements to react to, for example to repel or attract antlions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: hint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The hint to emit. See [SOUND](/gmod/Enums/SOUND)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to emit the hint at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The volume or radius of the hint

ARGUMENTS.NAME: duration
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The duration of the hint in seconds

Generate.DESCRIPTION: Creates a sound from a function.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This function cannot generate sounds that have a duration of less than 1 second.
Sounds persist between disconnects.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: indentifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An unique identified for the sound.
WARNINGS: You cannot override already existing ones.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: samplerate
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sample rate of the sound. Must be `11025`, `22050` or `44100`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: length
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The length in seconds of the sound to generate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A function which will be called to generate every sample on the sound. This function gets the current sample number passed as the first argument. The return value must be between `-1.0` and `1.0`. Other values will wrap back to the -1 to 1 range and basically clip. There are **65535** possible quantifiable values between -1 and 1.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the sound script

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The properties of the soundscript. See [SoundData](/gmod/Structures/SoundData)

GetTable.DESCRIPTION: Returns a list of all registered sound scripts.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The list/array of all registered sound scripts ( No other information is provided )

Play.DESCRIPTION:
Plays a sound from the specified position in the world.
If you want to play a sound without a position, such as a UI sound, use [surface.PlaySound](/gmod/surface.PlaySound) instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A string path to the sound.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A vector describing where the sound should play.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Level
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Sound level in decibels. 75 is normal. Ranges from 20 to 180, where 180 is super loud. This affects how far away the sound will be heard.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Pitch
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: An integer describing the sound pitch. Range is from 0 to 255. 100 is normal pitch.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Volume
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A float ranging from 0-1 describing the output volume of the sound.

PlayFile.DESCRIPTION:
Plays a file from GMod directory. You can find a list of all error codes [here](http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html)

For external file/stream playback, see [sound.PlayURL](/gmod/sound.PlayURL).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This fails for looping .wav files in 3D mode.
This fails with unicode file names.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The path to the file to play.

Unlike other sound functions and structures, the path is relative to `garrysmod/` instead of `garrysmod/sound/`

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Flags for the sound. Can be one or more of following, separated by a space (" "):

* 3d - Makes the sound 3D, so you can set its position

* mono - Forces the sound to have only one channel

* noplay - Forces the sound not to play as soon as this function is called

* noblock - Disables streaming in blocks. It is more resource-intensive, but it is required for [IGModAudioChannel:SetTime](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:SetTime).

If you don't want to use any of the above, you can just leave it as "".

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Callback function that is called as soon as the the stream is loaded. It has next arguments:

* [IGModAudioChannel](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel) soundchannel - The sound channel. Will be nil if an error occured.

* [number](/gmod/number) errorID - ID of an error if an error has occured. Will be nil, otherwise.

* [string](/gmod/string) errorName - Name of an error if an error has occured. Will be nil, otherwise.

PlayURL.DESCRIPTION:
Allows you to play external sound files, as well as online radio streams.

You can find a list of all error codes [here](http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html)

For offline file playback, see [sound.PlayFile](/gmod/sound.PlayFile).

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Due to a bug with [BASS](http://www.un4seen.com/), AAC codec streams cannot be played in 3D mode.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: url
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the sound to play

ARGUMENTS.NAME: flags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Flags for the sound. Can be one or more of following, separated by a space (" "):

* 3d - Makes the sound 3D, so you can set its position

* mono - Forces the sound to have only one channel

* noplay - Forces the sound not to play as soon as this function is called

* noblock - Disables streaming in blocks. It is more resource-intensive, but it is required for [IGModAudioChannel:SetTime](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel:SetTime).

If you don't want to use any of the above, you can just leave it as "".

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Callback function that is called as soon as the the stream is loaded. It has next arguments:

[IGModAudioChannel](/gmod/IGModAudioChannel) soundchannel - The sound channel

[number](/gmod/number) errorID - ID of an error, if an error has occured

[string](/gmod/string) errorName - Name of an error, if an error has occured

AddPropCategory.DESCRIPTION:
Used to add addon spawnlists to the spawnmenu tree. This function should be called within [SANDBOX:PopulatePropMenu](/gmod/SANDBOX:PopulatePropMenu).

Addon spawnlists will not save to disk if edited.
WARNINGS: You should never try to modify player customized spawnlists!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A unique classname of the list.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the category displayed to the player, e.g. `Comic Props`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: contents
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of entries for the spawn menu. It must be numerically indexed.

Each member of the table is a sub-table containing a type member, and other members depending on the type.

New content types can be added via [spawnmenu.AddContentType](/gmod/spawnmenu.AddContentType).

| [string](/gmod/string) type | Description | Other members |

| ------------- | ---------- | ----------------- |

| "header" | a simple header for organization | [string](/gmod/string) text - The text that the header will display |

| "model" | spawns a model where the player is looking | [string](/gmod/string) model - The path to the model file 	 [number](/gmod/number) skin - The skin for the model to use (optional)  [string](/gmod/string) body - The bodygroups for the model (optional)  [number](/gmod/number) wide - The width of the spawnicon (optional)  [number](/gmod/number) tall - The height of the spawnicon (optional) |

| "entity" | spawns an entity where the player is looking(appears in the Entities tab by default) | [string](/gmod/string) spawnname - The filename of the entity, for example "sent_ball"  [string](/gmod/string) nicename - The name of the entity to display  [string](/gmod/string) material - The icon to display, this should be set to "entities/

ARGUMENTS.NAME: icon
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The icon to use in the tree.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique ID number for the spawnlist category. Used to make sub categories. See "parentID" parameter below. If not set, it will be automatically set to ever increasing number, starting with 1000.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parentID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The unique ID of the parent category. This will make the created category a subcategory of category with given unique ID. `0` makes this a base category (such as `Builder`).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: needsApp
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The needed game for this prop category, if one is needed. If the specified game is not mounted, the category isn't shown. This uses the shortcut name, e.g. `cstrike`, and not the Steam AppID.

spawnmenu.DESCRIPTION: The spawnmenu library is a set of functions that allow you to control the spawn (Q) menu.

Begin.DESCRIPTION:
Tells the engine a set of queries is coming. Will wait until [sql.Commit](/gmod/sql.Commit) is called to run them.

This is most useful when you run more than 100+ queries.

This is equivalent to :

```

sql.Query( "BEGIN;" )

```

Commit.DESCRIPTION:
Tells the engine to execute a series of queries queued for execution, must be preceded by [sql.Begin](/gmod/sql.Begin).

This is equivalent to `sql.Query( "COMMIT;" )`.

IndexExists.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the index with the specified name exists.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: indexName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the index to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: exists

LastError.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last error from a SQLite query.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Last error from SQLite database.

Query.DESCRIPTION: Performs a query on the local SQLite database, returns a table as result set, nil if result is empty and false on error.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: query
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The query to execute.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: false is returned if there is an error, nil if the query returned no data.

QueryRow.DESCRIPTION:
Performs the query like [sql.Query](/gmod/sql.Query), but returns the first row found.

Basically equivalent to :

```

sql.Query( "*query* LIMIT 1;" )

```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: query
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The input query.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: row
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The row number. Say we receive back 5 rows, putting 3 as this argument will give us row #3.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The returned row.

QueryValue.DESCRIPTION: Performs the query like [sql.QueryRow](/gmod/sql.QueryRow), but returns the first value found.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: query
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The input query.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The returned value; the engine automatically converts numerical output to Lua numbers.

SQLStr.DESCRIPTION: Escapes dangerous characters and symbols from user input used in an SQLite SQL Query.
NOTES: this function is not meant to be used with external database engines such as `MySQL`. Escaping strings with inadequate functions is dangerous!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to be escaped.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bNoQuotes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Set this as `true`, and the function will not wrap the input string in apostrophes.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The escaped input.

TableExists.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the table with the specified name exists.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tableName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the table to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: exists

sql.DESCRIPTION:
The SQL library allows you to access powerful database software included with Garry's Mod. It is the preferred and fastest method of storing large amounts of data. The database is located in sv.db serverside and cl.db clientside, both in the Garry's Mod base folder. SQL is a whole scripting language in itself although relatively simple, it's something you'll need to read up on before using this library.

Example of using sql.

```

-- Creating a table

sql.Query("CREATE TABLE my_db_table( id NUMBER , name TEXT )" )

-- Inserting a value to the table

sql.Query("INSERT INTO my_db_table( id , name ) VALUES( 1 , 'First') ")

-- Printing the tables data

PrintTable( sql.Query("SELECT * FROM my_db_table ") )

-- Deleting the table

sql.Query("DROP TABLE my_db_table") 

```

Known GMod [SQL settings](https://www.sqlite.org/compile.html):

* Temp files are stored in memory (`SQLITE_TEMP_STORE = 3`)

* No `ATTACH` and `DETACH` operations (`SQLITE_OMIT_ATTACH = 1`)

* No Virtual Tables (`SQLITE_OMIT_VIRTUALTABLE = 1`)

* No `VACUUM` operation (`SQLITE_OMIT_VACUUM = 1`)

* No `LIMIT` and `ORDER BY` clauses in `DELETE` and `UPDATE` statements (`SQLITE_ENABLE_UPDATE_DELETE_LIMIT`)

Download.DESCRIPTION:
Downloads a file from the supplied addon and saves it as a .cache file in garrysmod/cache folder.

This is mostly used to download the preview image of the addon, but the game seems to also use it to download replays and saves.

In case the retrieved file is an image and you need the [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial), use [AddonMaterial](/gmod/Global.AddonMaterial) with the path supplied from the callback.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: workshopPreviewID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Preview ID of workshop item.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: uncompress
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Whether to uncompress the file or not, assuming it was compressed with LZMA.

You will usually want to set this to true.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: resultCallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to process retrieved data. The first and only argument is a string, containing path to the saved file.

DownloadUGC.DESCRIPTION: Downloads a Steam Workshop file by its ID and returns a path to it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: workshopID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of workshop item to download. **NOT** a file ID.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: resultCallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to process retrieved data. The first argument is a string, containing path to the saved file, or nil if the download failed to any reason. The second argument is a [File](/gmod/File) object pointing to the downloaded .gma file. The file handle will be closed after the function exits.

FileInfo.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves info about supplied Steam Workshop addon.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: workshopItemID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of Steam Workshop item.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: resultCallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The function to process retrieved data, with the following arguments:

* [table](/gmod/table) data - The data about the item, if the request succeeded, nil otherwise. See [UGCFileInfo](/gmod/Structures/UGCFileInfo).

GetList.DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a customized list of Steam Workshop addons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: type
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The type of items to retrieve. Possible values include:

* popular (All invalid options will equal to this)

* trending

* latest

* friends

* followed - Items of people the player is following on Steam

* friend_favs - Favorites of player's friends

* favorite - Player's favorites

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A table of tags to match.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: offset
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much of results to skip from first one. Mainly used for pages.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: numRetrieve
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How much items to retrieve, up to 50 at a time.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: days
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: When getting Most Popular content from Steam, this determines a time period. ( 7 = most popular addons in last 7 days, 1 = most popular addons today, etc )

ARGUMENTS.NAME: userID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: "0" to retrieve all addons, "1" to retrieve addons only published by you, or a valid SteamID64 of a user to get workshop items of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: resultCallback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to process retrieved data. The first and only argument is a table, containing all the info, or nil in case of error

GetPlayerName.DESCRIPTION:
Retrieves players name by his 64bit SteamID.

You must call [steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo](/gmod/steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo) a decent amount of time before calling this function.
DEPRECATED: You should use the callback of steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamID64
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The 64bit Steam ID ( aka Community ID ) of the player

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name of that player

IsSubscribed.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the client is subscribed to the specified Steam Workshop item.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: workshopItemID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the Steam Workshop item.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the client subscribed to the addon or not.

OpenWorkshop.DESCRIPTION: Opens the workshop website in the steam overlay browser.

Publish.DESCRIPTION: Publishes dupes, saves or demos to workshop.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tags
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The workshop tags to apply

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filename

LuaJIT supports all specifiers and doesn't support `*` width and `.*` presision.

LuaJIT exclusives:

| Format | Description | Example of the output |

|:------:|:-----------:|:---------------------:|

| %p | Returns pointer to supplied structure (table/function) | `0xf20a8968` |

| %q | Formats a string between double quotes, using escape sequences when necessary to ensure that it can safely be read back by the Lua interpreter | `"test\1\2test"` |

string.DESCRIPTION:
The string *type* is a sequence of characters.

The string *library* is a standard Lua library which provides functions for the manipulation of strings.[[1]](https://www.lua.org/pil/20.html)

In Garry's Mod there are several extra useful functions and features added to this library.

Most notably all strings will access this library through the string metatable index function.[[2]](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/lua/includes/extensions/string.lua#L288-L299)

This means all strings are treated like table objects and the string library as its [Meta Table](/gmod/Meta_Tables)

```lua

local x = "Kittens"

function string.Foobar(self) return self:Right(4) end

string.Right(x,4) == x:Right(4) == x:Foobar() == ("Kittens"):Right(4) == x[-4]..x[-3]..x[-2]..x[-1]

```

The string *metatable* however is something else, and to access that you must use `getmetatable("")`.

The difference here is related to [Metamethods](/gmod/Metamethods), such as using (+) instead of (..) to concatenate strings.

```lua

local stringmeta = getmetatable("")

function stringmeta.__add(str,x) return str..x end -- This will work

function string.__add(str,x) return str..x end -- But this will not.

print("Kittens" + " And " + "Puppies")

```

See [Meta Tables](/gmod/Meta Tables) and [Metamethods](/gmod/Metamethods) for more information.

This category lists functions available in the string *library*.
WARNINGS: Making changes to the string *metatable* is not a good idea unless you know what you are doing. Use the string *library* instead.
Using `+` operator for concatenation breaks lua metamethod to sum string as numbers (Example: `"10" + "1"` return `11` (number)) and this is 400 times SLOWER!

CreateFont.DESCRIPTION:
Creates a new font.

To prevent the font from displaying incorrectly when using the `outline` setting, set `antialias` to false. This will ensure the text properly fills out the entire outline.

Be sure to check the [List of Default Fonts](/gmod/Default_Fonts) first! Those fonts can be used without using this function.

See Also: [Finding the Font Name](/gmod/Finding the Font Name).
WARNINGS:
Due to the static nature of fonts, do **NOT** create the font more than once. You should only be creating them once, it is recommended to create them at the top of your script. Do not use this function within GM:HUDPaint or any other hook!

Define fonts that you will actually use, as fonts are very taxing on performance and will cause crashes! Do not create fonts for every size.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fontName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new font name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fontData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The font properties. See the [FontData](/gmod/Structures/FontData).

See also [surface.DrawTexturedRectUV](/gmod/surface.DrawTexturedRectUV).
