DrawTexturedRectUV.DESCRIPTION:
Draws a textured rectangle with a repeated or partial texture.

u and v refer to texture coordinates.

* (u, v) = (0, 0) is the top left

* (u, v) = (1, 0) is the top right

* (u, v) = (1, 1) is the bottom right

* (u, v) = (0, 1) is the bottom left

Using a start point of (1, 0) and an end point to (0, 1), you can draw an image flipped horizontally, same goes with other directions. Going above 1 will tile the texture. Negative values are allowed as well.

Here's a helper image:

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The UV offsets might require (sub-)pixel correction for accurate tiling results.

NOTES: If you are using a .png image, you need supply the "noclamp" flag as second parameter for Global.Material if you intend to use tiling.

If you find that surface.DrawTexturedRectUV is getting your texture coordinates (u0, v0), (u1, v1) wrong and you're rendering with a material created with Global.CreateMaterial, try adjusting them with the following code:

```

local du = 0.5 / 32 -- half pixel anticorrection

local dv = 0.5 / 32 -- half pixel anticorrection

local u0, v0 = (u0 - du) / (1 - 2 * du), (v0 - dv) / (1 - 2 * dv)

local u1, v1 = (u1 - du) / (1 - 2 * du), (v1 - dv) / (1 - 2 * dv)

```

**Explanation:**

surface.DrawTexturedRectUV tries to correct the texture coordinates by half a pixel (something to do with sampling) and computes the correction using IMaterial::GetMappingWidth()/GetMappingHeight(). If the material was created without a $basetexture, then GetMappingWidth()/GetMappingHeight() uses the width and height of the error material (which is 32x32).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The X integer coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y integer coordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: width
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The integer width of the rectangle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: height
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The integer height of the rectangle.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startU
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The U texture mapping of the rectangle origin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startV
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The V texture mapping of the rectangle origin.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endU
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The U texture mapping of the rectangle end.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endV
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The V texture mapping of the rectangle end.

GetAlphaMultiplier.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current alpha multiplier affecting drawing operations. This is set by [surface.SetAlphaMultiplier](/gmod/surface.SetAlphaMultiplier) or by the game engine in certain other cases.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The multiplier ranging from 0 to 1.

GetDrawColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current color affecting draw operations.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color that drawing operations will use as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetHUDTexture.DESCRIPTION: Gets the [HUD icon](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/hud_textures.txt) TextureID with the specified name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the texture.

GetTextColor.DESCRIPTION: Returns the current color affecting text draw operations.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: The returned color will not have the color metatable.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The color that text drawing operations will use as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetTextSize.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width and height (in pixels) of the given text, but only if the font has been set with [surface.SetFont](/gmod/surface.SetFont).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: text
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to check the size of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Width of the provided text.
Height of the provided text.

GetTextureID.DESCRIPTION: Returns the texture id of the material with the given name/path.
NOTES: This function will not work with .png or .jpg images. For that, see Global.Material

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name/path
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name or path of the texture.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The texture ID

GetTextureSize.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the size of the texture with the associated texture ID.

For `.png/.jpg` textures loaded with [Material](/gmod/Global.Material) you can use the `$realheight` and `$realwidth` material parameters ([IMaterial:GetInt](/gmod/IMaterial:GetInt)) to get the size of the image.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: textureID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The texture ID, returned by [surface.GetTextureID](/gmod/surface.GetTextureID).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The texture width.
The texture height.

PlaySound.DESCRIPTION: Play a sound file directly on the client (such as UI sounds, etc).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundfile
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The path to the sound file, which must be relative to the sound/ folder.

ScreenHeight.DESCRIPTION: Returns the height of the current client's screen.
DEPRECATED: You should use Global.ScrH instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: screenHeight

ScreenWidth.DESCRIPTION: Returns the width of the current client's screen.
DEPRECATED: You should use Global.ScrW instead.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: screenWidth

SetAlphaMultiplier.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the alpha multiplier that will influence all upcoming drawing operations.

See also [render.SetBlend](/gmod/render.SetBlend).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: multiplier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The multiplier ranging from 0 to 1.

SetDrawColor.DESCRIPTION: Set the color of any future shapes to be drawn, can be set by either using R, G, B, A as separate values or by a [Color](/gmod/Color). Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.
NOTES: The alpha value may not work properly if you're using a material without `$vertexalpha`.
Providing a Color structure is slower than providing four numbers. You may use Color:Unpack for this.
Due to post processing and gamma correction the color you set with this function may appear differently when rendered. This problem does not occur on materials drawn with surface.DrawTexturedRect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red value of color, or a [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green value of color. Unused if a [Color](/gmod/Color) was given.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue value of color. Unused if a [Color](/gmod/Color) was given.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: a
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The alpha value of color. Unused if a [Color](/gmod/Color) was given.

SetFont.DESCRIPTION:
Set the current font to be used for text operations later.

The fonts must first be created with [surface.CreateFont](/gmod/surface.CreateFont) or be one of the [Default Fonts](/gmod/Default Fonts).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: fontName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the font to use.

SetMaterial.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the material to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

Not to be confused with [render.SetMaterial](/gmod/render.SetMaterial).

See also [surface.SetTexture](/gmod/surface.SetTexture).

If you need to unset the texture, use the [draw.NoTexture](/gmod/draw.NoTexture) convenience function.
NOTES:
When using render.PushRenderTarget or render.SetRenderTarget, `material` should have the `$ignorez` flag set to make it visible. If the material is not used in 3D rendering, it is probably safe to add it with this code:

```lua

material:SetInt( "$flags", bit.bor( material:GetInt( "$flags" ), 32768 ) )

```
WARNINGS: Global.Material function calls are expensive to be done inside this function or inside rendering context, you should be caching the results of Global.Material calls

ARGUMENTS.NAME: material
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The material to be used.

SetTextColor.DESCRIPTION:
Set the color of any future text to be drawn, can be set by either using R, G, B, A as separate numbers or by a [Color](/gmod/Color).

Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.
NOTES: Providing a Color structure is slower than providing four numbers. You may use Color:Unpack for this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: r
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The red value of color, or a [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: g
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The green value of color

ARGUMENTS.NAME: b
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The blue value of color

ARGUMENTS.NAME: a
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The alpha value of color

SetTextPos.DESCRIPTION: Set the top-left position to draw any future text at.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The X integer co-ordinate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The Y integer co-ordinate.

SetTexture.DESCRIPTION:
Sets the texture to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

See also [surface.SetMaterial](/gmod/surface.SetMaterial) for an [IMaterial](/gmod/IMaterial) alternative.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: textureID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the texture to draw with returned by [surface.GetTextureID](/gmod/surface.GetTextureID).

surface.DESCRIPTION: The surface library allows you to draw text and shapes on the screen. Primarily used for making HUDs & custom GUI panels.

AppTime.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the total uptime of the current application as reported by Steam.

This will return a similar value to [SysTime](/gmod/Global.SysTime).
NOTES: This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Seconds of game uptime as an integer.

0-100 if a battery (laptop, UPS, etc) is present.

Will instead return 255 if plugged in without a battery.

FlashWindow.DESCRIPTION: Flashes the window, turning the border to white briefly

GetCountry.DESCRIPTION: Returns the country code of this computer, determined by the localisation settings of the OS.
NOTES: This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Two-letter country code, using [ISO 3166-1](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) standard.

HasFocus.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the game window has focus.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will return true when minimized in windowed-mode.

NOTES: This function does not work on dedicated servers and will instead return no value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the game window has focus.

IsLinux.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the current OS is Linux.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the game is running on Linux.

IsOSX.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the current OS is OSX.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the game is running on OSX.

IsWindowed.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the game is being run in a window or in fullscreen (you can change this by opening the menu, clicking 'Options', then clicking the 'Video' tab, and changing the Display Mode using the dropdown menu):

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is the game running in a window?

IsWindows.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the current OS is Windows.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the system the game runs on is Windows or not.

SteamTime.DESCRIPTION: Returns the synchronized Steam time. This is the number of seconds since the [Unix epoch](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).
NOTES: This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Current Steam-synchronized Unix time.

UpTime.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

This is a direct binding to ISteamUtils->GetSecondsSinceComputerActive, and is most likely related to Steam's automatic "Away" online status.
NOTES: This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

system.DESCRIPTION: The system library provides functions that allow you to gather information about the system running the game, such as operating system, uptime and battery level.

Add.DESCRIPTION:
Adds the contents from one table into another. The target table will be modified.

See also [table.insert](/gmod/table.insert), [table.Inherit](/gmod/table.Inherit) and [table.Merge](/gmod/table.Merge).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to insert the new values into.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: source
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to retrieve the values from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The target table.

ClearKeys.DESCRIPTION: Changes all keys to sequential integers. This creates a new table object and does not affect the original.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The original table to modify.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: saveKeys
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Save the keys within each member table. This will insert a new field `__key` into each value, and should not be used if the table contains non-table values.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table with integer keys.

CollapseKeyValue.DESCRIPTION: Collapses a table with keyvalue structure

ARGUMENTS.NAME: input
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Input table

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Output table

concat.DESCRIPTION: Concatenates the contents of a table to a string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to concatenate.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: concatenator
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A seperator to insert between strings

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key to start at

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key to end at

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Concatenated values

Copy.DESCRIPTION: Creates a deep copy and returns that copy.
WARNINGS: This function does NOT copy userdata, such as Vectors and Angles!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: originalTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to be copied.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A deep copy of the original table

CopyFromTo.DESCRIPTION: Empties the target table, and merges all values from the source table into it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: source
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to copy from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to write to.

Count.DESCRIPTION:
Counts the amount of keys in a table. This should only be used when a table is not numerically and sequentially indexed. For those tables, consider the length (**#**) operator.

If you only want to test if the table is empty or not, use [table.IsEmpty](/gmod/table.IsEmpty) instead as it is a lot faster.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to count the keys of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of keyvalue pairs. This includes non-numeric and non-sequential keys, unlike the length (**#**) operator.

DeSanitise.DESCRIPTION: Converts a table that has been sanitised with [table.Sanitise](/gmod/table.Sanitise) back to its original form

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to be de-sanitised

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: De-sanitised table

Empty.DESCRIPTION: Removes all values from a table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to empty.

FindNext.DESCRIPTION: Returns the value positioned after the supplied value in a table. If it isn't found then the first element in the table is returned
DEPRECATED: Instead, iterate the table using ipairs or increment from the previous index using Global.next. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to search

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to return element after

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Found element

FindPrev.DESCRIPTION: Returns the value positioned before the supplied value in a table. If it isn't found then the last element in the table is returned
DEPRECATED: Instead, iterate your table with ipairs, storing the previous value and checking for the target. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to search

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to return element before

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Found element

ForceInsert.DESCRIPTION: Inserts a value in to the given table even if the table is non-existent

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to insert value in to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to insert

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The supplied or created table

foreach.DESCRIPTION:
Iterates for each key-value pair in the table, calling the function with the key and value of the pair. If the function returns anything, the loop is broken.

This is inherited from the original Lua implementation and is deprecated in Lua as of 5.1; see [here](http://lua-users.org/wiki/TableLibraryTutorial). You should use [pairs](/gmod/Global.pairs) instead. The GLua interpretation of this is [table.ForEach](/gmod/table.ForEach).
DEPRECATED: This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use Global.pairs instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to iterate over.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: callback
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run for each key and value.

foreachi.DESCRIPTION:
Iterates for each numeric index in the table in order.

This is inherited from the original Lua implementation and is deprecated in Lua as of 5.1; see [here](http://lua-users.org/wiki/TableLibraryTutorial). You should use [ipairs](/gmod/Global.ipairs)() instead.
DEPRECATED: This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use Global.ipairs() instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to iterate over.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run for each index.

GetFirstKey.DESCRIPTION: Returns the first key found in the given table
DEPRECATED:
Instead, expect the first key to be 1.

Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a first key.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to retrieve key from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Key

GetFirstValue.DESCRIPTION: Returns the first value found in the given table
DEPRECATED:
Instead, index the table with a key of 1.

Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a first key.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to retrieve value from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Value

GetKeys.DESCRIPTION: Returns all keys of a table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tabl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to get keys of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Table of keys

GetLastKey.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last key found in the given table
DEPRECATED: Instead, use the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to retrieve key from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Key

GetLastValue.DESCRIPTION: Returns the last value found in the given table
DEPRECATED: Instead, index the table with the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to retrieve value from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Value

getn.DESCRIPTION: Returns the length of the table.
DEPRECATED: This function was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and is removed in 5.2. Use the length (#) operator instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Sequential length.

GetWinningKey.DESCRIPTION: Returns a key of the supplied table with the highest number value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: inputTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to search in.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: winningKey

HasValue.DESCRIPTION: Checks if a table has a value.
NOTES: For optimization, functions that look for a value by sorting the table should never be needed if you work on a table that you built yourself.
WARNINGS: This function is **very inefficient for large tables** (O(n)) and should probably not be called in things that run each frame. Instead, consider a table structure such as example 2 below. Also see: Tables: Bad Habits

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to check

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to search for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the table has that value, false otherwise

Inherit.DESCRIPTION:
Copies any missing data from base to target, and sets the target's `BaseClass` member to the base table's pointer.

See [table.Merge](/gmod/table.Merge), which overrides existing values and doesn't add a BaseClass member.

See also [table.Add](/gmod/table.Add), which simply adds values of one table to another.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Sub-tables aren't inherited. The target's table value will take priority.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: target
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to copy data to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: base
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to copy data from

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Target

insert.DESCRIPTION: Inserts a value into a table at the end of the table or at the given position.
NOTES: This function does not call the `__newindex` [metamethod](Metamethods).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to insert the variable into.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position in the table to insert the variable. If the third argument is nil this argument becomes the value to insert at the end of given table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The variable to insert into the table.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The index the object was placed at.

IsEmpty.DESCRIPTION:
Returns whether or not the given table is empty.

This works on both sequential and non-sequential tables, and is a lot faster to use than `table.Count(tbl) == 0`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is empty?

IsSequential.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether or not the table's keys are sequential

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to check

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is sequential

KeyFromValue.DESCRIPTION: Returns the first key found to be containing the supplied value

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to search

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to search for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Key

KeysFromValue.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of keys containing the supplied value

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to search

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Value to search for

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Keys

LowerKeyNames.DESCRIPTION: Returns a copy of the input table with all string keys converted to be lowercase recursively

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to convert

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: New table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to search.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The highest numerical key.

Merge.DESCRIPTION:
Merges the contents of the second table with the content in the first one. The destination table will be modified.

See [table.Inherit](/gmod/table.Inherit), which doesn't override existing values.

See also [table.Add](/gmod/table.Add), which simply adds values of one table to another.
NOTES: This function will cause a stack overflow under certain circumstances.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: destination
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table you want the source table to merge with

ARGUMENTS.NAME: source
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table you want to merge with the destination table

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Destination table

Random.DESCRIPTION: Returns a random value from the supplied table.
WARNINGS:
This function iterates over the given table **twice**, therefore with sequential tables you should instead use following:

```

mytable[ math.random( #mytable ) ]

```

ARGUMENTS.NAME: haystack
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to choose from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A random value from the table.
The key associated with the random value.

remove.DESCRIPTION: Removes a value from a table and shifts any other values down to fill the gap.
NOTES: Does nothing if index is less than 1 or greater than `#tbl`

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to remove the value from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the value to remove.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The value that was removed.

RemoveByValue.DESCRIPTION: Removes the first instance of a given value from the specified table with [table.remove](/gmod/table.remove), then returns the key that the value was found at.
WARNINGS: Avoid usage of this function. It does not remove all instances of given value in the table, only the first found, and it does not work with non sequential tables!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table that will be searched.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: val
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to find within the table.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The key at which the value was found, or false if the value was not found.

Reverse.DESCRIPTION: Returns a reversed copy of a sequential table. Any non-sequential and non-numeric keyvalue pairs will not be copied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to reverse.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A reversed copy of the table.

Sanitise.DESCRIPTION: Converts [Vector](/gmod/Vector)s, [Angle](/gmod/Angle)s and [boolean](/gmod/boolean)s to be able to be converted to and from key-values. [table.DeSanitise](/gmod/table.DeSanitise) does the opposite

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to sanitise

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Sanitised table

sort.DESCRIPTION: Sorts a sequential table either ascending or by the given sort function.
NOTES: This function modifies the table you give to it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to sort.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: sorter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
If specified, the function will be called with 2 parameters each.

Return true in this function if you want the first parameter to come first in the sorted array.

SortByKey.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a list of keys sorted based on values of those keys.

For normal sorting see [table.sort](/gmod/table.sort).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to sort. All values of this table must be of same type.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: descending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should the order be descending?

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of keys sorted by values from supplied table.

SortByMember.DESCRIPTION: Sorts a table by a named member.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tab
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to sort.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: memberKey
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key used to identify the member.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ascending
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the order should be ascending.

SortDesc.DESCRIPTION: Sorts a table in reverse order from [table.sort](/gmod/table.sort).
NOTES: This function modifies the table you give to it. Like table.sort, it does not return anything.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to sort in descending order.

ToString.DESCRIPTION: Converts a table into a string

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tbl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to iterate over.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: displayName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Optional. A name for the table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: niceFormatting
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Adds new lines and tabs to the string.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table formatted as a string.

table.DESCRIPTION:
The table `type` is an object that can store multiple values.

The table `library` is a standard Lua library which provides functions to manipulate tables. In Garry's Mod there are several extra useful functions added to this library.

This category lists the functions available in the table `library`.

AddScore.DESCRIPTION: Increases the score of the given team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: increment
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Amount to increase the team's score by

BestAutoJoinTeam.DESCRIPTION: Returns the team index of the team with the least players. Falls back to TEAM_UNASSIGNED

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Team index

GetAllTeams.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table consisting of information on every defined team

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Team info

GetClass.DESCRIPTION: Returns the selectable classes for the given team. This can be added to with [team.SetClass](/gmod/team.SetClass)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Selectable classes

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The team's color as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

GetName.DESCRIPTION: Returns the name of the team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The team name. If the team is not defined, returns an empty string.

GetPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table with all player of the specified team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table of [Player](/gmod/Player)s that belong to the requested team.

GetScore.DESCRIPTION: Returns the score of the team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: score

GetSpawnPoint.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of valid spawnpoint classes the team can use. These are set with [team.SetSpawnPoint](/gmod/team.SetSpawnPoint).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Valid spawnpoint classes

GetSpawnPoints.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of valid spawnpoint entities the team can use. These are set with  [team.SetSpawnPoint](/gmod/team.SetSpawnPoint).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Valid spawnpoint entities

Joinable.DESCRIPTION: Returns if a team is joinable or not. This is set in [team.SetUp](/gmod/team.SetUp).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index of the team.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: True if the team is joinable. False otherwise.

NumPlayers.DESCRIPTION: Returns the amount of players in a team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: playerCount

SetClass.DESCRIPTION: Sets valid classes for use by a team. Classes can be created using [player_manager.RegisterClass](/gmod/player_manager.RegisterClass)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A class ID or table of class IDs

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team's new color as a [Color](/gmod/Color).

SetScore.DESCRIPTION: Sets the score of the given team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: score
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team's new score

SetSpawnPoint.DESCRIPTION: Sets valid spawnpoint classes for use by a team.
NOTES: GM.TeamBased must be set to true for this to work

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A spawnpoint classname or table of spawnpoint classnames

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team name.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamColor
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team color. Uses the [Color](/gmod/Color).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: isJoinable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the team is joinable or not.

TotalDeaths.DESCRIPTION: Returns the sum of deaths of all players of the team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: teamIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The team index.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: deathCount

TotalFrags.DESCRIPTION: Get's the total frags in a team.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Entity or number
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity or number.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: index

Valid.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the given team index is valid

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Index of the team

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Is valid

team.DESCRIPTION: The team library gives you access to the team system built into the Source engine, and allows you to create custom teams and get information about them.

Adjust.DESCRIPTION: Adjusts the timer if the timer with the given identifier exists.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer to adjust.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The delay interval in seconds. **Must be specified.**

ARGUMENTS.NAME: repetitions
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Repetitions. Use `0` for infinite or `nil` to keep previous value.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The new function. Use `nil` to keep previous value.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: `true` if succeeded.

Create.DESCRIPTION:
Creates a new timer that will repeat its function given amount of times.

This function also requires the timer to be named, which allows you to control it after it was created via the [timer](/gmod/timer).

For a simple one-time timer with no identifiers, see [timer.Simple](/gmod/timer.Simple).
WARNINGS: Timers use Global.CurTime internally. Due to this, they won't advance while the client is timing out from the server or on an empty dedicated server due to hibernation. (unless sv_hibernate_think is set to 1)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer to create. Must be unique. If a timer already exists with the same identifier, that timer will be updated to the new settings and reset.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The delay interval in seconds. If the delay is too small, the timer will fire on the next frame/tick.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: repetitions
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The number of times to repeat the timer. Enter 0 for infinite repetitions.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Function called when timer has finished the countdown.

Destroy.DESCRIPTION: Stops and destroys the given timer. Alias of [timer.Remove](/gmod/timer.Remove).
DEPRECATED: You should be using timer.Remove instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer to destroy.

Exists.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the given timer exists or not.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the timer exists, false if it doesn't

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: false if the timer didn't exist or was already paused, true otherwise.

Remove.DESCRIPTION: Stops and removes a timer created by [timer.Create](/gmod/timer.Create).
WARNINGS: The timers are removed in the next frame! Keep this in mind when storing identifiers in variables.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer to remove.

RepsLeft.DESCRIPTION: Returns amount of repetitions/executions left before the timer destroys itself.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of executions left.

Simple.DESCRIPTION:
Creates a simple timer that runs the given function after a specified delay.

For a more advanced version that you can control after creation, see [timer.Create](/gmod/timer.Create).
WARNINGS: Timers use Global.CurTime internally. Due to this, they won't advance while the client is timing out from the server or on an empty dedicated server due to hibernation. (unless sv_hibernate_think is set to 1)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: delay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long until the function should be ran (in seconds). Use 0 to have the function run in the next [GM:Think](/gmod/GM:Think).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: func
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The function to run after the specified delay.

NOTES: Timers use Global.CurTime for timing.
WARNINGS: Timers won't advance while the client is timing out from the server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true if the timer exists, false if it doesn't.

Stop.DESCRIPTION: Stops the given timer and rewinds it.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: false if the timer didn't exist or was already stopped, true otherwise.

TimeLeft.DESCRIPTION: Returns amount of time left (in seconds) before the timer executes its function.
NOTES: If the timer is paused, the amount will be negative.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The amount of time left (in seconds).

Toggle.DESCRIPTION: Runs either [timer.Pause](/gmod/timer.Pause) or [timer.UnPause](/gmod/timer.UnPause) based on the timer's current status.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: status of the timer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: identifier
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Identifier of the timer.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: false if the timer didn't exist or was already running, true otherwise.

timer.DESCRIPTION: The timer library is a very useful set of functions which allow you to run a function periodically or after a given delay.

usermessage.DESCRIPTION: The usermessage library is used to receive user messages from the server on the client.
DEPRECATED: You should be using the net instead
WARNINGS: Usermessages have a limit of only 256 bytes!

char.DESCRIPTION: Receives zero or more integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: codepoints
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Unicode code points to be converted in to a UTF-8 string.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: UTF-8 string generated from given arguments.

codepoint.DESCRIPTION: Returns the codepoints (as numbers) from all characters in the given string that start between byte position startPos and endPos. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence. This functions similarly to [string.byte](/gmod/string.byte).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string that you will get the code(s) from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The starting byte of the string to get the codepoint of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ending byte of the string to get the codepoint of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The codepoint number(s).

codes.DESCRIPTION: Returns an iterator (like [string.gmatch](/gmod/string.gmatch)) which returns both the position and codepoint of each utf8 character in the string. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string that you will get the codes from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The iterator (to be used in a for loop).

force.DESCRIPTION:
Forces a string to contain only valid UTF-8 data. Invalid sequences are replaced with U+FFFD (the Unicode replacement character).

This is a lazy way for users to ensure a string contains only valid UTF-8 data.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string that will become a valid UTF-8 string.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The UTF-8 string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: str
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string that you will be searching with the supplied index.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: index
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The index's value of the string to be returned.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: str

len.DESCRIPTION: Returns the number of UTF-8 sequences in the given string between positions startPos and endPos (both inclusive). If it finds any invalid UTF-8 byte sequence, returns false as well as the position of the first invalid byte.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to calculate the length of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The starting position to get the length from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The ending position to get the length from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The number of UTF-8 characters in the string. If there are invalid bytes, this will be false.
The position of the first invalid byte. If there were no invalid bytes, this will be nil.

offset.DESCRIPTION: Returns the byte-index of the n'th UTF-8-character after the given startPos (nil if none). startPos defaults to 1 when n is positive and -1 when n is negative. If n is zero, this function instead returns the byte-index of the UTF-8-character startPos lies within.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string that you will get the byte position from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: n
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to get the beginning byte position from.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The offset for n.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Starting byte-index of the given position.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: string
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string you'll take a sub-string out of.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: StartPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the first character that will be included in the sub-string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: EndPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position of the last character to be included in the sub-string. It can be negative to count from the end.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The substring.

charpattern.DESCRIPTION:
# Not a function

This is NOT a function, it's the [pattern](/gmod/Patterns) (a string, not a function) 

```

"[%z\x01-\x7F\xC2-\xF4][\x80-\xBF]*"

```

which matches exactly one UTF-8 byte sequence, assuming that the subject is a valid UTF-8 string.

utf8.DESCRIPTION:
The utf8 library provides basic support for UTF-8 encoding. This library does not provide any support for Unicode other than the handling of the encoding. Any operation that needs the meaning of a character, such as character classification, is outside its scope.

Unless stated otherwise, all functions that expect a byte position as a parameter assume that the given position is either the start of a byte sequence or one plus the length of the subject string. As in the string library, negative indices count from the end of the string.

AddNetworkString.DESCRIPTION:
Adds the specified string to a string table, which will cache it and network it to all clients automatically.

Whenever you want to create a net message with [net.Start](/gmod/net.Start), you must add the name of that message as a networked string via this function.

If the passed string already exists, nothing will happen and the ID of the existing item will be returned.
NOTES: The string table used for this function does not interfere with the engine string tables and has 2048 slots.

Each unique network name needs to be pooled once - do not put this function call into any other functions if you're using a constant string. Preferable place for this function is in a serverside lua file, or in a shared file with the net.Receive function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: str
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Adds the specified string to the string table.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The id of the string that was added to the string table.

Same as calling [util.NetworkStringToID](/gmod/util.NetworkStringToID).

AimVector.DESCRIPTION:

Essentially a generic version of [gui.ScreenToVector](/gmod/gui.ScreenToVector).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ViewFOV
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: View Field of View

ARGUMENTS.NAME: x
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Mouse X position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: y
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Mouse Y position

ARGUMENTS.NAME: scrWidth

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Calculated aim vector

Effect.DESCRIPTION:
Creates an effect with the specified data.

You can find a list of built-in engine effects [here](/gmod/Effects). You can create your own. Example effects can be found [here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/tree/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/sandbox/entities/effects) and [here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/tree/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/base/entities/effects).

For Orange Box `.pcf` particles, see [ParticleEffect](/gmod/Global.ParticleEffect),  [ParticleEffectAttach](/gmod/Global.ParticleEffectAttach) and  [CreateParticleSystem](/gmod/Global.CreateParticleSystem).
NOTES: You will need to couple this function with Global.IsFirstTimePredicted if you want to use it in Prediction.
When dispatching an effect from the server, some values may be clamped for networking optimizations. Visit the Set accessors on CEffectData to see which ones are affected.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effectName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the effect to create.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: effectData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The effect data describing the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: allowOverride
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether Lua-defined effects should override engine-defined effects with the same name for this/single function call.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ignorePredictionOrRecipientFilter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
Can either be a boolean to ignore the prediction filter or a [CRecipientFilter](/gmod/CRecipientFilter).

Set this to true if you wish to call this function in multiplayer from server.

GetModelInfo.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table containing the info about the model.
NOTES:
This function will silently fail if used on models with following strings in them:

* _shared

* _anims

* _gestures

* _anim

* _postures

* _gst

* _pst

* _shd

* _ss

* _anm

* _include

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mdl
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Model path

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The model info as a table with the following keys:

* [number](/gmod/number) SkinCount - Identical to [Entity:SkinCount](/gmod/Entity:SkinCount).

* [string](/gmod/string) KeyValues - Valve key-value formatted info about the model's physics (Constraint Info, etc). This is limited to 4096 characters.

* [string](/gmod/string) ModelKeyValues - Valve key-value formatted info about the model ($keyvalues command in the .qc of the model), if present

GetModelMeshes.DESCRIPTION:
Returns a table of visual meshes of given model.

See also [ENTITY:GetRenderMesh](/gmod/ENTITY:GetRenderMesh).
NOTES: This does not work on brush models (`*number` models)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: model
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The full path to a model to get the visual meshes of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A table of tables with the following format:

* [string](/gmod/string) material - The material of the specific mesh

* [table](/gmod/table) triangles - A table of [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex)es ready to be fed into [IMesh:BuildFromTriangles](/gmod/IMesh:BuildFromTriangles)

* [table](/gmod/table) verticies - A table of [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex)es representing all the vertexes of the mesh. This table is used internally to generate the "triangles" table.

Each [MeshVertex](/gmod/Structures/MeshVertex) returned also has an extra table of tables field called "weights" with the following data:

* [number](/gmod/number) boneID - The bone this vertex is attached to

* [number](/gmod/number) weight - How "strong" this vertex is attached to the bone. A vertex can be attached to multiple bones at once.

GetPData.DESCRIPTION: Gets PData of an offline player using their SteamID
WARNINGS: This function internally uses Player:UniqueID, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamID

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Variable name to get the value of

ARGUMENTS.NAME: default
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The default value, in case there's nothing stored

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The stored value

GetSurfaceData.DESCRIPTION: Returns data of a surface property at given ID.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Surface property ID. You can get it from [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The data or no value if there is no valid surface property at given index.

See [SurfacePropertyData](/gmod/Structures/SurfacePropertyData)

GetSurfaceIndex.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the matching surface property index for the given surface property name.

See also [util.GetSurfaceData](/gmod/util.GetSurfaceData) and [util.GetSurfacePropName](/gmod/util.GetSurfacePropName) for opposite function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: surfaceName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the surface.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The surface property index, or -1 if name doesn't correspond to a valid surface property.

GetSurfacePropName.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the name of a surface property at given ID.

See also [util.GetSurfaceData](/gmod/util.GetSurfaceData) and [util.GetSurfaceIndex](/gmod/util.GetSurfaceIndex) for opposite function.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Surface property ID. You can get it from [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The name or an empty string if there is no valid surface property at given index.

GetUserGroups.DESCRIPTION: Returns a table of all SteamIDs that have a usergroup.
NOTES: This returns the original usergroups table, changes done to this table are not retroactive and will only affect newly connected users

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
The table of users. The table consists of SteamID-Table pairs, where the table has 2 fields:
[string](/gmod/string) name - Players name
[string](/gmod/string) group - The players user group

IntersectRayWithOBB.DESCRIPTION: Performs a "ray" box intersection and returns position, normal and the fraction.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayStart
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Origin/start position of the ray.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayDelta
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The ray vector itself. This can be thought of as: the ray end point relative to the start point.

Note that in this implementation, the ray is not infinite - it's only a segment.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxOrigin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The center of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxAngles
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The angles of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxMins
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The min position of the box.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: boxMaxs
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The max position of the box.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Hit position, nil if not hit.
Normal/direction vector, nil if not hit.
Fraction of trace used, nil if not hit.

IntersectRayWithPlane.DESCRIPTION: Performs a [ray-plane intersection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line%E2%80%93plane_intersection) and returns the hit position or nil.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayOrigin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Origin/start position of the ray.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: rayDirection
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The direction of the ray.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: planePosition
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Any position of the plane.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: planeNormal
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The normal vector of the plane.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The position of intersection, nil if not hit.

IsInWorld.DESCRIPTION: Checks if a certain position is within the world bounds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the vector is in world.

IsModelLoaded.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the model is loaded in the game.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name/Path of the model to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the model is loaded in the game; otherwise false.

IsSkyboxVisibleFromPoint.DESCRIPTION: Check whether the skybox is visible from the point specified.
NOTES: This will always return true in fullbright maps.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The position to check the skybox visibility from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the skybox is visible from the position.

IsValidModel.DESCRIPTION:
Checks if the specified model is valid.

A model is considered invalid in following cases:
* Starts with a space or **maps**
* Doesn't start with **models**
* Contains any of the following:
* * _gestures
* * _animations
* * _postures
* * _gst
* * _pst
* * _shd
* * _ss
* * _anm
* * .bsp
* * cs_fix
* On server: If the model isn't precached, if the model file doesn't exist on the disk
* If precache failed
* Model is the error model

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name/Path of the model to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether the model is valid or not. Returns false clientside if the model is not precached by the server.

IsValidPhysicsObject.DESCRIPTION: Checks if given numbered physics object of given entity is valid or not. Most useful for ragdolls.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity

ARGUMENTS.NAME: physobj
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Number of the physics object to test

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: true is valid, false otherwise

IsValidProp.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the specified prop is valid.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name/Path of the model to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the specified prop is valid; otherwise false.

IsValidRagdoll.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the specified model name points to a valid ragdoll.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ragdollName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name/Path of the ragdoll model to check.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if the specified model name points to a valid ragdoll; otherwise false.

JSONToTable.DESCRIPTION: Converts a JSON string to a Lua table.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will attempt cast the string keys "inf", "nan", "true", and "false" to their respective Lua values. This completely ignores nulls in arrays.
Colors will not have the color metatable.

WARNINGS: There is a limit of 15,000 keys total.
Keys are converted to numbers wherever possible. This means using Player:SteamID64 as keys won't work.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: json
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The JSON string to convert.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The table containing converted information. Returns nothing on failure.

KeyValuesToTable.DESCRIPTION: Converts a KeyValue string to a Lua table.
NOTES: Table keys will not repeat, see util.KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyValues
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The KeyValue string to convert.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: usesEscapeSequences
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true, will replace \t, \n, \" and \\ in the input text with their escaped variants

ARGUMENTS.NAME: preserveKeyCase
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we should preserve key case (may fail) or not (always lowercase)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The converted table

KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder.DESCRIPTION: Similar to [util.KeyValuesToTable](/gmod/util.KeyValuesToTable) but it also preserves order of keys.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: keyvals
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The key value string

ARGUMENTS.NAME: usesEscapeSequences
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If set to true, will replace \t, \n, \" and \\ in the input text with their escaped variants

ARGUMENTS.NAME: preserveKeyCase
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Whether we should preserve key case (may fail) or not (always lowercase)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The output table

LocalToWorld.DESCRIPTION: Returns a vector in world coordinates based on an entity and local coordinates

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity lpos is local to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lpos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Coordinates local to the ent

ARGUMENTS.NAME: bonenum
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The bonenumber of the ent lpos is local to

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: wpos

NetworkIDToString.DESCRIPTION: Returns the networked string associated with the given ID from the string table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: stringTableID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: ID to get the associated string from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The networked string, or nil if it wasn't found.

NetworkStringToID.DESCRIPTION: Returns the networked ID associated with the given string from the string table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: networkString
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: String to get the associated networked ID from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The networked ID of the string, or 0 if it hasn't been networked with [util.AddNetworkString](/gmod/util.AddNetworkString).

NiceFloat.DESCRIPTION: Formats a float by stripping off extra `0's` and `.'s`.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: float
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The float to format.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Formatted float.

ParticleTracer.DESCRIPTION: Creates a tracer effect with the given parameters.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the tracer effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the tracer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the tracer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: doWhiz
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Play the hit miss(whiz) sound.

ParticleTracerEx.DESCRIPTION: Creates a tracer effect with the given parameters.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the tracer effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the tracer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endPos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the tracer.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: doWhiz
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Play the hit miss(whiz) sound.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: entityIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity index of the emitting entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachmentIndex
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attachment index to be used as origin.

PixelVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns the visibility of a sphere in the world.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The center of the visibility test.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The radius of the sphere to check for visibility.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: PixVis
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The PixVis handle created with [util.GetPixelVisibleHandle](/gmod/util.GetPixelVisibleHandle).
WARNINGS: Don't use the same handle twice per tick or it will give unpredictable results.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Visibility, ranges from `0-1`. `0` when none of the area is visible, `1` when all of it is visible.

PointContents.DESCRIPTION: Returns the contents of the position specified.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: position
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Position to get the contents sample from.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Contents bitflag, see [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS)

PrecacheModel.DESCRIPTION: Precaches a model for later use. Model is cached after being loaded once.
WARNINGS: Modelprecache is limited to 4096 unique models. When it reaches the limit the game will crash.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: modelName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The model to precache.

PrecacheSound.DESCRIPTION: Precaches a sound for later use. Sound is cached after being loaded once.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Broken on purpose because hitting the limit above causes the server to shutdown
Ultimately does nothing on client, and only works with sound scripts, not direct paths.

NOTES: Soundcache is limited to 16384 unique sounds on the server.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: soundName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The sound to precache.

QuickTrace.DESCRIPTION: Performs a trace with the given origin, direction and filter.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: origin
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin of the trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endpos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION:
The end point of the trace, relative to the start.
This is the direction of the trace times the distance of the trace.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: filter
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity which should be ignored by the trace. Can also be a table of entities or a function - see [Trace](/gmod/Structures/Trace).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Trace result. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

RelativePathToFull.DESCRIPTION: Returns the absolute system path the file relative to /garrysmod/.
DEPRECATED: Will be removed.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: file
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file to get the absolute path of.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: absolutePath

RemovePData.DESCRIPTION: Removes PData of offline player using his SteamID.
WARNINGS: This function internally uses Player:UniqueID, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: SteamID of the player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Variable name to remove

NOTES: The screen shake effect is rendered by modifying the view origin on the client. If you override the view origin in GM:CalcView you may not be able to see the shake effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: pos
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The origin of the effect.
NOTES: Does nothing on client.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: amplitude
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The strength of the effect.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: frequency
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The frequency of the effect in hertz.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: duration
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The duration of the effect in seconds.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: radius
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The range from the origin within which views will be affected, in Hammer units.
NOTES: Does nothing on client.

SetPData.DESCRIPTION: Sets PData for offline player using his SteamID
WARNINGS: This function internally uses Player:UniqueID, which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). It's recommended that you don't use it. See the related wiki page for more information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: steamID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: SteamID of the player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Variable name to store the value in

ARGUMENTS.NAME: value
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The value to store

SharedRandom.DESCRIPTION: Generates a random float value that should be the same on client and server.
NOTES: This function is best used in a Predicted Hook

ARGUMENTS.NAME: uniqueName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The seed for the random value

ARGUMENTS.NAME: min
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value of the random range

ARGUMENTS.NAME: max
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value of the random range

ARGUMENTS.NAME: additionalSeed
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The additional seed

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The random float value

SpriteTrail.DESCRIPTION: Adds a trail to the specified entity.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity to attach trail to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: attachmentID
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Attachment ID of the entities model to attach trail to. If you are not sure, set this to 0

ARGUMENTS.NAME: color
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Color of the trail, use [Color](/gmod/Global.Color)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: additive
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Should the trail be additive or not

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Start width of the trail

ARGUMENTS.NAME: endWidth
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: End width of the trail

ARGUMENTS.NAME: lifetime
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long it takes to transition from startWidth to endWidth

ARGUMENTS.NAME: textureRes
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The resolution of trails texture. A good value can be calculated using this formula: 1 / ( startWidth + endWidth ) * 0.5

ARGUMENTS.NAME: texture
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Path to the texture to use as a trail.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Entity of created trail ([env_spritetrail](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Env_spritetrail))
A brand new stack object

SteamIDFrom64.DESCRIPTION: Given a 64bit SteamID will return a STEAM_0: style Steam ID

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The 64 bit Steam ID

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: STEAM_0 style Steam ID

SteamIDTo64.DESCRIPTION: Given a STEAM_0 style Steam ID will return a 64bit Steam ID

ARGUMENTS.NAME: id
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The STEAM_0 style id

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: 64bit Steam ID

StringToType.DESCRIPTION:
Converts a string to the specified type.

This can be useful when dealing with ConVars.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: str
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The string to convert

ARGUMENTS.NAME: typename
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The type to attempt to convert the string to. This can be vector, angle, float, int, bool, or string (case insensitive).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The result of the conversion, or nil if a bad type is specified.

TableToJSON.DESCRIPTION: Converts a table to a JSON string.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: This will produce invalid JSON if the provided table contains nan or inf values.

WARNINGS: All integers will be converted to decimals (5 -> 5.0).
All keys are strings in the JSON format, so all keys will be converted to strings!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Table to convert.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: prettyPrint
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Format and indent the JSON.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A JSON formatted string containing the serialized data

TableToKeyValues.DESCRIPTION: Converts the given table into a key value string.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table to convert.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parentKey
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The parent key.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: KeyValueString

ARGUMENTS.NAME: startdelay
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: How long you want the timer to be.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
A timer object. It has next methods:
;Reset() - Resets the timer to nothing
;Start( time ) - Starts the timer, call with end time
;Started() - Returns true if the timer has been started
;Elapsed() - Returns true if the time has elapsed

TimerCycle.DESCRIPTION: Returns the time since this function has been last called

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Time since this function has been last called in ms

tobool.DESCRIPTION: Converts string or a number to a bool, if possible. Alias of [tobool](/gmod/Global.tobool).
DEPRECATED: You should use Global.tobool instead.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: input
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A string or a number to convert.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: False if the input is equal to the string or boolean "false", if the input is equal to the string or number "0", or if the input is nil. Returns true otherwise.

TraceEntity.DESCRIPTION: Runs a trace using the entity's collisionmodel between two points. This does not take the entity's angles into account and will trace its unrotated collisionmodel.
NOTES: Clientside entities will not be hit by traces.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: tracedata
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Trace data. See [Trace](/gmod/Structures/Trace)

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The entity to use

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Trace result. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

TraceEntityHull.DESCRIPTION: Traces from one entity to another.
DEPRECATED: This function is broken and returns the same values all the time

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent1
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The first entity to trace from

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent2
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The second entity to trace to

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Trace result. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

TraceHull.DESCRIPTION: Performs an AABB hull (axis-aligned bounding box, aka not rotated) trace with the given trace data.
NOTES: Clientside entities will not be hit by traces.
This function may not always give desired results clientside due to certain physics mechanisms not existing on the client. Use it serverside for accurate results.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: TraceData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The trace data to use. See [HullTrace](/gmod/Structures/HullTrace)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Trace result. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

TraceLine.DESCRIPTION: Performs a trace with the given trace data.
NOTES: Clientside entities will not be hit by traces.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: TraceData
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The trace data to use. See [Trace](/gmod/Structures/Trace)

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION:
Trace result. See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult).

Can return nil if [game.GetWorld](/gmod/game.GetWorld) or its [physics object](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObject) is invalid. This will be the case for any traces done before [GM:InitPostEntity](/gmod/GM:InitPostEntity) is called.

TypeToString.DESCRIPTION: Converts a type to a (nice, but still parsable) string

ARGUMENTS.NAME: input
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: What to convert

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Converted string

util.DESCRIPTION: This is the list of utility functions.

Create.DESCRIPTION: Creates a panel by the specified classname.
NOTES: Custom VGUI elements are not loaded instantly. Use GM:OnGamemodeLoaded to create them on startup.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Classname of the panel to create. Valid classnames are listed at: [VGUI Element List](/gmod/VGUI Element List).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Parent of the created panel.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the created panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: metatable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Your PANEL table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Which panel to parent the newly created panel to

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of your panel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created panel

ARGUMENTS.NAME: class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class of the panel to create

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: If specified, parents created panel to given one

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the created panel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Created panel

CursorVisible.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the cursor is currently active and visible.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isCursorVisible

FocusedHasParent.DESCRIPTION: Returns whether the currently focused panel is a child of the given one.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: parent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The parent panel to check the currently focused one against. This doesn't need to be a direct parent (focused panel can be a child of a child and so on).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the focused panel is a child of the passed one.

GetControlTable.DESCRIPTION: Gets the method table of this panel. Does not return parent methods!

ARGUMENTS.NAME: Panelname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The name of the panel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: methods

GetHoveredPanel.DESCRIPTION: Returns the panel the cursor is hovering above.
WARNINGS:
This returns a cached value that is only updated after rendering and `before` the next VGUI Think/Layout pass.

ie. it lags one frame behind panel layout and is completely unhelpful for PANEL:Paint if your panels are moving around under the mouse a lot every frame.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The panel that the user is currently hovering over with their cursor.

GetKeyboardFocus.DESCRIPTION: Returns the panel which is currently receiving keyboard input.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The panel with keyboard focus

GetWorldPanel.DESCRIPTION:
Returns the global world panel which is the parent to all others, except for the HUD panel.

See also [GetHUDPanel](/gmod/Global.GetHUDPanel).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The world panel

IsHoveringWorld.DESCRIPTION: Returns whenever the cursor is hovering the world panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: isHoveringWorld

Register.DESCRIPTION: Registers a panel for later creation.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Classname of the panel to create.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panelTable
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The table containg the panel information.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: baseName
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Name of the base of the panel.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The given panel table from second argument

RegisterFile.DESCRIPTION: Registers a new VGUI panel from a file.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: file
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The file to register

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: A table containing info about the panel. Can be supplied to [vgui.CreateFromTable](/gmod/vgui.CreateFromTable)

RegisterTable.DESCRIPTION: Registers a table to use as a panel. All this function does is assigns Base key to your table and returns the table.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: panel
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The PANEL table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: base
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: A base for the panel

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The PANEL table

vgui.DESCRIPTION: The vgui library allows you to script and create your own panels using Valve's GUI system.For an alphabetically ordered list of VGUI panels, see [VGUI Element List](/gmod/VGUI Element List).

ARGUMENTS.NAME: config
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The video config. See [VideoData](/gmod/Structures/VideoData).

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The video object (returns **false** if there is an error)
The error string, if there is an error

Get.DESCRIPTION: Get a `copy` of weapon table by name. This function also inherits fields from the weapon's base class, unlike [weapons.GetStored](/gmod/weapons.GetStored).
NOTES: This will only work on SWEP's, this means that this will not return anything for HL2 weapons.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Class name of weapon to retrieve

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The retrieved table or nil

GetList.DESCRIPTION: Get a list of all the registered SWEPs. This does not include weapons added to spawnmenu manually.

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: List of all the registered SWEPs

GetStored.DESCRIPTION: Gets the REAL weapon table, not a copy. The produced table does `not` inherit fields from the weapon's base class, unlike [weapons.Get](/gmod/weapons.Get).
WARNINGS: Modifying this table will modify what is stored by the weapons library. Take a copy or use weapons.Get to avoid this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: weapon_class
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Weapon class to retrieve weapon table of

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: The weapon table

IsBasedOn.DESCRIPTION: Checks if name is based on base

ARGUMENTS.NAME: name
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Entity's class name to be checked

ARGUMENTS.NAME: base
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Base class name to be checked

RETURNS.DESCRIPTION: Returns true if class name is based on base, else false.

OnLoaded.DESCRIPTION:
Called after all SWEPS have been loaded and runs [baseclass.Set](/gmod/baseclass.Set) on each one.

You can retrieve all the currently registered SWEPS with [weapons.GetList](/gmod/weapons.GetList).
NOTES: This is not called after a SWEP auto refresh, and thus the inherited baseclass functions retrieved with baseclass.Get will not be updated

Register.DESCRIPTION: Used to register your SWEP with the engine.

BUGS.DESCRIPTION: Sub-tables provided in the first argument will not carry over their metatable, and will receive a BaseClass key if the table was merged with the base's. Userdata references, which includes Vectors, Angles, Entities, etc. will not be copied.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: swep_table
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The SWEP table

ARGUMENTS.NAME: classname
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Classname to assign to that swep

weapons.DESCRIPTION: The weapons library allows you to access information about any scripted weapons loaded into the game, as well as register your own weapons.

PlayerTick.DESCRIPTION: Automatically called to update all widgets.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ply
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: The player

ARGUMENTS.NAME: mv
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Player move data

RenderMe.DESCRIPTION: Renders a widget. Normally you won't need to call this.

ARGUMENTS.NAME: ent
ARGUMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Widget entity to render

widgets.DESCRIPTION:
The widgets library.

Widgets allow the player to have mouse interaction with entities, such as being able to manipulate the [bones of an NPC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3gG0t39-pQ).

dmgtype.NAME: dmgtype
dmgtype.DESCRIPTION:
Damage type using [DMG](/gmod/Enums/DMG).

Related function is [game.GetAmmoDamageType](/gmod/game.GetAmmoDamageType).

force.NAME: force
force.DESCRIPTION:
The force of the ammo.

Related function is [game.GetAmmoForce](/gmod/game.GetAmmoForce).

name.NAME: name
name.DESCRIPTION:
Name of the ammo.

Related functions are [game.GetAmmoName](/gmod/game.GetAmmoName) and [game.GetAmmoID](/gmod/game.GetAmmoID).

npcdmg.NAME: npcdmg
npcdmg.DESCRIPTION:
The damage dealt to NPCs.

Related function is [game.GetAmmoNPCDamage](/gmod/game.GetAmmoNPCDamage).
NOTES: Can also be a string pointing to a convar. The value will automatically update with the convar's.

plydmg.NAME: plydmg
plydmg.DESCRIPTION:
The damage dealt to players.

Related function is [game.GetAmmoPlayerDamage](/gmod/game.GetAmmoPlayerDamage).
NOTES: Can also be a string pointing to a convar. The value will automatically update with the convar's.

maxcarry.NAME: maxcarry
maxcarry.DESCRIPTION:
Maximum amount of ammo of this type the player should be able to carry in reserve.

Related function is [game.GetAmmoMax](/gmod/game.GetAmmoMax).
NOTES: gmod_maxammo will override this value if set to above 0.
Can also be a string pointing to a convar. The value will automatically update with the convar's.

flags.NAME: flags
flags.DESCRIPTION: Flags for the ammo type using [AMMO](/gmod/Enums/AMMO).

AmmoData.DESCRIPTION:
Table structure that describes a Source Engine ammo type.

See [game.AddAmmoType](/gmod/game.AddAmmoType) and [game.GetAmmoData](/gmod/game.GetAmmoData).

AngPos.DESCRIPTION: Table used by various functions, such as [Entity:GetAttachment](/gmod/Entity:GetAttachment).

StartTime.NAME: StartTime
StartTime.DESCRIPTION: The system time value returned by [SysTime](/gmod/Global.SysTime) when the animation starts/will start.

EndTime.NAME: EndTime
EndTime.DESCRIPTION: The system time value returned by [SysTime](/gmod/Global.SysTime) when the animation ends/will end.

Ease.NAME: Ease
Ease.DESCRIPTION: The ease in/out level of the animation.

OnEnd.NAME: OnEnd
OnEnd.DESCRIPTION:
The callback function that will be called upon completion of the animation. The arguments passed to it are:

* [table](/gmod/table) animData - This structure.

* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) tgtPanel - The panel the animation was run on.

Think.NAME: Think
Think.DESCRIPTION:
The `think` function called every frame that will animate the panel object. This varies based on the animation. You can create a custom function for this if you aren't using the stock panel methods. The arguments passed to it are:

* [table](/gmod/table) animData - This structure.

* [Panel](/gmod/Panel) tgtPanel - The panel the animation is being run on.

* [number](/gmod/number) fraction - The progress fraction of the animation, between 0 and 1. The change rate of this number will not be linear if you are easing.

Pos.NAME: Pos
Pos.DESCRIPTION: The target position, or target translation of the panel object. Used by [Panel:MoveTo](/gmod/Panel:MoveTo) and [Panel:MoveBy](/gmod/Panel:MoveBy) respectively.

StartPos.NAME: StartPos
StartPos.DESCRIPTION: The position of the panel object when the animation started. Used by [Panel:MoveTo](/gmod/Panel:MoveTo) and [Panel:MoveBy](/gmod/Panel:MoveBy).

SizeX.NAME: SizeX
SizeX.DESCRIPTION: Whether to resize the panel horizontally or not. Only used by [Panel:SizeTo](/gmod/Panel:SizeTo).

SizeY.NAME: SizeY
SizeY.DESCRIPTION: Whether to resize the panel vertically or not. Only used by [Panel:SizeTo](/gmod/Panel:SizeTo).

Size.NAME: Size
Size.DESCRIPTION: The target size of the panel object. Only used by [Panel:SizeTo](/gmod/Panel:SizeTo).

StartSize.NAME: StartSize
StartSize.DESCRIPTION: The size of the panel object when the animation started. Only used by [Panel:SizeTo](/gmod/Panel:SizeTo).

Color.NAME: Color
Color.DESCRIPTION: The target colour of the panel object. Only used by [Panel:ColorTo](/gmod/Panel:ColorTo).

StartColor.NAME: StartColor
StartColor.DESCRIPTION: The colour of the panel object when the animation started. Only used by [Panel:ColorTo](/gmod/Panel:ColorTo).

Alpha.NAME: Alpha
Alpha.DESCRIPTION: The target alpha (0-255) of the panel object. Only used by [Panel:AlphaTo](/gmod/Panel:AlphaTo).

StartAlpha.NAME: StartAlpha
StartAlpha.DESCRIPTION: The alpha (0-255) of the panel object when the animation started. Only used by [Panel:AlphaTo](/gmod/Panel:AlphaTo).

Speed.NAME: Speed
Speed.DESCRIPTION: The speed to use for transitions when using linear interpolation (Lerp) animations. Only used by [Panel:LerpPositions](/gmod/Panel:LerpPositions).

UseGravity.NAME: UseGravity
UseGravity.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not to use easing to make the panel 'jump' at its target, slowing as it approaches. Only used by [Panel:LerpPositions](/gmod/Panel:LerpPositions).

AnimationData.DESCRIPTION: Table used by panel animation methods, primarily [Panel:AnimationThinkInternal](/gmod/Panel:AnimationThinkInternal), and returned by [Panel:NewAnimation](/gmod/Panel:NewAnimation).

submodels.NAME: submodels
submodels.DESCRIPTION: A zero-indexed table that is of length _num_ with values being the name of the smd mesh file of the respective body group value.

s.NAME: s
s.DESCRIPTION: The entity's scale manipulation of the bone

a.NAME: a
a.DESCRIPTION: The entity's angle manipulation of the bone

p.NAME: p
p.DESCRIPTION: The entity's position manipulation of the given bone

BoneManipulationData.DESCRIPTION:
Structure used for storing/restoring bone manipulations.

Data is stored from [Entity:GetManipulateBoneScale](/gmod/Entity:GetManipulateBoneScale), [Entity:GetManipulateBoneAngles](/gmod/Entity:GetManipulateBoneAngles), and [Entity:GetManipulateBonePosition](/gmod/Entity:GetManipulateBonePosition).

Data is restored using [Entity:ManipulateBoneScale](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneScale), [Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles), and [Entity:ManipulateBonePosition](/gmod/Entity:ManipulateBonePosition).

The function [duplicator.DoBoneManipulator](/gmod/duplicator.DoBoneManipulator) and [EntityCopyData](/gmod/Structures/EntityCopyData) use a table

containing a BoneManipulationData structure for each bone (that has manipulations applied) with the bone ID as the struct index in the table.

Fields **s**, **a**, and **p** are set if they don't equal **Vector( 1, 1, 1 )**, **Angle( 0, 0, 0 )**, and **Vector( 0, 0, 0 )** respectively.

Attacker.NAME: Attacker
Attacker.DESCRIPTION:
The entity that should be reported as attacker eg. a player

By default this would be set to the entity [Entity:FireBullets](/gmod/Entity:FireBullets) is called on.

Callback.NAME: Callback
Callback.DESCRIPTION:
Function to be called **after** the bullet was fired but **before** the damage is applied (the callback is called even if no damage is applied). The arguments are:

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) attacker

* [table](/gmod/table) tr - See [TraceResult](/gmod/Structures/TraceResult)

* [CTakeDamageInfo](/gmod/CTakeDamageInfo) dmgInfo

Damage.NAME: Damage
Damage.DESCRIPTION: The damage dealt by the bullet

Distance.NAME: Distance
Distance.DESCRIPTION: Maximum distance the bullet can travel

HullSize.NAME: HullSize
HullSize.DESCRIPTION: The hull size of the bullet

Num.NAME: Num
Num.DESCRIPTION: The amount of bullets to fire
