Tracer.NAME: Tracer
Tracer.DESCRIPTION: Show tracer for every x bullets

TracerName.NAME: TracerName
TracerName.DESCRIPTION: The tracer name. You can find a list of default effects [here](/gmod/Effects).

Spread.NAME: Spread
Spread.DESCRIPTION: The spread, only x and y are needed

Src.NAME: Src
Src.DESCRIPTION: The position to fire the bullets from

IgnoreEntity.NAME: IgnoreEntity
IgnoreEntity.DESCRIPTION: The entity that the bullet will ignore when it will be shot.

Bullet.DESCRIPTION: Tables used for bullets see [Entity:FireBullets](/gmod/Entity:FireBullets) and [GM:EntityFireBullets](/gmod/GM:EntityFireBullets).

drawviewer.NAME: drawviewer
drawviewer.DESCRIPTION: Set true to draw local players player model.

ortho.NAME: ortho
ortho.DESCRIPTION:
If set, enables orthographic mode. The table has following arguments:

* [number](/gmod/number) left

* [number](/gmod/number) right

* [number](/gmod/number) top

* [number](/gmod/number) bottom

Each describes where their border starts, (`left`+`right`) and (`top`+`bottom`) should equal `0` to center on the view position.

OurOldVelocity.NAME: OurOldVelocity
OurOldVelocity.DESCRIPTION: The entity's velocity before the collision

DeltaTime.NAME: DeltaTime
DeltaTime.DESCRIPTION: Time since the last collision with the `HitEntity`

TheirOldVelocity.NAME: TheirOldVelocity
TheirOldVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Speed of the other entity before the collision

Speed.NAME: Speed
Speed.DESCRIPTION: The speed of the entity before the collision

HitNormal.NAME: HitNormal
HitNormal.DESCRIPTION: Normal of the surface that hit the other entity

TheirSurfaceProps.NAME: TheirSurfaceProps
TheirSurfaceProps.DESCRIPTION: Surface Property ID of the entity we collided with

HitSpeed.NAME: HitSpeed
HitSpeed.DESCRIPTION: The scalar speed at which the impact happened

OurNewVelocity.NAME: OurNewVelocity
OurNewVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Our new velocity after the impact

TheirNewVelocity.NAME: TheirNewVelocity
TheirNewVelocity.DESCRIPTION: The new velocity after the impact of the entity we collided with

OurOldAngularVelocity.NAME: OurOldAngularVelocity
OurOldAngularVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Old angular velocity of this entity

TheirOldAngularVelocity.NAME: TheirOldAngularVelocity
TheirOldAngularVelocity.DESCRIPTION: Old angular velocity of the entity we collided with

CollisionData.DESCRIPTION: Passed as argument of [ENTITY:PhysicsCollide](/gmod/ENTITY:PhysicsCollide), [EFFECT:PhysicsCollide](/gmod/EFFECT:PhysicsCollide) and used with [Entity:AddCallback](/gmod/Entity:AddCallback).
NOTES:
Sometimes, the value of `Speed` can be different from getting the length calculated from `OurOldVelocity`, even though they should be the same, or close to same. It's recommended to do `OurOldVelocity:Length()` instead. 

```

function ENT:PhysicsCollide( colData, collider )

    -- you may get two completely different values, and the second one should be more accurate.

    print(colData.Speed)

    print(colData.OurOldVelocity:Length())

end

```

Color.DESCRIPTION: Table created by the [Color](/gmod/Global.Color) function and used in various situations.

Function.NAME: Function
Function.DESCRIPTION: The function used to generate the content of the tab.

Icon.NAME: Icon
Icon.DESCRIPTION: The icon material that will accompany the title of the tab.

Order.NAME: Order
Order.DESCRIPTION: The order in which a tab will be displayed relative to the other tabs.

Tooltip.NAME: Tooltip
Tooltip.DESCRIPTION: The tooltip to be shown with the tab.

CreationMenus.DESCRIPTION: Table that maintains information on the creation menu tabs. Each key of the table represents the name of the tab. See [spawnmenu.AddCreationTab](/gmod/spawnmenu.AddCreationTab) and [spawnmenu.GetCreationTabs](/gmod/spawnmenu.GetCreationTabs).

wday.NAME: wday
wday.DESCRIPTION:
Day of the week

Sunday: 1, Saturday: 7

DateData.DESCRIPTION: Table returned by [os.date](/gmod/os.date) and used by [os.time](/gmod/os.time).

func.NAME: func
func.DESCRIPTION:
Reference to the function that was passed in. If a stack level was specified, this will be the function at that stack level. 0 = debug.getinfo, 1 = function that called debug.getinfo, etc.

**Option: f**

linedefined.NAME: linedefined
linedefined.DESCRIPTION:
The line where the function definiton starts (where "function" is located).

**Option: S**

lastlinedefined.NAME: lastlinedefined
lastlinedefined.DESCRIPTION:
The line the function definition ended (where "end" is located).

**Option: S**

source.NAME: source
source.DESCRIPTION:
The path to the file where the passed function is defined prepended by an @ (ex. "@lua/autorun/mytestfile.lua"). This will be the [CompileString](/gmod/Global.CompileString) or [RunString](/gmod/Global.RunString) identifier if the function wasn't defined in a file, also prepended by an @.

**Option: S**

short_src.NAME: short_src
short_src.DESCRIPTION:
The shortened name of the source (without the @). May be truncated if the source path is long.

**Option: S**

what.NAME: what
what.DESCRIPTION:
The language used. Either "Lua" or "C".

**Option: S**

currentline.NAME: currentline
currentline.DESCRIPTION:
The current line. This will be -1 if the code is not executed from a file.

**Option: l** (lowercase L)

name.NAME: name
name.DESCRIPTION:
The function name. This will be nil if the name cannot be found. Only works if stack level is passed rather than function pointer.

**Option: n**

namewhat.NAME: namewhat
namewhat.DESCRIPTION:
The function "type". This will be "global", "local", "method", "field". Can also be an empty string if the function name could not be found. Only works if stack level is passed rather than function pointer.

**Option: n**

isvararg.NAME: isvararg
isvararg.DESCRIPTION:
Whether the function is variadic (has a `...` argument).

**Option: u**

nparams.NAME: nparams
nparams.DESCRIPTION:
The number of arguments the function uses excluding varargs.

**Option: u**

nups.NAME: nups
nups.DESCRIPTION:
Upvalue count. Max index that can be used with [debug.getupvalue](/gmod/debug.getupvalue). C functions can have upvalues but they cannot be accessed from Lua.

**Option: u**

activelines.NAME: activelines
activelines.DESCRIPTION:
A table of all the active lines in the function - that is, lines with code that actually does something (not blank lines or lines with comments only).

The table keys will be line numbers, and their values will all be true. Lines that are inactive are simply not included in the table - they have the value nil.

It doesn't check for activeline in subfunctions.

**Option: L**

DebugInfo.DESCRIPTION:
Table returned by [debug.getinfo](/gmod/debug.getinfo).

For functions defined in C/C++, the following members will always have the given values: 

* what = "C"

* source = "[C]"

* nparams = 0

* isvararg = true

* namewhat = ""

* short_src = "[C]"

* linedefined = -1

* currentline = -1

* lastlinedefined = -1
NOTES: If a filter is applied to debug.getinfo, some members may not exist!

decay.NAME: decay
decay.DESCRIPTION:
Fade out speed.

Here's a formula for calculating Decay for your light: 1000 / fadeOutTimeInSeconds. For example setting decay to 1000 would fade out the light in 1 second, 2000 - 0.5 seconds.

dietime.NAME: dietime
dietime.DESCRIPTION:
Time after which light will be removed.

This is relative to [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime). If you put in a value that is less than or equal to [CurTime](/gmod/Global.CurTime), the light will not behave properly.

Note, that it does not affect fading out. Light will be removed regardless of it being fully faded out or not.

dir.NAME: dir
dir.DESCRIPTION: The light direction. Used with **InnerAngle** and **OuterAngle**.

innerangle.NAME: innerangle
innerangle.DESCRIPTION: The closer this is to zero, the smoother the light will be. Requires **Dir** and **OuterAngle** to be set.

outerangle.NAME: outerangle
outerangle.DESCRIPTION: The angle of the Dynamic Light. Requires **Dir** to be set.

key.NAME: key
key.DESCRIPTION: Makes the light brighter and flicker? Changing the value does not seem to affect anything.

noworld.NAME: noworld
noworld.DESCRIPTION: Don't light the world. Has no effect for elights since they never light the world.

b.NAME: b
b.DESCRIPTION: The blue part of the color

g.NAME: g
g.DESCRIPTION: The green part of the color

r.NAME: r
r.DESCRIPTION: The red part of the color

DynamicLight.DESCRIPTION:
Structure for [DynamicLight](/gmod/Global.DynamicLight).

All members are case insensitive.
NOTES: This is an actual class named **dlight_t**, not a table.

SoundName.NAME: SoundName
SoundName.DESCRIPTION:
The file path of the played sound.

Sounds prefixed with ) tell the sound engine that it is a spatial sound; this allows the sound to emit from a specific location within the world.

Sounds prefixed with ^ tell the sound engine that it is a distance based sound. The left channel of the .wav is the 'near' sound that will play when the sound originates close to you, and the right channel is the 'far' sound that will play when the sound originates far from you.

OriginalSoundName.NAME: OriginalSoundName
OriginalSoundName.DESCRIPTION:
The original file path or soundscript name.

Even if the SoundName value is changed, the OriginalSoundName value will remain the same.

Sounds may be returned as soundscripts (for example, "Weapon_357.Single") instead of the sound's file path. You can use [sound.GetProperties](/gmod/sound.GetProperties) to retrieve the actual file path.

SoundTime.NAME: SoundTime
SoundTime.DESCRIPTION:
The time at which the sound should be played.

If equal to 0 or CurTime(), the sound is played immediately. If greater than CurTime(), the sound is played with a delay. If less than CurTime(), part of the sound is skipped.

DSP.NAME: DSP
DSP.DESCRIPTION:
The DSP (digital signal processing) preset applied to the sound.

There are approximately 134 different presets defined by the Source engine between 0 and 133. These presets represent different types of 'rooms' or environments.

[List of DSP's](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

SoundLevel.NAME: SoundLevel
SoundLevel.DESCRIPTION:
The sound's attenuation, a number between 0 (low) and 511 (high)

This determines how fast the sound drops away. A higher value means the sound can be heard farther away.

See [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL).

Pitch.NAME: Pitch
Pitch.DESCRIPTION: The pitch of the played sound, a number between 0 (low) and 255 (high), where 100 is the sound's original pitch.

Flags.NAME: Flags
Flags.DESCRIPTION: The bit flags of the played sound. See [SND](/gmod/Enums/SND) for available options.

Channel.NAME: Channel
Channel.DESCRIPTION: The sound's channel. See [CHAN](/gmod/Enums/CHAN) for available options.

Volume.NAME: Volume
Volume.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the played sound, return as a decimal number between 0 (low) and 1 (high).

Entity.NAME: Entity
Entity.DESCRIPTION: The entity that played the sound.

Pos.NAME: Pos
Pos.DESCRIPTION: The origin of the played sound.

Base.NAME: Base
Base.DESCRIPTION: The base entity to derive from. This **must** be a valid Lua entity

Type.NAME: Type
Type.DESCRIPTION:
Type of the entity. This **must be one of these:**

* **anim**

* **brush**

* **point**

* **ai**

* **nextbot**

* **filter**

See [Scripted Entities](/gmod/Scripted Entities) for a more detailed explanation of what each one is.

ClassName.NAME: ClassName
ClassName.DESCRIPTION:
Entity class name of the entity (File or folder name of your entity).

**This is set automatically `after` the entity file is loaded.**

Folder.NAME: Folder
Folder.DESCRIPTION: The folder from where the entity was loaded. This should always be "entity/ent_myentity", regardless whether your entity is stored as a file, or multiple files in a folder. **This is set automatically `before` the entity file is loaded.**

AutomaticFrameAdvance.NAME: AutomaticFrameAdvance
AutomaticFrameAdvance.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Set this to true if your entity has animations. You should also apply changes to the [ENTITY:Think](/gmod/ENTITY:Think) function from the example on that page.

Category.NAME: Category
Category.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Spawnmenu category to put the entity into

Spawnable.NAME: Spawnable
Spawnable.DESCRIPTION: Whether this entity should be displayed and is spawnable in the spawn menu

Editable.NAME: Editable
Editable.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity supports Editing. See [Editable Entities](/gmod/Editable Entities) for more info.

AdminOnly.NAME: AdminOnly
AdminOnly.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not only admins can spawn the entity from their spawn menu

PrintName.NAME: PrintName
PrintName.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Nice name of the entity to appear in the spawn menu

Contact.NAME: Contact
Contact.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The contacts of the entity creator

Purpose.NAME: Purpose
Purpose.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The purpose of the entity creation

DisableDuplicator.NAME: DisableDuplicator
DisableDuplicator.DESCRIPTION: (Serverside) Disable the ability for players to duplicate this entity.

ScriptedEntityType.NAME: ScriptedEntityType
ScriptedEntityType.DESCRIPTION:
(Clientside) Sets the spawnmenu content icon type for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.

See [spawnmenu.AddContentType](/gmod/spawnmenu.AddContentType) for more information.

DoNotDuplicate.NAME: DoNotDuplicate
DoNotDuplicate.DESCRIPTION: (Serverside) If set, the entity will not be duplicated via the built-in duplicator system.

IconOverride.NAME: IconOverride
IconOverride.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside)If set, overrides the icon path to be displayed in the Spawnemnu for this entity.

ENT.DESCRIPTION:
Information about the ENT structure.

To learn more about scripted entities, [see this page](/gmod/Scripted_Entities).

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.
NOTES: Values defined in ENT table can't be changed per instance. Initialize default values in ENTITY:Initialize or other hook

Pos.NAME: Pos
Pos.DESCRIPTION: The entity's position, relative to the duplication origin point.

Angle.NAME: Angle
Angle.DESCRIPTION: The entity's angle, relative to the duplication angle.

DT.NAME: DT
DT.DESCRIPTION: The entity's Network Vars, see [ENTITY:SetupDataTables](/gmod/ENTITY:SetupDataTables) and [Networking Entities](/gmod/Networking Entities).

ModelScale.NAME: ModelScale
ModelScale.DESCRIPTION: The entity's model scale, see [Entity:GetModelScale](/gmod/Entity:GetModelScale). This will only be present if the model scale isn't 1.

ColGroup.NAME: ColGroup
ColGroup.DESCRIPTION: The entity's collision group, see [Entity:GetCollisionGroup](/gmod/Entity:GetCollisionGroup). Uses the [COLLISION_GROUP](/gmod/Enums/COLLISION_GROUP).

Mins.NAME: Mins
Mins.DESCRIPTION: The entity's collision bound minimums, see [Entity:GetCollisionBounds](/gmod/Entity:GetCollisionBounds).

Maxs.NAME: Maxs
Maxs.DESCRIPTION: The entity's collision bound maximums, see [Entity:GetCollisionBounds](/gmod/Entity:GetCollisionBounds).

PhysicsObjects.NAME: PhysicsObjects
PhysicsObjects.DESCRIPTION: Data about the entity's [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj)s, see [Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum). The key is the physics object index (starts from 0), and the value is a [PhysicsObjectSave](/gmod/Structures/PhysicsObjectSave). Unlike other tables in this structure, if there are no physics objects for this entity this will be an empty table.

Flex.NAME: Flex
Flex.DESCRIPTION: Each flex bone's flex weight, see [Entity:GetFlexWeight](/gmod/Entity:GetFlexWeight). The key is the flex's index and the value is the weight. Only flexes with a non-default (nonzero) weight are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.

BodyG.NAME: BodyG
BodyG.DESCRIPTION: The entity's body groups, see [Entity:GetBodygroup](/gmod/Entity:GetBodygroup). The key is the bodygroup ID and the value is the assigned bodygroup number. Only body groups with a non-default (> 0) value are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.

BoneManip.NAME: BoneManip
BoneManip.DESCRIPTION: Bone manipulation data, see [Entity:HasBoneManipulations](/gmod/Entity:HasBoneManipulations). The key is the bone index and the value is a [BoneManipulationData](/gmod/Structures/BoneManipulationData). Only bones that have been manipulated with non-default values are listed, and if none exist, this field will be nil.

MapCreationID.NAME: MapCreationID
MapCreationID.DESCRIPTION: The entity's MapCreationID, only exists for entities that were created by the map. See [Entity:MapCreationID](/gmod/Entity:MapCreationID).

EntityCopyData.DESCRIPTION:
Data structure used by the [duplicator](/gmod/duplicator) to store and load entity data.

It is created by [duplicator.CopyEntTable](/gmod/duplicator.CopyEntTable) and can be loaded by [duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable](/gmod/duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable).

It also shows up in several other contexts:

* [duplicator.RegisterEntityClass](/gmod/duplicator.RegisterEntityClass)

* [ENTITY:OnEntityCopyTableFinish](/gmod/ENTITY:OnEntityCopyTableFinish)

* [ENTITY:OnDuplicated](/gmod/ENTITY:OnDuplicated)
NOTES: 1=In addition to all fields listed here, any field saved on the entity will be saved as-is to this table. For example, if you set ent.FavoriteFood = "Steak" before duplicating it, this structure will also contain the field FavoriteFood with the value "Steak".

font.NAME: font
font.DESCRIPTION:
The font source. Custom font files are stored in resource/fonts/.

The length is limited to 31 characters maximum.
WARNINGS:
This must be the actual 'nice' font, not a file name. (Finding the Font Name)

This also cannot be an already registered font, i.e. you cannot base your font from any of the Default_Fonts

extended.NAME: extended
extended.DESCRIPTION: Allow the font to display glyphs that are outside of the Latin-1 range. Unicode code points above 0xFFFF are not supported.

blursize.NAME: blursize
blursize.DESCRIPTION:
The strength of the font blurring

`Range:` 0 - 80

scanlines.NAME: scanlines
scanlines.DESCRIPTION:
The "scanline" interval

Must be > 1 to work. This setting is per blursize per font - so if you create a font using "Arial" without scanlines, you cannot create an Arial font using scanlines with the same blursize

underline.NAME: underline
underline.DESCRIPTION: Add an underline to the font

symbol.NAME: symbol
symbol.DESCRIPTION: Enables the use of symbolic fonts such as Webdings

rotary.NAME: rotary
rotary.DESCRIPTION: Seems to add a line in the middle of each letter

shadow.NAME: shadow
shadow.DESCRIPTION: Add shadow casting to the font

outline.NAME: outline
outline.DESCRIPTION:
Add a black outline to the font.

This does not work well with antialias, and only allows black 1-pixel outlines. It may be preferable to not use this parameter, and instead use [draw.SimpleTextOutlined](/gmod/draw.SimpleTextOutlined) when drawing text that you want outlined.

Name.NAME: Name
Name.DESCRIPTION: The fancy name of your gamemode.

Author.NAME: Author
Author.DESCRIPTION: The name/contact info of the gamemode author.

Email.NAME: Email
Email.DESCRIPTION: The contact email associated with the gamemode.

Website.NAME: Website
Website.DESCRIPTION: The website associated with the gamemode.

FolderName.NAME: FolderName
FolderName.DESCRIPTION: The name of the gamemode folder, automatically set.

Folder.NAME: Folder
Folder.DESCRIPTION: The name of the gamemode folder prepended with "gamemodes/" (such as "gamemodes/sandbox"), automatically set.

TeamBased.NAME: TeamBased
TeamBased.DESCRIPTION: Set this to true if your gamemode is team-based. Used to enable/disable the base gamemode team system.

IsSandboxDerived.NAME: IsSandboxDerived
IsSandboxDerived.DESCRIPTION: True if the gamemode is derived from sandbox.

ThisClass.NAME: ThisClass
ThisClass.DESCRIPTION: The name of the gamemode folder prepended with "gamemode_" (such as "gamemode_sandbox"), automatically set.

BaseClass.NAME: BaseClass
BaseClass.DESCRIPTION: The table of the base gamemode to derive from, set automatically by [DeriveGamemode](/gmod/Global.DeriveGamemode).
NOTES: It is recommended to use Global.DEFINE_BASECLASS when referencing the gamemode's BaseClass to prevent unintended behavior

Global.DeriveGamemode modifies the main gamemode's BaseClass, which is shared with parent gamemodes. Because of this, in parent gamemodes the BaseClass can be incorrect, so for instance you need to use `self.BaseClass.BaseClass` in the 1st parent instead

GM.DESCRIPTION:
Information about a gamemode, used in .

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.

failed.NAME: failed
failed.DESCRIPTION:
Function to be called on failure. Arguments are

* [string](/gmod/string) reason

success.NAME: success
success.DESCRIPTION:
Function to be called on success. Arguments are

* [number](/gmod/number) code

* [string](/gmod/string) body

* [table](/gmod/table) headers

method.NAME: method
method.DESCRIPTION:
Request method, case insensitive. Possible values are:

* GET

* POST

* HEAD

* PUT

* DELETE

* PATCH

* OPTIONS

parameters.NAME: parameters
parameters.DESCRIPTION:
KeyValue table for parameters. This is only applicable to the following request methods:

* GET

* POST

* HEAD

body.NAME: body
body.DESCRIPTION: Body string for POST data. If set, will override parameters

start.NAME: start
start.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the trace

endpos.NAME: endpos
endpos.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the trace

maxs.NAME: maxs
maxs.DESCRIPTION: The 3D vector local to the start/endpos with the highest values. This will represent the corner with the upper bounds of the box.

mins.NAME: mins
mins.DESCRIPTION: The 3D vector local to the start/endpos with the lowest (often negative) values. This will represent the corner with the lower bounds of the box.

filter.NAME: filter
filter.DESCRIPTION:
Things the trace should not hit. Can also be a table of entities or a function with one argument:

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent - The entity that the trace hit

Using a function here is super slow. Try to avoid it.

mask.NAME: mask
mask.DESCRIPTION: The trace mask [MASK](/gmod/Enums/MASK). This determines what the trace should hit and what it shouldn't hit.

collisiongroup.NAME: collisiongroup
collisiongroup.DESCRIPTION: The collision group [COLLISION_GROUP](/gmod/Enums/COLLISION_GROUP). This determines what the trace should hit in regards to the entity's collision group.

ignoreworld.NAME: ignoreworld
ignoreworld.DESCRIPTION: Should the trace ignore world or not.

output.NAME: output
output.DESCRIPTION: If set, the trace result will be written to the supplied table instead of returning a new table

type.NAME: type
type.DESCRIPTION: The type of the light source, see [MATERIAL_LIGHT](/gmod/Enums/MATERIAL_LIGHT).

color.NAME: color
color.DESCRIPTION: The color of the light source (x is red, y is green, z is blue). Values are not restricted to a specific range, higher values will result in a brighter light.

pos.NAME: pos
pos.DESCRIPTION: The origin of the light in world coordinates.

dir.NAME: dir
dir.DESCRIPTION: The direction of the light. Only required for directional and spot lights.

range.NAME: range
range.DESCRIPTION: The maximum range of the light source. Does not actually control light attenuation. Usually left at 0 for infinite range.

angularFalloff.NAME: angularFalloff
angularFalloff.DESCRIPTION: Angular falloff exponent for spot lights. Higher values result in a sharper transition between the inner cone and the outer cone.

innerAngle.NAME: innerAngle
innerAngle.DESCRIPTION: The inner cone angle for spot lights, in degrees. No angular falloff will occur inside that cone.

outerAngle.NAME: outerAngle
outerAngle.DESCRIPTION: The outer cone angle for spot lights, in degrees.

fiftyPercentDistance.NAME: fiftyPercentDistance
fiftyPercentDistance.DESCRIPTION: The distance at which the light will fade to 50% of its brightness.

zeroPercentDistance.NAME: zeroPercentDistance
zeroPercentDistance.DESCRIPTION: The distance at which the light will completely fade out.

quadraticFalloff.NAME: quadraticFalloff
quadraticFalloff.DESCRIPTION: The quadratic term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

linearFalloff.NAME: linearFalloff
linearFalloff.DESCRIPTION: The linear term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

constantFalloff.NAME: constantFalloff
constantFalloff.DESCRIPTION: The constant term of the light falloff. This will only be used if fiftyPercentDistance and zeroPercentDistance are not supplied, and allows finer control over light attenuation.

name.NAME: name
name.DESCRIPTION: The name of the material proxy

init.NAME: init
init.DESCRIPTION:
The function used to get variables from the ".vmt". Called once per each ".vmt". Arguments are:

* [table](/gmod/table) self

* [string](/gmod/string) materialName

* [table](/gmod/table) values

bind.NAME: bind
bind.DESCRIPTION:
The function used to apply the proxy. This is called every frame while any materials with this proxy are used in world. Arguments are:

* [table](/gmod/table) self

* [string](/gmod/string) materialName

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent

normal.NAME: normal
normal.DESCRIPTION: The triangles normal required to calculate lighting(optional).

tangent.NAME: tangent
tangent.DESCRIPTION: The triangles tangent. Not used by the VertexLitGeneric shader.

binormal.NAME: binormal
binormal.DESCRIPTION: The triangles binormal. Not used by the VertexLitGeneric shader.

userdata.NAME: userdata
userdata.DESCRIPTION: A table of four numbers. This is used by most shaders in Source to hold tangent information of the vertex ( tangentX, tangentY, tangentZ, tangentHandedness ).

MeshVertex.DESCRIPTION: Table used by various functions, such as [IMesh:BuildFromTriangles](/gmod/IMesh:BuildFromTriangles).

RPM.NAME: RPM
RPM.DESCRIPTION: The current RPM of the vehicle

gear.NAME: gear
gear.DESCRIPTION: The current gear of the vehicle, starting from 0

speed.NAME: speed
speed.DESCRIPTION: The current speed, in inches per second

area.NAME: area
area.DESCRIPTION: The navmesh area this segment occupies.

curvature.NAME: curvature
curvature.DESCRIPTION: How much of a curve should the bot execute when navigating this segment. 0 = none, 1 = 180°

distanceFromStart.NAME: distanceFromStart
distanceFromStart.DESCRIPTION: Distance of this segment from the start of the path.

forward.NAME: forward
forward.DESCRIPTION: The direction of travel to reach the end of this segment from the start, represented as a normalised vector.

how.NAME: how
how.DESCRIPTION: The direction of travel to reach the end of this segment from the start, represented as a cardinal direction integer 0 to 3, or 9 for vertical movement.

ladder.NAME: ladder
ladder.DESCRIPTION: The navmesh ladder this segment occupies, if any.

pos.NAME: pos
pos.DESCRIPTION: The position of the end of this segment.

type.NAME: type
type.DESCRIPTION:
The movement type of this segment, indicating how bots are expected to move along this segment.

* 0 is ground movement

* 1 is falling down

* 2 is climbing up or jumping

* 3 is jumping over a gap

* 4 is climbing a ladder up (unused)

* 5 is climbing a ladder down (unused)

PathSegment.DESCRIPTION: Structure represents a path segment, returned by [PathFollower:GetCurrentGoal](/gmod/PathFollower:GetCurrentGoal), [PathFollower:FirstSegment](/gmod/PathFollower:FirstSegment) and [PathFollower:LastSegment](/gmod/PathFollower:LastSegment).

LookAheadTimeObjectsVsObject.NAME: LookAheadTimeObjectsVsObject
LookAheadTimeObjectsVsObject.DESCRIPTION: Maximum amount of seconds to precalculate collisions with objects.

LookAheadTimeObjectsVsWorld.NAME: LookAheadTimeObjectsVsWorld
LookAheadTimeObjectsVsWorld.DESCRIPTION: Maximum amount of seconds to precalculate collisions with world.

MaxCollisionsPerObjectPerTimestep.NAME: MaxCollisionsPerObjectPerTimestep
MaxCollisionsPerObjectPerTimestep.DESCRIPTION: Maximum collision per object per tick.

MaxFrictionMass.NAME: MaxFrictionMass
MaxFrictionMass.DESCRIPTION: Maximum mass of an object to be affected by friction.

MinFrictionMass.NAME: MinFrictionMass
MinFrictionMass.DESCRIPTION: Minimum mass of an object to be affected by friction.

Pos.NAME: Pos
Pos.DESCRIPTION: The entity's world position made local with [WorldToLocal](/gmod/Global.WorldToLocal)

Angle.NAME: Angle
Angle.DESCRIPTION: The entity's world angles made local with [WorldToLocal](/gmod/Global.WorldToLocal)

Frozen.NAME: Frozen
Frozen.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is moveable. Equal to (`not` [PhysObj:IsMoveable](/gmod/PhysObj:IsMoveable))

NoGrav.NAME: NoGrav
NoGrav.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity's gravity is affected by gravity or not. [PhysObj:IsGravityEnabled](/gmod/PhysObj:IsGravityEnabled)

Sleep.NAME: Sleep
Sleep.DESCRIPTION: Whether the entity is dormant or not. [PhysObj:IsAsleep](/gmod/PhysObj:IsAsleep)

PhysicsObjectSave.DESCRIPTION:
Structure used in storing/restoring physics object attributes.

[duplicator.GenericDuplicatorFunction](/gmod/duplicator.GenericDuplicatorFunction) and [duplicator.DoGenericPhysics](/gmod/duplicator.DoGenericPhysics) use a table of PhysicsObjectSaves with the struct's index in the table being the physics object ID.

Pos and Angle are set by the following:

```

Pos, Angle = WorldToLocal(phys:GetPos(), phys:GetAngle(), Vector( 0, 0, 0 ), Angle( 0, 0, 0 ))

```

GravityToggle.NAME: GravityToggle
GravityToggle.DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables gravity for the entity

Material.NAME: Material
Material.DESCRIPTION: Sets the physics material for the entity

DisplayName.NAME: DisplayName
DisplayName.DESCRIPTION: The 'nice' name of the player class for display in User Interface and such.

WalkSpeed.NAME: WalkSpeed
WalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION: How fast to move when not running

RunSpeed.NAME: RunSpeed
RunSpeed.DESCRIPTION: How fast to move when running/sprinting

CrouchedWalkSpeed.NAME: CrouchedWalkSpeed
CrouchedWalkSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Multiply walk speed by this when crouching

DuckSpeed.NAME: DuckSpeed
DuckSpeed.DESCRIPTION: How fast to go from not ducking, to ducking

UnDuckSpeed.NAME: UnDuckSpeed
UnDuckSpeed.DESCRIPTION: How fast to go from ducking, to not ducking

JumpPower.NAME: JumpPower
JumpPower.DESCRIPTION: How powerful a jump should be

CanUseFlashlight.NAME: CanUseFlashlight
CanUseFlashlight.DESCRIPTION: Can the player use the flashlight

StartHealth.NAME: StartHealth
StartHealth.DESCRIPTION: How much health we start with

StartArmor.NAME: StartArmor
StartArmor.DESCRIPTION: How much armour we start with

DropWeaponOnDie.NAME: DropWeaponOnDie
DropWeaponOnDie.DESCRIPTION: Do we drop our weapon when we die

TeammateNoCollide.NAME: TeammateNoCollide
TeammateNoCollide.DESCRIPTION: Do we collide with teammates or run straight through them

PLAYER.DESCRIPTION: This page describes all **default** fields for a [player class](/gmod/Player_Classes).

x.NAME: x
x.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate of the vertex.

y.NAME: y
y.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate of the vertex.

u.NAME: u
u.DESCRIPTION: The u texture coordinate of the vertex. `Can be left blank.`

v.NAME: v
v.DESCRIPTION: The v texture coordinate of the vertex. `Can be left blank.`

PolygonVertex.DESCRIPTION:
A structure containing vertex information for use with [surface.DrawPoly](/gmod/surface.DrawPoly).

UV coordinates describe which part of a given texture should be drawn at a vertex - your graphics card's interpolator will fill in space between vertices. UV coords range from `0-1`, with `0` being top/left and `1` being bottom/right. If you're using a texture these are mandatory.
NOTES:
You must pass a table of tables with this structure to the function. **You need to pass at least 3 points.**

Your points must be defined in a **clockwise order.** Otherwise, your shape will not render.

Type.NAME: Type
Type.DESCRIPTION: Can be set to "toggle" to make this property a toggle property.

MenuLabel.NAME: MenuLabel
MenuLabel.DESCRIPTION: Label to show on opened menu

MenuIcon.NAME: MenuIcon
MenuIcon.DESCRIPTION: Icon to show on opened menu for this item. Optional for simple properties and unused for toggle properties.

StructureField (Order).NAME: StructureField (Order)
StructureField (Order).DESCRIPTION:
Where in the list should the property be positioned, relative to other properties.

For reference, here are the default properties and their Order values:

Property |  Order |

---------|-------|

| Bone Manipulate | 500 |

| Bodygroups | 600 |

| Skin | 601 |

| Keep Upright | 900 |

| Ignite/Extinguish | 999 |

| Remove | 1000 |

| Gravity | 1001 |

| Drive | 1100 |

| Collision | 1500 |

| Statue | 1501 |

| NPC Biggify/Smallify | 1799, 1800 |

| Motion Control (Kinect) | 2500 |

| [Edit Properties](/gmod/Editable_Entities) | 90001 |

PrependSpacer.NAME: PrependSpacer
PrependSpacer.DESCRIPTION: Whether to add a spacer before this property. This should generally be true for the first property in a group of properties.

Filter.NAME: Filter
Filter.DESCRIPTION:
Used **clientside** to decide whether this property should be shown for an entity. Gets these arguments:

* [table](/gmod/table) self - the property table

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent - the entity the player clicked

Return true if the property should be shown for this entity. It's good practice to call [SANDBOX:CanProperty](/gmod/SANDBOX:CanProperty) in this hook via [gamemode.Call](/gmod/gamemode.Call) or [hook.Run](/gmod/hook.Run).

Checked.NAME: Checked
Checked.DESCRIPTION:
Required for toggle properties (clientside). Must return a boolean value to either check or uncheck the toggle property.

* [table](/gmod/table) self - the property table

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent - the entity the player clicked

* [table](/gmod/table) tr - the player's eye trace

Action.NAME: Action
Action.DESCRIPTION:
Called **clientside** when the property is clicked with these arguments:

* [table](/gmod/table) self - the property table

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent - the entity the player clicked

* [table](/gmod/table) tr - the player's eye trace

When appropriate, within this function you can call self:MsgStart(), write data with the [net](/gmod/net) 'Write' functions, and finish with self:MsgEnd(). This will activate the 'Receive' function on the server. In most cases, you will want to send the entity to the server, as it's not done by default.

Receive.NAME: Receive
Receive.DESCRIPTION:
Called **serverside** if the client sends a message in the 'Action' function (see above).

* [table](/gmod/table) self - the property table

* [number](/gmod/number) len - the net message length, although this includes the property identifier used internally (the name of the property)

* [Player](/gmod/Player) ply - the player who clicked the property

You can read data received from the client with the [net](/gmod/net) 'Read' functions. It's good practice to check [SANDBOX:CanProperty](/gmod/SANDBOX:CanProperty) here via [gamemode.Call](/gmod/gamemode.Call) or [hook.Run](/gmod/hook.Run).

MenuOpen.NAME: MenuOpen
MenuOpen.DESCRIPTION:
Called **clientside** when the property option has been created in the right-click menu. This is not called for toggle properties!

* [table](/gmod/table) self - the property table

* [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) option - the menu option

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent - the entity the player right-clicked

* [table](/gmod/table) tr - the player's eye trace

OnCreate.NAME: OnCreate
OnCreate.DESCRIPTION:
Same as MenuOpen, but also called for toggle properties and has different arguments. This is called immediately after MenuOpen, but nothing happens in between so you should only ever use one or the other.

* [table](/gmod/table) self - the property table

* [DMenu](/gmod/DMenu) menu - the property menu

* [DMenuOption](/gmod/DMenuOption) option - the menu option

x.NAME: x
x.DESCRIPTION: The x position of the view port

y.NAME: y
y.DESCRIPTION: The y position of the view port

w.NAME: w
w.DESCRIPTION: The width of the view port

h.NAME: h
h.DESCRIPTION: The height of the view port

type.NAME: type
type.DESCRIPTION:
The type of cam. Valid types are:

* "2D" - No additional arguments are required

* "3D" - Only origin and angles are needed, all other parameters are optional.

aspect.NAME: aspect
aspect.DESCRIPTION: The aspect ratio of the view port (Note that this is NOT set to w/h by default)

zfar.NAME: zfar
zfar.DESCRIPTION: The distance to the far clipping plane

znear.NAME: znear
znear.DESCRIPTION: The distance to the near clipping plane

subrect.NAME: subrect
subrect.DESCRIPTION: Set to true if this is to draw into a subrect of the larger screen.

offcenter.NAME: offcenter
offcenter.DESCRIPTION:
A table having these keys: ( all floats )

* left

* right

* bottom

* top

ortho.NAME: ortho
ortho.DESCRIPTION:
If set, makes the view/camera orthogonal. A table having these keys: ( all floats )

* left

* right

* bottom

* top

RenderCamData.DESCRIPTION:
Used for [cam.Start](/gmod/cam.Start).

Unless stated otherwise, the default values for all these keys would be inherited from the engine's current CViewSetup and do not have static representations.

format.NAME: format
format.DESCRIPTION:
Format of the capture. Valid formats are:

* `jpeg` or `jpg`

* `png`

x.NAME: x
x.DESCRIPTION: X coordinate of the capture origin

y.NAME: y
y.DESCRIPTION: Y coordinate of the capture origin

quality.NAME: quality
quality.DESCRIPTION: The quality of the capture. Affects jpeg only.

alpha.NAME: alpha
alpha.DESCRIPTION: Set to false to capture an image with alpha channel set to fully opaque. Affects png only.

activityname.NAME: activityname
activityname.DESCRIPTION: Name of the activity this sequence is attached to.

activity.NAME: activity
activity.DESCRIPTION: The activity ID associated with this sequence. See [ACT](/gmod/Enums/ACT).

actweight.NAME: actweight
actweight.DESCRIPTION: How likely this sequence is to be picked when playing an activity its attached to. -1 means this is the only sequence for that activity. (needs validation)

flags.NAME: flags
flags.DESCRIPTION: The looping and other flags of this sequence.

numevents.NAME: numevents
numevents.DESCRIPTION: Number of animation events this sequence has.

bbmin.NAME: bbmin
bbmin.DESCRIPTION: Mins part of the bounding box for this sequence

bbmax.NAME: bbmax
bbmax.DESCRIPTION: Maxs part of the bounding box for this sequence

fadeintime.NAME: fadeintime
fadeintime.DESCRIPTION: ideal cross fade in time (0.2 default)

fadeouttime.NAME: fadeouttime
fadeouttime.DESCRIPTION: ideal cross fade out time (0.2 default)

nextseq.NAME: nextseq
nextseq.DESCRIPTION: If non 0, the next sequence for auto advancing sequences

cycleposeindex.NAME: cycleposeindex
cycleposeindex.DESCRIPTION: If non 0, index of pose parameter to be used as cycle index. This means that the sequence playback will be controlled by a pose parameter.

anims.NAME: anims
anims.DESCRIPTION: A 1-based array of all animationIDs associated with this sequence. For use with [Entity:GetAnimInfo](/gmod/Entity:GetAnimInfo).

GameDir.NAME: GameDir
GameDir.DESCRIPTION: The game directory to get the servers for

Type.NAME: Type
Type.DESCRIPTION:
Type of servers to retrieve. Valid values are:

* "internet"

* "favorite"

* "history"

* "lan"

AppID.NAME: AppID
AppID.DESCRIPTION: Steam application ID to get the servers for

Callback.NAME: Callback
Callback.DESCRIPTION:
Called when a new server is found and queried. Arguments:

[number](/gmod/number) ping - Latency to the server.

[string](/gmod/string) name - Name of the server

[string](/gmod/string) desc - "Nice" gamemode name

[string](/gmod/string) map - Current map

[number](/gmod/number) players - Total player number ( bot + human )

[number](/gmod/number) maxplayers - Maximum reported amount of players

[number](/gmod/number) botplayers - Amount of bots on the server

[boolean](/gmod/boolean) pass - Whether this server has password or not

[number](/gmod/number) lastplayed - Time when you last played on this server, as UNIX timestamp or 0

[string](/gmod/string) address - IP Address of the server

[string](/gmod/string) gamemode - Gamemode folder name

[number](/gmod/number) workshopid - Gamemode Steam Workshop ID

Return false to stop the query.

Finished.NAME: Finished
Finished.DESCRIPTION: Called when the query is finished. No arguments

channel.NAME: channel
channel.DESCRIPTION: The sound channel to play in. See [CHAN](/gmod/Enums/CHAN)

pitchend.NAME: pitchend
pitchend.DESCRIPTION: The pitch end. Deprecated, use pitch.

pitchstart.NAME: pitchstart
pitchstart.DESCRIPTION: The initial pitch. Deprecated, use pitch.

level.NAME: level
level.DESCRIPTION: The soundlevel of the sound in dB. See [SNDLVL](/gmod/Enums/SNDLVL).

sound.NAME: sound
sound.DESCRIPTION: The sound file to be used in this sound effect. Can be a table of sound files. Relative to "sound" directory (must be in a subfolder, so sound/test.wav will not work).

volume.NAME: volume
volume.DESCRIPTION:
The volume of the sound as a decimal between `0` and `1`. Can be a table of two numbers, a minimum and a maximum value.

**Warning:** Volume of `0` will act as volume of `1`

pitch.NAME: pitch
pitch.DESCRIPTION: The pitch of the sound. Can be a table of two numbers, a minimum and a maximum value.

obstruction.NAME: obstruction
obstruction.DESCRIPTION: Indicates how obstructed the sun is, 1 not visible, 0 fully visible

name.NAME: name
name.DESCRIPTION: The name of the surface property, identical to [util.GetSurfacePropName](/gmod/util.GetSurfacePropName).

hardnessFactor.NAME: hardnessFactor
hardnessFactor.DESCRIPTION: How hard a surface is. If this is greater than or equal to another surfaces's hardThreshold, a hard impact sound will be used.

hardThreshold.NAME: hardThreshold
hardThreshold.DESCRIPTION: Hardness threshold for impact sounds. HitSurface.hardnessFactor >= InflictorSurface.hardThreshold - hard impact sound (depends on hardVelocityThreshold's value), HitSurface.hardnessFactor < InflictorSurface.hardThreshold - soft impact sound (always).

hardVelocityThreshold.NAME: hardVelocityThreshold
hardVelocityThreshold.DESCRIPTION: Velocity threshold for impact sounds. impactSpeed >= HitSurface.hardVelocityThreshold - hard impact sound (depends on hardThreshold's value), impactSpeed < HitSurface.hardVelocityThreshold - soft impact sound (always).

reflectivity.NAME: reflectivity
reflectivity.DESCRIPTION: Amount of sound reflected from the surface represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0 - no reflection, 1 - fully reflected.

roughnessFactor.NAME: roughnessFactor
roughnessFactor.DESCRIPTION: How rough a surface is. If this is greater than or equal to another surfaces's roughThreshold, a rough scrape sound will be used.

roughThreshold.NAME: roughThreshold
roughThreshold.DESCRIPTION: Roughness threshold for friction sounds. HitSurface.roughnessFactor >= InflictorSurface.roughThreshold - rough friction sound, HitSurface.roughnessFactor < InflictorSurface.roughThreshold - soft friction sound.

climbable.NAME: climbable
climbable.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether or not the surface is a ladder. Used to detect whether a player is on a ladder. 0 - false, > 0 - true.

jumpFactor.NAME: jumpFactor
jumpFactor.DESCRIPTION: Scalar multiplier for player jump height - or more accurately, applied z-axis velocity on a surface. For example, 1 - normal jump, 2 - twice as high, and 0.5 - half as high.

maxSpeedFactor.NAME: maxSpeedFactor
maxSpeedFactor.DESCRIPTION: Scalar multiplier for player speed. Achieves this by multiplying [CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed](/gmod/CMoveData:SetMaxSpeed) in [GM:Move](/gmod/GM:Move).

dampening.NAME: dampening
dampening.DESCRIPTION: This is the physical drag on an object when in contact with this surface (0 - x, 0 none to x a lot).

density.NAME: density
density.DESCRIPTION: Material density in kg / m^3 (water is 1000). If a surface's density is < 1000, it will float in water. This is used to calculate the total mass of an object.

elasticity.NAME: elasticity
elasticity.DESCRIPTION: Collision elasticity - used to compute coefficient of restitution represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0.01 is soft, 1.0 is hard.

friction.NAME: friction
friction.DESCRIPTION: Physical friction used to slow entities touching the surface represented as a number 0.0 - 1.0. 0.01 is slick, 1.0 is completely rough.

thickness.NAME: thickness
thickness.DESCRIPTION: Material thickness. If this is 0, the material is not volumetrically solid, and thus the object mass will be calculated as "volume * 0.0254^3 * density" where 0.0254 is meters per inch. If non-zero, the mass will be "surfacearea * thickness * 0.0254^3 * density".

breakSound.NAME: breakSound
breakSound.DESCRIPTION: Sound to play when a prop or func_breakable is broken.

bulletImpactSound.NAME: bulletImpactSound
bulletImpactSound.DESCRIPTION: Bullet impact sound with this surface.

impactHardSound.NAME: impactHardSound
impactHardSound.DESCRIPTION: Physical impact sound when hitting surfaces hard.

impactSoftSound.NAME: impactSoftSound
impactSoftSound.DESCRIPTION: Physical impact sound when hitting surfaces softly.

scrapeRoughSound.NAME: scrapeRoughSound
scrapeRoughSound.DESCRIPTION: Friction sound when roughly scraping against an entity.

scrapeSmoothSound.NAME: scrapeSmoothSound
scrapeSmoothSound.DESCRIPTION: Friction sound when smoothly scraping against an entity.

ClassName.NAME: ClassName
ClassName.DESCRIPTION: Entity class name of the SWEP (file or folder name of your SWEP). This is set automatically

Spawnable.NAME: Spawnable
Spawnable.DESCRIPTION: Whether this SWEP should be displayed in the Q menu

AdminOnly.NAME: AdminOnly
AdminOnly.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not only admins can spawn the SWEP from their Q menu

Base.NAME: Base
Base.DESCRIPTION: The base weapon to derive from. This **must** be a Lua weapon

Owner.NAME: Owner
Owner.DESCRIPTION: The entity that owns/wields this SWEP, if any. This is an __index override and not an actual key, so [rawget](/gmod/Global.rawget)(self:GetTable(), "Owner") will return `nil`.
DEPRECATED: Use Entity:GetOwner() instead, which is slightly faster.

Weapon.NAME: Weapon
Weapon.DESCRIPTION: This is equivalent to `self` in SWEP functions. This only exists for legacy code.

Author.NAME: Author
Author.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The author of the SWEP to be shown in weapon selection

Contact.NAME: Contact
Contact.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The contacts of the SWEP creator to be shown in weapon selection

Purpose.NAME: Purpose
Purpose.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The purpose of the SWEP creator to be shown in weapon selection

Instructions.NAME: Instructions
Instructions.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) How to use your weapon, to be shown in weapon selection

ViewModel.NAME: ViewModel
ViewModel.DESCRIPTION: Path to the view model for your SWEP (what the wielder will see)

ViewModelFlip.NAME: ViewModelFlip
ViewModelFlip.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Should we flip the view model? This is needed for some CS:S view models

ViewModelFlip1.NAME: ViewModelFlip1
ViewModelFlip1.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Same as ViewModelFlip, but for the second viewmodel

ViewModelFlip2.NAME: ViewModelFlip2
ViewModelFlip2.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Same as ViewModelFlip, but for the third viewmodel

ViewModelFOV.NAME: ViewModelFOV
ViewModelFOV.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) An angle of FOV used for the view model (Half-Life value is 90; Half-Life 2 is 54; Counter-Strike: Source is 74; Day of Defeat: Source is 45)

WorldModel.NAME: WorldModel
WorldModel.DESCRIPTION: The world model for your SWEP (what you will see in other players hands)

AutoSwitchFrom.NAME: AutoSwitchFrom
AutoSwitchFrom.DESCRIPTION: (Serverside) Whether this weapon can be autoswitched away from when the player runs out of ammo in this weapon or picks up another weapon or ammo

AutoSwitchTo.NAME: AutoSwitchTo
AutoSwitchTo.DESCRIPTION: (Serverside) Whether this weapon can be autoswitched to when the player runs out of ammo in their current weapon or they pick this weapon up

Weight.NAME: Weight
Weight.DESCRIPTION: (Serverside) Determines the priority of the weapon when autoswitching. The weapon being autoswitched from will attempt to switch to a weapon with the same weight that has ammo, but if none exists, it will prioritise higher weight weapons.

BobScale.NAME: BobScale
BobScale.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The scale of the viewmodel bob (viewmodel movement from left to right when walking around)

SwayScale.NAME: SwayScale
SwayScale.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) The scale of the viewmodel sway (viewmodel position lerp when looking around).

BounceWeaponIcon.NAME: BounceWeaponIcon
BounceWeaponIcon.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Should the weapon icon bounce in weapon selection?

DrawWeaponInfoBox.NAME: DrawWeaponInfoBox
DrawWeaponInfoBox.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Should draw the weapon selection info box, containing SWEP.Instructions, etc.

DrawAmmo.NAME: DrawAmmo
DrawAmmo.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Should we draw the default HL2 ammo counter?

DrawCrosshair.NAME: DrawCrosshair
DrawCrosshair.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Should we draw the default crosshair?

Slot.NAME: Slot
Slot.DESCRIPTION: Slot in the weapon selection menu, starts with 0

SlotPos.NAME: SlotPos
SlotPos.DESCRIPTION: Position in the slot, should be in the range 0-128

SpeechBubbleLid.NAME: SpeechBubbleLid
SpeechBubbleLid.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Internal variable for drawing the info box in weapon selection

WepSelectIcon.NAME: WepSelectIcon
WepSelectIcon.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Path to an texture. Override this in your SWEP to set the icon in the weapon selection. This must be the texture ID, see [surface.GetTextureID](/gmod/surface.GetTextureID)

CSMuzzleFlashes.NAME: CSMuzzleFlashes
CSMuzzleFlashes.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Should we use Counter-Strike muzzle flashes upon firing? This is required for DoD:S or CS:S view models to fix their muzzle flashes.

CSMuzzleX.NAME: CSMuzzleX
CSMuzzleX.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Use the X shape muzzle flash instead of the default Counter-Strike muzzle flash. Requires CSMuzzleFlashes to be set to true

Primary.NAME: Primary
Primary.DESCRIPTION:
Primary attack settings. The table contains these fields:

* [string](/gmod/string) Ammo - Ammo type ("Pistol", "SMG1" etc)

* [number](/gmod/number) ClipSize - The maximum amount of bullets one clip can hold

* [number](/gmod/number) DefaultClip - Default ammo in the clip, making it higher than ClipSize will give player additional ammo on spawn

* [boolean](/gmod/boolean) Automatic - If true makes the weapon shoot automatically as long as the player has primary attack button held down

Secondary.NAME: Secondary
Secondary.DESCRIPTION: Secondary attack settings, has same fields as Primary attack settings

UseHands.NAME: UseHands
UseHands.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Makes the player models hands bonemerged onto the view model
WARNINGS:
The gamemode and view models **must** support this feature for it to work!

You can find more information here: Using_Viewmodel_Hands

Folder.NAME: Folder
Folder.DESCRIPTION: The folder from where the weapon was loaded. This should always be "weapons/weapon_myweapon", regardless whether your SWEP is stored as a file, or multiple files in a folder. It is set automatically on load

AccurateCrosshair.NAME: AccurateCrosshair
AccurateCrosshair.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside) Makes the default SWEP crosshair be positioned in 3D space where your aim actually is (like on Jeep), instead of simply sitting in the middle of the screen at all times

DisableDuplicator.NAME: DisableDuplicator
DisableDuplicator.DESCRIPTION: Disable the ability for players to duplicate this SWEP

ScriptedEntityType.NAME: ScriptedEntityType
ScriptedEntityType.DESCRIPTION:
(Clientside) Sets the spawnmenu content icon type for the entity, used by spawnmenu in the Sandbox-derived gamemodes.

See [spawnmenu.AddContentType](/gmod/spawnmenu.AddContentType) for more information.

m_bPlayPickupSound.NAME: m_bPlayPickupSound
m_bPlayPickupSound.DESCRIPTION: If set to false, the weapon will not play the weapon pick up sound when picked up.

IconOverride.NAME: IconOverride
IconOverride.DESCRIPTION: (Clientside)If set, overrides the icon path to be displayed in the Spawnemnu for this entity.

SWEP.DESCRIPTION:
Information about a [Scripted Weapons](/gmod/Scripted_Entities), used by [SANDBOX:PlayerGiveSWEP](/gmod/SANDBOX:PlayerGiveSWEP) and in SWEP creation.

For list of callbacks, see `WEAPON` hooks.

While some of the fields may be serverside or clientside only, it is recommended to provide them on both so addons could use their values.

Joinable.NAME: Joinable
Joinable.DESCRIPTION: Whether the team is joinable or not.

font.NAME: font
font.DESCRIPTION: The font to draw with. List of default fonts can be found [here](/gmod/Default_Fonts).

pos.NAME: pos
pos.DESCRIPTION: This holds the X and Y coordinates. Key value 1 is x, key value 2 is y.

xalign.NAME: xalign
xalign.DESCRIPTION: The alignment of the X position. See [TEXT_ALIGN](/gmod/Enums/TEXT_ALIGN)

yalign.NAME: yalign
yalign.DESCRIPTION: The alignment of the Y position. See [TEXT_ALIGN](/gmod/Enums/TEXT_ALIGN)

texture.NAME: texture
texture.DESCRIPTION: surface.GetTextureID number of the texture to be drawn.

AddToMenu.NAME: AddToMenu
AddToMenu.DESCRIPTION: If set to false, the tool won't be added to the tool menu and players will have to access it by other means.

Category.NAME: Category
Category.DESCRIPTION: The tool menu category under which the tool should be listed.

Command.NAME: Command
Command.DESCRIPTION: The console command to execute upon being selected in the Q menu.

Name.NAME: Name
Name.DESCRIPTION:
The name of the tool in the Q menu.

Common practice is to set this to "#tool.[lua filename].name" to match the name displayed in the tool information box.

ClientConVar.NAME: ClientConVar
ClientConVar.DESCRIPTION:
A key-value ( convar name-default value ) table containing the client-side convars to create. All convars will be prefixed with the filename of the tool.

You can later use [Tool:GetClientNumber](/gmod/Tool:GetClientNumber) or [Tool:GetClientInfo](/gmod/Tool:GetClientInfo) to retrieve these values.

ServerConVar.NAME: ServerConVar
ServerConVar.DESCRIPTION: Same as above, but created server-side instead.

BuildCPanel.NAME: BuildCPanel
BuildCPanel.DESCRIPTION:
The function that is called to build the context menu for your tool. It has one argument, namely the context menu's base panel to which all of your custom panels are going to be parented to.

While it might sound like a hook, it isn't - you won't receive a self argument inside the function.

Information.NAME: Information
Information.DESCRIPTION:
Allows you to override the tool usage information shown when the tool is equipped.

See [Tool Information Display](/gmod/Tool Information Display) for more information.

Mode.NAME: Mode
Mode.DESCRIPTION:
Class name of the tool. (name of the .lua file)

This is set automatically.

Tab.NAME: Tab
Tab.DESCRIPTION: The tool tab ([spawnmenu.AddToolTab](/gmod/spawnmenu.AddToolTab)) to add this tool to. (The internal name, first argument)

TOOL.DESCRIPTION:
The TOOL table is used in Sandbox tool creation. You can find a list of callbacks on the  page and a list of methods on the  page. Do note that some of the fields below have no effect on server-side operations.

The tool information box drawn on the HUD while your tool is selected has 2 values that are set by [language.Add](/gmod/language.Add).

* `tool.[tool mode].name` - The tool name (Note this is NOT the same as TOOL.Name)

* `tool.[tool mode].desc` - The tool description

Ensure that all tool file names are entirely lowercase.  Including capital letters can lead to unintended behavior.

x.NAME: x
x.DESCRIPTION: The x coordinate on the players screen

y.NAME: y
y.DESCRIPTION: The y coordinate on the players screen

visible.NAME: visible
visible.DESCRIPTION: The coordinate is not behind the player. **This does not mean the coordinate is on the screen.** When this is false, it means that the coordinate would not be on the screen even if the player had a full 180 degree FOV.

start.NAME: start
start.DESCRIPTION: The start position of the trace

endpos.NAME: endpos
endpos.DESCRIPTION: The end position of the trace

filter.NAME: filter
filter.DESCRIPTION:
Things the trace should not hit. Can also be a table of entities or a function with one argument:

* [Entity](/gmod/Entity) ent - The entity that the trace hit

Return true in the function to hit the entity, false to skip it.
WARNINGS: Using a function here is super slow - try to avoid it.

mask.NAME: mask
mask.DESCRIPTION: The trace mask [MASK](/gmod/Enums/MASK). This determines what the trace should hit and what it shouldn't hit. A mask is a combination of [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS) - you can use these for more advanced masks.

collisiongroup.NAME: collisiongroup
collisiongroup.DESCRIPTION: The collision group [COLLISION_GROUP](/gmod/Enums/COLLISION_GROUP). This determines what the trace should hit in regards to the entity's collision group.

ignoreworld.NAME: ignoreworld
ignoreworld.DESCRIPTION: Should the trace ignore world or not

output.NAME: output
output.DESCRIPTION: If set, the trace result will be written to the supplied table instead of returning a new table

Entity.NAME: Entity
Entity.DESCRIPTION: The entity hit by the trace.

Fraction.NAME: Fraction
Fraction.DESCRIPTION: This indicates the how much of your trace length was used from 0-1 (resultLength/originalLength).

FractionLeftSolid.NAME: FractionLeftSolid
FractionLeftSolid.DESCRIPTION: Given the trace started in a solid enviroment, this will return at what distance the trace left the solid from 0-1. Doesn't work if the trace hit a non-worldspawn entity.

Hit.NAME: Hit
Hit.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether the trace hit something.

HitBox.NAME: HitBox
HitBox.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the hitbox hit by the trace.

HitGroup.NAME: HitGroup
HitGroup.DESCRIPTION: [HITGROUP](/gmod/Enums/HITGROUP) describing what hitgroup the trace hit (not the same as HitBox).

HitNoDraw.NAME: HitNoDraw
HitNoDraw.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whenever the trace hit a no-draw brush.

HitNonWorld.NAME: HitNonWorld
HitNonWorld.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whenever the trace did not hit the world.

HitNormal.NAME: HitNormal
HitNormal.DESCRIPTION: The direction of the surface that was hit as a normal vector (vector with [length](/gmod/Vector:Length) of 1).

HitPos.NAME: HitPos
HitPos.DESCRIPTION: The position the trace stopped. This will be the provided endpos if the trace hit nothing.

HitSky.NAME: HitSky
HitSky.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whenever the trace hit the sky.

HitTexture.NAME: HitTexture
HitTexture.DESCRIPTION: The surface material (not texture) of whatever the trace hit. Will be `**displacement**` if the trace hit a displacement, and `**studio**` if it hit a prop.

HitWorld.NAME: HitWorld
HitWorld.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whenever the trace hit the world.

MatType.NAME: MatType
MatType.DESCRIPTION: [MAT](/gmod/Enums/MAT) of the material hit by the trace.

Normal.NAME: Normal
Normal.DESCRIPTION: The direction of the trace as a normal vector (vector with [length](/gmod/Vector:Length) of 1).

PhysicsBone.NAME: PhysicsBone
PhysicsBone.DESCRIPTION:
The [PhysObj](/gmod/PhysObj) ID that was hit.

Used for [Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum](/gmod/Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum).

StartPos.NAME: StartPos
StartPos.DESCRIPTION: The origin of the trace. Will match the provided startpos.

SurfaceProps.NAME: SurfaceProps
SurfaceProps.DESCRIPTION:
ID of hit surface property from `scripts/surfaceproperties.txt`.

You can get the name using [util.GetSurfacePropName](/gmod/util.GetSurfacePropName).

Used for [CEffectData:SetSurfaceProp](/gmod/CEffectData:SetSurfaceProp).

StartSolid.NAME: StartSolid
StartSolid.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whenever the trace started in a solid enviroment.

AllSolid.NAME: AllSolid
AllSolid.DESCRIPTION: True if the entire trace is inside a solid.

SurfaceFlags.NAME: SurfaceFlags
SurfaceFlags.DESCRIPTION: The surface flags of the hit surface. See [SURF](/gmod/Enums/SURF).

DispFlags.NAME: DispFlags
DispFlags.DESCRIPTION: The displacement flags of the hit surface. See [DISPSURF](/gmod/Enums/DISPSURF).

Contents.NAME: Contents
Contents.DESCRIPTION: The contents of the hit surface. See [CONTENTS](/gmod/Enums/CONTENTS).

TraceResult.DESCRIPTION: Table structure used as trace result. Default values are when the trace hits nothing.

title.NAME: title
title.DESCRIPTION: The title of the Workshop item

description.NAME: description
description.DESCRIPTION: The description of the Workshop item

fileid.NAME: fileid
fileid.DESCRIPTION: The internal File ID of the workshop item, if any

previewid.NAME: previewid
previewid.DESCRIPTION: The internal File ID of the workshop item preview, if any

owner.NAME: owner
owner.DESCRIPTION: The SteamID64 of the original uploader of the addon

created.NAME: created
created.DESCRIPTION: Unix timestamp of when the item was created

updated.NAME: updated
updated.DESCRIPTION: Unix timestamp of when the file was last updated

banned.NAME: banned
banned.DESCRIPTION: Whether the file is banned or not

tags.NAME: tags
tags.DESCRIPTION: Comma (,) separated list of tags, may be truncated to some length

size.NAME: size
size.DESCRIPTION: File size of the workshop item contents

installed.NAME: installed
installed.DESCRIPTION: If the addon is subscribed, this value represents whether it is installed on the client and its files are accessible, false otherwise.

disabled.NAME: disabled
disabled.DESCRIPTION: If the addon is subscribed, this value represents whether it is disabled on the client, false otherwise.

children.NAME: children
children.DESCRIPTION:
A list of child Workshop Items for this item.

For collections this will be sub-collections, for workshop items this will be the items they depend on.

ownername.NAME: ownername
ownername.DESCRIPTION:
The "nice" name of the Uploader, or "Unnammed Player" if we failed to get the data for some reason.

Do not use this field as it will most likely not be updated in time. Use [steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo](/gmod/steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo) instead.

error.NAME: error
error.DESCRIPTION:
If this key is set, no other data will be present in the response.

Values above 0 represent Steam Error codes, values below 0 mean the following:

* -1 means Failed to create query

* -2 means Failed to send query

* -3 means Received 0 or more than 1 result

* -4 means Failed to get item data from the response

* -5 means Workshop item ID in the response is invalid

* -6 means Workshop item ID in response is mismatching the requested file ID

Owner.NAME: Owner
Owner.DESCRIPTION: The player responsible who owns the undo

Name.NAME: Name
Name.DESCRIPTION: The name of the text to report to the player

Entities.NAME: Entities
Entities.DESCRIPTION: A table of entities to be removed by the undo

CustomUndoText.NAME: CustomUndoText
CustomUndoText.DESCRIPTION: A custom undo text to show the client

NiceName.NAME: NiceName
NiceName.DESCRIPTION: A "nice" name of the undo, which will be used for the UI

wheels_brakeMaterialIndex.NAME: wheels_brakeMaterialIndex
wheels_brakeMaterialIndex.DESCRIPTION: Material index of braking material of the wheels. Upon braking, the wheels will be set to this material.

wheels_materialIndex.NAME: wheels_materialIndex
wheels_materialIndex.DESCRIPTION: Material index of the wheels by default.

wheels_skidMaterialIndex.NAME: wheels_skidMaterialIndex
wheels_skidMaterialIndex.DESCRIPTION: Material index of skid material of the wheels. Upon skidding ( pressing Space and sliding the vehicle ), the wheels will be set to this material.

addGravity.NAME: addGravity
addGravity.DESCRIPTION: Additional gravity to be applied to the vehicle

axleRatio.NAME: axleRatio
axleRatio.DESCRIPTION:
This acts as the final ratio of the gearbox.

It's like a master coefficient of the gearbox.

boostDelay.NAME: boostDelay
boostDelay.DESCRIPTION: Amount of seconds between being able to use the boost ( by pressing Shift key by default )

boostDuration.NAME: boostDuration
boostDuration.DESCRIPTION: Duration of the boost in seconds

boostMaxSpeed.NAME: boostMaxSpeed
WARNINGS:
The Vehicle:SetVehicleParams function takes this in **miles per hour**, but Vehicle:GetVehicleParams returns this in **hammer units per second**!

1 MPH is roughly 17.6 HU/s.

gearCount.NAME: gearCount
gearCount.DESCRIPTION: Amount of gears this vehicle has

gearRatio.NAME: gearRatio
gearRatio.DESCRIPTION:
A table of numbers, of gear rations.

Table length is equal to "gearCount" member of this table.

horsepower.NAME: horsepower
horsepower.DESCRIPTION:
The HP amount of the vehicle

This value is used to calculate the effectively applied torque, along with ratios and `maxRPM`.

isAutoTransmission.NAME: isAutoTransmission
isAutoTransmission.DESCRIPTION: If `true`, the gearbox shifts gears, if `false` the gearbox stays stuck to the 1st gear (gear number 0).

maxRPM.NAME: maxRPM
maxRPM.DESCRIPTION:
Maximum RPM of the vehicle.

Despite this being a maximum value, the vehicle can exceed it.
WARNINGS: Attempts to exceed the max RPM will force the active gear ratio to be that of the 1st gear, which will provide even more torque. This is the opposite of a rev limiter. This value is only used for the calculation of the effectively applied torque.

maxRevSpeed.NAME: maxRevSpeed
maxRevSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Maximum reverse speed of the vehicle
WARNINGS:
The Vehicle:SetVehicleParams function takes this in **miles per hour**, but Vehicle:GetVehicleParams returns this in **hammer units per second**!

1 MPH is roughly 17.6 HU/s.

maxSpeed.NAME: maxSpeed
maxSpeed.DESCRIPTION: Maximum forward going speed of the vehicle without boosting
WARNINGS:
The Vehicle:SetVehicleParams function takes this in **miles per hour**, but Vehicle:GetVehicleParams returns this in **hammer units per second**!

1 MPH is roughly 17.6 HU/s.

shiftDownRPM.NAME: shiftDownRPM
shiftDownRPM.DESCRIPTION: Amount of RPM to automatically shift one gear down

shiftUpRPM.NAME: shiftUpRPM
shiftUpRPM.DESCRIPTION: Amount of RPM to automatically shift one gear up

degreesBoost.NAME: degreesBoost
degreesBoost.DESCRIPTION: The maximum angle at which the vehicle can turn while boosting

degreesFast.NAME: degreesFast
degreesFast.DESCRIPTION: The maximum angle at which the vehicle can turn while moving at max speed and not boosting

degreesSlow.NAME: degreesSlow
degreesSlow.DESCRIPTION: The maximum angle at which the vehicle can turn while moving slowest

dustCloud.NAME: dustCloud
dustCloud.DESCRIPTION: Disabled in Garry's Mod. In Half-Life 2: Episode 2 this dictates whether the vehicle should leave wheel dust effects when driving around

isSkidAllowed.NAME: isSkidAllowed
isSkidAllowed.DESCRIPTION: Whether the vehicle is allowed to skid/drift

container.NAME: container
container.DESCRIPTION:
The video container format.

Valid options are: `webm`, `ogg`

video.NAME: video
video.DESCRIPTION:
The video codec.

Valid options are: `vp8`, `theora`

audio.NAME: audio
audio.DESCRIPTION:
The audio codec.

Valid options are: `vorbis`

lockfps.NAME: lockfps
lockfps.DESCRIPTION: Lock the frame count per second

name.NAME: name
name.DESCRIPTION: The file name for the video

x.NAME: x
x.DESCRIPTION: The x position of the viewport to render in

y.NAME: y
y.DESCRIPTION: The y position of the viewport to render in

w.NAME: w
w.DESCRIPTION: The width of the viewport to render in

h.NAME: h
h.DESCRIPTION: The height of the viewport to render in

drawhud.NAME: drawhud
drawhud.DESCRIPTION: Draw the HUD and call the hud painting related hooks

ortho.NAME: ortho
ortho.DESCRIPTION:
Render the view orthogonal. Can also be a table with these keys: (In which case orthogonal view is automatically set to true)

* left

* right

* top

* bottom

ortholeft.NAME: ortholeft
ortholeft.DESCRIPTION: Coordinate for the left clipping plane

orthoright.NAME: orthoright
orthoright.DESCRIPTION: Coordinate for the right clipping plane

orthotop.NAME: orthotop
orthotop.DESCRIPTION: Coordinate for the top clipping plane

orthobottom.NAME: orthobottom
orthobottom.DESCRIPTION: Coordinate for the bottom clipping plane

znear.NAME: znear
znear.DESCRIPTION: The distance of the view's origin to the near clipping plane

zfar.NAME: zfar
zfar.DESCRIPTION: The distance of the view's origin to the far clipping plane

znearviewmodel.NAME: znearviewmodel
znearviewmodel.DESCRIPTION: The distance of the view's origin to the near clipping plane for the viewmodel

zfarviewmodel.NAME: zfarviewmodel
zfarviewmodel.DESCRIPTION: The distance of the view's origin to the far clipping plane for the viewmodel

dopostprocess.NAME: dopostprocess
dopostprocess.DESCRIPTION: Currently works identically to the "bloomtone" option (it also overrides it if you set this to false).

bloomtone.NAME: bloomtone
bloomtone.DESCRIPTION: Disables default engine bloom and pauses the "brightness changes" on HDR maps.

offcenter.NAME: offcenter
offcenter.DESCRIPTION:
This allows you to "zoom in" on a part of the screen - for example, the top-left quarter of the screen. This is similar to how [poster splits the screen](https://garry.tv/2012/02/25/poster-screenshots/) into separate renders.

It's a table with 4 keys, controlling what portion of the screen to draw:

* left - where the left edge starts. Natural value is 0.

* right - where the right edge ends. Natural value is equal to w (the width of the viewport).

* top - where the `bottom` edge starts. Natural value is 0.

* bottom - where the `top` edge ends. Natural value is equal to h (the height of the viewport).

Note that top and bottom are reversed.

Values outside the viewport are allowed, but not recommended - instead you should increase the view FOV.

ViewData.DESCRIPTION:
Table structure used for [render.RenderView](/gmod/render.RenderView).

Unless stated otherwise, the default values for all these keys would be inherited from the engine's CViewSetup and do not have static representations.
